original: dṛśyanti putrāḥ sugatasya aurasā dhyānena te prasthita agrabodhim // / //
analyzed: dṛśyanti putrāḥ sugatasya aurasāḥ dhyānena te prasthita agrabodhim
translated: The sons of the Sugata are seen, who have set out for supreme enlightenment through meditation.

original: bhūtaṃ padaṃ śāntamanāsravaṃ ca prajānamānāśca prakāśayanti /
analyzed: bhūtam padam śāntam anāsravam ca prajānamānāḥ ca prakāśayanti
translated: The true state, peaceful and undefiled, understanding and revealing it,

original: deśenti dharmaṃ bahulokadhātuṣu sugatānubhāvādiyamīdṛśī kriyā // / //
analyzed: deśenti dharmam bahu lokadhātuṣu sugata anubhāvāt iyam īdṛśī kriyā
translated: They teach the Dharma in many world systems. Such is this activity through the power of the Sugatas.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca tā parṣa catasra tāyinaścandrārkadīpasya imaṃ prabhāvam /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca tā catasraḥ tāyinaḥ candra arka dīpasya imam prabhāvam
translated: Having seen the four assemblies and the power of this of Candrārka-dīpa, the protector,

original: harṣasthitāḥ sarvi bhavitva tatkṣaṇamanyonya pṛcchanti kathaṃ nu etat // / //
analyzed: harṣa sthitāḥ tad kṣaṇam anyonya pṛcchanti katham nu etat
translated: All of them, filled with joy, asked each other: What is this?

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: The physician

original: acirācca so naramaruyakṣapūjitaḥ samādhito vyutthita lokanāyakaḥ /
analyzed: acirāt ca saḥ nara maru yakṣa pūjitaḥ samādhitaḥ vyutthita loka nāyakaḥ
translated: And soon, the one worshipped by humans, maruts, and yakshas, the leader of the world, arose from samadhi.

original: varaprabhaṃ putra tadādhyabhāṣata yo bodhisattvo vidu dharmabhāṇakaḥ // / //
analyzed: varaprabham putra tadā adhyabhāṣata yaḥ bodhisattvaḥ dharma bhāṇakaḥ
translated: He then spoke to Varaprabha, the son, the wise Dharma teacher bodhisattva:

original: lokasya cakṣuśca gatiśca tvaṃ vidurvaiśvāsiko dharmadharaśca mahyam /
analyzed: lokasya cakṣuḥ ca gatiḥ ca tvam viduḥ vaiśvāsikaḥ dharma dharaḥ ca mahyam
translated: You are the eyes and refuge of the world, O wise one, and my confidant and upholder of the Dharma.

original: tvaṃ hyatra sākṣī mama dharmakośe yathāhu bhāṣiṣyi hitāya prāṇinām // / //
analyzed: tvam hi atra sākṣī mama dharma kośe yathā āhu bhāṣiṣyi hitāya prāṇinām
translated: You are the witness here of my Dharma treasury, as I will teach it for the benefit of living beings.

original: saṃsthāpayitvā bahubodhisattvān harṣitva saṃvarṇiya saṃstavitvā /
analyzed: saṃsthāpayitvā bahu bodhisattvān saṃvarṇiya saṃstavitvā
translated: Having established many bodhisattvas, having delighted them, having praised and extolled them,

original: prabhāṣate tajjina agradharmān paripūrṇa so antarakalpa ṣaṣṭim // / //
analyzed: prabhāṣate tad jina agra dharmān paripūrṇa saḥ antara kalpa ṣaṣṭim
translated: The Victorious One taught those supreme teachings for a full sixty intermediate eons.

original: yaṃ caiva so bhāṣati lokanātho ekāsanasthaḥ pravarāgradharmam /
analyzed: yam ca eva saḥ bhāṣati loka nāthaḥ eka āsana sthaḥ pravara agra dharmam
translated: And whatever that Lord of the World taught, the supreme Dharma while seated in one place,

original: taṃ sarvamādhārayi so jinātmajo varaprabho yo abhu dharmabhāṇakaḥ // / //
analyzed: tam sarvam ādhārayi saḥ jina ātmajaḥ vara prabhaḥ yaḥ dharma bhāṇakaḥ
translated: All of it was upheld by that son of the Victorious Ones, Varaprabha, who was the Dharma teacher.

original: so co jino bhāṣiya agradharmaṃ praharṣayitvā janatāmanekām /
analyzed: saḥ caḥ jinaḥ agra dharmam praharṣayitvā janatām anekām
translated: And that Victorious One, having taught the supreme Dharma and delighted the multitude,

original: tasmiṃśca divase vadate sa nāyakaḥ purato hi lokasya sadevakasya // / //
analyzed: tasmin ca divase vadate sa nāyakaḥ puratas hi lokasya sa devakasya
translated: And on that day, the Guide declares in the presence of the world and its devas:

original: prakāśitā me iya dharmanetrī ācakṣito dharmasvabhāva yādṛaśaḥ /
analyzed: prakāśitā me iya dharma netrī ācakṣitaḥ dharma svabhāva yādṛaśaḥ
translated: This Dharma method has been revealed by me, and the nature of phenomena has been taught as it is.

original: nirvāṇakālo mama adya bhikṣavo rātrīya yāmasmiha madhyamasmin // / //
analyzed: nirvāṇa kālaḥ mama adya bhikṣavaḥ yāmasmin iha madhyamasmin
translated: Monks, today, in the middle of the night, is the time of my nirvana.

original: bhavathāpramattā adhimuktisārā abhiyujyathā mahya imasmi śāsane /
analyzed: bhavatha apramattāḥ adhimukti sārāḥ abhiyujyathāḥ mahye imasmi śāsane
translated: Be heedful, have resolute faith, and apply yourselves to my teaching.

original: sudurlabhā bhonti jinā maharṣayaḥ kalpāna koṭīnayutāna atyayāt // / //
analyzed: su durlabhāḥ bhonti jināḥ mahā ṛṣayaḥ kalpāna koṭī nayutāna atyayāt
translated: For it is extremely difficult to find the victorious great sages, even after countless eons.

original: saṃtāpajātā bahubuddhaputrā duḥkhena cogreṇa samarpitābhavan /
analyzed: saṃtāpa jātāḥ bahu buddha putrāḥ duḥkhena ca ugreṇa samarpitāḥ abhavan
translated: The many sons of the Buddha, filled with grief, are overwhelmed by intense suffering.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: śrutvāna ghoṣaṃ dvipadottamasya nirvāṇaśabdaṃ atikṣiprametat // / //
analyzed: ghoṣam dvipada uttamasya nirvāṇa śabdam ati kṣipram etat
translated: Having heard the voice of the supreme human, the word of nirvana, 'this is too soon,'

original: āśvāsayitvā ca narendrarājā tāḥ prāṇakoṭyo bahavo acintiyāḥ /
analyzed: āśvāsayitvā ca narendra rājā tāḥ prāṇa koṭyaḥ bahavaḥ acintiyāḥ
translated: The king of men, the lord of men, comforted those many inconceivable millions of beings,

original: mā bhāyathā bhikṣava nirvṛte mayi bhaviṣyatha buddha mamottareṇa // / //
analyzed: mā bhāyathāḥ bhikṣava nirvṛte mayi bhaviṣyatha buddha mama uttareṇa
translated: Saying, Monks, do not be afraid of my nirvana. After me, there will be a buddha.

original: śrīgarbha eṣo vidu bodhisattvo gatiṃ gato jñāni anāsravasmin /
analyzed: śrī garbhaḥ eṣaḥ vidu bodhisattvaḥ gatim gataḥ jñāni anāsravasmin
translated: This wise bodhisattva, the womb of glory, has attained the state of the stainless knowledge.

original: spṛśiṣyate uttamamagrabodhiṃ vimalāgranetro ti jino bhaviṣyati // / //
analyzed: spṛśiṣyate uttamam agra bodhim vimala agra netraḥ ti jinaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And will attain the supreme, highest enlightenment. He will be the Victorious One, Vimala-agra-netra.

original: tāmeva rātriṃ tada yāmi madhyame parinirvṛto hetukṣaye va dīpaḥ /
analyzed: tām eva rātrim yāmi madhyame parinirvṛtaḥ hetu kṣaye dīpaḥ
translated: On that very night, in the middle yāma, he passed into parinirvāṇa, like a flame extinguished when the fuel is exhausted.

original: śarīra vaistāriku tasya cābhūt stūpāna koṭīnayutā anantakā // / //
analyzed: tasya tasya
translated: His body was widely distributed, and there were countless quintillions of stūpas.

original: bhikṣuśca tatrā tatha bhikṣuṇīyo ye prasthitā uttamamagrabodhim /
analyzed: bhikṣuḥ ca tatra bhikṣuṇīyaḥ ye prasthitāḥ uttamam agra bodhim
translated: And there were monks and nuns who were dedicated to the supreme, highest enlightenment.

original: analpakāste yatha gaṅgabālikā abhiyukta tasyo sugatasya śāsane // / //
analyzed: analpakāḥ te gaṅgabālikāḥ
translated: They were not few in number, like the sands of the Ganges, and were dedicated to the teaching of that Sugata.

original: yaścāpi bhikṣustada dharmabhāṇako varaprabho yena sa dharma dhāritaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca api dharma bhāṇakaḥ vara prabhaḥ yena sa dharma dhāritaḥ
translated: And the monk who was the Dharma teacher, Varaprabha, by whom that Dharma was upheld,

original: aśīti so antarakalpa pūrṇāṃ tahi śāsane bhāṣati agradharmān // / //
analyzed: saḥ antara kalpa pūrṇām śāsane bhāṣati agra dharmān
translated: For eighty full intermediate eons he taught the supreme Dharma in that teaching.

original: aṣṭāśataṃ tasya abhūṣi śiṣyāḥ paripācitā ye tada tena sarve /
analyzed: aṣṭāśatam tasya śiṣyāḥ paripācitāḥ ye tada tena sarve
translated: He had eight hundred disciples, all of whom were fully ripened by him.

original: dṛṣṭā ca tebhirbahubuddhakoṭyaḥ satkāru teṣāṃ ca kṛto maharṣiṇām // / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭā ca tebhiḥ bahu buddha koṭyaḥ teṣām ca kṛtaḥ mahā ṛṣiṇām
translated: And they saw many millions of Buddhas, and made offerings to those Great Sages.

original: caryāṃ caritvā tada ānulomikīṃ buddhā abhūvan bahulokadhātuṣu
analyzed: caryām caritvā tadā ānulomikīm buddhāḥ abhūvan bahu lokadhātuṣu
translated: Having practiced in accordance with that, they became Buddhas in many world systems.

original: parasparaṃ te ca anantareṇa anyonya vyākarṣu tadāgrabodhaye // / //
analyzed: parasparam te ca anantareṇa anyonya
translated: And they mutually proclaimed to each other their highest enlightenment.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: teṣāṃ ca buddhāna paraṃpareṇa dīpaṃkaraḥ paścimako abhūṣi /
analyzed: teṣām ca paraṃpareṇa dīpaṃkaraḥ paścimakaḥ
translated: And in their succession of Buddhas, the last was Dīpaṃkara,

original: devātidevo ṛṣisaṃghapūjito vinītavān prāṇisahasrakoṭyaḥ // / //
analyzed: devātidevaḥ ṛṣi saṃgha pūjitaḥ vinītavān prāṇi sahasra koṭyaḥ
translated: The god above gods, worshipped by the assembly of sages, who disciplined millions of living beings.

original: yaścāsi tasyo sugatātmajasya varaprabhasyo tada dharma bhāṣataḥ /🔽śiṣyaḥ kusīdaśca sa lolupātmā lābhaṃ ca jñānaṃ ca gaveṣamāṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: yaḥ ca asi tasya sugata ātmajasya varaprabhasya dharma bhāṣataḥ  śiṣyaḥ kusīdaḥ ca sa lolupa ātmā lābham ca jñānam ca gaveṣamāṇaḥ
translated: And you were the lazy and greedy disciple of that son of the Sugata, Varaprabha, when he taught the Dharma,🔽Searching for gain and knowledge.

original: yaśorthikaścāpyatimātra āsīt kulākulaṃ ca pratipannamāsīt /
analyzed: yaśaḥ ṛthikaḥ ca api atimātraḥ āsīt kula ākulam ca pratipannam āsīt
translated: And you were also excessively devoted to fame, and you engaged in going from house to house.

original: uddeśa svādhyāyu tathāsya sarvo na tiṣṭhate bhāṣitu tasmi kāle // / //
analyzed: sarvaḥ na tiṣṭhate tasmi kāle
translated: And all his recitation and study at that time did not remain.

original: nāmaṃ ca tasyo imamevamāsīd yaśakāmanāmnā diśatāsu viśrutaḥ /
analyzed: nāmam ca tasya u imam evam āsīt yaśakāma nāmnā diśatāsu viśrutaḥ
translated: And his name was also like this: Yasakāma, renowned in the ten directions.

original: sa cāpi tenākuśalena karmaṇā kalmāṣabhūtenabhisaṃskṛtena // / //
analyzed: sa ca api tena akuśalena karmaṇā kalmāṣa bhūtena abhisaṃskṛtena
translated: And by that unwholesome action, which was made variegated and manifest,

original: ārāgayī buddhasahasrakoṭyaḥ pūjāṃ ca teṣāṃ vipulāmakārṣīt /
analyzed: ārāgayī buddha sahasra koṭyaḥ pūjām ca teṣām vipulām akārṣīt
translated: He pleased millions of Buddhas and made vast offerings to them.

original: cīrṇā ca caryā vara ānulomikī dṛṣṭaśca buddho ayu śākyasiṃhaḥ // / //
analyzed: cīrṇā ca caryā varaḥ ānulomikī dṛṣṭaḥ ca buddhaḥ śākyasiṃhaḥ
translated: And I practiced the supreme and proper conduct, and saw this Buddha, the Lion of the Shakyas.

original: ayaṃ ca so paścimako bhaviṣyati anuttarāṃ lapsyati cāgrabodhim /
analyzed: ayam ca saḥ paścimakaḥ bhaviṣyati anuttarām lapsyati ca agra bodhim
translated: And this will be his last birth, and he will attain supreme enlightenment.

original: maitreyagotro bhagavān bhaviṣyati vineṣyati prāṇasahasrakoṭyaḥ // / //
analyzed: maitreya gotraḥ bhagavān bhaviṣyati vineṣyati prāṇa sahasra koṭyaḥ
translated: The Blessed One will be of the Maitreya clan, and will guide millions of beings.

original: kausīdyaprāptastada yo babhūva parinirvṛtasya sugatasya śāsane /
analyzed: kausīdya prāptaḥ tada yaḥ babhūva parinirvṛtasya sugatasya śāsane
translated: He who became lazy in the teaching of the Parinirvana of the Sugata,

original: tvameva so tādṛśako babhūva ahaṃ ca āsīttada dharmabhāṇakaḥ // / //
analyzed: tvam eva tādṛśakaḥ babhūva aham ca āsīt tadā dharma bhāṇakaḥ
translated: you were just like that, and I was the Dharma preacher then.

original: imena haṃ kāraṇahetunādya dṛṣṭvā nimittaṃ idamevarūpam /
analyzed: imena ham kāraṇa hetunā adya dṛṣṭvā nimittam idam evarūpam
translated: For this reason, seeing this kind of sign today,

original: jñānasya tasya prathitaṃ nimittaṃ prathamaṃ mayā tatra vadāmi dṛṣṭam // / //
analyzed: jñānasya tasya prathitam nimittam prathamam mayā tatra vadāmi dṛṣṭam
translated: I declare that I first saw the sign of that knowledge there.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: dhruvaṃ jinendro 'pi samantacakṣuḥ śākyādhirājaḥ paramārthadarśī /
analyzed: dhruvam samanta cakṣuḥ śākya adhirājaḥ parama artha darśī
translated: The Lord of Victors, the Omniscient One, the King of the Shakyas, the Seer of the Ultimate Truth,

original: tameva yaṃ icchati bhāṣaṇāya paryāyamagraṃ tadadyo mayā śrutaḥ // / //
analyzed: tam eva yam icchati bhāṣaṇāya paryāyam agram tad adyaḥ mayā śrutaḥ
translated: has spoken this supreme discourse, which I have heard today.

original: tadeva paripūrṇa nimittamadya upāyakauśalya vināyakānām /
analyzed: tat eva paripūrṇa nimittam adya upāya kauśalya vināyakānām
translated: This is the complete sign today of the skillful means of the Guides,

original: saṃsthāpanaṃ kurvati śākyasiṃho bhāṣiṣyate dharmasvabhāvamudrām // / //
analyzed: saṃsthāpanam kurvati śākyasiṃhaḥ bhāṣiṣyate dharma svabhāva mudrām
translated: When the Lion of the Śākyas establishes it, he will teach the Dharma-seal of the nature of phenomena.

original: prayatā sucittā bhavathā kṛtāñjalī bhāṣiṣyate lokahitānukampī /
analyzed: prayatā su cittāḥ bhavathā kṛtāñjalī bhāṣiṣyate loka hita anukampī
translated: Be attentive, with pure minds and palms together, the compassionate one who benefits the world will teach.

original: varṣiṣyate dharmamanantavarṣaṃ tarpiṣyate ye sthita bodhihetoḥ // / //
analyzed: varṣiṣyate dharmam ananta varṣam tarpiṣyate ye sthita bodhi hetoḥ
translated: He will rain down the endless rain of Dharma, satisfying those who abide for the sake of enlightenment.

original: yeṣāṃ ca saṃdehagatīha kācid ye saṃśayā yā vicikitsa kācit /
analyzed: yeṣām ca saṃdeha gatī iha kācid ye saṃśayāḥ yā kācid
translated: For those who have any doubts or inclinations, any doubts or uncertainties,

original: vyapaneṣyate tā vidurātmajānāṃ ye bodhisattvā iha bodhiprasthitāḥ // / //
analyzed: vyapaneṣyate tāḥ vidura ātmajānām ye bodhisattvāḥ iha bodhi prasthitāḥ
translated: The wise sons of the Victor will dispel them, the Bodhisattvas who are established in enlightenment here.

original: ityāryasaddharmapuṇḍarīke dhamaparyāye nidānaparivarto nāma prathamaḥ ////
analyzed: iti ārya saddharmapuṇḍarīke dhama paryāye nidānaparivartaḥ nāma prathamaḥ
translated: Thus ends the first chapter named The Introduction in the noble Dharma discourse called The White Lotus of the True Dharma.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: upāyakauśalyaparivartaḥ /
analyzed: upāya kauśalya parivartaḥ
translated: The Chapter on Skillful Means

original: atha khalu bhagavān smṛtimān saṃprajānaṃstataḥ samādhervyutthitaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān smṛtimān saṃprajānan tatas samādheḥ vyutthitaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One, mindful and fully aware, arose from that concentration.

original: vyutthāya āyuṣmantaṃ śāriputramāmantrayate sma gambhīraṃ śāriputra durdṛśaṃ duranubodhaṃ buddhajñānaṃ tathāgatairarhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ
analyzed: vyutthāya āyuṣmantam śāriputram āmantrayate sma gambhīram śāriputra durdṛśam duranubodham buddha jñānam tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ
translated: Having arisen, he addressed the Venerable Śāriputra: Śāriputra, the knowledge of the Buddha, which is profound, difficult to see, and difficult to understand, has been realized by the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Enlightened Ones.

original: durvijñeyaṃ sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhaiḥ /
analyzed: durvijñeyam sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhaiḥ
translated: It is difficult to know for all the Śrāvakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: bahubuddhakoṭīnayutaśatasahasraparyupāsitāvino hi śāriputra tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā
analyzed: bahu buddha koṭī nayuta śata sahasra paryupāsitāvinaḥ hi śāriputra tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: Śāriputra, the Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones have attended upon many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of Buddhas.

original: bahubuddhakoṭīnayutaśatasahasracīrṇacaritāvino 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau dūrānugatāḥ
analyzed: bahu buddha koṭī nayuta śata sahasra cīrṇa caritāvinaḥ nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau dūra anugatāḥ
translated: They have practiced for many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of Buddhas in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment. They have gone far.

original: kṛtavīryā āścaryādbhutadharmasamanvāgatā durvijñeyadharmasamanvāgatā durvijñeyadharmānujñātāvinaḥ //
analyzed: kṛtavīryāḥ āścarya adbhuta dharma samanvāgatāḥ durvijñeya dharma samanvāgatāḥ durvijñeya dharma anujñātāvinaḥ
translated: They have accomplished their task. They possess the Dharma of wonders and marvels. They possess the Dharma that is difficult to know. They have the approval of the Dharma that is difficult to know.

original: durvijñeyaṃ śāriputra saṃdhābhāṣyaṃ tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānām /
analyzed: durvijñeyam śāriputra saṃdhā bhāṣyam tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām
translated: Śāriputra, the implied teachings of the Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones are difficult to know.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: svapratyayān dharmān prakāśayanti vividhopāyakauśalyajñānadarśanahetukāraṇanirdeśanārambaṇaniruktiprajñaptibhistairupāyakauśalyaistasmiṃstasmiṃllagnān 🔽sattvān pramocayitum /
analyzed: sva pratyayān dharmān prakāśayanti vividha upāya kauśalya jñāna darśana hetu kāraṇa nirdeśana ārambaṇa nirukti prajñaptibhiḥ taiḥ upāya kauśalyaiḥ tasmin tasmin lagnān  sattvān pramocayitum
translated: They teach the dharmas that are their own direct knowledge with various knowledges of skillful means, with the knowledge of seeing causes and conditions, with objects of reference, with definitions, and with designations, in order to liberate those beings who are attached to this and that.

original: mahopāyakauśalyajñānadarśanaparamapāramitāprāptāḥ śāriputra tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ /
analyzed: mahā upāya kauśalya jñāna darśana parama pāramitā prāptāḥ śāriputra tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: Śāriputra, the Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones have attained the supreme perfection of the knowledge of seeing the great skillful means.

original: asaṅgāpratihatajñānadarśanabalavaiśāradyāveṇikendriyabalabodhyaṅgadhyānavimokṣasamādhisamāpattyadbhutadharmasamanvāgatā vividhadharmasaṃprakāśakāḥ
analyzed: asaṅga a pratihata jñāna darśana bala vaiśāradya āveṇika indriya bala bodhyaṅga dhyāna vimokṣa samādhi samāpatti adbhuta dharma samanvāgatāḥ vividha dharma saṃprakāśakāḥ
translated: endowed with the power of unobstructed and unattached knowledge and insight, with the unique qualities of fearlessness, the powers, the factors of awakening, the dhyānas, liberations, samādhis, and samāpattis, and with the marvelous Dharma,

original: mahāścaryādbhutaprāptāḥ śāriputra tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ /
analyzed: mahā āścarya adbhuta prāptāḥ śāriputra tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: the Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones have attained great wonders and marvels, Śāriputra.

original: alaṃ śāriputra etāvadeva bhāṣituṃ bhavatu paramāścaryaprāptāḥ śāriputra tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ /
analyzed: alam śāriputra etāvat eva bhāṣitum bhavatu parama āścarya prāptāḥ śāriputra tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: It is enough, Śāriputra, just this much should be said: the Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones have attained the highest wonders and marvels, Śāriputra.

original: tathāgata eva śāriputra tathāgatasya dharmān deśayet /
analyzed: tathāgataḥ eva śāriputra tathāgatasya dharmān deśayet
translated: Only the Tathāgata, Śāriputra, can teach the dharmas of the Tathāgata.

original: yān dharmāṃstathāgato jānāti /🔽sarvadharmānapi śāriputra tathāgata eva deśayati /
analyzed: yān dharmān tathāgataḥ jānāti  sarva dharmān api śāriputra tathāgataḥ eva deśayati
translated: The dharmas that the Tathāgata knows.🔽All dharmas, Śāriputra, the Tathāgata alone teaches.

original: sarvadharmānapi tathāgata eva jānāti /
analyzed: sarva dharmān api tathāgataḥ eva jānāti
translated: All dharmas, Śāriputra, the Tathāgata alone knows.

original: ye ca te dharmāḥ /🔽yathā ca te dharmāḥ /
analyzed: ye ca te dharmāḥ  yathā ca te dharmāḥ
translated: And those dharmas,🔽and how those dharmas are,

original: yādṛśāśca te dharmāḥ /🔽yallakṣaṇāśca te dharmāḥ /
analyzed: yādṛśāḥ ca te dharmāḥ  yad lakṣaṇāḥ ca te dharmāḥ
translated: and what kind those dharmas are,🔽and what characteristics those dharmas have,

original: yatsvabhāvāśca te dharmāḥ /
analyzed: yad svabhāvāḥ ca te dharmāḥ
translated: and what essence those dharmas have,

original: ye ca yathā ca yādṛśāśca yallakṣaṇāśca yatsvabhāvāśca te dharmā iti /
analyzed: ye ca yathā ca yādṛśāḥ ca yad lakṣaṇāḥ ca yad svabhāvāḥ ca te dharmāḥ iti
translated: those dharmas, whatever they are, however they are, whatever kind they are, whatever characteristics they have, whatever essence they have.

original: teṣu dharmeṣu tathāgata eva pratyakṣo 'parokṣaḥ //
analyzed: teṣu dharmeṣu tathāgataḥ eva pratyakṣaḥ parokṣaḥ
translated: The Tathāgata alone is the direct witness and knower of those dharmas.

original: atha khalu bhagavānetamevārthaṃ bhūyasyā mātrayā saṃdarśayamānastasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān etam eva artham bhūyasyā mātrayā saṃdarśayamānaḥ tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One, in order to illustrate this meaning further, spoke these verses at that time:

original: aprameyā mahāvīrā loke samarumānuṣe /
analyzed: aprameyāḥ mahā vīrāḥ loke sa maru mānuṣe
translated: The great heroes, immeasurable in the world with its gods and men,

original: na śakyaṃ sarvaśo jñātuṃ sarvasattvairvināyakāḥ // / //
analyzed: na śakyam sarvaśas jñātum sarva sattvaiḥ vināyakāḥ
translated: Cannot be fully known by all beings, the guides of all beings.

original: balā vimokṣā ye teṣāṃ vaiśāradyāśca yādṛśāḥ /
analyzed: balāḥ vimokṣāḥ ye teṣām vaiśāradyāḥ ca yādṛśāḥ
translated: The powers and liberations of theirs, and the kinds of confidences,

original: yādṛśā buddhadharmāśca na śakyaṃ jñātu kenacit // / //
analyzed: yādṛśāḥ buddha dharmāḥ ca na śakyam jñātu kenacid
translated: And the kinds of Buddha-dharmas, cannot be known by anyone.

original: pūrve niṣevitā caryā buddhakoṭīna antike /
analyzed: pūrve niṣevitā caryā buddhakoṭīna antike
translated: The conduct has been practiced for many eons in the presence of millions of Buddhas,

original: gambhīrā caiva sūkṣmā ca durvijñeyā sudurdṛśā // / //
analyzed: gambhīrā ca eva sūkṣmā ca durvijñeyā su durdṛśā
translated: It is profound and subtle, difficult to know, very difficult to see.

original: tasyāṃ cīrṇāya caryāyāṃ kalpakoṭyo acintiyā /
analyzed: tasyām cīrṇāya caryāyām
translated: Having practiced that conduct for countless millions of eons,

original: phalaṃ me bodhimaṇḍasmin dṛṣṭaṃ yādṛśakaṃ hi tat // / //
analyzed: phalam me bodhimaṇḍasmin dṛṣṭam yādṛśakam hi tat
translated: I have seen the fruit in the Bodhi tree, just as it is.

original: ahaṃ ca tatprajānāmi ye cānye lokanāyakāḥ /
analyzed: aham ca tat prajānāmi ye ca anye loka nāyakāḥ
translated: I know that, and also the other world-guides,

original: yathā yad yādṛśaṃ cāpi lakṣaṇaṃ cāsya yādṛśam // / //
analyzed: yathā yat yādṛśam ca api lakṣaṇam ca asya yādṛśam
translated: As it is, what it is, and also what its characteristics are.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidyādhara

original: na taddarśayituṃ śakyaṃ vyāhāro 'sya na vidyate /
analyzed: na tat darśayitum śakyam vyāhāraḥ sya na vidyate
translated: That cannot be shown, there is no expression for it,

original: nāpyasau tādṛśaḥ kaścit sattvo lokasmi vidyate // / //
analyzed: na api asau tādṛśaḥ kaścid vidyate
translated: There is no such being found in the world.

original: yasya taṃ deśayeddharma deśitaṃ cāpi jāniyāt /
analyzed: yasya tam deśayet dharma deśitam ca api jāniyāt
translated: To whom one could teach the Dharma, and who could understand the taught Dharma.

original: anyatra bodhisattvebhyo adhimuktīya ye sthitāḥ // / //
analyzed: anyatra bodhisattvebhyaḥ ye sthitāḥ
translated: Except for the bodhisattvas, who are established in resolute faith.

original: ye cāpi te lokavidusya śrāvakāḥ kṛtādhikārāḥ sugatānuvarṇitāḥ /
analyzed: ye ca api te śrāvakāḥ kṛta adhikārāḥ sugata anuvarṇitāḥ
translated: And also the disciples of the knower of the world, who have rendered service and are praised by the Sugata,

original: kṣīṇāsravā antimadehadhāriṇo na teṣa viṣayo 'sti jināna jñāne // / //
analyzed: kṣīṇa āsravāḥ antima dehadhāriṇaḥ na teṣa viṣayaḥ sti jināna jñāne
translated: Who have exhausted the defilements and bear their last body, for them there is no scope for the knowledge of the Jinas.

original: sa caiva sarvā iya lokadhātu pūrṇā bhavecchārisutopamānām /
analyzed: sa ca eva
translated: And if this entire world realm were filled with beings similar to Shariputra,

original: ekībhavitvāna vicintayeyuḥ sugatasya jñānaṃ na hi śakya jānitum // / //
analyzed: ekībhavitvāna vicintayeyuḥ sugatasya jñānam na hi śakya jānitum
translated: Having become one, they would contemplate the knowledge of the Sugata, but would not be able to know it.

original: saceha tvaṃ sādṛśakehi paṇḍitaiḥ pūrṇā bhaveyurdaśā pi ddiśāyo /
analyzed: sacā iha tvam paṇḍitaiḥ pūrṇāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: If this entire world were filled with wise ones similar to you, in all ten directions,

original: ye cāpi mahyaṃ imi śrāvakānye teṣāṃ pi pūrṇā bhavi evameva // / //
analyzed: ye ca api mahyam teṣām evam eva
translated: And if all of my other disciples were also similarly filled,

original: ekībhavitvāna ca te 'dya sarve vicintayeyuḥ sugatasya jñānam /
analyzed: ekībhavitvāna ca te sarve vicintayeyuḥ sugatasya jñānam
translated: Having become one today, all of them would contemplate the knowledge of the Sugata.

original: na śakta sarve sahitā pi jñātuṃ yathāprameyaṃ mama buddhajñānam // / //
analyzed: na śakta sarve sahitāḥ jñātum yathā aprameyam mama buddha jñānam
translated: Even all of them together would not be able to know my immeasurable Buddha knowledge, as it truly is.

original: pratyekabuddhāna anāsravāṇāṃ tīkṣṇendriyāṇāntimadehadhāriṇām /
analyzed: anāsravāṇām
translated: The pratyekabuddhas, who are free from defilements, whose faculties are sharp, and who bear their last body,

original: diśo daśaḥ sarva bhaveyuḥ pūrṇā yathā naḍānāṃ vanaveṇunāṃ vā // / //
analyzed: diśaḥ daśa bhaveyuḥ pūrṇāḥ yathā naḍānām vana veṇunām vā
translated: If the ten directions were all filled with them, like a thicket of reeds or bamboo,

original: eko bhavitvāna vicintayeyurmamāgradharmāṇa pradeśamātram /
analyzed: ekaḥ bhavitvāna vicintayeyuḥ mama agra dharmāṇa pradeśa mātram
translated: And they were to think together as one, they could not fully understand even a fraction of my supreme Dharma.

original: kalpāna koṭīnayutānanantānna tasya bhūtaṃ parijāni artham // / //
analyzed: kalpān koṭī nayutān anantān na tasya bhūtam artham
translated: For countless quintillions of eons, they would not know its true meaning.

original: navayānasaṃprasthita bodhisattvāḥ kṛtādhikārā bahubuddhakoṭiṣu /
analyzed: bodhisattvāḥ kṛta adhikārāḥ bahu buddha koṭiṣu
translated: The bodhisattvas who have newly set out in the vehicle, who have served many millions of buddhas,

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: suviniścitārthā bahudharmabhāṇakāsteṣāṃ pi pūrṇā daśimā diśo bhavet // / //
analyzed: su viniścita arthāḥ bahu dharma bhāṇakāḥ teṣām pūrṇā daśimā diśaḥ bhavet
translated: who have well-ascertained meanings, and who are teachers of the Dharma, if they were to fill the ten directions,

original: naḍāna veṇūna va nityakālamacchidrapūrṇo bhavi sarvalokaḥ /
analyzed: nityakālam acchidra pūrṇaḥ sarva lokaḥ
translated: Like a thicket of reeds or bamboo, the entire world would always be completely filled with them.

original: ekībhavitvāna vicintayeyuryo dharma sākṣāt sugatena dṛṣṭaḥ // / //
analyzed: ekībhavitvāna vicintayeyuḥ yaḥ dharma sākṣāt sugatena dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: And if they were to think together as one, about the Dharma that the Sugata has directly seen,

original: anucintayitvā bahukalpakoṭyo gaṅgā yathā vālika aprameyāḥ /
analyzed: anucintayitvā bahu kalpa koṭyaḥ gaṅgāḥ yathā vālika aprameyāḥ
translated: Even if they were to think about it for many millions of eons, as numerous as the immeasurable sands of the Ganges,

original: ananyacittāḥ sukhumāya prajñayā teṣāṃ pi cāsmin viṣayo na vidyate // / //
analyzed: an anya cittāḥ prajñayā teṣām ca asmin viṣayaḥ na vidyate
translated: With minds focused on nothing else, with subtle wisdom, even for them this would not be within their sphere of experience.

original: avivartikā ye bhavi bodhisattvā analpakā yathariva gaṅgavālikāḥ /
analyzed: avivartikāḥ ye bodhisattvāḥ analpakāḥ gaṅga vālikāḥ
translated: The irreversible bodhisattvas, not few in number, like the sands of the Ganges,

original: ananyacittāśca vicintayeyusteṣāṃ pi cāsmin viṣayo na vidyate // / //
analyzed: an anya cittāḥ ca vicintayeyuḥ teṣām ca asmin viṣayaḥ na vidyate
translated: If they were to think with undivided minds, even for them this would not be their domain.

original: gambhīra dharmā sukhumā pi buddhā atarkikāḥ sarvi anāsravāśca /
analyzed: buddhāḥ atarkikāḥ sarvi anāsravāḥca
translated: The profound and subtle dharmas of the Buddhas, which are beyond thought and are all immaculate,

original: ahaṃ ca jānāmiha yādṛśā hi te te vā jinā loki daśaddiśāsu // / //
analyzed: aham ca jānām iha yādṛśāḥ hi te te vā jināḥ loki daśat diśāsu
translated: And I know what they are like, and those Jinas in the worlds of the ten directions.

original: yaṃ śāriputro sugataḥ prabhāṣate adhimuktisaṃpanna bhavāhi tatra /
analyzed: yam śāriputraḥ sugataḥ prabhāṣate adhimukti saṃpanna bhavāhi tatra
translated: What the Sugata, Śāriputra, proclaims, be endowed with faith in that.

original: ananyathāvādi jino maharṣī cireṇa pī bhāṣati uttamārtham // / //
analyzed: ananyathāvādi jinaḥ mahā ṛṣī cireṇa bhāṣati uttama artham
translated: The Jina, the Great Sage, who speaks without falsehood, after a long time teaches the supreme meaning.

original: āmantrayāmī imi sarvaśrāvakān pratyekabodhāya ca ye 'bhiprasthitāḥ /
analyzed: āmantrayāmi sarva śrāvakān pratyeka bodhāya ca ye
translated: I exhort all these śrāvakas, and those who have set out for the enlightenment of a pratyekabuddha,

original: saṃsthāpitā ye maya nirvṛtīya saṃmokṣitā duḥkhaparaṃparātaḥ // / //
analyzed: saṃsthāpitāḥ ye saṃmokṣitāḥ duḥkha paraṃparātaḥ
translated: Those who have been established by me in nirvāṇa, and who have been liberated from the continuity of suffering.

original: upāyakauśalya mametadagraṃ bhāṣāmi dharmaṃ bahu yena loke /
analyzed: upāya kauśalya mama etat agram bhāṣāmi dharmam bahu yena loke
translated: This is my foremost skillful means, by which I teach the Dharma in the world in many ways.

original: tahiṃ tahiṃ lagna pramocayāmi trīṇī ca yānānyupadarśayāmi // / //
analyzed: tahim tahim lagna pramocayāmi trīṇi ca yānāni upadarśayāmi
translated: Here and there I liberate those who are attached, and I demonstrate the three vehicles.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: atha khalu ye tatra parṣatsaṃnipāte mahāśrāvakā ājñātakauṇḍinyapramukhā arhantaḥ
analyzed: atha khalu ye tatra parṣad saṃnipāte mahāśrāvakāḥ ājñātakauṇḍinya pramukhāḥ arhantaḥ
translated: Then, in that assembly, the great hearers, headed by Ājñāta Kauṇḍinya, the arhats

original: kṣīṇāsravā dvādaśa vaśībhūtaśatāni ye cānye śrāvakayānikā bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikā
analyzed: kṣīṇa āsravāḥ dvādaśa vaśībhūta śatāni ye ca anye śrāvaka yānikāḥ bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikā
translated: who had exhausted the defilements, the twelve hundred who had mastered themselves, and the others who were in the Śrāvakayāna, the bhikṣus, bhikṣuṇīs, upāsakas, and upāsikās,

original: ye ca pratyekabuddhayānasaṃprasthitāḥ /
analyzed: ye ca pratyekabuddha yāna saṃprasthitāḥ
translated: and those who had set out in the Pratyekabuddhayāna,

original: teṣāṃ sarveṣāmetadabhavat ko nu hetuḥ kiṃ kāraṇaṃ yad bhagavānadhimātramupāyakauśalyaṃ tathāgatānāṃ saṃvarṇayati /
analyzed: teṣām sarveṣām etat abhavat kaḥ nu hetuḥ kim kāraṇam yat bhagavān adhimātram upāya kauśalyam tathāgatānām saṃvarṇayati
translated: all of them thought, What is the reason, what is the cause, that the Blessed One praises so much the skill in means of the Tathāgatas?

original: gambhīraścāyaṃ mayā dharmo 'bhisaṃbuddha iti saṃvarṇayati /
analyzed: gambhīraḥ ca ayam mayā dharmaḥ bhisaṃbuddhaḥ iti saṃvarṇayati
translated: He praises the fact that this profound Dharma has been realized by me.

original: durvijñeyaśca sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhairiti saṃvarṇayati /
analyzed: durvijñeyaḥ ca sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhaiḥ iti saṃvarṇayati
translated: He praises the fact that it is difficult to understand for all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: yathā tāvad bhagavatā ekaiva vimuktirākhyātā /
analyzed: yathā tāvat bhagavatā ekā eva vimuktiḥ ākhyātā
translated: As the Blessed One has declared, there is only one liberation.

original: vayamapi buddhadharmāṇāṃ lābhino nirvāṇaprāptāḥ /
analyzed: vayam api buddha dharmāṇām lābhinaḥ nirvāṇa prāptāḥ
translated: We too have attained the Buddha-qualities and have reached nirvāṇa.

original: asya ca vayaṃ bhagavato bhāṣitasyārtha na jānīmaḥ //
analyzed: asya ca vayam bhagavataḥ bhāṣitasya artha na jānīmaḥ
translated: But we do not understand the meaning of what the Blessed One has said.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān śāriputrastāsāṃ catasṛṇāṃ parṣadāṃ vicikitsākathaṃkathāṃ viditvā
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ tāsām catasṛṇām parṣadām vicikitsā kathaṃkathām viditvā
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra, knowing the doubts and uncertainties of the fourfold assembly,

original: cetasaiva cetaḥparivitarkamājñāya ātmanā ca dharmasaṃśayaprāptastasyāṃ velāyāṃ bhagavantametadavocat
analyzed: cetasā eva cetaḥ parivitarkam ājñāya ātmanā ca dharma saṃśaya prāptaḥ tasyām velāyām bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Having understood the thought of the assembly through his own mind, and having himself attained doubt about the Dharma, he said this to the Blessed One at that time:

original: ko bhagavan hetuḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ
translated: What is the reason, Blessed One,🔽what is the cause, that the Blessed One again and again extols the knowledge, insight, and teaching of the profound Dharma of the Tathāgatas?

original: kaḥ pratyayo yad bhagavānadhimātraṃ punaḥ punastathāgatānāmupāyakauśalyajñānadarśanadharmadeśanāṃ saṃvarṇayati gambhīraśca me dharmo 'bhisaṃbuddha 🔽iti /
analyzed: kaḥ pratyayaḥ yat bhagavān adhimātram punar punar tathāgatānām upāya kauśalya jñāna darśana dharma deśanām saṃvarṇayati gambhīraḥ ca me dharmaḥ bhisaṃbuddha  / iti
translated: 'My Dharma is profound,' he says,

original: durvijñeyaṃ ca saṃghābhāṣyamiti punaḥ punaḥ saṃvarṇayati /
analyzed: durvijñeyam ca saṃgha ābhāṣyam iti punar punar saṃvarṇayati
translated: and 'difficult to understand is the teaching in the assembly.' Thus he extols it again and again.

original: na ca me bhagavato 'ntikādevaṃrūpo dharmaparyāyaḥ śrutapūrvaḥ /
analyzed: na ca me bhagavataḥ ntikāt evaṃrūpaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ śruta pūrvaḥ
translated: And I have never heard such a discourse on the Dharma from the Blessed One before.

original: imāśca bhagavaṃścatasraḥ parṣado vicikitsākathaṃkathāprāptāḥ /
analyzed: imāḥ ca bhagavan catasraḥ parṣadaḥ vicikitsā kathaṃkathā prāptāḥ
translated: And these four assemblies have doubts and uncertainties, Blessed One.

original: tatsādhu bhagavānnirdiśatu yatsaṃghāya tathāgato gambhīrasya tathāgatadharmasya punaḥ punaḥ saṃvarṇanāṃ karoti //
analyzed: tat sādhu bhagavān nirdiśatu yat saṃghāya tathāgataḥ gambhīrasya tathāgata dharmasya punar punar saṃvarṇanām karoti
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, it would be good if the Blessed One would explain the reason why the Tathāgata repeatedly extols the profound Dharma of the Tathāgatas.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān śāriputrastasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then at that time the venerable Śāriputra spoke these verses:

original: cirasyādya narāditya īdṛśīṃ kurute kathām /
analyzed: cirasya adya narādityaḥ īdṛśīm kurute kathām
translated: Today, after a long time, the Sun of Men makes this kind of speech.

original: balā vimokṣā dhyānāśca aprameyā mi sparśitāḥ // / //🔽bodhimaṇḍaṃ ca kīrtesi pṛcchakaste na vidyate /
analyzed: balāḥ vimokṣāḥ dhyānāḥ ca aprameyāḥ mi sparśitāḥ  bodhimaṇḍam ca pṛcchakaḥ te na vidyate
translated: The strengths, liberations, and immeasurable dhyānas have been touched by me.🔽You proclaim the seat of awakening, but there is no one who asks you.

original: saṃdhābhāṣyaṃ ca kīrtesi na ca tvāṃ kaści pṛcchati // / //
analyzed: saṃdhā bhāṣyam ca na ca tvām pṛcchati
translated: You proclaim the implied teachings, but no one asks you.

original: apṛcchito vyāharasi caryāṃ varṇesi cātmanaḥ /
analyzed: a pṛcchitaḥ vyāharasi caryām ca ātmanaḥ
translated: You speak without being asked, and you praise your own conduct.

original: jñānādhigama kīrtesi gambhīraṃ ca prabhāṣase // / //
analyzed: gambhīram ca prabhāṣase
translated: You proclaim the attainment of wisdom, and you speak of the profound.

original: adyeme saṃśayaprāptā vaśībhūtā anāsravāḥ /
analyzed: adya ime saṃśaya prāptāḥ vaśībhūtāḥ anāsravāḥ
translated: Today these beings have attained doubt, the controlled, the untainted,

original: nirvāṇaṃ prasthitā ye ca kimetad bhāṣate jinaḥ // / //
analyzed: nirvāṇam prasthitāḥ ye ca kim etat bhāṣate jinaḥ
translated: Those who are intent on nirvāṇa - what is the Victor speaking of?

original: pratyekabodhiṃ prārthentā bhikṣuṇyo bhikṣavastathā /
analyzed: pratyeka bodhim prārthentā bhikṣuṇyaḥ bhikṣavaḥ tathā
translated: Those who aspire to the enlightenment of a pratyekabuddha, the nuns and monks,

original: devā nāgāśca yakṣāśca gandharvāśca mahoragāḥ // / //
analyzed: devāḥ nāgāḥ ca yakṣāḥ ca gandharvāḥ ca mahā uragāḥ
translated: The devas, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, and mahoragas,

original: samālapanto anyonyaṃ prekṣante dvipadottamam /
analyzed: samālapantaḥ anyonyam prekṣante dvipada uttamam
translated: Speaking to each other, they look at the supreme human.

original: kathaṃkathī vicintentā vyākuruṣva mahāmune // / //
analyzed: kathaṃkathī vyākuruṣva mahā mune
translated: Contemplating the various possibilities, speak, O great sage!

original: yāvantaḥ śrāvakāḥ santi sugatasyeha sarvaśaḥ /🔽ahamatra pāramīprāpto nirdiṣṭaḥ paramarṣiṇā // / //
analyzed: yāvantaḥ śrāvakāḥ santi sugatasya iha sarvaśas  aham atra pāramī prāptaḥ nirdiṣṭaḥ parama ṛṣiṇā
translated: All the śrāvakas who are here of the Well-Gone One,🔽I have attained perfection here, indicated by the supreme sage.

original: mamāpi saṃśayo hyatra svake sthāne narottama /
analyzed: mama api saṃśayaḥ hi atra svake sthāne nara uttama
translated: I too have doubt in this, in my own place, O best of men.

original: kiṃ niṣṭhā mama nirvāṇe atha caryā mi darśitā // / //
analyzed: kim niṣṭhā mama nirvāṇe atha caryā mi darśitā
translated: What is my reliance on nirvana, or is conduct shown to me?

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: pramuñca ghoṣaṃ varadundubhisvarā udāharasvā yatha eṣa dharmaḥ /
analyzed: pramuñca ghoṣam vara dundubhi svarā udāharasva yathā eṣa dharmaḥ
translated: Emit a sound like the supreme drum, speak as this Dharma.

original: ime sthitā putra jinasya aurasā vyavalokayantaśca kṛtāñjalī jinam // / //
analyzed: ime sthitā putra jinasya aurasāḥ vyavalokayantaḥ ca kṛtāñjalī jinam
translated: These sons of the Victor, the heart-sons, stand here, looking with folded hands at the Victor.

original: devāśca nāgāśca sayakṣarākṣasāḥ koṭīsahasrā yatha gaṅgavālikāḥ /
analyzed: devāḥ ca nāgāḥ ca sa yakṣa rākṣasāḥ koṭī sahasrāḥ gaṅga vālikāḥ
translated: The devas, nagas, yakshas, rakshasas, and kotis of thousands like the sands of the Ganges,

original: ye cāpi prārthenti samagrabodhiṃ sahasraśītiḥ paripūrṇa ye sthitāḥ // / //
analyzed: ye ca api samagra bodhim sahasraśītiḥ paripūrṇa ye sthitāḥ
translated: And those who aspire for complete enlightenment, the eighty thousand who are present,

original: rājāna ye mahipati cakravartino ye āgatāḥ kṣetrasahasrakoṭibhiḥ /
analyzed: ye mahipati cakravartinaḥ ye āgatāḥ kṣetra sahasra koṭibhiḥ
translated: The kings who are the lords of the earth, the wheel-turning kings, who have come from kotis of thousands of realms,

original: kṛtāñjalī sarvi sagauravāḥ sthitāḥ kathaṃ nu caryāṃ paripūrayema // / //
analyzed: kṛtāñjalī sarvi sa gauravāḥ sthitāḥ katham nu caryām paripūrayema
translated: All stand with folded hands, full of respect, thinking, How shall we fulfill our conduct?

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ śāriputrametadavocat alaṃ śāriputra /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat alam śāriputra
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Shariputra, Enough, Shariputra.

original: kimanenārthena bhāṣitena /
analyzed: kim anena arthena bhāṣitena
translated: What is the use of speaking about this meaning?

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: utrasiṣyati śāriputra ayaṃ sadevako loko 'sminnarthe vyākriyamāṇe /
analyzed: śāriputra ayam sa devakaḥ smin arthe vyākriyamāṇe
translated: Shariputra, this world with its devas will tremble at this meaning being explained.

original: dvaitīyakamapyāyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantamadhyeṣate sma bhāṣatāṃ bhagavān /
analyzed: dvaitīyakam api āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam adhyeṣate sma bhāṣatām bhagavān
translated: For a second time, the venerable Śāriputra requested the Blessed One, May the Blessed One speak!

original: bhāṣatāṃ sugata etamevārtham /
analyzed: bhāṣatām sugataḥ etam eva artham
translated: May the Sugata speak about this very topic.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: santi bhagavaṃstasyāṃ parṣadi bahūni prāṇiśatāni bahūni prāṇisahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇiśatasahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇikoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi pūrvabuddhadarśāvīni
analyzed: santi bhagavan tasyām parṣadi bahūni prāṇi śatāni bahūni prāṇi sahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇi śata sahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇi koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi pūrva buddha darśāvīni
translated: Blessed One, in this assembly there are many hundreds of living beings, many thousands of living beings, many hundreds of thousands of living beings, many hundred thousand koṭis of niyutas of living beings who have seen the former Buddhas,

original: yāni bhagavato bhāṣitaṃ śraddhāsyanti pratīyiṣyanti udgrahīṣyanti //
analyzed: yāni bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam śraddhāsyanti pratīyiṣyanti udgrahīṣyanti
translated: who will have faith in, understand, and accept what the Blessed One has said.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantamanayā gāthayādhyabhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam anayā gāthayā adhyabhāṣata
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra addressed the Blessed One with this verse:

original: vispaṣṭu bhāṣasva jināna uttamā santīha parṣāya sahasra prāṇinām /
analyzed: vispaṣṭu bhāṣasva jināna uttamā santi iha parṣāya sahasra prāṇinām
translated: Speak clearly, O Victorious One, supreme among men! There are in this assembly thousands of living beings,

original: śrāddhāḥ prasannāḥ sugate sagauravā jñāsyanti ye dharmamudāhṛtaṃ te // / //
analyzed: śrāddhāḥ prasannāḥ sugate sa gauravāḥ jñāsyanti ye dharmam udāhṛtam te
translated: Faithful, serene, respectful towards the Sugata, who will understand the Dharma when it is taught.

original: atha khalu bhagavān dvaitīyakamapyāyuṣmantaṃ śāriputrametadavocat alaṃ śāriputra anenārthena prakāśitena /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān dvaitīyakam api āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat alam śāriputra anena arthena prakāśitena
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Śāriputra for a second time, Enough, Śāriputra, with the teaching of this meaning being revealed.

original: utrasiṣyati śāriputra ayaṃ sadevako loko 'sminnarthe vyākriyamāṇe /
analyzed: śāriputra ayam sa devakaḥ smin arthe vyākriyamāṇe
translated: Śāriputra, the world with its gods will be terrified when this matter is declared.

original: abhimānaprāptāśca bhikṣavo mahāprapātaṃ prapatiṣyanti //
analyzed: abhimāna prāptāḥ ca bhikṣavaḥ mahā prapātam prapatiṣyanti
translated: And conceited monks will fall into a great abyss.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimāṃ gāthāmabhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imām gāthām abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke this verse:

original: alaṃ hi dharmeṇiha bhāṣitena sūkṣmaṃ idaṃ jñānamatarkikaṃ ca /
analyzed: alam hi dharmeṇa iha bhāṣitena sūkṣmam idam jñānam atarkikam ca
translated: Enough with teaching the Dharma here, for this knowledge is subtle and not to be reasoned about.

original: abhimānaprāptā bahu santi bālā nirdiṣṭadharmasmi kṣipe ajānakāḥ // / //
analyzed: abhimāna prāptāḥ bahu santi bālāḥ kṣipe a jānakāḥ
translated: There are many conceited fools who, not knowing, will reject the taught Dharma.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vaidya

original: traitīyakamapyāyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantamadhyeṣate sma bhāṣatāṃ bhagavān /
analyzed: traitīyakam api āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam adhyeṣate sma bhāṣatām bhagavān
translated: For the third time, the Venerable Śāriputra entreated the Blessed One, saying: Let the Blessed One speak!

original: bhāṣatāṃ sugata etamevārtham /
analyzed: bhāṣatām sugataḥ etam eva artham
translated: Let the Well-Gone One speak about this very matter!

original: mādṛśānāṃ bhagavanniha parṣadi bahūni prāṇiśatāni saṃvidyante /
analyzed: mādṛśānām bhagavan iha parṣadi bahūni prāṇi śatāni saṃvidyante
translated: Blessed One, in this assembly of mine there are many hundreds of living beings,

original: anyāni ca bhagavan bahūni prāṇiśatāni bahūni prāṇisahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇiśatasahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇikoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi /
analyzed: anyāni ca bhagavan bahūni prāṇi śatāni bahūni prāṇi sahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇi śata sahasrāṇi bahūni prāṇi koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi
translated: Blessed One, there are many other hundreds of living beings, many thousands of living beings, many hundreds of thousands of living beings, many hundred thousands of millions of living beings,

original: yāni bhagavatā pūrvabhaveṣu paripācitāni /
analyzed: yāni bhagavatā pūrva bhaveṣu paripācitāni
translated: who have been matured by the Blessed One in previous existences.

original: tāni bhagavato bhāṣitaṃ śraddhāsyanti pratīyiṣyanti udgahīṣyanti /
analyzed: tāni bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam śraddhāsyanti pratīyiṣyanti udgahīṣyanti
translated: They will have faith in the Blessed One's teaching, will understand it, and will accept it.

original: teṣāṃ tadbhabhaviṣyati dīrgharātramarthāya hitāya sukhāyeti //
analyzed: teṣām tat bhabhaviṣyati dīrgharātram arthāya hitāya sukhāya iti
translated: This will be for their benefit, welfare, and happiness for a long time.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān śāriputrastasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then at that time the venerable Śāriputra spoke these verses:

original: bhāṣasva dharmaṃ dvipadānamuttamā ahaṃ tvāmadhyeṣami jyeṣṭhaputraḥ /
analyzed: bhāṣasva dharmam dvipa dānam uttamā aham tvām adhyeṣami jyeṣṭha putraḥ
translated: Speak the Dharma, O best of humans! I, your eldest son, request you.

original: santīha prāṇīna sahasrakoṭayo ye śraddadhāsyanti te dharma bhāṣitam // / //
analyzed: santi iha prāṇīna sahasra koṭayaḥ ye śraddadhāsyanti te dharma bhāṣitam
translated: There are here many millions of beings who will have faith in the Dharma you teach.

original: ye ca tvayā pūrvabhaveṣu nityaṃ paripācitāḥ sattva sudīrgharātram /
analyzed: ye ca tvayā pūrva bhaveṣu nityam paripācitāḥ sattva su dīrgharātram
translated: Those beings whom you have always been ripening for a long time in past existences,

original: kṛtāñjalī te pi sthitātra sarve ye śraddadhāsyanti tavaita dharmam // / //
analyzed: kṛtāñjalī te sthitā atra sarve ye śraddadhāsyanti dharmam
translated: They all stand here with palms joined, who will have faith in this Dharma of yours.

original: asmādṛśā dvādaśime śatāśca ye cāpi te prasthita agrabodhaye /
analyzed: asmādṛśāḥ dvādaśime śatāḥ ca ye ca api te
translated: These twelve hundred of us, and those who have set out for supreme enlightenment,

original: tān paśyamānaḥ sugataḥ prabhāṣatāṃ teṣāṃ ca harṣaṃ paramaṃ janetu // / //
analyzed: tān paśyamānaḥ sugataḥ prabhāṣatām teṣām ca harṣam paramam janetu
translated: Seeing them, O Sugata, speak! And let them generate the highest joy!

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstraitīyakamapyāyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasyādhyeṣaṇāṃ viditvā āyuṣmantaṃ śāriputrametadavocat yadidānīṃ tvaṃ śāriputra yāvatraitīyakamapi 🔽tathāgatamadhyeṣase /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān traitīyakam api āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasya adhyeṣaṇām viditvā āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat yat idānīm tvam śāriputra yāvatraitīyakam api  tathāgatam adhyeṣase
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing for the third time the request of the venerable Śāriputra, said this to the venerable Śāriputra: If now, Śāriputra, you request the Tathāgata up to the third time,

original: evamadhyeṣamāṇaṃ tvāṃ śāriputra kiṃ vakṣyāmi /
analyzed: evam adhyeṣamāṇam tvām śāriputra kim vakṣyāmi
translated: requesting thus, Śāriputra, what shall I say to you?

original: tena hi śāriputra śṛṇu /
analyzed: tena hi śāriputra śṛṇu
translated: Therefore, Śāriputra, listen.

original: sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasi kuru /
analyzed: sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasi kuru
translated: Listen well and pay attention.

original: bhāṣiṣye 'haṃ te //
analyzed: bhāṣiṣye ham te
translated: I will teach you.

original: samanantarabhāṣitā ceyaṃ bhagavatā vāk /🔽atha khalu tataḥ parṣada ābhimānikānāṃ bhikṣūṇāṃ bhikṣuṇīnāmupāsakānāmupāsikānāṃ
analyzed: samanantara bhāṣitā ca iyam bhagavatā vāc  atha khalu tatas parṣadaḥ ābhimānikānām bhikṣūṇām bhikṣuṇīnām upāsakānām upāsikānām
translated: And this speech was just spoken by the Blessed One.🔽Then from that assembly, five thousand monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen who were conceited,

original: pañcamātrāṇi sahasrāṇyutthāya āsanebhyo bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivanditvā tataḥ
analyzed: pañca mātrāṇi sahasrāṇi utthāya āsanebhyaḥ bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivanditvā tatas
translated: having risen from their seats, bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One, and then

original: parṣado 'pakrāmanti sma /
analyzed: parṣadaḥ pakrāmanti sma
translated: departed from that assembly.

original: yathāpīdamabhimānākuśalamūlena aprāpte prāptasaṃjñino 'nadhigate 'dhigatasaṃjñinaḥ /
analyzed: yathā api idam abhimāna akuśala mūlena a prāpte prāpta saṃjñinaḥ na adhigate dhigata saṃjñinaḥ
translated: As if they were due to the unwholesome root of conceit, having the perception of attained where they have not attained, the perception of realized where they have not realized.

original: te ātmānaṃ savraṇaṃ jñātvā tataḥ parṣado 'pakrāntāḥ /
analyzed: te ātmānam sa vraṇam jñātvā tatas parṣadā upakrāntāḥ
translated: Knowing themselves to be wounded, they departed from that assembly.

original: bhagavāṃśca tūṣṇīṃbhāvenādhivāsayati sma //
analyzed: bhagavān ca tūṣṇīṃbhāvena adhivāsayati sma
translated: And the Blessed One assented by remaining silent.

original: atha khalu bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ śāriputramāmantrayate sma nippalāvā me śāriputra parṣat apagataphalguḥ śraddhāsāre pratiṣṭhitā /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmantam śāriputram āmantrayate sma nippalāvā me śāriputra parṣad apagata phalguḥ śraddhā sāre pratiṣṭhitā
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the venerable Śāriputra, saying, Śāriputra, my assembly is free from chaff, devoid of husks, and established in the essence of faith.

original: sādhu śāriputra eteṣāmābhimānikānāmato 'pakramaṇam /
analyzed: sādhu śāriputra eteṣām ābhimānikānām atas upakramaṇam
translated: It is good, Śāriputra, that these conceited ones have departed.

original: tena hi śāriputra bhāṣiṣye etamartham /
analyzed: tena hi śāriputra bhāṣiṣye etam artham
translated: Therefore, Śāriputra, I will teach this meaning.

original: sādhu bhagavannityāyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavataḥ pratyaśrauṣīt //
analyzed: sādhu bhagavan iti āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavataḥ pratyaśrauṣīt
translated: Very well, Blessed One, the venerable Śāriputra replied to the Blessed One.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: bhagavānetadavocat kadācit karhicicchāriputra tathāgata evaṃrūpāṃ dharmadeśanāṃ kathayati /
analyzed: bhagavān etat avocat kadācid karhicit śāriputra tathāgataḥ evaṃrūpām dharma deśanām kathayati
translated: The Blessed One said this: Śāriputra, a Tathāgata sometimes teaches this kind of Dharma teaching.

original: tadyathāpi nāma śāriputra udumbarapuṣpaṃ kadācit karhicit saṃdṛśyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma śāriputra udumbara puṣpam kadācid karhicit saṃdṛśyate
translated: For example, Śāriputra, the flower of the udumbara tree is sometimes seen.

original: evameva śāriputra tathāgato 'pi kadācit karhicit evaṃrūpāṃ dharmadeśanāṃ kathayati /
analyzed: evam eva śāriputra tathāgataḥ pi kadācid karhicit evaṃrūpām dharma deśanām kathayati
translated: In the same way, Śāriputra, a Tathāgata sometimes teaches this kind of Dharma teaching.

original: śraddadhata me śāriputra /🔽bhūtavādyahamasmi /🔽tathāvādyahamasmi /
analyzed: śraddadhata me śāriputra  bhūtavādī aham asmi  tathāvādī aham asmi
translated: Have faith in me, Śāriputra.🔽I am one who speaks the truth.🔽I am one who speaks thus.

original: ananyathāvādyahamasmi /
analyzed: an anyathāvādī aham asmi
translated: I am one who speaks without falsehood.

original: durbodhyaṃ śāriputra tathāgatasya saṃdhābhāṣyam /
analyzed: durbodhyam śāriputra tathāgatasya saṃdhā bhāṣyam
translated: “Śāriputra, the Tathāgata’s teaching with an implied meaning is difficult to understand.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: nānāniruktinirdeśābhilāpanirdeśanairmayā śāriputra vividhairupāyakauśalyaśatasahasrairdharmaḥ saṃprakāśitaḥ /
analyzed: nānā nirukti nirdeśa abhilāpa nirdeśanaiḥ mayā śāriputra vividhaiḥ upāya kauśalya śata sahasraiḥ dharmaḥ saṃprakāśitaḥ
translated: “Śāriputra, I have taught the Dharma with many different kinds of expressions, with many hundreds of thousands of skillful methods.

original: atarko 'tarkāvacarastathāgatavijñeyaḥ śāriputra saddharmaḥ /
analyzed: atarko tarka avacaraḥ tathāgata vijñeyaḥ śāriputra saddharmaḥ
translated: “Śāriputra, the true Dharma of the Tathāgata is beyond thought and beyond being an object of thought. It is to be known by the Tathāgata.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: ekakṛtyena śāriputra ekakaraṇīyena tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho loka utpadyate mahākṛtyena mahākaraṇīyena /
analyzed: eka kṛtyena śāriputra eka karaṇīyena tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke utpadyate mahā kṛtyena mahā karaṇīyena
translated: “Śāriputra, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha appears in the world for one great matter, for one great deed.

original: katamaṃ ca śāriputra tathāgatasya ekakṛtyamekakaraṇīyaṃ mahākṛtyaṃ mahākaraṇīyaṃ yena kṛtyena tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho loka utpadyate /
analyzed: katamam ca śāriputra tathāgatasya eka kṛtyam eka karaṇīyam mahā kṛtyam mahā karaṇīyam yena kṛtyena tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke utpadyate
translated: “Śāriputra, what is the Tathāgata’s one great matter, his one great deed, for which the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha appears in the world?

original: yadidaṃ tathāgatajñānadarśanasamādāpanahetunimittaṃ sattvānāṃ tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho loka utpadyate /
analyzed: yat idam tathāgata jñāna darśana samādāpana hetu nimittam sattvānām tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke utpadyate
translated: It is in order to cause beings to experience the vision of the Tathāgata’s knowledge and insight that the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha appears in the world.

original: tathāgatajñānadarśanasaṃdarśanahetunimittaṃ sattvānāṃ tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho loka utpadyate /
analyzed: tathāgata jñāna darśana saṃdarśana hetu nimittam sattvānām tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke utpadyate
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One appears in the world for the sake of showing the vision, knowledge, wisdom, and realization of the Tathāgata.

original: tathāgatajñānadarśanāvatāraṇahetunimittaṃ sattvānāṃ tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho loka utpadyate /🔽tathāgatajñānapratibodhanahetunimittaṃ sattvānāṃ tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho loka utpadyate /
analyzed: tathāgata jñāna darśana avatāraṇa hetu nimittam sattvānām tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke utpadyate  tathāgata jñāna pratibodhana hetu nimittam sattvānām tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke utpadyate
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One appears in the world for the sake of introducing beings to the vision, knowledge, wisdom, and realization of the Tathāgata.🔽The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One appears in the world for the sake of awakening beings to the vision, knowledge, wisdom, and realization of the Tathāgata.

original: tathāgatajñānadarśanamārgāvatāraṇahetunimittaṃ sattvānāṃ tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho loka utpadyate /
analyzed: tathāgata jñāna darśana mārga avatāraṇa hetu nimittam sattvānām tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke utpadyate
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One appears in the world for the sake of introducing beings to the path of the vision, knowledge, wisdom, and realization of the Tathāgata.

original: idaṃ tacchāriputra tathāgatasya ekakṛtyamekakaraṇīyaṃ mahākṛtyaṃ mahākaraṇīyamekaprayojanaṃ loke prādurbhāvāya /🔽iti hi śāriputra yattathāgatasya ekakṛtyamekakaraṇīyaṃ mahākṛtyaṃ mahākaraṇīyam /
analyzed: idam tat śāriputra tathāgatasya eka kṛtyam eka karaṇīyam mahā kṛtyam mahā karaṇīyam eka prayojanam loke prādurbhāvāya  iti hi śāriputra yat tathāgatasya eka kṛtyam eka karaṇīyam mahā kṛtyam mahā karaṇīyam
translated: This, Śāriputra, is the Tathāgata's one deed, one action, one great deed, one great action, one purpose for appearing in the world.

original: tattathāgataḥ karoti /
analyzed: tat tathāgataḥ karoti
translated: Thus, Śāriputra, the Tathāgata performs that one deed, one action, one great deed, one great action.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathāgatajñānadarśanasamādāpaka evāhaṃ śāriputra /
analyzed: tathāgata jñāna darśana samādāpakaḥ eva aham śāriputra
translated: Śāriputra, I am the one who inspires to the vision, knowledge, wisdom, and realization of the Tathāgata.

original: tathāgatajñānadarśanasaṃdarśaka evāhaṃ śāriputra /🔽tathāgatajñānadarśanāvatāraka evāhaṃ śāriputra /
analyzed: tathāgata jñāna darśana saṃdarśakaḥ eva aham śāriputra  tathāgata jñāna darśana avatārakaḥ eva aham śāriputra
translated: I am the one who reveals the vision of the Tathāgata’s knowledge, Śāriputra.🔽I am the one who causes the vision of the Tathāgata’s knowledge to be entered, Śāriputra.

original: tathāgatajñānadarśanapratibodhaka evāhaṃ śāriputra /
analyzed: tathāgata jñāna darśana pratibodhakaḥ eva aham śāriputra
translated: I am the one who causes the vision of the Tathāgata’s knowledge to be awakened, Śāriputra.

original: tathāgatajñānadarśanamārgāvatāraka evāhaṃ śāriputra /
analyzed: tathāgata jñāna darśana mārga avatārakaḥ eva aham śāriputra
translated: I am the one who causes the vision of the Tathāgata’s knowledge to be entered upon the path, Śāriputra.

original: ekamevāhaṃ śāriputra yānamārabhya sattvānāṃ dharma deśayāmi yadidaṃ buddhayānam /
analyzed: ekam eva aham śāriputra yānam ārabhya sattvānām dharma deśayāmi yat idam buddha yānam
translated: Śāriputra, I teach the Dharma to beings with reference to one vehicle, and that is the Buddhayāna.

original: na kiṃcicchāriputra dvitīyaṃ vā tṛtīyaṃ vā yānaṃ saṃvidyate /
analyzed: na kiṃcid śāriputra dvitīyam vā tṛtīyam vā yānam saṃvidyate
translated: Śāriputra, there is no second vehicle or third vehicle.

original: sarvatraiṣā śāriputra dharmatā daśadigloke /
analyzed: sarvatra eṣā śāriputra dharma tā daśa diś loke
translated: Śāriputra, this is the nature of things everywhere in the worlds of the ten directions.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: ye 'pi tu śāriputra atīta
analyzed: ye pi tu śāriputra atīta
translated: Śāriputra, those who in the past

original: 'dhvanyabhūvan daśasu dikṣvaprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tathāgatā arhantaḥ
analyzed: dhvanyabhūvan daśasu dikṣu aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ
translated: in the immeasurable and incalculable world systems in the ten directions were Tathāgatas, Arhats,

original: samyaksaṃbuddhā bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāyai mahato janakāyasyārthāya
analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāyai mahataḥ jana kāyasya arthāya
translated: Perfectly Enlightened Ones, for the benefit of many people, for the happiness of many people, out of compassion for the world, for the welfare, benefit, and happiness

original: hitāya sukhāya devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca /
analyzed: hitāya sukhāya devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca
translated: of gods and human beings,

original: ye nānābhinirhāranirdeśavividhahetukāraṇanidarśanārambaṇaniruktyupāyakauśalyairnānādhimuktānāṃ sattvānāṃ nānādhātvāśayānāmāśayaṃ viditvā dharmaṃ 🔽deśitavantaḥ /
analyzed: ye nānā abhinirhāra nirdeśa vividha hetu kāraṇa nidarśana ārambaṇa nirukti upāya kauśalyaiḥ nānā adhimuktānām sattvānām nānā dhātu āśayānām āśayam viditvā dharmam  deśitavantaḥ
translated: using various expressions, reasons, explanations, illustrations, etymologies, and skillful means,

original: te 'pi sarve śāriputra buddhā bhagavanta ekameva yānamārabhya sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśitavantaḥ /
analyzed: te pi sarve śāriputra buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ ekam eva yānam ārabhya sattvānām dharmam deśitavantaḥ
translated: they all, Śāriputra, taught the Dharma to beings using only the One Vehicle,

original: yadidaṃ buddhayānaṃ sarvajñatāparyavasānam /
analyzed: yat idam buddha yānam sarvajña tā paryavasānam
translated: namely the Buddha Vehicle, which ends in omniscience.

original: yadidaṃ tathāgatajñānadarśanasamādāpanameva sattvānāṃ tathāgatajñānadarśanasaṃdarśanameva
analyzed: yat idam tathāgata jñāna darśana samādāpanam eva sattvānām tathāgata jñāna darśana saṃdarśanam eva
translated: They taught the Dharma to beings by encouraging them to attain the vision and knowledge of the Tathāgata, by showing them the vision and knowledge of the Tathāgata,

original: tathāgatajñānadarśanāvatāraṇameva tathāgatajñānadarśanapratibodhanameva tathāgatajñānadarśanamārgāvatāraṇameva
analyzed: tathāgata jñāna darśana avatāraṇam eva tathāgata jñāna darśana pratibodhanam eva tathāgata jñāna darśana mārga avatāraṇam eva
translated: by causing them to enter the vision and knowledge of the Tathāgata, by causing them to awaken to the vision and knowledge of the Tathāgata, and by causing them to enter the path of the vision and knowledge of the Tathāgata.

original: sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśitavantaḥ /
analyzed: sattvānām dharmam deśitavantaḥ
translated: They taught the Dharma to beings.

original: yairapi śāriputra sattvaisteṣāmatītānāṃ tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāmantikāt saddharmaḥ śrutaḥ /
analyzed: yaiḥ api śāriputra sattvaiḥ teṣām atītānām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām antikāt saddharmaḥ śrutaḥ
translated: Śāriputra, those beings who have heard the true Dharma from those past Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones,

original: te 'pi sarve 'nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodherlābhino 'bhūvan //
analyzed: te pi sarve nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ lābhinaḥ bhūvan
translated: they all have attained the highest complete enlightenment.

original: Vaidya 🔽ye 'pi te śāriputra anāgate 'dhvani bhaviṣyanti daśasu dikṣvaprameyeṣvasaṃkhyeyeṣu
analyzed: vaidya  ye pi te śāriputra anāgate dhvani bhaviṣyanti daśasu dikṣu aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu
translated: physician 🔽Those who in the future, Śāriputra, will be Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones in the immeasurable and incalculable

translated: Listen to me, son of Śāri, how this Dharma of the Perfectly Awakened Ones, the Supreme Men,

original: yathā ca buddhāḥ kathayanti nāyakā upāyakauśalyaśatairanekaiḥ // / //
analyzed: yathā ca buddhāḥ kathayanti nāyakāḥ upāya kauśalya śataiḥ anekaiḥ
translated: and how the Buddhas, the Leaders, with many hundreds of skillful means,

original: yathāśayaṃ jāniya te cariṃ ca nānādhimuktāniha prāṇakoṭinām /
analyzed: yathāśayam te carim ca nānā adhimuktān iha prāṇa koṭinām
translated: knowing their inclinations and conduct, and the various aspirations of these millions of living beings here,

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: the physician

original: citrāṇi karmāṇi viditva teṣāṃ purākṛtaṃ yatkuśalaṃ ca tehi // / //
analyzed: citrāṇi karmāṇi teṣām purā kṛtam yat kuśalam ca te hi
translated: having known their various actions and the good deeds done by them in the past,

original: nānāniruktīhi ca kāraṇehi saṃprāpayāmī ima teṣa prāṇinām /🔽hetūhi dṛṣṭāntaśatehi cāhaṃ tathā tathā toṣayi sarvasattvān // / //
analyzed: nānā niruktīhi ca kāraṇehi saṃprāpayāmi prāṇinām  dṛṣṭānta śatehi ca aham tathā tathā toṣayi sarva sattvān
translated: with various etymologies and reasons, I bring these living beings🔽to the path of the noble ones, to the supreme city of nirvāṇa, with hundreds of reasons and examples.

original: sūtrāṇi bhāṣāmi tathaiva gāthā itivṛttakaṃ jātakamadbhutaṃ ca /
analyzed: sūtrāṇi bhāṣāmi tathā eva gāthāḥ itivṛttakam jātakam adbhutam ca
translated: I teach the sūtras and likewise the verses, the itivṛttaka, the jātaka, and the adbhuta.

original: nidāna aupamyaśataiśca citrairgeyaṃ ca bhāṣāmi tathopadeśān // / //
analyzed: nidāna aupamya śataiḥ ca citraiḥ geyam ca bhāṣāmi tathā upadeśān
translated: With hundreds of parables and various teachings, I teach the Geṣya and the Upadeśa.

original: ye bhonti hīnābhiratā avidvasū acīrṇacaryā bahubuddhakoṭiṣu /
analyzed: ye bhonti hīna abhiratāḥ a vidvasū a cīrṇa caryāḥ bahu buddha koṭiṣu
translated: Those who delight in the inferior, who are ignorant, who have not practiced for many millions of eons,

original: saṃsāralagnāśca suduḥkhitāśca nirvāṇa teṣāmupadarśayāmi // / //
analyzed: saṃsāra lagnāḥ ca su duḥkhitāḥ ca nirvāṇa teṣām upadarśayāmi
translated: Who are attached to saṃsāra and greatly suffering, to them I show nirvāṇa.

original: upāyametaṃ kurute svayaṃbhūrbauddhasya jñānasya prabodhanārtham /
analyzed: upāyam etam kurute svayaṃbhūḥ bauddhasya jñānasya prabodhana artham
translated: This is the method the Self-Existent One uses for the sake of awakening to the Buddha's knowledge.

original: na cāpi teṣāṃ pravade kadācid yuṣme 'pi buddhā iha loki bheṣyatha // / //
analyzed: na ca api teṣām pravade kadācid yuṣme buddhāḥ iha loki
translated: But I never tell them, You too will become Buddhas in this world.

original: kiṃ kāraṇaṃ kālamavekṣya tāyī kṣaṇaṃ ca dṛṣṭvā tatu paśca bhāṣate /
analyzed: kim kāraṇam kālam avekṣya tāyī kṣaṇam ca dṛṣṭvā bhāṣate
translated: Why is it so? The Teacher, considering the time, having seen the moment, then speaks.

original: so 'yaṃ kṣaṇo adya kathaṃci labdho vadāmi yeneha ca bhūtaniścayam // / //
analyzed: saḥ yam kṣaṇaḥ adya kathaṃcid labdhaḥ vadāmi yena iha ca bhūta niścayam
translated: This moment has somehow been obtained today, by which I speak here of the true certainty.

original: navāṅgametanmama śāsanaṃ ca prakāśitaṃ sattvabalābalena /
analyzed: nava aṅgam etat mama śāsanam ca prakāśitam sattva balābalena
translated: This nine-branched teaching of mine has been revealed according to the strength and weakness of beings.

original: upāya eṣo varadasya jñāne praveśanārthāya nidarśito me // / //
analyzed: upāyaḥ eṣaḥ vara dasya jñāne praveśana arthāya nidarśitaḥ me
translated: This method has been shown by me, the Bestower of Boons, for the sake of entering into knowledge.

original: bhavanti ye ceha sadā viśuddhā vyaktā śucī sūrata buddhaputrāḥ /
analyzed: bhavanti ye ca iha sadā viśuddhāḥ vyaktā śucī sūrata buddha putrāḥ
translated: Those who are always pure, clear, clean, loving, and the Buddha's sons, in this world,

original: kṛtādhikārā bahubuddhakoṭiṣu vaipulyasūtrāṇi vadāmi teṣām // / //
analyzed: kṛta adhikārāḥ bahu buddha koṭiṣu vaipulya sūtrāṇi vadāmi teṣām
translated: Having performed acts of service to many millions of buddhas, I teach them the extensive sūtras.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: tathā hi te āśayasaṃpadāya viśuddharūpāya samanvitābhūn /
analyzed: tathā hi te āśaya saṃpadāya viśuddha rūpāya samanvitāḥ abhūn
translated: For they were endowed with the perfection of intention and pure form.

original: vadāmi tān buddha bhaviṣyatheti anāgate 'dhvāni hitānukampakāḥ // / //
analyzed: vadāmi tān buddha bhaviṣyatha iti anāgate dhvāni hita anukampakāḥ
translated: I say, 'In the future, you will become buddhas, benefactors and compassionate ones.'

original: śrutvā ca prītisphuṭa bhonti sarve buddhā bhaviṣyāma jagatpradhānāḥ /
analyzed: śrutvā ca bhonti sarve buddhāḥ bhaviṣyāma jagat pradhānāḥ
translated: And having heard, they all become filled with joy, thinking, 'We will become buddhas, supreme in the world.'

original: punaśca haṃ jāniya teṣa caryāṃ vaipulyasūtrāṇi prakāśayāmi // / //
analyzed: punar ca ham caryām vaipulya sūtrāṇi prakāśayāmi
translated: And again, knowing their conduct, I reveal the extensive sūtras to them.

original: ime ca te śrāvaka nāyakasya yehi śrutaṃ śāsanametamagryam /
analyzed: ime ca te śrāvaka nāyakasya yā ihi śrutam śāsanam etam agryam
translated: And these are the disciples of the guide who have heard this supreme teaching of mine.

original: ekāpi gāthā śruta dhāritā vā sarveṣa bodhāya na saṃśayo 'sti // / //
analyzed: ekā api gāthā śruta dhāritā vā sarveṣa bodhāya na saṃśayaḥ sti
translated: Even if they have heard or retained just one verse, there is no doubt that all of them will attain enlightenment.

original: ekaṃ hi yānaṃ dvitiyaṃ na vidyate tṛtiyaṃ hi naivāsti kadāci loke /
analyzed: ekam hi yānam dvitiyam na vidyate tṛtiyam hi na eva asti kadācid loke
translated: There is only one vehicle, a second does not exist, and a third never exists at any time in the world.

original: anyatrupāyā puruṣottamānāṃ yadyānanānātvupadarśayanti // / //
analyzed: anyatra upāyā puruṣa uttamānām
translated: Except for the skillful means of the Supreme Beings, by which they show the variety of vehicles.

original: bauddhasya jñānasya prakāśanārthaṃ loke samutpadyati lokanāthaḥ /
analyzed: bauddhasya jñānasya prakāśana artham loke samutpadyati lokanāthaḥ
translated: For the sake of revealing the knowledge of the Buddha, the Lord of the World appears in the world.

original: ekaṃ hi kāryaṃ dvitiyaṃ na vidyate na hīnayānena nayanti buddhāḥ // / //
analyzed: ekam hi kāryam dvitiyam na vidyate na hīna yānena nayanti buddhāḥ
translated: For there is only one task, there is no second, the Buddhas do not lead with the Lesser Vehicle.

original: pratiṣṭhito yatra svayaṃ svayaṃbhūryaccaiva buddhaṃ yatha yādṛśaṃ ca /
analyzed: pratiṣṭhitaḥ yatra svayam svayaṃbhūḥ yat ca eva buddham yādṛśam ca
translated: Where the Self-Existent One himself is established, and also the Buddha, as he is and what he is like,

original: balāśca ye dhyānavimokṣaindriyāstatraiva sattvā pi pratiṣṭhapeti // / //🔽mātsaryadoṣo hi bhaveta mahyaṃ spṛśitva bodhiṃ virajāṃ viśiṣṭām /
analyzed: balāḥ ca ye dhyāna vimokṣa aindriyāḥ tatra eva  mātsarya doṣaḥ hi bhaveta mahyam spṛśitva bodhim virajām viśiṣṭām
translated: And the powers, the meditations, liberations, and faculties, there he establishes beings.

original: yadi hīnayānasmi pratiṣṭhapeyamekaṃ pi sattvaṃ na mamate sādhu // / //
analyzed: yadi sattvam na mamate sādhu
translated: If I were to establish even one being in the Lesser Vehicle, that would not be good for me,🔽For I would have the fault of stinginess, having attained the supreme, stainless enlightenment.

original: mātsarya mahyaṃ na kahiṃci vidyate īrṣyā na me nāpi ca chandarāgaḥ /
analyzed: mātsarya mahyam na kahiṃci vidyate īrṣyā na me na api ca chanda rāgaḥ
translated: I have no stinginess anywhere, I have no envy or desire,

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: ucchinna pāpā mama sarvadharmāstenāsmi buddho jagato 'nubodhāt // / //
analyzed: ucchinna pāpāḥ mama sarva dharmāḥ tena asmi buddhaḥ jagataḥ
translated: I have cut off all evil dharmas, therefore I am a Buddha, through realizing the world.

original: yathā hyahaṃ citritu lakṣaṇehi prabhāsayanto imu sarvalokam /
analyzed: yathā hi aham lakṣaṇehi prabhāsayantaḥ sarva lokam
translated: Just as I, adorned with the marks, illuminating this entire world,

original: puraskṛtaḥ prāṇiśatairanekairdeśemimāṃ dharmasvabhāvamudrām // / //
analyzed: puraskṛtaḥ prāṇi śataiḥ anekaiḥ deśem imām dharma svabhāva mudrām
translated: Surrounded by many hundreds of beings, teach this Dharma seal of the nature of reality,

original: evaṃ ca cintemyahu śāriputra kathaṃ nu evaṃ bhavi sarvasattvāḥ /
analyzed: evam ca cintemi ahu śāriputra katham nu evam sarva sattvāḥ
translated: And I think like this, Śāriputra, how can all beings be

original: dvātriṃśatīlakṣaṇarūpadhāriṇaḥ svayaṃprabhā lokavidū svayaṃbhūḥ // / //
analyzed: dvātriṃśatī lakṣaṇa rūpa dhāriṇaḥ svayaṃprabhāḥ svayaṃbhūḥ
translated: Bearing the form of the thirty-two marks, self-luminous, a knower of the world, self-arisen.

original: yathā ca paśyāmi yathā ca cintaye yathā ca saṃkalpa mamāsi pūrvam /
analyzed: yathā ca paśyāmi yathā ca cintaye yathā ca saṃkalpa mama asi pūrvam
translated: As I see, as I think, as I had previously imagined,

original: paripūrṇametat praṇidhānu mahyaṃ buddhā ca bodhiṃ ca prakāśayāmi // / //
analyzed: paripūrṇam etat mahyam buddhā ca bodhim ca prakāśayāmi
translated: This aspiration of mine is fulfilled. I proclaim the Buddha and the enlightenment.

original: sacedahaṃ śārisutā vadeyaṃ sattvāna bodhāya janetha chandam /
analyzed: saced aham śārisutāḥ vadeyam bodhāya janetha chandam
translated: If I, Shariputra, were to say, 'Generate the desire for enlightenment for the sake of beings,'

original: ajānakāḥ sarva bhrameyuratra na jātu gṛhṇīyu subhāṣitaṃ me // / //
analyzed: a jānakāḥ sarve bhrameyuḥ atra na jātu gṛhṇīyuḥ subhāṣitam me
translated: All who do not know would be confused here. They would never accept my well-spoken words.

original: tāṃścaiva haṃ jāniya evarūpān na cīrṇacaryāḥ purimāsu jātiṣu /🔽adhyoṣitāḥ kāmaguṇeṣu saktāstṛṣṇāya saṃmūrchita mohacittāḥ // / //
analyzed: tān ca eva ham jāniye evarūpān na cīrṇa caryāḥ purimāsu jātiṣu  adhyoṣitāḥ kāma guṇeṣu saktāḥ tṛṣṇāya saṃmūrchita moha cittāḥ
translated: And I know those of such kind have not practiced the conduct in previous births,🔽Addicted to the pleasures of the senses, their minds deluded and intoxicated by craving.

original: te kāmahetoḥ prapatanti durgatiṃ ṣaṭsū gatīṣū parikhidyamānāḥ /
analyzed: te kāma hetoḥ prapatanti durgatim parikhidyamānāḥ
translated: For the sake of sensual pleasures, they fall into bad rebirths, suffering in the six destinies.

original: kaṭasī ca vardhenti punaḥ punaste duḥkhena saṃpīḍita alpapuṇyāḥ // / //
analyzed: ca vardhenti punar punar te duḥkhena saṃpīḍita alpa puṇyāḥ
translated: They increase their defilements again and again, those of little merit, afflicted by suffering.

original: vilagna dṛṣṭīgahaneṣu nityamastīti nāstīti tathāsti nāsti /
analyzed: nityam asti iti na asti iti tathā asti na asti
translated: Always entangled in the thickets of wrong views, 'It exists,' 'It does not exist,' 'It both exists and does not exist,'

original: dvāṣaṣṭi dṛṣṭīkṛta niśrayitvā asanta bhāvaṃ parigṛhya te sthitāḥ // / //
analyzed: dvāṣaṣṭi dṛṣṭīkṛta niśrayitvā asanta bhāvam parigṛhya te sthitāḥ
translated: Relying on the sixty-two views, they abide in the grasping of non-existent existence.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: duḥśodhakā mānina dambhinaśca vaṅkāḥ śaṭhā alpaśrutāśca bālāḥ /
analyzed: duḥśodhakāḥ dambhinaḥ ca vaṅkāḥ śaṭhāḥ alpa śrutāḥ ca bālāḥ
translated: Difficult to purify, proud, deceitful, crooked, deceitful, and of little learning, the foolish

original: te naiva śṛṇvanti subuddhaghoṣaṃ kadāci pi jātisahasrakoṭiṣu // / //
analyzed: te na eva śṛṇvanti su buddha ghoṣam kadācid jāti sahasra koṭiṣu
translated: Never hear the sound of the Well-Gone, even in thousands of millions of births.

original: teṣāmahaṃ śārisutā upāyaṃ vadāmi duḥkhasya karotha antam /
analyzed: teṣām aham śārisutāḥ upāyam vadāmi duḥkhasya karotha antam
translated: I, the son of Śāri, speak the means for them: Make an end to suffering!

original: duḥkhena saṃpīḍita dṛṣṭva sattvān nirvāṇa tatrāpyupadarśayāmi // / //
analyzed: duḥkhena saṃpīḍita dṛṣṭvā sattvān nirvāṇa tatra api upadarśayāmi
translated: Seeing beings afflicted by suffering, I show them nirvāṇa.

original: evaṃ ca bhāṣāmyahu nityanirvṛtā ādipraśāntā imi sarvadharmāḥ /
analyzed: evam ca bhāṣāmi ahu nitya nirvṛtāḥ ādi praśāntāḥ sarva dharmāḥ
translated: And I say this: All these phenomena are eternally extinguished, originally peaceful.

original: caryāṃ ca so pūriya buddhaputro anāgate 'dhvāni jino bhaviṣyati // / //
analyzed: caryām ca saḥ buddha putraḥ anāgate jinaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And that son of the Buddha, having fulfilled his practice, will become a Victor in the future.

original: upāyakauśalya mamaivarūpaṃ yat trīṇi yānānyupadarśayāmi /🔽ekaṃ tu yānaṃ hi nayaśca eka ekā ciyaṃ deśana nāyakānām // / //
analyzed: upāya kauśalya mama eva rūpam yat trīṇi yānāni upadarśayāmi  ekam tu yānam hi nayaḥ ca ekaḥ ekā nāyakānām
translated: This is the kind of skillful means I have: I show three vehicles.🔽But there is only one vehicle and one way, and this is the teaching of the guides.

original: vyapanehi kāṅkṣāṃ tatha saṃśayaṃ ca yeṣāṃ ca keṣāṃ ciha kāṅkṣa vidyate /
analyzed: vyapanehi kāṅkṣām saṃśayam ca yeṣām ca keṣām ciha kāṅkṣa vidyate
translated: Remove your doubts and uncertainties, and those of anyone else who has doubts.

original: ananyathāvādina lokanāyakā ekaṃ idaṃ yānu dvitīyu nāsti // / //
analyzed: ekam na asti
translated: The guides of the world, who speak without error, say that there is only one, and a second does not exist.

original: ye cāpyabhūvan purimāstathāgatāḥ parinirvṛtā buddhasahasra neke /
analyzed: ye ca api abhūvan purimāḥ tathāgatāḥ parinirvṛtāḥ buddha sahasra na eke
translated: And those who were the Tathāgatas in the past, many thousands of Buddhas who have attained final nirvāṇa,

original: atītamadhvānamasaṃkhyakalpe teṣāṃ pramāṇaṃ na kadāci vidyate // / //
analyzed: atītam adhvānam asaṃkhya kalpe teṣām pramāṇam na kadācid vidyate
translated: In the countless eons of the past, their number was never known.

original: sarvehi tehi puruṣottamehi prakāśitā dharma bahū viśuddhāḥ /
analyzed: sarvehi tehi puruṣottamehi prakāśitāḥ dharma bahū viśuddhāḥ
