translated: By all those Best of Men, many pure teachings have been proclaimed,

original: dṛṣṭāntakaiḥ kāraṇahetubhiśca upāyakauśalyaśatairanekaiḥ // / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭāntakaiḥ kāraṇa hetubhiḥ ca upāya kauśalya śataiḥ anekaiḥ
translated: With parables, reasons, and causes, and with many hundreds of skillful means.

original: sarve ca te darśayi ekayānamekaṃ ca yānaṃ avatārayanti /
analyzed: sarve ca te eka yānam ekam ca yānam avatārayanti
translated: And all of them show only one vehicle, and lead to the one vehicle,

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: The physician

original: ekasmi yāne paripācayanti acintiyā prāṇisahasrakoṭyaḥ // / //
analyzed: ekasmi yāne paripācayanti acintiyā prāṇi sahasra koṭyaḥ
translated: And bring to maturity in the one vehicle countless billions of living beings.

original: anye upāyā vividhā jinānāṃ yehī prakāśentimamagradharmam /
analyzed: anye upāyāḥ vividhāḥ jinānām
translated: The Jinas have many other methods by which they proclaim the supreme Dharma,

original: jñātvādhimuktiṃ tatha āśayaṃ ca tathāgatā loki sadevakasmin // / //
analyzed: jñātvā adhimuktim āśayam ca tathāgatāḥ loki sa devakasmin
translated: Knowing the inclinations and intentions of the Tathāgatas in the world with its gods,

original: ye cāpi sattvāstahi teṣa saṃmukhaṃ śṛṇvanti dharmaṃ atha vā śrutāvinaḥ /
analyzed: ye ca api sattvāḥ tahi saṃmukham śṛṇvanti dharmam atha vā śrutāvinaḥ
translated: And those beings who hear the Dharma directly from them, or from those who have heard it,

original: dānaṃ ca dattaṃ caritaṃ ca śīlaṃ kṣāntyā ca saṃpādita sarvacaryāḥ // / //
analyzed: dānam ca dattam caritam ca śīlam kṣāntyā ca saṃpādita sarva caryāḥ
translated: And they have practiced generosity, given, and observed discipline, and perfected all practices through patience.

original: vīryeṇa dhyānena kṛtādhikārāḥ prajñāya vā cintita eti dharmāḥ /
analyzed: vīryeṇa dhyānena kṛta adhikārāḥ prajñāya vā cintitaḥ eti dharmāḥ
translated: They have exerted themselves in diligence and meditation, and contemplated these dharmas with wisdom.

original: vividhāni puṇyāni kṛtāni yehi te sarvi bodhāya abhūṣi lābhinaḥ // / //
analyzed: vividhāni puṇyāni kṛtāni yehi te sarvi bodhāya abhūṣi lābhinaḥ
translated: Those who have created various merits, they have all attained enlightenment.

original: parinirvṛtānāṃ ca jināna teṣāṃ ye śāsane kecidabhūṣi sattvāḥ /
analyzed: parinirvṛtānām ca teṣām ye śāsane sattvāḥ
translated: Those beings who have been in the teachings of those Jinas who have attained Parinirvana,

original: kṣāntā ca dāntā ca vinīta tatra te sarvi bodhāya abhūṣi lābhinaḥ // / //
analyzed: kṣāntā ca dāntā ca vinīta tatra te sarvi bodhāya abhūṣi lābhinaḥ
translated: The patient, disciplined, and trained ones there, they have all attained enlightenment.

original: ye cāpi dhātūna karonti pūjāṃ jināna teṣāṃ parinirvṛtānām /
analyzed: ye ca api dhātūna karonti pūjām teṣām parinirvṛtānām
translated: Those who make offerings to the relics of those Jinas who have attained Parinirvana,

original: ratnāmayān stūpasahasra nekān suvarṇarūpyasya ca sphāṭikasya // / //
analyzed: ratna āmayān stūpa sahasra nekān suvarṇa rūpyasya ca sphāṭikasya
translated: Many thousands of stupas made of jewels, of gold, silver, and crystal,

original: ye cāśmagarbhasya karonti stūpān karketanāmuktamayāṃśca kecit /
analyzed: ye ca aśmagarbhasya karonti stūpān karketa nāmukta mayān ca kecid
translated: Those who make stupas of precious stone, and some of coral and amber,

original: vaiḍūryaśreṣṭhasya tathendranīlān te sarvi bodhāya abhūṣi lābhinaḥ // / //
analyzed: vaiḍūrya śreṣṭhasya tathā indranīlān te sarvi bodhāya lābhinaḥ
translated: Of excellent lapis lazuli and sapphire, they have all attained enlightenment.

original: ye cāpi śaileṣu karonti stūpān ye candanānāmagurusya kecit /
analyzed: ye ca api śaileṣu karonti stūpān ye candanānām agurusya kecid
translated: Those who make stupas of stone, and some of sandalwood and aloeswood,

original: ye devadārūsya karonti stūpān ye dārusaṃghātamayāṃśca kecit // / //
analyzed: ye karonti stūpān ye dāru saṃghāta mayān ca kecid
translated: Those who make stūpas out of devadāru wood, or some out of bundles of wood,

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: iṣṭāmayān mṛttikasaṃcitān vā prītāśca kurvanti jināna stūpān /
analyzed: iṣṭa āmayān mṛttika saṃcitān vā prītāḥ ca kurvanti stūpān
translated: Those who joyfully make stūpas of the Victorious Ones out of desired materials or piled up clay,

original: uddiśya ye pāṃsukarāśayo 'pi aṭavīṣu durgeṣu ca kārayanti // / //
analyzed: uddiśya ye aṭavīṣu durgeṣu ca kārayanti
translated: And those who, pointing out heaps of dust, have them made in difficult and dangerous forests,

original: sikatāmayān vā puna kūṭa kṛtvā ye keciduddiśya jināna stūpān /
analyzed: sikatā mayān vā puna kūṭa kṛtvā ye kecid uddiśya stūpān
translated: Or those who, having made heaps of sand, have them made as stūpas of the Victorious Ones,

original: kumārakāḥ krīḍiṣu tatra tatra te sarvi bodhāya abhūṣi lābhinaḥ // / //
analyzed: kumārakāḥ krīḍiṣu tatra tatra te sarvi bodhāya abhūṣi lābhinaḥ
translated: The children who play there and there, all of them have attained enlightenment.

original: ratnāmayā bimba tathaiva kecid dvātriṃśatīlakṣaṇarūpadhāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: ratna āmayāḥ bimba tathā eva kecid dvātriṃśatī lakṣaṇa rūpa dhāriṇaḥ
translated: Some have made images of the Victorious Ones out of jewels, bearing the form of the thirty-two marks,

original: uddiśya kārāpita yehi cāpi te sarvi bodhāya abhūṣi lābhinaḥ // / //
analyzed: uddiśya kārāpita yehi cāpi te sarvi bodhāya abhūṣi lābhinaḥ
translated: And those who have had them made as well, all of them have attained enlightenment.

original: ye saptaratnāmaya tatra kecid ye tāmrikā vā tatha kāṃsikā vā /
analyzed: tatra kecid ye tāmrikāḥ vā kāṃsikāḥ vā
translated: Some have had them made of the seven precious substances, or of copper or brass,

original: kārāpayīṣu sugatāna bimbā te sarvi bodhāya abhūṣi lābhinaḥ // / //
analyzed: kārāpayīṣu sugatāna bimbā te sarvi bodhāya abhūṣi lābhinaḥ
translated: Those who have had images of the Sugatas made, all of them have attained enlightenment.

original: sīsasya lohasya ca mṛttikāya vā kārāpayīṣu sugatāna vigrahān /
analyzed: sīsasya lohasya ca vā kārāpayīṣu sugatāna vigrahān
translated: Those who have had images of the Sugatas made of lead, iron, or clay,

original: ye pustakarmāmaya darśanīyāṃste sarvi bodhāya abhūṣi lābhinaḥ // / //
analyzed: ye pustakarma āmaya darśanīyān te sarvi bodhāya lābhinaḥ
translated: All of them attained enlightenment.

original: ye citrabhittīṣu karonti vigrahān paripūrṇagātrān śatapuṇyalakṣaṇān /
analyzed: ye citra bhittīṣu karonti vigrahān paripūrṇa gātrān śata puṇya lakṣaṇān
translated: Those who make images on painted surfaces, with perfect bodies and the marks of a hundred merits,

original: likhetsvayaṃ cāpi likhāpayedvā te sarvi bodhāya abhūṣi lābhinaḥ // / //
analyzed: likhet svayam ca api likhāpayet vā te sarvi bodhāya lābhinaḥ
translated: whether they paint them themselves or have others paint them, all of them attained enlightenment.

original: ye cāpi kecittahi śikṣamāṇāḥ krīḍāratiṃ cāpi vinodayantaḥ /
analyzed: ye ca api śikṣamāṇāḥ krīḍā ratim ca api vinodayantaḥ
translated: Those who, while training in this, are engaged in play, amusement, and entertainment,

original: nakhena kāṣṭhena kṛtāsi vigrahān bhittīṣu puruṣā ca kumārakā vā // / //
analyzed: nakhena kāṣṭhena kṛtāsi vigrahān bhittīṣu puruṣā ca kumārakā vā
translated: whether men or boys, who make images with their nails or with wood on walls,

original: sarve ca te kārūṇikā abhūvan sarve 'pi te tārayi prāṇikoṭyaḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca te kārūṇikāḥ abhūvan sarve pi te prāṇi koṭyaḥ
translated: all of them became compassionate, all of them saved millions of living beings,

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: samādapentā bahubodhisatvāṃste sarvi bodhāya abhūṣi lābhinaḥ // / //🔽dhātūṣu yaiścāpi tathāgatānāṃ stūpeṣu vā mṛttikavigraheṣu vā /
analyzed: bahu bodhisatvān te sarvi bodhāya lābhinaḥ  yaiḥ ca api tathāgatānām stūpeṣu vā mṛttikā vigraheṣu vā
translated: encouraging many bodhisattvas, all of them attained enlightenment.🔽Those who offered flowers and incense to the relics of the Tathagatas, or to stupas, or to images made of clay,

original: ālekhyabhittīṣvapi pāṃsustūpe puṣpā ca gandhā ca pradatta āsīt // / //
analyzed: ālekhya bhittīṣu api pāṃsu stūpe puṣpā ca gandhā ca pradattaḥ āsīt
translated: or to painted walls, or to sand stupas,

original: vādyā ca vādāpita yehi tatra bheryo 'tha śaṅkhāḥ paṭahāḥ sughoṣakāḥ /
analyzed: ca tatra tatra
translated: and those who played musical instruments there, such as drums, conches, and well-sounding kettledrums,

original: nirnāditā dundubhayaśca yehi pūjāvidhānāya varāgrabodhinām // / //
analyzed: nirnāditāḥ dundubhayaḥ ca yehi pūjā vidhānāya vara agra bodhinām
translated: And those who beat drums for the sake of making offerings to the supreme, highest enlightenment.

original: vīṇāśca tālā paṇavāśca yehi mṛdaṅga vaṃśā tuṇavā manojñāḥ /
analyzed: vīṇāḥ ca tālā paṇavāḥ ca yehi mṛdaṅga vaṃśā tuṇavāḥ manojñāḥ
translated: Those who play vīṇās, flutes, and paṇavas, mṛdaṅgas, bamboo flutes, and delightful tabors,

original: ekotsavā vā sukumārakā vā te sarvi bodhāya abhūṣi lābhinaḥ // / //
analyzed: ekotsavāḥ vā sukumārakāḥ vā te sarvi bodhāya lābhinaḥ
translated: Whether they are of one accord or delicate, they all attain enlightenment.

original: vādāpitā jhallariyo 'pi yehi jalamaṇḍakā carpaṭamaṇḍakā vā /
analyzed: vādāpitā jhallariyaḥ pi carpaṭamaṇḍakā vā
translated: Those who play jhaṭāras, water-filled horns, and carpaṭa horns,

original: sugatāna uddiśyatha pūjanārthaṃ gītaṃ sugītaṃ madhuraṃ manojñam // / //
analyzed: uddiśyatha pūjana artham gītam su gītam madhuram manojñam
translated: Having dedicated them to the Sugatas for the sake of worship, they sing beautiful, sweet, and delightful songs.

original: sarve ca te buddha abhūṣi loke kṛtvāna tāṃ bahuvidhadhātupūjām /
analyzed: sarve ca te loke tām bahuvidha dhātu pūjām
translated: All of them become Buddhas in the world, having made those many kinds of offerings to the relics.

original: kimalpakaṃ pi sugatāna dhātuṣu ekaṃ pi vādāpiya vādyabhāṇḍam // / //
analyzed: kim alpakam dhātuṣu ekam pi vādya bhāṇḍam
translated: Even if it is only a little, having played one instrument for the relics of the Sugatas,

original: puṣpeṇa caikena pi pūjayitvā ālekhyabhittau sugatāna bimbān /
analyzed: puṣpeṇa ca ekena pi pūjayitvā ālekhya bhittau sugatāna bimbān
translated: Even if they make offerings with only one flower to the images of the Sugatas on a painted wall,

original: vikṣiptacittā pi ca pūjayitvā anupūrva drakṣyanti ca buddhakoṭyaḥ // / //
analyzed: vikṣipta cittā pi ca pūjayitvā anupūrva drakṣyanti ca buddha koṭyaḥ
translated: Even if they make offerings with a distracted mind, they will gradually see ten million Buddhas.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: yaiścāñjalistatra kṛto 'pi stūpe paripūrṇa ekā talasaktikā vā /
analyzed: yaiḥ ca añjaliḥ tatra stūpe paripūrṇaḥ ekā tala saktikā vā
translated: Those who make the añjali gesture there to the stūpa, even if it is only filled with one palmful,

original: unnāmitaṃ śīrṣamabhūnmuhūrtamavanāmitaḥ kāyu tathaikavāram // / //
analyzed: unnāmitam śīrṣam abhūt muhūrtam avanāmitaḥ tathā eka vāram
translated: The head was raised for a moment, and the body bent down in the same way once.

original: namo 'stu buddhāya kṛtaikavāraṃ yehī tadā dhātudhareṣu teṣu /
analyzed: namaḥ stu buddhāya kṛta eka vāram tadā dhātudhareṣu teṣu
translated: Homage to the Buddha, even those who paid homage to the relics of the Tathagatas

original: vikṣiptacittairapi ekavāraṃ te sarvi prāptā imamagrabodhim // / //
analyzed: vikṣipta cittaiḥ api eka vāram te sarvi prāptāḥ imam agra bodhim
translated: Even those who paid homage with a distracted mind once, all of them attained this supreme enlightenment.

original: sugatāna teṣāṃ tada tasmi kāle parinirvṛtānāmatha tiṣṭhatāṃ vā /
analyzed: teṣām tasmi kāle parinirvṛtānām atha tiṣṭhatām vā
translated: Of those Sugatas who at that time had attained final Nirvana or were still present,

original: ye dharmanāmāpi śruṇiṃsu sattvāste sarvi bodhāya abhūṣi lābhinaḥ // / //
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ te sarvi bodhāya lābhinaḥ
translated: Those beings who heard even the name of the Dharma, all of them became destined for enlightenment.

original: anāgatā pī bahubuddhakoṭyo acintiyā yeṣu pramāṇu nāsti /
analyzed: bahu buddha koṭyaḥ acintiyāḥ yeṣu
translated: In the future, there will be many millions of Buddhas, inconceivable and immeasurable,

original: te pī jinā uttamalokanāthāḥ prakāśayiṣyanti upāyametam // / //
analyzed: te jināḥ uttama lokanāthāḥ prakāśayiṣyanti upāyam etam
translated: Those Jinas, the supreme lords of the world, will proclaim this method.

original: upāyakauśalyamanantu teṣāṃ bhaviṣyati lokavināyakānām /
analyzed: upāya kauśalyam anantu teṣām bhaviṣyati loka vināyakānām
translated: Those leaders of the world will have infinite skill in means,

original: yenā vineṣyantiha prāṇakoṭyo bauddhasmi jñānasmi anāsravasmin // / //
analyzed: vineṣyanti iha prāṇa koṭyaḥ
translated: By which they will guide millions of beings in the Buddha's knowledge, which is uncontaminated.

original: eko 'pi sattvo na kadāci teṣāṃ śrutvāna dharmaṃ na bhaveta buddhaḥ /
analyzed: ekaḥ pi sattvaḥ na kadācid teṣām dharmam na bhaveta buddhaḥ
translated: Not even a single being will ever hear the Dharma from them and not become a Buddha.

original: praṇidhānametaddhi tathāgatānāṃ caritva bodhāya carāpayeyam // / //
analyzed: praṇidhānam etat hi tathāgatānām bodhāya carāpayeyam
translated: This is the aspiration of the Tathagatas: 'Having practiced for enlightenment, I will cause others to practice.'

original: dharmāmukhā koṭisahasra neke prakāśayiṣyanti anāgate 'dhve /
analyzed: koṭi sahasra neke prakāśayiṣyanti anāgate
translated: In the future, many thousands of millions of Dharma doors will be taught, saying: This is the path to heaven, this is the path to liberation.

original: upadarśayanto imamekayānaṃ vakṣyanti dharmaṃ hi tathāgatatve // / //
analyzed: upadarśayantaḥ imam eka yānam vakṣyanti dharmam hi tathāgata tve
translated: They will teach this single vehicle, saying: This is the Dharma that leads to becoming a Tathāgata.

original: sthitikā hi eṣā sada dharmanetrī prakṛtiśca dharmāṇa sadā prabhāsate /🔽Vaidya
analyzed: sthitikā hi eṣā sadā dharma netrī prakṛtiḥ ca sadā prabhāsate  vaidya
translated: This Dharma method always abides, and the nature of phenomena always shines.

original: viditva buddhā dvipadānamuttamā prakāśayiṣyanti mamekayānam // / //
analyzed: viditvā buddhāḥ dvipadānam uttamā prakāśayiṣyanti mama eka yānam
translated: The Buddhas, the Supreme Humans, knowing this, teach this single vehicle.

original: dharmasthitiṃ dharmaniyāmatāṃ ca nityasthitāṃ loki imāmakampyām /
analyzed: dharma sthitim dharma niyāma tām ca nitya sthitām loki imām akampyām
translated: The stability of phenomena, the regularity of phenomena, always abiding in the world, unshakable -

original: buddhāśca bodhiṃ pṛthivīya maṇḍe prakāśayiṣyanti upāyakauśalam // / //
analyzed: buddhāḥ ca bodhim pṛthivīya maṇḍe prakāśayiṣyanti upāya kauśalam
translated: The Buddhas, on the terrace of enlightenment, teach this skillful means.

original: daśasū diśāsū naradevapūjitāstiṣṭhanti buddhā yatha gaṅgavālikāḥ /
analyzed: naradeva pūjitāḥ tiṣṭhanti buddhāḥ gaṅgavālikāḥ
translated: In the ten directions, Buddhas as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, worshipped by humans and gods, abide.

original: sukhāpanārthaṃ iha sarvaprāṇināṃ te cāpi bhāṣantimamagrabodhim // / //
analyzed: sukhāpana artham iha sarva prāṇinām te ca api bhāṣanti imam agra bodhim
translated: For the sake of bringing happiness to all beings, they also teach this supreme enlightenment.

original: upāyakauśalya prakāśayanti vividhāni yānānyupadarśayanti /
analyzed: upāya kauśalya prakāśayanti vividhāni yānāni upadarśayanti
translated: They teach skillful means, displaying various vehicles,

original: ekaṃ ca yānaṃ paridīpayanti buddhā imāmuttamaśāntabhūmim // / //
analyzed: ekam ca yānam paridīpayanti buddhāḥ imām uttama śānta bhūmim
translated: But the Buddhas illuminate this supreme peaceful ground, the single vehicle.

original: caritaṃ ca te jāniya sarvadehināṃ yathāśayaṃ yacca purā niṣevitam /
analyzed: caritam ca te sarva dehinām yathāśayam yat ca purā niṣevitam
translated: They know the conduct of all embodied beings, their inclinations and what they have practiced in the past.

original: vīryaṃ ca sthāmaṃ ca viditva teṣāṃ jñātvādhimuktiṃ ca prakāśayanti // / //
analyzed: vīryam ca sthāmam ca teṣām jñātvā adhimuktim ca prakāśayanti
translated: Knowing their diligence and strength, and knowing their aspirations, they illuminate...

original: dṛṣṭāntahetūn bahu darśayanti bahukāraṇān jñānabalena nāyakāḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭānta hetūn bahu darśayanti bahu kāraṇān jñāna balena nāyakāḥ
translated: The guides, with the power of knowledge, show many examples and reasons, and many causes.

original: nānādhimuktāṃśca viditva sattvān nānābhinirhārupadarśayanti // / //
analyzed: nānā adhimuktān ca sattvān nānā abhinirhārā upadarśayanti
translated: Knowing the various inclinations of beings, they demonstrate various accomplishments...

original: ahaṃ pi caitarhi jinendranāyako utpanna sattvāna sukhāpanārtham /
analyzed: aham ca etarhi jinendra nāyakaḥ sukhāpana artham
translated: I too, now, as a lord of the Jinas, a guide, have arisen for the sake of bringing happiness to beings.

original: saṃdarśayāmī ima buddhabodhiṃ nānābhinirhārasahasrakoṭibhiḥ // / //
analyzed: saṃdarśayāmi buddha bodhim nānā abhinirhāra sahasra koṭibhiḥ
translated: I reveal this enlightenment of the Buddhas through many billions of various accomplishments...

original: deśemi dharmaṃ ca bahuprakāraṃ adhimuktimadhyāśaya jñātva prāṇinām /
analyzed: deśemi dharmam ca bahu prakāram adhimuktim adhyāśaya jñātvā prāṇinām
translated: I teach the Dharma in many ways, knowing the inclinations and higher intentions of living beings.

original: saṃharṣayāmī vividhairupāyaiḥ pratyātmikaṃ jñānabalaṃ mamaitat // / //
analyzed: saṃharṣayāmī vividhaiḥ upāyaiḥ pratyātmikam jñāna balam mama etat
translated: I delight them with various methods. This is my own knowledge and power...

original: ahaṃ pi paśyāmi daridrasattvān prajñāya puṇyehi ca viprahīṇān /
analyzed: aham pi paśyāmi daridra sattvān prajñāya puṇyehi ca viprahīṇān
translated: I also see poor beings, deprived of wisdom and merit,

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: doctor

original: praskanna saṃsāri niruddha durge magnāḥ punarduḥkhaparaṃparāsu // / //
analyzed: praskanna saṃsāri niruddha durge magnāḥ punar duḥkha paraṃparāsu
translated: Fallen, wandering, obstructed, stuck in difficult situations, sinking again in a succession of sufferings...

original: tṛṣṇāvilagnāṃścamarīva bāle kāmairihāndhīkṛta sarvakālam /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā vilagnān camarī iva bāle kāmaiḥ iha andhīkṛta sarvakālam
translated: Attached to craving like a young female camel, blinded by desires at all times here,

original: na buddhameṣanti mahānubhāvaṃ na dharma mārganti dukhāntagāminam // / //
analyzed: na buddham eṣanti mahā anubhāvam na dharma mārganti dukhānta gāminam
translated: They do not seek the Buddha of great power, they do not seek the Dharma that leads to the end of suffering.

original: gatīṣu ṣaṭsu pariruddhacittāḥ kudṛṣṭidṛṣṭīṣu sthitā akampyāḥ /
analyzed: ṣaṭsu pariruddha cittāḥ kudṛṣṭi dṛṣṭīṣu sthitāḥ akampyāḥ
translated: Their minds are confined to the six destinies, they are unshakable in their wrong views,

original: duḥkhātu duḥkhānupradhāvamānāḥ kāruṇya mahyaṃ balavantu teṣu // / //
analyzed: duḥkha anupradhāvamānāḥ kāruṇya mahyam balavantu teṣu
translated: Running from suffering to suffering, I have great compassion for them.

original: so 'haṃ viditvā tahi bodhimaṇḍe saptāha trīṇi paripūrṇa saṃsthitaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ ham bodhimaṇḍe saṃsthitaḥ
translated: I, having known this on the seat of awakening, remained there for three full weeks,

original: arthaṃ vicintemimamevarūpaṃ ullokayan pādapameva tatra // / //
analyzed: artham ullokayan pādapam eva tatra
translated: Contemplating this kind of meaning, looking up at the tree there.

original: prekṣāmi taṃ cānimiṣaṃ drumendraṃ tasyaiva heṣṭhe anucaṃkramāmi /
analyzed: prekṣāmi tam ca animiṣam druma indram tasya eva heṣṭhe anucaṃkramāmi
translated: I gazed at that immovable lord of trees, walking below it,

original: āścaryajñānaṃ ca idaṃ viśiṣṭaṃ sattvāśca mohāndha avidvasū ime // / //
analyzed: āścarya jñānam ca idam viśiṣṭam sattvāḥ ca mohāndha avidvasū ime
translated: This is a wondrous and distinguished knowledge, but these beings are ignorant and blinded by delusion.

original: brahmā ca māṃ yācati tasmi kāle śakraśca catvāri ca lokapālāḥ /
analyzed: brahmā ca mām yācati tasmi kāle śakraḥ ca catvāri ca lokapālāḥ
translated: At that time, Brahma and Shakra, the four world guardians,

original: maheśvaro īśvara eva cāpi marudgaṇānāṃ ca sahasrakoṭayaḥ // / //
analyzed: maheśvaraḥ īśvaraḥ eva ca api marut gaṇānām ca sahasra koṭayaḥ
translated: Maheshvara and Isvara, and thousands of millions of Maruts,

original: kṛtāñjalī sarvi sthitāḥ sagauravā arthaṃ ca cintemi kathaṃ karomi /
analyzed: sthitāḥ sa gauravāḥ artham ca cintemi katham karomi
translated: All of them stand with palms joined, full of respect. I think, How can I act?

original: ahaṃ ca bodhīya vadāmi varṇān ime ca duḥkhairabhibhūta sattvāḥ // / //
analyzed: aham ca vadāmi varṇān ime ca duḥkhaiḥ abhibhūta sattvāḥ
translated: I speak in praise of enlightenment, but these beings are overwhelmed by suffering.

original: te mahya dharmaṃ kṣipi bālabhāṣitaṃ kṣipitva gaccheyurapāyabhūmim /
analyzed: te dharmam kṣipi bāla bhāṣitam kṣipitva gaccheyuḥ apāya bhūmim
translated: They will throw away my Dharma, calling it the speech of a fool. Having thrown it away, they will go to the lower realms.

original: śreyo mamā naiva kadāci bhāṣituṃ adyaiva me nirvṛtirastu śāntā // / //
analyzed: śreyaḥ na eva kadācid bhāṣitum adyā eva me nirvṛtiḥ astu śāntā
translated: It would be better for me never to speak. May my peace of nirvana come about today!

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: The doctor

original: purimāṃśca buddhān samanusmaranto upāyakauśalyu yathā ca teṣām /
analyzed: purimān ca buddhān samanusmarantaḥ upāya kauśalyu yathā ca teṣām
translated: Remembering the Buddhas of the past, and the skillful means of those Buddhas,

original: yaṃ nūna haṃ pi ima buddhabodhiṃ tridhā vibhajyeha prakāśayeyam // / //
analyzed: yam nūna ham buddha bodhim tridhā vibhajya iha prakāśayeyam
translated: I too, having divided this enlightenment of the Buddhas into three, will teach it here.

original: evaṃ ca me cintitu eṣa dharmo ye cānye buddhā daśasu ddiśāsu /
analyzed: evam ca me eṣa dharmaḥ ye ca anye buddhāḥ daśasu ddiśāsu
translated: Thinking thus, This Dharma, and the other Buddhas in the ten directions,

original: darśiṃsu te mahya tadātmabhāvaṃ sādhuṃ ti ghoṣaṃ samudīrayanti // / //🔽sādhū mune lokavināyakāgra anuttaraṃ jñānamihādhigamya /
analyzed: te tad ātmabhāvam sādhum ti ghoṣam samudīrayanti  sādhu mune anuttaram jñānam iha adhigamya
translated: They show me their own bodies, and utter the sound 'Excellent!'🔽Excellent, Sage, foremost guide of the world, having attained the unsurpassed knowledge here,

original: upāyakauśalyu vicintayanto anuśikṣase lokavināyakānām // / //
analyzed: upāya kauśalyu anuśikṣase loka vināyakānām
translated: Contemplating skillful means, you train in the teachings of the guides of the world.

original: vayaṃ pi buddhāya paraṃ tadā padaṃ tṛdhā ca kṛtvāna prakāśayāmaḥ /
analyzed: vayam buddhāya param tadā padam tṛdhā ca prakāśayāmaḥ
translated: We also, for the sake of the supreme state of the Buddha, having divided it into three, taught it.

original: hīnādhimuktā hi avidvasū narā bhaviṣyathā buddha na śraddadheyuḥ // / //
analyzed: hīna adhimuktāḥ hi avidvasū narāḥ bhaviṣyathāḥ buddha na śraddadheyuḥ
translated: Because people with inferior aspirations and no knowledge would not believe in the Buddha.

original: tato vayaṃ kāraṇasaṃgraheṇa upāyakauśalya niṣevamāṇāḥ /
analyzed: tatas vayam kāraṇa saṃgraheṇa upāya kauśalya niṣevamāṇāḥ
translated: Then, by means of skillful means, we, through the collection of causes,

original: phalābhilāṣaṃ parikīrtayantaḥ samādapemo bahubodhisattvān // / //
analyzed: phala abhilāṣam parikīrtayantaḥ samādapemaḥ bahu bodhisattvān
translated: Having proclaimed the desire for the fruit, inspired many bodhisattvas.

original: ahaṃ cudagrastada āsi śrutvā ghoṣaṃ manojñaṃ puruṣarṣabhāṇām /
analyzed: aham cudagraḥ tadā āsi śrutvā ghoṣam manojñam puruṣa ṛṣabhāṇām
translated: I was overjoyed upon hearing the melodious voice of the best of men.

original: udagracitto bhaṇi teṣa tāyināṃ na mohavādī pravarā maharṣī // / //
analyzed: udagra cittaḥ tāyinām na moha vādī pravarāḥ mahā ṛṣī
translated: With a joyful mind, I spoke to those protectors, The supreme great sages do not speak out of delusion.

original: ahaṃ pi evaṃ samudācariṣye yathā vadantī vidu lokanāyakāḥ /
analyzed: aham evam samudācariṣye yathā vadantī loka nāyakāḥ
translated: I too will practice as the wise world leaders say.

original: ahaṃ pi saṃkṣobhi imasmi dāruṇe utpanna sattvāna kaṣāyamadhye // / //
analyzed: aham dāruṇe utpanna kaṣāya madhye
translated: I too will stir up this terrible, defiled world arisen in the midst of the defilements of beings.

original: tato hyahaṃ śārisutā viditvā vārāṇasīṃ prasthitu tasmi kāle /
analyzed: tatas hi aham śāri sutā viditvā vārāṇasīm tasmin kāle
translated: Then, Sharidatta, knowing this, I set out for Varanasi at that time.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: tahi pañcakānāṃ pravadāmi bhikṣuṇāṃ dharmaṃ upāyena praśāntabhūmim // / //
analyzed: pañcakānām pravadāmi bhikṣuṇām dharmam upāyena praśānta bhūmim
translated: There, to the five monks, I spoke of the Dharma, the peaceful ground, through skillful means.

original: tataḥ pravṛttaṃ mama dharmacakraṃ nirvāṇaśabdaśca abhūṣi loke /
analyzed: tatas pravṛttam mama dharmacakram nirvāṇa śabdaḥ ca abhūṣi loke
translated: Then the wheel of the Dharma was set in motion for me, and the word 'nirvana' appeared in the world.

original: arhantaśabdastatha dharmaśabdaḥ saṃghasya śabdaśca abhūṣi tatra // / //
analyzed: dharma śabdaḥ saṃghasya śabdaḥ ca tatra
translated: The word 'arhat', the word 'Dharma', and the word 'Sangha' appeared there.

original: bhāṣāmi varṣāṇi analpakāni nirvāṇabhūmiṃ cupadarśayāmi /
analyzed: bhāṣāmi varṣāṇi analpakāni nirvāṇa bhūmim
translated: I spoke for many years, showing the ground of nirvana.

original: saṃsāraduḥkhasya ca eṣa anto evaṃ vadāmī ahu nityakālam // / //
analyzed: saṃsāra duḥkhasya ca eṣa antaḥ evam vadāmi nityakālam
translated: This is the end of the suffering of samsara, I always said this.

original: yasmiṃśca kāle ahu śāriputra paśyāmi putrān dvipadottamānām /
analyzed: yasmin ca kāle ahu śāriputra paśyāmi putrān dvipada uttamānām
translated: At the time when I saw the sons of the supreme humans,

original: ye prasthitā uttamamagrabodhiṃ koṭīsahasrāṇi analpakāni // / //
analyzed: ye prasthitāḥ uttamam agra bodhim koṭī sahasrāṇi analpakāni
translated: Many thousands of koṭis, not a few, who had set out for the supreme highest enlightenment.

original: upasaṃkramitvā ca mamaiva antike kṛtāñjalīḥ sarvi sthitāḥ sagauravāḥ /
analyzed: upasaṃkramitvā ca mama eva antike kṛtāñjalīḥ sarvi sthitāḥ sa gauravāḥ
translated: They came and stood before me with palms joined, all of them with reverence,

original: yehī śruto dharma jināna āsīt upāyakauśalyu bahuprakāram // / //
analyzed: śrutaḥ dharma jinānaḥ āsīt bahu prakāram
translated: By whom the Dharma of the Jinas had been heard, with many kinds of skillful means.

original: tato mamā etadabhūṣi tatkṣaṇaṃ samayo mamā bhāṣitumagradharmam /
analyzed: tatas mama tad kṣaṇam samayaḥ mama bhāṣitum agra dharmam
translated: Then this occurred to me at that moment: 'The time has come for me to teach the supreme Dharma,

original: yasyāhamarthaṃ iha loki jātaḥ prakāśayāmī tamihāgrabodhim // / //
analyzed: yasya aham artham iha loki jātaḥ prakāśayāmi tam iha agra bodhim
translated: For whose sake I was born in this world, I will proclaim that supreme enlightenment here.'

original: duḥśraddadhaṃ etu bhaviṣyate 'dya nimittasaṃjñāniha bālabuddhinām /
analyzed: duḥśraddadham etu bhaviṣyate nimitta saṃjñān iha bāla buddhinām
translated: Today it will be difficult to believe for those with the perception of signs, with childish understanding here.

original: adhimānaprāptāna avidvasūnāṃ ime tu śroṣyanti hi bodhisattvāḥ // / //
analyzed: avidvasūnām ime tu śroṣyanti hi bodhisattvāḥ
translated: But these bodhisattvas will hear it.

original: viśāradaścāhu tadā prahṛṣṭaḥ saṃlīyanāṃ sarva vivarjayitvā /
analyzed: viśāradaḥ ca āhuḥ tadā prahṛṣṭaḥ saṃlīyanām vivarjayitvā
translated: Then, being fearless and joyful, having abandoned all clinging,

original: bhāṣāmi madhye sugatātmajānāṃ tāṃścaiva bodhāya samādapemi // / //
analyzed: bhāṣāmi madhye sugata ātmajānām tān ca eva bodhāya samādapemi
translated: I speak in the midst of the sons of the Sugata, and I inspire them towards enlightenment.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: saṃdṛśya caitādṛśabuddhaputrāṃstavāpi kāṅkṣā vyapanīta bheṣyati /
analyzed: saṃdṛśya ca etādṛśa buddha putrān tava api kāṅkṣā vyapanīta
translated: Seeing such sons of the Buddha, your doubts will be dispelled.

original: ye cā śatā dvādaśime anāsravā buddhā bhaviṣyantimi loki sarve // / //
analyzed: ye cā śatā dvādaśime anāsravāḥ buddhāḥ bhaviṣyanti imi loki sarve
translated: And these twelve hundred who are free from defilements will all become buddhas in this world.

original: yathaiva teṣāṃ purimāṇa tāyināṃ anāgatānāṃ ca jināna dharmatā /
analyzed: yathā eva teṣām tāyinām anāgatānām ca dharmatā
translated: Just as it is for those past protectors and the future victorious ones,

original: mamāpi eṣaiva vikalpavarjitā tathaiva haṃ deśayi adya tubhyam // / //
analyzed: mama api eṣā eva vikalpa varjitā tathā eva ham adya tubhyam
translated: this is also my own nature, free from conceptualization. Thus, I will teach it to you today.

original: kadāci kahiṃci kathaṃci loke utpādu bhoti puruṣarṣabhāṇām /
analyzed: kadāci kahiṃci kathaṃci loke puruṣa ṛṣabhāṇām
translated: Sometimes, somewhere, somehow, in the world, the bulls among men appear.

original: utpadya cā loki anantacakṣuṣaḥ kadācidetādṛśu dharma deśayuḥ // / //
analyzed: utpadya ca loki ananta cakṣuṣaḥ kadācid etādṛśu dharma
translated: And having appeared in the world, those of infinite vision, sometimes they teach such a Dharma.

original: sudurlabho īdṛśu agradharmaḥ kalpāna koṭīnayutairapi syāt /
analyzed: su durlabhaḥ agra dharmaḥ syāt
translated: Such supreme Dharma is very difficult to find, even in many quintillions of eons.

original: sudurlabhā īdṛśakāśca sattvāḥ śratvāna ye śraddadhi agradharmam // / //
analyzed: su durlabhāḥ īdṛśakāḥ ca sattvāḥ ye śraddadhi agra dharmam
translated: And beings who, having heard it, have faith in this supreme Dharma are extremely rare.

original: audumbaraṃ puṣpa yathaiva durlabhaṃ kadāci kahiṃci kathaṃci dṛśyate /
analyzed: audumbaram puṣpa yathā eva durlabham kadācid kahiṃci kathaṃci dṛśyate
translated: Just as the udumbara flower is rarely seen, only sometimes, somewhere, somehow,

original: manojñarūpaṃ ca janasya tadbhavedāścaryu lokasya sadevakasya // / //
analyzed: manojña rūpam ca janasya tat bhavet āścaryu lokasya sa devakasya
translated: and becomes a delightful form for people, a wonder for the world with its gods,

original: ataśca āścaryataraṃ vadāmi śrutvāna yo dharmamimaṃ subhāṣitam /
analyzed: atas ca āścaryataram vadāmi yaḥ dharmam imam subhāṣitam
translated: I say that is even more of a wonder: having heard this well-spoken Dharma,

original: anumodi ekaṃ pi bhaṇeya vācaṃ kṛta sarvabuddhāna bhaveya pūjā // / //
analyzed: ekam pi bhaṇeya vācam bhaveya pūjā
translated: if one rejoices in it, speaks one word, or makes offerings to all the Buddhas,

original: vyapanehi kāṅkṣāmiha saṃśayaṃ ca ārocayāmi ahu dharmarājā /
analyzed: vyapanehi kāṅkṣām iha saṃśayam ca ārocayāmi ahu dharmarājā
translated: remove your doubts and uncertainties here. I proclaim it, I am the Dharma King.

original: samādapemi ahamagrabodhau na śrāvakāḥ kecidihāsti mahyam // / //
analyzed: samādapemi aham agra bodhau na śrāvakāḥ kecid iha asti mahyam
translated: I encourage you in supreme enlightenment. I have no disciples here at all.

original: tava śāriputraitu rahasyu bhotu ye cāpi me śrāvaka mahya sarve /
analyzed: tava śāriputra etu ye ca api me sarve
translated: O Śāriputra, let this be a secret to you, and to all my disciples,

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: ye bodhisattvāśca ime pradhānā rahasyametanmama dhārayantu // / //
analyzed: ye bodhisattvāḥ ca ime pradhānāḥ rahasyam etat mama dhārayantu
translated: and to these foremost bodhisattvas, let them keep this secret of mine.

original: kiṃ kāraṇaṃ pañcakaṣāyakāle kṣudrāśca duṣṭāśca bhavanti sattvāḥ /
analyzed: kim kāraṇam pañca kaṣāya kāle kṣudrāḥ ca duṣṭāḥ ca bhavanti sattvāḥ
translated: Why is it that in the age of the five degenerations, beings become petty and wicked?

original: kāmairihāndhīkṛta bālabuddhayo na teṣa bodhāya kadāci cittam // / //
analyzed: kāmaiḥ iha andhīkṛta bāla buddhayaḥ na teṣa bodhāya kadācid cittam
translated: The minds of those with childish understanding, blinded by desires here, are never directed towards enlightenment.

original: śrutvā ca yānaṃ mama etadekaṃ prakāśitaṃ tena jinena āsīt /
analyzed: śrutvā ca yānam mama etat ekam prakāśitam tena jinena āsīt
translated: Having heard this single vehicle taught by that Jina,

original: anāgate 'dhvāni bhrameyu sattvāḥ sūtraṃ kṣipitvā narakaṃ vrajeyuḥ // / //
analyzed: anāgate bhrameyuḥ sattvāḥ sūtram kṣipitvā narakam vrajeyuḥ
translated: In the future, beings would wander, casting aside the sutra, and would go to hell.

original: lajjī śucī ye ca bhaveyu sattvāḥ saṃprasthitā uttamamagrabodhim /
analyzed: ye ca bhaveyuḥ sattvāḥ saṃprasthitāḥ uttamam agra bodhim
translated: Those beings who are ashamed, pure, and set out for the supreme highest enlightenment,

original: viśārado bhūtva vademi teṣāmekasya yānasya anantavarṇān // / //
analyzed: viśāradaḥ bhūtvā vademi teṣām ekasya yānasya ananta varṇān
translated: Having become fearless, I will speak to them the endless praises of the single vehicle.

original: etādṛśī deśana nāyakānāmupāyakauśalyamidaṃ variṣṭham /
analyzed: etādṛśī deśana nāyakānām upāya kauśalyam idam variṣṭham
translated: Such is the teaching of the leaders, this supreme skillful means.

original: bahūhi saṃdhāvacanehi coktaṃ durbodhyametaṃ hi aśikṣitehi // / //
analyzed: bahūhi saṃdhā vacanehi ca uktam durbodhyam etam hi a śikṣitehi
translated: It is spoken with many indirect expressions, difficult to understand for the untrained.

original: tasmāddhi saṃdhāvacanaṃ vijāniyā buddhāna lokācariyāṇa tāyinām /
analyzed: tasmāt hi saṃdhā vacanam vijāniyāḥ buddhāna loka ācariyāṇa tāyinām
translated: Therefore, one should know the indirect expressions of the Buddhas, the protectors who are teachers of the world.

original: jahitva kāṅkṣāṃ vijahitva saṃśayaṃ bhaviṣyathā buddha janetha harṣam // / //
analyzed: jahitva kāṅkṣām vijahitva saṃśayam bhaviṣyathāḥ buddha janetha harṣam
translated: Having abandoned doubt and hesitation, one will become a Buddha and generate joy.

original: ityāryasaddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye upāyakauśalyaparivarto nāma dvitīyaḥ //
analyzed: iti ārya saddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye upāyakauśalyaparivartaḥ nāma dvitīyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the second chapter named Skill in Means in the noble Dharma discourse White Lotus of the True Dharma.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: aupamyaparivartaḥ /
analyzed: aupamya parivartaḥ
translated: The Chapter on Parables

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān śāriputrastasyāṃ velāyāṃ tuṣṭa udagra āttamanāḥ pramuditaḥ prītisaumanasyajāto
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ tasyām velāyām tuṣṭaḥ udagraḥ ātta manāḥ pramuditaḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ
translated: Then at that time the venerable Śāriputra, being satisfied, elated, delighted, joyful,

original: yena bhagavāṃstenāñjaliṃ praṇamya bhagavato 'bhimukho bhagavantameva vyavalokayamāno
analyzed: yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamya bhagavataḥ bhimukhaḥ bhagavantam eva vyavalokayamānaḥ
translated: with palms joined in the direction of the Blessed One, looking only at the Blessed One,

original: bhagavantametadavocat āścaryādbhutaprāpto 'smi bhagavan audbilyaprāptaḥ idamevaṃrūpaṃ
analyzed: bhagavantam etat avocat āścarya adbhuta prāptaḥ smi bhagavan audbilya prāptaḥ idam evaṃrūpam
translated: said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, I have attained wonder and marvel,

original: bhagavato 'ntikād ghoṣaṃ śrutvā /
analyzed: bhagavataḥ ntikāt ghoṣam śrutvā
translated: having heard this kind of speech from the Blessed One.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: aśrutvaiva tāvadahaṃ bhagavan idamevaṃrūpaṃ bhagavato 'ntikād dharmaṃ tadanyān bodhisattvān dṛṣṭvā bodhisattvānāṃ ca anāgate 'dhvani buddhanāma
analyzed: a śrutvā eva tāvat aham bhagavan idam evaṃrūpam bhagavataḥ ntikāt dharmam tad anyān bodhisattvān dṛṣṭvā bodhisattvānām ca anāgate dhvani buddha nāma
translated: Blessed One, not having heard this kind of Dharma from the Blessed One, having seen other bodhisattvas and having heard the names of the Buddhas

original: śrutvā atīva śocāmi atīva saṃtapye /
analyzed: śrutvā atīva śocāmi atīva saṃtapye
translated: of the bodhisattvas in the future, I have been greatly grieving, greatly burning.

original: bhraṣṭo 'smyevaṃrūpāt tathāgatajñānagocarād jñānadarśanāt /
analyzed: bhraṣṭaḥ smi evaṃrūpāt tathāgata jñāna gocarāt jñāna darśanāt
translated: I have fallen away from such a realm of the Tathāgata's knowledge, from the knowledge and vision.

original: yadā cāhaṃ bhagavan abhīkṣṇaṃ gacchāmi parvatagirikandarāṇi vanaṣaṇḍānyārāmanadīvṛkṣamūlānyekāntāni divāvihārāya /
analyzed: yadā ca aham bhagavan abhīkṣṇam gacchāmi parvata giri kandarāṇi vana ṣaṇḍāni ārāma nadī vṛkṣa mūlāni ekāntāni divāvihārāya
translated: And when, Blessed One, I frequently go to mountain caves, forests, groves, river banks, and the roots of trees for my daytime rest,

original: tadāpyahaṃ bhagavan yadbhūyastvena anenaiva vihāreṇa viharāmi /
analyzed: tadā api aham bhagavan yat bhūyastvena anena eva vihāreṇa viharāmi
translated: Even then, Blessed One, I mostly lived with this very dwelling.

original: tulye nāma dharmadhātupraveśe vayaṃ bhagavatā hīnena yānena niryātitāḥ /
analyzed: tulye nāma dharmadhātu praveśe vayam bhagavatā hīnena yānena niryātitāḥ
translated: Although we are equal in entering the dharmadhatu, we have been led to liberation by the Blessed One through the inferior vehicle.

original: evaṃ ca me bhagavaṃstasmin samaye bhavati asmākamevaiṣo 'parādhaḥ /
analyzed: evam ca me bhagavan tasmin samaye bhavati asmākam eva eṣaḥ parādhaḥ
translated: And thus, Blessed One, it occurs to me that this is our own fault.

original: naiva bhagavato 'parādhaḥ /
analyzed: na eva bhagavataḥ parādhaḥ
translated: It is not the fault of the Blessed One.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: sacedbhagavānasmābhiḥ pratīkṣitaḥ syāt sāmutkarṣikīṃ dharmadeśanāṃ kathayamānaḥ /
analyzed: saced bhagavān asmābhiḥ pratīkṣitaḥ syāt sāmutkarṣikīm dharma deśanām kathayamānaḥ
translated: If the Blessed One had been waited for by us, speaking the Dharma with a superior tone,

original: yadidamanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimārabhya /
analyzed: yat idam anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim ārabhya
translated: starting from this unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

original: teṣveva vayaṃ bhagavan dharmeṣu niryātāḥ syāma /
analyzed: teṣu eva vayam bhagavan dharmeṣu niryātāḥ syāma
translated: we would have been led to liberation in those very dharmas, Blessed One.

original: yatpunarbhagavan asmābhiranupasthiteṣu bodhisattveṣu saṃdhābhāṣyaṃ bhagavato 'jānamānaistvaramāṇaiḥ
analyzed: yat punar bhagavan asmābhiḥ anupasthiteṣu bodhisattveṣu saṃdhā bhāṣyam bhagavataḥ jānamānaiḥ tvaramāṇaiḥ
translated: But again, Blessed One, we who did not attend to the bodhisattvas, not knowing the Buddha's implied teachings, being hasty,

original: prathamabhāṣitaiva tathāgatasya dharmadeśanā śrutvodgṛhītā dhāritā bhāvitā cintitā manasikṛtā /
analyzed: prathama bhāṣitā eva tathāgatasya dharma deśanā śrutvā udgṛhītā dhāritā bhāvitā cintitā manasi kṛtā
translated: having heard the Tathagata's first Dharma teachings, we accepted them, remembered them, contemplated them, and mentally reflected on them.

original: so 'haṃ bhagavan ātmaparibhāṣaṇayaiva bhūyiṣṭhena rātriṃdivānyatināmayāmi /
analyzed: saḥ ham bhagavan ātma paribhāṣaṇayā eva bhūyiṣṭhena rātriṃdivāni atināmayāmi
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, I spend most of my days and nights in self-reproach.

original: adyāsmi bhagavan nirvāṇaprāptaḥ /
analyzed: adyā asmi bhagavat nirvāṇa prāptaḥ
translated: Today, Blessed One, I have attained nirvāṇa.

original: adyāsmi bhagavan parinirvṛtaḥ /
analyzed: adya asmi bhagavan parinirvṛtaḥ
translated: Today, Blessed One, I have attained complete nirvāṇa.

original: adya me bhagavan arhattvaṃ prāptam /
analyzed: adya me bhagavan arhat tvam prāptam
translated: Today, Blessed One, I have attained arhatship.

original: adyāhaṃ bhagavan bhagavataḥ putro jyeṣṭha auraso mukhato jāto dharmajo dharmanirmito dharmadāyādo dharmanirvṛttaḥ /
analyzed: adya aham bhagavan bhagavataḥ putraḥ jyeṣṭhaḥ aurasaḥ mukhataḥ jātaḥ dharma jaḥ dharma nirmitaḥ dharma dāyādaḥ dharma nirvṛttaḥ
translated: Today, Blessed One, I am the Blessed One's son, the eldest, born from the mouth, born of the Dharma, created by the Dharma, an heir of the Dharma, born of the Dharma.

original: apagataparidāho 'smyadya bhagavan imamevaṃrūpamadbhutadharmamaśrutapūrvaṃ bhagavato 'ntikād ghoṣaṃ śrutvā //
analyzed: apagata paridāhaḥ smi adya bhagavan imam evaṃrūpam adbhuta dharmam a śruta pūrvam bhagavataḥ ntikāt ghoṣam śrutvā
translated: Today, Blessed One, I am free from burning, having heard this kind of marvelous Dharma never heard before from the Blessed One.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān śāriputrastasyāṃ velāyāṃ bhagavantamābhirgāthābhiradhyabhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ tasyām velāyām bhagavantam ābhiḥ gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣata
translated: Then at that time the venerable Śāriputra addressed the Blessed One with these verses:

original: āścaryaprāpto 'smi mahāvināyaka audbilyajāto imu ghoṣa śrutvā /
analyzed: āścarya prāptaḥ smi mahā vināyaka audbilya jātaḥ ghoṣa śrutvā
translated: I have attained the marvelous, O Great Leader, and have given rise to joy upon hearing this sound.

original: kathaṃkathā mahya na bhūya kācit paripācito 'haṃ iha agrayāne // / //
analyzed: kathaṃkathā na kācid paripācitaḥ haṃ iha agrayāne
translated: How can there be any doubt for me? I am fully ripened in this supreme vehicle.

original: āścaryabhūtaḥ sugatāna ghoṣaḥ kāṅkṣāṃ ca śokaṃ ca jahāti prāṇinām /
analyzed: āścarya bhūtaḥ ghoṣaḥ kāṅkṣām ca śokam ca jahāti prāṇinām
translated: The Sugata's voice is marvelous, it dispels doubt and sorrow of living beings.

original: kṣīṇāsravasyo mama yaśca śoko vigato 'sti sarvaṃ śruṇiyāna ghoṣam // / //
analyzed: kṣīṇa āsra vasyaḥ mama yaḥ ca śokaḥ vigataḥ sti sarvam
translated: Even my sorrow as one whose defilements are exhausted is gone, having heard this sound.

original: divāvihāramanucaṃkramanto vanaṣaṇḍa ārāmatha vṛkṣamūlam /
analyzed: divāvihāram anucaṃkramantaḥ vana ṣaṇḍe ārām atha vṛkṣa mūlam
translated: Wandering during the day, walking in the forest groves, parks, and at the foot of trees,

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Physician

original: girikandarāṃścāupyupasevamāno anucintayāmī imameva cintām // / //
analyzed: giri kandarān ca aupī upasevamānaḥ anucintayāmī imam eva cintām
translated: And resorting to mountain caves, I contemplate this very thought:

original: aho 'smi parivañcitu pāpacittaistulyeṣu dharmeṣu anāsraveṣu /
analyzed: aho smi pāpa cittaiḥ tulyeṣu dharmeṣu anāsraveṣu
translated: Alas, I have been deceived by evil thoughts, in regard to the dharmas that are equal, free from defilements.

original: yannāma traidhātuki agradharmaṃ na deśayiṣyāmi anāgate 'dhve // / //
analyzed: yat nāma traidhātuki agra dharmam na deśayiṣyāmi anāgate dhve
translated: Since I will not teach the supreme dharma of the three realms in the future...

original: dvātriṃśatī lakṣaṇa mahya bhraṣṭā suvarṇavarṇacchavitā ca bhraṣṭā /
analyzed: dvātriṃśatī bhraṣṭā suvarṇa varṇa chavi tā ca bhraṣṭā
translated: The thirty-two marks have been lost for me, and the golden complexion has been lost.

original: balā vimokṣāścimi sarvi riñcitā tulyeṣu dharmeṣu aho 'smi mūḍhaḥ // / //
analyzed: balā vimokṣa aścimi sarvi riñcitā tulyeṣu dharmeṣu aho smi mūḍhaḥ
translated: The powers and liberations have all been abandoned. I am deluded in regard to the equal dharmas...

original: anuvyañjanā ye ca mahāmunīnāmaśīti pūrṇāḥ pravarā viśiṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: anuvyañjanāḥ ye ca mahāmunīnām aśīti pūrṇāḥ pravarāḥ viśiṣṭāḥ
translated: The eighty excellent and supreme minor marks of the great sages,

original: aṣṭādaśāveṇika ye ca dharmāste cāpi bhraṣṭā ahu vañcito 'smi // / //
analyzed: ye ca dharmāḥ te ca api bhraṣṭāḥ smi
translated: And the eighteen unique qualities, I have lost them. I have been deceived...

original: dṛṣṭvā ca tvāṃ lokahitānukampī divāvihāraṃ parigamya caikaḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca tvām loka hita anukampī divāvihāram parigamya ca ekaḥ
translated: Having seen you, the compassionate one who benefits the world, wandering alone during the day,

original: hā vañcito 'smīti vicintayāmi asaṅgajñānātu acintiyātaḥ // / //
analyzed: hā vañcitaḥ smi iti vicintayāmi
translated: I think, 'Alas, I have been deceived,' from the inconceivable unobstructed knowledge...

original: rātriṃdivāni kṣapayāmi nātha bhūyiṣṭha so eva vicintayantaḥ /
analyzed: rātriṃdivāni kṣapayāmi nātha bhūyiṣṭha eva vicintayantaḥ
translated: I spend my days and nights, O Lord, thinking mostly about this:

original: pṛcchāmi tāvad bhagavantameva bhraṣṭo 'hamasmītyatha vā na veti // / //
analyzed: pṛcchāmi tāvat bhagavantam eva bhraṣṭaḥ ham asmi iti atha vā na vā iti
translated: I ask the Blessed One himself whether I have fallen or not.

original: evaṃ ca me cintayato jinendra gacchanti rātriṃdiva nityakālam /
analyzed: evam ca me cintayataḥ jinendra gacchanti rātriṃdiva nityakālam
translated: And thus, O Lord of Jinas, my nights and days always pass by as I think this way.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca anyān bahubodhisattvān saṃvarṇitāṃllokavināyakena // / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca anyān bahu bodhisattvān saṃvarṇitān loka vināyakena
translated: And having seen many other Bodhisattvas praised by the World's Guide,

original: śrutvā ca so 'haṃ imu buddhadharmaṃ saṃghāya etatkila bhāṣitaṃ ti /
analyzed: śrutvā ca saḥ haṃ buddha dharmam saṃghāya etat kila bhāṣitam
translated: and having heard this Buddha-Dharma, I think it is indeed spoken for the Sangha.

original: atarkikaṃ sūkṣmamanāsravaṃ ca jñānaṃ praṇetī jina bodhimaṇḍe // / //
analyzed: atarkikam sūkṣmam anāsravam ca jñānam jina bodhimaṇḍe
translated: The Jina, on the seat of enlightenment, proclaims the knowledge that is inconceivable, subtle, and free from defilements.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: dṛṣṭīvilagno hyahamāsi pūrvaṃ parivrājakastīrthikasaṃmataśca /
analyzed: dṛṣṭīvilagnaḥ hi aham āsi pūrvam parivrājakaḥ tīrthika saṃmataḥ ca
translated: Formerly, I was attached to views, a wandering ascetic respected by the tīrthikas.

original: tato mamā āśayu jñātva nātho dṛṣṭīvimokṣāya bravīti nirvṛtim // / //
analyzed: nāthaḥ nirvṛtim
translated: Then, the Lord, knowing my aspiration, spoke of nirvana for the sake of liberation from views.

original: vimucya tā dṛṣṭikṛtāni sarvaśaḥ śūnyāṃśca dharmānahu sparśayitvā /
analyzed: vimucya tāḥ dṛṣṭi kṛtāni sarvaśas śūnyān ca dharmān ahu sparśayitvā
translated: Having completely freed myself from all those actions based on views, and having realized the empty dharmas,

original: tato vijānāmyahu nirvṛto 'smi na cāpi nirvāṇamidaṃ pravucyati // / //
analyzed: tatas vijānāmi ahu nirvṛtaḥ smi na ca api nirvāṇam idam pravucyati
translated: then I knew I was in nirvana, but this is not called nirvana.

original: yadā tu buddho bhavate 'grasattvaḥ puraskṛto naramaruyakṣarākṣasaiḥ /
analyzed: yadā tu buddhaḥ bhavate gra sattvaḥ puraskṛtaḥ nara maru yakṣa rākṣasaiḥ
translated: But when the supreme being becomes a Buddha, honored by humans, Maruts, Yakshas, and Rakshasas,

original: dvātriṃśatīlakṣaṇarūpadhārī aśeṣato nirvṛtu bhoti tatra // / //
analyzed: dvātriṃśatī lakṣaṇa rūpa dhārī aśeṣatas tatra
translated: Embodying the thirty-two major marks, he becomes completely Nirvanized there.

original: vyapanīta sarvāṇi mi manyitāni śrutvā ca ghoṣaṃ ahamadya nirvṛtaḥ /
analyzed: vyapanīta sarvāṇi mi manyitāni śrutvā ca ghoṣam aham adya nirvṛtaḥ
translated: Having heard the sound, 'I am now Nirvanized,' all my conceits are removed.

original: yadāpi vyākurvasi agrabodhau purato hi lokasya sadevakasya // / //
analyzed: yadā api vyākurvasi agra bodhau puratas hi lokasya sa devakasya
translated: When you predict supreme enlightenment, in the presence of the world with its gods,

original: balavacca āsīnmama chambhitatvaṃ prathamaṃ giraṃ śrutva vināyakasya /
analyzed: balavat ca āsīt mama chambhita tvam prathamam giram śrutva vināyakasya
translated: I was greatly frightened, having heard the first word of the Leader.

original: mā haiva māro sa bhavedviheṭhako abhinirmiṇitvā bhuvi buddhaveṣam // / //
analyzed: mā ha eva māraḥ sa bhavet viheṭhakaḥ abhinirmiṇitvā bhuvi buddha veṣam
translated: Don't let that be Mara, the one who causes harm, having manifested on earth in the guise of a Buddha.

original: yadā tu hetūhi ca kāraṇaiśca dṛṣṭāntakoṭīnayutaiśca darśitā /
analyzed: yadā tu ca kāraṇaiḥ ca dṛṣṭānta koṭī nayutaiḥ ca darśitā
translated: When you showed with causes, reasons, and hundreds of thousands of parables

original: suparisthitā sā varabuddhabodhistato 'smi niṣkāṅkṣu śruṇitva dharmam // / //
analyzed: su paristhitā sā vara buddha bodhiḥ tatas smi dharmam
translated: That the supreme enlightenment of the Buddha is well-established, then I became free from doubt, having heard the Dharma.

original: yadā ca me buddhasahasrakoṭyaḥ kīrteṣyatī tān parinirvṛtān jinān /
analyzed: yadā ca me buddha sahasra koṭyaḥ kīrtā iṣyatī tān parinirvṛtān jinān
translated: When you will proclaim the millions of Buddhas, the victorious ones who have attained final Nirvana,

original: yathā ca tairdeśitu eṣa dharma upāyakauśalya pratiṣṭhihitvā // / //
analyzed: yathā ca eṣa dharmaḥ upāya kauśalya
translated: And how they taught this Dharma, having relied on skillful means,

original: anāgatāśco bahu buddha loke tiṣṭhanti ye co paramārthadarśinaḥ /
analyzed: bahu buddha loke tiṣṭhanti ye ca parama artha darśinaḥ
translated: And the many future Buddhas in the world, who are the seers of the ultimate truth,

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: The physician,

original: upāyakauśalyaśataiśca dharmaṃ nidarśayiṣyantyatha deśayanti ca // / //
analyzed: upāya kauśalya śataiḥ ca dharmam nidarśayiṣyanti atha deśayanti ca
translated: And with hundreds of skillful means, will teach the Dharma and are teaching it now,

original: tathā ca te ātmana yādṛśī carī abhiniṣkramitvā prabhṛtīya saṃstutā /
analyzed: tathā ca te ātmana yādṛśī carī abhiniṣkramitvā saṃstutā
translated: And Just as is my own conduct, having gone forth and begun, it is praised,

original: buddhaṃ ca te yādṛśu dharmacakraṃ tathā ca te 'vasthita dharmadeśanā // / //
analyzed: buddham ca te dharma cakram tathā ca te dharma deśanā
translated: And just as is the Buddha, the Dharma wheel, and just so is your established Dharma teaching,

original: tataśca jānāmi na eṣa māro bhūtāṃ cariṃ darśayi lokanāthaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca jānāmi naḥ eṣa māraḥ bhūtām carim loka nāthaḥ
translated: And then I knew, This is not Mara, but the Lord of the world showing his true conduct,

original: na hyatra mārāṇa gatī hi vidyate mamaiva cittaṃ vicikitsaprāptam // / //
analyzed: na hi atra mārāṇa gatī hi vidyate mama eva cittam vicikitsa prāptam
translated: For Mara has no way here. My own mind has reached doubt.

original: yadā tu madhureṇa gabhīravalgunā saṃharṣito buddhasvareṇa cāham /
analyzed: yadā tu madhureṇa gabhīra valgunā saṃharṣitaḥ buddha svareṇa ca aham
translated: But when I was delighted by the Buddha's voice, sweet, deep, and pleasant,

original: tadā mi vidhvaṃsita sarvasaṃśayā vicikitsa naṣṭā ca sthito 'smi jñāne // / //
analyzed: tadā mi sarva saṃśayā naṣṭā ca sthitaḥ smi jñāne
translated: Then all my doubts were destroyed, my doubts were lost, and I remained in knowledge.

original: niḥsaṃśayaṃ bheṣyi tathāgato 'haṃ puraskṛto loki sadevake 'smin /
analyzed: niḥsaṃśayam tathāgataḥ ham puraskṛtaḥ loki sa devake smin
translated: Without doubt I will become a Tathagata, honored in this world with its gods,

original: saṃghāya vakṣye imu buddhabodhiṃ samādapento bahubodhisattvān // / //
analyzed: saṃghāya vakṣye buddha bodhim samādapentaḥ bahu bodhisattvān
translated: And having attained this Buddha enlightenment, I will exhort many Bodhisattvas to undertake it.🔽 🔽And when I had attained the supreme enlightenment, I would exhort many Bodhisattvas to undertake it.

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ śāriputrametadavocat ārocayāmi te śāriputra /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat ārocayāmi te śāriputra
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the Venerable Śāriputra: Śāriputra, I declare to you,

original: prativedayāmi te asya sadevakasya lokasya purataḥ samārakasya sabrahmakasya saśramaṇabrāhmaṇikāyāḥ prajāyāḥ purataḥ /
analyzed: prativedayāmi te asya sa devakasya lokasya puratas sa mārakasya sa brahmakasya sa śramaṇa brāhmaṇikāyāḥ prajāyāḥ puratas
translated: I make it known to you, in the presence of this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans,

original: mayā tvaṃ śāriputra viṃśatīnāṃ buddhakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇāmantike paripācito 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: mayā tvam śāriputra viṃśatīnām buddha koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇām antike paripācitaḥ nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: that you, Śāriputra, have been ripened by twenty thousand koṭis of nayutas of hundreds of thousands of Buddhas for supreme and perfect awakening.

original: mama ca tvaṃ śāriputra dīrgharātramanuśikṣito 'bhūt /
analyzed: mama ca tvam śāriputra dīrgharātram anuśikṣitaḥ bhūt
translated: And, Śāriputra, you have long followed me as a disciple.

original: sa tvaṃ śāriputra bodhisattvasaṃmantritena bodhisattvarahasyena iha mama pravacane upapannaḥ /
analyzed: sa tvam śāriputra bodhisattva saṃmantritena bodhisattva rahasyena iha mama pravacane upapannaḥ
translated: But, Śāriputra, you have been reborn in my teaching through the secret counsel and secret knowledge of the bodhisattvas.

original: sa tvaṃ śāriputra bodhisattvādhiṣṭhānena tatpaurvakaṃ caryāpraṇidhānaṃ bodhisattvasaṃmantritaṃ bodhisattvarahasyaṃ na samanusmarasi /
analyzed: sa tvam śāriputra bodhisattva adhiṣṭhānena tad paurvakam caryā praṇidhānam bodhisattva saṃmantritam bodhisattva rahasyam na samanusmarasi
translated: And, Śāriputra, by the empowerment of the bodhisattvas, you do not remember that former practice, vow, secret counsel and secret knowledge of the bodhisattvas.

original: nirvṛto 'smīti manyase /
analyzed: nirvṛtaḥ smi iti manyase
translated: You think, 'I have attained nirvāṇa.'

original: so 'haṃ tvāṃ śāriputra pūrvacaryāpraṇidhānajñānānubodhamanusmārayitukāma imaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīkaṃ
analyzed: saḥ ham tvām śāriputra pūrva caryā praṇidhāna jñāna anubodham anusmārayitu kāmaḥ imam saddharmapuṇḍarīkam
translated: “Śāriputra, I wish to remind you of your previous conduct, aspirations, knowledge, and understanding, and this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma,

original: dharmaparyāyaṃ sūtrāntaṃ mahāvaipulyaṃ bodhisattvāvavādaṃ sarvabuddhaparigrahaṃ śrāvakāṇāṃ saṃprakāśayāmi //
analyzed: dharmaparyāyam sūtrāntam mahā vaipulyam bodhisattva avavādam sarva buddha parigraham śrāvakāṇām saṃprakāśayāmi
translated: I, Sharīputra, wishing to remind you of your former conduct, aspirations, knowledge, and enlightenment, am expounding this Dharma discourse, this sūtra, this great extensive teaching, this instruction for bodhisattvas, this Dharma discourse that is cherished by all the Buddhas, to the hearers.

original: api khalu punaḥ śāriputra /🔽bhaviṣyasi tvamanāgate 'dhvani aprameyaiḥ kalpairacintyairapramāṇairbahūnāṃ tathāgatakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇāṃ
analyzed: api khalu punar śāriputra  bhaviṣyasi tvam anāgate dhvani aprameyaiḥ kalpaiḥ acintyaiḥ apramāṇaiḥ bahūnām tathāgata koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇām
translated: Moreover, Sharīputra,

original: saddharmaṃ dhārayitvā vividhāṃ ca pūjāṃ kṛtvā imāmeva bodhisattvacaryāṃ paripūrya
analyzed: saddharmam dhārayitvā vividhām ca pūjām kṛtvā imām eva bodhisattva caryām paripūrya
translated: In the future, after immeasurable, inconceivable, and innumerable hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of kalpas, you will uphold the true Dharma of many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of Tathāgatas, make various offerings, and having fulfilled this very bodhisattva conduct,

original: padmaprabho nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho loke bhaviṣyasi Vaidya
analyzed: padmaprabhaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke bhaviṣyasi vaidya
translated: you will become a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One named Padma Prabha in the world, a doctor,

original: vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca buddho bhagavān //
analyzed: vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed guide for those to be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed One.

original: tena khalu punaḥ śāriputra samayena tasya bhagavataḥ padmaprabhasya tathāgatasya
analyzed: tena khalu punar śāriputra samayena tasya bhagavataḥ padmaprabhasya tathāgatasya
translated: Then, Sharīputra, at that time, to that Blessed One, the Tathāgata Padma Prabha,

original: virajaṃ nāma buddhakṣetraṃ bhaviṣyati samaṃ ramaṇīyaṃ prāsādikaṃ paramasudarśanīyaṃ
analyzed: virajam nāma buddhakṣetram bhaviṣyati samam ramaṇīyam prāsādikam parama su darśanīyam
translated: The buddha realm will be named Viraja, and it will be even, delightful, beautiful, and supremely lovely to behold.

original: pariśuddhaṃ ca sphītaṃ ca ṛddhaṃ ca kṣemaṃ ca subhikṣaṃ ca bahujananārīgaṇākīrṇaṃ
analyzed: pariśuddham ca sphītam ca ṛddham ca kṣemam ca subhikṣam ca bahu jana nārī gaṇa ākīrṇam
translated: It will be pure, prosperous, flourishing, peaceful, and well-fed, and will be filled with many people and women.

original: ca maruprakīrṇaṃ ca vaiḍūryamayaṃ suvarṇasūtrāṣṭāpadanibaddham /
analyzed: ca maru prakīrṇam ca vaiḍūrya mayam suvarṇa sūtra aṣṭāpada nibaddham
translated: It will be strewn with celestial flowers and made of beryl, with golden cords marking out the eight directions.

original: teṣu ca aṣṭāpadeṣu ratnavṛkṣā bhaviṣyanti saptānāṃ ratnānāṃ puṣpaphalaiḥ satatasamitaṃ samarpitāḥ //
analyzed: teṣu ca aṣṭāpadeṣu ratna vṛkṣāḥ bhaviṣyanti saptānām ratnānām puṣpa phalaiḥ satata samitam samarpitāḥ
translated: In those squares there will be jeweled trees, always and continuously bearing flowers and fruits of the seven precious substances.

original: so 'pi śāriputra padmaprabhastathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhastrīṇyeva yānānyārabhya dharmaṃ deśayiṣyati /
analyzed: saḥ pi śāriputra padmaprabhaḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ trīṇi eva yānāni ārabhya dharmam deśayiṣyati
translated: Śāriputra, that Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One Padma Prabha will also teach the Dharma based on the three vehicles.

original: kiṃcāpi śāriputra sa tathāgato na kalpakaṣāya utpatsyate /
analyzed: kiṃca api śāriputra sa tathāgataḥ na kalpa kaṣāye utpatsyate
translated: Śāriputra, although that Tathāgata will not appear during a time of degeneration of the eon,

original: api tu praṇidhānavaśena dharmaṃ deśayiṣyati /🔽mahāratnapratimaṇḍitaśca nāma śāriputra sa kalpo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: api tu praṇidhāna vaśena dharmam deśayiṣyati  mahāratnapratimaṇḍitaḥ ca nāma śāriputra sa kalpaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: he will teach the Dharma out of the power of his vow.🔽Śāriputra, that eon will be named Mahāratnapratimaṇḍita.

original: tatkiṃ manyase śāriputra kena kāraṇena sa kalpo mahāratnapratimaṇḍita ityucyate /
analyzed: tat kim manyase śāriputra kena kāraṇena sa kalpaḥ mahāratnapratimaṇḍitaḥ iti ucyate
translated: What do you think, Śāriputra, why is that eon called Mahāratnapratimaṇḍita?

original: ratnāni śāriputra buddhakṣetre bodhisattvā ucyante /
analyzed: ratnāni śāriputra buddhakṣetre bodhisattvāḥ ucyante
translated: “Śāriputra, the jewels in a buddhafield are said to be the bodhisattvas.

original: te tasmin kāle tasyāṃ virajāyāṃ lokadhātau bahavo bodhisattvā bhaviṣyantyaprameyā asaṃkhyeyā acintyā atulyā amāpyā gaṇanāṃ samatikrāntā anyatra 🔽tathāgatagaṇanayā /
analyzed: te tasmin kāle tasyām virajāyām lokadhātau bahavaḥ bodhisattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti aprameyāḥ asaṃkhyeyāḥ acintyāḥ atulyāḥ a māpyāḥ gaṇanām samatikrāntāḥ anyatra  tathāgata gaṇanayā
translated: At that time, in that Vairocana world system, there will be many bodhisattvas, innumerable, beyond measure, beyond reckoning, except in the reckoning of the Tathāgata.

original: tena kāraṇena sa kalpo mahāratnapratimaṇḍita ityucyate //
analyzed: tena kāraṇena sa kalpaḥ mahāratnapratimaṇḍitaḥ iti ucyate
translated: For that reason, that eon will be called the Great Adornment with Jewels.

original: tena khalu punaḥ śāriputra samayena bodhisattvāstasmin buddhakṣetre yadbhūyasā ratnapadmavikrāmiṇo bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tena khalu punar śāriputra samayena bodhisattvāḥ tasmin buddhakṣetre yat bhūyasā ratna padma vikrāmiṇaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: “Moreover, Śāriputra, at that time, in that buddhafield, most of the bodhisattvas will be born from a lotus flower.

original: anādikarmikāśca te bodhisattvā bhaviṣyanti /🔽ciracaritakuśalamūlā bahubuddhaśatasahasracīrṇabrahmacaryāḥ /🔽tathāgataparisaṃstutā buddhajñānābhiyuktā mahābhijñāparikarmanirjātāḥ sarvadharmanayakuśalā mārdavāḥ smṛtimantaḥ /
analyzed: anādi karmikāḥ ca te bodhisattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti  cira carita kuśala mūlāḥ bahu buddha śata sahasra cīrṇa brahmacaryāḥ  tathāgata parisaṃstutāḥ buddha jñāna abhiyuktāḥ mahā abhijñā parikarma nirjātāḥ sarva dharma naya kuśalāḥ mārdavāḥ smṛtimantaḥ
translated: Those bodhisattvas will not be beginners.

original: bhūyiṣṭhena śāriputra evaṃrūpāṇāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ paripūrṇaṃ tadbuddhakṣetraṃ bhaviṣyati //
analyzed: bhūyiṣṭhena śāriputra evaṃrūpāṇām bodhisattvānām paripūrṇam tat buddhakṣetram bhaviṣyati
translated: They will have long practiced the roots of virtue, will have practiced celibacy for many hundreds of thousands of eons, will have been praised by the Tathāgatas, will be intent on the wisdom of the buddhas, will have been born from the transformation of the great higher knowledges, will be skilled in the methods of all the dharmas, will be gentle, will have mindfulness, and will be for the most part such bodhisattvas. Śāriputra, that buddhafield will be completely filled with such bodhisattvas.”

original: tasya khalu punaḥ śāriputra padmaprabhasya tathāgatasya dvādaśāntarakalpā āyuṣpramāṇaṃ bhaviṣyati sthāpayitvā kumārabhūtatvam /
analyzed: tasya khalu punar śāriputra padmaprabhasya tathāgatasya dvādaśa antara kalpāḥ āyuṣpramāṇam bhaviṣyati sthāpayitvā kumāra bhūta tvam
translated: “Śāriputra, the lifespan of the Tathāgata Padma­prabha will be twelve intermediate eons, except for the time of being a prince.

original: teṣāṃ ca sattvānāmaṣṭāntarakalpā āyuṣpramāṇaṃ bhaviṣyati /🔽sa ca śāriputra padmaprabhastathāgato dvādaśānāmantarakalpānāmatyayena dhṛtiparipūrṇaṃ nāma bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ vyākṛtya anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau
analyzed: teṣām ca sattvānām aṣṭa antara kalpāḥ āyuṣpramāṇam bhaviṣyati  sa ca śāriputra padmaprabhaḥ tathāgataḥ dvādaśānām antara kalpānām atyayena dhṛtiparipūrṇam nāma bodhisattvam mahāsattvam vyākṛtya anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: The lifespan of those beings will be eight intermediate eons.

original: parinirvāsyati /
analyzed: parinirvāsyati
translated: Śāriputra, after the passing of twelve intermediate eons, the Tathāgata Padma­prabha will make a prediction to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Dhṛti­pūrṇa, and then enter parinirvāṇa.

original: ayaṃ bhikṣavo dhṛtiparipūrṇo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo mamānantaramanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyate /🔽padmavṛṣabhavikrāmī nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho loke bhaviṣyati vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ
analyzed: ayam bhikṣavaḥ dhṛtiparipūrṇaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ mama anantaram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate  padmavṛṣabhavikrāmī nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke bhaviṣyati vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ
translated: He will say, ‘Bhikṣus, this bodhisattva mahāsattva Dhṛti­pūrṇa will attain the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood immediately after me.

original: sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: He will appear in the world as the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One named Padma­vṛṣabha­vikrāmin, perfect in wisdom and conduct, a blissful one, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed guide for those to be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, a bhagavān.’🔽He will appear in the world as the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One named Padma­vṛṣabha­vikrāmin, perfect in wisdom and conduct, a blissful one, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed guide for those to be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, a bhagavān.”

original: tasyāpi śāriputra padmavṛṣabhavikrāmiṇastathāgatasya evaṃrūpameva buddhakṣetraṃ bhaviṣyati //
analyzed: tasya api śāriputra padmavṛṣabhavikrāmiṇaḥ tathāgatasya evaṃrūpam eva buddhakṣetram bhaviṣyati
translated: “Śāriputra, the tathāgata Padma­vṛṣabha­vikrāmin will also have a buddha realm just like that.”

original: tasya khalu punaḥ śāriputra padmaprabhasya tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya dvātriṃśadantarakalpān saddharmaḥ sthāsyati /
analyzed: tasya khalu punar śāriputra padmaprabhasya tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya dvātriṃśat antara kalpān saddharmaḥ sthāsyati
translated: “Śāriputra, after the parinirvāṇa of the tathāgata Padma­prabha, the true Dharma will remain for thirty-two intermediate eons.

original: tatastasya tasmin saddharme kṣīṇe dvātriṃśadantarakalpān saddharmapratirūpakaḥ sthāsyati //
analyzed: tatas tasya tasmin saddharme kṣīṇe dvātriṃśat antara kalpān saddharma pratirūpakaḥ sthāsyati
translated: Then, after the true Dharma has disappeared, a semblance of the true Dharma will remain for thirty-two intermediate eons.”

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Bhagavān spoke these verses:

original: bhaviṣyase śārisutā tuhaṃ pi anāgate 'dhvāni jinastathāgataḥ /
analyzed: bhaviṣyase tuham pi anāgate jinaḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: “Śārisuta, in the future you will become a jina, a tathāgata,

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: A physician,

original: padmaprabho nāma samantacakṣurvineṣyase prāṇisahasrakoṭyaḥ // / //
analyzed: padmaprabhaḥ nāma samanta cakṣuḥ vineṣyase prāṇi sahasra koṭyaḥ
translated: Named Padma­prabha, an all-seeing one, who will guide many quintillions of beings.

original: bahubuddhakoṭīṣu karitva satkriyāṃ caryābalaṃ tatra upārjayitvā /
analyzed: bahu buddha koṭīṣu satkriyām caryā balam tatra upārjayitvā
translated: Having made offerings to many millions of buddhas, having there accumulated the power of practice,

original: utpādayitvā ca daśo balāni spṛśiṣyase uttamamagrabodhim // / //
analyzed: utpādayitvā ca daśa balāni spṛśiṣyase uttamam agra bodhim
translated: Having generated the ten powers, you will attain the supreme, highest enlightenment.”

original: acintiye aparimitasmi kalpe prabhūtaratnastada kalpu bheṣyati /
analyzed: kalpe
translated: “In an inconceivable, immeasurable eon, that eon will be called Prabhūtaratna,

original: virajā ca nāmnā tada lokadhātuḥ kṣetraṃ viśuddhaṃ dvipadottamasya // / //
analyzed: virajā ca nāmnā tada lokadhātuḥ kṣetram viśuddham dvipada uttamasya
translated: And that world realm will be named Viraja, the pure field of the supreme human.

original: vaidūryasaṃstīrṇa tathaiva bhūmiḥ suvarṇasūtrapratimaṇḍitā ca /
analyzed: vaidūrya saṃstīrṇa tathā eva bhūmiḥ suvarṇa sūtra pratimaṇḍitā ca
translated: The ground will be made of beryl, adorned with golden threads,

original: ratnāmayairvṛkṣaśatairupetā sudarśanīyaiḥ phalapuṣpamaṇḍitaiḥ // / //
analyzed: ratna āmayaiḥ vṛkṣa śataiḥ upetā su darśanīyaiḥ phala puṣpa maṇḍitaiḥ
translated: And filled with hundreds of jewel trees, beautiful and adorned with fruits and flowers.

original: smṛtimanta tasmin bahubodhisattvāḥ caryābhinirhārasukovidāśca /
analyzed: tasmin bahu bodhisattvāḥ caryā abhinirhāra su kovidāḥ ca
translated: There will be many mindful bodhisattvas, skilled in accomplishing conduct,

original: ye śikṣitā buddhaśateṣu caryāṃ te tatra kṣetre upapadya santi // / //
analyzed: ye śikṣitāḥ buddha śateṣu caryām te tatra kṣetre upapadya santi
translated: Who have trained in conduct under a hundred buddhas and will be reborn in that field.

original: so cejjinaḥ paścimake samucchraye kumārabhūmīmatināmayitvā /
analyzed: saḥ ced jinaḥ paścimake samucchraye kumāra bhūmīm atināmayitvā
translated: If that Jina, in his last existence, having passed beyond the stage of a prince,

original: jahitva kāmānabhiniṣkamitvā spṛśiṣyate uttamamagrabodhim // / //
analyzed: jahitvā kāmān abhiniṣkamitvā spṛśiṣyate uttamam agra bodhim
translated: Having renounced desires and gone forth, will attain the supreme, highest enlightenment.

original: sama dvādaśā antarakalpa tasya bhaviṣyate āyu tadā jinasya /
analyzed: sama dvādaśā antarakalpa tasya bhaviṣyate āyu tadā jinasya
translated: His lifespan will be twelve intermediate eons, that of the Jina,

original: manujānapī antarakalpa aṣṭa āyuṣpramāṇaṃ tahi teṣa bheṣyati // / //
analyzed: antara kalpaḥ aṣṭa
translated: And the lifespan of humans there will be eight intermediate eons.

original: parinirvṛtasyāpi jinasya tasya dvātriṃśatiṃ antarakalpa pūrṇām /
analyzed: parinirvṛtasya api jinasya tasya dvātriṃśatim antarakalpa pūrṇām
translated: Even after the nirvana of that Jina, for thirty-two intermediate eons,

original: saddharma saṃsthāsyati tasmi kāle hitāya lokasya sadevakasya // / //
analyzed: saddharma saṃsthāsyati tasmin kāle hitāya lokasya sa devakasya
translated: The true Dharma will remain at that time For the benefit of the world and its gods.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: saddharmi kṣīṇe pratirūpako 'sya dvātriṃśatī antarakalpa sthāsyati /
analyzed: saddharmi kṣīṇe sthāsyati
translated: When the true Dharma has declined, its semblance will remain for thirty-two intermediate eons.

original: śarīravaistārika tasya tāyinaḥ susatkṛto naramarutaiśca nityam // / //
analyzed: śarīra vaistārika tasya tāyinaḥ su satkṛtaḥ nara marutaiḥ ca nityam
translated: The relics of that protector will be widely distributed, and will always be well-honored by humans and gods.

original: etādṛśaḥ so bhagavān bhaviṣyati prahṛṣṭa tvaṃ śārisutā bhavasva /
analyzed: etādṛśaḥ saḥ bhagavān bhaviṣyati prahṛṣṭa tvam śārisutā bhavasva
translated: Such will be that Blessed One, so rejoice, son of Śāri.

original: tvameva so tādṛśako bhaviṣyasi anābhibhūto dvipadānamuttamaḥ // / //
analyzed: tvam eva tādṛśakaḥ bhaviṣyasi
translated: You yourself will become such, invincible, supreme among humans.

original: atha khalu tāścatasraḥ parṣado bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikā devanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragamanuṣyāmanuṣyā
analyzed: atha khalu tāḥ catasraḥ parṣadaḥ bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikāḥ deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga manuṣya amanuṣyā
translated: Then those four assemblies of monks, nuns, male and female lay followers, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans,

original: āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasyedaṃ vyākaraṇamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau bhagavato 'ntikāt
analyzed: āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasya idam vyākaraṇam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau bhagavataḥ ntikāt
translated: having heard directly from the Blessed One this prophecy of the venerable Śāriputra regarding supreme perfect enlightenment,

original: saṃmukhaṃ śrutvā tuṣṭā udagrā āttamanasaḥ pramuditāḥ prītisaumanasyajātāḥ svakasvakaiścīvarairbhagavantamabhicchādayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: saṃmukham śrutvā tuṣṭāḥ udagrāḥ ātta manasaḥ pramuditāḥ prīti saumanasya jātāḥ svaka svakaiḥ cīvaraiḥ bhagavantam abhicchādayāmāsuḥ
translated: were satisfied, delighted, elated, joyful, and blissful. They each covered the Blessed One with their own robes.

original: śakraśca devānāmindro brahmā ca sahāṃpatiranyāśca devaputraśatasahasrakoṭyo bhagavantaṃ divyairvastrairabhicchādayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: śakraḥ ca devānām indraḥ brahmā ca sahāṃpatiḥ anyāḥ ca devaputra śata sahasra koṭyaḥ bhagavantam divyaiḥ vastraiḥ abhicchādayāmāsuḥ
translated: Śakra, lord of the gods, and Brahmā, lord of the Sahā World, and other hundreds of thousands of millions of gods covered the Blessed One with divine garments.

original: divyaiśca māndāravairmahāmāndaravaiśca puṣpairabhyavakiranti sma /
analyzed: divyaiḥ ca māndāravaiḥ mahā māndaravaiḥ ca puṣpaiḥ abhyavakiranti sma
translated: They scattered divine coral tree flowers and great coral tree flowers.

original: divyāni ca vastrāṇyuparyantarīkṣe bhrāmayanti sma /
analyzed: divyāni ca vastrāṇi upari antarīkṣe bhrāmayanti sma
translated: They waved divine garments in the air.

original: divyāni ca tūryaśatasahasrāṇi dundubhayaścoparyantarīkṣe parāhananti sma /
analyzed: divyāni ca tūrya śata sahasrāṇi dundubhayaḥ ca upari antarīkṣe parāhananti sma
translated: Hundreds of thousands of divine musical instruments and drums were played in the sky.

original: mahāntaṃ ca puṣpavarṣamabhipravarṣayitvā evaṃ ca vācaṃ bhāṣante sma pūrvaṃ bhagavatā vārāṇasyāmṛṣipatane mṛgadāve dharmacakraṃ pravartitam
analyzed: mahāntam ca puṣpa varṣam abhipravarṣayitvā evam ca vācam bhāṣante sma pūrvam bhagavatā vārāṇasyām ṛṣipatane mṛgadāve dharmacakram pravartitam
translated: Having rained down a great rain of flowers, they spoke these words: Previously, the Blessed One turned the wheel of Dharma in Vārāṇasī, in the Deer Park at Ṛṣipatana.

original: idaṃ punarbhagavatā adya anuttaraṃ dvitīyaṃ dharmacakraṃ pravartitam /
analyzed: idam punar bhagavatā adya anuttaram dvitīyam dharmacakram pravartitam
translated: Today, the Blessed One has turned the unsurpassed second wheel of Dharma.

original: te ca devaputrāstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣanta
analyzed: te ca devaputrāḥ tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣanta
translated: And those gods spoke these verses at that time:

original: dharmacakraṃ pravartesi loke apratipudgala /
analyzed: dharmacakram pravartesi loke apratipudgala
translated: You turn the wheel of Dharma in the world, O peerless one.

original: vārāṇasyāṃ mahāvīra skandhānāmudayaṃ vyayam // / //
analyzed: vārāṇasyām mahā vīra skandhānām udayam vyayam
translated: In Vārāṇasī, O Great Hero, you reveal the arising and ceasing of the aggregates.

original: prathamaṃ pravartitaṃ tatra dvitīyamiha nāyaka /
analyzed: prathamam pravartitam tatra dvitīyam iha nāyaka
translated: The first was set in motion there, the second here, O Leader.

original: duḥśraddadheya yasteṣāṃ deśito 'dya vināyaka // / //
analyzed: duḥśraddadheya yaḥ teṣām deśitaḥ vināyaka
translated: The one difficult to believe, which was taught by the Guide to them, is now being taught by me.

original: bahu dharmaḥ śruto 'smābhiarlokanāthasya saṃmukham /
analyzed: bahu dharmaḥ śrutaḥ smābhiḥ loka nāthasya saṃmukham
translated: We have heard much Dharma in the presence of the Lord of the World,

original: na cāyamīdṛśo dharmaḥ śrutapūrvaḥ kadācana // / //
analyzed: na ca ayam īdṛśaḥ dharmaḥ śruta pūrvaḥ kadācana
translated: But we have never before heard such a Dharma as this.

original: anumodāma mahāvīra saṃdhābhāṣyaṃ maharṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: anumodāma mahā vīra saṃdhā bhāṣyam mahā ṛṣiṇaḥ
translated: We rejoice, O Great Hero, in the teaching with implied meaning of the Great Sage,

original: yathārtho vyākṛto hyeṣa śāriputro viśāradaḥ // / //
analyzed: yathārthaḥ vyākṛtaḥ hi eṣa śāriputraḥ viśāradaḥ
translated: For this one who is skilled in speech, Shariputra, has been truly prophesied.

original: vayamapyedṛśāḥ syāmo buddhā loke anuttarāḥ /
analyzed: vayam api edṛśāḥ syāmaḥ buddhāḥ loke anuttarāḥ
translated: May we also become such, Buddhas in the world, unsurpassed,

original: saṃdhābhāṣyeṇa deśento buddhabodhimanuttarām // / //
analyzed: saṃdhā bhāṣyeṇa deśentaḥ buddha bodhim anuttarām
translated: Teaching the unsurpassed Buddha-enlightenment with implied meaning.

original: yacchrutaṃ kṛtamasmābhirasmiṃlloke paratra vā /
analyzed: yat śrutam kṛtam asmābhiḥ asmin loke paratra vā
translated: Whatever we have heard and done in this world or the next,

original: ārāgitaśca yadbuddhaḥ prārthanā bhotu bodhaye // / //
analyzed: ārāgitaḥ ca yat buddhaḥ prārthanā bhotu bodhaye
translated: And whatever Buddha we have pleased, may our aspiration be for enlightenment.

original: Vaidya 🔽atha khalvāyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantametadavocat niṣkāṅkṣo 'smi bhagavan vigatakathaṃkatho bhagavato 'ntikāt saṃmukhamidamātmano vyākaraṇaṃ
analyzed: vaidya  atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat niṣkāṅkṣaḥ smi bhagavan vigata kathaṃkathaḥ bhagavataḥ ntikāt saṃmukham idam ātmanaḥ vyākaraṇam
translated: Vaidya

original: śrutvā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: śrutvā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Then the venerable Shariputra said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, I am free from doubt and hesitation, having heard this prophecy about myself directly from the Blessed One regarding unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: yāni ca imāni bhagavan dvādaśa vaśībhūtaśatāni bhagavatā pūrvaṃ śaikṣabhūmau sthāpitāni
analyzed: yāni ca imāni bhagavan dvādaśa vaśībhūta śatāni bhagavatā pūrvam śaikṣa bhūmau sthāpitāni
translated: And these twelve hundred who have mastered themselves, whom the Blessed One previously established on the stage of training,

original: evamavavaditāni evamanuśiṣṭānyabhūvan etatparyavasāno me bhikṣavo dharmavinayo yadidaṃ
analyzed: evam avavaditāni evam anuśiṣṭāni abhūvan etad paryavasānaḥ me bhikṣavaḥ dharma vinayaḥ yat idam
translated: thus instructed, thus admonished, they said: This is the end of our practice, monks, namely

original: jātijarāvyādhimaraṇaśokasamatikramo nirvāṇasamavasaraṇaḥ /
analyzed: jāti jarā vyādhi maraṇa śoka samatikramaḥ nirvāṇa samavasaraṇaḥ
translated: the transcendence of birth, old age, sickness, death, and sorrow, the entry into nirvana.
