original: diśo daśā sarva gaveṣayitvā sthāpetvupāyaṃ puruṣottamānām // / //
analyzed: diśaḥ daśa gaveṣayitvā sthāpetu upāyam puruṣa uttamānām
translated: Having searched in all the ten directions, except for the skillful means of the Supreme Men,

original: putrā mamā yūyamahaṃ pitā vo mayā ca niṣkāsita yūya duḥkhāt /
analyzed: putrāḥ mama yūyam aham pitā vaḥ mayā ca niṣkāsita yūya duḥkhāt
translated: You are my sons, I am your father, and I have delivered you from suffering,

original: paridahyamānā bahukalpakoṭayastraidhātukāto bhayabhairavātaḥ // / //
analyzed: paridahyamānāḥ bahu kalpa koṭayaḥ traidhātukātaḥ bhaya bhairavātaḥ
translated: Burning for many koṭis of eons, from the three realms with their dangers and terrors.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: evaṃ ca haṃ tatra vadāmi nirvṛtimanirvṛtā yūya tathaiva cādya /
analyzed: evam ca ham tatra vadāmi nirvṛtim anirvṛtāḥ yūya tathā eva ca adya
translated: And I say this to them: 'You are not liberated, and you are not liberated today.'

original: saṃsāraduḥkhādiha yūya muktā bauddhaṃ tu yānaṃ va gaveṣitavyam // / //
analyzed: saṃsāra duḥkhāt iha yūya muktāḥ bauddham tu yānam gaveṣitavyam
translated: You are liberated from the suffering of saṃsāra, but you should still seek the Buddha's vehicle.

original: ye bodhisattvāśca ihāsti kecicchṛṇvanti sarve mama buddhanetrīm /
analyzed: ye bodhisattvāḥ ca iha asti kecid śṛṇvanti sarve mama buddha netrīm
translated: If there are any bodhisattvas here who listen to my entire Buddha's teaching,

original: upāyakauśalyamidaṃ jinasya yeno vinetī bahubodhisattvān // / //
analyzed: upāya kauśalyam idam jinasya yena u vinetī bahu bodhisattvān
translated: This is the skillful means of the Victorious One, by which he guides many bodhisattvas.

original: hīneṣu kāmeṣu jugupsiteṣu ratā yadā bhontimi atra sattvāḥ /
analyzed: hīneṣu kāmeṣu jugupsiteṣu ratāḥ yadā atra sattvāḥ
translated: When beings here delight in inferior, despised sensual pleasures,

original: duḥkhaṃ tadā bhāṣati lokanāyako ananyathāvādirihāryasatyam // / //
analyzed: duḥkham tadā bhāṣati loka nāyakaḥ ananyathāvādiḥ iha ārya satyam
translated: Then the Leader of the World teaches suffering, the noble truth that is not otherwise in this world.

original: ye cāpi duḥkhasya ajānamānā mūlaṃ na paśyantiha bālabuddhayaḥ /
analyzed: ye ca api duḥkhasya a jānamānāḥ mūlam na paśyanti iha bāla buddhayaḥ
translated: And those who do not understand suffering, whose childish minds do not see its root,

original: mārgaṃ hi teṣāmanudarśayāmi samudāgamastṛṣṇa dukhasya saṃbhavaḥ // / //
analyzed: mārgam hi teṣām anudarśayāmi samudāgamaḥ tṛṣṇa dukhasya saṃbhavaḥ
translated: I show them the path, that the arising of suffering is due to the origination of craving.

original: tṛṣṇānirodho 'tha sadā aniśritā nirodhasatyaṃ tṛtiyaṃ idaṃ me /
analyzed: nirodha satyam tṛtiyam idam me
translated: The cessation of craving, always without support, is my third truth of cessation.

original: ananyathā yena ca mucyate naro mārgaṃ hi bhāvitva vimukta bhoti // / //
analyzed: ananyathā yena ca mucyate naraḥ mārgam hi
translated: By which a man is liberated, not otherwise, he becomes liberated by cultivating the path.

original: kutaśca te śārisutā vimuktā asantagrāhātu vimukta bhonti /
analyzed: kutas ca te śārisutāḥ vimuktāḥ bhonti
translated: And from where are you liberated, Śārisuta? You are liberated from grasping at non-existence.

original: na ca tāva te sarvata mukta bhonti anirvṛtāṃstān vadatīha nāyakaḥ // / //
analyzed: na ca te anirvṛtān tān vadati iha nāyakaḥ
translated: And yet they are not completely liberated, the Guide says of them that they are not fully enlightened.

original: kikāraṇaṃ nāsya vadāmi mokṣamaprāpyimāmuttamamagrabodhim /
analyzed: kikāraṇam na asya vadāmi mokṣam a prāpya imām uttamam agra bodhim
translated: Why do I not speak of their liberation until I have attained this supreme, highest enlightenment?

original: mamaiṣa chando ahu dharmarājā sukhāpanārthāyiha loki jātaḥ // / //
analyzed: mama eṣa chandaḥ ahu dharma rājā sukhāpana arthāya iha loki jātaḥ
translated: This is my aspiration, I am the Dharma King, born into this world for the sake of bringing happiness.

original: iya śāriputrā mama dharmamudrā yā paścime kāli mayādya bhāṣitā /
analyzed: iya śāriputrāḥ mama dharmamudrā yā paścime mayā adya bhāṣitā
translated: This, Śāriputra, is my Dharma seal, which I am teaching now for the last time.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: hitāya lokasya sadevakasya diśāsu vidiśāsu ca deśayasva // / //
analyzed: hitāya lokasya sa devakasya diśāsu vidiśāsu ca deśayasva
translated: For the benefit of the world, including the gods, teach it in the directions and intermediate directions.

original: yaścāpi te bhāṣati kaści sattvo anumodayāmīti vadeta vācam /
analyzed: yaḥ ca api te bhāṣati sattvaḥ anumodayāmi iti vadeta vācam
translated: And if any being speaks to you, saying, I rejoice,

original: mūrdhnena cedaṃ pratigṛhya sūtraṃ avivartikaṃ taṃ naru dhārayestvam // / //
analyzed: ca idam pratigṛhya sūtram avivartikam tam naru dhārayeḥ tvam
translated: If you accept this sūtra with your head, you should consider that person to be irreversible.

original: dṛṣṭāśca teno purimāstathāgatāḥ satkāru teṣāṃ ca kṛto abhūṣi /
analyzed: dṛṣṭāḥ ca tena u purimāḥ tathāgatāḥ teṣām ca kṛtaḥ
translated: And by him the Tathāgatas of the past have been seen, and he has made offerings to them.

original: śrutaśca dharmo ayamevarūpo ya eta sūtraṃ abhiśraddadheta // / //
analyzed: śrutaḥ ca dharmaḥ ayam eva rūpaḥ yaḥ eta sūtram abhiśraddadheta
translated: And this kind of Dharma has been heard by him, who has faith in this sūtra.

original: ahaṃ ca tvaṃ caiva bhaveta dṛṣṭo ayaṃ ca sarvo mama bhikṣusaṃghaḥ /
analyzed: aham ca tvam ca eva bhaveta dṛṣṭaḥ ayam ca sarvaḥ mama bhikṣu saṃghaḥ
translated: He and I and you have been seen, and this entire assembly of monks of mine,

original: dṛṣṭāśca sarve imi bodhisattvā ye śraddadhe bhāṣitameta mahyam // / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭāḥ ca sarve bodhisattvāḥ ye śraddadhe bhāṣitam eta mahyam
translated: And all these bodhisattvas who have faith in what I have said have seen it.

original: sūtraṃ imaṃ bālajanapramohanamabhijñajñānāna mi etu bhāṣitam /
analyzed: imam bhāṣitam
translated: This sūtra, which is a delusion for foolish people, was spoken by me for the sake of the knowledge of the higher knowledges.

original: viṣayo hi naivāstiha śrāvakāṇāṃ pratyekabuddhāna gatirna cātra // / //
analyzed: viṣayaḥ hi na eva asti ha śrāvakāṇām gatiḥ na ca atra
translated: The disciples have no domain here, and the pratyekabuddhas have no course of action here.

original: adhimuktisārastuva śāriputra kiṃ vā punarmahya ime 'nyaśrāvakāḥ /
analyzed: adhimukti sāraḥ tuva śāriputra kim vā punar mahyaḥ ime
translated: Śāriputra, you have faith in me, so what to speak of these other disciples of mine?

original: ete 'pi śraddhāya mamaiva yānti pratyātmikaṃ jñānu na caiva vidyate // / //
analyzed: ete śraddhāya mama eva yānti pratyātmikam jñānu na ca eva vidyate
translated: They also have faith in me and go forth. But they do not have the knowledge of their own.

original: mā caiva tvaṃ stambhiṣu mā ca māniṣu māyuktayogīna vadesi etat /
analyzed: mā ca eva tvam stambhiṣu mā ca māniṣu vadesi etat
translated: Do not speak this to the proud ones, the conceited ones, and the ones who are not practicing yoga.

original: bālā hi kāmeṣu sadā pramattā ajānakā dharmu kṣipeyu bhāṣitam // / //
analyzed: bālāḥ hi kāmeṣu sadā pramattāḥ a jānakāḥ dharmu kṣipeyu bhāṣitam
translated: Foolish people are always heedless in regard to sensual pleasures. They do not know the Dharma and would reject what is taught.

original: upāyakauśalya kṣipitva mahyaṃ yā buddhanetrī sada loki saṃsthitā /
analyzed: upāya kauśalya mahyam yā buddha netrī sada loki saṃsthitā
translated: Having rejected my skillful means, the Buddha's eye that always abides in the world,

original: bhṛkuṭiṃ karitvāna kṣipitva yānaṃ vipāku tasyeha śṛṇohi tīvram // / //
analyzed: bhṛkuṭim karitvāna kṣipitva yānam vipāku tasya iha śṛṇohi tīvram
translated: Having frowned and rejected the vehicle, listen to the intense ripening of that here.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vaidya

original: kṣipitva sūtraṃ idamevarūpaṃ mayi tiṣṭhamāne parinirvṛte vā /
analyzed: kṣipitvā sūtram idam eva rūpam mayi tiṣṭhamāne parinirvṛte vā
translated: Having rejected this kind of sūtra, whether I am present or have attained parinirvāṇa,

original: bhikṣūṣu vā teṣu khilāni kṛtvā teṣāṃ vipākaṃ mamihaṃ śṛṇohi // / //
analyzed: bhikṣūṣu vā teṣu khilāni kṛtvā teṣām vipākam śṛṇohi
translated: Or if they harbor ill will towards those monks, listen to the ripening of that karma:

original: cyutvā manuṣyeṣu avīci teṣāṃ pratiṣṭha bhotī paripūrṇakalpāt /
analyzed: cyutvā manuṣyeṣu avīci teṣām pratiṣṭha bhotī paripūrṇa kalpāt
translated: Having fallen from the human realm, they will be reborn in Avīci for a full eon.

original: tataśca bhūyo 'ntarakalpa nekāṃścyutāścyutāstatra patanti bālāḥ // / //
analyzed: tatas ca bhūyas ntara kalpa na ekān cyutāḥ cyutāḥ tatra patanti bālāḥ
translated: And then again and again for many intermediate eons, the foolish ones will fall there, again and again.

original: yadā ca narakeṣu cyutā bhavanti tataśca tiryakṣu vrajanti bhūyaḥ /
analyzed: yadā ca narakeṣu cyutāḥ bhavanti tatas ca tiryakṣu vrajanti bhūyas
translated: When they fall from the hells, then they will go to the animal realm again.

original: sudurbalāḥ śvānaśṛgālabhūtāḥ pareṣa krīḍāpanakā bhavanti // / //
analyzed: su durbalāḥ śvāna śṛgāla bhūtāḥ krīḍāpanakāḥ bhavanti
translated: Very weak, they will become dogs and jackals, playthings for others.

original: varṇena te kālaka tatra bhonti kalmāṣakā vrāṇika kaṇḍulāśca /
analyzed: varṇena te kālaka tatra bhonti kalmāṣakāḥ vrāṇika kaṇḍulāḥ ca
translated: They will have a bad color there, black, with white spots, and will be itchy and scaly.

original: nirlomakā durbala bhonti bhūyo vidveṣamāṇā mama agrabodhim // / //
analyzed: nirlomakāḥ bhonti bhūyas vidveṣamāṇāḥ mama agra bodhim
translated: They will be hairless and very weak, hating my supreme enlightenment.

original: jugupsitā prāṇiṣu nitya bhonti loṣṭaprahārābhihatā rudantaḥ /🔽daṇḍena saṃtrāsita tatra tatra kṣudhāpipāsāhata śuṣkagātrāḥ // / //
analyzed: jugupsitāḥ prāṇiṣu bhonti loṣṭa prahāra abhihatāḥ rudantaḥ  daṇḍena tatra tatra kṣudhā pipāsā hata śuṣka gātrāḥ
translated: They will always be despised by living beings, crying out when struck with clods of earth.🔽Terrified by sticks here and there, their bodies dried up by hunger and thirst,

original: uṣṭrātha vā gardabha bhonti bhūyo bhāraṃ vahantaḥ kaśadaṇḍatāḍitāḥ /
analyzed: uṣṭrā atha vā gardabha bhonti bhūyas bhāram vahantaḥ kaśa daṇḍa tāḍitāḥ
translated: they will become camels or donkeys again, carrying loads, beaten with whips.

original: āhāracintāmanucintayanto ye buddhanetrī kṣipi bālabuddhayaḥ // / //
analyzed: āhāra cintām anucintayantaḥ ye buddha netrī kṣipi bāla buddhayaḥ
translated: Who, with foolish minds, have cast aside the Buddha's teachings while thinking about food.

original: punaśca te kroṣṭuka bhonti tatra bībhatsakāḥ kāṇaka kuṇṭhakāśca /
analyzed: punar ca te kroṣṭuka bhonti tatra bībhatsakāḥ kāṇaka kuṇṭhakāḥ ca
translated: And again, they become jackals there, repulsive, one-eyed, and crippled,

original: utpīḍitā grāmakumārakehi loṣṭaprahārābhihatāśca bālāḥ // / //
analyzed: utpīḍitāḥ grāma kumārakehi loṣṭa prahāra abhihatāḥ ca bālāḥ
translated: Oppressed by the children of the village, and struck by clods and sticks, those fools...

original: tataścyavitvāna ca bhūyu bālāḥ pañcāśatīnāṃ sama yojanānām /
analyzed: tatas cyavitvāna ca bhūyu bālāḥ pañcāśatīnām sama yojanānām
translated: And having fallen from there, those fools again, for fifty thousand leagues,

original: Vaidya 🔽dīrghātmabhāvā hi bhavanti prāṇino jaḍāśca mūḍhāḥ parivartamānāḥ // / //
analyzed: vaidya  dīrgha ātma bhāvāḥ hi bhavanti prāṇinaḥ jaḍāḥ ca mūḍhāḥ parivartamānāḥ
translated: Physician🔽Have long bodies and are dull and stupid, wandering around...

original: apādakā bhonti ca kroḍasakkino vikhādyamānā bahuprāṇikoṭibhiḥ /
analyzed: a pādakāḥ bhonti ca kroḍa sakkinaḥ vikhādyamānāḥ bahu prāṇi koṭibhiḥ
translated: They become legless, crawling on their bellies, eaten by many millions of creatures.

original: sudāruṇāṃ te anubhonti vedanāṃ kṣipitva sūtraṃ idamevarūpam // / //
analyzed: su dāruṇām te anubhonti vedanām sūtram idam evarūpam
translated: They experience extremely terrible feelings, having cast aside a sūtra like this...

original: puruṣātmabhāvaṃ ca yada labhante te kuṇṭhakā laṅgaka bhonti tatra /
analyzed: puruṣa ātma bhāvam ca labhante te kuṇṭhakāḥ laṅgaka bhonti tatra
translated: When they obtain a human body, there they become crippled and lame,

original: kubjātha kāṇā ca jaḍā jaghanyā aśraddadhantā ima sūtra mahyam // / //
analyzed: kubjā atha kāṇā ca jaḍā jaghanyā aśraddadhantā mahyam
translated: Hunchbacked, one-eyed, dull, and low, having no faith in this sūtra of mine...

original: apratyanīyāśca bhavanti loke pūtī mukhātteṣa pravāti gandhaḥ /
analyzed: apratyanīyāḥ ca bhavanti loke pūtī mukhāt teṣa pravāti gandhaḥ
translated: And they become unlikable in the world, a foul smell comes from their mouths,

original: yakṣagraho ukrami teṣa kāye aśraddadhantānima buddhabodhim // / //
analyzed: kāye buddha bodhim
translated: The yaksha spirit possesses their bodies, and they do not believe in the Buddha's enlightenment.

original: daridrakā peṣaṇakārakāśca upasthāyakā nitya parasya durbalāḥ /
analyzed: daridrakāḥ peṣaṇa kārakāḥ ca upasthāyakāḥ durbalāḥ
translated: They are poor, working as grinders, always servants to others, weak.

original: ābādha teṣāṃ bahukāśca bhonti anāthabhūtā viharanti loke // / //
analyzed: teṣām bahukāḥ ca bhonti anātha bhūtāḥ viharanti loke
translated: They have many illnesses and live in the world without a protector.

original: yasyaiva te tatra karonti sevanāmadātukāmo bhavatī sa teṣām /
analyzed: yasya eva te tatra karonti sevanāma dātu kāmaḥ bhavatī sa teṣām
translated: To whomsoever they offer service, that one wishes to give to them.

original: dattaṃ pi co naśyati kṣiprameva phalaṃ hi pāpasya imevarūpam // / //
analyzed: dattam caḥ naśyati kṣipram eva phalam hi pāpasya
translated: But even what is given is quickly lost - such is the result of evil.

original: yaccāpi te tatra labhanti auṣadhaṃ suyuktarūpaṃ kuśalehi dattam /
analyzed: yat ca api te tatra labhanti auṣadham su yukta rūpam dattam
translated: And whatever medicine they obtain there, well-prepared and given by the wise,

original: tenāpi teṣāṃ ruja bhūyu vardhate so vyādhirantaṃ na kadāci gacchati // / //
analyzed: tena api teṣām bhūyu vardhate saḥ vyādhiḥ antam na kadācid gacchati
translated: By that their pain increases even more, that illness never ends.

original: anyehi cauryāṇi kṛtāni bhonti ḍamarātha ḍimbāstatha vigrahāśca /
analyzed: cauryāṇi kṛtāni bhonti vigrahāḥ ca
translated: And other people commit thefts, quarrels, disputes, and fights.

original: dravyāpahārāśca kṛtāstathānyairnipatanti tasyopari pāpakarmaṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: dravya apahārāḥ ca kṛtāḥ tathā anyaiḥ nipatanti tasya upari pāpa karmaṇaḥ
translated: And other people commit robberies, and the evil karma falls upon him.

original: na jātu so paśyati lokanāthaṃ narendrarājaṃ mahi śāsamānam /
analyzed: na jātu saḥ paśyati loka nātham narendra rājam mahi śāsamānam
translated: He never sees the Lord of the World, the king of men, the great ruler,

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: tasyākṣaṇeṣveva hi vāsu bhoti imāṃ kṣipitvā mama buddhanetrīm // / //
analyzed: tasya akṣaṇeṣu eva hi vāsu bhoti imām kṣipitvā mama buddha netrīm
translated: Will only dwell in the lower realms, having cast aside this eye of the buddhas.

original: na cāpi so dharma śṛṇoti bālo badhiraśca so bhoti acetanaśca /
analyzed: na ca api saḥ dharma śṛṇoti bālaḥ badhiraḥ ca saḥ acetanaḥ ca
translated: That fool will not hear the Dharma, will be deaf and without understanding,

original: kṣipitva bodhīmimamevarūpāmupaśānti tasyo na kadāci bhoti // / //
analyzed: na
translated: And will never attain peace, having cast aside such an enlightenment as this.

original: sahasra nekā nayutāṃśca bhūyaḥ kalpāna koṭyo yatha gaṅgavālikāḥ /
analyzed: bhūyas kalpān koṭyaḥ
translated: For many thousands, many nayutas of eons, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges,

original: jaḍātmabhāvo vikalaśca bhoti kṣipitva sūtraṃ imu pāpakaṃ phalam // / //
analyzed: jaḍa ātma bhāvaḥ vikalaḥ ca pāpakam phalam
translated: He will have a dull body and be incomplete, having cast aside this sūtra, this evil result.

original: udyānabhūmī narako 'sya bhoti niveśanaṃ tasya apāyabhūmiḥ /
analyzed: udyāna bhūmī niveśanam tasya apāya bhūmiḥ
translated: His pleasure grove will become a hell, his dwelling place will be the lower realms,

original: kharasūkarā kroṣṭuka bhūmisūcakāḥ pratiṣṭhitasyeha bhavanti nityam // / //
analyzed: pratiṣṭhitasya iha bhavanti nityam
translated: And he will always be reborn as a donkey, pig, jackal, or earthworm.

original: manuṣyabhāvatvamupetya cāpi andhatva badhiratva jaḍatvameti /
analyzed: manuṣya bhāva tvam upetya ca api andha tva badhira tva jaḍa tvam eti
translated: Even if he attains a human birth, he will be blind, deaf, and dull,

original: parapreṣya so bhoti daridra nityaṃ tatkāli tasyābharaṇānimāni // / //
analyzed: saḥ daridra nityam tad kāli tasya ābharaṇāni imāni
translated: Always a servant to others, poor, at that time these will be his ornaments.

original: vastrāṇi co vyādhayu bhonti tasya vraṇāna koṭīnayutāśca kāye /
analyzed: vastrāṇi bhonti tasya koṭī nayutāḥ ca kāye
translated: His clothes will be diseased, and there will be a hundred thousand million wounds on his body,

original: vicarcikā kaṇḍu tathaiva pāmā kuṣṭhaṃ kilāsaṃ tatha āmagandhaḥ // / //
analyzed: vicarcikā kaṇḍu tathā eva pāmā kuṣṭham kilāsam āma gandhaḥ
translated: Itching, scabies, and leprosy, and also a foul smell.

original: satkāyadṛṣṭiśca ghanāsya bhoti udīryate krodhabalaṃ ca tasya /
analyzed: sat kāya dṛṣṭiḥ ca udīryate krodha balam ca tasya
translated: And he becomes firmly attached to the view of the real existence of the body, and his power of anger increases.

original: saṃrāgu tasyātibhṛśaṃ ca bhoti tiryāṇa yonīṣu ca so sadā ramī // / //🔽sacedahaṃ śārisutādya tasya paripūrṇakalpaṃ pravadeya doṣān /
analyzed: tasya ati bhṛśam ca ca saḥ sadā ramī  saced aham śārisuta adya tasya paripūrṇa kalpam pravadeya doṣān
translated: He becomes extremely lustful, and always delights in the wombs of animals.🔽If I were to speak today, Shariputra, about his faults for a full eon,

original: yo hī mamā etu kṣipeta sūtraṃ paryantu doṣāṇa na śakya gantum // / //
analyzed: yaḥ hi etu kṣipeta sūtram paryantu na śakya gantum
translated: The end of his faults could not be reached.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Doctor

original: saṃpaśyamāno idameva cārthaṃ tvāṃ saṃdiśāmī ahu śāriputra /
analyzed: saṃpaśyamānaḥ idam eva ca artham tvām saṃdiśāmi ahu śāriputra
translated: Seeing this very meaning, I send you, Shariputra,

original: mā haiva tvaṃ bālajanasya agrato bhāṣiṣyase sūtramimevarūpam // / //
analyzed: mā ha eva tvam bāla janasya agratas bhāṣiṣyase sūtram imā evarūpam
translated: Do not speak in front of the foolish people about this kind of sutra.

original: ye tū iha vyakta bahuśrutāśca smṛtimanta ye paṇḍita jñānavantaḥ /
analyzed: ye tu iha vyakta bahuśrutāḥca ye paṇḍita jñānavantaḥ
translated: But those who are very learned in this, who are mindful, wise, and knowledgeable,

original: ye prasthitā uttamamagrabodhiṃ tān śrāvayestvaṃ paramārthametat // / //
analyzed: ye prasthitāḥ uttamam agra bodhim tān śrāvayeḥ tvam parama artham etat
translated: Those who are set out for the highest supreme enlightenment, to them you should proclaim this ultimate truth.

original: dṛṣṭāśca yehī bahubuddhakoṭyaḥ kuśalaṃ ca yai ropitamaprameyam /
analyzed: dṛṣṭāḥ ca bahu buddha koṭyaḥ kuśalam ca yaiḥ ropitam aprameyam
translated: And those who have seen many millions of Buddhas, by whom immeasurable merit has been planted,

original: adhyāśayāścā dṛḍha yeṣa co syāttān śrāvayestvaṃ paramārthametat // / //
analyzed: syāt tān śrāvayeḥ tvam parama artham etat
translated: And those who have firm superior intention, to them you should teach this ultimate truth.

original: ye vīryavantaḥ sada maitracittā bhāventi maitrīmiha dīrgharātram /
analyzed: ye vīryavantaḥ maitra cittāḥ bhāventi maitrīm iha dīrgharātram
translated: Those who are energetic, always kind-hearted, and cultivate loving-kindness here for a long time,

original: utsṛṣṭakāyā tatha jīvite ca teṣāmidaṃ sūtra bhaṇeḥ samakṣam // / //
analyzed: jīvite ca teṣām idam sūtra bhaṇeḥ samakṣam
translated: Who have given up their body and life, to them you should recite this sūtra in their presence.

original: anyonyasaṃkalpa sagauravāśca teṣāṃ ca bālehi na saṃstavo 'sti /
analyzed: anyonya saṃkalpa sa gauravāḥ ca teṣām ca na saṃstavaḥ asti
translated: Who are respectful to each other and have no friendship with fools,

original: ye cāpi tuṣṭā girikandareṣu tān śrāvayestvaṃ ida sūtra bhadrakam // / //
analyzed: ye ca api tuṣṭāḥ giri kandareṣu tān śrāvayeḥ tvam idam sūtra bhadrakam
translated: And those who are content in mountain caves, to them you should recite this excellent sūtra.

original: kalyāṇamitrāṃśca niṣevamāṇāḥ pāpāṃśca mitrān parivarjayantaḥ /
analyzed: kalyāṇa mitrān ca niṣevamāṇāḥ pāpān ca mitrān parivarjayantaḥ
translated: Who rely on spiritual friends and avoid evil friends,

original: yānīdṛśān paśyasi buddhaputrāṃsteṣāmidaṃ sūtra prakāśayesi // / //
analyzed: yāni īdṛśān paśyasi buddha putrān teṣām idam sūtra
translated: To those who are like this, you should teach this sūtra.

original: acchidraśīlā maṇiratnasādṛśā vaipulyasūtrāṇa parigrahe sthitāḥ /
analyzed: acchidra śīlāḥ maṇi ratna sādṛśāḥ parigrahe sthitāḥ
translated: Who have flawless discipline like a precious jewel, and are dedicated to the extensive sūtras,

original: paśyesi yānīdṛśa buddhaputrāṃsteṣāgrataḥ sūtramidaṃ vadesi // / //
analyzed: paśyesi buddha putrān teṣām agratas sūtram idam vadesi
translated: To those who are like this, you should recite this sūtra in their presence.

original: akrodhanā ye sada ārjavāśca kṛpāsamanvāgata sarvaprāṇiṣu /🔽Vaidya
analyzed: a krodhanāḥ ye sadaḥ ārjavāḥ ca kṛpā samanvāgata sarva prāṇiṣu 🔽vaidya
translated: Who are always without anger and straightforward, and are endowed with compassion for all beings,

original: sagauravā ye sugatasya antike teṣāgrataḥ sūtramidaṃ vadesi // / //
analyzed: sa gauravāḥ ye sugatasya antike teṣām agratas sūtram idam vadesi
translated: And who are respectful in the presence of the Sugata, to them you should recite this sutra.

original: yo dharmu bhāṣe pariṣāya madhye asaṅgaprāpto vadi yuktamānasaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ bhāṣe pariṣāya madhye asaṅga prāptaḥ vadi yukta mānasaḥ
translated: Whoever teaches the Dharma in the midst of an assembly, who has attained non-attachment and speaks with a focused mind,

original: dṛṣṭāntakoṭīnayutairanekaistasyeda sūtraṃ upadarśayesi // / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭānta koṭī nayutaiḥ anekaiḥ sūtram
translated: To him you should show this sutra through many quintillions of parables.

original: mūrdhnāñjaliṃ yaśca karoti baddhvā sarvajñabhāvaṃ parimārgamāṇaḥ /
analyzed: mūrdhnā añjalim yaḥ ca karoti baddhvā sarvajña bhāvam parimārgamāṇaḥ
translated: Whoever joins the palms of his head and makes a gesture of respect, seeking the state of omniscience,

original: daśo diśo yo 'pi ca caṃkrameta subhāṣitaṃ bhikṣu gaveṣamāṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: daśa diśaḥ yaḥ ca caṃkrameta subhāṣitam bhikṣu gaveṣamāṇaḥ
translated: And whoever wanders in the ten directions, seeking the well-spoken teachings of a bhikshu,

original: vaipulyasūtrāṇi ca dhārayeta na cāsya rucyanti kadācidanye /
analyzed: vaipulya sūtrāṇi ca dhārayeta na ca asya rucyanti kadācid anye
translated: And whoever upholds the Vaipulya sutras, and is never interested in anything else,

original: ekāṃ pi gāthāṃ na ca dhāraye 'nyatastaṃ śrāvayestvaṃ varasūtrametat // / //
analyzed: ekām gāthām na ca dhāraye nyatas tam śrāvayeḥ tvam vara sūtram etat
translated: To him you should proclaim this excellent sutra, even if he does not uphold a single verse.

original: tathāgatasyo yatha dhātu dhārayettathaiva yo mārgati koci taṃ naraḥ /
analyzed: dhātu dhārayet tathā eva yaḥ mārgati tam naraḥ
translated: Whoever seeks the essence of the Tathagata, just as a man seeks it in that way,

original: emeva yo mārgati sūtramīdṛśaṃ labhitva yo mūrdhani dhārayeta // / //
analyzed: ema iva yaḥ mārgati sūtram īdṛśam yaḥ mūrdhani dhārayeta
translated: In the same way, whoever seeks a sutra like this, having obtained it, should uphold it on his head.

original: anyeṣu sūtreṣu na kāci cintā lokāyatairanyataraiśca śāstraiḥ /
analyzed: anyeṣu sūtreṣu na kāci cintā lokāyataiḥ anyataraiḥ ca śāstraiḥ
translated: In other sutras there is no thought at all, in the worldly treatises and other scriptures,🔽But in this sutra there is a great thought, it is the essence of the Dharma, the essence of the Tathagata.

original: bālāna etādṛśa bhonti gocarāstāṃstvaṃ vivarjitva prakāśayeridam // / //
analyzed: bhonti gocarāḥ tān tvam prakāśayeḥ idam
translated: Such are the objects of the childish. Having abandoned them, you should proclaim this.

original: pūrṇaṃ pi kalpaṃ ahu śāriputra vadeyamākāra sahasrakoṭyaḥ /
analyzed: pūrṇam śāriputra vadeyam ākāra sahasra koṭyaḥ
translated: For a full eon, Shariputra, I could speak with thousands of millions of forms,

original: ye prasthitā uttamamagrabodhiṃ teṣāgrataḥ sūtramidaṃ vadesi // / //
analyzed: ye prasthitāḥ uttamam agra bodhim teṣām agratas sūtram idam vadesi
translated: To those who are set on the supreme, highest enlightenment, I would speak this sutra in front of them.

original: ityāryasaddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye aupamyaparivarto nāma tṛtīyaḥ //
analyzed: iti ārya saddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye aupamyaparivartaḥ nāma tṛtīyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the third chapter, on the Parables, in the noble Dharma-discourse called White Lotus of the True Dharma.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: adhimuktiparivartaḥ /
analyzed: adhimukti parivartaḥ
translated: Chapter on Faith

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān subhūtirāyuṣmāṃśca mahākātyāyanaḥ āyuṣmāṃśca mahākāśyapaḥ āyuṣmāṃśca
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ āyuṣmān ca mahākātyāyanaḥ āyuṣmān ca mahākāśyapaḥ āyuṣmān ca
translated: Then the Venerable Subhūti, the Venerable Mahākātyāyana, the Venerable Mahākāśyapa, and the Venerable

original: mahāmaudgalyāyanaḥ imamevaṃrūpamaśrutapūrvaṃ dharmaṃ śrutvā bhagavato 'ntikāt saṃmukhamāyuṣmataśca
analyzed: mahāmaudgalyāyanaḥ imam evaṃrūpam a śruta pūrvam dharmam śrutvā bhagavataḥ ntikāt saṃmukham āyuṣmataḥ ca
translated: Mahāmaudgalyāyana, having heard this kind of unheard-before Dharma directly from the Blessed One, and having heard the prediction to the Venerable

original: śāriputrasya vyākaraṇaṃ śrutvā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau āścaryaprāptā adbhutaprāptā
analyzed: śāriputrasya vyākaraṇam śrutvā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau āścarya prāptā adbhuta prāptā
translated: Śāriputra of unsurpassed and perfect awakening, were amazed, astonished, and

original: audbilyaprāptā stasyāṃ velāyāmutthāyāsanebhyo yena bhagavāṃstenopasaṃkrāman /
analyzed: audbilya prāptāḥ tasyām velāyām utthāya āsanebhyaḥ yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāman
translated: overjoyed. At that time, they rose from their seats and approached the Blessed One.

original: upasaṃkramya ekāṃsamuttarāsaṅgaṃ kṛtvā dakṣiṇaṃ jānuṃ pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpya yena
analyzed: upasaṃkramyaḥ eka aṃsam uttarāsaṅgam kṛtvā dakṣiṇam jānum pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya yena
translated: Having approached, they arranged their upper robes over one shoulder, placed their right knees on the ground,

original: bhagavāṃstenāñjaliṃ praṇamya bhagavantamabhimukhamullokayamānā avanakāyā abhinatakāyāḥ
analyzed: bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamya bhagavantam abhimukham ullokayamānāḥ avana kāyāḥ abhinata kāyāḥ
translated: and with palms joined, they bowed to the Blessed One. Gazing at the Blessed One with eyes wide open, with their bodies bent, their bodies bowed,

original: praṇatakāyāstasyāṃ velāyāṃ bhagavantametadavocan vayaṃ hi bhagavan jīrṇā vṛddhā
analyzed: praṇata kāyāḥ tasyām velāyām bhagavantam etat avocan vayam hi bhagavan jīrṇāḥ vṛddhā
translated: their bodies prostrated, they said this to the Blessed One at that time: Blessed One, we are old, aged,

original: mahallakā asmin bhikṣusaṃghe sthavirasaṃmatā jarājīrṇībhūtā nirvāṇaprāptāḥ sma iti
analyzed: mahallakāḥ asmin bhikṣu saṃghe sthavira saṃmatāḥ jarā jīrṇībhūtāḥ nirvāṇa prāptāḥ smaḥ iti
translated: and decrepit in this community of monks, esteemed as elders. We have become worn out by old age, thinking we have attained nirvana.

original: bhagavan nirudyamā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhāvapratibalāḥ smaḥ /
analyzed: bhagavat nirudyamāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau apratibalāḥ smaḥ
translated: Blessed One, we have no enthusiasm for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment. We are incapable.

original: aprativīryārambhāḥ smaḥ /
analyzed: a prativīrya ārambhāḥ smaḥ
translated: We have no courage to begin.

original: yadāpi bhagavān dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: yadā api bhagavān dharmam deśayati
translated: Even when the Blessed One teaches the Dharma,

original: ciraṃ niṣaṇṇaśca bhagavān bhavati /
analyzed: ciram niṣaṇṇaḥ ca bhagavān bhavati
translated: and the Blessed One sits for a long time,

original: vayaṃ ca tasyāṃ dharmadeśanāyāṃ pratyupasthitā bhavāmaḥ /
analyzed: vayam ca tasyām dharma deśanāyām pratyupasthitāḥ bhavāmaḥ
translated: and we are present for that teaching of the Dharma,

original: tadāpyasmākaṃ bhagavan ciraṃ niṣaṇṇānāṃ bhagavantaṃ ciraṃ paryupāsitānāmaṅgapratyaṅgāni duḥkhanti /
analyzed: tadā api asmākam bhagavan ciram niṣaṇṇānām bhagavantam ciram paryupāsitānām aṅga pratyaṅgāni duḥkhanti
translated: then, Blessed One, our limbs and minor limbs ache from sitting for a long time and attending on the Blessed One for a long time.

original: saṃdhivisaṃdhayaśca duḥkhanti /
analyzed: saṃdhi visaṃdhayaḥ ca
translated: Our joints and minor joints ache.

original: tato vayaṃ bhagavan bhagavato dharmaṃ deśayamānasya śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitaṃ sarvamāviṣkurmaḥ /
analyzed: tatas vayam bhagavan bhagavataḥ dharmam deśayamānasya śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitam sarvam āviṣkurmaḥ
translated: “Therefore, Blessed One, when the Blessed One teaches the Dharma of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, we reveal all of it.

original: nāsmābhireṣu buddhadharmeṣu buddhakṣetravyūheṣu vā bodhisattvavikrīḍiteṣu vā tathāgatavikrīḍiteṣu vā spṛhotpāditā /
analyzed: na asmābhiḥ eṣu buddha dharmeṣu buddhakṣetra vyūheṣu vā bodhisattva vikrīḍiteṣu vā tathāgata vikrīḍiteṣu vā spṛhā utpāditā
translated: We have not given rise to any longing for these Buddha qualities, for the displays of the Buddha fields, for the play of the bodhisattvas, or for the play of the Tathāgatas.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: yaccāsmādbhagavaṃstraidhātukānnirdhāvitā nirvāṇasaṃjñinaḥ /
analyzed: yat ca asmāt bhagavan traidhātukāt nirdhāvitāḥ nirvāṇa saṃjñinaḥ
translated: Blessed One, we have escaped from this three-world universe and have the perception of nirvāṇa.

original: vayaṃ ca jarājīrṇāḥ /
analyzed: vayam ca jarā jīrṇāḥ
translated: And we are old and decrepit.

original: tato bhagavan asmābhirapyanye bodhisattvā avavaditā abhūvannanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: tatas bhagavan asmābhiḥ api anye bodhisattvāḥ avavaditāḥ abhūvan anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, we have also instructed other bodhisattvas in the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: anuśiṣṭāśca /
analyzed: anuśiṣṭāḥ ca
translated: We have given them instruction.

original: na ca bhagavaṃstatrāsmābhirekamapi spṛhācittamutpāditamabhūt /
analyzed: na ca bhagavan tatra asmābhiḥ ekam api spṛhā cittam utpāditam abhūt
translated: But, Blessed One, we have not given rise to a single thought of longing for that.

original: te vayaṃ bhagavannetarhi bhagavato 'ntikācchrāvakāṇāmapi vyākaraṇamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau bhavatīti śrutvā āścaryādbhutaprāptā mahālābhaprāptāḥ 🔽smaḥ /
analyzed: te vayam bhagavan etarhi bhagavataḥ ntikāt śrāvakāṇām api vyākaraṇam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau bhavati iti śrutvā āścarya adbhuta prāptāḥ mahā lābha prāptāḥ 🔽smaḥ
translated: Blessed One, now that we have heard from the Blessed One that even the disciples will receive predictions regarding unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, we have attained amazement and wonder, and we have attained a great gain.

original: bhagavannadya sahasaivemamevaṃrūpamaśrutapūrvaṃ tathāgataghoṣaṃ śrutvā mahāratnapratilabdhāśca smaḥ /
analyzed: bhagavan adya sahasā eva imam evaṃrūpam a śruta pūrvam tathāgata ghoṣam śrutvā mahā ratna pratilabdhāḥ ca smaḥ
translated: Blessed One, today we have suddenly heard this kind of sound of the Tathāgata, which we have never heard before, and we have obtained a great treasure.

original: bhagavan aprameyaratnapratilabdhāśca smaḥ /
analyzed: bhagavan aprameya ratna pratilabdhāḥ ca smaḥ
translated: Blessed One, we have obtained an immeasurable treasure.

original: bhagavan amārgitamaparyeṣṭamacintitamaprārthitaṃ cāsmābhirbhagavannidamevaṃ rūpaṃ mahāratnaṃ pratilabdham /
analyzed: bhagavan a mārgitam a paryeṣṭam a cintitam a prārthitam ca asmābhiḥ bhagavan idam evam rūpam mahā ratnam pratilabdham
translated: Blessed One, this kind of great treasure has been obtained by us, Blessed One, without being sought, without being sought for, without being thought of, without being wished for.

original: pratibhāti no bhagavan /
analyzed: pratibhāti naḥ bhagavan
translated: It occurs to us, Blessed One.

original: pratibhāti naḥ sugata /
analyzed: pratibhāti naḥ sugata
translated: It occurs to us, Sugata.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhagavan kaścideva puruṣaḥ piturantikādapakrāmet /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhagavan kaścid eva puruṣaḥ pituḥ antikāt apakrāmet
translated: Blessed One, it is just as if some person were to leave his father.

original: so 'pakramya anyataraṃ janapadapradeśaṃ gacchet /
analyzed: saḥ u pakramya anyataram janapada pradeśam gacchet
translated: Having left, he would go to some other region of the country.

original: sa tatra bahūni varṣāṇi vipravased viṃśatiṃ vā triṃśadvā catvāriṃśadvā pañcāśadvā /
analyzed: sa tatra bahūni varṣāṇi vipravaset viṃśatim vā triṃśat vā catvāriṃśat vā pañcāśat vā
translated: There he would live in exile for many years, twenty, thirty, forty, or fifty.

original: atha sa bhagavan mahān puruṣo bhavet /
analyzed: atha sa bhagavat mahān puruṣaḥ bhavet
translated: Now, Blessed One, that would be a great man.

original: sa ca daridraḥ syāt /
analyzed: sa ca daridraḥ syāt
translated: And he would be poor.

original: sa ca vṛttiṃ paryeṣamāṇa āhāracīvarahetordiśo vidiśaḥ prakāman anyataraṃ janapadapradeśaṃ gacchet /
analyzed: sa ca vṛttim paryeṣamāṇaḥ āhāra cīvara hetoḥ diśaḥ vidiśaḥ prakāman anyataram janapada pradeśam gacchet
translated: And seeking a livelihood, for the sake of food and clothing, wandering in all directions, he would go to some other region of the country.

original: tasya ca sa pitā anyatamaṃ janapadaṃ prakrāntaḥ syāt /
analyzed: tasya ca sa pitā anyatamam janapadam prakrāntaḥ syāt
translated: And that father of his would have gone to another country.

original: bahudhanadhānyahiraṇyakośakoṣṭhāgāraśca bhavet /
analyzed: bahu dhana dhānya hiraṇya kośa koṣṭhāgāraḥ ca bhavet
translated: And he would have much wealth, grain, treasure, and storehouses.

original: bahusuvarṇarūpyamaṇimuktāvaiḍūryaśaṅkhaśilāpravālajātarūparajatasamanvāgataśca bhavet /
analyzed: bahu suvarṇa rūpya maṇi muktā vaiḍūrya śaṅkha śilā pravāla jātarūpa rajata samanvāgataḥ ca bhavet
translated: He would be endowed with much gold, silver, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, quartz, coral, refined gold, and silver.

original: bahudāsīdāsakarmakarapauruṣeyaśca bhavet /
analyzed: bahu dāsī dāsa karmakara pauruṣeyaḥ ca bhavet
translated: He would have many female and male slaves, servants, and workers.

original: bahuhastyaśvarathagaveḍakasamanvāgataśca bhavet /
analyzed: bahu hasti aśva ratha gaveḍaka samanvāgataḥ ca bhavet
translated: He would be endowed with many elephants, horses, chariots, cattle, and goats.

original: mahāparivāraśca bhavet /
analyzed: mahā parivāraḥ ca bhavet
translated: He would have a great retinue.

original: mahājanapadeṣu ca dhanikaḥ syāt /
analyzed: mahā janapadeṣu ca dhanikaḥ syāt
translated: He would be a moneylender in the great countries.

original: āyogaprayogakṛṣivaṇijyaprabhūtaśca bhavet //
analyzed: āyoga prayoga kṛṣi vaṇijya prabhūtaḥ ca bhavet
translated: He would be engaged in agriculture and trade.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: athe khalu bhagavan sa daridrapuruṣa āhāracīvaraparyeṣṭihetorgrāmanagaranigamajanapadarāṣṭrarājadhānīṣu
analyzed: athe khalu bhagavan sa daridra puruṣaḥ āhāra cīvara paryeṣṭi hetoḥ grāma nagara nigama janapada rāṣṭra rājadhānīṣu
translated: Then, Blessed One, that poor man, for the sake of seeking food and clothing, would wander through villages, towns, markets, countries, kingdoms, and capital cities,

original: paryaṭamāno 'nupūrveṇa yatrāsau puruṣo bahudhanahiraṇyasuvarṇakośakoṣṭhāgārastasyaiva pitā vasati /
analyzed: paryaṭamānaḥ nupūrveṇa yatra asau puruṣaḥ bahu dhana hiraṇya suvarṇa kośa koṣṭhāgāraḥ tasya eva pitā vasati
translated: and in due course he would arrive at the city where that man who had much wealth, gold, silver, treasure, and storehouses, who was his own father, was living.

original: tannagaramanuprāpto bhavet /
analyzed: tat nagaram anuprāptaḥ bhavet
translated: He would have arrived at that city.

original: atha khalu bhagavan sa daridrapuruṣasya pitā bahudhanahiraṇyakośakoṣṭhāgārastasmin nagare vasamānastaṃ pañcāśadvarṣanaṣṭaṃ putraṃ satatasamitamanusmaret
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavan sa daridra puruṣasya pitā bahu dhana hiraṇya kośa koṣṭhāgāraḥ tasmin nagare vasamānaḥ tam pañcāśat varṣa naṣṭam putram satata samitam anusmaret
translated: Then, Blessed One, the father of that poor man, who lived in that city with much wealth, gold, treasure, and storehouses, would always and constantly remember his son who had been lost for fifty years.

original: samanusmaramāṇaśca na kasyacidācakṣedanyatraika evātmanādhyātmaṃ saṃtapyet /
analyzed: samanusmaramāṇaḥ ca na kasyacid ācakṣet anyatra ekaḥ eva ātmanā adhyātmam saṃtapyet
translated: And while remembering him, he would not tell anyone, but would only burn with inner anguish.

original: evaṃ ca cintayet ahamasmi jīrṇo vṛddho mahallakaḥ /
analyzed: evam ca cintayet aham asmi jīrṇaḥ vṛddhaḥ mahallakaḥ
translated: And he would think like this: I am old, aged, and decrepit.

original: prabhūtaṃ me hiraṇyasuvarṇadhanadhānyakośakoṣṭhāgāraṃ saṃvidyate /
analyzed: prabhūtam me hiraṇya suvarṇa dhana dhānya kośa koṣṭhāgāram saṃvidyate
translated: I have much gold, silver, wealth, grain, treasure, and storehouses.

original: na ca me putraḥ kaścidasti /
analyzed: na ca me putraḥ kaścid asti
translated: But I have no son at all.

original: mā haiva mama kālakriyā bhavet /
analyzed: mā ha eva mama kālakriyā bhavet
translated: May I not die!

original: sarvamidamaparibhuktaṃ vinaśyet /
analyzed: sarvam idam a paribhuktam vinaśyet
translated: All this will be lost without being enjoyed.

original: sa taṃ punaḥ punaḥ putramanusmaret aho nāmāhaṃ nirvṛtiprāpto bhaveyaṃ yadi me sa putra imaṃ dhanaskandhaṃ paribhuñjīta //
analyzed: sa tam punar punar putram anusmaret aho nāma aham nirvṛti prāptaḥ bhaveyam yadi me sa putraḥ imam dhana skandham paribhuñjīta
translated: He would remember his son again and again, thinking, Oh, how could I attain peace if that son of mine were to enjoy this wealth!

original: atha khalu bhagavan sa daridrapuruṣa āhāracīvaraṃ paryeṣamāṇo 'nupūrveṇa yena tasya
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavan sa daridra puruṣaḥ āhāra cīvaram paryeṣamāṇaḥ nupūrveṇa yena tasya
translated: Then, Blessed One, that poor man, seeking food and clothing, would eventually go to that city

original: prabhūtahiraṇyasuvarṇadhanadhānyakośakoṣṭhāgārasya samṛddhasya puruṣasya niveśanaṃ tenopasaṃkrāmet /
analyzed: prabhūta hiraṇya suvarṇa dhana dhānya kośa koṣṭhāgārasya samṛddhasya puruṣasya niveśanam tena upasaṃkrāmet
translated: He would approach the residence of a man who had abundant gold, silver, wealth, grain, treasuries, and storehouses.

original: atha khalu bhagavan sa tasya daridrapuruṣasya pitā svake niveśanadvāre mahatyā brāhmaṇakṣatriyaviṭśūdrapariṣadā
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavan sa tasya daridra puruṣasya pitā svake niveśana dvāre mahatyā brāhmaṇa kṣatriya viś śūdra pariṣadā
translated: Then, Blessed One, that poor man's father, in his own residence, surrounded by a great assembly of Brahmins, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, and Shudras,

original: parivṛtaḥ puraskṛto mahāsiṃhāsane sapādapīṭhe suvarṇarūpyapratimaṇḍite upaviṣṭo hiraṇyakoṭīśatasahasrairvyavahāraṃ
analyzed: parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ mahā siṃhāsane sa pāda pīṭhe suvarṇa rūpya pratimaṇḍite upaviṣṭaḥ hiraṇya koṭī śata sahasraiḥ vyavahāram
translated: seated on a great lion throne with a footstool, adorned with gold and silver, conducting business with hundreds of thousands of crores of gold coins,

original: kurvan vālavyajanena vījyamāno vitatavitāne pṛthivīpradeśe muktakusumābhikīrṇe ratnadāmābhipralambite
analyzed: kurvan vāla vyajanena vījyamānaḥ vitata vitāne pṛthivī pradeśe mukta kusuma abhikīrṇe ratna dāma abhipralambite
translated: being fanned with a yak-tail fan, in an open space strewn with scattered flowers, with jeweled garlands hanging down,

original: mahatyaddharyā upaviṣṭaḥ syāt /
analyzed: upaviṣṭaḥ syāt
translated: seated on a great precious throne.

original: adrākṣīt sa bhagavan daridrapuruṣastaṃ svakaṃ pitaraṃ svake niveśanadvāre evaṃrūpayā ṛdhyā upaviṣṭaṃ mahatā janakāyena parivṛtaṃ gṛhapatikṛtyaṃ 🔽kurvāṇam /
analyzed: adrākṣīt sa bhagavan daridra puruṣaḥ tam svakam pitaram svake niveśana dvāre evaṃrūpayā ṛdhyā upaviṣṭam mahatā jana kāyena parivṛtam gṛhapati kṛtyam 🔽kurvāṇam
translated: Blessed One, that poor man would see his father, seated in his own residence, in such a manner, surrounded by a great crowd, performing the duties of a householder.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punarbhītastrastaḥ saṃvignaḥ saṃhṛṣṭaromakūpajātaḥ udvignamānasaḥ evamanuvicintayāmāsa sahasaivāyaṃ mayā rājā vā rājamātro vā āsāditaḥ
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar bhītaḥ trastaḥ saṃvignaḥ saṃhṛṣṭa romakūpa jātaḥ udvigna mānasaḥ evam anuvicintayāmāsa sahasā eva ayam mayā rājā vā rājamātraḥ vā āsāditaḥ
translated: Seeing him, he would be frightened, terrified, anxious, with his body hair standing on end, and his mind would be disturbed. He would think like this: 'Suddenly I have encountered a king or a king's minister.

original: nāstyasmākamiha kiṃcit karma /
analyzed: na asti asmākam iha kiṃcid karma
translated: We have no work here.

original: gacchāmo vayaṃ yena daridravīthī /
analyzed: gacchāmaḥ vayam yena daridra vīthī
translated: Let us go to the poor streets.

original: tatrāsmākamāhāracīvaramalpakṛcchreṇaiva utpatsyate /
analyzed: tatra asmākam āhāra cīvaram alpa kṛcchreṇa eva utpatsyate
translated: There our food and clothing will arise with little difficulty.

original: alaṃ me ciraṃ vilambitena /
analyzed: alam me ciram vilambitena
translated: I have delayed long enough.

original: mā haivāhamiha vaiṣṭiko vā gṛhyeya /
analyzed: mā ha eva aham iha vaiṣṭikaḥ vā gṛhyeya
translated: Lest I be seized as a thief

original: anyataraṃ vā doṣamanuprāpnuyām //
analyzed: anyataram vā doṣam anuprāpnuyām
translated: or incur some other misfortune.'

original: atha khalu bhagavan sa daridrapuruṣo duḥkhaparaṃparāmanasikārabhayabhītastvaramāṇaḥ prakrāmet palāyet /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavan sa daridra puruṣaḥ duḥkha paraṃparā manasikāra bhaya bhītaḥ tvaramāṇaḥ prakrāmet palāyet
translated: Then, Blessed One, that poor man, frightened by the fear of contemplating a succession of sufferings, would quickly depart and flee.

original: na tatra saṃtiṣṭhet /
analyzed: na tatra saṃtiṣṭhet
translated: He would not stay there.

original: atha khalu bhagavan sa āḍhyaḥ puruṣaḥ svake niveśanadvāre siṃhāsane upaviṣṭastaṃ svakaṃ putraṃ sahadarśanenaiva pratyabhijānīyāt /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavan saḥ āḍhyaḥ puruṣaḥ svake niveśana dvāre siṃhāsane upaviṣṭaḥ tam svakam putram saha darśanena eva pratyabhijānīyāt
translated: Then, Blessed One, that wealthy man, seated on a lion throne at the door of his own house, would recognize his own son as soon as he saw him.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punastuṣṭa udagra āttamanaskaḥ pramuditaḥ prītisaumanasyajāto bhavet /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar tuṣṭaḥ udagraḥ ātta manaskaḥ pramuditaḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ bhavet
translated: And having seen him, he would be satisfied, elated, delighted, and filled with joy and gladness.

original: evaṃ ca cintayet āścaryaṃ yāvad yatra hi nāma asya mahato hiraṇyasuvarṇadhanadhānyakośakoṣṭhāgārasya paribhoktā upalabdhaḥ /
analyzed: evam ca cintayet āścaryam yāvat yatra hi nāma asya mahataḥ hiraṇya suvarṇa dhana dhānya kośa koṣṭhāgārasya paribhoktā upalabdhaḥ
translated: And he would think, ‘It is wonderful that the one who will enjoy this great wealth of gold, silver, property, grain, treasure, and storehouses has been found.

original: ahaṃ caitameva punaḥ punaḥ samanusmarāmi /
analyzed: aham ca etam eva punar punar samanusmarāmi
translated: And I remember him again and again.

original: ayaṃ ca svayamevehāgataḥ /
analyzed: ayam ca svayam eva iha āgataḥ
translated: And he has come here of his own accord.

original: ahaṃ ca jīrṇo vṛddho mahallakaḥ //
analyzed: aham ca jīrṇaḥ vṛddhaḥ mahallakaḥ
translated: And I am old, aged, and advanced in years.’

original: atha khalu bhagavan sa puruṣaḥ putratṛṣṇāsaṃpīḍitastasmin kṣaṇalavamuhūrte javanān puruṣān saṃpreṣayet gacchata mārṣā etaṃ puruṣaṃ śīghramānayadhvam
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavan sa puruṣaḥ putra tṛṣṇā saṃpīḍitaḥ tasmin kṣaṇa lava muhūrte javanān puruṣān saṃpreṣayet gacchata mārṣāḥ etam puruṣam śīghram ānayadhvam
translated: “Then, Blessed One, that man, tormented by craving for his son, would immediately dispatch swift messengers, saying, ‘Go, sirs, and quickly bring that man here.’

original: atha khalu bhagavaṃste puruṣāḥ rsava eva javena pradhāvitāstaṃ daridrapuruṣamadhyālambeyuḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavan te puruṣāḥ rsavaḥ eva javena pradhāvitāḥ tam daridra puruṣam adhyālambeyuḥ
translated: “Then, Blessed One, those messengers would all run swiftly and seize that poor man.

original: atha khalu daridrapuruṣastasyāṃ velāyāṃ bhītastrastaḥ saṃvignaḥ saṃhṛṣṭaromakūpajātaḥ udvigramānaso dāruṇamārtasvaraṃ muñcedāraved viravet
analyzed: atha khalu daridra puruṣaḥ tasyām velāyām bhītaḥ trastaḥ saṃvignaḥ saṃhṛṣṭa romakūpa jātaḥ udvigra mānasaḥ dāruṇam ārta svaram muñcet āravet viravet
translated: Then, at that time, the poor man would be frightened, terrified, anxious, with his hair standing on end, his mind disturbed, and he would let out a terrible cry of distress, cry out and wail,

original: nāhaṃ yuṣmākaṃ kiṃcidaparādhyāmīti vācaṃ bhāṣeta /
analyzed: na aham yuṣmākam kiṃcid aparādhyāmi iti vācam bhāṣeta
translated: saying, ‘I have done nothing wrong to you!’”

original: atha khalu te puruṣā balātkāreṇa taṃ Vaidya
analyzed: atha khalu te puruṣāḥ balātkāreṇa tam vaidya
translated: Then, Bhagavān, those men would forcibly drag that poor man,

original: daridrapuruṣaṃ viravantamapyākarṣeyuḥ /
analyzed: daridra puruṣam viravantam api ākarṣeyuḥ
translated: even though he was crying out, to the physician.

original: atha khalu sa daridrapuruṣo bhītastrastaḥ saṃvigna udvignamānasa evaṃ ca cintayet mā tāvadahaṃ vadhyo daṇḍayo bhaveyam /
analyzed: atha khalu sa daridra puruṣaḥ bhītaḥ trastaḥ saṃvignaḥ udvigna mānasaḥ evam ca cintayet mā tāvat aham vadhyaḥ daṇḍayaḥ bhaveyam
translated: Then, Bhagavān, that poor man, frightened, terrified, anxious, and worried, would think, ‘Let me not be killed or punished.

original: naśyāmīti /
analyzed: naśyāmi iti
translated: Let me escape.’

original: sa mūrchito dharaṇyāṃ prapatet /
analyzed: sa mūrchitaḥ dharaṇyām prapatet
translated: He would faint and fall to the ground.

original: visaṃjñaśca syāt /
analyzed: visaṃjñaḥ ca syāt
translated: He would be unconscious.

original: āsanne cāsya sa pitā bhavet /🔽sa tān puruṣānevaṃ vadet mā bhavanta etaṃ puruṣamānayantviti /
analyzed: āsanne ca asya sa pitā bhavet  sa tān puruṣān evam vadet mā bhavantaḥ etam puruṣam ānayantu iti
translated: And his father would be nearby.🔽He would say to those men, ‘Do not bring that man here.’

original: tamenaṃ śītalena vāriṇā parisiñcitvā na bhūya ālapet /
analyzed: tam enam śītalena vāriṇā parisiñcitvā na bhūyas ālapet
translated: They would sprinkle that poor man with cool water, and he would not speak again.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: jānāti sa gṛhapatistasya daridrapuruṣasya hīnādhimuktikatāmātmanaścodārasthāmatām /
analyzed: jānāti sa gṛhapatiḥ tasya daridra puruṣasya hīna adhimuktika tām ātmanaḥ ca udāra sthāma tām
translated: That householder knows the poor man’s inferior aspirations and his own superior status.

original: jānīte ca mamaiṣa putra iti //
analyzed: jānīte ca mama eṣa putraḥ iti
translated: He knows, ‘He is my son.’

original: atha khalu bhagavan sa gṛhapatirupāyakauśalyena na kasyacidācakṣet mamaiṣa putra iti /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavan sa gṛhapatiḥ upāya kauśalyena na kasyacid ācakṣet mama eṣa putraḥ iti
translated: Then, Bhagavān, that householder, through skillful means, would not tell anyone, ‘He is my son.’

original: atha khalu bhagavan sa gṛhapatiranyataraṃ puruṣamāmantrayet gaccha tvaṃ bhoḥ puruṣa /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavan sa gṛhapatiḥ anyataram puruṣam āmantrayet gaccha tvam bhoḥ puruṣa
translated: “Then, Bhagavān, that householder would say to another man, ‘Go, man,

original: enaṃ daridrapuruṣamevaṃ vadasva gaccha tvaṃ bhoḥ puruṣa yenākāṅkṣasi /
analyzed: enam daridra puruṣam evam vadasva gaccha tvam bhoḥ puruṣa yena ākāṅkṣasi
translated: and tell that poor man, “Go, man, wherever you wish.

original: mukto 'si /
analyzed: muktaḥ si
translated: You are free.”

original: evaṃ vadati sa puruṣastasmai pratiśrutya yena sa daridrapuruṣastenopasaṃkrāmet /
analyzed: evam vadati sa puruṣaḥ tasmai pratiśrutya yena sa daridra puruṣaḥ tena upasaṃkrāmet
translated: “When that man has agreed to do as he has been told, he would go to that poor man.

original: upasaṃkramya taṃ daridrapuruṣamevaṃ vadet gaccha tvaṃ bhoḥ puruṣa yenākāṅkṣasi /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya tam daridra puruṣam evam vadet gaccha tvam bhoḥ puruṣa yena ākāṅkṣasi
translated: Having approached him, he would say to that poor man, ‘Go, man, wherever you wish.

original: mukto 'sīti /
analyzed: muktā u si iti
translated: You are free.’

original: atha khalu sa daridrapuruṣa idaṃ vacanaṃ śrutvā āścaryādbhutaprāpto bhavet /🔽sa utthāya tasmāt pṛthivīpradeśādyena daridravīthī tenopasaṃkrāmedāhāracīvaraparyeṣṭihetoḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu sa daridra puruṣaḥ idam vacanam śrutvā āścarya adbhuta prāptaḥ bhavet  saḥ utthāya tasmāt pṛthivī pradeśāt yena daridra vīthī tena upasaṃkrāmet āhāra cīvara paryeṣṭi hetoḥ
translated: “Then that poor man, having heard those words, would be astonished and amazed.🔽He would rise up from that place and go to the poor section of town in order to search for food and clothing.

original: atha khalu sa gṛhapatistasya daridrapuruṣasyākarṣaṇahetorupāyakauśalyaṃ prayojayet /
analyzed: atha khalu sa gṛhapatiḥ tasya daridra puruṣasya ākarṣaṇa hetoḥ upāya kauśalyam prayojayet
translated: “Then that householder, in order to attract that poor man, would employ a skillful method.

original: sa tatra dvau puruṣau prayojayet durvarṇāvalpaujaskau gacchatāṃ bhavantau yo 'sau puruṣa ihāgato 'bhūt /
analyzed: sa tatra dvau puruṣau prayojayet durvarṇau alpa ojaskau gacchatām bhavantau saḥ puruṣaḥ iha āgataḥ bhūt
translated: He would employ two men, who were ugly and had little power, saying, ‘Go to that man who has come here,

original: taṃ yuvāṃ dviguṇayā divasamudrayā ātmavacanenaiva bharayitveha mama niveśane karma kārāpayethām /
analyzed: tam yuvām dviguṇayā divasamudrayā ātma vacanena eva bharayitvā iha mama niveśane karma kārāpayethām
translated: You two should hire him here in my house to work for double wages for a day's work, by your own words.

original: sacet sa evaṃ vadet kiṃ karma kartavyamiti /
analyzed: saced saḥ evam vadet kim karma kartavyam iti
translated: If he should say, 'What work should be done?'

original: sa yuvābhyāmevaṃ vaktavyaḥ saṃkāradhānaṃ śodhayitavyaṃ sahāvābhyāmiti /
analyzed: sa yuvābhyām evam vaktavyaḥ saṃkāra dhānam śodhayitavyam saha āvābhyām iti
translated: You two should say to him, 'You should clean out the rubbish heap together with us.'

original: atha tau puruṣau taṃ daridrapuruṣaṃ paryeṣayitvā tayā kriyayā saṃpādayetām /
analyzed: atha tau puruṣau tam daridra puruṣam paryeṣayitvā tayā kriyayā saṃpādayetām
translated: Then those two men, having searched for that poor man, would accomplish it with that action.

original: atha khalu tau dvau puruṣau sa ca daridrapuruṣo vetanaṃ gṛhītvā tasya mahādhanasya puruṣasyāntikāttasminneva niveśane saṃkāradhānaṃ śodhayeyuḥ
analyzed: atha khalu tau dvau puruṣau sa ca daridra puruṣaḥ vetanam gṛhītvā tasya mahādhanasya puruṣasya antikāt tasmin eva niveśane saṃkāra dhānam śodhayeyuḥ
translated: Then indeed those two men and that poor man, having received wages from that very wealthy man, would clean out the rubbish heap in that very house.

original: tasyaiva ca mahādhanasya puruṣasya gṛhaparisare kaṭapalikuñcikāyāṃ vāsaṃ kalpayeyuḥ /
analyzed: tasya eva ca mahādhanasya puruṣasya gṛha parisare kaṭapali kuñcikāyām vāsam kalpayeyuḥ
translated: And they would make their dwelling in a hut of sticks and grass near the house of that very wealthy man.

original: sa cāḍhyaḥ puruṣo gavākṣavātāyanena taṃ svakaṃ putraṃ paśyet saṃkāradhānaṃ śodhayamānam /
analyzed: sa ca āḍhyaḥ puruṣaḥ gavākṣa vātāyanena tam svakam putram paśyet saṃkāra dhānam śodhayamānam
translated: And that rich man would see his own son through a window or ventilator, cleaning out the rubbish heap.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punarāścaryaprāpto bhavet //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar āścarya prāptaḥ bhavet
translated: And having seen him, he would be amazed.

original: atha khalu sa gṛhapatiḥ svakānniveśanādavatīrya apanayitvā mālyābharaṇani /
analyzed: atha khalu sa gṛhapatiḥ svakāt niveśanāt avatīrya apanayitvā
translated: Then that householder, having descended from his own house, having removed his garlands and ornaments,

original: apanayitvā mṛdukāni vastrāṇi /
analyzed: apanayitvā mṛdukāni vastrāṇi
translated: having removed his soft garments,

original: caukṣāṇyudārāṇi malināni vastrāṇi prāvṛtya /
analyzed: caukṣāṇi udārāṇi malināni vastrāṇi prāvṛtya
translated: having put on clean, excellent, dirty garments,

original: dakṣiṇena pāṇinā piṭakaṃ parigṛhya pāṃsunā svagātraṃ dūṣayitvā dūrata eva saṃbhāṣamāṇo yena sa daridrapuruṣastenopasaṃkrāmet /
analyzed: dakṣiṇena pāṇinā piṭakam parigṛhya pāṃsunā sva gātram dūṣayitvā dūratas eva saṃbhāṣamāṇaḥ yena sa daridra puruṣaḥ tena upasaṃkrāmet
translated: having taken a basket in his right hand, having defiled his body with dust, having spoken from afar, he would approach that poor man.

original: upasaṃkramyaivaṃ vadet vahantu bhavantaḥ piṭakāni /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya evam vadet vahantu bhavantaḥ piṭakāni
translated: Having approached, he would say thus: 'Carry the baskets, sirs.

original: mā tiṣṭhata /
analyzed: mā tiṣṭhata
translated: Do not stand.

original: harata pāṃsūni /
analyzed: harata pāṃsūni
translated: Take the dust.

original: anenopāyena taṃ putramālapet saṃlapecca /
analyzed: anena upāyena tam putram ālapet saṃlapet ca
translated: By this means he would speak to that son and converse with him.

original: enaṃ vadet ihaiva tvaṃ bhoḥ puruṣa karma kuruṣva /
analyzed: enam vadet iha eva tvam bhoḥ puruṣa karma kuruṣva
translated: He would say to him: 'Here, good man, do your work.

original: mā bhūyo 'nyatra gamiṣyasi /
analyzed: mā bhūyas nyatra gamiṣyasi
translated: Do not go anywhere else again.

original: saviśeṣaṃ te 'haṃ vetanakaṃ dāsyāmi /
analyzed: sa viśeṣam te haṃ vetanakam dāsyāmi
translated: I will give you wages with a special allowance.

original: yena yena ca te kārya bhavet /
analyzed: yena yena ca te kārya bhavet
translated: And whatever you may need,

original: tadviśrabdhaṃ māṃ yāceḥ /
analyzed: tat viśrabdham mām yāceḥ
translated: you may confidently ask me for it.'

original: yadi vā kuṇḍamūlyena yadi vā kuṇḍikāmūlyena yadi vā sthālikāmūlyena yadi vā kāṣṭhamūlyena yadi vā lavaṇamūlyena yadi vā bhojanena yadi vā prāvaraṇena
analyzed: yadi vā kuṇḍa mūlyena yadi vā kuṇḍikā mūlyena yadi vā sthālikā mūlyena yadi vā kāṣṭha mūlyena yadi vā lavaṇa mūlyena yadi vā bhojanena yadi vā prāvaraṇena
translated: whether for the price of a pot, or for the price of a water-pot, or for the price of a pan, or for the price of wood, or for the price of salt, or for food, or for clothing,

original: asti me bhoḥ puruṣa jīrṇaśāṭī /
analyzed: asti me bhoḥ puruṣa jīrṇa śāṭī
translated: ‘Sir, I have an old garment.

original: sacettayā te kāryaṃ syāt /
analyzed: saced tayā te kāryam syāt
translated: If you have any use for it,

original: yāceḥ /
analyzed: yāceḥ
translated: ask for it.

original: ahaṃ te 'nupradāsyāmi /
analyzed: aham te nupradāsyāmi
translated: I will give it to you.

original: yena yena te bhoḥ puruṣa kāryamevaṃrūpeṇa pariṣkāreṇa /
analyzed: yena yena te bhoḥ puruṣa kāryam evaṃrūpeṇa pariṣkāreṇa
translated: Whatever you need, sir, in the way of provisions,

original: taṃ tamevāhaṃ te sarvamanupradāsyāmi /
analyzed: tam tam eva aham te sarvam anupradāsyāmi
translated: I will give you all of it.

original: nirvṛtastvaṃ bhoḥ puruṣa bhava /🔽yādṛśaste pitā /
analyzed: nirvṛtaḥ tvam bhoḥ puruṣa bhava  yādṛśaḥ te pitā
translated: Be satisfied, sir.

original: tādṛśaste 'haṃ mantavyaḥ /
analyzed: tādṛśaḥ te ham mantavyaḥ
translated: You should think of me as being like your father.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ / ahaṃ Vaidya
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ aham vaidya
translated: Why is that? I am a doctor

original: ca vṛddhaḥ / tvaṃ ca daharaḥ /
analyzed: ca vṛddhaḥ tvam ca daharaḥ
translated: and you are young.

original: mama ca tvayā bahu karma kṛtamimaṃ saṃkāradhānaṃ śodhayatā /
analyzed: mama ca tvayā bahu karma kṛtam imam saṃkāra dhānam śodhayatā
translated: And you have done much work for me, cleaning this rubbish heap.

original: na ca tvayā bhoḥ puruṣa atra karma kurvatā śāṭhayaṃ vā vakratā vā kauṭilyaṃ vā māno vā mrakṣo vā kṛtapūrvaḥ / karoṣi vā /
analyzed: na ca tvayā bhoḥ puruṣa atra karma kurvatā śāṭhayam vā vakra tā vā kauṭilyam vā mānaḥ vā mrakṣaḥ vā kṛta pūrvaḥ karoṣi vā
translated: And, sir, while you were doing this work here, you have never before done anything deceitful, crooked, devious, proud, or arrogant. Or do you do so now?

original: sarvathā te bhoḥ puruṣa na samanupaśyāmyekamapi pāpakarma /
analyzed: sarvathā te bhoḥ puruṣa na samanupaśyāmi ekam api pāpa karma
translated: “In every way, sir, I do not see a single bad deed in you.

original: yathaiṣāmanyeṣāṃ puruṣāṇāṃ karma kurvatāmime doṣāḥ saṃvidyante /
analyzed: yathā eṣām anyeṣām puruṣāṇām karma kurvatām ime doṣāḥ saṃvidyante
translated: While these other men who work have these faults,

original: yādṛśo me putra aurasaḥ /
analyzed: yādṛśaḥ me putraḥ aurasaḥ
translated: you are like my own son.

original: tādṛśastvaṃ mama adyāgreṇa bhavasi //
analyzed: tādṛśaḥ tvam mama adya agreṇa bhavasi
translated: From this day forward, you are like my own son.”

original: atha khalu bhagavan sa gṛhapatistasya daridrapuruṣasya putra iti nāma kuryāt /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavan sa gṛhapatiḥ tasya daridra puruṣasya putraḥ iti nāma kuryāt
translated: Then, Blessed One, that householder would give the poor man the name of his own son.

original: sa ca daridrapuruṣastasya gṛhapaterantike pitṛsaṃjñāmutpādayet /
analyzed: sa ca daridra puruṣaḥ tasya gṛhapateḥ antike pitṛ saṃjñām utpādayet
translated: And the poor man would think of the householder as his father.

original: anena bhagavan paryāyeṇa sa gṛhapatiḥ putrakāmatṛṣito viṃśativarṣāṇi taṃ putraṃ saṃkāradhānaṃ śodhāpayet /
analyzed: anena bhagavan paryāyeṇa sa gṛhapatiḥ putra kāma tṛṣitaḥ viṃśati varṣāṇi tam putram saṃkāra dhānam śodhāpayet
translated: In this way, Blessed One, the householder, thirsty for a son, would have that son clean out the rubbish heap for twenty years.

original: atha viṃśatervarṣāṇāmatyayena sa daridrapuruṣastasya gṛhapaterniveśane viśrabdho bhavenniṣkramaṇapraveśe /
analyzed: atha viṃśateḥ varṣāṇām atyayena sa daridra puruṣaḥ tasya gṛhapateḥ niveśane viśrabdhaḥ bhavet niṣkramaṇa praveśe
translated: Then, after twenty years had passed, the poor man would be confident in the householder’s house, coming and going as he pleased.

original: tatraiva ca kaṭapalikuñcikāyāṃ vāsaṃ kalpayet //
analyzed: tatra eva ca kaṭapali kuñcikāyām vāsam kalpayet
translated: And he would make his dwelling right there, in the hole in the ground.

original: atha khalu bhagavaṃstasya gṛhapaterglānyaṃ pratyupasthitaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavan tasya gṛhapateḥ glānyam pratyupasthitam bhavet
translated: Then, Blessed One, the householder would become sick.

original: sa maraṇakālasamayaṃ ca ātmanaḥ pratyupasthitaṃ samanupaśyet /
analyzed: sa maraṇa kāla samayam ca ātmanaḥ pratyupasthitam samanupaśyet
translated: He would see that the time of his death had arrived.

original: sa taṃ daridrapuruṣamevaṃ vadet āgaccha tvaṃ bhoḥ puruṣa /
analyzed: sa tam daridra puruṣam evam vadet āgaccha tvam bhoḥ puruṣa
translated: He would say to that poor man, ‘Come here, good man.

original: idaṃ mama prabhūtaṃ hiraṇyasuvarṇadhanadhānyakośakoṣṭhāgāramasti /
analyzed: idam mama prabhūtam hiraṇya suvarṇa dhana dhānya kośa koṣṭhāgāram asti
translated: I have this great wealth of gold, silver, property, grain, treasure, and storehouses.

original: ahaṃ bāḍhaglānaḥ /🔽icchāmyetaṃ yasya dātavyaṃ yataśca grahītavyaṃ yacca nidhātavyaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: aham bāḍha glānaḥ  icchāmi etam yasya dātavyam yatas ca grahītavyam yat ca nidhātavyam bhavet
translated: I am very sick.

original: sarvaṃ saṃjānīyāḥ /
analyzed: sarvam saṃjānīyāḥ
translated: I wish you to know everything about what should be given, what should be taken, and what should be stored.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: yādṛśa eva ahamasya dravyasya svāmī /
analyzed: yādṛśaḥ eva aham asya dravyasya svāmī
translated: Just as I am the owner of this wealth,

original: tādṛśastvamapi /
analyzed: tādṛśaḥ tvam api
translated: so are you.

original: mā ca me tvaṃ kiṃcidato vipraṇāśayiṣyasi //
analyzed: mā ca me tvam kiṃcid atas vipraṇāśayiṣyasi
translated: Do not lose anything of mine.’

original: atha khalu bhagavan sa daridrapuruṣo 'nena paryāyeṇa tacca tasya gṛhapateḥ prabhūtaṃ hiraṇyasuvarṇadhanadhānyakośakoṣṭhāgāraṃ saṃjānīyāt /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavan sa daridra puruṣaḥ nena paryāyeṇa tat ca tasya gṛhapateḥ prabhūtam hiraṇya suvarṇa dhana dhānya kośa koṣṭhāgāram saṃjānīyāt
translated: “Then, Bhagavān, that poor man, through this method, would know about the householder’s great wealth of gold, silver, property, grain, treasure, and storehouses.

original: ātmanā ca tato niḥspṛho bhavet /
analyzed: ātmanā ca tatas niḥspṛhaḥ bhavet
translated: He would have no desire for any of it.

original: na ca tasmāt kiṃcit prārthayet /🔽antaśaḥ saktuprasthamūlyamātramapi /
analyzed: na ca tasmāt kiṃcid prārthayet  antaśas saktu prastha mūlya mātram api
translated: He would not ask for anything from it,🔽not even the price of a prastha of flour.

original: tatraiva ca kaṭapalikuñcikāyāṃ vāsaṃ kalpayet /
analyzed: tatra eva ca kaṭapali kuñcikāyām vāsam kalpayet
translated: He would make his home right there in the hole in the wall.

original: tāmeva daridracintāmanuvicintayamānaḥ //
analyzed: tām eva daridra cintām anuvicintayamānaḥ
translated: Thinking about that poverty,

original: atha khalu bhagavan sa gṛhapatistaṃ putraṃ śaktaṃ paripālakaṃ paripakvaṃ viditvā🔽avamarditacittamudārasaṃjñayā ca paurvikayā daridracintayā ārtīyantaṃ jehrīyamāṇaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavan sa gṛhapatiḥ tam putram śaktam paripālakam paripakvam viditvā  avamardita cittam udāra saṃjñayā ca paurvikayā daridra cintayā ārtīyantam jehrīyamāṇam
translated: Then, Blessed One, that householder, knowing that his son was capable, a protector, and mature,🔽Knowing that he was disgusted, ashamed,

original: jugupsamānaṃ viditvā maraṇakālasamaye pratyupasthite taṃ daridrapuruṣamānāyya mahato
analyzed: jugupsamānam viditvā maraṇa kāla samaye pratyupasthite tam daridra puruṣam ānāyya
translated: and contemptuous with a mind of contempt and the previous thought of poverty, at the time of his death approaching, having summoned that poor man,

original: jñātisaṃghasyopanāmayitvā rājño vā rājamātrasya vā purato naigamajānapadānāṃ ca saṃmukhamevaṃ
analyzed: jñāti saṃghasya upanāmayitvā rājñaḥ vā rājamātrasya vā puratas naigama jānapadānām ca saṃmukham evam
translated: Having presented him to a great assembly of relatives, in the presence of the king or the king's minister and the people of the town and country, he would proclaim

original: saṃśrāvayet śṛṇvantu bhavantaḥ /
analyzed: saṃśrāvayet śṛṇvantu bhavantaḥ
translated: like this: Listen, sirs!

original: ayaṃ mama putra auraso mayaiva janitaḥ /
analyzed: ayam mama putraḥ aurasaḥ mayā eva janitaḥ
translated: This is my son, born of me, begotten by me.

original: amukaṃ nāma nagaram /
analyzed: amukam nāma nagaram
translated: In such and such a town.

original: tasmādeṣa pañcāśadvarṣo naṣṭaḥ /🔽amuko nāmaiṣa nāmnā /
analyzed: tasmāt eṣa pañcāśat varṣaḥ naṣṭaḥ  amukaḥ nāma eṣa nāmnā
translated: From there he was lost for fifty years.🔽His name is such and such.

original: ahamapyamuko nāma /
analyzed: aham api amukaḥ nāma
translated: And my name is such and such.

original: tataścāhaṃ nagarādetameva mārgamāṇa ihāgataḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca aham nagarāt etam eva mārgamāṇaḥ iha āgataḥ
translated: Then, searching for him in that town, I came here.

original: eṣa mama putraḥ /
analyzed: eṣa mama putraḥ
translated: This is my son.

original: ahamasya pitā /
analyzed: aham asya pitā
translated: I am his father.

original: yaḥ kaścinmamopabhogo 'sti /
analyzed: yaḥ kaścid mama upabhogaḥ sti
translated: Whatever possessions I have,

original: taṃ sarvamasmai puruṣāya niryātayāmi /
analyzed: tam sarvam asmai puruṣāya niryātayāmi
translated: I give them all to that man.

original: yacca me kiṃcidasti pratyātmakaṃ dhanam /
analyzed: yat ca me kiṃcid asti pratyātmakam dhanam
translated: Whatever wealth I have acquired personally,

original: tatsarvameṣa eva jānāti //
analyzed: tat sarvam eṣaḥ eva jānāti
translated: he alone knows it all.

original: atha khalu bhagavan sa daridrapuruṣastasmin samaye imamevaṃrūpaṃ ghoṣaṃ śrutvā āścaryādbhutaprāpto bhavet /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavan sa daridra puruṣaḥ tasmin samaye imam evaṃrūpam ghoṣam śrutvā āścarya adbhuta prāptaḥ bhavet
translated: Then, Blessed One, that poor man, hearing such a voice at that time, would be filled with wonder and amazement.

original: evaṃ ca vicintayet sahasaiva mayedameva tāvad hiraṇyasuvarṇadhanadhānyakośakoṣṭhāgāraṃ pratilabdhamiti //
analyzed: evam ca vicintayet sahasā eva mayā idam eva tāvat hiraṇya suvarṇa dhana dhānya kośa koṣṭhāgāram pratilabdham iti
translated: And he would think: 'Suddenly I have obtained this very wealth of gold, silver, grain, treasure, and storehouses.'

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: evameva bhagavan vayaṃ tathāgatasya putrapratirūpakāḥ /
analyzed: evam eva bhagavan vayam tathāgatasya putra pratirūpakāḥ
translated: In the same way, Blessed One, we are like the sons of the Tathāgata.

original: tathāgataśca asmākamevaṃ vadati putrā mama yūyamiti /
analyzed: tathāgataḥ ca asmākam evam vadati putrāḥ mama yūyam iti
translated: And the Tathāgata says to us: 'You are my sons.'

original: yathā sa gṛhapatiḥ /
analyzed: yathā sa gṛhapatiḥ
translated: Just like that householder.

original: vayaṃ ca bhagavaṃstisṛbhirduḥkhatābhiḥ saṃpīḍitā abhūma /
analyzed: vayam ca bhagavan tisṛbhiḥ duḥkha tābhiḥ saṃpīḍitāḥ abhūma
translated: And we, Blessed One, were afflicted by three kinds of suffering.

original: katamābhistisṛbhiḥ /
analyzed: katamābhiḥ tisṛbhiḥ
translated: What are the three?

original: yaduta duḥkhaduḥkhatayā saṃskāraduḥkhatayā vipariṇāmaduḥkhatayā ca /
analyzed: yat uta duḥkha duḥkha tayā saṃskāra duḥkha tayā vipariṇāma duḥkha tayā ca
translated: Namely, the suffering of suffering, the suffering of change, and the suffering of the composite.

original: saṃsāre ca hīnādhimuktikāḥ /
analyzed: saṃsāre ca hīna adhimuktikāḥ
translated: And we were inclined to the inferior in the world.

original: tato vayaṃ bhagavatā bahūn dharmān pratyavarān saṃkāradhānasadṛśānanuvicintayitāḥ /
analyzed: tatas vayam bhagavatā bahūn dharmān pratyavarān saṃkāra dhāna sadṛśān anuvicintayitāḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One made us think about many inferior things, like a heap of rubbish.

original: teṣu cāsma prayuktā ghaṭamānā vyāyacchamānāḥ /
analyzed: teṣu ca āsma prayuktāḥ ghaṭamānāḥ vyāyacchamānāḥ
translated: And we have applied ourselves to them, exerted ourselves, and struggled.

original: nirvāṇamātraṃ ca vayaṃ bhagavan divasamudrāmiva paryeṣamāṇā mārgāmaḥ /
analyzed: nirvāṇa mātram ca vayam bhagavan divasa mudrām iva paryeṣamāṇāḥ mārgāmaḥ
translated: We have sought nirvāṇa, Blessed One, as if it were the sun’s orb.

original: tena ca vayaṃ bhagavan nirvāṇena pratilabdhena tuṣṭā bhavāmaḥ /
analyzed: tena ca vayam bhagavat nirvāṇena pratilabdhena tuṣṭāḥ bhavāmaḥ
translated: And, Blessed One, having attained that nirvāṇa, we are satisfied.

original: bahu ca labdhamiti manyāmahe tathāgatasyāntikāt eṣu dharmeṣvabhiyuktā ghaṭitvā vyāyamitvā /
analyzed: bahu ca labdham iti manyāmahe tathāgatasya antikāt eṣu dharmeṣu abhiyuktāḥ ghaṭitvā vyāyamitvā
translated: We think that we have obtained much from the Tathāgata by applying ourselves to these teachings, exerting ourselves, and struggling.

original: prajānāti ca tathāgato 'smākaṃ hīnādhimuktikatām /
analyzed: prajānāti ca tathāgataḥ smākam hīna adhimuktika tām
translated: And the Tathāgata knows our inferior aspiration.

original: tataśca bhagavānasmānupekṣate /
analyzed: tatas ca bhagavān asmān upekṣate
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, the Blessed One ignores us.

original: na saṃbhinatti /
analyzed: na saṃbhinatti
translated: He does not break through to us.

original: nācaṣṭe yo 'yaṃ tathāgatasya jñānakośaḥ /
analyzed: na ācaṣṭe yaḥ yam tathāgatasya jñāna kośaḥ
translated: He does not explain to us this treasure of the Tathāgata’s knowledge.

original: eṣa eva yuṣmākaṃ bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: eṣaḥ eva yuṣmākam bhaviṣyati iti
translated: He says, ‘This will be yours.’

original: bhagavāṃścāsmākamupāyakauśalyena asmiṃstathāgatajñānakośe dāyādān saṃsthāpayati /
analyzed: bhagavān ca asmākam upāya kauśalyena asmin tathāgata jñāna kośe dāyādān saṃsthāpayati
translated: And the Blessed One, through skillful means, establishes us as heirs to this treasure of the Tathāgata’s knowledge.

original: niḥspṛhāśca vayaṃ bhagavan /
analyzed: niḥspṛhāḥ ca vayam bhagavan
translated: We are without desire, Blessed One.

original: tata evaṃ jānīma etadevāsmākaṃ bahukaraṃ yadvayaṃ tathāgatasyāntikāddivasamudrāmiva nirvāṇaṃ pratilabhāmahe /
analyzed: tatas evam jānīma etat eva asmākam bahukaram yat vayam tathāgatasya antikāt divasamudrām iva nirvāṇam pratilabhāmahe
translated: Therefore we know this: ‘It is very beneficial for us that we obtain nirvāṇa from the Tathāgata as if it were the sun’s orb.’

original: te vayaṃ bhagavan bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ tathāgatajñānadarśanamārabhya udārāṃ dharmadeśanāṃ kurmaḥ /
analyzed: te vayam bhagavan bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tathāgata jñāna darśanam ārabhya udārām dharma deśanām kurmaḥ
translated: “Therefore, Blessed One, we teach the Dharma extensively to bodhisattva mahāsattvas, beginning with the vision of the Tathāgata’s wisdom.

original: tathāgatajñānaṃ vivarāmo darśayāma upadarśayāmaḥ /
analyzed: tathāgata jñānam vivarāmaḥ darśayāmaḥ upadarśayāmaḥ
translated: We reveal, show, and point out the Tathāgata’s wisdom.

original: vayaṃ bhagavaṃstato niḥspṛhāḥ samānāḥ /
analyzed: vayam bhagavan tatas niḥspṛhāḥ samānāḥ
translated: Blessed One, we are free from desire for that.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: upāyakauśalyena tathāgato 'smākamadhimuktiṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: upāya kauśalyena tathāgataḥ smākam adhimuktim prajānāti
translated: The Tathāgata knows our inclinations through skillful means.

original: tacca vayaṃ na jānīmo na budhyāmahe yadidaṃ bhagavatā etarhi kathitam yathā vayaṃ bhagavato bhūtāḥ putrāḥ /
analyzed: tat ca vayam na jānīmaḥ na budhyāmahe yat idam bhagavatā etarhi kathitam yathā vayam bhagavataḥ bhūtāḥ putrāḥ
translated: We do not know or understand that, as the Blessed One has just said, that we are truly the sons of the Blessed One.

original: bhagavāṃścāsmākaṃ smārayati tathāgatajñānadāyādān /
analyzed: bhagavān ca asmākam smārayati tathāgata jñāna dāyādān
translated: And the Blessed One reminds us of the inheritance of the Tathāgata’s wisdom.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: yathāpi nāma vayaṃ tathāgatasya bhūtāḥ putrāḥ iti /
analyzed: yathā api nāma vayam tathāgatasya bhūtāḥ putrāḥ iti
translated: It is because we are truly the sons of the Tathāgata.

original: api tu khalu punarhīnādhimuktāḥ /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar hīna adhimuktāḥ
translated: However, we have inferior inclinations.

original: saced bhagavānasmākaṃ paśyedadhimuktibalam /
analyzed: saced bhagavān asmākam paśyet adhimukti balam
translated: If the Blessed One were to see our strength of inclination,

original: bodhisattvaśabdaṃ bhagavānasmākamudāharet /
analyzed: bodhisattva śabdam bhagavān asmākam udāharet
translated: the Blessed One would pronounce the word ‘bodhisattva’ for us.

original: vayaṃ punarbhagavatā dve kārye kārāpitāḥ bodhisattvānāṃ cāgrato hīnādhimuktikā ityuktāḥ /
analyzed: vayam punar bhagavatā dve kārye kārāpitāḥ bodhisattvānām ca agratas hīna adhimuktikāḥ iti uktāḥ
translated: But we, O Blessed One, have been made to do two things by the Blessed One: we have been declared to have inferior aspirations in the presence of the Bodhisattvas,

original: te codārāyāṃ buddhabodhau samādāpitāḥ /
analyzed: te ca udārāyām buddha bodhau samādāpitāḥ
translated: and we have been inspired with the lofty enlightenment of the Buddhas.

original: asmākaṃ cedānīṃ bhagavānadhimuktibalaṃ jñātvā idamudāhṛtavān /
analyzed: asmākam ca idānīm bhagavān adhimukti balam jñātvā idam udāhṛtavān
translated: Now the Blessed One, knowing our strength of aspiration, has uttered this.

original: anena vayaṃ bhagavan paryāyeṇaivaṃ vadāmaḥ sahasaivāsmābhirniḥspṛhairākāṅkṣitamamārgitamaparyeṣitamacintitamaprārthitaṃ
analyzed: anena vayam bhagavan paryāyeṇa evam vadāmaḥ sahasā eva asmābhiḥ niḥspṛhaiḥ ākāṅkṣitam a mārgitam a paryeṣitam a cintitam a prārthitam
translated: By this method, Blessed One, we say: Suddenly, without desire, without seeking, without searching, without thinking, without wishing,

original: sarvajñatāratnaṃ pratilabdhaṃ yathāpīdaṃ tathāgatasya putraiḥ //
analyzed: sarvajña tā ratnam pratilabdham yathā api idam tathāgatasya putraiḥ
translated: we have obtained the jewel of omniscience, just like the sons of the Tathagata.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān mahākāśyapastasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣat
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān mahākāśyapaḥ tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣat
translated: Then the venerable Mahakasyapa, at that time, spoke these verses:

original: āścaryabhūtāḥ sma tathādbhutāśca audbilyaprāptāḥ sma śruṇitva ghoṣam /
analyzed: āścarya bhūtāḥ sma tathā adbhutāḥ ca audbilya prāptāḥ sma ghoṣam
translated: We are wondrous and marvelous, and have attained joy upon hearing the sound.

original: sahasaiva asmābhirayaṃ tathādya manojñaghoṣaḥ śrutu nāyakasya // / //
analyzed: sahasā eva asmābhiḥ ayam tathā adya manojña ghoṣaḥ nāyakasya
translated: Suddenly, today, we have heard this delightful voice of the guide.

original: viśiṣṭaratnāna mahantarāśirmuhūrtamātreṇayamadya labdhaḥ /
analyzed: mahanta rāśiḥ muhūrta mātreṇa ayam adya labdhaḥ
translated: In just a moment, today, we have obtained this great heap of precious things.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Physician

original: na cintito nāpi kadāci prārthitastaṃ śrutva āścaryagatāḥ sma sarve // / //
analyzed: na cintitaḥ na api kadācid prārthitaḥ tam śrutvā āścarya gatāḥ sma sarve
translated: We were all amazed to hear it, for it was not thought of or ever desired.

original: yathāpi bālaḥ puruṣo bhaveta utplāvito bālajanena santaḥ /
analyzed: yathā api bālaḥ puruṣaḥ bhaveta utplāvitaḥ bāla janena santaḥ
translated: Just as if there were a young boy, a youth, who was pampered by the people,

original: pituḥ sakāśātu apakrameta anyaṃ ca deśaṃ vraji so sudūram // / //
analyzed: pituḥ sakāśātu apakrameta anyam ca deśam su dūram
translated: And would run away from his father, and go to another country, far away.

original: pitā ca taṃ śocati tasmi kāle palāyitaṃ jñātva svakaṃ hi putram /
analyzed: pitā ca tam śocati tasmi kāle palāyitam jñātvā svakam hi putram
translated: And the father would grieve at that time, knowing that his own son had run away,

original: śocantu so digvidiśāsu añce varṣāṇi pañcāśadanūnakāni // / //
analyzed: śocantu saḥ diś vidiśāsu añce varṣāṇi pañcāśat anūnakāni
translated: And he would grieve, looking in all directions, for fifty years without fail.

original: tathā ca so putra gaveṣamāṇo anyaṃ mahantaṃ nagaraṃ hi gatvā /
analyzed: tathā ca saḥ putra gaveṣamāṇaḥ anyam mahantam nagaram hi gatvā
translated: And so, searching for his son, he would go to another great city,

original: niveśanaṃ māpiya tatra tiṣṭhet samarpito kāmugaṇehi pañcabhiḥ // / //
analyzed: niveśanam tatra tiṣṭhet pañcabhiḥ
translated: And having built a house there, he would live there, attended by the five groups of desire.

original: bahuṃ hiraṇyaṃ ca suvarṇarūpyaṃ dhānyaṃ dhanaṃ śaṅkhaśilāpravālam /
analyzed: bahum hiraṇyam ca suvarṇa rūpyam dhānyam dhanam śaṅkha śilā pravālam
translated: Much gold, silver, and coins, grain, wealth, conch shells, crystals, and coral,

original: hastī ca aśvāśca padātayaśca gāvaḥ paśūścaiva tathaiḍakāśca // / //
analyzed: hastī ca aśvāḥ ca padātayaḥ ca gāvaḥ paśūḥ ca eva tathā eḍakāḥ ca
translated: Elephants, horses, foot soldiers, cows, and goats and sheep,

original: prayoga āyoga tathaiva kṣetrā dāsī ca dāsā bahu preṣyavargaḥ /
analyzed: prayoga āyoga tathā eva kṣetrāḥ dāsī ca dāsāḥ bahu preṣya vargaḥ
translated: Agriculture, trade, and likewise fields, female and male slaves, and a large retinue of servants,

original: susatkṛtaḥ prāṇisahasrakoṭibhī rājñaśca so vallabhu nityakālam // / //
analyzed: su satkṛtaḥ prāṇi sahasra koṭibhiḥ rājñaḥ ca saḥ vallabhu nityakālam
translated: He is well-honored by billions of beings, and is always the king's favorite.

original: kṛtāñjalī tasya bhavanti nāgarā grāmeṣu ye cāpi vasanti grāmiṇaḥ /
analyzed: kṛta añjalī tasya bhavanti nāgarāḥ grāmeṣu ye ca api vasanti grāmiṇaḥ
translated: The city-dwellers and villagers who live in the villages all have folded palms towards him.

original: bahuvāṇijāstasya vrajanti antike bahūhi kāryehi kṛtādhikārāḥ // / //
