analyzed: bahu vāṇijāḥ tasya vrajanti antike bahuhi kāryehi kṛta adhikārāḥ
translated: Many merchants who have done him favors come to him for various needs.

original: etādṛśo ṛddhimato naraḥ syājjīrṇaśca vṛddhaśca mahallakaśca /
analyzed: etādṛśaḥ ṛddhimataḥ naraḥ syāt jīrṇaḥ ca vṛddhaḥ ca mahallakaḥ ca
translated: Such would be the prosperity of that man, who is old, aged, and decrepit.

original: sa putraśokaṃ anucintayantaḥ kṣapeya rātriṃdiva nityakālam // / //
analyzed: sa putra śokam anucintayantaḥ kṣapeya rātriṃdiva nityakālam
translated: He would spend day and night constantly thinking about the sorrow of his son.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: sa tādṛśo durmati mahya putraḥ pañcāśa varṣāṇi tadā palānakaḥ /
analyzed: sa tādṛśaḥ putraḥ pañcāśa varṣāṇi tadā palānakaḥ
translated: That son of mine, so unwise, was then Palāyana for fifty years.

original: ayaṃ ca kośo vipulo mamāsti kālakriyā co mama pratyupasthitā // / //
analyzed: ayam ca kośaḥ vipulaḥ mama asti kālakriyā mama pratyupasthitā
translated: And this vast treasure of mine is here, and the time of my death has come.

original: so cāpi bālo tada tasya putro daridrakaḥ kṛpaṇaku nityakālam /
analyzed: tasya putraḥ daridrakaḥ
translated: And that son of his, the foolish one, was always poor and miserable.

original: grāmeṇa grāmaṃ anucaṃkramantaḥ paryeṣate bhakta athāpi colam // / //
analyzed: grāmeṇa grāmam anucaṃkramantaḥ paryeṣate bhakta atha api colam
translated: Wandering from village to village, he sought for food and clothing.

original: paryeṣamāṇo 'pi kadāci kiṃcillabheta kiṃcit puna naiva kiṃcit /
analyzed: paryeṣamāṇaḥ pi kadācid kiṃcid labheta kiṃcid punar na eva kiṃcid
translated: Even when seeking, he sometimes found a little, and sometimes nothing at all.

original: sa śuṣyate paraśaraṇeṣu bālo dadrūya kaṇḍūya ca digdhagātraḥ // / //
analyzed: sa śuṣyate para śaraṇeṣu bālaḥ dadrūya kaṇḍūya ca digdha gātraḥ
translated: That fool dries up in the houses of others, his body covered with scabs and itching.

original: so ca vrajettaṃ nagaraṃ yahiṃ pitā anupūrvaśo tatra gato bhaveta /
analyzed: saḥ ca vrajet tam nagaram yahim pitā tatra gataḥ bhaveta
translated: And he would go to that city where his father was, and in due course he would arrive there.

original: bhaktaṃ ca colaṃ ca gaveṣamāṇo niveśanaṃ yatra pituḥ svakasya // / //
analyzed: bhaktam ca colam ca gaveṣamāṇaḥ niveśanam yatra pituḥ svakasya
translated: Seeking food and clothing, to the house of his own father.

original: so cāpi āḍhyaḥ puruṣo mahādhano dvārasmi siṃhāsani saṃniṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ ca api āḍhyaḥ puruṣaḥ mahādhanaḥ siṃhāsani saṃniṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: And that wealthy man, the very rich man, was seated on a lion throne at the door,

original: parivāritaḥ prāṇiśatairanekairvitāna tasyā vitato 'ntarīkṣe // / //
analyzed: parivāritaḥ prāṇi śataiḥ anekaiḥ vitāna tasyāḥ vitataḥ ntarīkṣe
translated: Surrounded by many hundreds of living beings, a canopy spread over him in the sky.

original: āpto janaścāsya samantataḥ sthito dhanaṃ hiraṇyaṃ ca gaṇenti kecit /
analyzed: āptaḥ janaḥ ca asya samantataḥ sthitaḥ dhanam hiraṇyam ca gaṇenti kecid
translated: And his people were standing all around, some counting his wealth and gold,

original: kecittu lekhānapi lekhayanti kecit prayogaṃ ca prayojayanti // / //
analyzed: kecid tu lekhān api lekhayanti kecid prayogam ca prayojayanti
translated: Some were writing letters, some were making preparations.

original: so cā daridro tahi etu dṛṣṭvā vibhūṣitaṃ gṛhapatino niveśanam /
analyzed: saḥ cā daridraḥ dṛṣṭvā vibhūṣitam gṛhapatinaḥ niveśanam
translated: And that poor man, having seen there the house of the householder adorned,

original: kahiṃ nu adya ahamatra āgato rājā ayaṃ bheṣyati rājamātraḥ // / //
analyzed: kahim nu adya aham atra āgataḥ rājā ayam rājamātraḥ
translated: Where have I come to today? This must be a king or a king's minister.

original: mā dāni doṣaṃ pi labheyamatra gṛhṇitva veṣṭiṃ pi ca kārayeyam /
analyzed: mā dāni doṣam pi labheyam atra gṛhṇitvā veṣṭim pi ca kārayeyam
translated: Let me not incur any blame here, having taken a cloak and having it made.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: anucintayantaḥ sa palāyate naro daridravīthīṃ paripṛcchamānaḥ // / //
analyzed: anucintayantaḥ sa palāyate naraḥ daridra vīthīm paripṛcchamānaḥ
translated: And thinking about it, the man runs away, wandering through the streets of the poor.

original: so cā dhanī taṃ svaku putra dṛṣṭvā siṃhāsanasthaśca bhavet prahṛṣṭaḥ /🔽sa dūtakān preṣayi tasya antike ānetha etaṃ puruṣaṃ daridram // / //
analyzed: dhanī tam dṛṣṭvā siṃhāsana sthaḥ ca bhavet prahṛṣṭaḥ  sa dūtakān preṣayi tasya antike ānetha etam puruṣam daridram
translated: And the rich man, seeing his own son sitting on a lion throne, would be delighted.🔽He would send messengers to him, saying, Bring this poor man here.

original: samanantaraṃ tehi gṛhītu so naro gṛhītamātro 'tha ca mūrccha gacchet /
analyzed: samanantaram saḥ naraḥ gṛhīta mātraḥ ca gacchet
translated: As soon as the man is seized, he would faint.

original: dhrūvaṃ khu mahyaṃ vadhakā upasthitāḥ kiṃ mahya colenatha bhojanena vā // / //
analyzed: dhrūvam khu mahyam vadhakāḥ upasthitāḥ kim bhojanena vā
translated: Surely, the executioners have come for me. What is the use of clothes or food for me?

original: dṛṣṭvā ca so paṇḍitu taṃ mahādhanī hīnādhimukto ayu bāla durmatiḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca saḥ tam mahā dhanī hīna adhimuktaḥ bāla durmatiḥ
translated: The wise and very rich man, seeing that the foolish one, attached to inferior things,

original: na śraddadhī mahyamimāṃ vibhūṣitāṃ pitā mamāyaṃ ti na cāpi śraddadhīt // / //🔽puruṣāṃśca so tatra prayojayeta vaṅkāśca ye kāṇaka kuṇṭhakāśca /
analyzed: na śraddadhī mahyam imām vibhūṣitām pitā mama ayam na ca api śraddadhīt  puruṣān ca saḥ tatra prayojayeta vaṅkāḥ ca ye kāṇaka kuṇṭhakāḥ ca
translated: would not believe that I am his father, and would not believe even if I said so.🔽And he would employ men there, hunchbacks, one-eyed people, and lame people,

original: kucelakāḥ kṛṣṇaka hīnasattvāḥ paryeṣathā taṃ naru karmakārakam // / //
analyzed: ku celakāḥ kṛṣṇaka hīna sattvāḥ paryeṣathāḥ tam naru karma kārakam
translated: poorly dressed, dark, of low character, to search for that man who would be a laborer.

original: saṃkāradhānaṃ imu mahya pūtikamuccāraprasrāvavināśitaṃ ca /
analyzed: saṃkāra dhānam ca
translated: This heap of rubbish is foul-smelling to me, destroyed by urine and excrement.

original: taṃ śodhanārthāya karohi karma dviguṇaṃ ca te vetanakaṃ pradāsye // / //
analyzed: tam śodhana arthāya karohi karma dviguṇam ca te vetanakam pradāsye
translated: For the purpose of cleaning it, you should do the work, and I will give you double wages.

original: etādṛśaṃ ghoṣa śruṇitva so naro āgatya saṃśodhayi taṃ pradeśam /
analyzed: etādṛśam saḥ naraḥ āgatya tam pradeśam
translated: Having heard such a voice, that man would come and clean that place.

original: tatraiva so āvasathaṃ ca kuryānniveśanasyopalikuñcike 'smin // / //
analyzed: tatra eva saḥ āvasatham ca kuryāt niveśanasya upali kuñcike smin
translated: He would also make a dwelling right there, in this little cave of the house.

original: so cā dhanī taṃ puruṣaṃ nirīkṣed gavākṣaolokanake 'pi nityam /
analyzed: saḥ cā dhanī tam puruṣam nirīkṣet nityam
translated: And the rich man would always watch that man through a window,

original: hīnādhimukto ayu mahya putraḥ saṃkāradhānaṃ śucikaṃ karoti // / //
analyzed: putraḥ saṃkāra dhānam śucikam karoti
translated: thinking, This son of mine is of low aspiration, he makes a clean place out of the garbage heap.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: sa otaritvā piṭakaṃ gṛhītvā malināni vastrāṇi ca prāvaritvā /
analyzed: saḥ otaritvā piṭakam gṛhītvā malināni vastrāṇi ca prāvaritvā
translated: He would descend, take a basket, and put on dirty clothes.

original: upasaṃkramettasya narasya antike avabhartsayanto na karotha karma // / //
analyzed: upasaṃkramet tasya narasya antike avabhartsayantaḥ na karotha karma
translated: He would approach that man, scolding him, saying, You are not doing your work.

original: dviguṇaṃ ca te vetanakaṃ dadāmi dviguṇāṃ ca bhūyastatha pādamrakṣaṇam /
analyzed: dviguṇam ca te vetanakam dadāmi dviguṇām ca pāda mrakṣaṇam
translated: I will give you double wages, and also double the foot-washing,

original: saloṇabhaktaṃ ca dadāmi tubhya śākaṃ ca śāṭiṃ ca punardadāmi // / //
analyzed: sa loṇa bhaktam ca dadāmi śākam ca śāṭim ca punar dadāmi
translated: and I will give you salted food, and also give you vegetables and a cloth.

original: evaṃ ca taṃ bhartsiya tasmi kāle saṃśleṣayettaṃ punareva paṇḍitaḥ /
analyzed: evam ca tam tasmin kāle saṃśleṣayet tam punar eva paṇḍitaḥ
translated: And at that time, having scolded him in this way, the wise one would reconcile him again.

original: suṣṭhuṃ khalū karma karoṣi atra putro 'si vyaktaṃ mama nātra saṃśayaḥ // / //
analyzed: khalu karma karoṣi atra vyaktam mama na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: You are indeed doing your work well here. It is clear that you are my son, there is no doubt about this.

original: sa stokastokaṃ ca gṛhaṃ praveśayet karmaṃ ca kārāpayi taṃ manuṣyam /
analyzed: sa stoka stokam ca gṛham praveśayet karmam ca kārāpayi tam manuṣyam
translated: He would gradually lead him into the house and make him do work.

original: viṃśacca varṣāṇi supūritāni krameṇa viśrambhayi taṃ naraṃ saḥ // / //
analyzed: viṃśat ca varṣāṇi su pūritāni krameṇa tam naram saḥ
translated: For twenty years he would fully satisfy that man, and gradually gain his trust.

original: hiraṇyu so mauktiku sphāṭikaṃ ca pratisāmayettatra niveśanasmin /
analyzed: ca sphāṭikam
translated: He would give him gold, pearls, and crystal in that house.

original: sarvaṃ ca so saṃgaṇanāṃ karoti arthaṃ ca sarvaṃ anucintayeta // / //🔽bahirdhā so tasya niveśanasya kuṭikāya eko vasamānu bālaḥ /
analyzed: sarvam ca saḥ saṃgaṇanām karoti artham ca sarvam anucintayeta  bahirdhā saḥ tasya niveśanasya kuṭikāya ekaḥ bālaḥ
translated: He would count everything and consider all the wealth.

original: daridracintāmanucintayeta na me 'sti etādṛśa bhoga kecit // / //
analyzed: daridra cintām anucintayeta na me sti etādṛśa bhoga kecid
translated: Outside that house, in a small hut, he would live alone, thinking like a poor man: I have no such possessions at all.

original: jñātvā ca so tasya imevarūpamudārasaṃjñābhigato mi putraḥ /
analyzed: jñātvā ca saḥ tasya putraḥ
translated: Knowing that his son had such a high opinion of himself,

original: sa ānayitvā suhṛjñātisaṃghaṃ niryātayiṣyāmyahu sarvamartham // / //
analyzed: saḥ ānayitvā suhṛd jñāti saṃgham niryātayiṣyāmi ahu sarvam artham
translated: he would bring together a group of friends and relatives and give them all his wealth.

original: rājāna so naigamanāgarāṃśca samānayitvā bahuvāṇijāṃśca /
analyzed: rājāna saḥ naigama nāgarān ca samānayitvā bahu vāṇijān ca
translated: He would summon the king, the citizens and country people, and many merchants,

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: uvāca evaṃ pariṣāya madhye putro mamāyaṃ cira vipranaṣṭakaḥ // / //
analyzed: uvāca evam madhye putraḥ mama ayam cira vipranaṣṭakaḥ
translated: In the middle of the assembly, 'This is my son, who was lost for a long time.'

original: pañcāśa varṣāṇi supūrṇakāni anye ca 'to viṃśatiye mi dṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: pañcāśa varṣāṇi supūrṇakāni anye ca dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: 'For fifty full years and twenty more, I have been looking for him.

original: amukātu nagarātu mamaiṣa naṣṭo ahaṃ ca mārganta ihaivamāgataḥ // / //
analyzed: mama eṣa naṣṭaḥ aham ca mārgantaḥ iha evam āgataḥ
translated: He was lost in such and such a city, and I, searching for him, have come here.'

original: sarvasya dravyasya ayaṃ prabhurme etasya niryātayi sarvaśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: sarvasya dravyasya ayam prabhuḥ me etasya sarvaśeṣataḥ
translated: 'He is the master of all my wealth. I give him everything that remains.

original: karotu kāryaṃ ca piturdhanena sarvaṃ kuṭumbaṃ ca dadāmi etat // / //
analyzed: karotu kāryam ca pituḥ dhanena sarvam kuṭumbam ca dadāmi etat
translated: Let him do his work with his father's wealth. I give him this entire family.'

original: āścaryaprāptaśca bhavennaro 'sau daridrabhāvaṃ purimaṃ smaritvā /
analyzed: āścarya prāptaḥ ca sau daridra bhāvam pur imam smaritvā
translated: 'That man would be filled with wonder, remembering his former state of poverty.

original: hīnādhimuktiṃ ca pituśca tān guṇāṃllabdhvā kuṭumbaṃ sukhito 'smi adya // / //
analyzed: hīna adhimuktim ca pituḥ ca tān guṇān labdhvā kuṭumbam sukhitaḥ smi adya
translated: Remembering his inferior aspirations and his father's qualities, having obtained the family, he is happy today.'

original: tathaiva cāsmāka vināyakena hīnādhimuktitva vijāniyāna /
analyzed: tathā eva ca asmāka vināyakena
translated: 'In the same way, the Guide, knowing our inferior aspirations,

original: na śrāvitaṃ buddha bhaviṣyatheti yūyaṃ kila śrāvaka mahya putrāḥ // / //
analyzed: na śrāvitam buddha bhaviṣyatha iti yūyam kila śrāvaka putrāḥ
translated: did not proclaim, You will become Buddhas. He said, You are my disciples, my sons.

original: asmāṃśca adhyeṣati lokanātho ye prasthitā uttamamagrabodhim /
analyzed: asmān ca adhyeṣati lokanāthaḥ ye prasthitāḥ uttamam agra bodhim
translated: 'And the Lord of the World exhorts us, those who have set out for supreme, highest enlightenment,

original: teṣāṃ vade kāśyapa mārga nuttaraṃ yaṃ mārga bhāvitva bhaveyu buddhāḥ // / //
analyzed: teṣām vade kāśyapa yam mārga bhaveyu buddhāḥ
translated: I will teach them the unsurpassed path, O Kāśyapa, by cultivating which path they will become Buddhas.

original: vayaṃ ca teṣāṃ sugatena preṣitā bahubodhisattvāna mahābalānām /
analyzed: vayam ca teṣām sugatena preṣitāḥ mahā balānām
translated: We, sent by that Sugata, to many powerful Bodhisattvas,

original: anuttaraṃ mārga pradarśayāma dṛṣṭāntahetūnayutāna koṭibhiḥ // / //
analyzed: anuttaram mārga pradarśayāma koṭibhiḥ
translated: Display the unsurpassed path with countless millions of parables and reasons.

original: śrutvā ca asmāku jinasya putrā bodhāya bhāventi sumārgamagryam /
analyzed: śrutvā ca jinasya putrāḥ bodhāya su mārgam agryam
translated: Having heard from us, the sons of the Jina, they cultivate the supreme path for enlightenment,

original: te vyākriyante ca kṣaṇasmi tasmin bhaviṣyathā buddha imasmi loke // / //
analyzed: te vyākriyante ca tasmin bhaviṣyathāḥ buddha imasmi loke
translated: And in that very moment they are prophesied: 'You will become Buddhas in this world.'

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: etādṛśaṃ karma karoma tāyinaḥ saṃrakṣamāṇā ima dharmakośam /
analyzed: etādṛśam karma karoma tāyinaḥ saṃrakṣamāṇāḥ dharma kośam
translated: We perform such an action for the Protector, preserving this treasure of the Dharma,

original: prakāśayantaśca jinātmajānāṃ vaiśvāsikastasya yathā naraḥ saḥ // / //
analyzed: prakāśayantaḥ ca jina ātmajānām vaiśvāsikaḥ tasya yathā naraḥ saḥ
translated: And we illuminate it for the sons of the Jina, just as a man has full confidence in it.

original: daridracintāśca vicintayāma viśrāṇayanto imu buddhakośam /
analyzed: daridra cintāḥ ca vicintayāma buddhakośam
translated: We think of the poor, distributing this treasure of the Buddha,

original: na caiva prārthema jinasya jñānaṃ jinasya jñānaṃ ca prakāśayāmaḥ // / //
analyzed: na ca eva prārthema jinasya jñānam jinasya jñānam ca prakāśayāmaḥ
translated: But we do not aspire for the knowledge of the Jina, we proclaim the knowledge of the Jina.

original: pratyātmikīṃ nirvṛti kalpayāma etāvatā jñānamidaṃ na bhūyaḥ /
analyzed: pratyātmikīm nirvṛti kalpayāmaḥ etāvatā jñānam idam na bhūyaḥ
translated: We imagine personal nirvāṇa, thinking 'This much is knowledge, no more,'

original: nāsmāka harṣo 'pi kadācia bhoti kṣetreṣu buddhāna śruṇitva vyūhān // / //
analyzed: na asmāka harṣaḥ pi kadācid bhoti kṣetreṣu buddhāna vyūhān
translated: We never had any joy when we heard about the Buddha-fields of the Buddhas.

original: śāntāḥ kilā sarvimi dharmanāsravā nirodhautpādavivarjitāśca /
analyzed: śāntāḥ dharma nāsravāḥ nirodha autpāda vivarjitāḥ ca
translated: All these dharmas are indeed empty, peaceful, signless, wishless, free from strife, free from thought, unborn, unceasing, free from defilement, free from purification.

original: na cātra kaścidbhavatīha dharmo evaṃ tu cintetva na bhoti śraddhā // / //
analyzed: na ca atra kaścid bhavati iha dharmaḥ evam tu na bhoti śraddhā
translated: When we reflect in this way, we do not have faith.

original: suniḥspṛhā smā vaya dīrgharātraṃ bauddhasya jñānasya anuttarasya /
analyzed: su niḥspṛhā smā dīrgharātram bauddhasya jñānasya anuttarasya
translated: For a long time we have had no desire for the unsurpassed knowledge of the Buddha.

original: praṇidhānamasmāka na jātu tatra iyaṃ parā niṣṭha jinena uktā // / //
analyzed: na jātu tatra iyam parā niṣṭha jinena uktā
translated: We never made any aspiration for that. This is the highest point taught by the Victorious One.

original: nirvāṇaparyanti samucchraye 'smin paribhāvitā śūnyata dīrgharātram /
analyzed: nirvāṇa paryanti samucchraye smin paribhāvitā śūnyata dīrgharātram
translated: In this world, which is limited by nirvana, we have contemplated emptiness for a long time.

original: parimukta traidhātukaduḥkhapīḍitāḥ kṛtaṃ ca asmābhi jinasya śāsanam // / //
analyzed: parimukta traidhātuka duḥkha pīḍitāḥ kṛtam ca asmābhi jinasya śāsanam
translated: We are liberated from the suffering and distress of the three realms, and we have fulfilled the teachings of the Victorious One.

original: yaṃ hi prakāśema jinātmajānāṃ ye prasthitā bhonti ihāgrabodhau /
analyzed: yam hi prakāśema jina ātmajānām ye prasthitāḥ bhonti iha agra bodhau
translated: Whatever we might teach to the offspring of the Victorious Ones who are dedicated to supreme enlightenment here,

original: teṣāṃ ca yatkiṃci vadāma dharmaṃ spṛha tatra asmāka na jātu bhoti // / //
analyzed: teṣām ca yat kiṃci vadāma dharmam spṛha tatra asmāka na jātu
translated: we never have any desire for that Dharma which we might teach them.

original: taṃ cāsma lokācariyaḥ svayaṃbhūrupekṣate kālamavekṣamāṇaḥ /
analyzed: tam ca āsma svayaṃbhūḥ upekṣate kālam avekṣamāṇaḥ
translated: And that self-arisen world teacher, who looks at the right time, overlooks us.

original: na bhāṣate bhūtapadārthasaṃdhiṃ adhimuktimasmāku gaveṣamāṇaḥ // / //🔽Vaidya
analyzed: na bhāṣate bhūta padārtha saṃdhim adhimuktim asmāku gaveṣamāṇaḥ  vaidya
translated: He does not teach the connection between real things, Seeking our aspiration.

original: upāyakauśalya yathaiva tasya mahādhanasya puruṣasya kāle /
analyzed: upāya kauśalya yathā eva tasya mahādhanasya puruṣasya kāle
translated: The skillful means of that man of great wealth, at the right time,

original: hīnādhimuktaṃ satataṃ dameti damiyāna cāsmai pradadāti vittam // / //
analyzed: hīna adhimuktam satatam ca asmai pradadāti vittam
translated: Always tames those with inferior aspirations, and having tamed them, he gives them wealth.

original: suduṣkaraṃ kurvati lokanātho upāyakauśalya prakāśayantaḥ /
analyzed: su duṣkaram kurvati upāya kauśalya prakāśayantaḥ
translated: The Lord of the World performs a very difficult task, manifesting skillful means,

original: hīnādhimuktān damayantu putrān dametva ca jñānamidaṃ dadāti // / //
analyzed: hīna adhimuktān damayantu putrān ca jñānam idam dadāti
translated: In order to tame the sons with inferior aspirations, and having tamed them, he gives them this knowledge.

original: āścaryaprāptāḥ sahasā sma adya yathā daridro labhiyāna vittam /
analyzed: āścarya prāptāḥ sahasā sma adya yathā daridraḥ vittam
translated: We are suddenly astonished today, as if a poor man had obtained wealth,

original: phalaṃ ca prāptaṃ iha buddhāśāsane prathamaṃ viśiṣṭaṃ ca anāsravaṃ ca // / //
analyzed: phalam ca prāptam iha buddha āśāsane prathamam viśiṣṭam ca anāsravam ca
translated: And attained the fruit in this teaching of the Buddha, which is foremost and undefiled.

original: yacchīlamasmābhi ca dīrgharātraṃ saṃrakṣitaṃ lokavidusya śāsane /
analyzed: ca dīrgharātram saṃrakṣitam śāsane
translated: The morality that we have guarded for a long time in the teaching of the Knower of the World,

original: asmābhi labdhaṃ phalamadya tasya śīlasya pūrvaṃ caritasya nātha // / //
analyzed: asmābhi labdham phalam adya tasya śīlasya pūrvam caritasya nātha
translated: We have obtained the fruit of that today, O Lord, of that morality and former practice.

original: yad brahmacaryaṃ paramaṃ viśuddhaṃ niṣevitaṃ śāsani nāyakasya /
analyzed: yat brahmacaryam paramam viśuddham niṣevitam śāsani nāyakasya
translated: The supreme and pure spiritual practice that has been followed in the teaching of the Guide,

original: tasyo viśiṣṭaṃ phalamadya labdhaṃ śāntaṃ udāraṃ ca anāsravaṃ ca // / //
analyzed: tasya u viśiṣṭam phalam adya labdham śāntam udāram ca anāsravam ca
translated: Today you have attained the excellent result, which is peaceful, vast, and free from defilements.

original: adyo vayaṃ śrāvakabhūta nātha saṃśrāvayiṣyāmatha cāgrabodhim /
analyzed: adyas vayam śrāvaka bhūta nātha saṃśrāvayiṣyām atha ca agra bodhim
translated: Today we have become the disciples of the Lord and will proclaim the supreme enlightenment.

original: bodhīya śabdaṃ ca prakāśayāmasteno vayaṃ śrāvaka bhīṣmakalpāḥ // / //
analyzed: śabdam ca prakāśayāmaḥ tena u vayam śrāvaka bhīṣma kalpāḥ
translated: We will proclaim the sound of enlightenment, and therefore we are like the fearful disciples.

original: arhantabhūtā vayamadya nātha arhāmahe pūja sadevakātaḥ /
analyzed: vayam adya nātha arhāmahe pūja
translated: Today we have become Arhats, O Lord, and are worthy of worship from the world with its gods,

original: lokātsamārātu sabrahmakātaḥ sarveṣa sattvāna ca antikātaḥ // / //
analyzed: sa brahmakātaḥ sarveṣa sattvāna
translated: from the world with its Maras, from the world with its Brahmas, and from all beings.

original: ko nāma śaktaḥ pratikartu tubhyamudyuktarūpo bahukalpakoṭyaḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ nāma śaktaḥ pratikartu tubhyam udyukta rūpaḥ bahu kalpa koṭyaḥ
translated: Who is able to repay you, even if they were to strive for many millions of eons?

original: suduṣkarāṇīdṛśakā karoṣi suduṣkarān yāniha martyaloke // / //
analyzed: karoṣi su duṣkarān yān iha martya loke
translated: You perform such difficult tasks in this world of mortals, which are so difficult to do.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Doctor

original: hastehi pādehi śireṇa cāpi pratipriyaṃ duṣkarakaṃ hi kartum /
analyzed: hastehi pādehi śireṇa ca api pratipriyam duṣkarakam hi kartum
translated: With hands, feet, and even with one's head, it is difficult to repay kindness.

original: śireṇa aṃsena ca yo dhareta paripūrṇakalpān yatha gaṅgavālikāḥ // / //
analyzed: śireṇa aṃsena ca yaḥ dhareta gaṅgavālikāḥ
translated: One who would support with one's head and shoulders for as many eons as there are sands in the Ganges,

original: khādyaṃ dadedbhojanavastrapānaṃ śayanāsanaṃ co vimalottaracchadam /
analyzed: khādyam dadet bhojana vastra pānam śayana āsanam vimala uttaracchadam
translated: One who would give food, drink, and clothing, and a bed and seat covered with a spotless upper garment,

original: vihāra kārāpayi candanāmayān saṃstīrya co dūṣyayugehi dadyāt // / //
analyzed: candana āmayān saṃstīrya dadyāt
translated: And have pleasure groves made of sandalwood, and cover them with pairs of garments and give them away.

original: gilānabhaiṣajya bahuprakāraṃ pūjārtha dadyāt sugatasya nityam /
analyzed: bahu prakāram pūjā artha dadyāt sugatasya nityam
translated: For the sake of worship, one should always give to the Sugata various kinds of medicine for the sick.

original: dadeya kalpān yatha gaṅgavālikā naivaṃ kadācit pratikartu śakyam // / //
analyzed: dadeya na evam kadācid pratikartu śakyam
translated: One could give for eons as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, but one could never repay him.

original: mahātmadharmā atulānubhāvā maharddhikāḥ kṣāntibale pratiṣṭhitāḥ /
analyzed: mahātma dharmāḥ atula anubhāvāḥ maharddhikāḥ kṣānti bale pratiṣṭhitāḥ
translated: The great beings have incomparable power, great spiritual attainments, and are established in the power of patience.

original: buddhā mahārāja anāsravā jinā sahanti bālāna imīdṛśāni // / //
analyzed: buddhāḥ mahā rāja anāsravāḥ jinā sahanti imā īdṛśāni
translated: The Buddhas, the great kings, the stainless victors, endure such things from the foolish.

original: anuvartamānastatha nityakālaṃ nimittacārīṇa bravīti dharmam /
analyzed: nityakālam bravīti dharmam
translated: Always acting in accordance with them, he speaks the Dharma to those who practice with signs.

original: dharmeśvaro īśvaru sarvaloke maheśvaro lokavināyakendraḥ // / //
analyzed: sarva loke mahā īśvaraḥ loka vināyaka indraḥ
translated: The Lord of Dharma, the Lord of the entire world, the Great Lord, the leader of the world,

original: pratipatti darśeti bahuprakāraṃ sattvāna sthānāni prajānamānaḥ /
analyzed: bahu prakāram
translated: Manifests various practices, knowing the states of beings.

original: nānādhimuktiṃ ca viditva teṣāṃ hetūsahasrehi bravīti dharmam // / //
analyzed: nānā adhimuktim ca teṣām bravīti dharmam
translated: Knowing their various aspirations, he teaches the Dharma with a thousand reasons.

original: tathāgataścarya prajānamānaḥ sarveṣa sattvānatha pudgalānām /
analyzed: tathāgataḥ carya prajānamānaḥ sarveṣa sattvān atha pudgalānām
translated: The Tathagata, knowing the conduct of all beings and individuals,

original: bahuprakāraṃ hi bravīti dharmaṃ nidarśayanto imamagrabodhim // / //
analyzed: bahu prakāram hi bravīti dharmam nidarśayantaḥ imam agra bodhim
translated: For he teaches the Dharma in many ways, demonstrating this supreme enlightenment.

original: ityāryasaddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye adhimuktiparivarto nāma caturthaḥ //
analyzed: iti ārya saddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye adhimuktiparivartaḥ nāma caturthaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fourth chapter in the Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma, called “Devoted Interest.”

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: oṣadhīparivartaḥ /
analyzed: oṣadhīparivartaḥ
translated: The Chapter on Medicine

original: atha khalu bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ mahākāśyapaṃ tāṃścānyān sthavirān mahāśrāvakānāmantrayāmāsa sādhu sādhu mahākāśyapa /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmantam mahākāśyapam tān ca anyān sthavirān mahāśrāvakān āmantrayāmāsa sādhu sādhu mahākāśyapa
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the venerable Mahākāśyapa and the other elder great disciples, saying, Excellent, excellent, Mahākāśyapa!

original: sādhu khalu punaryuṣmākaṃ kāśyapa yadyūyaṃ tathāgatasya bhūtān guṇavarṇān bhāṣadhve /
analyzed: sādhu khalu punar yuṣmākam kāśyapa yat yūyam tathāgatasya bhūtān guṇa varṇān bhāṣadhve
translated: It is indeed excellent that you, Kāśyapa, speak the true praises of the Tathāgata's qualities.

original: ete ca kāśyapa tathāgatasya bhūtā guṇāḥ /🔽ataścānye 'prameyā asaṃkhyeyāḥ /
analyzed: ete ca kāśyapa tathāgatasya bhūtāḥ guṇāḥ  atas ca anye prameyāḥ asaṃkhyeyāḥ
translated: These, Kāśyapa, are the Tathāgata's true qualities.🔽And beyond these there are immeasurable, countless others,

original: yeṣāṃ na sukaraḥ paryanto 'dhigantumaparimitānapi kalpān bhāṣamāṇaiḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām na sukaraḥ paryantaḥ dhigantum aparimitān api kalpān bhāṣamāṇaiḥ
translated: the end of which cannot be reached even in immeasurable eons of speaking.

original: dharmasvāmī kāśyapa tathāgataḥ /
analyzed: dharma svāmī kāśyapa tathāgataḥ
translated: Kāśyapa, the Tathāgata is the lord of the Dharma.

original: sarvadharmāṇāṃ rājā prabhurvaśī /
analyzed: sarva dharmāṇām rājā prabhuḥ vaśī
translated: He is the king, the master, and the controller of all dharmas.

original: yaṃ ca kāśyapa tathāgato dharmaṃ yatropanikṣipati /
analyzed: yam ca kāśyapa tathāgataḥ dharmam yatra upanikṣipati
translated: Kāśyapa, whatever Dharma the Tathāgata entrusts to someone,

original: sa tathaiva bhavati /
analyzed: sa tathā eva bhavati
translated: that becomes so.

original: sarvadharmāśca kāśyapa tathāgato yuktyopanikṣipati /
analyzed: sarva dharmāḥ ca kāśyapa tathāgataḥ yuktyā upanikṣipati
translated: All dharmas, Kashyapa, the Tathagata places with reasoning.

original: tathāgatajñānenopanikṣipati /
analyzed: tathāgata jñānena upanikṣipati
translated: He places them with the knowledge of the Tathagata.

original: yathā te dharmāḥ sarvajñabhūmimeva gacchanti /
analyzed: yathā te dharmāḥ sarvajña bhūmim eva gacchanti
translated: So that those dharmas go only to the stage of omniscience.

original: sarvadharmārthagatiṃ ca tathāgato vyavalokayati /
analyzed: sarva dharma artha gatim ca tathāgataḥ vyavalokayati
translated: And the Tathagata looks at the meaning and the course of all dharmas.

original: sarvadharmārthavaśitāprāptaḥ sarvadharmādhyāśayaprāptaḥ sarvadharmaviniścayakauśalyajñānaparamapāramitāprāptaḥ
analyzed: sarva dharma artha vaśitā prāptaḥ sarva dharma adhyāśaya prāptaḥ sarva dharma viniścaya kauśalya jñāna parama pāramitā prāptaḥ
translated: Having attained mastery over the meaning of all dharmas, having attained the highest intention regarding all dharmas, having attained the supreme perfection of the knowledge of skill in determining all dharmas,🔽the Tathagata, Kashyapa, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One,

original: sarvajñajñānasaṃdarśakaḥ sarvajñajñānāvatārakaḥ sarvajñajñānopanikṣepakaḥ kāśyapa🔽tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ //
analyzed: sarvajña jñāna saṃdarśakaḥ sarvajña jñāna avatārakaḥ sarvajña jñāna upanikṣepakaḥ kāśyapa  tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: is the one who shows the knowledge of omniscience, who causes entry into the knowledge of omniscience, who places the knowledge of omniscience.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kāśyapa asyāṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasrāyāṃ lokadhātau yāvantastṛṇagulmauṣadhivanaspatayo
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kāśyapa asyām tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrāyām lokadhātau yāvantaḥ tṛṇa gulma oṣadhi vanaspatayaḥ
translated: Just as, Kashyapa, in this great trichiliocosm, as many grasses, bushes, herbs, and forests as there are,

original: nānāvarṇā nānāprakārā oṣadhigrāmā nānānāmadheyāḥ pṛthivyāṃ jātāḥ parvatagirikandareṣu vā /
analyzed: nānā varṇāḥ nānā prakārāḥ oṣadhi grāmāḥ nānā nāmadheyāḥ pṛthivyām jātāḥ parvata giri kandareṣu vā
translated: varieties of colors, varieties of kinds, varieties of groups of herbs, with various names, born on the earth, in mountain caves, or on mountains,

original: meghaśca mahāvāriparipūrṇa unnamet /
analyzed: meghaḥ ca mahā vāri paripūrṇaḥ unnamet
translated: and a cloud filled with great water rises,🔽and having risen, covers the whole great trichiliocosm with a net of clouds,

original: unnamitvā sarvāvatīṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasrāṃ lokadhātuṃ saṃchādayet /
analyzed: unnamitvā sarvāvatīm tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrām lokadhātum saṃchādayet
translated: Having risen, it would cover the entire great trichiliocosm.

original: saṃchādya ca sarvatra samakālaṃ vāri pramuñcet /
analyzed: saṃchādya ca sarvatra sama kālam vāri pramuñcet
translated: Having covered it, it would release rain everywhere at the same time.

original: tatra kāśyapa ye tṛṇagulmauṣadhivanaspatayo 'syāṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasralokadhātau /
analyzed: tatra kāśyapa ye syām tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātau
translated: There, Kāśyapa, those grasses, bushes, herbs, and forest trees in this great trichiliocosm,

original: tatra ye taruṇāḥ komalanālaśākhāpatrapalāśāstṛṇagulmauṣadhivanaspatayo drumā mahādrumāḥ /
analyzed: tatra ye taruṇāḥ komala nāla śākhā patra palāśāḥ tṛṇa gulma oṣadhi vanaspatayaḥ drumāḥ mahā drumāḥ
translated: there those young, tender-stemmed, leaf-budded grasses, bushes, herbs, trees, and great trees,

original: sarve te tato mahāmeghapramuktādvāriṇo yathābalaṃ yathāviṣayamabdhātuṃ pratyāpibanti /
analyzed: sarve te tatas mahā megha pramuktāt vāriṇaḥ yathābalam yathāviṣayam ap dhātum pratyāpibanti
translated: all of them, from the water released by that great cloud, drink the water element according to their strength and according to their capacity.

original: te caikarasena vāriṇā prabhūtena meghapramuktena yathābījamanvayaṃ vivṛddhiṃ virūḍhiṃ vipulatāmāpadyante /
analyzed: te ca eka rasena vāriṇā prabhūtena megha pramuktena yathābījam anvayam vivṛddhim virūḍhim vipula tām āpadyante
translated: And those, with abundant water of one taste released by the cloud, grow, develop, and become vast according to the type of seed.

original: tathā ca puṣpaphalāni prasavanti /
analyzed: tathā ca puṣpa phalāni prasavanti
translated: And they produce flowers and fruits.

original: te ca pṛthak pṛthagū nānānāmadheyāni pratilabhante /
analyzed: te ca pṛthak pṛthak nānā nāmadheyāni pratilabhante
translated: And those, individually, obtain various names.

original: ekadharaṇīpratiṣṭhitāśca te sarve oṣadhigrāmā bījagrāmā ekarasatoyābhiṣyanditāḥ /
analyzed: eka dharaṇī pratiṣṭhitāḥ ca te sarve oṣadhi grāmāḥ bīja grāmāḥ eka rasa toya abhiṣyanditāḥ
translated: And those groups of herbs and groups of seeds, established on one earth, are moistened by water of one taste.

original: evameva kāśyapa tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho loka utpadyate /
analyzed: evam eva kāśyapa tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke utpadyate
translated: In the same way, Kāśyapa, a Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One appears in the world.

original: yathā mahāmeghaḥ unnamate /
analyzed: yathā mahā meghaḥ unnamate
translated: Just like a great cloud rises.

original: tathā tathāgato 'pyutpadya sarvāvantaṃ sadevamānuṣāsuraṃ lokaṃ svareṇābhivijñāpayati /
analyzed: tathā tathāgataḥ u pi utpadya sarvāvantam sa deva mānuṣa asuram lokam svareṇa abhivijñāpayati
translated: In the same way, the Tathāgata, having appeared, makes his voice heard to the entire world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kāśyapa mahāmeghaḥ sarvāvatīṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasrāṃ lokadhātumavacchādayati /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kāśyapa mahā meghaḥ sarvāvatīm tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrām lokadhātum avacchādayati
translated: Just as, Kāśyapa, a great cloud covers the entire trichiliocosm,

original: evameva kāśyapa tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sadevamānuṣāsurasya lokasya purata evaṃ śabdamudīrayati /
analyzed: evam eva kāśyapa tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sa deva mānuṣa asurasya lokasya puratas evam śabdam udīrayati
translated: in the same way, Kāśyapa, a Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One, in the presence of the world with its gods, humans, and asuras, proclaims this sound:

original: ghoṣamanuśrāvayati tathāgato 'smi bhavanto devamanuṣyāḥ arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ /
analyzed: ghoṣam anuśrāvayati tathāgataḥ smi bhavantaḥ deva manuṣyāḥ arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: Gentlemen, gods and humans, I am the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One.

original: tīrṇastārayāmi /🔽mukto mocayāmi /🔽āśvasta āśvāsayāmi /
analyzed: tīrṇaḥ tārayāmi  muktaḥ mocayāmi  āśvastaḥ āśvāsayāmi
translated: I have crossed and I cause to cross.🔽I am liberated and I cause to be liberated.

original: parinirvṛtaḥ parinirvāpayāmi /
analyzed: parinirvṛtaḥ parinirvāpayāmi
translated: I am comforted and I cause to be comforted.🔽I am completely extinguished and I cause to be completely extinguished.

original: ahamimaṃ ca lokaṃ paraṃ ca lokaṃ samyak prajñayā yathābhūtaṃ prajānāmi sarvajñaḥ sarvadarśī /
analyzed: aham imam ca lokam param ca lokam samyak prajñayā yathābhūtam prajānāmi sarvajñaḥ sarva darśī
translated: With right wisdom I know and see this world and the other world as they are. I am all-knowing, all-seeing.

original: upasaṃkrāmantu māṃ bhavanto devamanuṣyā dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: upasaṃkrāmantu mām bhavantaḥ deva manuṣyāḥ dharma śravaṇāya
translated: Come to me, gentlemen, gods and humans, to listen to the Dharma.

original: ahaṃ mārgasyākhyātā mārgadeśiko mārgavit mārgakovidaḥ /
analyzed: aham mārgasya ākhyātā mārga deśikaḥ mārga vid mārga kovidaḥ
translated: I am the one who teaches the path, the one who shows the path, the one who knows the path, the one who is skilled in the path.

original: tatra kāśyapa bahūni prāṇikoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi tathāgatasya dharmaśravaṇāyopasaṃkrāmanti /
analyzed: tatra kāśyapa bahūni prāṇi koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi tathāgatasya dharma śravaṇāya upasaṃkrāmanti
translated: There, Kāśyapa, many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of living beings approach the Tathāgata to listen to the Dharma.

original: atha tathāgato 'pi teṣāṃ sattvānāmindriyavīryaparāparavaimātratāṃ Vaidya 🔽jñātvā tāṃstān dharmaparyāyānupasaṃharati /
analyzed: atha tathāgataḥ u pi teṣām sattvānām indriya vīrya para apara vaimātra tām vaidya  jñātvā tān tān dharmaparyāyān upasaṃharati
translated: Then the Tathāgata, knowing the superiority of the faculties, the strength, and the maturity of those beings,🔽teaches them various kinds of teachings,

original: tāṃ tāṃ dharmakathāṃ kathayati bahvīṃ vicitrāṃ harṣaṇīyāṃ paritoṣaṇīyāṃ prāmodyakaraṇīyāṃ hitasukhasaṃvartanakaraṇīyām / yayā
analyzed: tām tām dharma kathām kathayati bahvīm vicitrām harṣaṇīyām paritoṣaṇīyām prāmodya karaṇīyām hita sukha saṃvartana karaṇīyām yayā
translated: various kinds of Dharma discourses, which are delightful, satisfying, gladdening, beneficial, and conducive to happiness,

original: kathaya te sattvāḥ dṛṣṭa eva dharme sukhitā bhavanti /
analyzed: kathaya te sattvāḥ dṛṣṭe eva dharme sukhitāḥ bhavanti
translated: by which those beings become happy in this very life.

original: kālaṃ ca kṛtvā sugatīṣūpapadyante /
analyzed: kālam ca kṛtvā sugatīṣu upapadyante
translated: And after death, they are reborn in good destinies.

original: yatra prabhūtāṃśca kāmān paribhuñjante /
analyzed: yatra prabhūtān ca kāmān paribhuñjante
translated: There they enjoy abundant pleasures,

original: dharmaṃ ca śṛṇvanti /
analyzed: dharmam ca śṛṇvanti
translated: and they listen to the Dharma.

original: śrutvā ca taṃ dharmaṃ vigatanīvaraṇā bhavanti /
analyzed: śrutvā ca tam dharmam vigata nīvaraṇāḥ bhavanti
translated: Having heard that Dharma, they become free from hindrances.

original: anupūrveṇa ca sarvajñadharmeṣvabhiyujyante yathābalaṃ yathāviṣayaṃ yathāsthānam //
analyzed: anupūrveṇa ca sarvajña dharmeṣu abhiyujyante yathābalam yathāviṣayam yathāsthānam
translated: And in due course, they apply themselves to all the teachings of the Omniscient One according to their ability, their domain, and their place.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kāśyapa mahāmeghaḥ sarvāvatīṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasrāṃ lokadhātuṃ saṃchādya samaṃ vāri pramuñcati /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kāśyapa mahā meghaḥ sarvāvatīm tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrām lokadhātum saṃchādya samam vāri pramuñcati
translated: “Kāśyapa, it is like this: a great cloud covers the entire trichiliocosm and releases rain evenly.

original: sarvāṃśca tṛṇagulmauṣadhivanaspatīn vāriṇā saṃtarpayati /
analyzed: sarvān ca tṛṇa gulma oṣadhi vanaspatīn vāriṇā saṃtarpayati
translated: It satisfies all the grass, thickets, herbs, and forests with water.

original: yathābalaṃ yathāviṣayaṃ yathāsthāmaṃ ca te tṛṇagulmauṣadhivanaspatayo vāryāpibanti /
analyzed: yathābalam yathāviṣayam yathāsthāmam ca te tṛṇa gulma oṣadhi vanaspatayaḥ vāri āpibanti
translated: The grass, thickets, herbs, and forests drink the water according to their strength, according to their domain, according to their power.

original: svakasvakāṃ ca jātipramāṇatāṃ gacchanti /
analyzed: svaka svakām ca jāti pramāṇa tām gacchanti
translated: They attain their own individual measure.

original: evameva kāśyapa tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho yaṃ dharmaṃ bhāṣate /
analyzed: evam eva kāśyapa tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ yam dharmam bhāṣate
translated: In the same way, Kāśyapa, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, teaches the Dharma.

original: sarvaḥ sa dharma ekaraso yaduta vimuktiraso virāgaraso nirodharasaḥ sarvajñajñānaparyavasānaḥ /
analyzed: sarvaḥ sa dharmaḥ eka rasaḥ yat uta vimukti rasaḥ virāga rasaḥ nirodha rasaḥ sarvajña jñāna paryavasānaḥ
translated: All that Dharma has one taste, namely the taste of liberation, the taste of dispassion, the taste of cessation, and ends in omniscient knowledge.

original: tatra kāśyapa ye te sattvāstathāgatasya dharmaṃ bhāṣamāṇasya śṛṇvanti dhārayanti abhisaṃyujyante /
analyzed: tatra kāśyapa ye te sattvāḥ tathāgatasya dharmam bhāṣamāṇasya śṛṇvanti dhārayanti abhisaṃyujyante
translated: “Kāśyapa, those beings who listen to the Tathāgata teaching the Dharma, who remember it, and who apply themselves to it,

original: na te ātmanātmānaṃ jānanti vā vedayanti vā budhyanti vā /
analyzed: na te ātmanā ātmānam jānanti vā vedayanti vā budhyanti vā
translated: do not know themselves, do not experience themselves, and do not understand themselves.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: tathāgata eva kāśyapa tān sattvāṃstathā jānāti /
analyzed: tathāgataḥ eva kāśyapa tān sattvān tathā jānāti
translated: Kāśyapa, the Tathāgata himself knows those beings in that way.

original: ye ca te /
analyzed: ye ca te
translated: And those who are they.

original: yathā ca te /
analyzed: yathā ca te
translated: And how they are.

original: yādṛśāśca te /🔽yaṃ ca te cintayanti /
analyzed: yādṛśāḥ ca te  yam ca te cintayanti
translated: And what they are like.🔽And what they think.

original: yathā ca te cintayanti /🔽yena ca te cintayanti /
analyzed: yathā ca te cintayanti  yena ca te cintayanti
translated: And how they think.🔽And by what they think.

original: yaṃ ca te bhāvayanti /🔽yathā ca te bhāvayanti /
analyzed: yam ca te bhāvayanti  yathā ca te bhāvayanti
translated: And what they meditate on.🔽And how they meditate.

original: yena ca te bhāvayanti /
analyzed: yena ca te bhāvayanti
translated: And by what they meditate.

original: yaṃ ca te prāpnuvanti /
analyzed: yam ca te prāpnuvanti
translated: And what they attain.

original: yathā ca te prāpnuvanti /
analyzed: yathā ca te prāpnuvanti
translated: And how they attain.

original: yena ca te prāpnuvanti /
analyzed: yena ca te prāpnuvanti
translated: And by what they attain.

original: tathāgata eva kāśyapa tatra pratyakṣaḥ pratyakṣadarśī yathā ca darśī teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ tāsu tāsu bhūmiṣu sthitānāṃ tṛṇagulmauṣadhivanaspatīnāṃ
analyzed: tathāgataḥ eva kāśyapa tatra pratyakṣaḥ pratyakṣa darśī yathā ca darśī teṣām sattvānām tāsu tāsu bhūmiṣu sthitānām tṛṇa gulma oṣadhi vanaspatīnām
translated: The Tathagata alone, Kashyapa, is a direct witness there, a direct seer, as to how those beings, abiding in those various stages, the grasses, bushes, herbs, and forests,

original: hīnotkṛṣṭamadhyamānām /
analyzed: hīna utkṛṣṭa madhyamānām
translated: the inferior, superior, and middling,

original: so 'haṃ kāśyapa ekarasadharma viditvā yaduta vimuktirasaṃ nirvṛtirasaṃ nirvāṇaparyavasānaṃ
analyzed: saḥ ham kāśyapaḥ eka rasa dharma viditvā yat uta vimukti rasam nirvṛti rasam nirvāṇa paryavasānam
translated: Having known, Kashyapa, the single taste of the Dharma, namely the taste of liberation, the taste of tranquility, ending in nirvana,

original: nityaparinirvṛtamekabhūmikamākāśagatikamadhimuktiṃ sattvānāmanurakṣamāṇo na sahasaiva
analyzed: nitya parinirvṛtam eka bhūmikam ākāśa gatikam adhimuktim sattvānām anurakṣamāṇaḥ na sahasā eva
translated: eternally extinguished, of a single stage, moving in space, out of consideration for beings' inclinations, I do not immediately

original: sarvajñajñānaṃ saṃprakāśayāmi /
analyzed: sarvajña jñānam saṃprakāśayāmi
translated: reveal the knowledge of omniscience.

original: āścaryaprāptā adbhutaprāptā yūyaṃ kāśyapa yadyūyaṃ saṃdhābhāṣitaṃ tathāgatasya na śaknutha avataritum /
analyzed: āścarya prāptāḥ adbhuta prāptāḥ yūyam kāśyapa yat yūyam saṃdhā bhāṣitam tathāgatasya na śaknutha avataritum
translated: You are astonished and amazed, Kāśyapa, that you are unable to understand the Tathāgata's teaching with implied meaning.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: durvijñeyaṃ kāśyapa tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ saṃdhābhāṣitamiti //
analyzed: durvijñeyam kāśyapa tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām saṃdhā bhāṣitam iti
translated: The implied teachings of the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Enlightened Ones are difficult to understand, Kāśyapa.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimamevārthaṃ bhūyasyā mātrayā saṃdarśayamāna imā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imam eva artham bhūyasyā mātrayā saṃdarśayamānaḥ imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One, in order to further illustrate this very meaning, spoke these verses:

original: dharmarājā ahaṃ loke utpanno bhavamardanaḥ /
analyzed: dharma rājā aham loke utpannaḥ bhava mardanaḥ
translated: I, the Dharma King, have appeared in the world, crushing existence.

original: dharmaṃ bhāṣāmi sattvānāmadhimuktiṃ vijāniya // / //
analyzed: dharmam bhāṣāmi sattvānām adhimuktim
translated: Knowing the inclinations of beings, I teach the Dharma to them.

original: dhīrabuddhī mahāvīrā ciraṃ rakṣanti bhāṣitam /
analyzed: ciram rakṣanti bhāṣitam
translated: The wise, the courageous, the great heroes, for a long time protect what is said.

analyzed: rahasyam ca api dhārenti na ca bhāṣanti prāṇinām  durbodhyam ca api tat jñānam sahasā bāliśāḥ
translated: They also keep it secret, and do not speak it to living beings.🔽That knowledge is difficult to understand. Suddenly hearing it, the foolish ones

original: kāṅkṣāṃ kuryuḥ sudurmedhāstato bhraṣṭā bhrameyu te // / //
analyzed: kāṅkṣām kuryuḥ su durmedhāḥ tatas bhraṣṭāḥ bhrameyuḥ te
translated: Would have doubts. Those of poor understanding would then fall away and wander.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Doctor

original: yathāviṣayu bhāṣāmi yasya yādṛśakaṃ balam /
analyzed: bhāṣāmi yasya yādṛśakam balam
translated: I teach according to the strength of the poison of each one.

original: anyamanyehi arthehi dṛṣṭiṃ kurvāmi ujjukām // / //
analyzed: anyam anyehi arthehi dṛṣṭim kurvāmi ujjukām
translated: With various meanings, I make their view straight.

original: yathāpi kāśyapā megho lokadhātūya unnataḥ /
analyzed: yathā api kāśyapāḥ meghaḥ lokadhātūyaḥ unnataḥ
translated: Just as, Kashyapa, a cloud rises in the world realm,

original: sarvamonahatī cāpi chādayanto vasuṃdharām // / //
analyzed: ca api chādayantaḥ vasuṃdharām
translated: Covering the entire earth with darkness,

original: so ca vārisya saṃpūrṇo vidyunmālī mahāmbudaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ ca vārisya saṃpūrṇaḥ vidyunmālī mahā ambudaḥ
translated: That great cloud, full of water, with a garland of lightning,

original: nirnādayanta śabdena harṣayet sarvadehinaḥ // / //
analyzed: nirnādayanta śabdena harṣayet sarva dehinaḥ
translated: Resounds with a sound and delights all beings.

original: sūryaraśmī nivāritvā śītalaṃ kṛtva maṇḍalam /
analyzed: sūrya raśmī nivāritvā śītalam kṛtvā maṇḍalam
translated: Having blocked the sun's rays and cooled the sphere,

original: hastaprāpto 'vatiṣṭhanto vāri muñcet samantataḥ // / //
analyzed: hasta prāptaḥ vatiṣṭhantaḥ vāri muñcet samantataḥ
translated: Standing within reach, it releases water everywhere.

original: sa caiva mama muñceta āpaskandhamanalpakam /
analyzed: sa ca eva mama muñceta āpaskandham analpakam
translated: And it releases from me a great mass of water,

original: prākharantaḥ samantena tarpayenmedinīmimām // / //
analyzed: prākhara antar samantena tarpayet medinīm imām
translated: Flowing all around, it satisfies this earth.

original: iha yā kāci medinyāṃ jātā oṣadhayo bhavet /
analyzed: iha yā kāci medinyām jātāḥ oṣadhayaḥ bhavet
translated: Whatever herbs there are on this earth,

original: tṛṇagulmavanaspatyo drumā vātha mahādrumāḥ // / //
analyzed: tṛṇa gulma vanaspatyaḥ drumāḥ vā atha mahā drumāḥ
translated: Grasses, shrubs, trees, or great trees,

original: sasyāni vividhānyeva yadvāpi haritaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: sasyāni vividhāni eva yat vā api haritam bhavet
translated: Various crops or whatever is green,

original: parvate kandare caiva nikuñjeṣu ca yadbhavet // / //
analyzed: parvate kandare ca eva nikuñjeṣu ca yat bhavet
translated: Or what there is on mountains, in caves, and in thickets,

original: sarvān saṃtarpayenmeghastṛṇagulmavanaspatīn /
analyzed: sarvān saṃtarpayet megha stṛṇa gulma vanaspatīn
translated: The cloud satisfies all of them, the grasses, shrubs, and trees.

original: tṛṣitāṃ dharaṇīṃ tarpet pariṣiñcati cauṣadhīḥ // / //
analyzed: tṛṣitām dharaṇīm tarpet pariṣiñcati ca oṣadhīḥ
translated: It satisfies the thirsty earth and sprinkles the herbs.

original: tacca ekarasaṃ vāri meghamuktamihasthitam /
analyzed: tat ca eka rasam vāri megha muktam iha sthitam
translated: And that rain, released by the clouds, remains here with a single taste.

original: yathābalaṃ yathāviṣayaṃ tṛṇagulmā pibanti tat // / //
analyzed: yathābalam yathāviṣayam tṛṇa gulmā pibanti tat
translated: According to their strength and domain, the grasses and shrubs drink it...

original: drumāśca ye keci mahādrumāśca khudrāka madhyāśca yathāvayāśca /
analyzed: drumāḥ ca mahā drumāḥ ca madhyāḥ ca yathāvayāḥ ca
translated: And the trees, whatever they may be, and the great trees, the small, the medium, and the old,

original: yathābalaṃ sarve pibanti vāri pibanti vardhanti yathecchakāmāḥ // / //
analyzed: yathābalam sarve pibanti vāri pibanti vardhanti yathā icchā kāmāḥ
translated: All drink the water according to their strength, they drink and grow as they desire...

original: kāṇḍena nālena tvacā yathaiva śākhāpraśākhāya tathaiva patraiḥ /
analyzed: kāṇḍena nālena tvacā yathā eva śākhā praśākhāya tathā eva patraiḥ
translated: Just as by the trunk, by the bark, by the leaves, by the branches and twigs,

original: vardhanti puṣpehi phalehi caiva meghābhivṛṣṭena mahauṣadhīyaḥ // / //
analyzed: vardhanti puṣpehi phalehi ca eva megha abhivṛṣṭena mahauṣadhīyaḥ
translated: The great herbs grow by the rain released by the clouds, by the flowers and fruits...

original: yathābalaṃ tā viṣayaśca yādṛśo yāsāṃ ca yad yādṛśakaṃ ca bījam /
analyzed: yathābalam tāḥ viṣayaḥ ca yādṛśaḥ yāsām ca yat yādṛśakam ca bījam
translated: According to their strength, according to the domain, according to the seed of each one,

original: svakasvakaṃ tāḥ prasavaṃ dadanti vāriṃ ca taṃ ekarasaṃ pramuktam // / //
analyzed: svaka svakam tāḥ prasavam dadanti vārim ca tam eka rasam pramuktam
translated: They give their own growth, the water released with a single taste...

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Physician

original: emeva buddho 'pi ha loke kāśyapa utpadyate vāridharo va loke /
analyzed: buddhaḥ pi ha loke kāśyapaḥ utpadyate vāridharaḥ loke
translated: In the same way, O Kāśyapa, the Buddha also appears in the world, like a rain-cloud in the world.

original: utpadya ca bhāṣati lokanātho bhūtāṃ cariṃ darśayate ca prāṇinām // / //
analyzed: utpadya ca bhāṣati loka nāthaḥ bhūtām carim darśayate ca prāṇinām
translated: And having appeared, the Lord of the World speaks, and shows the true conduct of beings...

original: evaṃ ca saṃśrāvayate maharṣiḥ puraskṛto loke sadevake 'smin /
analyzed: evam ca saṃśrāvayate mahā ṛṣiḥ puraskṛtaḥ loke sa devake smin
translated: And thus the great sage proclaims, being honored in this world with its gods,

original: tathāgato 'haṃ dvipadottamo jino utpannu lokasmi yathaiva meghaḥ // / //
analyzed: tathāgataḥ ham dvipada uttamaḥ jinaḥ yathā eva meghaḥ
translated: I am the Tathāgata, the Victorious One, the best of two-legged beings, arisen in the world like a cloud.

original: saṃtarpayiṣyāmyahu sarvasattvān saṃśuṣkagātrāṃstribhave vilagnān /
analyzed: saṃtarpayiṣyāmi ahu sarva sattvān saṃśuṣka gātrān tri bhave vilagnān
translated: I will satisfy all beings, whose bodies are withered, attached to the three existences,

original: duḥkhena śuṣyanta sukhe sthapeyaṃ kāmāṃśca dāsyāmyahu nirvṛtiṃ ca // / //
analyzed: duḥkhena sukhe sthapeyam kāmān ca dāsyāmi ahu nirvṛtim ca
translated: and establish them in happiness, having freed them from suffering. I will give them desires and liberation.

original: śṛṇotha me devamanuṣyasaṃghā upasaṃkramadhvaṃ mama darśanāya /
analyzed: śṛṇotha me deva manuṣya saṃghāḥ upasaṃkramadhvam mama darśanāya
translated: Listen to me, assembly of gods and humans! Approach to see me!

original: tathāgato 'haṃ bhagavānanābhibhūḥ saṃtāraṇārthaṃ iha loki jātaḥ // / //
analyzed: tathāgataḥ ham bhagavān anābhi bhūḥ saṃtāraṇa artham iha loki jātaḥ
translated: I am the Tathāgata, the Blessed One, the Unconquered One, born in this world for the sake of liberation.

original: bhāṣāmi ca prāṇisahasrakoṭināṃ dharmaṃ viśuddhaṃ abhidarśanīyam /
analyzed: bhāṣāmi ca prāṇi sahasra koṭinām dharmam viśuddham abhidarśanīyam
translated: And I teach the pure and sublime Dharma to thousands of millions of living beings,

original: ekā ca tasyo samatā tathatvaṃ yadidaṃ vimuktiścatha nirvṛtī ca // / //
analyzed: ekā ca samatā tathatvam yat idam ca
translated: with a single equality and suchness, namely liberation and nirvana.

original: svareṇa caikena vadāmi dharmaṃ bodhiṃ nidānaṃ kariyāna nityam /🔽samaṃ hi etadviṣamatva nāsti na kaści vidveṣu na rāgu vidyate // / //
analyzed: svareṇa ca ekena vadāmi dharmam bodhim nidānam nityam  samam hi na asti na vidyate
translated: With a single voice I always teach the Dharma, making enlightenment the basis.🔽For this is equal, there is no inequality. There is no attachment or aversion to be found anywhere.

original: anunīyatā mahya na kācidasti premā ca doṣaśca na me kahiṃcit /
analyzed: anunīyatā na kācid asti premā ca doṣaḥ ca na me kahiṃcid
translated: I have no affection for anyone, nor any fault.

original: samaṃ ca dharmaṃ pravadāmi dehināṃ yathaikasattvasya tathā parasya // / //
analyzed: samam ca dharmam pravadāmi dehinām yathā eka sattvasya tathā parasya
translated: I teach the Dharma equally to all beings, just as I would to one being, so to another.

original: ananyakarmā pravadāmi dharmaṃ gacchantu tiṣṭhantu niṣīdamānaḥ /
analyzed: an anya karmā pravadāmi dharmam gacchantu tiṣṭhantu niṣīdamānaḥ
translated: I teach the Dharma without any other work, whether walking, standing, or sitting.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Doctor

original: niṣaṇṇa śayyāsanamāruhitvā kilāsitā mahya na jātu vidyate // / //
analyzed: niṣaṇṇa śayyā āsanam āruhitvā kilāsitā na jātu vidyate
translated: Whether lying down, sitting, or standing, I never have any laziness.

original: saṃtarpayāmī imu sarvalokaṃ megho va vāriṃ sama muñcamānaḥ /
analyzed: saṃtarpayāmi sarva lokam meghaḥ vā vārim muñcamānaḥ
translated: I satisfy this entire world, like a cloud evenly releasing rain.

original: āryeṣu nīceṣu ca tulyabuddhirduḥśīlabhūteṣvatha śīlavatsu // / //
analyzed: āryeṣu nīceṣu ca tulya buddhiḥ duḥśīla bhūteṣu atha śīlavatsu
translated: I have equal understanding of the noble and the lowly, of those with bad conduct and those with good conduct.

original: vinaṣṭacāritra tathaiva ye narāścāritraācārasamanvitāśca /
analyzed: vinaṣṭa cāritra tathā eva ye narāḥ cāritra ācāra samanvitāḥ ca
translated: And likewise, for those men whose conduct is destroyed, and those who have conduct and good behavior,

original: dṛṣṭisthitā ye ca vinaṣṭadṛṣṭī samyagdṛśo ye cāviśuddhadṛṣṭayaḥ // / //🔽hīneṣu cotkṛṣṭamatīṣu cāpi mṛdvindriyeṣu pravadāmi dharmam /
analyzed: dṛṣṭi sthitāḥ ye ca vinaṣṭa dṛṣṭī samyak dṛśaḥ ye ca a viśuddha dṛṣṭayaḥ  hīneṣu ca utkṛṣṭa matīṣu ca api mṛdu indriyeṣu pravadāmi dharmam
translated: Those who are fixed in wrong views, and those with destroyed views, and those with right views, and those with impure views,🔽And for those with inferior and superior understandings, and those with weak faculties, I teach the Dharma.

original: kilāsitāṃ sarva vivarjayitvā samyak pramuñcāmyahu dharmavarṣam // / //
analyzed: kilāsi tām vivarjayitvā samyak dharma varṣam
translated: Abandoning all laziness, I properly release the rain of Dharma.

original: yathābalaṃ ca śruṇiyāna mahyaṃ vividhāsu bhūmīṣu pratiṣṭhihanti /
analyzed: yathābalam ca mahyam vividhāsu bhūmīṣu pratiṣṭhihanti
translated: And having listened to me to the best of their ability, they are established in various stages.

original: deveṣu martyeṣu manorameṣu śakreṣu brahmeṣvatha cakravartiṣu // / //
analyzed: deveṣu martyeṣu manorameṣu śakreṣu brahmeṣu atha cakravartiṣu
translated: Among gods, mortals, and delightful beings, among Shakra, Brahma, and Chakravartins.

original: kṣudrānukṣudrā ima oṣadhīyo kṣudrīka etā iha yāva loke /
analyzed: kṣudra anukṣudrāḥ ime kṣudrīke etāḥ iha loke
translated: These are the small and smaller herbs, these are the minute ones in this world.

original: anyā ca madhyā mahatī ca oṣadhī śṛṇotha tāḥ sarva prakāśayiṣye // / //
analyzed: anyā ca madhyā mahatī ca oṣadhī śṛṇotha tāḥ sarva prakāśayiṣye
translated: And there are other herbs, medium and great. Listen, I will proclaim them all.

original: anāsravaṃ dharma prajānamānā nirvāṇaprāptā viharanti ye narāḥ /
analyzed: anāsravam dharma prajānamānāḥ nirvāṇa prāptāḥ viharanti ye narāḥ
translated: Those who know the undefiled Dharma, those men who dwell having attained nirvana,

original: ṣaḍabhijña traividya bhavanti ye ca sā kṣudrikā oṣadhi saṃpravuttā // / //
analyzed: ṣaḍabhijña traividya bhavanti ye ca sā kṣudrikā oṣadhi saṃpravuttā
translated: Those who have the six higher knowledges and the three knowledges, they are called the small herbs.

original: girikandeṣū viharanti ye ca pratyekabodhiṃ spṛhayanti ye narāḥ /
analyzed: giri kanda iṣū viharanti ye ca pratyeka bodhim spṛhayanti ye narāḥ
translated: Those who dwell in mountain caves, those men who aspire to the enlightenment of a pratyekabuddha,

original: ye īdṛśā madhyaviśuddhabuddhayaḥ sā madhyamā oṣadhi saṃpravuttā // / //
analyzed: ye īdṛśāḥ madhya viśuddha buddhayaḥ sā madhyamā oṣadhi saṃpravuttā
translated: Those of such a kind, with a medium purified mind, they are called the medium herbs.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Doctor

original: ye prārthayante puruṣarṣabhatvaṃ buddho bhaviṣye naradevanāthaḥ /
analyzed: ye prārthayante puruṣa ṛṣabha tvam buddhaḥ bhaviṣye naradeva nāthaḥ
translated: Those who aspire to be a bull among men, a Buddha, a lord of men and gods,

original: vīryaṃ ca dhyānaṃ ca niṣevamāṇāḥ sā oṣadhī agra iyaṃ pravuccati // / //
analyzed: vīryam ca dhyānam ca niṣevamāṇāḥ sā oṣadhī agre iyam pravuccati
translated: Practicing diligence and meditation, that herb is called the supreme.

original: ye cāpi yuktāḥ sugatasya putrā maitrīṃ niṣevantiha śāntacaryām /
analyzed: ye ca api yuktāḥ sugatasya putrāḥ maitrīm niṣevanti iha śānta caryām
translated: And those sons of the Sugata who are devoted, who practice the peaceful conduct of loving-kindness,

original: niṣkāṅkṣaprāptā puruṣarṣabhatve ayaṃ drumo vucyati evarūpaḥ // / //
analyzed: niṣkāṅkṣa prāptā puruṣa ṛṣabha tve ayam drumaḥ eva rūpaḥ
translated: And have attained the state of a supreme human, this tree is said to be like that.

original: avivarticakraṃ hi pravartayantā ṛddhībalasmin sthita ye ca dhīrāḥ /
analyzed: avivarti cakram hi pravartayantaḥ ṛddhī balasmin ye ca dhīrāḥ
translated: Those who turn the irreversible wheel, and those who are steadfast in the power of spiritual abilities,

original: pramocayanto bahu prāṇikoṭī mahādrumo so ca pravuccate hi // / //
analyzed: pramocayantaḥ bahu prāṇi koṭī mahā drumaḥ saḥ ca pravuccate hi
translated: Liberating many millions of beings, he is said to be a great tree.

original: samaśca so dharma jinena bhāṣito meghena vā vāri samaṃ pramuktam /
analyzed: samaḥ ca saḥ dharma jinena bhāṣitaḥ meghena vā vāri samam pramuktam
translated: The Dharma taught by the Victor is the same, like rain released equally by a cloud.

original: citrā abhijñā ima evarūpā yathauṣadhīyo dharaṇītalasthāḥ // / //
analyzed: citrāḥ abhijñāḥ ime evarūpāḥ yathā oṣadhīyaḥ dharaṇī tala sthāḥ
translated: These various higher knowledges are like medicinal herbs growing on the earth.

original: anena dṛṣṭāntanidarśanena upāyu jānāhi tathāgatasya /
analyzed: anena dṛṣṭānta nidarśanena upāyu jānāhi tathāgatasya
translated: By this example and illustration, understand the skillful means of the Tathāgata.

original: yathā ca so bhāṣati ekadharmaṃ nānāniruktī jalabindavo vā // / //
analyzed: yathā ca saḥ bhāṣati eka dharmam nānā niruktī jala bindavaḥ vā
translated: Just as he teaches the same Dharma in various definitions, like water drops,

original: mamāpi co varṣatu dharmavarṣaṃ loko hyayaṃ tarpitu bhoti sarvaḥ /
analyzed: mama api ca u varṣatu dharma varṣam lokaḥ hi ayam sarvaḥ
translated: May I also rain down the rain of Dharma, and may this entire world be satisfied.

original: yathābalaṃ cānuvicintayanti subhāṣitaṃ ekarasaṃ pi dharmam // / //
analyzed: yathābalam ca anuvicintayanti subhāṣitam ekarasam dharmam
translated: According to their abilities, they contemplate the well-spoken Dharma, which is of one taste.

original: tṛṇagulmakā vā yatha varṣamāṇe madhyā pi vā oṣadhiyo yathaiva /
analyzed: varṣamāṇe varṣamāṇe madhyā vai oṣadhiyaḥ yathā eva
translated: Like grass and bushes when it rains, or like the middle-sized medicinal herbs,

original: drumā pi vā te ca mahādrumā vā yatha śobhayante daśadikṣu sarve // / //
analyzed: drumāḥ vā te ca mahā drumāḥ vā śobhayante daśa dikṣu sarve
translated: And the trees, even the great trees, all beautify the ten directions.

original: iyaṃ sadā lokahitāya dharmatā tarpeti dharmeṇimu sarvalokam /
analyzed: iyam sadā loka hitāya dharma tā sarpa iti
translated: This is the nature of phenomena, always for the benefit of the world, it satisfies the entire world with the Dharma.

original: saṃtarpitaścāpyatha sarvalokaḥ pramuñcate oṣadhi puṣpakāṇi // / //
analyzed: saṃtarpitaḥ ca api atha sarva lokaḥ pramuñcate oṣadhi puṣpakāṇi
translated: And when the entire world is satisfied, it releases the flowers of medicinal herbs.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: madhyāpi ca oṣadhiyo vivardhayī arhanta ye te sthita āsravakṣaye /
analyzed: ca oṣadhiyaḥ arhanta ye te sthite āsrava kṣaye
translated: And the medicinal herbs grow, the arhats who abide in the cessation of defilements,

original: pratyekabuddhā vanaṣaṇḍacāriṇo niṣpādayī dharmamimaṃ subhāṣitam // / //
analyzed: pratyekabuddhāḥ vana ṣaṇḍa cāriṇaḥ dharmam imam su bhāṣitam
translated: The pratyekabuddhas who wander in the forest groves, they accomplish this well-spoken Dharma.

original: bahubodhisattvāḥ smṛtimanta dhīrāḥ sarvatra traidhātuki ye gatiṃgatāḥ /
analyzed: bahu bodhisattvāḥ dhīrāḥ sarvatra traidhātuki ye gatiṃgatāḥ
translated: Many wise and mindful bodhisattvas, who have penetrated everywhere in the three realms,

original: paryeṣamāṇā imamagrabodhiṃ drumā va vardhanti ti nityakālam // / //
analyzed: paryeṣamāṇāḥ imam agra bodhim drumāḥ vardhanti nityakālam
translated: Constantly seeking this supreme enlightenment, they grow like trees.

original: ye ṛddhimantaścatudhyānadhyāyino ye śūnyatāṃ śrutva janenti prītim /
analyzed: ye ṛddhimantaḥ catu dhyāna dhyāyinaḥ ye śūnyatām prītim
translated: Those who have spiritual powers and meditate on the four dhyānas, those who, having heard emptiness, generate joy,

original: raśmīsahasrāṇi pramuñcamānāste caiva vuccanti mahādrumā iha // / //
analyzed: raśmī sahasrāṇi pramuñcamānāḥ te ca eva vuccanti mahā drumāḥ iha
translated: Emitting thousands of light rays, they are called the great trees here.

original: etādṛśī kāśyapa dharmadeśanā meghena vā vāri samaṃ pramuktam /
analyzed: etādṛśī kāśyapa dharma deśanā meghena vā vāri samam pramuktam
translated: Such is the teaching of the Dharma, O Kāśyapa, like rain poured down evenly by a cloud,

original: bahvī vivardhanti mahauṣadhīyo manuṣyapuṣpāṇi anantakāni // / //
analyzed: bahvī vivardhanti mahauṣadhīyaḥ manuṣya puṣpāṇi anantakāni
translated: Many great medicines grow, and countless human flowers.

original: svapratyayaṃ dharma prakāśayāmi kālena darśemi ca buddhabodhim /
analyzed: sva pratyayam dharma prakāśayāmi kālena darśemi ca buddha bodhim
translated: I teach the Dharma according to my own understanding, and in time I show the enlightenment of the Buddhas.

original: upāyakauśalyu mamaitadagraṃ sarveṣa co lokavināyakānām // / //
analyzed: mama etat agram
translated: This is my foremost skillful means, of all the guides of the world.

original: paramārtha evaṃ mayaṃ bhūtabhāṣito te śrāvakāḥ sarvi na enti nirvṛtim /
analyzed: parama arthe evam te śrāvakāḥ na enti nirvṛtim
translated: The ultimate truth is thus spoken, but all my disciples do not attain nirvana.

original: caranti ete vara bodhicārikāṃ buddhā bhaviṣyantimi sarvaśrāvakāḥ // / //
analyzed: caranti ete vara bodhicārikām buddhāḥ sarva śrāvakāḥ
translated: They practice the supreme enlightenment, and all these disciples will become Buddhas.

original: punaraparaṃ kāśyapa tathāgataḥ sattvavinaye samo na cāsamaḥ /
analyzed: punar aparam kāśyapa tathāgataḥ sattva vinaye samaḥ na ca asamaḥ
translated: Furthermore, Kashyapa, the Tathagata is impartial in guiding beings, but not the same.

original: tadyathā kāśyapa candrasuryaprabhā sarvalokamavabhāsayati kuśalakāriṇamakuśalakāriṇaṃ cordhvāvasthitamadharāvasthitaṃ ca sugandhi durgandhi /
analyzed: tat yathā kāśyapa candra surya prabhā sarva lokam avabhāsayati kuśala kāriṇam a kuśala kāriṇam ca ūrdhva avasthitam adhara avasthitam ca sugandhi durgandhi
translated: Just as, Kashyapa, the light of the sun and moon illuminates the whole world, whether one is doing good or evil, whether one is above or below, whether one smells good or bad,

original: sā sarvatra samaṃ prabhā nipatati na viṣamam /
analyzed: sā sarvatra samam prabhā nipatati na viṣamam
translated: that light falls equally everywhere, not unevenly.

original: evameva kāśyapa tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ sarvajñajñānacittaprabhā sarveṣu
analyzed: evam eva kāśyapa tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām sarvajña jñāna citta prabhā sarveṣu
translated: In the same way, Kashyapa, the light of the mind of omniscience of the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Enlightened Ones, is in all

original: pañcagatyupapanneṣu sattveṣu yathādhimuktiṃ mahāyānikapratyekabuddhayānikaśrāvakayānikeṣu
analyzed: pañca gati upapanneṣu sattveṣu yathā adhimuktim mahā yānika pratyekabuddha yānika śrāvaka yānikeṣu
translated: For beings born in the five destinies, according to their inclinations, in the Mahāyāna, the Pratyekabuddhayāna, and the Śrāvakayāna,

original: saddharmadeśanā samaṃ pravartate /
analyzed: saddharma deśanā samam pravartate
translated: the teaching of the true Dharma proceeds equally.

original: na ca tathāgatasya jñānaprabhāyā ūnatā vā atiriktatā vā yathāpuṇyajñānasamudāgamāya saṃbhavati /
analyzed: na ca tathāgatasya jñāna prabhāyāḥ ūna tā vā atirikta tā vā yathā puṇya jñāna samudāgamāya saṃbhavati
translated: And there is no deficiency or excess in the Tathāgata's knowledge-light, as it occurs for the attainment of merit and knowledge.

original: na santi kāśyapa trīṇi yānāni /
analyzed: na santi kāśyapa trīṇi yānāni
translated: There are not, O Kāśyapa, three vehicles.

original: kevalamanyonyacaritāḥ sattvāḥ /
analyzed: kevalam anyonya caritāḥ sattvāḥ
translated: It is only beings with different practices.

original: tena trīṇi yānāni prajñapyante //
analyzed: tena trīṇi yānāni prajñapyante
translated: Therefore, three vehicles are designated.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Physician

original: evamukte āyuṣmān mahākāśyapo bhagavantametadavocat yadi bhagavan na santi trīṇi yānāni /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān mahākāśyapaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat yadi bhagavat na santi trīṇi yānāni
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Mahākāśyapa said to the Blessed One: If, Blessed One, there are not three vehicles,

original: kiṃ kāraṇaṃ pratyutpanne 'dhvani śrāvakapratyekabuddhabodhisattvānāṃ prajñaptiḥ prajñapyate /
analyzed: kim kāraṇam pratyutpanne dhvani śrāvaka pratyekabuddha bodhisattvānām prajñaptiḥ prajñapyate
translated: why is the designation of śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas made in the present time?

original: evamukte bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ mahākāśyapametadavocat tadyathā kāśyapa kumbhakāraḥ samāsu mṛttikāsu bhājanāni karoti /🔽tatra kānicid guḍabhājanāni bhavanti /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam mahākāśyapam etat avocat tat yathā kāśyapa kumbhakāraḥ samāsu mṛttikāsu bhājanāni karoti  tatra kānicid guḍa bhājanāni bhavanti
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the Venerable Mahākāśyapa: It is just as, O Kāśyapa, a potter makes vessels out of the same clay.🔽Some of them become vessels for molasses,

original: kānicid ghṛtabhājanāni /
analyzed: kānicid ghṛta bhājanāni
translated: some for ghee,

original: kānicid dadhikṣīrabhājanāni /
analyzed: kānicid dadhi kṣīra bhājanāni
translated: Some are vessels for curds and milk.

original: kānicid hīnānyaśucibhājanāni bhavanti /
analyzed: kānicid hīnāni aśuci bhājanāni bhavanti
translated: Some are inferior, impure vessels.

original: na ca mṛttikāyā nānātvam /
analyzed: na ca mṛttikāyāḥ nānātvam
translated: And yet the clay is not different.

original: atha ca dravyaprakṣepamātreṇa bhājanānāṃ nānātvaṃ prajñāyate /
analyzed: atha ca dravya prakṣepa mātreṇa bhājanānām nānātvam prajñāyate
translated: And yet, merely by the addition of substances, the difference of the vessels is known.

original: evameva kāśyapa ekamevedaṃ yānaṃ yaduta buddhayānam /
analyzed: evam eva kāśyapa ekam eva idam yānam yat uta buddha yānam
translated: In the same way, Kāśyapa, there is only one vehicle, namely the Buddha-vehicle.

original: na dvitīyaṃ na tṛtīyaṃ vā yānaṃ saṃvidyate //
analyzed: na dvitīyam na tṛtīyam vā yānam saṃvidyate
translated: There is no second vehicle, no third vehicle.

original: evamukte āyuṣmān mahākāśyapo bhagavantametadavocat yadyapi bhagavan sattvā nānādhimuktayo ye traidhātukānniḥsṛtāḥ /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān mahākāśyapaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat yadi api bhagavan sattvāḥ nānā adhimuktayaḥ ye traidhātukāt niḥsṛtāḥ
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Mahākāśyapa said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, even if beings have different aspirations and have escaped from the three realms,

original: kiṃ teṣāmekaṃ nirvāṇamuta dve trīṇi vā /
analyzed: kim teṣām ekam nirvāṇam uta dve trīṇi vā
translated: do they have one nirvāṇa or two or three?

original: bhagavānāha sarvadharmasamatāvabodhāddhi kāśyapa nirvāṇam /
analyzed: bhagavān āha sarva dharma samatā avabodhāt hi kāśyapa nirvāṇam
translated: The Blessed One said, Kāśyapa, nirvāṇa is due to the realization of the equality of all dharmas.

original: taccaikam / na dve na trīṇi /
analyzed: tat ca ekam na dve na trīṇi
translated: And that is one, not two, not three.

original: tena hi kāśyapa upamāṃ te kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: tena hi kāśyapa upamām te kariṣyāmi
translated: Therefore, Kāśyapa, I will give you a parable.

original: upamayā ihaikatyā vijñapuruṣā bhāṣitasyārthamājānanti /
analyzed: upamayā iha ekatyāḥ vijña puruṣāḥ bhāṣitasya artham ājānanti
translated: By means of a parable, some wise people understand the meaning of what is said.

original: tadyathā kāśyapa jātyandhaḥ puruṣaḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā kāśyapa jāti andhaḥ puruṣaḥ
translated: For example, Kāśyapa, there is a man who is born blind.

original: sa evaṃ brūyānna santi suvarṇadurvaṇāni rūpāṇi /
analyzed: saḥ evam brūyāt na santi suvarṇa durvaṇāni rūpāṇi
translated: He would say, 'There are no good or bad colors.'

original: na santi suvarṇadurvarṇānāṃ rūpāṇāṃ draṣṭāraḥ /
analyzed: na santi suvarṇa durvarṇānām rūpāṇām draṣṭāraḥ
translated: There are no observers of good and bad forms.

original: na staḥ sūryācandramasau /
analyzed: na staḥ sūryācandramasau
translated: There are no sun and moon.

original: na santi nakṣatrāṇi /🔽na santi grahāḥ /
analyzed: na santi nakṣatrāṇi  na santi grahāḥ
translated: There are no stars.🔽There are no planets.

original: na santi grahāṇāṃ draṣṭāraḥ /
analyzed: na santi grahāṇām draṣṭāraḥ
translated: There are no observers of planets.

original: athānye puruṣāstasya jātyandhasya puruṣasya purata evaṃ vadeyuḥ santi suvarṇadurvarṇāni rūpāṇi /
analyzed: atha anye puruṣāḥ tasya jāti andhasya puruṣasya puratas evam vadeyuḥ santi suvarṇa durvarṇāni rūpāṇi
translated: Then other men would say to that man who is blind from birth, 'There are good and bad forms.

original: santi suvarṇadurvarṇānāṃ rūpāṇāṃ draṣṭāraḥ /
analyzed: santi suvarṇa durvarṇānām rūpāṇām draṣṭāraḥ
translated: There are observers of good and bad forms.

original: staḥ sūryācandramasau /
analyzed: staḥ sūryācandramasau
translated: There are sun and moon.

original: santi nakṣatrāṇi /🔽santi grahāḥ /
analyzed: santi nakṣatrāṇi  santi grahāḥ
translated: There are stars.🔽There are planets.

original: santi grahāṇāṃ draṣṭāraḥ /
analyzed: santi grahāṇām draṣṭāraḥ
translated: There are observers of planets.'

original: sa ca jātyandhaḥ puruṣasteṣāṃ puruṣāṇāṃ na śraddadhyāt /
analyzed: sa ca jāti andhaḥ puruṣaḥ teṣām puruṣāṇām na śraddadhyāt
translated: But that man who is blind from birth would not believe those men.

original: noktaṃ gṛhṇīyāt /
analyzed: na uktam gṛhṇīyāt
translated: He would not accept their words.

original: atha kaścid vaidyaḥ sarvavyādhijñaḥ syāt /
analyzed: atha kaścid vaidyaḥ sarva vyādhi jñaḥ syāt
translated: Then some physician who knows all diseases

original: sa taṃ jātyandhaṃ puruṣaṃ paśyet /
analyzed: sa tam jāti andham puruṣam paśyet
translated: would see that man who is blind from birth.

original: tasyaivaṃ syāt tasya puruṣasya pūrvapāpena karmaṇā vyādhirutpannaḥ /
analyzed: tasya evam syāt tasya puruṣasya pūrva pāpena karmaṇā vyādhiḥ utpannaḥ
translated: He would think, 'That man's disease arose from his previous bad karma.

original: ye ca kecana vyādhaya utpadyante /
analyzed: ye ca kecana vyādhayaḥ utpadyante
translated: And whatever diseases arise,

original: te sarve caturvidhāḥ vātikāḥ paittikāḥ ślaiḥmikāḥ sāṃnipātikāśca /
analyzed: te sarve caturvidhāḥ vātikāḥ paittikāḥ ślaiḥmikāḥ sāṃnipātikāḥ ca
translated: they are all of four types: wind-related, bile-related, phlegm-related, and due to a combination of humors.'

original: atha sa vaidyastasya vyādhervyupaśamanārthaṃ punaḥ punarupāyaṃ cintayet /
analyzed: atha sa vaidyaḥ tasya vyādheḥ vyupaśamana artham punar punar upāyam cintayet
translated: Then that physician would repeatedly think of a means to alleviate that disease.

original: tasyaivaṃ syāt yāni khalvimāni dravyāṇi pracaranti /
analyzed: tasya evam syāt yāni khalu imāni dravyāṇi pracaranti
translated: He would think thus: 'Indeed, these substances that are used,

original: na taiḥ śakyo 'yaṃ vyādhiścikitsitum /
analyzed: na taiḥ śakyaḥ yam vyādhiḥ cikitsitum
translated: are not able to cure this disease.

original: santi tu himavati parvatarāje catasra oṣadhayaḥ /
analyzed: santi tu himavati parvata rāje catasraḥ oṣadhayaḥ
translated: But there are four herbs on the king of mountains, the Himalayas.

original: katamāścatasraḥ /
analyzed: katamāḥ catasraḥ
translated: What are the four?

original: tadyathā prathamā sarvavarṇarasasthānānugatā nāma /
analyzed: tat yathā prathamā sarvavarṇarasasthānānugatā nāma
translated: Namely, the first is called 'following all colors, tastes, and locations'.

original: dvitīyā sarvavyādhipramocanī nāma /
analyzed: dvitīyā sarvavyādhipramocanī nāma
translated: The second is called 'liberating from all diseases'.

original: tṛtīyā sarvaviṣavināśanī nāma /
analyzed: tṛtīyā sarvaviṣavināśanī nāma
translated: The third is called 'destroying all poisons'.

original: caturthī yathāsthānasthitasukhapradā nāma /
analyzed: caturthī yathāsthānasthitasukhapradā nāma
translated: The fourth is called 'giving happiness according to the location'.

original: imāścatasraḥ oṣadhayaḥ /
analyzed: imāḥ catasraḥ oṣadhayaḥ
translated: These are the four herbs.

original: atha sa vaidyastasmin jātyandhe kāruṇyamutpādya tādṛśamupāyaṃ cintayet /
analyzed: atha sa vaidyaḥ tasmin jāti andhe kāruṇyam utpādya tādṛśam upāyam cintayet
translated: Then that physician, having generated compassion for that congenitally blind man, would think of a means such as

original: yenopāyena himavantaṃ parvatarājaṃ śaknuyādgantam /🔽gatvā cordhvamapyārohet /
analyzed: yena upāyena himavantam parvata rājam śaknuyāt gantam  gatvā ca ūrdhvam api ārohet
translated: by which means he would be able to go to the Himalayas, the king of mountains.🔽And having gone, he would ascend upwards,

original: adho 'pyavataret /
analyzed: adhas pi avataret
translated: and descend downwards,

original: tiryagapipravicinuyāt /🔽sa evaṃ pravicinvaṃstāścatasra oṣadhīrārāgayet /
analyzed: tiryak apipravicinuyāt  saḥ evam pravicinvan tāḥ catasraḥ oṣadhīḥ ārāgayet
translated: and investigate even horizontally.🔽Investigating thus, he would obtain those four herbs.

original: ārāgya ca kāṃciddantaiḥ kṣoditāṃ kṛtvā dadyāt /
analyzed: ārāgya ca kāṃcid dantaiḥ kṣoditām kṛtvā dadyāt
translated: Having obtained them, he would crush some with his teeth and give them,

original: kāṃcit peṣayitvā dadyāt /🔽kāṃcidanyadravyasaṃyojitāṃ pācayitvā dadyāt /
analyzed: kāṃcid peṣayitvā dadyāt  kāṃcid anya dravya saṃyojitām pācayitvā dadyāt
translated: Some he should grind and give.🔽Some he should cook and give, mixed with other ingredients.

original: kāṃcidāmadravyasaṃyojitāṃ kṛtvā dadyāt /🔽kāṃcicchalākayā śarīrasthānaṃ viddhvā dadyāt /
analyzed: kāṃcid āma dravya saṃyojitām kṛtvā dadyāt  kāṃcid śalākayā śarīra sthānam viddhvā dadyāt
translated: Some he should prepare and give, mixed with other ingredients.🔽Some he should pierce a part of the body with a needle and give.

original: kāṃcidagninā paridāhya dadyāt /
analyzed: kāṃcid agninā paridāhya dadyāt
translated: Some he should burn with fire and give.

original: kāṃcidanyonyadravyasaṃyuktāṃ yāvat pānabhojanādiṣvapi yojayitvā dadyāt /
analyzed: kāṃcid anyonya dravya saṃyuktām yāvat pāna bhojana ādiṣu api yojayitvā dadyāt
translated: Some he should mix with other substances and give, up to adding them to drinks, food, etc.

original: atha sa jātyandhapuruṣastenopāyayogena cakṣuḥ pratilabheta /
analyzed: atha sa jāti andha puruṣaḥ tena upāya yogena cakṣuḥ pratilabheta
translated: Then that man born blind, by that method of application, would obtain sight.

original: sa pratilabdhacakṣurbahiradhyātmaṃ dūre āsanne ca candrasūryaprabhāṃ nakṣatrāṇi grahān sarvarūpāṇi ca paśyet /
analyzed: sa pratilabdha cakṣuḥ bahis adhyātmam dūre āsanne ca candra sūrya prabhām nakṣatrāṇi grahān sarva rūpāṇi ca paśyet
translated: Having obtained sight, he would see outside and inside, far and near, the light of the moon and sun, the stars and planets, and all forms.

original: evaṃ ca vadet aho batāhaṃ mūḍhaḥ /🔽yo 'haṃ pūrvamācakṣamāṇānāṃ na śraddadhāmi /
analyzed: evam ca vadet aho bata aham mūḍhaḥ  yaḥ ham pūrvam ācakṣamāṇānām na śraddadhāmi
translated: And he would say, Ah, indeed I was deluded.🔽I did not believe what was said to me before.

original: noktaṃ Vaidya gṛhṇāmi /
analyzed: na uktam vaidya gṛhṇāmi
translated: I did not accept the doctor's words.

original: so 'hamidānīṃ sarvaṃ paśyāmi /🔽mukto 'smi andhabhāvāt /
analyzed: saḥ u ham idānīm sarvam paśyāmi  muktaḥ smi andha bhāvāt
translated: But now I see everything.🔽I am freed from blindness.

original: pratilabdhacakṣuścāsmi /
analyzed: pratilabdha cakṣuḥ ca asmi
translated: I have obtained sight.

original: na ca me kaścid viśiṣṭataro 'stīti /
analyzed: na ca me kaścid viśiṣṭataraḥ sti iti
translated: And there is no one superior to me.

original: tena ca samayena pañcābhijñā ṛṣayo bhaveyurdivyacakṣurdivyaśrotraparacittajñānapūrvanivāsānusmṛtijñānarddhivimokṣakriyākuśalāḥ /
analyzed: tena ca samayena pañca abhijñāḥ ṛṣayaḥ bhaveyuḥ divya cakṣuḥ divya śrotra para citta jñāna pūrva nivāsa anusmṛti jñāna ṛddhi vimokṣa kriyā kuśalāḥ
