translated: At that time, there would be sages with the five higher knowledges, skilled in the divine eye, divine ear, knowledge of others' minds, knowledge of past lives, and miraculous liberations.

original: te taṃ puruṣamevaṃ vadeyuḥ kevalaṃ bhoḥ puruṣa tvayā cakṣuḥ pratilabdham /
analyzed: te tam puruṣam evam vadeyuḥ kevalam bhoḥ puruṣa tvayā cakṣuḥ pratilabdham
translated: They would say to that person, Oh, friend, you have only obtained the eye.

original: na tu bhavān kiṃcijjānāti /
analyzed: na tu bhavān kiṃcid jānāti
translated: But you do not know anything.

original: kuto 'bhimānaste samutpannaḥ /🔽na ca te 'sti prajñā /
analyzed: kutas bhimānaḥ te samutpannaḥ  na ca te sti prajñā
translated: Where did this pride arise in you?🔽You have no wisdom.

original: na cāsi paṇḍitaḥ /
analyzed: na ca asi paṇḍitaḥ
translated: You are not wise.

original: tamenamevaṃ vadeyuḥ yadā tvaṃ bhoḥ puruṣa antargṛhaṃ niṣaṇṇo bahiranyāni rūpāṇi na paśyasi /
analyzed: tam enam evam vadeyuḥ yadā tvam bhoḥ puruṣa antar gṛham niṣaṇṇaḥ bahis anyāni rūpāṇi na paśyasi
translated: They would say to him, When you are sitting in the house, you do not see other forms outside.

original: na ca jānāsi /
analyzed: na ca jānāsi
translated: You do not know.

original: nāpi te ye sattvāḥ snigdhacittā vā drugdhacittā vā /
analyzed: na api te ye sattvāḥ snigdha cittāḥ vā drugdha cittāḥ vā
translated: You do not recognize whether beings have a friendly mind or a hostile mind.

original: na vijānīṣe pañcayojanāntarasthitasya janasya bhāṣamāṇasya /
analyzed: na vijānīṣe pañca yojana antara sthitasya janasya bhāṣamāṇasya
translated: You do not understand the sound of a person speaking five yojanas away.

original: bherīśaṅkhādīnāṃ śabdaṃ na prajānāsi / na śṛṇoṣi /
analyzed: bherī śaṅkha ādīnām śabdam na prajānāsi na śṛṇoṣi
translated: You do not know the sound of a drum, conch, etc. You do not hear it.

original: krośāntaramapyanutkṣipya pādau na śaknoṣi gantum /
analyzed: krośa antaram api an utkṣipya pādau na śaknoṣi gantum
translated: You cannot walk without lifting your feet even a krośa away.

original: jātasaṃvṛddhaścāsi mātuḥ kukṣau /
analyzed: jāta saṃvṛddhaḥ ca asi mātuḥ kukṣau
translated: And you were born and grew up in your mother's womb.

original: tāṃ ca kriyāṃ na smarasi /
analyzed: tām ca kriyām na smarasi
translated: You do not remember that action.

original: tatkathamasi paṇḍitaḥ /
analyzed: tat katham asi paṇḍitaḥ
translated: How then are you wise?

original: kathaṃ ca sarvaṃ paśyāmīti
analyzed: katham ca sarvam paśyāmi iti
translated: And how do you say you see everything?

original: vadasi / tatsādhu bhoḥ puruṣa yadandhakāraṃ tatprakāśamiti saṃjānīṣe /
analyzed: vadasi tat sādhu bhoḥ puruṣa yat andhakāram tat prakāśam iti saṃjānīṣe
translated: Well then, man, it is good that you know what is darkness as light,

original: yacca prakāśaṃ tadandhakāramiti saṃjānīṣe //
analyzed: yat ca prakāśam tat andhakāram iti saṃjānīṣe
translated: and what is light as darkness.

original: atha sa puruṣastān ṛṣīnevaṃ vadet ka upāyaḥ /
analyzed: atha sa puruṣaḥ tān ṛṣīn evam vadet kaḥ upāyaḥ
translated: Then that man would say to those sages, What is the means?

original: kiṃ vā śubhaṃ karma kṛtvedṛśīṃ prajñāṃ pratilabheya /
analyzed: kim vā śubham karma kṛtvā īdṛśīm prajñām pratilabheya
translated: Having done what good karma, would I attain such wisdom?

original: yuṣmākaṃ prasādāccaitān guṇān pratilabheya /
analyzed: yuṣmākam prasādāt ca etān guṇān pratilabheya
translated: And by your grace, would I attain these qualities?

original: atha khalu te ṛṣayastasya puruṣasyaivaṃ kathayeyuḥ yadīcchasi /
analyzed: atha khalu te ṛṣayaḥ tasya puruṣasya evam kathayeyuḥ yadi icchasi
translated: Then indeed those sages would say to that man, If you wish,

original: araṇye vasa /
analyzed: araṇye vasa
translated: live in the forest.

original: parvataguhāsu vā niṣaṇṇo dharmaṃ cintaya /
analyzed: parvata guhāsu vā niṣaṇṇaḥ dharmam cintaya
translated: Sitting in mountain caves, contemplate the Dharma.

original: kleśāśca te prahātavyāḥ /
analyzed: kleśāḥ ca te prahātavyāḥ
translated: And you should abandon the afflictions.

original: tathā dhūtaguṇasamanvāgato 'bhijñāḥ pratilapsyase /
analyzed: tathā dhūta guṇa samanvāgataḥ bhijñāḥ pratilapsyase
translated: Thus endowed with the qualities of purity, you will attain the higher knowledges.

original: atha sa puruṣastamarthaṃ gṛhītvā pravrajitaḥ /
analyzed: atha sa puruṣaḥ tam artham gṛhītvā pravrajitaḥ
translated: Then that man, having taken up that meaning, would go forth.

original: araṇye vasan ekāgracitto lokatṛṣṇāṃ prahāya pañcābhijñāḥ prāpnuyāt /
analyzed: araṇye vasan ekāgra cittaḥ loka tṛṣṇām prahāya pañca abhijñāḥ prāpnuyāt
translated: Dwelling in the forest with a one-pointed mind, abandoning craving for the world, he would attain the five higher knowledges.

original: pratilabdhābhijñaśca cintayet yadahaṃ pūrvamanyatkarma kṛtavān /
analyzed: pratilabdha abhijñaḥ ca cintayet yat aham pūrvam anyat karma kṛtavān
translated: And having attained the higher knowledges, he would think, The other karma I previously did,

original: tena me na kaścid guṇo 'dhigataḥ /
analyzed: tena me na kaścid guṇaḥ dhigataḥ
translated: by that I have not attained any virtue.

original: idānīṃ yathācintitaṃ gacchāmi /
analyzed: idānīm yathā cintitam gacchāmi
translated: Now I will go as I have thought.

original: pūrvaṃ cāhamalpaprajño 'lpapratisaṃvedī andhabhūto 'smyāsīt //
analyzed: pūrvam ca aham alpa prajñaḥ lpa pratisaṃvedī andha bhūtaḥ smi āsīt
translated: Formerly I was of little wisdom, of little understanding, blind,

original: iti hi kāśyapa upamaiṣā kṛtā asyārthasya vijñaptaye /
analyzed: iti hi kāśyape upamā eṣā kṛtā asya arthasya vijñaptaye
translated: Thus, Kāśyapa, this is a simile made for the understanding of this meaning.

original: ayaṃ ca punaratrārtho draṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: ayam ca punar atra arthaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: And this meaning should be seen here.

original: jātyandha iti kāśyapa ṣaḍgatisaṃsārasthitānāṃ sattvānāmetadadhivacanam /
analyzed: jāti andhaḥ iti kāśyapa ṣaṣ gati saṃsāra sthitānām sattvānām etat adhivacanam
translated: Kāśyapa, the one born blind is a designation for beings dwelling in the six destinies of saṃsāra.

original: ye saddharmaṃ na jānanti /
analyzed: ye saddharmam na jānanti
translated: Those who do not know the true Dharma.

original: kleśatamondhakāraṃ ca saṃvardhayanti /
analyzed: kleśa tamaḥ ndhakāram ca saṃvardhayanti
translated: And they increase the darkness of the defilements.

original: te cāvidyāndhāḥ /
analyzed: te ca avidyā andhāḥ
translated: And they are blind with ignorance.

original: avidyāndhāśca saṃskārānupavicinvati /
analyzed: avidyā andhāḥ ca saṃskārān upavicinvati
translated: And the blind with ignorance accumulate the formative forces.

original: saṃskārapratyayaṃ ca nāmarūpam /
analyzed: saṃskāra pratyayam ca nāma rūpam
translated: And name-and-form has the formative forces as its condition.

original: yāvadevamasya kevalasya mahato duḥkhaskandhasya samudayo bhavati /
analyzed: yāvat evam asya kevalasya mahataḥ duḥkha skandhasya samudayaḥ bhavati
translated: And thus there is the origin of this entire great mass of suffering.

original: evamavidyāndhāstiṣṭhanti sattvāḥ saṃsāre /
analyzed: evam avidyā andhāḥ tiṣṭhanti sattvāḥ saṃsāre
translated: Thus beings dwell blind with ignorance in saṃsāra.

original: tathāgatastu karuṇāṃ janayitvā traidhātukānniḥsṛtaḥ piteva priye ekaputrake karuṇāṃ janayitvā traidhātuke 'vatīrya sattvān saṃsāracakre paribhramataḥ
analyzed: tathāgataḥ tu karuṇām janayitvā traidhātukāt niḥsṛtaḥ pitā iva priye eka putrake karuṇām janayitvā traidhātuke vatīrya sattvān saṃsāra cakre paribhramataḥ  /
translated: But the Tathāgata, having generated compassion, has emerged from the three realms, like a father generating compassion for his beloved only son, having descended into the three realms, sees beings wandering in the wheel of saṃsāra.

original: saṃpaśyati /
analyzed: saṃpaśyati
translated: He sees them.

original: na ca te saṃsārānniḥsaraṇaṃ prajānanti /
analyzed: na ca te saṃsārāt niḥsaraṇam prajānanti
translated: And they do not know how to escape from saṃsāra.

original: atha bhagavāṃstān prajñācakṣuṣā paśyati /
analyzed: atha bhagavān tān prajñā cakṣuṣā paśyati
translated: Then the Blessed One sees them with the eye of wisdom.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca jānāti amī sattvāḥ pūrvaṃ kuśalaṃ kṛtvā mandadveṣāstīvrarāgāḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca jānāti amī sattvāḥ pūrvam kuśalam kṛtvā manda dveṣāḥ tīvra rāgāḥ
translated: Having seen, he knows: These beings, having previously done what is wholesome, with weak hatred and strong passion,

original: mandarāgāstīvradveṣāḥ /
analyzed: manda rāgāḥ tīvra dveṣāḥ
translated: with weak passion and strong hatred,

original: kecidalpaprajñāḥ /
analyzed: kecid alpa prajñāḥ
translated: some with little wisdom,

original: kecit paṇḍitāḥ /
analyzed: kecid paṇḍitāḥ
translated: some wise,

original: kecitparipākaśuddhāḥ /
analyzed: kecid paripāka śuddhāḥ
translated: some with pure maturity,

original: kecinmithyādṛṣṭayaḥ /
analyzed: kecid mithyā dṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: some with wrong views,

original: teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ tathāgata upāyakauśalyena trīṇi yānāni deśayati /
analyzed: teṣām sattvānām tathāgataḥ upāya kauśalyena trīṇi yānāni deśayati
translated: for those beings the Tathāgata teaches the three vehicles with skillful means.

original: tatra yathā te ṛṣayaḥ pañcābhijñā viśuddhacakṣuṣaḥ /
analyzed: tatra yathā te ṛṣayaḥ pañca abhijñāḥ viśuddha cakṣuṣaḥ
translated: There, just as those sages with the five higher knowledges and pure eyes,

original: evaṃ bodhisattvā bodhicittānyutpādya anutpattikīṃ dharmakṣāntiṃ pratilabhya anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyante //
analyzed: evam bodhisattvāḥ bodhi cittāni utpādya an utpattikīm dharma kṣāntim pratilabhya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyante
translated: in the same way the bodhisattvas, having given rise to the mind of awakening, having attained the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas, fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: tatra yathāsau mahāvaidyaḥ /
analyzed: tatra yathā asau mahā vaidyaḥ
translated: There, just as that great physician,

original: evaṃ tathāgato draṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: evam tathāgataḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: the Tathāgata should be seen in the same way.

original: yathāsau jātyandhastathā mohāndhāḥ sattvā draṣṭavyāḥ /
analyzed: yathā asau jāti andhaḥ tathā moha andhāḥ sattvāḥ draṣṭavyāḥ
translated: Just as that one born blind, in the same way beings blinded by delusion should be seen.

original: yathā vātapittaśleṣmāṇaḥ /
analyzed: yathā vāta pitta śleṣmāṇaḥ
translated: Just as wind, bile, and phlegm,

original: evaṃ rāgadveṣamohāḥ /
analyzed: evam rāga dveṣa mohāḥ
translated: in the same way passion, hatred, and delusion,

original: dvāṣaṣṭi ca dṛṣṭikṛtāni draṣṭavyāni /
analyzed: dvāṣaṣṭi ca dṛṣṭi kṛtāni draṣṭavyāni
translated: and the sixty-two views should be seen.

original: yathā catasra oṣadhayastathā śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitanirvāṇadvāraṃ ca draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: yathā catasraḥ oṣadhayaḥ tathā śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita nirvāṇa dvāram ca draṣṭavyam
translated: And the doors of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness should be seen as like the four medicines.

original: yathā yathā dravyāṇyupayujyante /
analyzed: yathā yathā dravyāṇi upayujyante
translated: As the substances are used,

original: tathā tathā vyādhayaḥ praśāmyantīti /
analyzed: tathā tathā vyādhayaḥ praśāmyanti iti
translated: in the same way the diseases are pacified.

original: evaṃ śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitāni vimokṣamukhāni bhāvayitvā sattvā avidyāṃ nirodhayanti /
analyzed: evam śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitāni vimokṣa mukhāni bhāvayitvā sattvāḥ avidyām nirodhayanti
translated: Thus, having cultivated the doors of liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, beings put an end to ignorance.

original: avidyānirodhāt saṃskāranirodhaḥ /
analyzed: avidyā nirodhāt saṃskāra nirodhaḥ
translated: From the cessation of ignorance comes the cessation of volitional formations.

original: yāvadevamasya kevalasya mahato duḥkhaskandhasya nirodho bhavati /
analyzed: yāvat evam asya kevalasya mahataḥ duḥkha skandhasya nirodhaḥ bhavati
translated: In this way, there is the cessation of this entire great mass of suffering.

original: evaṃ cāsya cittaṃ na kuśale tiṣṭhati na pāpe //
analyzed: evam ca asya cittam na kuśale tiṣṭhati na pāpe
translated: And his mind does not remain in the wholesome or in the unwholesome.

original: yathā andhaścakṣuḥ pratilabhate /
analyzed: yathā andhaḥ cakṣuḥ pratilabhate
translated: Just as the blind person obtains sight,

original: tathā śrāvakapratyekabuddhayānīyo draṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: tathā śrāvaka pratyekabuddha yānīyaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: in the same way the followers of the Śrāvaka and Pratyekabuddha vehicles should be seen.

original: saṃsārakleśabandhanāni cchinatti /
analyzed: saṃsāra kleśa bandhanāni chinatti
translated: He cuts off the bonds of saṃsāra and afflictions.

original: kleśabandhanānnirmuktaḥ pramucyate ṣaṅgatikāt traidhātukāt /
analyzed: kleśa bandhanāt nirmuktaḥ pramucyate ṣaṅgatikāt traidhātukāt
translated: Liberated from the bonds of afflictions, he is released from the six destinies and the three realms.

original: tena śrāvakayānīyaḥ evaṃ jānāti /
analyzed: tena śrāvaka yānīyaḥ evam jānāti
translated: Therefore, the followers of the Śrāvaka vehicle know this:

original: evaṃ ca vācaṃ bhāṣate na santyapare dharmā abhisaṃboddhavyāḥ /
analyzed: evam ca vācam bhāṣate na santi apare dharmāḥ abhisaṃboddhavyāḥ
translated: And they speak these words: There are no other dharmas to be fully awakened to.

original: nirvāṇaprāpto 'smīti /
analyzed: nirvāṇa prāptaḥ smi iti
translated: I have attained nirvāṇa.

original: atha khalu tathāgatastasmai dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: atha khalu tathāgataḥ tasmai dharmam deśayati
translated: Then the Tathāgata teaches him the Dharma,

original: yena sarvadharmā na prāptāḥ /
analyzed: yena sarva dharmāḥ na prāptāḥ
translated: by which all dharmas are not attained.

original: kutastasya nirvāṇamiti /
analyzed: kutas tasya nirvāṇam iti
translated: How can he attain nirvāṇa?

original: taṃ bhagavān bodhau samādāpayati /
analyzed: tam bhagavān bodhau samādāpayati
translated: The Blessed One encourages him in enlightenment.

original: sa utpannabodhicitto na saṃsārasthito na nirvāṇaprāpto bhavati /
analyzed: saḥ utpanna bodhi cittaḥ na saṃsāra sthitaḥ na nirvāṇa prāptaḥ bhavati
translated: Having generated the thought of enlightenment, he does not remain in saṃsāra nor does he attain nirvāṇa.

original: so 'vabudhya traidhātukaṃ daśasu dikṣu śūnyaṃ nirmitopamaṃ māyopamaṃ svapnamarīcipratiśrutkopamaṃ lokaṃ paśyati /
analyzed: saḥ vabudhya traidhātukam daśasu dikṣu śūnyam nirmita upamam māyā upamam svapna marīci pratiśrutkā upamam lokam paśyati
translated: Having understood, he sees the world of the three realms as empty in the ten directions, like an illusion, like a dream, like a mirage, like an echo.

original: sa sarvadharmānanutpannānaniruddhān abaddhānamuktān atamondhakārān naprakāśān paśyati /
analyzed: sa sarva dharmān an utpannān a niruddhān a baddhān a muktān a tamaḥ undhakārān na prakāśān paśyati
translated: He sees all dharmas as unborn, unceased, unbound, unliberated, neither dark nor light.

original: ya evaṃ gambhīrān dharmān paśyati /
analyzed: yaḥ evam gambhīrān dharmān paśyati
translated: One who sees the profound dharmas in this way

original: sa paśyati apaśyanayā sarvatraidhātukaṃ paripūrṇamanyonyasattvāśayādhimuktam //
analyzed: sa paśyati a paśyanayā sarva traidhātukam paripūrṇam anyonya sattva āśaya adhimuktam
translated: sees the three realms completely filled with other beings' intentions and faiths, using the method of non-seeing.

original: atha khalu bhagavānimamevārthaṃ bhūyasyā mātrayā saṃdarśayamānaḥ tasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān imam eva artham bhūyasyā mātrayā saṃdarśayamānaḥ tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One, manifesting this very meaning even more, at that time spoke these verses:

original: candrasūryaprabhā yadvannipatanti samaṃ nṛṣu /
analyzed: candra sūrya prabhāḥ yadvat nipatanti samam nṛṣu
translated: Just as the light of the sun and moon falls equally on men,

original: guṇavatsvatha pāpeṣu prabhāyā nonapūrṇatā // / //
analyzed: guṇavatsu atha pāpeṣu prabhāyāḥ na ūna pūrṇa tā
translated: In the virtuous and the sinful, the light is not deficient or excessive.

original: tathāgatasya prajñābhā samā hyādityacandravat /
analyzed: tathāgatasya prajñā ābhā samā hi āditya candra vat
translated: The light of wisdom of the Tathāgata is equal, like the sun and moon.

original: sarvasattvān vinayate na conā naiva cādhikā // / //
analyzed: sarva sattvān vinayate na ca ūnā na eva ca adhikā
translated: It disciplines all beings, neither less nor more.

original: yathā kulālo mṛdbhāṇḍaṃ kurvan mṛtsu samāsvapi /
analyzed: yathā kulālaḥ mṛd bhāṇḍam kurvan mṛtsu samāsu api
translated: Just as a potter, working with clay of equal quality,

original: bhavanti bhājanā tasya guḍakṣīradhṛtāmbhasām // / //
analyzed: bhavanti tasya guḍa kṣīra dhṛta ambhasām
translated: produces vessels for jaggery, milk, ghee, and water.

original: aśuceḥ kānicittatra dadhno 'nyāni bhavanti tu /
analyzed: aśuceḥ kānicid tatra dadhnaḥ nyāni bhavanti tu
translated: Some of them are for impure substances, others for curd.

original: mṛdamekāṃ sa gṛhṇāti kurvan bhāṇḍāni bhārgavaḥ // / //
analyzed: mṛdam ekām sa gṛhṇāti kurvan bhāṇḍāni bhārgavaḥ
translated: The potter takes the same clay and makes various vessels.

original: yādṛk prakṣipyate dravyaṃ bhājanaṃ tena lakṣyate /
analyzed: yādṛś prakṣipyate dravyam bhājanam tena lakṣyate
translated: The vessel is indicated by the substance that is put into it.

original: sattvāviśeṣe 'pi tathā rucibhedāttathāgatāḥ // / //
analyzed: sattva aviśeṣe tathā ruci bhedāt tathāgatāḥ
translated: In the same way, the Tathāgatas, though not different in essence, are distinguished by the difference in the aspirations of beings.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: yānabhedaṃ varṇayanti buddhayānaṃ tu niṃścitam /
analyzed: yāna bhedam varṇayanti buddha yānam tu niṃścitam
translated: They describe the division of vehicles, but the Buddha vehicle is certain.

original: saṃsāracakrasyājñānānnirvṛtiṃ na vijānate // / //
analyzed: saṃsāra cakrasya ajñānāt nirvṛtim na vijānate
translated: Due to ignorance of the wheel of saṃsāra, they do not know nirvāṇa.

original: yastu śūnyān vijānāti dharmānātmavivarjitān /
analyzed: yaḥ tu śūnyān vijānāti dharmān ātma vivarjitān
translated: But one who knows that dharmas are empty and devoid of self,

original: saṃbuddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ bodhiṃ jānāti tattvataḥ // / //
analyzed: saṃbuddhānām bhagavatām bodhim jānāti tattvataḥ
translated: truly knows the enlightenment of the fully enlightened Blessed Ones.

original: prajñāmadhyavyavasthānāt pratyekajina ucyate /
analyzed: prajñā madhya vyavasthānāt pratyeka jinaḥ ucyate
translated: One who has middling wisdom is called a pratyekabuddha.

original: śūnyajñānavihīnatvācchrāvakaḥ saṃprabhāṣyate // / //
analyzed: śūnya jñāna vihīna tvāt śrāvakaḥ saṃprabhāṣyate
translated: Due to the lack of the knowledge of emptiness, one is called a śrāvaka.

original: sarvadharmāvabodhāttu samyaksaṃbuddha ucyate /
analyzed: sarva dharma avabodhāt tu samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ ucyate
translated: But due to the realization of all dharmas, one is called a perfectly enlightened one.

original: tenopāyaśatairnityaṃ dharmaṃ deśeti prāṇinām // / //
analyzed: tena upāya śataiḥ nityam dharmam deśeti prāṇinām
translated: Therefore, he always teaches the Dharma to beings through hundreds of skillful means.

original: yathā hi kaścijjātyandhaḥ sūryendugrahatārakāḥ /
analyzed: yathā hi kaścit jāti andhaḥ sūrya indu graha tārakāḥ
translated: Just as a congenitally blind person, not seeing the sun, moon, planets, and stars,

original: apaśyannevamāhāsau nāsti rūpāṇi sarvaśaḥ // / //
analyzed: a paśyan evam āha asau na asti rūpāṇi sarvaśas
translated: says in this way, Forms do not exist at all,

original: jātyandhe tu mahāvaidyaḥ kāruṇyaṃ saṃniveśya ha /
analyzed: jāti andhe tu mahā vaidyaḥ kāruṇyam saṃniveśya ha
translated: but the great physician, having generated compassion for the congenitally blind,

original: himavantaṃ sa gatvāna tiryagūrdhvamadhastathā // / //
analyzed: himavantam sa gatvāna tiryak ūrdhvam adhas tathā
translated: goes to the Himalayas and searches everywhere, above, below, and in the middle,

original: sarvavarṇarasthānā nagāllabhata oṣadhīḥ /
analyzed: nagāt labhate oṣadhīḥ
translated: and obtains medicinal herbs of all colors and forms from the mountain.

original: evamādīścatasro 'tha prayogamakarottataḥ // / //🔽dantaiḥ saṃcūrṇya kāṃcittu piṣṭvā cānyāṃ tathāparām /
analyzed: evamādīḥ catasraḥ tha prayogam akarot tatas  dantaiḥ saṃcūrṇya kāṃcid tu piṣṭvā ca anyām tathā aparām
translated: And then he prepares four types of remedies in this way:🔽some he grinds with his teeth, some he crushes, some he inserts with the tip of a needle into the body,

original: sūcyagreṇa praveśyāṅge jātyandhāya prayojayet // / //
analyzed: sūcī agreṇa praveśya aṅge jāti andhāya prayojayet
translated: and he applies them to the congenitally blind.

original: sa labdhacakṣuḥ saṃpaśyet sūryendugrahatārakāḥ /
analyzed: sa labdha cakṣuḥ saṃpaśyet sūrya indu graha tārakāḥ
translated: Having regained his sight, he sees the sun, moon, planets, and stars,

original: evaṃ cāsya bhavetpūrvajñānāttadudāhṛtam // / //
analyzed: evam ca asya bhavet pūrva jñānāt tat udāhṛtam
translated: and he says, This was spoken by one who had prior knowledge.

original: evaṃ sattvā mahājñānā jātyandhāḥ saṃsaranti hi /
analyzed: evam sattvāḥ mahā jñānāḥ jāti andhāḥ saṃsaranti hi
translated: In the same way, beings with great knowledge wander in saṃsāra, congenitally blind,

original: pratītyotpādacakrasya ajñānādduḥkhavartmanaḥ // / //
analyzed: pratītya utpāda cakrasya ajñānāt duḥkha vartmanaḥ
translated: Due to ignorance of the wheel of dependent origination, the path of suffering.

original: evamajñānasaṃmūḍhe loke sarvaviduttamaḥ /
analyzed: evam ajñāna saṃmūḍhe loke sarva vid uttamaḥ
translated: Thus, in a world deluded by ignorance, the supreme knower of all,

original: tathāgato mahāvaidya utpannaḥ karuṇātmakaḥ // / //
analyzed: tathāgataḥ mahā vaidyaḥ utpannaḥ karuṇā ātmakaḥ
translated: The Tathagata, the great physician, arose, having compassion as his essence.

original: upāyakuśalaḥ śāstā saddharmaṃ deśayatyasau /
analyzed: upāya kuśalaḥ śāstā saddharmam deśayati asau
translated: The teacher, skilled in means, teaches the true Dharma.

original: anuttarāṃ buddhabodhiṃ deśayatyagrayānike // / //🔽prakāśayati madhyāṃ tu madhyaprajñāya nāyakaḥ /
analyzed: anuttarām buddha bodhim deśayati agra yānike  prakāśayati madhyām tu madhya prajñāya nāyakaḥ
translated: He teaches the unsurpassed enlightenment of the Buddha to the foremost travelers.

original: saṃsārabhīrave bodhimanyāṃ saṃvarṇayatyapi // / //
analyzed: saṃsāra bhīrave bodhim anyām saṃvarṇayati api
translated: The leader also praises another kind of enlightenment to those who are afraid of samsara.

original: traidhātukānniḥsṛtasya śrāvakasya vijānataḥ /
analyzed: traidhātukāt niḥsṛtasya śrāvakasya vijānataḥ
translated: For the shravaka who has emerged from the three realms and knows,

original: bhavatyevaṃ mayā prāptaṃ nirvāṇamamalaṃ śivam // / //
analyzed: bhavati evam mayā prāptam nirvāṇam amalam śivam
translated: It is thus: I have attained the stainless and blissful nirvana.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Doctor

original: tāmeva tatra prakāśemi naitannirvāṇamucyate /
analyzed: tām eva tatra prakāśemi na etat nirvāṇam ucyate
translated: I reveal that very thing there, this is not called nirvana.

original: sarvadharmāvabodhāttu nirvāṇaṃ prāpyate 'mṛtam // / //
analyzed: sarva dharma avabodhāt tu nirvāṇam prāpyate mṛtam
translated: But nirvana, the deathless, is attained through the realization of all dharmas.

original: maharṣayo yathā tasmai karuṇāṃ saṃniveśya vai /
analyzed: mahā ṛṣayaḥ yathā tasmai karuṇām saṃniveśya vai
translated: Just as the great sages, having placed compassion in him,

original: kathayanti ca mūḍho 'si mā te 'bhūjjñānavānaham // / //
analyzed: kathayanti ca mūḍhaḥ si mā te bhūt jñānavān aham
translated: Say, You are deluded, let me not become one who has knowledge.

original: abhyantarāvasthitastvaṃ yadā bhavasi koṣṭhake /
analyzed: abhyantara avasthitaḥ tvam yadā bhavasi koṣṭhake
translated: When you are situated inside the stomach,

original: bahiryadvartate tadvai na jānīṣe tvamalpadhīḥ // / //
analyzed: bahis yat vartate tat vai na jānīṣe tvam alpa dhīḥ
translated: You, of little understanding, do not know what exists externally.

original: yo 'bhyantare 'vasthitastu bahirjñātaṃ kṛtākṛtam /
analyzed: yaḥ bhyantare vasthitaḥ tu bahis jñātam kṛta a kṛtam
translated: He who is within knows what has been done and not done externally,

original: so adyāpi na jānāti kutastvaṃ vetsyase 'lpadhīḥ // / //
analyzed: saḥ adya api na jānāti kutas tvam vetsyase lpa dhīḥ
translated: but even he does not know it yet, how much less can you, of little understanding, know it?

original: pañcayojanamātraṃ tu yaḥ śabdo niścarediha /
analyzed: pañca yojana mātram tu yaḥ śabdaḥ niścaret iha
translated: Even if a sound were to come forth here just five yojanas away,

original: taṃ śrotuṃ na samartho 'si prāgevānyaṃ vidūrataḥ // / //
analyzed: tam śrotum na samarthaḥ si prāk eva anyam vidūrataḥ
translated: you would not be able to hear it, how much less another from far away?

original: tvayi ye pāpacitta vā anunītāstathāpare /
analyzed: tvayi ye pāpa citta vā anunītāḥ tathā apare
translated: Those who have been influenced by evil thoughts towards you, and others as well,

original: te na śakyaṃ tvayā jñātumabhimānaḥ kuto 'sti te // / //
analyzed: te na śakyam tvayā jñātum abhimānaḥ kutas sti te
translated: you are not able to know them, how can you have pride in yourself?

original: krośamātre 'pi gantavye padavīṃ na vinā gatiḥ /
analyzed: krośa mātre gantavye padavīm na vinā gatiḥ
translated: Even when one has to go just a krośa, one cannot go without a path.

original: mātuḥ kukṣau ca yadvṛttaṃ vismṛtaṃ tattadeva te // / //
analyzed: mātuḥ kukṣau ca yat vṛttam vismṛtam tat tat eva te
translated: What happened in the mother's womb, that has been forgotten by you.

original: abhijñā yasya pañcaitāḥ sa sarvajña ihocyate /
analyzed: abhijñāḥ yasya pañca etāḥ sa sarvajñaḥ iha ucyate
translated: He who has these five higher knowledges is called omniscient here.

original: tvaṃ mohādapyakiṃcijjñaḥ sarvajño 'smīti bhāṣase // / //
analyzed: tvam mohāt api a kiṃcid jñaḥ sarvajñaḥ smi iti bhāṣase
translated: You, knowing nothing even out of delusion, speak of yourself as omniscient.

original: sarvajñatvaṃ prārthayase yadyabhijñābhinirhareḥ /
analyzed: sarvajña tvam prārthayase yadi abhijña abhinirhareḥ
translated: If you seek omniscience, you should manifest the higher knowledges.

original: taṃ cābhijñābhinirhāramaraṇyastho vicintaya /
analyzed: tam ca abhijñā abhinirhāram araṇya sthaḥ vicintaya
translated: And reflect on that manifestation of the higher knowledges while staying in the forest.

original: dharmaṃ viśuddhaṃ tena tvamabhijñāḥ pratilapsyase // / //
analyzed: dharmam viśuddham tena tvam abhijñāḥ pratilapsyase
translated: Through that pure Dharma, you will attain the higher knowledges.

original: so 'rthaṃ gṛhya gato 'raṇyaṃ cintayet susamāhitaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ ṛtham gṛhya gataḥ raṇyam cintayet su samāhitaḥ
translated: Having grasped that meaning, he goes to the forest and contemplates with complete concentration.

original: abhijñāḥ prāptavān pañca nacireṇa guṇānvitaḥ // / //
analyzed: abhijñāḥ prāptavān pañca nacireṇa guṇa anvitaḥ
translated: Endowed with qualities, he soon attains the five higher knowledges.

original: tathaiva śrāvakāḥ sarve prāptanirvāṇasaṃjñinaḥ /
analyzed: tathā eva śrāvakāḥ sarve prāpta nirvāṇa saṃjñinaḥ
translated: In the same way, all the disciples, conceiving of attaining nirvana,

original: jino 'tha deśayettasmai viśrāmo 'yaṃ na nirvṛtiḥ // / //
analyzed: deśayet tasmai viśrāmaḥ yam na nirvṛtiḥ
translated: the Victor then teaches them, This is a rest, not nirvana.

original: upāya eṣa buddhānāṃ vadanti yadimaṃ nayam /
analyzed: upāyaḥ eṣa buddhānām vadanti yat imam nayam
translated: This is the method of the Buddhas, if they proclaim this way.

original: sarvajñatvamṛte nāsti nirvāṇaṃ tatsamārabha // / //
analyzed: sarvajña tvam ṛte nā asti nirvāṇam tat samārabha
translated: Apart from omniscience, there is no nirvana, therefore one should strive for it.

original: tryadhvajñānamanantaṃ ca ṣaṭ ca pāramitāḥ śubhāḥ /
analyzed: tri adhva jñānam anantam ca ṣaḍ ca pāramitāḥ śubhāḥ
translated: The infinite knowledge of the three times and the six pure perfections,

original: śūnyatāmanimittaṃ ca praṇidhānavivarjitam // / //
analyzed: śūnyatām animittam ca praṇidhāna vivarjitam
translated: Emptiness, signlessness, and the abandonment of wishes,

original: bodhicittaṃ ca ye cānye dharmā nirvāṇagāminaḥ /
analyzed: bodhi cittam ca ye ca anye dharmāḥ nirvāṇa gāminaḥ
translated: The enlightenment mind and other dharmas leading to nirvana,

original: sāsravānāsravāḥ śāntāḥ sarve gaganasaṃnibhāḥ // / //
analyzed: sa āsrava anāsravāḥ śāntāḥ sarve gagana saṃnibhāḥ
translated: With and without outflows, peaceful, all like the sky.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: brahmavihārāścatvāraḥ saṃgrahā ye ca kīrtitāḥ /
analyzed: brahmavihārāḥ catvāraḥ saṃgrahāḥ ye ca kīrtitāḥ
translated: The four Brahma abodes and the four immeasurables,

original: sattvānāṃ vinayārthāya kīrtitāḥ paramarṣibhiḥ // / //
analyzed: sattvānām vinaya arthāya kīrtitāḥ parama ṛṣibhiḥ
translated: Proclaimed by the supreme sages for the purpose of taming beings.

original: yaśca dharmān vijānāti māyāsvapnasvabhāvakān /
analyzed: yaḥ ca dharmān vijānāti māyā svapna svabhāvakān
translated: And he who knows the dharmas as having the nature of illusion and dream,

original: kadalīskandhaniḥsārān pratiśrutkāsamānakān // / //
analyzed: kadalī skandha niḥsārān pratiśrutkā samānakān
translated: Like the trunk of a plantain tree, insubstantial, like an echo.

original: tatsvabhāvaṃ ca jānāti traidhātukamaśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: tad svabhāvam ca jānāti traidhātukam aśeṣatas
translated: And he knows their nature, the entire three realms,

original: abaddhamavimuktaṃ ca na vijānāti nirvṛtim // / //
analyzed: abaddham avimuktam ca na vijānāti nirvṛtim
translated: Unbound and unliberated, he does not know nirvana.

original: sarvadharmān samān śūnyānnirnānākaraṇātmakān /
analyzed: sarva dharmān samān śūnyān niḥ nānā karaṇa ātmakān
translated: All dharmas are equal, empty, without any differentiation,

original: na caitān prekṣate nāpi kiṃciddharmaṃ vipaśyati // / //
analyzed: na ca etān prekṣate na api kiṃcid dharmam vipaśyati
translated: And he does not see them, nor does he perceive any dharma.

original: sa paśyati mahāprajño dharmakāyamaśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: sa paśyati mahā prajñaḥ dharmakāyam aśeṣatas
translated: That one of great wisdom sees the Dharma body in its entirety,

original: nāsti yānatrayaṃ kiṃcidekayānamihāsti tu // / //
analyzed: na asti yāna trayam kiṃcid eka yānam iha asti tu
translated: There is no Triyāna at all, here there is only the Ekayāna.

original: sarvadharmāḥ samāḥ sarve samāḥ samasamāḥ sadā /
analyzed: sarva dharmāḥ samāḥ sarve samāḥ sama samāḥ sadā
translated: All dharmas are equal, all are equal, always equally equal.

original: evaṃ jñātvā vijānāti nirvāṇamamṛtaṃ śivam // / //
analyzed: evam jñātvā vijānāti nirvāṇam amṛtam śivam
translated: Knowing thus, he knows nirvana, the deathless, the auspicious.

original: ityāryasaddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye oṣadhīparivarto nāma pañcamaḥ //
analyzed: iti ārya saddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye oṣadhīparivartaḥ nāma pañcamaḥ
translated: Thus ends the chapter on herbs, the fifth chapter in the noble Dharma discourse called the White Lotus of the True Dharma.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vaidya

original: vyākaraṇaparivartaḥ /
analyzed: vyākaraṇa parivartaḥ
translated: The Chapter on Predictions

original: atha khalu bhagavānimā gāthā bhāṣitvā sarvāvantaṃ bhikṣusaṃghamāmantrayate sma ārocayāmi vo bhikṣavaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān imāḥ gāthāḥ bhāṣitvā sarvāvantam bhikṣu saṃgham āmantrayate smaḥ ārocayāmi vaḥ bhikṣavaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One, having spoken these verses, addressed the entire assembly of monks: Monks, I declare to you,

original: prativedayāmi /
analyzed: prativedayāmi
translated: I make it known to you,

original: ayaṃ mama śrāvakaḥ kāśyapo bhikṣustriṃśato buddhakoṭīsahasrāṇāmantike satkāraṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: ayam mama śrāvakaḥ kāśyapaḥ bhikṣuḥ triṃśataḥ buddha koṭī sahasrāṇām antike satkāram kariṣyati
translated: This bhikṣu Kāśyapa, my disciple, will make offerings to three hundred thousand koṭis of buddhas.

original: gurukāraṃ mānanāṃ pūjanāmarcanāmapacāyanāṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: gurukāram mānanām pūjanām arcanām apacāyanām kariṣyati
translated: He will show them respect, honor, praise, and venerate them.

original: teṣāṃ ca buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ saddharmaṃ dhārayiṣyati /🔽sa paścime samucchraye avabhāsaprāptāyāṃ lokadhātau mahāvyūhe kalpe raśmiprabhāso
analyzed: teṣām ca buddhānām bhagavatām saddharmam dhārayiṣyati  sa paścime samucchraye avabhāsaprāptāyām lokadhātau mahāvyūhe kalpe raśmiprabhāsaḥ
translated: He will uphold the true Dharma of those buddhas.

original: nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho loke bhaviṣyati vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato
analyzed: nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke bhaviṣyati vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ
translated: In his final existence, in the world system called Avabhāsa-prāptā, in the kalpa called Mahāvyūha, he will appear in the world as the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One named Raśmi-prabhāsa,🔽accomplished in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata,

original: lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca buddho bhagavān /🔽dvādaśa cāsyāntarakalpānāyuṣpramāṇaṃ bhaviṣyati /🔽viṃśatiṃ cāsyāntarakalpān saddharmaḥ sthāsyati /
analyzed: loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca buddhaḥ bhagavān  dvādaśa ca asya antara kalpān āyuṣpramāṇam bhaviṣyati  viṃśatim ca asya antara kalpān saddharmaḥ sthāsyati
translated: a knower of the world, an unsurpassed guide for those to be tamed, a teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, a Bhagavān.🔽His lifespan will be twelve intermediate kalpas.🔽His true Dharma will remain for twenty intermediate kalpas.

original: viṃśatimevāntarakalpān saddharmapratirūpakaḥ sthāsyati /
analyzed: viṃśatim eva antara kalpān saddharma pratirūpakaḥ sthāsyati
translated: The semblance of his true Dharma will also remain for twenty intermediate kalpas.

original: taccāsya buddhakṣetraṃ śuddhaṃ bhaviṣyati śuci apagatapāṣāṇaśarkarakaṭhalyamapagataśvabhraprapātamapagatasyandanikāgūtholigallaṃ
analyzed: tat ca asya buddhakṣetram śuddham bhaviṣyati śuci apagata pāṣāṇa śarkara kaṭhalyam apagata śvabhra prapātam apagata syandanikā gūtha uligallam
translated: And that buddha realm of his will be pure, clean, free of stones, pebbles, and gravel, free of chasms and cliffs, free of ditches, excrement, and swamps,

original: samaṃ ramaṇīyaṃ prāsādikaṃ darśanīyaṃ vaiḍūryamayaṃ ratnavṛkṣapratimaṇḍitaṃ suvarṇasūtrāṣṭāpadanibaddhaṃ puṣpābhikīrṇam /
analyzed: samam ramaṇīyam prāsādikam darśanīyam vaiḍūrya mayam ratna vṛkṣa pratimaṇḍitam suvarṇa sūtra aṣṭāpada nibaddham puṣpa abhikīrṇam
translated: even, delightful, beautiful, and pleasant to see, made of beryl, adorned with jeweled trees, with golden cords marking out the squares, and strewn with flowers.

original: bahūni ca tatra bodhisattvaśatasahasrāṇyutpatsyante /
analyzed: bahūni ca tatra bodhisattva śata sahasrāṇi utpatsyante
translated: And many hundreds of thousands of bodhisattvas will be born there.

original: aprameyāṇi ca tatra śrāvakakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: aprameyāṇi ca tatra śrāvaka koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi bhaviṣyanti
translated: And there will be immeasurable many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of śrāvakas there.

original: na ca tatra māraḥ pāpīyānavatāraṃ lapsyate /
analyzed: na ca tatra māraḥ pāpīyān avatāram lapsyate
translated: And Māra the wicked one will not find an opportunity there.

original: na ca māraparṣat prajñāsyate /
analyzed: na ca māra parṣad prajñāsyate
translated: And the assembly of Māra will not be known there.

original: bhaviṣyanti tatra khalu punarmāraśca māraparṣadaśca /
analyzed: bhaviṣyanti tatra khalu punar māraḥ ca māra parṣadaḥ ca
translated: But there will be Māra and the assembly of Māra there.

original: api tu khalu punastatra lokadhātau tasyaiva bhagavato raśmiprabhāsasya tathāgatasya śāsane saddharmaparigrahāyābhiyuktā bhaviṣyanti //
analyzed: api tu khalu punar tatra lokadhātau tasya eva bhagavataḥ raśmiprabhāsasya tathāgatasya śāsane saddharma parigrahāya abhiyuktāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: But in that world system, they will be devoted to upholding the true Dharma of that very Tathāgata Raśmiprabhāsa.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses on that occasion:

original: paśyāmyahaṃ bhikṣava buddhacakṣuṣā sthaviro hyayaṃ kāśyapa buddha bheṣyati /
analyzed: paśyāmi aham bhikṣava buddha cakṣuṣā sthaviraḥ hi ayam kāśyapa buddha
translated: I see with the eye of a Buddha, monks, that this elder Kāśyapa will become a Buddha.

original: anāgate 'dhvāni asaṃkhyakalpe kṛtvāna pūjāṃ dvipadottamānām // / //
analyzed: anāgate asaṃkhya kalpe pūjām dvipada uttamānām
translated: In the future, after countless eons, having made offerings to the highest of two-legged beings...

original: triṃśatsahasrāḥ paripūrṇakoṭyo jinānayaṃ drakṣyati kāśyapo hyayam /
analyzed: triṃśat sahasrāḥ paripūrṇa koṭyaḥ jinān ayam drakṣyati kāśyapaḥ hi ayam
translated: Kāśyapa will see thirty thousand fully complete koṭis of Jinas.

original: cariṣyatī tatra ca brahmacaryaṃ bauddhasya jñānasya kṛtena bhikṣavaḥ // / //
analyzed: cariṣyatī tatra ca brahmacaryam bauddhasya jñānasya kṛtena bhikṣavaḥ
translated: And he will practice the holy life there, monks, for the sake of the knowledge of a Buddha...

original: kṛtvāna pūjāṃ dvipadottamānāṃ samudāniya jñānamidaṃ anuttaram /
analyzed: pūjām dvipada uttamānām samudāniya jñānam idam anuttaram
translated: Having made offerings to the highest of two-legged beings, and having attained this unsurpassed knowledge,

original: sa paścime cocchrayi lokanātho bhaviṣyate apratimo maharṣiḥ // / //
analyzed: sa paścime ca ucchrayi loka nāthaḥ bhaviṣyate apratimaḥ mahā ṛṣiḥ
translated: In his last existence, he will become a protector of the world, an unequaled great sage.

original: kṣetraṃ ca tasya pravaraṃ bhaviṣyati vicitra śuddhaṃ śubha darśanīyam /
analyzed: kṣetram ca tasya pravaram bhaviṣyati vicitra śuddham śubha darśanīyam
translated: And his realm will be supreme, varied, pure, beautiful, and pleasant to behold,

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vaidya

original: manojñarūpaṃ sada premaṇīyaṃ suvarṇasūtraiḥ samalaṃkṛtaṃ ca // / //
analyzed: manojña rūpam suvarṇa sūtraiḥ samalaṃkṛtam ca
translated: Always delightful and lovely to behold, adorned with golden threads...

original: ratnāmayā vṛkṣa tahiṃ vicitrā aṣṭāpadasmiṃ tahi ekameke /
analyzed: ratna āmayāḥ ekam eke
translated: There will be jeweled trees of various kinds, one for each square,

original: manojñagandhaṃ ca vimuñcamānā bheṣyanti kṣetrasmi imasmi bhikṣo // / //
analyzed: manojña gandham ca vimuñcamānāḥ bheṣyanti
translated: Emitting a delightful fragrance, monks, in this realm...

original: puṣpaprakāraiḥ samalaṃkṛtaṃ ca vicitrapuṣpairupaśobhitaṃ ca /
analyzed: puṣpa prakāraiḥ samalaṃkṛtam ca vicitra puṣpaiḥ upaśobhitam ca
translated: Adorned with various flowers, and beautified with various flowers,

original: śvabhraprapātā na ca tatra santi samaṃ śivaṃ bheṣyati darśanīyam // / //
analyzed: śvabhra prapātāḥ na ca tatra santi samam śivam darśanīyam
translated: There will be no ravines or precipices, it will be level, peaceful, and beautiful.

original: tahi bodhisattvāna sahasrakoṭyaḥ sudāntacittāna maharddhikānām /
analyzed: bodhisattvāna sahasra koṭyaḥ su dānta cittāna maharddhikānām
translated: There will be thousands of koṭis of bodhisattvas there, with well-tamed minds, of great spiritual power,

original: vaipulyasūtrāntadharāṇa tāyināṃ bahū bhaviṣyanti sahasra neke // / //
analyzed: tāyinām bahū bhaviṣyanti na eke
translated: Many thousands of them will be holders of the extensive sūtras, protectors,

original: anāsravā antimadehadhāriṇo bheṣyanti ye śrāvaka dharmarājñaḥ /
analyzed: anāsravāḥ antima deha dhāriṇaḥ ye śrāvaka dharmarājñaḥ
translated: The śrāvakas of the Dharma King will be free from defilements, bearing their last bodies.

original: pramāṇu teṣāṃ na kadāci vidyate divyena jñānena gaṇitva kalpān // / //
analyzed: pramāṇu teṣām na kadāci vidyate divyena jñānena gaṇitva kalpān
translated: Their number will never be known, even by divine knowledge, if one were to count for eons.

original: so dvādaśa antarakalpa sthāsyati saddharma viṃśāntarakalpa sthāsyati /
analyzed: saḥ dvādaśa antara kalpa sthāsyati saddharma viṃśa antara kalpa sthāsyati
translated: It will last for twelve intermediate eons, the true Dharma will last for twenty intermediate eons,

original: pratirūpakaścāntarakalpa viṃśatiṃ raśmiprabhāsasya viyūha bheṣyati // / //
analyzed: pratirūpakaḥ ca antara kalpa viṃśatim raśmiprabhāsasya viyūha
translated: And the semblance Dharma will last for twenty intermediate eons, the array of the radiance of the light rays of Raśmiprabhāsa will be so.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān mahāmaudgalyāyanaḥ sthavira āyuṣmāṃśca subhūtirāyuṣmāṃśca mahākātyāyanaḥ pravepamānaiḥ kāyairbhagavantamanimiṣairnetrairvyavalokayanti 🔽sma /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān mahāmaudgalyāyanaḥ sthaviraḥ āyuṣmān ca subhūtiḥ āyuṣmān ca mahākātyāyanaḥ pravepamānaiḥ kāyaiḥ bhagavantam animiṣaiḥ netraiḥ vyavalokayanti  /🔽sma
translated: Then the elder venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, the venerable Subhūti, and the venerable Mahākātyāyana, with trembling bodies, gazed unblinkingly at the Blessed One with their eyes.

original: tasyāṃ ca velāyāṃ pṛthak pṛthaṅamanaḥsaṃgītyā imā gāthā abhāṣanta
analyzed: tasyām ca velāyām pṛthak pṛthaṅ a manaḥ saṃgītyā imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣanta
translated: And at that time, each with a single voice, they spoke these verses:

original: arhanta he mahāvīra śākyasiṃha narottama /
analyzed: arhanta he mahāvīra śākyasiṃha narottama
translated: O Arhat, O Great Hero, Lion of the Shakyas, Supreme One among Men,

original: asmākamanukampāya buddhaśabdamudīraya // / //🔽avaśyamavasaraṃ jñātvā asmākaṃ pi narottama /
analyzed: asmākam anukampāya buddha śabdam udīraya  avaśyam avasaram jñātvā asmākam nara uttama
translated: Out of compassion for us, utter the sound of the Buddha.🔽O Supreme One among Men, having surely understood the opportunity for us,

original: amṛteneva siñcitvā vyākuruṣva vibhojana // / //
analyzed: amṛtena iva siñcitvā vyākuruṣva
translated: Having sprinkled us with the nectar, explain, O Great Teacher.

original: durbhikṣādāgataḥ kaścinnaro labdhvā subhojanam /
analyzed: durbhikṣāt āgataḥ kaścid naraḥ labdhvā su bhojanam
translated: Just as a man who has come from a famine-stricken land, having obtained good food,

original: pratīkṣa bhūya ucyeta hastaprāptasmi bhojane // / //
analyzed: pratīkṣa bhūyas ucyeta bhojane
translated: Would wait for more, saying 'I have obtained food in my hand,'

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Physician

original: evamevotsukā asmo hīnayānaṃ vicintaya /
analyzed: evam eva utsukā hīnayānam vicintaya
translated: In the same way, we are eager, thinking of the Lesser Vehicle,

original: duṣkālabhuktasattvā vā buddhajñānaṃ labhāmahe // / //
analyzed: duṣkāla bhukta sattvāḥ vā buddha jñānam labhāmahe
translated: As if beings who have eaten at the wrong time would obtain the knowledge of the Buddha.

original: na tāvadasmān saṃbuddho vyākaroti mahāmuniḥ /
analyzed: na tāvat asmān saṃbuddhaḥ vyākaroti mahā muniḥ
translated: The Fully Enlightened One, the Great Sage, does not yet prophesy us,

original: yathā hastasmi prakṣiptaṃ na tadbhuñjīta bhojanam // / //
analyzed: yathā prakṣiptam na tat bhuñjīta bhojanam
translated: Just as one would not eat the food that has been put in the hand.

original: evaṃ ca utsukā vīra śrutvā ghoṣamanuttaram /
analyzed: evam ca utsukāḥ vīra śrutvā ghoṣam anuttaram
translated: In the same way, O Hero, we are eager, having heard the unsurpassed sound,

original: vyākṛtā yada bheṣyāmastadā bheṣyāma nirvṛtāḥ // / //
analyzed: vyākṛtāḥ nirvṛtāḥ
translated: When we will be prophesied, then we will be at peace.

original: vyākarohi mahāvīra hitaiṣī anukampakaḥ /
analyzed: vyākarohi mahāvīra hita eṣī anukampakaḥ
translated: Prophesy, O Great Hero, the one who wishes for our benefit, the compassionate one,

original: api dāridryacittānāṃ bhavedanto mahāmune // / //
analyzed: api dāridrya cittānām bhavet antaḥ mahā mune
translated: May there be an end to the poverty-stricken minds of those who are poor, O Great Sage.”

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃsteṣā mahāśrāvakāṇāṃ sthavirāṇāmimamevaṃrūpaṃ cetasaiva cetaḥparivitarkamājñāya
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān teṣām mahāśrāvakāṇām sthavirāṇām imam evaṃrūpam cetasā eva cetaḥ parivitarkam ājñāya
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing with his mind the thoughts in the minds of those great disciples, the elders,

original: punarapi sarvāvantaṃ bhikṣusaṃghamāmantrayate sma ayaṃ me bhikṣavo mahāśrāvakaḥ
analyzed: punar api sarvāvantam bhikṣu saṃgham āmantrayate sma  ayam me bhikṣavaḥ mahāśrāvakaḥ
translated: again addressed the entire assembly of monks: This, monks, is my great disciple,

original: sthaviraḥ subhūtistriṃśata eva buddhakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇāṃ satkāraṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: sthaviraḥ subhūtiḥ triṃśataḥ eva buddha koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇām satkāram kariṣyati
translated: the elder Subhūti, who will render service to three hundred thousand koṭis of nayutas of Buddhas,

original: gurukāraṃ mānanāṃ pūjanāmarcanāmapacāyanāṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: gurukāram mānanām pūjanām arcanām apacāyanām kariṣyati
translated: and will perform acts of veneration, respect, homage, and praise.

original: tatra ca brahmacaryaṃ cariṣyati /
analyzed: tatra ca brahmacaryam cariṣyati
translated: He will practice celibacy there,

original: bodhiṃ ca samudānayiṣyati /
analyzed: bodhim ca samudānayiṣyati
translated: and will attain enlightenment.

original: evaṃrūpāṃścādhikārān kṛtvā paścime samucchraye śaśiketurnāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho🔽loke bhaviṣyati vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ
analyzed: evaṃrūpān ca adhikārān kṛtvā paścime samucchraye śaśiketuḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ  loke bhaviṣyati vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ
translated: Having rendered such service, in his last existence he will become the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One named Śaśiketu,🔽a knower of the world, a leader of men to be tamed, a teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, a blessed one.

original: śāstā devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: śāstā devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: He will be the teacher of gods and humans.

original: ratnasaṃbhavaṃ ca nāmāsya tad buddhakṣetraṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ratnasaṃbhavam ca nāma asya tat buddhakṣetram bhaviṣyati
translated: His buddha realm will be called Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: ratnāvabhāsaśca nāma sa kalpo bhaviṣyati /🔽samaṃ ca tad buddhakṣetraṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ratnāvabhāsaḥ ca nāma sa kalpaḥ bhaviṣyati  samam ca tat buddhakṣetram bhaviṣyati
translated: That eon will be called Ratnāvabhāsa.

original: ramaṇīyaṃ sphaṭikamayaṃ ratnavṛkṣavicitritamapagataśvabhraprapātamapagatagūtholigallaṃ manojñaṃ puṣpābhikīrṇam /
analyzed: ramaṇīyam sphaṭika mayam ratna vṛkṣa vicitritam apagata śvabhra prapātam apagata gūtha uligallam manojñam puṣpa abhikīrṇam
translated: That buddha realm will be even, delightful, made of crystal, adorned with jeweled trees, free from pits and cliffs, free from feces and urine, delightful, strewn with flowers,

original: kūṭāgāraparibhogeṣu cātra puruṣā vāsaṃ kalpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: kūṭāgāra paribhogeṣu ca atra puruṣāḥ vāsam kalpayiṣyanti
translated: and the men there will live in palaces.

original: bahavaścāsya śrāvakā bhaviṣyantyaparimāṇāḥ /
analyzed: bahavaḥ ca asya śrāvakāḥ bhaviṣyanti aparimāṇāḥ
translated: He will have many innumerable disciples,

original: yeṣāṃ na śakyaṃ gaṇanayā paryanto 'dhigantum /
analyzed: yeṣām na śakyam gaṇanayā paryantaḥ dhigantum
translated: whose number cannot be known by calculation.

original: bahūni cātra bodhisattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi bhaviḥyanti /
analyzed: bahūni ca atra bodhisattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi bhaviḥyanti
translated: There will be many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of bodhisattvas there.

original: tasya ca bhagavato dvādaśāntarakalpānāyuḥpramāṇaṃ bhaviḥyati /🔽viṃśatiṃ cāntarakalpān saddharmaḥ sthāsyati /
analyzed: tasya ca bhagavataḥ dvādaśa antara kalpān āyuḥ pramāṇam  viṃśatim ca antara kalpān saddharmaḥ sthāsyati
translated: The lifespan of that Bhagavān will be twelve intermediate eons.🔽The true Dharma will remain for twenty intermediate eons.

original: viṃśatimevāntarakalpān saddharmapratirūpakaḥ sthāsyati /
analyzed: viṃśatim eva antara kalpān saddharma pratirūpakaḥ sthāsyati
translated: The semblance Dharma will remain for twenty intermediate eons.

original: sa ca bhagavān vaihāyasamantarīkḥe sthitvā abhīkḥṇaṃ dharmaṃ deśayiḥyati /
analyzed: sa ca bhagavān vaihāyasam antarīkṣe sthitvā abhīkḥṇam dharmam deśayiḥyati
translated: And that Bhagavān, remaining in the sky in the intermediate space, will often teach the Dharma.

original: bahūni ca bodhisattvaśatasahasrāṇi bahūni ca śrāvakaśatasahasrāṇi vineḥyati //
analyzed: bahūni ca bodhisattva śata sahasrāṇi bahūni ca śrāvaka śata sahasrāṇi vineḥyati
translated: And he will guide many hundreds of thousands of bodhisattvas and many hundreds of thousands of śrāvakas.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses on that occasion:

original: ārocayāmi ahamadya bhikṣavaḥ prativedayāmyadya mamā śṛṇotha /
analyzed: ārocayāmi aham adya bhikṣavaḥ prativedayāmi adya
translated: I declare to you today, monks, I make it known today, listen to me.

original: sthaviraḥ subhūtirmama śrāvako 'yaṃ bhaviṣyate buddha anāgate 'dhvani // / //
analyzed: sthaviraḥ subhūtiḥ mama śrāvakaḥ yam bhaviṣyate anāgate
translated: This elder Subhūti, my śrāvaka, will become a buddha in the future.

original: buddhāṃśca paśyitva mahānubhāvān triṃśacca pūrṇānayutāna koṭīḥ /🔽Vaidya
analyzed: buddhān ca mahā anubhāvān triṃśat ca koṭīḥ  vaidya
translated: Having seen many buddhas of great power, thirty full nayuta koṭis,

original: cariṣyate carya tadānulomikīmimasya jñānasya kṛtena caiṣaḥ // / //
analyzed: cariṣyate tad ānulomikīm imasya jñānasya kṛtena ca eṣaḥ
translated: he will practice the way that accords with this knowledge for the sake of this wisdom.

original: sa paścime vīra samucchrayasmin dvātriṃśatīlakṣaṇarūpadhārī /🔽suvarṇayūpapratimo maharṣirbhaviṣyate lokahitānukampī // / //
analyzed: sa paścime vīra dvātriṃśatī lakṣaṇa rūpa dhārī  suvarṇa yūpa pratimaḥ mahā ṛṣiḥ bhaviṣyate loka hita anukampī
translated: In his last existence, the hero, endowed with the thirty-two marks,🔽will become a great sage, a golden sacrificial post, compassionate towards beings.

original: sudarśanīyaṃ ca sukṣetra bheṣyati iṣṭaṃ manojñaṃ ca mahājanasya /
analyzed: su darśanīyam ca iṣṭam manojñam ca mahājanasya
translated: He will be a beautiful field, pleasing and delightful to the great multitude.

original: vihariṣyate yatra sa lokabandhustāritva prāṇīnayutāna koṭīḥ // / //
analyzed: vihariṣyate yatra sa lokabandhuḥ koṭīḥ
translated: There he will dwell, the friend of the world, having liberated many nayuta koṭis of beings.

original: bahubodhisattvātra mahānubhāvā avivartyacakrasya pravartitāraḥ /
analyzed: bahu bodhisattvāḥ atra mahā anubhāvāḥ a vivartya cakrasya pravartitāraḥ
translated: Many bodhisattvas of great power, who will turn the irreversible wheel,

original: tīkṣṇendriyāstasya jinasya śāsane ye śobhayiṣyanti ta buddhakṣetram // / //
analyzed: tīkṣṇa indriyāḥ tasya jinasya śāsane ye śobhayiṣyanti buddhakṣetram
translated: And those with sharp faculties in the teachings of that Jina, who will adorn that Buddha-field.

original: bahuśrāvakāstasya na saṃkhya teṣāṃ pramāṇu naivāsti kadāci teṣām /
analyzed: bahu śrāvakāḥ tasya na teṣām
translated: Many shravakas of his, their number incalculable, never having a measure of them,

original: ṣaḍabhijña traividya maharddhikāśca aṣṭāvimokṣeṣu pratiṣṭhitāśca // / //
analyzed: ṣaḍabhijña traividya maharddhikāḥ ca aṣṭāvimokṣeṣu pratiṣṭhitāḥ ca
translated: Possessing the six higher knowledges, the three knowledges, great spiritual powers, and established in the eight liberations.

original: acintiyaṃ ṛddhibalaṃ ca bheṣyati prakāśayantasyimamagrabodhim /
analyzed: acintiyam ṛddhi balam ca prakāśayantasya imam agra bodhim
translated: Inconceivable will be his spiritual power and strength, as he teaches this supreme enlightenment.

original: devā manuṣyā yatha gaṅgavālikā bheṣyanti tasyo satataṃ kṛtāñjalī // / //🔽so dvādaśo antarakalpa sthāsyapi saddharmu viṃśāntarakalpa sthāsyati /
analyzed: devāḥ manuṣyāḥ satatam kṛtāñjalī  saḥ dvādaśaḥ antara kalpaḥ sthāsī api saddharmu viṃśa antara kalpaḥ sthāsyati
translated: Gods and humans, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, will always have their palms joined to him.🔽He will remain for twelve intermediate eons, and the true Dharma will remain for twenty intermediate eons.

original: pratirūpako viṃśatimeva sthāsyati kalpāntarāṇi dvipadottamasya // / //
analyzed: pratirūpakaḥ viṃśatim eva sthāsyati kalpa antarāṇi dvipada uttamasya
translated: The semblance Dharma will remain for twenty intermediate eons, of that supreme human.

original: atha khalu bhagavān punareva sarvāvantaṃ bhikṣusaṃghamāmantrayate sma ārocayāmi vo bhikṣayaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān punar eva sarvāvantam bhikṣu saṃgham āmantrayate smaḥ ārocayāmi vaḥ bhikṣayaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One again addressed the entire assembly of monks: I declare to you, monks!

original: prativedayāmi /
analyzed: prativedayāmi
translated: I inform you!

original: ayaṃ mama śrāvakaḥ sthaviro mahākātyāyano 'ṣṭānāṃ buddhakoṭīśatasahasrāṇāmantike satkāraṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: ayam mama śrāvakaḥ sthaviraḥ mahākātyāyano ṣṭānām buddha koṭī śata sahasrāṇām antike satkāram kariṣyati
translated: This my disciple, the elder Mahākātyāyana, will render service to eight hundred thousand koṭis of nayutas of Buddhas,

original: gurukāraṃ mānanāṃ pūjanāmarcanāmapacāyanāṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: gurukāram mānanām pūjanām arcanām apacāyanām kariṣyati
translated: and will revere, venerate, honor, and make offerings to them.

original: parinirvṛtānāṃ ca teṣāṃ tathāgatānāṃ stūpān kariṣyati yojanasahasraṃ samucchrayeṇa pañcāśad yojanāni pariṇāhena saptānāṃ ratnānām /
analyzed: parinirvṛtānām ca teṣām tathāgatānām stūpān kariṣyati yojana sahasram samucchrayeṇa pañcāśat yojanāni pariṇāhena saptānām ratnānām
translated: And when those Tathāgatas have attained final nirvāṇa, he will make stūpas for them, one yojana high and five hundred yojanas in circumference, made of the seven precious substances,

original: tadyathā suvarṇasya rūpyasya vaiḍūryasya sphaṭikasya lohitamukteraśmargabhasya musāragalvasya saptamasya ratnasya /
analyzed: tat yathā suvarṇasya rūpyasya vaiḍūryasya sphaṭikasya lohitamukteḥ aśmargabhasya musāragalvasya saptamasya ratnasya
translated: namely gold, silver, beryl, crystal, red pearls, emerald, and coral.

original: teṣāṃ ca stūpānāṃ pūjāṃ kariṣyati puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākāvaijayantībhiśca Vaidya /
analyzed: teṣām ca stūpānām pūjām kariṣyati puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākā vaijayantībhiḥ ca vaidya
translated: And he will make offerings to those stūpas with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, flags, and banners.

original: tataśca bhūyaḥ pareṇa paratareṇa punarviśatīnāṃ buddhakoṭīnāmantike evarūpameva satkāraṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: tatas ca bhūyas pareṇa paratareṇa punar viśatīnām buddha koṭīnām antike evarūpam eva satkāram kariṣyati
translated: And after that, even further on, he will render such service to two hundred thousand koṭis of nayutas of Buddhas,

original: gurukāraṃ mānanāṃ pūjanāmarcanāmapacāyanāṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: gurukāram mānanām pūjanām arcanām apacāyanām kariṣyati
translated: and will revere, venerate, honor, and make offerings to them.

original: sa paścime samucchraye paścime ātmabhāvapratilambhe jāmbūnadaprabhāso nāma tathāgato🔽'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho loke bhaviṣyati vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ
analyzed: sa paścime samucchraye paścime ātma bhāva pratilambhe jāmbūnadaprabhāsaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ  rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke bhaviṣyati vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ
translated: In his last existence, in his last birth, he will become the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One named Jāmbūnadaprabhāsa,

original: puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca buddho bhagavan /
analyzed: puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca buddhaḥ bhagavan
translated: the one endowed with knowledge and good conduct, the Sugata, the knower of the world, the unexcelled charioteer of persons to be tamed, the teacher of gods and humans, the Buddha, the Blessed One.

original: pariśuddhaṃ cāsya buddhakṣetraṃ bhaviṣyati samaṃ ramaṇīyaṃ prāsādikaṃ darśanīyaṃ
analyzed: pariśuddham ca asya buddhakṣetram bhaviṣyati samam ramaṇīyam prāsādikam darśanīyam
translated: His Buddha-field will be pure, even, delightful, beautiful,

original: sphaṭikamayaṃ ratnavṛkṣābhivicitritaṃ suvarṇasūtrācchoḍitaṃ puṣpasaṃstarasaṃstṛtamapagatanirayatiryagyoniyamalokāsurakāyaṃ
analyzed: sphaṭika mayam ratna vṛkṣa abhivicitritam suvarṇa sūtra ācchoḍitam puṣpa saṃstara saṃstṛtam apagata niraya tiryagyoni yama loka asura kāyam
translated: made of crystal, adorned with various jeweled trees, marked with golden cords, covered with flower carpets, free from the realms of hells, animals, and hungry ghosts, and free from the bodies of asuras.

original: bahunaradevapratipūrṇaṃ bahuśrāvakaḥatasahasropaḥobhitaṃ bahubodhisattvaḥatasahasrālaṃkṛtam /
analyzed: bahu naradeva pratipūrṇam bahu śrāvaka ḥata sahasra upaḥobhitam bahu bodhisattva ḥata sahasra alaṃkṛtam
translated: It will be filled with many humans and gods, surrounded by many thousands of Śrāvakas, and adorned with many thousands of Bodhisattvas.

original: dvādaḥa cāsya antarakalpānāyuṣpramāṇaṃ bhaviṣyati /🔽viṃḥatiṃ cāsya antarakalpān saddharmaḥ sthāsyati /
analyzed: ca asya antara kalpān āyuṣpramāṇam bhaviṣyati  ca asya antara kalpān saddharmaḥ sthāsyati
translated: His lifespan will be twelve intermediate eons.🔽His True Dharma will remain for twenty intermediate eons.

original: viṃḥatimevāntarakalpān saddharmapratirūpakaḥ sthāsyati //
analyzed: sthāsyati
translated: The semblance of his True Dharma will also remain for twenty intermediate eons.🔽(Thus have I heard.)

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses on that occasion:

original: śṛṇotha me bhikṣava adya sarve udāharantasya girāmananyathām /
analyzed: śṛṇotha me bhikṣavaḥ adya sarve udāharantasya girām ananyathām
translated: Listen to me, all you monks, today, as I utter words that are not otherwise.

original: kātyāyanaḥ sthaviru ayaṃ mi śrāvakaḥ kariṣyate pūja vināyakānām // / //
analyzed: kātyāyanaḥ sthaviru ayam mi śrāvakaḥ kariṣyate pūja vināyakānām
translated: This elder Kātyāyana, my disciple, will make offerings to the guides.

original: satkāru teṣāṃ ca bahuprakāraṃ bahūvidhaṃ lokavināyakānām /
analyzed: satkāru teṣām ca bahu prakāram bahūvidham loka vināyakānām
translated: He will make many kinds of offerings to the world's guides in many ways,

original: stūpāṃśca kārāpayi nirvṛtānāṃ puṣpehi gandhehi ca pūjayiṣyati // / //
analyzed: stūpān ca nirvṛtānām puṣpehi gandhehi ca pūjayiṣyati
translated: And will also make stūpas for those who have passed into nirvāṇa, and will worship them with flowers and incense.

original: labhitva so paścimakaṃ samucchrayaṃ pariśuddhakṣetrasmi jino bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: labhitvā saḥ paścimakam samucchrayam jinaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Having attained his final birth, he will become a victor in a pure field.

original: paripūrayitvā imameva jñānaṃ deśeṣyate prāṇisahasrakoṭinām // / //
analyzed: paripūrayitvā imam eva jñānam deśeṣyate prāṇi sahasra koṭinām
translated: Having fulfilled this very knowledge, he will teach it to many millions of beings.

original: sa satkṛto loki sadevakasmin prabhākaro buddha vibhurbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: sa satkṛtaḥ loki sa devakasmin prabhākaraḥ buddha vibhuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: He will be honored in the world together with the gods, and will become a radiant and powerful buddha.

original: jāmbūnadābhāsu sa cāpi nāmnā saṃtārako devamanuṣyakoṭinām // / //
analyzed: jāmbūnada ābhāsu sa ca api nāmnā saṃtārakaḥ deva manuṣya koṭinām
translated: His name will be Jāmbūnadābhāsa, and he will liberate millions of gods and humans.

original: bahubodhisattvāstatha śrāvakāśca amitā asaṃkhyā pi ca tatra kṣetre /
analyzed: śrāvakāḥ ca amitāḥ asaṃkhyā ca tatra kṣetre
translated: There will be many bodhisattvas and śrāvakas there in that field, immeasurable and countless.

original: upaśobhayiṣyanti ti buddhaśāsanaṃ bhavaprahīṇā vibhavāśca sarve // / //
analyzed: upaśobhayiṣyanti ti buddha śāsanam bhava prahīṇāḥ vibhavāḥ ca sarve
translated: They will beautify the Buddha's teachings, and all of them will be free from becoming and destruction.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: atha khalu bhagavān punareva sarvāvantaṃ bhikṣusaṃghamāmantrayate sma ārocayāmi vo bhikṣavaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān punar eva sarvāvantam bhikṣu saṃgham āmantrayate smaḥ ārocayāmi vaḥ bhikṣavaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One again addressed the entire assembly of monks: Bhikṣus, I declare to you,

original: prativedayāmi /
analyzed: prativedayāmi
translated: I make it known to you,

original: ayaṃ mama śrāvakaḥ sthaviro mahāmaudgalyāyano 'ṣṭāviṃśatibuddhasahasrāṇyārāgayiṣyati /
analyzed: ayam mama śrāvakaḥ sthaviraḥ mahāmaudgalyāyanaḥ ṣṭāviṃśati buddha sahasrāṇi ārāgayiṣyati
translated: that this elder disciple of mine, Mahāmaudgalyāyana, will serve twenty-eight thousand buddhas,

original: teṣāṃ ca buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ vividhaṃ satkāraṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: teṣām ca buddhānām bhagavatām vividham satkāram kariṣyati
translated: and will perform various kinds of worship for those Buddha Bhagavats.

original: gurukāraṃ mānanāṃ pūjanāmarcanāmapacāyanāṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: gurukāram mānanām pūjanām arcanām apacāyanām kariṣyati
translated: He will perform acts of respect, honor, reverence, and worship.

original: parinirvṛtānāṃ ca teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ stūpān kārayiṣyati saptaratnamayān /
analyzed: parinirvṛtānām ca teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām stūpān kārayiṣyati sapta ratna mayān
translated: And when those Buddha Bhagavats have passed into parinirvāṇa, he will make stūpas for those Buddha Bhagavats out of the seven precious substances.

original: tadyathā suvarṇasya rūpyasya vaidūryasya sphaṭikasya lohitamukteraśmagarbhasya musāragalvasya /
analyzed: tat yathā suvarṇasya rūpyasya vaidūryasya sphaṭikasya lohitamukteḥ aśmagarbhasya musāragalvasya
translated: Namely, gold, silver, lapis lazuli, crystal, red pearl, emerald, and coral.

original: yojanasahasraṃ samucchrayeṇa pañcayojanaśatāni pariṇāhena /
analyzed: yojana sahasram samucchrayeṇa pañca yojana śatāni pariṇāhena
translated: One thousand yojanas in height and five hundred yojanas in circumference.

original: teṣāṃ ca stūpānāṃ vividhāṃ pūjāṃ kariṣyati puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākāvaijayantībhiḥ /
analyzed: teṣām ca stūpānām vividhām pūjām kariṣyati puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākā vaijayantībhiḥ
translated: He will make various offerings to those stūpas, with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, pennants, and flags.

original: tataśca bhūyaḥ pareṇa paratareṇa viṃśaterbuddhakoṭīśatasahasrāṇāmevaṃrūpameva satkāraṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: tatas ca bhūyas pareṇa paratareṇa viṃśateḥ buddha koṭī śata sahasrāṇām evaṃrūpam eva satkāram kariṣyati
translated: Then, even more, after that, for twenty thousand koṭis of Buddhas, he will make offerings of this kind.

original: gurukāraṃ mānanāṃ pūjanāmarcanāmapacāyanāṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: gurukāram mānanām pūjanām arcanām apacāyanām kariṣyati
translated: He will make offerings, respect, honor, praise, and venerate them.

original: paścime ca ātmabhāvapratilambhe tamālapatracandanagandho nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho🔽loke bhaviṣyati vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ
analyzed: paścime ca ātma bhāva pratilambhe tamālapatracandanagandhaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ  loke bhaviṣyati vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ
translated: In his last lifetime, he will become the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One named Tamāla-pattra-candana-gandha,

original: śāstā devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: śāstā devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: the one endowed with knowledge and conduct, the Sugata, the knower of the world, the unsurpassed guide for those to be tamed, the teacher of gods and humans, the Buddha, the Blessed One.

original: manobhirāmaṃ ca nāmāsya tadbuddhakṣetraṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: manobhirāmam ca nāma asya tat buddhakṣetram bhaviṣyati
translated: His Buddha-field will be called Manobhirāma.

original: ratiprapūrṇaśca nāma sa kalpo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ratiprapūrṇaḥ ca nāma sa kalpaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: That eon will be called Ratipūrṇa.

original: pariśuddhaṃ cāsya tadbuddhakṣetraṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: pariśuddham ca asya tat buddhakṣetram bhaviṣyati
translated: His Buddha-field will be pure.

original: samaṃ ramaṇīyaṃ prāsādikaṃ sudarśanīyaṃ sphaṭikamayaṃ ratnavṛkṣābhivicitritaṃ muktakusumābhikīrṇaṃ
analyzed: samam ramaṇīyam prāsādikam su darśanīyam sphaṭika mayam ratna vṛkṣa abhivicitritam mukta kusuma abhikīrṇam
translated: It will be even, delightful, beautiful, and pleasant to behold, made of crystal, adorned with jeweled trees, and strewn with loose flowers.

original: bahunaradevapratipūrṇamṛṣiśatasahasraniṣevitaṃ yaduta śrāvakaiśca bodhisattvaiśca /
analyzed: bahu naradeva pratipūrṇam ṛṣi śata sahasra niṣevitam yat uta śrāvakaiḥ ca bodhisattvaiḥ ca
translated: It will be filled with many humans and gods, and will be frequented by hundreds of thousands of sages, namely disciples and bodhisattvas.

original: caturviśatiṃ cāsya antarakalpānāyuṣpramāṇaṃ bhaviṣyati /🔽catvāriṃśacca antarakalpān saddharmaḥ sthāsyati /
analyzed: caturviśatim ca asya antara kalpān āyuṣpramāṇam bhaviṣyati  catvāriṃśat ca antara kalpān saddharmaḥ sthāsyati
translated: His lifespan will be twenty-four intermediate eons.🔽The true Dharma will remain for forty intermediate eons.

original: catvāriṃśadeva antarakalpān saddharmapratirūpakaḥ sthāsyati //
analyzed: catvāriṃśat eva antara kalpān saddharma pratirūpakaḥ sthāsyati
translated: The semblance of the true Dharma will remain for another forty intermediate eons.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses on that occasion:

original: maudgalyagotro mama śrāvako 'yaṃ jahitva mānuṣyakamātmabhāvam /
analyzed: maudgalya gotraḥ mama śrāvakaḥ yam jahitvā mānuṣyakam ātmabhāvam
translated: This disciple of mine, Maudgalyagotra, having abandoned his human body,

original: viṃśatsahasrāṇi jināna tāyināmanyāṃśca aṣṭau virajāna drakṣyati // / //
analyzed: viṃśat sahasrāṇi tāyinām anyān ca aṣṭau virajāna drakṣyati
translated: will see twenty thousand victorious protectors and eight other stainless ones.

original: cariṣyate tatra ca brahmacaryaṃ bauddhaṃ imaṃ jñāna gaveṣamāṇaḥ /
analyzed: cariṣyate tatra ca brahmacaryam bauddham imam jñāna gaveṣamāṇaḥ
translated: He will practice the holy life there, seeking this knowledge of the Buddha,

original: satkāru teṣāṃ dvipadottamānāṃ vividhaṃ tadā kāhi vināyakānām // / //
analyzed: teṣām dvipada uttamānām vividham tadā vināyakānām
translated: and will make various offerings to those supreme humans, the guides.

original: saddharmu teṣāṃ vipulaṃ praṇītaṃ dhāretva kalpāna sahasrakoṭyaḥ /
analyzed: saddharmu teṣām vipulam praṇītam kalpāna sahasra koṭyaḥ
translated: They will uphold the vast and excellent true Dharma for thousands of koṭis of kalpas,

original: pūjāṃ ca stūpeṣu kariṣyate tadā parinirvṛtānāṃ sugatāna teṣām // / //
analyzed: pūjām ca stūpeṣu kariṣyate tadā parinirvṛtānām teṣām
translated: And will make offerings to the stūpas of those Sugatas who have attained parinirvāṇa.

original: ratnāmayān stūpa savaijayantān kariṣyate teṣa jinottamānām /
analyzed: ratna āmayān sa vaijayantān kariṣyate jina uttamānām
translated: They will make stūpas of jewels with victory banners for those supreme Jinas,

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vaidya

original: puṣpehi gandhehi ca pūjayanto vādyehi vā lokahitānukampinām // / //
analyzed: puṣpehi gandhehi ca pūjayantaḥ vādyehi vā loka hita anukampinām
translated: Making offerings with flowers, incense, and music to those who are compassionate towards the world.

original: tatpaścime caiva samucchrayasmin priyadarśane tatra manojñakṣetre /
analyzed: tad paścime ca eva priya darśane tatra manojña kṣetre
translated: In his last existence, in the delightful and beautiful field,

original: bhaviṣyate lokahitānukampī tamālapatracandanagandha nāmnā // / //
analyzed: bhaviṣyate loka hita anukampī tamālapatracandanagandha nāmnā
translated: There will be one compassionate towards the world, named Tamālapatracandanagandha.

original: caturviśapūrṇāntarakalpa tasya āyuṣpramāṇaṃ sugatasya bheṣyati /
analyzed: tasya āyuṣpramāṇam sugatasya
translated: His lifespan will be twenty-four intermediate kalpas, and he will be a Sugata.

original: prakāśayantasyima buddhanetrīṃ manujeṣu deveṣu ca nityakālam // / //
analyzed: buddha netrīm manujeṣu deveṣu ca nityakālam
translated: Constantly teaching this Buddha's eye to humans and gods.

original: bahuśrāvakātasya jinasya tatra koṭī sahasrā yatha gaṅgavālikāḥ /
analyzed: jinasya tatra koṭī gaṅgavālikāḥ
translated: He will have many śrāvakas of the Jina there, in the millions, like the sands of the Ganges.

original: ṣaḍabhijña traividya maharddhikāśca abhijñaprāptāḥ sugatasya śāsane // / //
analyzed: ṣaḍabhijña traividya maharddhikāḥ ca abhijña prāptāḥ sugatasya śāsane
translated: Possessing the six higher knowledges, the three knowledges, and great spiritual powers, they will attain higher knowledge in the Sugata's teachings.

original: avaivartikāśco bahubodhisattvā ārabdhavīryāḥ sada saṃprajānāḥ /
analyzed: bahu bodhisattvāḥ ārabdha vīryāḥ
translated: And many irreversible bodhisattvas, who were always diligent and mindful,

original: abhiyuktarūpāḥ sugatasya śāsane teṣāṃ sahasrāṇi bahūni tatra // / //🔽parinirvṛtasyāpi jinasya tasya saddharmu saṃsthāsyati tasmi kāle /
analyzed: abhiyukta rūpāḥ sugatasya śāsane teṣām sahasrāṇi bahūni tatra  parinirvṛtasya api jinasya tasya saddharmu saṃsthāsyati tasmi kāle
translated: Who were devoted to the teaching of the Sugata, many thousands of them,🔽Even after the nirvana of that Jina, the true Dharma will remain for twenty full intermediate eons.

original: viṃśacca viṃśāntarakalpa pūrṇā etatpramāṇaṃ pratirūpakasya // / //
analyzed: viṃśat ca viṃśa antara kalpa pūrṇā etat pramāṇam pratirūpakasya
translated: This is the extent of the Counterfeit Dharma.

original: maharddhikāḥ pañca mi śrāvakā ye nirdiṣṭa ye te maya agrabodhaye /
analyzed: maharddhikāḥ pañca mi śrāvakāḥ ye nirdiṣṭa ye te
translated: The five greatly powerful Shravakas who were designated by me for supreme enlightenment,

original: anāgate 'dhvāni jināḥ svayaṃbhuvasteṣāṃ ca caryāṃ śṛṇuthā mamāntikāt // / //
analyzed: anāgate jināḥ svayaṃbhuvaḥ teṣām ca caryām śṛṇuthāḥ mama antikāt
translated: Listen from me, in the future, to the conduct of those self-existing Jinas.

original: ityāryasaddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye vyākaraṇaparivarto nāma ṣaṣṭhaḥ //
analyzed: iti ārya saddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye vyākaraṇaparivartaḥ nāma ṣaṣṭhaḥ
translated: Thus ends the chapter named The Prophecy - the sixth chapter in the noble Dharma discourse called The White Lotus of the True Dharma.

original: Vaidya 🔽pūrvayogaparivartaḥ /
analyzed: vaidya  pūrva yoga parivartaḥ
translated: Vidy🔽The Chapter on Past Endeavors

original: bhūtapūrva bhikṣavo 'tīte 'dhvani asaṃkhyeyaiḥ kalpairasaṃkhyeyatarairvipulairaprameyairacintyairaparimitairapramāṇaistataḥ
analyzed: bhūta pūrva bhikṣavaḥ tīte dhvani asaṃkhyeyaiḥ kalpaiḥ asaṃkhyeyataraiḥ vipulaiḥ aprameyaiḥ acintyaiḥ aparimitaiḥ apramāṇaiḥ tatas
translated: Monks, in the past, incalculable eons ago, vast, immeasurable, inconceivable, limitless, and boundless...

original: pareṇa paratareṇa yadāsīt tena kālena tena samayena mahābhijñājñānābhibhūrnāma🔽tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho loka udapādi vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ
analyzed: pareṇa paratareṇa yadā āsīt tena kālena tena samayena mahābhijñājñānābhibhūḥ nāma  tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke udapādi vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ
translated: In the past, in a distant time, there appeared in the world a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One named Mahābhijñājñānābhibuddhah,🔽a Sugata, a Knower of the World, an unsurpassed Trainer of those who can be trained, a Teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Bhagavat.🔽

original: puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstāḥ devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca buddho bhagavān saṃbhavāyāṃ lokadhātau mahārūpe kalpe /
analyzed: puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca buddhaḥ bhagavān saṃbhavāyām lokadhātau mahārūpe kalpe
translated: In the past, in the distant past, at that time and at that juncture, there appeared in the world the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, endowed with perfect knowledge and conduct, the Sugata, the Knower of the world, the Leader of men to be tamed, the Teacher of gods and men, the Buddha, the Blessed One named Mahābhijñā-jñānābhibhū.🔽He appeared in the world in the great kalpa Mahā-rūpa in the world sphere Saṃbhavā.

original: kiyaccirotpannaḥ sa bhikṣavastathāgato 'bhūt /
analyzed: kiyat cira utpannaḥ sa bhikṣavaḥ tathāgataḥ bhūt
translated: How long ago did that Tathāgata appear, monks?

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhikṣavo yāvāniha trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau pṛthivīdhātuḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhikṣavaḥ yāvān iha tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau pṛthivī dhātuḥ
translated: Monks, it is like this: Suppose someone were to reduce the entire earth, this great trichiliocosm, to tiny particles.

original: taṃ kaścideva puruṣaḥ sarvaṃ cūrṇīkuryāt /🔽maṣiṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: tam kaścid eva puruṣaḥ sarvam cūrṇīkuryāt  maṣim kuryāt
translated: He would reduce it all to dust.

original: atha khalu sa puruṣastasmāllokadhātorekaṃ paramāṇurajo gṛhītvā pūrvasyāṃ diśi lokadhātusahasramatikramya tadekaṃ paramāṇuraja upanikṣipet /
analyzed: atha khalu sa puruṣaḥ tasmāt lokadhātoḥ ekam paramāṇu rajaḥ gṛhītvā pūrvasyām diśi lokadhātu sahasram atikramya tat ekam paramāṇu rajaḥ upanikṣipet
translated: Then that person, taking a single atom from that world system, would place it in the east, passing over a thousand world systems.

original: atha sa puruṣo dvitīyaṃ ca paramāṇurajo gṛhītvā tataḥ pareṇa parataraṃ lokadhātusahasramatikramya dvitīyaṃ paramāṇuraja upanikṣipet /
analyzed: atha sa puruṣaḥ dvitīyam ca paramāṇu rajaḥ gṛhītvā tatas pareṇa parataram lokadhātu sahasram atikramya dvitīyam paramāṇu rajaḥ upanikṣipet
translated: Then that man, taking a second atom, would place it beyond that world system, and a second atom beyond that.

original: anena paryāyeṇa sa puruṣaḥ sarvāvantaṃ pṛthivīdhātumupanikṣipet pūrvasyāṃ diśi /
analyzed: anena paryāyeṇa sa puruṣaḥ sarvāvantam pṛthivī dhātum upanikṣipet pūrvasyām diśi
translated: In this way, that man would place all the earth element in the eastern direction.

original: tatkiṃ manyadhve bhikṣavaḥ śakyaṃ teṣāṃ lokadhātūnāmanto vā paryanto vā gaṇanayādhigantum /
analyzed: tat kim manyadhve bhikṣavaḥ śakyam teṣām lokadhātūnām antaḥ vā paryantaḥ vā gaṇanayā adhigantum
translated: What do you think, monks? Is it possible to know the end or limit of those world systems by counting?

original: ta āhuḥ no hīdaṃ bhagavan /
analyzed: te āhuḥ na u hi idam bhagavan
translated: They said, No indeed, Blessed One.

original: no hīdaṃ sugata /
analyzed: no hi idam sugata
translated: No indeed, Sugata.

original: bhagavānāha śakyaṃ punarbhikṣavasteṣāṃ lokadhātūnāṃ kenacid gaṇakena vā gaṇakamahāmātreṇa vā gaṇanayā paryanto 'dhigantum /
analyzed: bhagavān āha  śakyam punar bhikṣavaḥ teṣām lokadhātūnām kenacid gaṇakena vā gaṇaka mahāmātreṇa vā gaṇanayā paryantaḥ dhigantum
translated: The Blessed One said, Monks, it is possible for some mathematician or great mathematician to know the end or limit of those world systems by calculation,

original: yeṣu vopanikṣiptāni tāni paramāṇurajāṃsi /
analyzed: yeṣu vā upanikṣiptāni tāni paramāṇu rajāṃsi
translated: in which those atomic particles were placed,

original: yeṣu vā nopanikṣiptāni /
analyzed: yeṣu vā na upanikṣiptāni
translated: or in which they were not placed.

original: na tveva teṣāṃ kalpakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇāṃ śakyaṃ gaṇanāyogena paryanto 'dhigantum /
analyzed: na tu eva teṣām kalpa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇām śakyam gaṇanā yogena paryantaḥ dhigantum
translated: But it is not possible to know the end or limit of those many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of kalpas by calculation.

original: yāvantaḥ kalpāstasya bhagavato mahābhijñājñānābhibhuvastathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya /
analyzed: yāvantaḥ kalpāḥ tasya bhagavataḥ mahābhijñājñānābhibhuvaḥ tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya
translated: As many eons as there were since the parinirvāṇa of the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Mahābhijñājñānābhibuddhe,

original: etāvān sa kālo 'bhūdevamacintyaḥ /
analyzed: etāvān sa kālaḥ bhūt evam acintyaḥ
translated: that long a time had passed, so inconceivable,

original: evamapramāṇaḥ /
analyzed: evam apramāṇaḥ
translated: so immeasurable.

original: taṃ cāhaṃ bhikṣavastathāgataṃ tāvacciraṃ parinirvṛtamanena tathāgatajñānadarśanabalādhānena yathādya śvo vā parinirvṛtamanusmarāmi //
analyzed: tam ca aham bhikṣavaḥ tathāgatam tāvat ciram parinirvṛtam anena tathāgata jñāna darśana bala ādhānena yathā adya śvas vā parinirvṛtam anusmarāmi
translated: And, monks, I remember that Tathāgata, who passed into parinirvāṇa so long ago, by the power of the Tathāgata's knowledge and insight, as if he passed into parinirvāṇa today or yesterday.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
