analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses on that occasion:

original: abhū atītā bahu kalpakoṭyo anusmarāmi dvipadānamuttamam /
analyzed: anusmarāmi
translated: Many eons ago, I remember the supreme human,

original: abhijñajñānābhibhūvaṃ mahāmunimabhūṣi tatkālamanuttamo jinaḥ // / //
analyzed: mahā munim abhūṣi tad kālam anuttamaḥ jinaḥ
translated: The great sage Abhijñājñānābhibhū, who was the supreme victor at that time.

original: yathā trisāhasrima lokadhātuṃ kaścid rajaṃ kurya aṇupramāṇam /
analyzed: yathā trisāhasrima lokadhātum kaścid rajam kuryaḥ aṇu pramāṇam
translated: Just as someone might make dust particles from a trichiliocosm,

original: paramāṇumekaṃ ca tato gṛhītvā kṣetraṃ sahasraṃ gamiyāna nikṣipet // / //
analyzed: paramāṇum ekam ca tatas gṛhītvā kṣetram sahasram nikṣipet
translated: And then taking one atom, go a thousand realms and deposit it,

original: dvitīyaṃ tṛtīyaṃ pi ca eva nikṣipet sarvaṃ pi so nikṣipi taṃ rajogatam /
analyzed: dvitīyam tṛtīyam ca eva nikṣipet sarvam tam rajaḥ gatam
translated: And likewise deposit a second and a third, until all the dust is deposited,

original: riktā bhavetā iya lokadhātuḥ sarvaśca so pāṃsu bhaveta kṣīṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: riktā bhavetā lokadhātuḥ sarvaḥ ca saḥ pāṃsu bhaveta kṣīṇaḥ
translated: This world realm would be empty, and all that dust would be exhausted.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: yo lokadhātūṣu bhaveta tāsu pāṃsu rajo yasya pramāṇu nāsti /
analyzed: yaḥ lokadhātūṣu bhaveta tāsu pāṃsu rajaḥ yasya pramāṇu na asti
translated: In those world realms, there is no measure of the dust and particles.

original: rajaṃ karitvāna aśeṣatastaṃ lakṣyaṃ dade kalpaśate gate ca // / //
analyzed: rajam aśeṣatas tam lakṣyam dade kalpa śate gate ca
translated: Having made that dust without remainder, a mark would be given after a hundred eons have passed.

original: evāprameyā bahu kalpakoṭyaḥ parinirvṛtasya sugatasya tasya /
analyzed: eva aprameyāḥ bahu kalpa koṭyaḥ parinirvṛtasya sugatasya tasya
translated: Thus, there are many immeasurable millions of eons since the Sugata's parinirvāṇa.

original: paramāṇu sarve na bhavanti lakṣyāstāvadbahu kṣīṇa bhavanti kalpāḥ // / //
analyzed: sarve na bhavanti bhavanti kalpāḥ
translated: All the atoms would not be a mark, so many eons have passed since the exhaustion.

original: tāvacciraṃ nirvṛtu taṃ vināyakaṃ tān śrāvakāṃstāṃśca pi bodhisattvān /
analyzed: tāvat ciram tam vināyakam tān śrāvakān tān ca bodhisattvān
translated: For so long, the leader has been in nirvāṇa, those disciples and those bodhisattvas as well.

original: etādṛśaṃ jñānu tathāgatānāṃ smarāmi vṛttaṃ yatha adya śvo vā // / //
analyzed: etādṛśam tathāgatānām smarāmi vṛttam adya śvas vā
translated: I remember the events of the Tathāgatas' knowledge as if it were today or tomorrow.

original: etādṛśaṃ bhikṣava jñānametadanantajñānaśca tathāgatasya /
analyzed: etādṛśam bhikṣava jñānam etad ananta jñānaḥ ca tathāgatasya
translated: Such is the knowledge of the Tathāgata, monks, and the infinite knowledge of the Tathāgata.

original: buddhaṃ mayā kalpaśatairanekaiḥ smṛtīya sūkṣmāya anāsravāya // / //
analyzed: buddham mayā kalpa śataiḥ anekaiḥ smṛtīya sūkṣmāya anāsravāya
translated: Through subtle and undefiled memory, I, the Buddha, remember many hundreds of eons.

original: tasya khalu punarbhikṣavo mahābhijñājñānābhibhuvastathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya catuṣpañcāśatkalpakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇyāyuṣpramāṇamabhūt
analyzed: tasya khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ mahābhijñājñānābhibhuvaḥ tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya catuṣpañcāśat kalpa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi āyuṣpramāṇam abhūt
translated: “Bhikṣus, the lifespan of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha Mahābhijñā­jñānābhi­bhū was fifty-four hundred thousand quintillion eons.

original: pūrve ca sa bhagavān mahābhijñānābhibhūstathāgato 'nabhisaṃbuddho 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhiṃ bodhimaṇḍavarāgragrata eva sarvāṃ mārasenāṃ prābhañjīt
analyzed: pūrve ca sa bhagavān mahābhijñānābhibhūḥ tathāgataḥ na abhisaṃbuddhaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim bodhimaṇḍa vara agra agratas eva sarvām māra senām prābhañjīt  /
translated: “Bhikṣus, before that Bhagavān, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha Mahābhijñā­jñānābhi­bhū attained the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood, while he was still in the bodhisattva stage, he defeated and conquered the entire army of Māra at the sublime, supreme Bodhimaṇḍa.

original: parājaiṣīt /
analyzed: parājaiṣīt
translated: He defeated and conquered the entire army of Māra.

original: prabhañjayitvā parājayitvā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyāmiti na ca tāvattasya te dharmā āmukhībhavanti sma /
analyzed: prabhañjayitvā parājayitvā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyām iti na ca tāvat tasya te dharmāḥ āmukhībhavanti sma
translated: Having defeated and conquered them, he thought, ‘I will attain the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood,’ but the Dharma had not yet manifested to him.

original: sa bodhivṛkṣamūle bodhimaṇḍe ekamantarakalpamasthāt /
analyzed: sa bodhi vṛkṣa mūle bodhimaṇḍe ekam antara kalpam asthāt
translated: He remained at the Bodhimaṇḍa, at the foot of the Bodhi tree, for one intermediate eon.

original: dvitīyamapyantarakalpasthāt /
analyzed: dvitīyam api antara kalpa sthāt
translated: He remained there for a second intermediate eon.

original: na ca tāvadanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyate /
analyzed: na ca tāvat anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate
translated: Still the Dharma had not manifested to him, and he had not attained the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood.

original: tṛtīyamapi caturthamapi pañcamamapi ṣaṣṭhamapi saptamamapi aṣṭamamapi navamamapi daśamamapyantarakalpaṃ
analyzed: tṛtīyam api caturtham api pañcamam api ṣaṣṭham api saptamam api aṣṭamam api navamam api daśamam api antarakalpam
translated: He remained there for a third, a fourth, a fifth, a sixth, a seventh, an eighth, a ninth, and a tenth intermediate eon.

original: bodhivṛkṣamūle bodhimaṇḍe 'sthāt sakṛdvartanena paryaṅkena antarādavyutthitaḥ /
analyzed: bodhi vṛkṣa mūle bodhimaṇḍe sthāt sakṛt vartanena paryaṅkena antarāt a vyutthitaḥ
translated: He sat at the foot of the Bodhi tree, in the Bodhi grove, in the first cross-legged sitting, without rising in between.

original: aniñjamānena cittena acalamānena avepamānena kāyenāsthāt /
analyzed: an iñjamānena cittena a calamānena a vepamānena kāyena asthāt
translated: He sat with an unwavering mind, an unshakable body, and an unmoving body.

original: na ca tāvadasya te dharmā āmukhībhavanti sma //
analyzed: na ca tāvat asya te dharmāḥ āmukhībhavanti sma
translated: But those dharmas did not yet manifest to him.

original: tasya khalu punarbhikṣavo bhagavato bodhimaṇḍavarāgragatasya devaistrāyastriṃśairmahāsiṃhāsanaṃ prajñaptamabhūd yojanaśatasahasraṃ samucchrayeṇa /🔽yatra sa bhagavān niṣadya anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhaḥ /
analyzed: tasya khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ bhagavataḥ bodhimaṇḍa vara agra gatasya devaiḥ trāyastriṃśaiḥ mahā siṃhāsanam prajñaptam abhūt yojana śata sahasram samucchrayeṇa  yatra sa bhagavān niṣadya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: Bhikṣus, when the Blessed One had gone to the supreme seat of awakening, the gods of the Thirty-Three prepared a great lion throne for him, a hundred thousand leagues in height.🔽The Blessed One sat there and fully awakened to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: samanantaraniṣaṇṇasya ca khalu punastasya bhagavato bodhimaṇḍe /
analyzed: samanantara niṣaṇṇasya ca khalu punar tasya bhagavataḥ bodhimaṇḍe
translated: And as soon as the Blessed One sat on the seat of awakening,

original: atha brahmakāyikā devaputrā divyaṃ puṣpavarṣamabhipravarṣayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: atha brahmakāyikāḥ devaputrāḥ divyam puṣpa varṣam abhipravarṣayāmāsuḥ
translated: then the gods of the Brahma realm caused a rain of divine flowers to fall.

original: bodhimaṇḍasya parisāmantakena yojanaśatamantarikṣe ca vātān pramuñcanti /
analyzed: bodhimaṇḍasya parisāmantakena yojana śatam antarikṣe ca vātān pramuñcanti
translated: They released winds in the sky around the seat of awakening for a hundred leagues,

original: ye taṃ jīrṇapuṣpamavakarṣayanti /
analyzed: ye tam jīrṇa puṣpam avakarṣayanti
translated: which removed those old flowers.

original: yathāpravarṣitaṃ ca tat puṣpavarṣaṃ tasya bhagavato bodhimaṇḍe niṣaṇṇasya avyucchinnaṃ pravarṣayanti /
analyzed: yathā pravarṣitam ca tat puṣpa varṣam tasya bhagavataḥ bodhimaṇḍe niṣaṇṇasya avyucchinnam pravarṣayanti
translated: And that rain of flowers, having rained down on the Blessed One seated at the seat of awakening, rained down continuously.

original: paripūrṇān daśāntarakalpān taṃ bhagavantamabhyavakiranti Vaidya sma /
analyzed: paripūrṇān daśa antara kalpān tam bhagavantam abhyavakiranti vaidya sma
translated: For a full ten intermediate eons, they sprinkled the Blessed One with flowers.

original: tathā pravarṣitaṃ ca tatpuḥpavarḥaṃ pravarḥayanti yāvat parinirvāṇakālasamaye tasya bhagavatastaṃ bhagavantamabhyavakiranti /
analyzed: tathā pravarṣitam ca tat puṣpavarḍam pravarḥayanti yāvat parinirvāṇa kāla samaye tasya bhagavataḥ tam bhagavantam abhyavakiranti
translated: And that rain of flowers, having rained down in that way, rained down until the time of the Blessed One's parinirvāṇa, sprinkling the Blessed One.

original: cāturmahārājakāyikāśca devaputrā divyāṃ devadundubhimabhipravādayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: cāturmahārājakāyikāḥ ca devaputrāḥ divyām deva dundubhim abhipravādayāmāsuḥ
translated: And the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings played divine drums.

original: tasya bhagavato bodhimaṇḍavarāgragatasya satkārārthamavyucchinnaṃ pravādayāmāsuḥ paripūrṇān daśāntarakalpān tasya bhagavato niḥaṇṇasya /
analyzed: tasya bhagavataḥ bodhimaṇḍa vara agra gatasya satkāra artham avyucchinnam pravādayāmāsuḥ paripūrṇān daśa antara kalpān tasya bhagavataḥ niḥaṇṇasya
translated: For the sake of honoring the Blessed One seated at the supreme seat of awakening, they played continuously for a full ten intermediate eons after the Blessed One's nirvāṇa.

original: tata uttari tāni divyāṇi tūryāṇi satatasamitaṃ pravādayāmāsuryāvattasya bhagavato mahāparinirvāṇakālasamayāt //
analyzed: tatas uttari tāni divyāṇi tūryāṇi satata samitam pravādayāmāsuḥ yāvat tasya bhagavataḥ mahā parinirvāṇa kāla samayāt
translated: Then, those divine drums played constantly and uninterruptedly until the time of the Blessed One's great parinirvāṇa.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavo daśānāmantarakalpānāmatyayena sa bhagavān mahābhijñājñānābhibhūstathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhaḥ
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ daśānām antara kalpānām atyayena sa bhagavān mahābhijñājñānābhibhūḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: “Bhikṣus, after ten intermediate eons had passed, the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Mahābhijñā­jñānābhi­bhū attained the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood.

original: samanantarābhisaṃbuddhaṃ ca taṃ viditvā ye tasya bhagavataḥ kumārabhūtasya ṣoḍaśa putrā abhūvannaurasāḥ /
analyzed: samanantara abhisaṃbuddham ca tam viditvā ye tasya bhagavataḥ kumāra bhūtasya ṣoḍaśa putrāḥ abhūvan aurasāḥ
translated: “Bhikṣus, the sixteen young princes, the sons of the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Mahābhijñā­jñānābhi­bhū, knew that the bhagavān had attained the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood.

original: jñānākaro nāma teṣāṃ jyeṣṭho 'bhūt /🔽teṣāṃ ca khalu punarbhikṣavaḥ ṣoḍaśānāṃ rājakumārāṇāmekaikasya ca vividhāni krīḍanakāni rāmaṇīyakānyabhūvan vicitrāṇi darśanīyāni /
analyzed: jñānākaraḥ nāma teṣām jyeṣṭhaḥ bhūt  teṣām ca khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ ṣoḍaśānām rāja kumārāṇām ekaikasya ca vividhāni krīḍanakāni rāmaṇīyakāni abhūvan vicitrāṇi darśanīyāni
translated: “Bhikṣus, the eldest of the sixteen young princes was named Jñānākara.🔽“Bhikṣus, each of the sixteen young princes had various kinds of amusements and enjoyments, various kinds of delightful things to see, and various kinds of delightful things to hear.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavaste ṣoḍaśa rājakumārāstāni vividhāni krīḍanakāni rāmaṇīyakāni visarjayitvā /
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ te ṣoḍaśa rāja kumārāḥ tāni vividhāni krīḍanakāni rāmaṇīyakāni visarjayitvā
translated: “Bhikṣus, the sixteen young princes gave up those various kinds of amusements and enjoyments, those various kinds of delightful things to see, and those various kinds of delightful things to hear.

original: taṃ bhagavantaṃ mahābhijñājñānābhibhuvaṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhamanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhaṃ viditvā /
analyzed: tam bhagavantam mahābhijñājñānābhibhuvam tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddham viditvā
translated: “Bhikṣus, the sixteen young princes, knowing that the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Mahābhijñā­jñānābhi­bhū had attained the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood,

original: mātṛbhirdhātrībhiśca rudantībhiḥ parivṛtāḥ puraskṛtāḥ tena ca mahārājñā cakravartinā
analyzed: mātṛbhiḥ dhātrībhiḥ ca rudantībhiḥ parivṛtāḥ puraskṛtāḥ tena ca mahā rājñā cakravartinā
translated: surrounded and attended by their mothers and wet nurses who were crying, and by that great king, the universal monarch,

original: āryakeṇa mahākośena rājāmātyaiśca bahubhiśca prāṇikoṭīnayutaśatasahasraiḥ parivṛtāḥ
analyzed: āryakeṇa mahā kośena rāja amātyaiḥ ca bahubhiḥ ca prāṇi koṭī nayuta śata sahasraiḥ parivṛtāḥ
translated: the noble Mahākośa, the royal ministers, and many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of beings,

original: puraskṛtāḥ yena bhagavān mahābhijñājñānābhibhūstathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho bodhimaṇḍavarāgragataḥ /
analyzed: puraskṛtāḥ yena bhagavān mahābhijñājñānābhibhūḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ bodhimaṇḍa vara agra gataḥ
translated: they approached the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, the One of Great Knowledge and Power, who was at the supreme seat of enlightenment.

original: tenopasaṃkrāmanti sma /
analyzed: tena upasaṃkrāmanti sma
translated: They approached him.

original: tasya bhagavataḥ satkārārthāya gurukārārthāya mānanārthāya pūjanārthāya arcanārthāya apacāyanārthāya upasaṃkrāntāḥ /
analyzed: tasya bhagavataḥ satkāra arthāya gurukāra arthāya mānanā arthāya pūjanā arthāya arcanā arthāya apacāyanā arthāya upasaṃkrāntāḥ
translated: They approached in order to honor, venerate, respect, make offerings, and serve that Blessed One.

original: upasaṃkramya tasya bhagavataḥ pādau śirobhirvanditvā taṃ bhagavantaṃ triṣpradakṣiṇīkṛtya añjaliṃ pragṛhya taṃ bhagavantaṃ saṃmukhamābhirgāthābhiḥ
analyzed: upasaṃkramya tasya bhagavataḥ pādau śirobhiḥ vanditvā tam bhagavantam tris pradakṣiṇīkṛtya añjalim pragṛhya tam bhagavantam saṃmukham ābhiḥ gāthābhiḥ
translated: Having approached, they bowed their heads at the feet of that Blessed One, circumambulated him three times, and with palms joined addressed that Blessed One with these verses,

original: sārūpyābhirabhiṣṭuvanti sma
analyzed: sārūpyābhiḥ abhiṣṭuvanti sma
translated: praising him with appropriate verses:

original: mahābhiṣaṭko 'si anuttaro 'si anantakalpaiḥ samudāgato 'si /
analyzed: mahā abhiṣaṭkaḥ si anuttaraḥ si ananta kalpaiḥ samudāgataḥ si
translated: You are the great physician, the unsurpassed one, attained through infinite eons,

original: uttāraṇārthāyiha sarvadehināṃ paripūrṇa saṃkalpu ayaṃ ti bhadrakaḥ // / //
analyzed: sarva dehinām
translated: For the sake of liberating all embodied beings, this excellent one has fulfilled all intentions.

original: suduṣkarā antarakalpimān daśa kṛtāni ekāsani saṃniṣadya /
analyzed: su duṣkarā antarakalpimān daśa kṛtāni eka āsani saṃniṣadya
translated: It is extremely difficult to sit on one seat for ten intermediate eons,

original: na ca te 'ntarā kāyu kadāci cālito na hastapādaṃ na pi cānyadaṅgam // / //
analyzed: na ca te ntarā cālitaḥ na hasta pādam na ca anyat aṅgam
translated: And your body has never moved in the meantime, nor your hands, feet, or any other limb.

original: cittaṃ pi te śāntagataṃ susaṃsthitamaniñjyabhūtaṃ sada aprakampyam /
analyzed: cittam pi te śānta gatam su saṃsthitam aniñjya bhūtam sadaḥ a prakampyam
translated: Your mind is also peaceful and well-composed, unmoving and always unshakable.

original: vikṣepu naivāsti kadāci pi tava atyantaśāntasthitu tvaṃ anāsravaḥ // / //
analyzed: na eva asti tava anāsravaḥ
translated: You never have any distraction, you abide in complete peace, you are free from defilements.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Doctor

original: diṣṭayāsi kṣemeṇa ca svastinā ca aviheṭhitaḥ prāpta imāgrabodhim /
analyzed: diṣṭayā asi kṣemeṇa ca svastinā ca a viheṭhitaḥ prāptaḥ imā agra bodhim
translated: By good fortune, you have arrived at this supreme enlightenment, safe, sound, and unharmed.

original: asmākamṛddhī iyamevarūpā diṣṭayā ca vardhāma narendrasiṃha // / //
analyzed: asmākam ṛddhī iyam evarūpā diṣṭayā ca vardhāma narendra siṃha
translated: By good fortune, we increase in this way, O lion among men, this kind of prosperity of ours.

original: anāyikeyaṃ praja sarva duḥkhitā utpāṭitākṣī va nihīnasaukhyā /
analyzed: anāyikā iyam duḥkhitā nihīna saukhyā
translated: This entire helpless and suffering people, their eyes plucked out, are deprived of happiness.

original: mārgaṃ na jānanti dukhāntagāminaṃ na mokṣahetorjanayanti vīryam // / //
analyzed: mārgam na jānanti dukha anta gāminam na mokṣa hetoḥ janayanti vīryam
translated: They do not know the path leading to the end of suffering, and do not generate energy for the sake of liberation.

original: apāya vardhanti ca dīrgharātraṃ divyāśca kāyāḥ parihāṇadharmāḥ /
analyzed: apāya vardhanti ca dīrgharātram divyāḥ ca kāyāḥ parihāṇa dharmāḥ
translated: For a long time, they increase in the lower realms, and their divine bodies are subject to falling away.

original: na śrūyate jātu jināna śabdastamondhakāro ayu sarvalokaḥ // / //
analyzed: na śrūyate jātu śabdaḥ tamaḥ ndhakāraḥ sarva lokaḥ
translated: The sound of the Jinas is never heard, and the whole world is in the darkness of ignorance.

original: prāptaṃ ca te lokavidū ihādya śivaṃ padaṃ uttama nāsravaṃ ca /
analyzed: prāptam ca te loka vidū iha adya śivam padam uttama
translated: Today, O Knower of the World, you have attained the auspicious, supreme, and undefiled state.

original: vayaṃ ca lokaśca anugṛhītaḥ śaraṇaṃ ca tvā eti vrajāma nātha // / //
analyzed: vayam ca lokaḥ ca anugṛhītaḥ śaraṇam ca tvā eti vrajāma nātha
translated: We and the world are favored. We go for refuge to you, O Lord.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavaste ṣoḍaśa rājakumārāḥ kumārabhūtā eva bālakāḥ /🔽taṃ bhagavantaṃ mahābhijñājñānābhimukhaṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhamābhiḥ
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ te ṣoḍaśa rāja kumārāḥ kumāra bhūtāḥ eva bālakāḥ  tam bhagavantam mahā abhijñā jñāna abhimukham tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham ābhiḥ
translated: Then, monks, those sixteen princes, still young boys,🔽having praised with these fitting verses the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, who was facing the knowledge and insight of great awareness,

original: sārūpyabhīrgāthābhiḥ saṃmukhamabhiṣṭutya taṃ bhagavantamadhyeṣante sma dharmacakrapravartanatāyai
analyzed: sārūpya bhīḥ gāthābhiḥ saṃmukham abhiṣṭutya tam bhagavantam adhyeṣante sma dharma cakra pravartana tāyai
translated: they requested the Blessed One to turn the wheel of Dharma:

original: deśayatu bhagavān dharmam /
analyzed: deśayatu bhagavān dharmam
translated: May the Blessed One teach the Dharma!

original: deśayatu sugato dharmaṃ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāyai mahato janakāyasyārthāya hitāya sukhāya devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca /
analyzed: deśayatu sugataḥ dharmam bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāyai mahataḥ jana kāyasya arthāya hitāya sukhāya devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca
translated: May the Well-Gone One teach the Dharma for the benefit and happiness of many people, out of compassion for the world, for the good, benefit, and happiness of a great multitude of gods and humans.

original: tasyāṃ ca velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣanta
analyzed: tasyām ca velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣanta
translated: And at that time they spoke these verses:

original: deśehi dharmaṃ śatapuṇyalakṣaṇā vināyakā apratimā maharṣe /
analyzed: deśehi dharmam śata puṇya lakṣaṇāḥ vināyakāḥ apratimāḥ mahā ṛṣe
translated: Teach the Dharma, O One with the Characteristics of a Hundred Merits, O Unrivaled Leader, Great Sage,

original: labdhaṃ ti jñānaṃ pravaraṃ viśiṣṭaṃ prakāśayā loki sadevakasmin // / //
analyzed: labdham jñānam pravaram viśiṣṭam prakāśayā loki
translated: And having attained the supreme and excellent knowledge, illuminate it in this world with its devas.

original: asmāṃśca tārehi imāṃśca sattvān nidarśaya jñānu tathāgatānām /
analyzed: asmān ca tārehi imān ca sattvān nidarśaya tathāgatānām
translated: And deliver us and these beings, and show us the knowledge of the Tathāgatas.

original: yathā vayaṃ pi imamagrabodhiṃ anuprāpnuyāmo 'tha ime ca sattvāḥ // / //
analyzed: yathā vayam imam agra bodhim anuprāpnuyāmaḥ ime ca sattvāḥ
translated: So that we too may attain this supreme enlightenment, and so may these beings.

original: caryāṃ ca jñānaṃ pi ca sarva jānasi adhyāśayaṃ pūrvakṛtaṃ ca puṇyam /
analyzed: caryām ca jñānam ca sarva jānasi adhyāśayam pūrva kṛtam ca puṇyam
translated: You know all the conduct and knowledge, and the superior intention and merit made in the past.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Physician

original: adhimukti jānāsi ca sarvaprāṇināṃ pravartayā cakravaraṃ anuttaram // / //
analyzed: adhimukti jānāsi ca sarva prāṇinām pravartaya cakravaram anuttaram
translated: And you know the inclinations of all beings, and turn the supreme, unsurpassed wheel.

original: iti //
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: tena khalu punarbhikṣavaḥ samayena tena bhagavatā mahābhijñājñānābhibhuvā tathāgatenārhatā
analyzed: tena khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ samayena tena bhagavatā mahābhijñājñānābhibhuvā tathāgatena arhatā
translated: Then, monks, at that time, when the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One,

original: samyaksaṃbuddhena anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyamānena daśasu dikṣvaikaikasyāṃ
analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddhena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyamānena daśasu dikṣu a ekaikasyām
translated: the Greatly Renowned One, had attained supreme perfect enlightenment, in the ten directions, in each direction,

original: diśi pañcāśallokadhātukoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi ṣaḍvikāraṃ prakampitānyabhūīvan /
analyzed: diśi pañcāśat lokadhātu koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi ṣaṣ vikāram prakampitāni abhūīvan
translated: fifty hundred thousand koṭis of nayutas of world systems shook in six ways.

original: mahatā cāvabhāsena sphuṭānyabhūvan /
analyzed: mahatā ca avabhāsena sphuṭāni abhūvan
translated: And they were filled with a great radiance.

original: sarveṣu ca teṣu lokadhātuṣu yā lokāntarikāstāsu ye akṣaṇāḥ saṃvṛtā andhakāratamisrāḥ
analyzed: sarveṣu ca teṣu lokadhātuṣu yāḥ loka āntarikāḥ tāsu ye akṣaṇāḥ saṃvṛtāḥ andhakāra tamisrāḥ
translated: And in all those world systems, in the spaces between worlds, where there are unfavorable conditions, enclosed in darkness and gloom,

original: yatra imāvapi candrasūryau evaṃmaharddhikau evaṃmahānubhāvau evaṃmahaujaskau ābhayāpyābhāṃ nānubhavataḥ /
analyzed: yatra imau api candra sūryau evam maharddhikau evam mahā anubhāvau evam mahā ojaskau ābhayā api ābhām na anubhavataḥ
translated: where even the moon and sun, with such great power and great might and great majesty, do not reach with their light,

original: varṇenāpi varṇaṃ tejasāpi tejo nānubhavataḥ /
analyzed: varṇena api varṇam tejasā api tejaḥ na anubhavataḥ
translated: where color and form, even the color and form of the gods, do not prevail,

original: tāsvapi tasmin samaye mahato 'vabhāsasya prādurbhāvo 'bhūt /
analyzed: tāsu api tasmin samaye mahataḥ vabhāsasya prādurbhāvaḥ bhūt
translated: there too, at that time, a great light appeared.

original: ye 'pi tāsu lokāntarikāsu sattvā upapannāḥ /
analyzed: ye pi tāsu loka āntarikāsu sattvāḥ upapannāḥ
translated: And the beings who had been reborn in those spaces between worlds,

original: te 'pyanyonyamevaṃ paśyanti anyonyamevaṃ saṃjānanti anye 'pi bata bhoḥ sattvāḥ santīhopapannāḥ /
analyzed: te pi anyonyam evam paśyanti anyonyam evam saṃjānanti anye pi bata bhoḥ sattvāḥ santi iha upapannāḥ
translated: they saw each other and recognized each other, and they said, Oh! Other beings have been reborn here!

original: anye 'pi bata bhoḥ sattvāḥ santīhopapannāḥ iti /
analyzed: anye pi bata bhoḥ sattvāḥ santi iha upapannāḥ iti
translated: Oh! Other beings have been reborn here!

original: sarveṣu ca teṣu lokadhātuṣu yāni devabhavanāni devavimānāni ca /
analyzed: sarveṣu ca teṣu lokadhātuṣu yāni deva bhavanāni deva vimānāni ca
translated: And in all those world systems, in the celestial palaces of the gods up to the Brahma worlds,

original: yāvad brahmalokād ṣaḍvikāraṃ prakampitānyabhūvan /
analyzed: yāvat brahma lokāt ṣaṣ vikāram prakampitāni abhūvan
translated: they shook in six ways.

original: mahatā cāvabhāsena sphuṭānyabhūvan atikramya devānāṃ devānubhāvam /
analyzed: mahatā ca avabhāsena sphuṭāni abhūvan atikramya devānām deva anubhāvam
translated: And they were filled with a great light, surpassing the radiance of the gods.

original: iti hi bhikṣavastasmin samaye teṣu lokadhātuṣu mahataḥ pṛthivīcālasya mahataśca audārikasyāvabhāsasya loke prādurbhāvo 'bhūt //🔽atha pūrvasyāṃ diśi teṣu pañcāśatsu lokadhātukoṭīnayutaśatasahasreṣu yāni brāhmāṇi vimānāni /
analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ tasmin samaye teṣu lokadhātuṣu mahataḥ pṛthivīcālasya mahataḥ ca audārikasya avabhāsasya loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhūt  atha pūrvasyām diśi teṣu pañcāśatsu lokadhātu koṭī nayuta śata sahasreṣu yāni brāhmāṇi vimānāni
translated: Monks, at that time, in those world systems, there occurred a great earthquake, and a great and vast light appeared in the world.

original: tānyatīva bhrājanti tapanti virājanti /🔽śrīmanti aujasvīni ca /
analyzed: tāni atīva bhrājanti tapanti virājanti  śrīmanti aujasvīni ca
translated: Then, in the east, in those fifty hundred thousand quintillion world systems, the airborne palaces of the Brahmas became very beautiful, bright, radiant, glorious, and majestic.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavasteṣāṃ mahābrahmaṇāmetadabhavat imāni khalu punarbrāhmāṇi vimānānyatīva bhrājanti tapanti virājanti śrīmanti aujasvīni 🔽ca /
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ teṣām mahābrahmaṇām etat abhavat imāni khalu punar brāhmāṇi vimānāni atīva bhrājanti tapanti virājanti śrīmanti aujasvīni  / ca
translated: Monks, then those great Brahmas thought, “Why have our airborne palaces become so beautiful, bright, radiant, glorious, and majestic?

original: kasya khalvidaṃ pūrvanimittaṃ bhaviṣyatīti /🔽atha khalu bhikṣavasteṣu pañcāśatsu lokadhātukoṭīnayutaśatasahasreṣu ye mahābrahmāṇaḥ /
analyzed: kasya khalu idam pūrva nimittam bhaviṣyati iti  atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ teṣu pañcāśatsu lokadhātu koṭī nayuta śata sahasreṣu ye mahābrahmāṇaḥ
translated: What is the reason, what is the cause, that this has happened?”

original: te sarve 'nyonyabhavanāni gatvā ārocayāmāsuḥ //
analyzed: te sarve nyonya bhavanāni gatvā ārocayāmāsuḥ
translated: Monks, then all the great Brahmas in those fifty hundred thousand quintillion world systems went together to the eastern direction in search of the cause.🔽They went to a distance of many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of world systems, but they were unable to find the cause.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ sarvasattvatrātā nāma mahābrahmā taṃ mahāntaṃ brahmagaṇaṃ gāthābhiradhyabhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ sarvasattvatrātā nāma mahābrahmā tam mahāntam brahma gaṇam gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣata
translated: Then, monks, the Great Brahma named Sarvasattvatrata addressed that great assembly of Brahmas in verse:

original: atīva no harṣita adya sarve vimānaśreṣṭhā imi prajvalanti /
analyzed: atīva naḥ harṣita adya sarve vimāna śreṣṭhāḥ prajvalanti
translated: Today we are all greatly delighted, these excellent celestial palaces are ablaze.

original: śriyā dyutīyā ca manoramā ye kiṃ kāraṇaṃ īdṛśu bheṣyate 'dya // / //
analyzed: śriyā ca manoramāḥ ye
translated: With glory, radiance, and delight, what is the cause for this to be so today?

original: sādhu gaveṣāmatha etamarthaṃ ko devaputro upapannu adya /
analyzed: sādhu gaveṣām atha etam artham kaḥ adya
translated: It is good that we should seek this meaning, what god has been reborn today?

original: yasyānubhāvo ayamevarūpo abhūtapūrvo ayamadya dṛśyate // / //
analyzed: yasya anubhāvaḥ ayam eva rūpaḥ abhūta pūrvaḥ ayam adya dṛśyate
translated: Whose power is of such a kind, never seen before, is seen today.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: yadi vā bhaved buddha narendrarājā utpannu lokasmi kahiṃcidadya /
analyzed: yadi vā bhavet buddha narendra rājā kahiṃcid adya
translated: If it is the Buddha, the king of human lords, born somewhere in the world today,

original: yasyo nimittaṃ imamevarūpaṃ śriyā daśo dikṣu jvalanti adya // / //
analyzed: yasya u nimittam imam eva rūpam śriyā daśa dikṣu jvalanti adya
translated: Whose sign is of such a kind, the ten directions are ablaze with glory today.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavasteṣu pañcāśatsu lokadhātukoṭīnayutaśatasahasreṣu ye mahābrahmāṇaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ teṣu pañcāśatsu lokadhātu koṭī nayuta śata sahasreṣu ye mahābrahmāṇaḥ
translated: Then, monks, in those fifty hundred thousand quintillion worlds, the Great Brahmas

original: te sarve sahitāḥ samagrāstāni divyāni svāni svāni brāhmāṇi vimānānyabhiruhya divyāṃśca
analyzed: te sarve sahitāḥ samagrāḥ tāni divyāni svāni svāni brāhmāṇi vimānāni abhiruhya divyān ca
translated: all together, in unison, ascended to their own divine celestial palaces and, having assembled there,

original: sumerumātrān puṣpapuṭān gṛhītvā catasṛṣu dikṣvanucaṃkramanto 'nuvicarantaḥ paścimaṃ
analyzed: sumeru mātrān puṣpa puṭān gṛhītvā catasṛṣu dikṣu anucaṃkramantaḥ nu vicarantaḥ paścimam
translated: Taking flower baskets the size of Mount Sumeru, they wandered and roamed in the four directions,

original: digbhāgaṃ prakrāntāḥ /🔽adrākṣuḥ khalu punasteṣu pañcāśatsu lokadhātukoṭīnayutaśatasahasreṣu bhikṣavaste
analyzed: digbhāgam prakrāntāḥ  adrākṣuḥ khalu punar teṣu pañcāśatsu lokadhātu koṭī nayuta śata sahasreṣu bhikṣavaḥ te
translated: and then proceeded to the western direction.

original: mahābrahmāṇaḥ paścime digbhāge taṃ bhagavantaṃ mahābhijñājñānābhibhuvaṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ
analyzed: mahābrahmāṇaḥ paścime digbhāge tam bhagavantam mahābhijñājñānābhibhuvam tathāgatam arhantam
translated: Monks, those great Brahmas saw in the western direction the Blessed One, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One,

original: samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ bodhimaṇḍavarāgragataṃ bodhivṛkṣamūle siṃhāsanopaviṣṭaṃ parivṛtaṃ
analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddham bodhimaṇḍa vara agra gatam bodhivṛkṣa mūle siṃhāsana upaviṣṭam parivṛtam
translated: the One of Sharp Wisdom and Knowledge, who had gone to the supreme seat of enlightenment and was sitting on the lion throne at the foot of the enlightenment tree,

original: puraskṛtaṃ devanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragarūḍakinnaramahoragamanuṣyāmanuṣyaiḥ /
analyzed: puraskṛtam deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garūḍa kinnara mahoraga manuṣya amanuṣyaiḥ
translated: surrounded and revered by gods, nagas, yakshas, gandharvas, asuras, garudas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans,

original: taiśca putraiḥ ṣoḍaśabhī rājakumārairadhyeṣyamāṇaṃ dharmacakrapravartanatāyai /
analyzed: taiḥ ca putraiḥ ṣoḍaśabhiḥ rāja kumāraiḥ adhyeṣyamāṇam dharma cakra pravartana tāyai
translated: and by those sixteen princes, who were requesting him to turn the wheel of Dharma.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punaryena sa bhagavāṃstenopasaṃkrāntāḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar yena sa bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāntāḥ
translated: Having seen this, they approached the Blessed One.

original: upasaṃkramya tasya bhagavataḥ pādau śirobhirvanditvā taṃ bhagavantamanekaśatasahasrakṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya taiśca sumerumātraiḥ puṣpapuṭaistaṃ 🔽bhagavantamabhyavakiranti sma /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya tasya bhagavataḥ pādau śirobhiḥ vanditvā tam bhagavantam aneka śata sahasra kṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya taiḥ ca sumeru mātraiḥ puṣpa puṭaiḥ tam  bhagavantam abhyavakiranti sma
translated: They approached, bowed their heads to the feet of the Blessed One, circumambulated the Blessed One many hundreds of thousands of times, and with those heaps of flowers the size of Sumeru

original: abhiprakiranti sma /
analyzed: abhiprakiranti sma
translated: they scattered them over the Blessed One.

original: taṃ ca bodhivṛkṣaṃ daśayojanapramāṇam /
analyzed: tam ca bodhivṛkṣam daśa yojana pramāṇam
translated: They scattered them over the Bodhi tree, which was ten yojanas in size.

original: abhyavakīrya tāni brāhmāṇi vimānāni tasya bhagavato niryātayāmāsuḥ parigṛhṇātu bhagavānimāni brāhmāṇi vimānāni asmākamanukampāmupādāya /
analyzed: abhyavakīrya tāni brāhmāṇi vimānāni tasya bhagavataḥ niryātayāmāsuḥ parigṛhṇātu bhagavān imāni brāhmāṇi vimānāni asmākam anukampām upādāya
translated: Having scattered them, they offered those Brahmā palaces to the Blessed One, saying, Blessed One, out of compassion for us, accept these Brahmā palaces.

original: paribhuñjatu sugata imāni brāhmāṇi vimānānyasmākamanukampāmupādāya //
analyzed: paribhuñjatu sugataḥ imāni brāhmāṇi vimānāni asmākam anukampām upādāya
translated: Sugata, out of compassion for us, use these Brahmā palaces.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavaste mahābrahmāṇastāni svāni svāni vimānāni tasya bhagavato niryātya tasyāṃ velāyāṃ taṃ bhagavantaṃ saṃmukhamābhirgāthābhiḥ 🔽sārūpyābhirabhiṣṭuvanti sma
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ te mahābrahmāṇaḥ tāni svāni svāni vimānāni tasya bhagavataḥ niryātya tasyām velāyām tam bhagavantam saṃmukham ābhiḥ gāthābhiḥ  sārūpyābhiḥ abhiṣṭuvanti sma
translated: Then, monks, those Great Brahmas, having offered their own palaces to the Blessed One, at that time praised the Blessed One with these fitting verses:

original: āścaryabhūto jina aprameyo utpanna lokasmi hitānukampī /
analyzed: āścarya bhūtaḥ hita anukampī
translated: The Jina, who is a marvel and immeasurable, has appeared in the world out of compassion and for the benefit of beings.

original: nātho 'si śāstāsi gurūsi jāto anugṛhītā daśimā diśo 'dya // / //
analyzed: nāthaḥ si śāstā asi guruḥ asi jātaḥ anugṛhītā daśimāḥ diśaḥ
translated: You are the protector, the teacher, the guru who has appeared. The ten directions are now favored.

original: pañcāśatī koṭisahasra pūrṇā yā lokadhātūna ito bhavanti /
analyzed: pañcāśatī koṭi sahasra pūrṇāḥ yāḥ itas bhavanti
translated: Fifty full koṭis of thousands are the worlds that exist from here.

original: yato vayaṃ vandana āgatā jinaṃ vimānaśreṣṭhān prajahitva sarvaśaḥ // / //
analyzed: yatas vayam vandane āgatāḥ jinam vimāna śreṣṭhān prajahitvā sarvaśas
translated: We have come from there to pay homage to the Victor, having abandoned all our excellent celestial palaces.

original: pūrveṇa karmeṇa kṛtena asmin vicitracitrā hi ime vimānāḥ /
analyzed: pūrveṇa karmeṇa kṛtena asmin vicitra citrāḥ hi ime vimānāḥ
translated: By the karma we have created in the past, these celestial palaces are indeed variegated and colorful.

original: pratigṛhya asmākamanugrahārthaṃ paribhuñjatāṃ lokavidū yatheṣṭam // / //
analyzed: pratigṛhya asmākam anugraha artham paribhuñjatām loka vidū yatheṣṭam
translated: Accept them, O knower of the world, for our benefit, and enjoy them as you wish.

original: Vaidya 🔽atha khalu bhikṣavaste mahābrahmāṇastaṃ bhagavantaṃ mahābhijñājñānabhibhuvaṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ
analyzed: vaidya  atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ te mahābrahmāṇaḥ tam bhagavantam mahābhijñājñānabhibhuvam tathāgatam arhantam
translated: Vidy

original: samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ saṃmukhamābhiḥ sārūpyābhirgāthābhirabhiṣṭutya taṃ bhagavantametadūcuḥ
analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddham saṃmukham ābhiḥ sārūpyābhiḥ gāthābhiḥ abhiṣṭutya tam bhagavantam etat ūcuḥ
translated: Then, monks, those Great Brahmas, having praised face to face the Blessed One, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, the One of Flawless Knowledge and Conduct, the Well-Gone One, the Knower of the World, the Trainer of Human Beings, the Teacher of Gods and Humans, the Awakened One, the Blessed One, with these fitting verses, said this to the Blessed One:

original: pravartayatu bhagavān dharmacakram /
analyzed: pravartayatu bhagavān dharmacakram

original: pravartayatu sugato dharmacakraṃ loke /
analyzed: pravartayatu sugataḥ dharmacakram loke

original: deśayatu bhagavān nirvṛtim /
analyzed: deśayatu bhagavān nirvṛtim

original: tārayatu bhagavān sattvān /
analyzed: tārayatu bhagavān sattvān

original: anugṛhṇātu bhagavānimaṃ lokam /
analyzed: anugṛhṇātu bhagavān imam lokam

original: deśayatu bhagavān dharmasvāmī dharmamasya lokasya samārakasya sabrahmakasya saśramaṇabrāhmaṇikāyāḥ prajāyāḥ sadevamānuṣāsurāyāḥ /

translated: May the Blessed One, the Lord of the Dharma, teach the Dharma to this world, with its gods, Māra, Brahmā, renunciants, and brahmins, to this population with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: tad bhaviṣyati bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāyai mahato janakāyasyārthāya hitāya sukhāya devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca //

analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ tāni pañcāśat brahma koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi eka svareṇa sama saṃgītyā tam bhagavantam ābhiḥ sārūpyābhiḥ gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣanta
translated: Then, monks, those fifty hundred thousand koṭis of nayutas of Brahmas, with one voice and one mind, addressed the Blessed One in these fitting verses:

original: deśehi bhagavan dharmaṃ deśehi dvipadottama /
analyzed: deśehi bhagavan dharmam deśehi dvipada uttama
translated: Teach the Dharma, Blessed One! Teach the Dharma, Best of Men!

analyzed: maitrī balam ca deśehi sattvān tārehi duḥkhitān

original: durlabho lokapradyotaḥ puṣpamaudumbaraṃ yathā /
analyzed: durlabhaḥ loka pradyotaḥ puṣpam audumbaram yathā

analyzed: utpannaḥ si mahāvīra adhyeṣāmaḥ tathāgatam

translated: “Bhikṣus, the Brahmās each thought, ‘These airborne palaces of the Brahmās have become very beautiful, bright, radiant, glorious, and majestic.

original: kasya khalvidaṃ pūrvanimittaṃ bhaviṣyatīti /🔽atha khalu bhikṣavasteṣu pañcāśatsu lokadhātukoṭīnayutaśatasahasreṣu ye mahābrahmāṇaḥ /
analyzed: kasya khalu idam pūrva nimittam bhaviṣyati iti  atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ teṣu pañcāśatsu lokadhātu koṭī nayuta śata sahasreṣu ye mahābrahmāṇaḥ
translated: What is the reason for this?’

analyzed: te pi sarve nyonya bhavanāni gatvā ārocayāmāsuḥ
translated: “Bhikṣus, the Mahābrahmās in those fifty hundred thousand quintillion worlds each went to the airborne palaces of the other Mahābrahmās and said to them,🔽‘Good people, these airborne palaces of the Brahmās have become very beautiful, bright, radiant, glorious, and majestic.🔽What is the reason for this?’

original: atha khalu bhikṣavo 'dhimātrakāruṇiko nāma mahābrahmā taṃ mahāntaṃ brahmagaṇaṃ gāthābhiradhyabhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ dhimātrakāruṇikaḥ nāma mahābrahmā tam mahāntam brahma gaṇam gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣata
translated: “Bhikṣus, at that time the Mahābrahmā named Adhimātra­karuṇika spoke these verses to the great assembly of Brahmās:🔽‘Good people, what is the reason

analyzed: kasya pūrva nimittena māriṣā atha dṛśyate
translated: that this is seen?

analyzed: vimānāḥ sarvi bhrājanti adhimātram yaśasvinaḥ
translated: All the shining palaces of the illustrious ones

analyzed: yadi vā deva putraḥ puṇyavantaḥ iha āgataḥ

analyzed: yasya ime anubhāvena vimānāḥ sarvi śobhitāḥ

original: atha vā buddha loke 'sminnutpanno dvipadottamaḥ /
analyzed: atha vā buddha loke smin utpannaḥ dvipada uttamaḥ

analyzed: anubhāvena yasya adya vimānāḥ imi īdṛśāḥ

analyzed: sahitāḥ sarvi mārgāmaḥ na etat kāraṇam alpakam

analyzed: vyaktam loke buddhasya prādurbhāvaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: It is clear that today the appearance of a Buddha will occur in the world.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ tāni api pañcāśat brahma koṭī nayuta ḥata sahasrāṇi tāni svāni svāni  divyāni brāhmāṇi vimānāni abhiruhya divyān ca sumeru mātrān puṣpa puṭān gṛhītvā catasṛṣu
translated: Then, monks, those fifty hundred thousand koṭis of nayutas of thousands of Brahmās, having assembled all together,🔽having mounted their own divine Brahmā aerial palaces, and taking divine flower baskets the size of Mount Sumeru,🔽wandering and roaming in the four directions,

analyzed: adrākṣuḥ khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ te mahābrahmāṇaḥ uttarapaḥcime digbhāge tam bhagavantam  mahābhijñājñānābhibhuvam tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham bodhimaṇḍa vara agra gatam
translated: Monks, the Great Brahma gods saw the Blessed One, the thus-gone, the worthy one, the perfect Buddha Great Wisdom and Knowledge, who had arrived at the sublime seat of awakening in the northern direction.

original: bodhivṛkṣamūle siṃhāsanopaviṣṭa parivṛtaṃ puraskṛtaṃ devanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragamanuṣyāmanuṣyaiḥ /

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar yena sa bhagavān mahābhijñājñānābhibhūḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tena upasaṃkrantāḥ  upasaṃkramya ca tasya bhagavataḥ pādau ḥirobhiḥ vanditvā tam bhagavantam anekaḥata sahasra kṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya taiḥ sumeru mātraiḥ puṣpa puṭaiḥ tam
translated: Having seen that, they went to the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Mahābhijñā­jñānābhi­bhū.🔽Having approached him, they bowed their heads to the Bhagavān’s feet, circumambulated the Bhagavān many hundreds of thousands of times, and then scattered flowers over the Bhagavān.

original: bhagavantamabhyavakiranti sma /
analyzed: bhagavantam abhyavakiranti sma
translated: They scattered flower petals the size of Mount Sumeru.

original: abhiprakiranti sma taṃ ca bodhivṛkṣaṃ daḥayojanapramāṇam /
analyzed: abhiprakiranti sma tam ca bodhivṛkṣam daḥ a yojana pramāṇam
translated: They scattered them over the Bodhi tree, which was seven yojanas in height.

original: abhyavakīrya tāni brāhmāṇi vimānāni tasya bhagavato niryātayāmāsuḥ parigṛhṇātu bhagavānimāni brāhmāṇi vimānānyasmākamanukampāmupādāya /

analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ te mahābrahmāṇaḥ tāni svāni svāni vimānāni tasya bhagavataḥ niryātya tasyām velāyām tam bhagavantam saṃmukham ābhiḥ sārūpyābhiḥ gāthābhiḥ abhiṣṭuvanti  / sma
translated: Then, monks, those Great Brahmas, having offered their own palaces to the Blessed One, at that time praised the Blessed One with these fitting verses:

analyzed: namaḥ stu te apratimā mahā ṛṣe devātidevā kalaviṅka su svarā
translated: “Homage to you, unequaled great sage, with a voice as sweet as a sparrow,

analyzed: āścarya bhūtaḥ si kathaṃcid loke su cireṇa nātha

analyzed: āsīt aśīti buddhaiḥ ayu jīvalokaḥ
translated: For a full hundred eons, eighty eons this world of living beings was empty without Buddhas.”

analyzed: śūnyaḥ ca āsīt dvipada uttame hi apāya bhūmī

analyzed: divyāḥ ca kāyāḥ tadā aśīti kalpāna śatā su pūrṇā

original: so dāni cakṣuśca gatiśca leṇaṃ trāṇaṃ pitā co tatha bandhubhūtaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ dāni cakṣuḥ ca gatiḥ ca leṇam trāṇam pitā ca tathā bandhu bhūtaḥ

analyzed: hita anukampī asmāka puṇyaiḥ iha dharma rājā

analyzed: vaidya  atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ te mahābrahmāṇaḥ tam bhagavantam mahābhijñājñānābhibhuvam tathāgatam arhantam  samyaksaṃbuddham saṃmukham ābhiḥ sārūpyābhiḥ gāthābhiḥ abhiṣṭutya tam bhagavantam etat ūcuḥ  pravartayatu bhagavān dharmacakram  pravartayatu sugataḥ dharmacakram loke

analyzed: tat bhaviṣyati bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāyai mahataḥ jana kāyasya arthāya hitāya sukhāya devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca
translated: That will be for the benefit and happiness of many beings, out of compassion for the world, for the sake of a great multitude of beings, for the benefit and well-being of gods and humans.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavastāni pañcāśad brahmakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi ekasvareṇa samasaṃgītyā taṃ bhagavantamābhyāṃ sārūpyābhyāṃ gāthābhyāmadhyabhāṣanta

analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ sa bhagavān teṣām api mahābrahmaṇām tūṣṇībhāvena adhivāsayati sma

original: tena khalu punarbhikṣavaḥ samayena dakṣiṇasyāṃ diśi teṣu pañcāśatsu lokadhātukoṭīnayutaśatasahasreṣu yāni brāhmāṇi vimānāni tānyatīva bhrājanti
analyzed: tena khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ samayena dakṣiṇasyām diśi teṣu pañcāśatsu lokadhātu koṭī nayuta śata sahasreṣu yāni brāhmāṇi vimānāni tāni atīva bhrājanti  /
translated: Monks, at that time, in those fifty hundred thousand quintillion world systems in the south, the airborne palaces of the Brahmas became very beautiful,

original: tapanti virājanti /
analyzed: tapanti virājanti

original: śrīmanti ojasvīni ca /
analyzed: śrīmanti ojasvīni ca

analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ teṣām mahābrahmaṇām etat abhavat imāni khalu punar brāhmāṇi vimānāni atīva
translated: Monks, the Great Brahmas thought, “Why are the airborne palaces of the Brahmas

original: bhrājanti tapanti virājanti śrīmanti ojasvīni ca /
analyzed: bhrājanti tapanti virājanti śrīmanti ojasvīni ca
translated: so very beautiful, bright, radiant, luminous, majestic, and glorious?

original: kasya khalvidamevaṃrūpaṃ pūrvanimittaṃ bhaviṣyati /🔽atha khalu bhikṣavasteṣu pañcāśatsu lokadhātukoṭīnayutaśatasahasreṣu ye mahābrahmāṇaḥ /
analyzed: kasya khalu idam evaṃrūpam pūrva nimittam bhaviṣyati  atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ teṣu pañcāśatsu lokadhātu koṭī nayuta śata sahasreṣu ye mahābrahmāṇaḥ
translated: What is the reason, what is the cause, for this auspicious sign?”

analyzed: te sarve nyonya bhavanāni gatvā ārocayāmāsuḥ
translated: Monks, all the Great Brahmas in those fifty hundred thousand quintillion world systems went together to the Brahma realm called Beautiful to inform the Great Brahma God Superior Light of this matter.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ sudharmo nāma mahābrahmā taṃ mahāntaṃ brahmagaṇaṃ gāthābhyāmadhyabhāṣata

translated: Monks, at that time the Great Brahma named Sudharma spoke these verses to the great assembly of Brahmas:

original: nāhetu nākāraṇamadya mārṣāḥ sarve vimānā iha jājvalanti /
analyzed: na ahetu na akāraṇam adya mārṣāḥ sarve vimānāḥ iha jājvalanti

analyzed: ha kim loke sādhu tam etam artham

analyzed: śatā hi atītāḥ na etādṛśam jātu nimittam āsīt  vaidya

analyzed: yadi vā upapannaḥ iha deva putraḥ loke yadi vā iha buddhaḥ
translated: If a god has been reborn here, or if a Buddha has appeared in the world,

analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ teṣu pañcāśatsu lokadhātu koṭī nayuta śata sahasreṣu ye mahābrahmāṇaḥ  te sarve sahitāḥ samagrāḥ tāni divyāni svāni svāni brāhmāṇi vimānāni abhiruhya divyān ca
translated: Then, monks, in those fifty hundred thousand quintillion worlds, the great Brahma gods🔽all together, in unison, ascended to their own divine Brahma palaces and, taking divine flower baskets,

analyzed: sumeru mātrān puṣpa puṭān gṛhītvā catasṛṣu dikṣu anucaṃkramantaḥ nu vicarantaḥ uttaram  digbhāgam prakrāntāḥ

original: adrākṣuḥ khalu punarbhikṣavaste mahābrahmāṇa uttaraṃ digbhāgaṃ taṃ bhagavantaṃ mahābhijñājñānābhibhuvaṃ

translated: Monks, those great Brahma gods saw in the northern direction the Blessed One, the Greatly Wise and Powerful One,

original: tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ bodhimaṇḍavarāgragataṃ bodhivṛkṣamūle siṃhāsanopaviṣṭaṃ
analyzed: tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham bodhimaṇḍa vara agra gatam bodhivṛkṣa mūle siṃhāsana upaviṣṭam
translated: the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, who was seated on the lion throne at the foot of the Bodhi tree,

analyzed: parivṛtam puraskṛtam deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga manuṣya amanuṣyaiḥ
translated: surrounded and revered by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans,

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punaryena sa bhagavāṃstenopasaṃkrāntāḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar yena sa bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāntāḥ

translated: Having approached, they bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One, circumambulated the Blessed One many hundreds of thousands of times, and with those flower baskets the size of Mount Sumeru

original: bhagavantamabhyavakiranti sma /
analyzed: bhagavantam abhyavakiranti sma
translated: they scattered them over the Blessed One.

original: abhiprakiranti sma taṃ ca bodhivṛkṣaṃ daśayojanapramāṇam /
analyzed: abhiprakiranti sma tam ca bodhivṛkṣam daśa yojana pramāṇam
translated: They scattered them over the Bodhi tree, which was ten yojanas in size.🔽Having scattered them, they offered those Brahmā airborne palaces to the Blessed One, saying, Blessed One, out of compassion for us

original: abhyavakīrya tāni brāhmāṇi divyāni vimānāni tasya bhagavato niryātayāmāsuḥ parigṛhṇātu bhagavānimāni brāhmāṇi vimānāni asmākamanukampāmupādāya
analyzed: abhyavakīrya tāni brāhmāṇi divyāni vimānāni tasya bhagavataḥ niryātayāmāsuḥ parigṛhṇātu bhagavān imāni brāhmāṇi vimānāni asmākam anukampām upādāya
translated: please accept these Brahmā airborne palaces.

analyzed: paribhuñjatu sugataḥ imāni brāhmāṇi vimānāni asmākam anukampām upādāya
translated: ‘May the Sugata enjoy these airborne palaces of the Brahmās out of compassion for us.’

original: atha khalu bhikṣavaste 'pi mahābrahmāṇastāni svāni svāni vimānāni tasya bhagavato niryātya tasyāṃ velāyāṃ taṃ bhagavantaṃ saṃmukhamābhiḥ sārūpyābhirgāthābhirabhiṣṭuvanti 🔽sma
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ te pi mahābrahmāṇaḥ tāni svāni svāni vimānāni tasya bhagavataḥ niryātya tasyām velāyām tam bhagavantam saṃmukham ābhiḥ sārūpyābhiḥ gāthābhiḥ abhiṣṭuvanti  / sma
translated: “Bhikṣus, then those Mahābrahmās, after offering their airborne palaces to the Bhagavān, at that time recited these verses to the Bhagavān:

original: sudurlabhaṃ darśana nāyakānāṃ svabhyāgataṃ te bhavarāgamardana /
analyzed: su durlabham darśana nāyakānām su abhyāgatam te bhava rāga mardana
translated: “ ‘It is very difficult to see the guides, Who have come to crush the passion for existence.

original: sucirasya te darśanamadya loke paripūrṇa kalpāna śatebhi dṛśyase // / //
analyzed: su cirasya te darśanam adya loke paripūrṇa śatebhiḥ dṛśyase
translated: After a very long time you are seen today in the world. You are seen after a hundred perfect eons.

original: tṛṣitāṃ prajāṃ tarpaya lokanātha adṛṣṭapūrvo 'si kathaṃci dṛśyase /
analyzed: tṛṣitām prajām tarpaya lokanātha a dṛṣṭa pūrvaḥ si kathaṃci dṛśyase
translated: “ ‘Lord of the World, satisfy the thirsty people. You have never been seen before. Somehow you are seen.

original: audumbaraṃ puṣpa yathaiva durlabhaṃ tathaiva dṛṣṭo 'si kathaṃci nāyaka // / //🔽vimāna asmākamimā vināyaka tavānubhāvena viśobhitādya /
analyzed: audumbaram yathā eva durlabham tathā eva dṛṣṭaḥ si kathaṃcid  vimāna asmākam imāḥ vināyaka tava anubhāvena viśobhitāḥ adya
translated: Just as the flower of the udumbara tree is difficult to find, In that way, somehow, Guide, you are seen.🔽“ ‘Guide, these airborne palaces of ours Are today beautified by your power.

original: parigṛhya etāni samantacakṣuḥ paribhuñja cāsmākamanugrahārtham // / //
analyzed: parigṛhya etāni samanta cakṣuḥ paribhuñja ca asmākam anugraha artham
translated: All-Seeing One, accept them And enjoy them out of compassion for us.’🔽“Bhikṣus, at that time the Bhagavān, the Tathāgata Siddhārthabuddhi, knowing the higher motivation of those Mahābrahmās, who had the thought of requesting the Tathāgata to teach the Dharma, at that time manifested his form as a tathāgata, manifesting the body of a great being, and he manifested the body of a great being to those Mahābrahmās.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavaste mahābrahmāṇastaṃ bhagavantaṃ mahābhijñājñānābhibhuvaṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ te mahābrahmāṇaḥ tam bhagavantam mahābhijñājñānābhibhuvam tathāgatam arhantam
translated: Then, monks, those Great Brahma gods, having bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, the Powerful One, the Jina, the Supreme One, the Trainer of Men to be Tamed, the Teacher of Gods and Men, the Blessed Buddha, stood to one side.

original: samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ saṃmukhamābhiḥ sārūpyabhirgāthābhirabhiṣṭutya te bhagavantametadūcuḥ

translated: Then, monks, those Great Brahmas, having praised the Blessed One, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Mahaabhijñaa-jñaana-aabhisaambodhi with these fitting verses, said this to the Blessed One:

original: pravartayatu bhagavān dharmacakraṃ loke /
analyzed: pravartayatu bhagavān dharmacakram loke
translated: May the Blessed One turn the wheel of Dharma for the sake of the world's welfare,

original: deśayatu bhagavān nirvṛtim /
analyzed: deśayatu bhagavān nirvṛtim
translated: may the Blessed One teach nirvana,

original: tārayatu bhagavān sattvān /
analyzed: tārayatu bhagavān sattvān

original: anugṛhṇātu bhagavānimaṃ lokam /
analyzed: anugṛhṇātu bhagavān imam lokam

analyzed: deśayatu bhagavān dharmam asya lokasya sa mārakasya sa brahmakasya sa śramaṇa brāhmaṇikāyāḥ vaidya  prajāyāḥ sa deva mānuṣa asurāyāḥ
translated: may the Blessed One teach the Dharma to this world - with its gods, Maras, Brahmas, renunciants, and Brahmins;🔽with its people, devas, nagas, garudas, gandharvas, asuras, garudas, kinnaras, and mahoragas; with its humans and non-humans -

original: tadbhaviṣyati bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāyai mahato janakāyasyārthāya hitāya sukhāya devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca //
analyzed: tat bhaviṣyati bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāyai mahataḥ jana kāyasya arthāya hitāya sukhāya devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca
translated: for the welfare, benefit, and happiness of gods, humans, and a great multitude of beings.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavastāni pañcāśad brahmakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi ekasvareṇa samasaṃgītyā taṃ bhagavantamābhyāṃ sārūpyābhyāṃ gāthābhyāmadhyabhāṣanta
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ tāni pañcāśat brahma koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi eka svareṇa sama saṃgītyā tam bhagavantam ābhyām sārūpyābhyām gāthābhyām adhyabhāṣanta
translated: Then, monks, those five hundred thousand koṭis of nayutas of hundreds of Brahmas, with one voice and one mind, spoke thus to the Lord in these fitting verses:

original: deśehi dharmaṃ bhagavan vināyaka pravartayā dharmamayaṃ ca cakram /🔽nirnādayā dharmamayaṃ ca dundubhiṃ taṃ dharmaśaṅkhaṃ ca prapūrayasva // / //
analyzed: deśehi dharmam bhagavan vināyaka pravartaya dharma mayam ca cakram  nirnādaya dharma mayam ca dundubhim tam dharma śaṅkham ca prapūrayasva
translated: Proclaim the Law, O Lord, O Leader, set rolling the wheel of the Law,🔽Beat the drum of the Law, blow the conch of the Law, fill the world with the Law.

original: saddharmavarṣaṃ varṣayasva loke valgusvaraṃ bhāṣa subhāṣitaṃ ca /
analyzed: saddharma varṣam varṣayasva loke valgu svaram bhāṣa subhāṣitam ca
translated: Rain down the rain of the Law on the world, speak in a sweet voice and well,

translated: Being entreated, proclaim the Law, deliver myriads of koṭis of beings.

analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ teṣām mahābrahmaṇām etat abhavat imāni khalu punar brāhmāṇi vimānāni atīva bhrājanti tapanti virājanti śrīmanti ojasvīni
translated: “Then, monks, the great Brahmās each thought, ‘These airborne palaces of the Brahmās have become very beautiful, bright, radiant, glorious, and majestic.

analyzed: kasya khalu idam evaṃrūpam pūrvaṃnimittam bhaviṣyati iti  atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ teṣu pañcāśatsu lokadhātu koṭī nayuta śata sahasreṣu ye mahābrahmāṇaḥ

analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ śikhī nāma mahābrahmā tam mahāntam brahma gaṇam gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣata

translated: ‘Friends, what is the cause of this? What is the reason for this?

analyzed: ojena varṇena cāpi adhimātra vṛddhāni kim atra kāraṇam

translated: We have never seen or heard of such a thing before. Who was it that was like this in the past?

analyzed: adya etāḥ adhimātra bhrājanti kim atra kāraṇam

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

analyzed: yadi vā nu kaścid bhavi deva putraḥ śubhena karmeṇa samanvitaḥ iha

analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ teṣu pañcāśatsu lokadhātu koṭī nayuta śata sahasreṣu ye mahābrahmāṇaḥ
translated: Then, monks, all the great Brahmas in those fifty hundred thousand quintillion worlds,

analyzed: te sarve sahitāḥ samagrāḥ tāni divyāni svāni svāni brāhmāṇi vimānāni abhiruhya divyān ca
translated: together and in unison, ascended to their own divine Brahmā palaces and, taking divine🔽flowers

original: sumerumātrān puṣpapuṭān gṛhītvā catasṛṣu dikṣvanucaṃkramanto 'nuvicaranto yena adhodigbhāgastenopasaṃkrāntāḥ /
analyzed: sumeru mātrān puṣpa puṭān gṛhītvā catasṛṣu dikṣu anucaṃkramantaḥ nu vicarantaḥ yena adhas digbhāgaḥ tena upasaṃkrāntāḥ
translated: and flower baskets the size of Mount Sumeru, they roamed and wandered in the four directions, going to the lower regions.

original: adrākṣuḥ khalu punarbhikṣavaste mahābrahmāṇo 'dhodigbhāge taṃ bhagavantaṃ mahābhijñājñānābhibhuvaṃ🔽tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ bodhimaṇḍavarāgragataṃ bodhivṛkṣamūle siṃhāsanopaviṣṭaṃ
analyzed: adrākṣuḥ khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ te mahābrahmāṇaḥ dhas digbhāge tam bhagavantam mahā abhijñā jñāna abhibhuvam  tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham bodhimaṇḍa vara agra gatam bodhivṛkṣa mūle siṃhāsana upaviṣṭam
translated: Monks, the great Brahmās saw the Blessed One, the thus-gone, the worthy one, the perfect Buddha with great higher knowledge and wisdom,🔽who had gone to the sublime seat of awakening and was sitting on a lion throne at the foot of the Bodhi tree.

original: parivṛtaṃ puraskṛtaṃ devanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragarūḍakinnaramahoragamanuṣyāmanuṣyaiḥ /
analyzed: parivṛtam puraskṛtam deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garūḍa kinnara mahoraga manuṣya amanuṣyaiḥ
translated: Monks, the Great Brahma gods saw the Blessed One, the Thus-Gone One, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One, the one with perfect knowledge and conduct, the Sugata, the knower of the world, the unsurpassed guide for those to be tamed, the teacher of gods and humans, the Buddha, the Blessed One, sitting on the lion throne at the foot of the Bodhi tree, surrounded and revered by gods, nagas, yakshas, gandharvas, asuras, garudas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans,

original: taiśca putraiḥ ṣoḍaśabhī rājakumārairadhyeṣyamāṇaṃ dharmacakrapravartanatāyai /
analyzed: taiḥ ca putraiḥ ṣoḍaśabhiḥ rāja kumāraiḥ adhyeṣyamāṇam dharma cakra pravartana tāyai
translated: and by his sixteen sons, the princes, who were requesting him to turn the wheel of Dharma.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punaryena sa bhagavāṃstenopasaṃkrāntāḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar yena sa bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāntāḥ
translated: Having seen this, they approached the Blessed One.

original: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirobhirvanditvā taṃ bhagavantamanekaśatasahasrakṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya taiḥ sumerumātraiḥ puṣpapuṭaistaṃ bhagavantamabhyavakiranti
analyzed: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirobhiḥ vanditvā tam bhagavantam aneka śata sahasra kṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya taiḥ sumeru mātraiḥ puṣpa puṭaiḥ tam bhagavantam abhyavakiranti
translated: Having approached, they bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One, circumambulated the Blessed One many hundreds of thousands of times, and scattered flower baskets the size of Mount Sumeru over the Blessed One.

original: abhiprakiranti sma taṃ ca bodhivṛkṣaṃ daśayojanapramāṇam /
analyzed: abhiprakiranti sma tam ca bodhivṛkṣam daśa yojana pramāṇam
translated: They scattered them over the Bodhi tree, which was ten leagues in size.

original: abhyavakīrya tāni divyāni svāni svāni brāhmāṇi vimānāni tasya bhagavato niryātayāmāsuḥ pratigṛhṇātu bhagavānimāni brāhmāṇi vimānānyasmākamanukampāmupādāya
analyzed: abhyavakīrya tāni divyāni svāni svāni brāhmāṇi vimānāni tasya bhagavataḥ niryātayāmāsuḥ pratigṛhṇātu bhagavān imāni brāhmāṇi vimānāni asmākam anukampām upādāya
translated: Having scattered those divine, divine aerial palaces, they offered them to the Blessed One, saying, 'May the Blessed One accept these divine aerial palaces out of compassion for us.

original: paribhuñjatu sugata imāni brāhmāṇi vimānānyasmākamanukampāmupādāyeti //
analyzed: paribhuñjatu sugataḥ imāni brāhmāṇi vimānāni asmākam anukampām upādāya iti
translated: May the Sugata enjoy these divine aerial palaces out of compassion for us.'

original: atha khalu bhikṣavaste 'pi mahābrahmāṇastāni svāni svāni vimānāni tasya bhagavato niryātya tasyāṃ velāyāṃ taṃ bhagavantaṃ saṃmukhamābhiḥ sārūpyābhirgāthābhirabhiṣṭuvanti 🔽sma
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ te pi mahābrahmāṇaḥ tāni svāni svāni vimānāni tasya bhagavataḥ niryātya tasyām velāyām tam bhagavantam saṃmukham ābhiḥ sārūpyābhiḥ gāthābhiḥ abhiṣṭuvanti  / sma
translated: Then, monks, those Great Brahmas, having offered their own aerial palaces to the Blessed One, at that time extolled him with these fitting verses in his presence:

original: sādhu darśana buddhāna lokanāthāna tāyinām /
analyzed: sādhu darśana buddhāna loka nāthāna tāyinām
translated: 'It is good to see the Buddhas, the Lords of the World, the Protectors,

original: tradhātukasmi buddhā vai sattvānāṃ ye pramocakāḥ // / //
analyzed: buddhāḥ vai sattvānām ye pramocakāḥ
translated: The Buddhas in the three realms, who liberate beings.

original: samantacakṣu lokendrā vyavalokenti diśo daśa /
analyzed: samantacakṣuḥ loka indrāḥ diśaḥ daśa
translated: The Eyes of the World, the Lords, look in the ten directions.

original: vivaritvāmṛtadvāramotārenti bahūn janān // / //
analyzed: bahūn janān
translated: Having opened the door to immortality, they liberate many people.

original: śūnyā acintiyāḥ kalpā atītāḥ pūrvi ye abhū /
analyzed: śūnyāḥ acintiyāḥ kalpāḥ atītāḥ pūrvi ye abhū
translated: Innumerable and inconceivable eons have passed in the past.

original: adarśanājjinendrāṇāṃ andhā āsīddiśo daśa // / //
analyzed: a darśanāt jinendrāṇām andhāḥ āsīt diśaḥ daśa
translated: In the absence of seeing the Lords of the Jinas, the ten directions were blind.

original: vardhanti narakāstīvrāstiryagyonistathāsurāḥ /
analyzed: vardhanti narakāḥ tīvrāḥ tiryagyoniḥ tathā asurāḥ
translated: The hells become more severe, and so do the animal realms and the realms of the asuras.

original: preteṣu copapadyante prāṇikoṭyaḥ sahasraśaḥ // / //
analyzed: preteṣu ca upapadyante prāṇi koṭyaḥ sahasraśas
translated: Thousands of millions of beings are reborn among the pretas.

original: divyāḥ kāyāśca hīyante cyutā gacchanti durgatim /
analyzed: divyāḥ kāyāḥ ca hīyante cyutāḥ gacchanti durgatim
translated: The divine bodies diminish, and upon falling, they go to bad destinies.

original: aśrutvā dharma buddhānāṃ gatyeṣāṃ bhoti pāpikā // / //
analyzed: a śrutvā dharma buddhānām gatī iṣām pāpikā
translated: Not hearing the Dharma of the Buddhas, their destiny becomes evil.

original: caryāśuddhigatiprajñā hīyante sarvaprāṇinām /
analyzed: caryā śuddhi gati prajñāḥ hīyante sarva prāṇinām
translated: The conduct, purity, and wisdom of all beings diminish.

original: sukhaṃ vinaśyatī teṣāṃ sukhasaṃjñā ca naśyati // / //
analyzed: sukham vinaśyatī teṣām sukha saṃjñā ca naśyati
translated: Their happiness is destroyed, and the notion of happiness is lost.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: anācārāśca te bhonti asaddharme pratiṣṭhitāḥ /
analyzed: anācārāḥ ca te bhonti asat dharme pratiṣṭhitāḥ
translated: They become immoral and established in false Dharma.

original: adāntā lokanāthena durgatiṃ prapatanti te // / //
analyzed: a dāntāḥ loka nāthena durgatim prapatanti te
translated: Untamed by the Lord of the World, they fall into bad destinies.

original: dṛṣṭo 'si lokapradyota sucireṇāsi āgataḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭaḥ si loka pradyota su cireṇa asi āgataḥ
translated: You are seen, O Light of the World, you have come after a long time.

original: utpannu sarvasattvānāṃ kṛtena anukampakaḥ // / //
analyzed: sarva sattvānām kṛtena anukampakaḥ
translated: You have arisen for the sake of all beings, out of compassion.

original: diṣṭayā kṣemeṇa prāpto 'si buddhajñānamanuttaram /
analyzed: diṣṭayā kṣemeṇa prāptaḥ si buddha jñānam anuttaram
translated: By good fortune and well-being, you have attained the unsurpassed knowledge of a Buddha.

original: vayaṃ te anumodāmo lokaścaiva sadevakaḥ // / //
analyzed: vayam te anumodāmaḥ lokaḥ ca eva sa devakaḥ
translated: We rejoice in you, and so does the world with its gods.

original: vimānāni sucitrāṇi anubhāvena te vibho /
analyzed: vimānāni su citrāṇi anubhāvena te vibho
translated: The beautifully adorned palaces, by your power, O Lord,

original: dadāma te mahāvīra pratigṛhṇa mahāmune // / //
analyzed: dadāma te mahā vīra pratigṛhṇa mahā mune
translated: We offer to you, O Great Hero, accept them, O Great Sage.

original: asmākamanukampārthaṃ paribhuñja vināyaka /
analyzed: asmākam anukampā artham paribhuñja vināyaka
translated: For the sake of showing compassion to us, O Guide, please accept them.

original: vayaṃ ca sarvasattvāśca agrāṃ bodhiṃ spṛśemahi // / //🔽atha khalu bhikṣavaste mahābrahmāṇastaṃ bhagavantaṃ mahābhijñājñānābhibhuvaṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ
analyzed: vayam ca sarva sattvāḥ ca agrām bodhim spṛśemahi  atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ te mahābrahmāṇaḥ tam bhagavantam mahābhijñājñānābhibhuvam tathāgatam arhantam
translated: May we and all beings touch the supreme enlightenment.

original: samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ saṃmukhamābhiḥ sārūpyābhirgāthābhirabhiṣṭutya taṃ bhagavantametadūcuḥ
analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddham saṃmukham ābhiḥ sārūpyābhiḥ gāthābhiḥ abhiṣṭutya tam bhagavantam etat ūcuḥ
translated: Then, monks, those Great Brahmas, having praised the Blessed One, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Maha-abhijña-jnana-abhibhu with these fitting verses, said this to the Blessed One:

original: pravartayatu bhagavān dharmacakram /
analyzed: pravartayatu bhagavān dharmacakram
translated: May the Blessed One turn the wheel of Dharma!

original: pravartayatu sugato dharmacakram /
analyzed: pravartayatu sugataḥ dharmacakram
translated: May the Well-Gone One turn the wheel of Dharma!

original: deśayatu bhagavān nirvṛtim /
analyzed: deśayatu bhagavān nirvṛtim
translated: May the Blessed One teach nirvana!

original: tārayatu bhagavān sarvasattvān /
analyzed: tārayatu bhagavān sarva sattvān
translated: May the Blessed One liberate all beings!

original: anugṛhṇātu bhagavānimaṃ lokam /
analyzed: anugṛhṇātu bhagavān imam lokam
translated: May the Blessed One favor this world!

original: deśayatu bhagavān /
analyzed: deśayatu bhagavān
translated: May the Blessed One teach!

original: dharmamasya lokasya samārakasya sabrahmakasya saśramaṇabrāhmaṇikāyāḥ prajāyāḥ sadevamānuṣāsurāyāḥ /
analyzed: dharmam asya lokasya sa mārakasya sa brahmakasya sa śramaṇa brāhmaṇikāyāḥ prajāyāḥ sa deva mānuṣa asurāyāḥ
translated: For the sake of this world, with its gods, Maras, Brahmas, renunciants, and Brahmins, this generation with its princes and people, may the Blessed One teach the Dharma that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with its own meaning and phrasing, reveal the holy life that is perfectly complete and pure.

original: tadbhaviṣyati bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokanukampāyai mahato janakāyasyārthāya hitāya sukhāya devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca //
analyzed: tat bhaviṣyati bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāyai mahataḥ jana kāyasya arthāya hitāya sukhāya devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca
translated: That will be for the benefit and happiness of many beings, for the sake of a great number of beings, for the benefit and happiness of gods, humans, and asuras.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavastāni pañcāśad brahmakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇyekasvareṇa samasaṃgītyā taṃ bhagavantamābhyāṃ sārūpyābhyāṃ gāthābhyāmadhyabhāṣanta
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ tāni pañcāśat brahma koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi eka svareṇa sama saṃgītyā tam bhagavantam ābhyām sārūpyābhyām gāthābhyām adhyabhāṣanta
translated: Then, monks, those fifty hundred thousand koṭis of nayutas of Brahmas, with one voice and one mind, spoke to the Lord these fitting verses:🔽“Set rolling the incomparable wheel,

original: pravartayā cakravaramanuttaraṃ parāhanasvā amṛtasya dundubhim /
analyzed: pravartaya cakravaram anuttaram parāhanasva amṛtasya dundubhim
translated: beat the drum of deathlessness,🔽deliver from a hundred miseries those who are in the world of life,

original: pramocayā duḥkhaśataiśca sattvān nirvāṇamārgaṃ ca pradarśayasva // / //
analyzed: pramocayā duḥkha śataiḥ ca sattvān nirvāṇa mārgam ca pradarśayasva
translated: and show the way to nirvana.”

original: asmābhiradhyeṣitu bhāṣa dharmamasmānanugṛhṇa imaṃ ca lokam /
analyzed: asmābhiḥ adhyeṣitu bhāṣa dharmam asmān anugṛhṇe imam ca lokam
translated: “We entreat thee to teach the dharma, and so favour us and this world.

original: valgusvaraṃ co madhuraṃ pramuñca samudānitaṃ kalpasahasrakoṭibhiḥ // / //
analyzed: valgu svaram ca u madhuram pramuñca samudānitam kalpa sahasra koṭibhiḥ
translated: Emit thy voice, sweet and charming, which thou hast gathered for koṭis of thousands of kalpas.”

original: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ sa bhagavān mahābhijñājñānābhibhūstathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhasteṣāṃ
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ sa bhagavān mahābhijñājñānābhibhūḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ teṣām
translated: Then, monks, the Lord, the Tathāgata, the Arhan, the perfect Buddha, the great-­power-­knowledge-­overwhelming, knowing the entreaty of those

original: brahmakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇāmadhyeṣaṇāṃ viditvā teṣāṃ ca ṣoḍaśānāṃ putrāṇāṃ rājakumārāṇām /
analyzed: brahma koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇām adhyeṣaṇām viditvā teṣām ca ṣoḍaśānām putrāṇām rāja kumārāṇām
translated: koṭis of nayutas of Brahmas and of his sixteen sons, the princes,

original: tasyāṃ velāyāṃ dharmacakraṃ pravartayāmāsa triparivartaṃ dvādaśākāramapravartitaṃ
analyzed: tasyām velāyām dharmacakram pravartayāmāsa tri parivartam dvādaśa ākāram a pravartitam
translated: at that time set rolling the incomparable wheel of dharma which is thrice-­revolved and twelve-­fold and which had never been set rolling by any recluse or brahman or god or Māra or Brahmā.

original: śramaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā devena vā māreṇa vā brahmaṇā vā anyena vā kenacit punarloke saha dharmeṇa /🔽yadidaṃ Vaidya
analyzed: śramaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā devena vā māreṇa vā brahmaṇā vā anyena vā kenacid punar loke saha dharmeṇa  yat idam vaidya
translated: by a monk, a brahmin, a god, a Māra, a Brahmā, or anyone else in the world, together with the Dharma.

original: duḥkham / ayaṃ duḥkhasamudayaḥ /
analyzed: duḥkham ayam duḥkha samudayaḥ
translated: This is the noble truth of suffering. This is the arising of suffering.

original: ayaṃ duḥkhanirodhaḥ /
analyzed: ayam duḥkha nirodhaḥ
translated: This is the cessation of suffering.

original: iyaṃ duḥkhanirodhagāminī pratipadāryasatyamiti /
analyzed: iyam duḥkha nirodha gāminī pratipad ārya satyam iti
translated: This is the path leading to the cessation of suffering, the noble truth.

original: pratītyasamutpādapravṛttiṃ ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayāmāsa iti hi bhikṣavo 'vidyāpratyayāḥ saṃskārāḥ /
analyzed: pratītyasamutpāda pravṛttim ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayāmāsa iti hi bhikṣavaḥ vidyā pratyayāḥ saṃskārāḥ
translated: He also taught in detail the progression of dependent origination. Thus, monks, with ignorance as condition, there are volitional formations.

original: saṃskārapratyayaṃ vijñānam /
analyzed: saṃskāra pratyayam vijñānam
translated: With volitional formations as condition, there is consciousness.

original: vijñānapratyayaṃ nāmarūpam /
analyzed: vijñāna pratyayam nāma rūpam
translated: With consciousness as condition, name-and-form.

original: nāmarūpapratyayaṃ ṣaḍāyatanam /
analyzed: nāma rūpa pratyayam ṣaṣ āyatanam
translated: With name-and-form as condition, the six sense bases.

original: ṣaḍāyatanapratyayaḥ sparśaḥ /
analyzed: ṣaṣ āyatana pratyayaḥ sparśaḥ
translated: With the six sense bases as condition, contact.

original: sparśapratyayā vedanā vedanāpratyayā tṛṣṇā /
analyzed: sparśa pratyayā vedanā vedanā pratyayā tṛṣṇā
translated: With contact as condition, feeling. With feeling as condition, craving.

original: tṛṣṇāpratyayamupādānam /🔽upādānapratyayo bhavaḥ /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā pratyayam upādānam  upādāna pratyayaḥ bhavaḥ
translated: With craving as condition, clinging.🔽With clinging as condition, becoming.

original: bhavapratyayā jātiḥ /
analyzed: bhava pratyayā jātiḥ
translated: With becoming as condition, birth.

original: jātipratyayā jarāmaraṇaśokaparidevaduḥkhadaurmanasyopāyāsāḥ saṃbhavanti /
analyzed: jāti pratyayāḥ jarā maraṇa śoka parideva duḥkha daurmanasya upāyāsāḥ saṃbhavanti
translated: With birth as condition, aging, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair (all) arise.

original: evamasya kevalasya mahato duḥkhaskandhasya samudayo bhavati /
analyzed: evam asya kevalasya mahataḥ duḥkha skandhasya samudayaḥ bhavati
translated: Thus arises this whole great mass of suffering.

original: avidyānirodhāt saṃskāranirodhaḥ /🔽saṃskāranirodhād vijñānanirodhaḥ /
analyzed: avidyā nirodhāt saṃskāra nirodhaḥ  saṃskāra nirodhāt vijñāna nirodhaḥ
translated: From the cessation of ignorance, the cessation of volitional formations.

original: vijñānanirodhānnāmarūpanirodhaḥ /
analyzed: vijñāna nirodhāt nāma rūpa nirodhaḥ
translated: From the cessation of volitional formations, the cessation of consciousness.🔽From the cessation of consciousness, the cessation of name-and-form.

original: nāmarūpanirodhāt ṣaḍāyatananirodhaḥ /
analyzed: nāma rūpa nirodhāt ṣaṣ āyatana nirodhaḥ
translated: From the cessation of name-and-form, the cessation of the six sense bases.

original: ṣaḍāyatananirodhāt sparśanirodhaḥ /
analyzed: ṣaṣ āyatana nirodhāt sparśa nirodhaḥ
translated: From the cessation of the six sense bases, the cessation of contact.

original: sparśanirodhād vedanānirodhaḥ /🔽vedanānirodhāttṛṣṇānirodhaḥ /
analyzed: sparśa nirodhāt vedanā nirodhaḥ  vedanā nirodhāt tṛṣṇā nirodhaḥ
translated: From the cessation of contact, the cessation of feeling.🔽From the cessation of feeling, the cessation of craving.

original: tṛṣṇānirodhādupādānanirodhaḥ /🔽upādānanirodhād bhavanirodhaḥ /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā nirodhāt upādāna nirodhaḥ
translated: From the cessation of craving, the cessation of clinging.🔽From the cessation of clinging, the cessation of becoming.

original: bhavanirodhājjātinirodhaḥ /
analyzed: bhava nirodhāt jāti nirodhaḥ
translated: From the cessation of becoming, the cessation of birth.

original: jātinirodhājjarāmaraṇaśokaparidevaduḥkhadaurmanasyopāyāsā nirudhyante /
analyzed: jāti nirodhāt jarā maraṇa śoka parideva duḥkha daurmanasya upāyāsāḥ nirudhyante
translated: From the cessation of birth, old age, death, grief, lamentation, pain, sorrow, and despair cease.

original: evamasya kevalasya mahato duḥkhaskandhasya nirodho bhavati //🔽sahapravartitaṃ cedaṃ bhikṣavastena bhagavatā mahābhijñājñānābhibhuvā tathāgatenārhatā
analyzed: evam asya kevalasya mahataḥ duḥkha skandhasya nirodhaḥ bhavati  saha pravartitam ca idam bhikṣavaḥ tena bhagavatā mahābhijñājñānābhibhuvā tathāgatena arhatā

analyzed: paryupāsadhvam bhikṣavaḥ etān ṣoḍaśa śrāmaṇerān punar punar  ye kecid bhikṣavaḥ vaidya
