original: śrāvakayānikā vā pratyekabuddhayānikā vā bodhisattvayānikā vā eṣāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ dharmadeśanāṃ na pratikṣepsyanti /
analyzed: śrāvaka yānikāḥ vā pratyekabuddha yānikāḥ vā bodhisattva yānikāḥ vā eṣām kula putrāṇām dharma deśanām na pratikṣepsyanti
translated: Bhikṣus, whoever, whether they are in the Śrāvakayāna, the Pratyeka­buddha­yāna, or the Bodhisattva­yāna, does not reject the teaching of the Dharma of these noble men,

original: na pratibādhiṣyante /
analyzed: na pratibādhiṣyante
translated: and does not oppose it,

original: sarve te kṣipramanuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodherlābhino bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: sarve te kṣipram anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ lābhinaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: all of them will quickly attain the highest, complete enlightenment.

original: sarve ca te tathāgatajñānamanuprāpsyanti //
analyzed: sarve ca te tathāgata jñānam anuprāpsyanti
translated: All of them will attain the wisdom of the tathāgatas.”

original: taiḥ khalu punarbhikṣavaḥ ṣoḍaśabhiḥ kulaputraistasya bhagavataḥ śāsane 'yaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīko dharmaparyāyaḥ punaḥ punaḥ saṃprakāśito 'bhūt
analyzed: taiḥ khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ ṣoḍaśabhiḥ kula putraiḥ tasya bhagavataḥ śāsane yam saddharmapuṇḍarīkaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ punar punar saṃprakāśitaḥ bhūt
translated: “Bhikṣus, those sixteen young men again and again taught this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma in the teaching of that Bhagavān.

original: taiḥ khalu punarbhikṣavaḥ ṣoḍaśabhiḥ śrāmaṇerairbodhisattvairmahāsattvairyāni tānyekaikena🔽bodhisattvena mahāsattvena ṣaṣṭiṣaṣṭigaṅgānadīvālukāsamāni sattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi
analyzed: taiḥ khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ ṣoḍaśabhiḥ śrāmaṇeraiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ mahāsattvaiḥ yāni tāni ekaikena  bodhisattvena mahāsattvena ṣaṣṭi ṣaṣṭi gaṅgā nadī vālukā samāni sattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi
translated: “Bhikṣus, those sixteen young men, those bodhisattva mahāsattvas, each one

original: bodhāya samādāpitānyabhūvan /
analyzed: bodhāya samādāpitāni abhūvan
translated: had inspired sixty quintillions of beings to attain the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood,

original: sarvāṇi ca tāni taireva sārdhaṃ tāsu tāsu jātiṣvanupravrajitāni /
analyzed: sarvāṇi ca tāni taiḥ eva sārdham tāsu tāsu jātiṣu anupravrajitāni
translated: and all of them had gone forth together with them in those births.

original: tānyeva samanupaśyantasteṣāmevāntikāddharmamaśrauṣuḥ /
analyzed: tāni eva samanupaśyantaḥ teṣām eva antikāt dharmam aśrauṣuḥ
translated: They saw them and heard the Dharma from them.

original: taiścatvāriṃśad buddhakoṭīsahasrāṇyārāgitāni /
analyzed: taiḥ catvāriṃśat buddha koṭī sahasrāṇi ārāgitāni
translated: They pleased forty koṭīs of buddhas,

original: kecidadyāpyārāgayanti //
analyzed: kecid adya api ārāgayanti
translated: and some are pleasing them even now.”

original: ārocayāmi vo bhikṣavaḥ /
analyzed: ārocayāmi vaḥ bhikṣavaḥ
translated: “Bhikṣus, I declare to you,

original: prativedayāmi vaḥ /
analyzed: prativedayāmi vaḥ
translated: I make it known to you,

original: ye te ṣoḍaśa rājakumārāḥ kumārabhūtā ye tasya bhagavataḥ śāsane śrāmaṇerā dharmabhāṇakā abhūvan /
analyzed: ye te ṣoḍaśa rāja kumārāḥ kumāra bhūtāḥ ye tasya bhagavataḥ śāsane śrāmaṇerāḥ dharma bhāṇakāḥ abhūvan
translated: that those sixteen young princes who were young men and were novice monks who taught the Dharma in the teaching of that Bhagavān,

original: sarve te 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhāḥ /
analyzed: sarve te nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: all of them have attained the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood.

original: sarve ca ta etarhi tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti /
analyzed: sarve ca te etarhi tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti
translated: All of them now remain, are present, and live.

original: daśasu dikṣu nānābuddhakṣetreṣu bahūnāṃ śrāvakabodhisattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇāṃ dharmaṃ deśayanti /
analyzed: daśasu dikṣu nānā buddhakṣetreṣu bahūnām śrāvaka bodhisattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇām dharmam deśayanti
translated: In the ten directions, in various buddha-fields, they teach the Dharma to many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of śrāvakas and bodhisattvas.

original: yaduta pūrvasyāṃ diśi bhikṣavo 'bhiratyāṃ lokadhātāvakṣobhyo nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho merukūṭaśca nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
analyzed: yat uta pūrvasyām diśi bhikṣavaḥ bhiratyām lokadhātau akṣobhyaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ merukūṭaḥ ca nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: To the east, monks, in the world-realm Abhirati, there are the Tathāgatas named Akṣobhya and Merukūṭa, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones.

original: pūrvadakṣiṇasyāṃ diśi bhikṣavaḥ siṃhaghoṣaśca nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ siṃhadhvajaśca nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ /
analyzed: pūrva dakṣiṇasyām diśi bhikṣavaḥ siṃhaghoṣaḥ ca nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ siṃhadhvajaḥ ca nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: To the southeast, monks, there are the Tathāgatas named Siṃhaghoṣa and Siṃhadhvaja, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones.

original: dakṣiṇasyāṃ diśi bhikṣavaḥ ākāśapratiṣṭhitaśca nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho nityaparinirvṛtaśca nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
analyzed: dakṣiṇasyām diśi bhikṣavaḥ ākāśapratiṣṭhitaḥ ca nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ nityaparinirvṛtaḥ ca nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: To the south, monks, there are the Tathāgatas named Ākāśapratiṣṭhita and Nityaparinirvṛta, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones.

original: dakṣiṇapaścimāyāṃ diśi bhikṣava indradhvajaśca nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho brahmadhvajaśca nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ /
analyzed: dakṣiṇa paścimāyām diśi bhikṣavaḥ indradhvajaḥ ca nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ brahmadhvajaḥ ca nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: To the southwest, monks, there are the Tathāgatas named Indradhvaja and Brahmadhvaja, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones.

original: paścimāyāṃ diśi bhikṣavo 'mitāyuśca nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sarvalokadhātūpadravodvegapratyuttīrṇaśca nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ🔽paścimottarasyāṃ diśi bhikṣavastamālapatracandanagandhābhijñaśca nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho merukalpaśca nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
analyzed: paścimāyām diśi bhikṣavaḥ mitāyuḥ ca nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sarvalokadhātūpadravodvegapratyuttīrṇaḥ ca nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ  paścima uttarasyām diśi bhikṣavaḥ tamālapatracandanagandhābhijñaḥ ca nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ merukalpaḥ ca nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: “Monks, in the western direction there is the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Amitāyus, and the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Sarvalokadhātūpadravo-dvigapratyuttīrṇa.🔽“Monks, in the northwestern direction there is the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Tamāla-patra-candana-gandhābhijña, and the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Meru-kalpa.

original: uttarasyāṃ diśi bhikṣavo meghasvaradīpaśca nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho meghasvararājaśca nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ /
analyzed: uttarasyām diśi bhikṣavaḥ meghasvaradīpaḥ ca nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ meghasvararājaḥ ca nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: “Monks, in the northern direction there is the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Megha-svara-dīpa, and the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Megha-svara-rāja.

original: uttarapūrvasyāṃ diśi bhikṣavaḥ sarvalokabhayacchambhitatvavidhvaṃsanarakaraśca nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ /
analyzed: uttara pūrvasyām diśi bhikṣavaḥ sarvalokabhayacchambhitatvavidhvaṃsanarakaraḥ ca nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: “Monks, in the northeastern direction there is the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Sarva-loka-bhaya-cchasambhītatva-vidhvaṃsana-raka-kara.

original: ahaṃ ca bhikṣavaḥ śākyamunirnāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ ṣoḍaśamo madhye khalvasyāṃ sahāyāṃ lokadhātāvanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhaḥ
analyzed: aham ca bhikṣavaḥ śākyamuniḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ ṣoḍaśamaḥ madhye khalu asyām sahāyām lokadhātau anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: And I, monks, was the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One named Śākyamuni, the sixteenth, who attained the highest complete enlightenment in this very middle of the Sahā world system.

original: ye punaste bhikṣavastadā asmākaṃ śrāmaṇerabhūtānāṃ sattvāṃ dharmaṃ śrutavantaḥ tasya🔽bhagavataḥ śāsana ekaikasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya bahūni gaṅgānadīvālukāsamāni
analyzed: ye punar te bhikṣavaḥ tadā asmākam śrāmaṇera bhūtānām sattvām dharmam śrutavantaḥ tasya  bhagavataḥ śāsane ekaikasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya bahūni gaṅgā nadī vālukā samāni
translated: And those beings, monks, who listened to the Dharma from us when we were Śrāmaṇeras,

original: sattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi yānyasmābhiḥ samādāpitānyanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: sattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi yāni asmābhiḥ samādāpitāni anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: in the teaching of that Blessed One, each of those Bodhisattva Mahāsattvas had many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭīs of beings who were inspired by them to the highest complete enlightenment.

original: tānyetāni bhikṣavo 'dyāpi śrāvakabhūmāvevāvasthitāni /🔽paripācyanta evānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: tāni etāni bhikṣavaḥ dyā api śrāvaka bhūmau eva avasthitāni  paripācyante eva anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Those beings, monks, are still established in the stage of Śrāvakas.🔽They are being ripened for the highest complete enlightenment.

original: eṣaivaiṣāmānupūrvī anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodherabhisaṃbodhanāya /
analyzed: eṣā eva eṣām ānupūrvī anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ abhisaṃbodhanāya
translated: This is their sequence for the realization of the highest complete enlightenment.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: evaṃ duradhimocyaṃ hi bhikṣavastathāgatajñānam Vaidya /
analyzed: evam duradhimocyam hi bhikṣavaḥ tathāgata jñānam vaidya
translated: Because, monks, the knowledge of the Tathāgata is difficult to fathom.

original: katame ca te bhikṣavaḥ sattvāḥ /
analyzed: katame ca te bhikṣavaḥ sattvāḥ
translated: And who are those beings, monks?

original: ye mayā bodhisattvena tasya bhagavataḥ śāsane aprameyāṇyasaṃkhyeyāni gaṅgānadīvālukāsamāni sattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi sarvajñatādharmamanuśrāvitāni /
analyzed: ye mayā bodhisattvena tasya bhagavataḥ śāsane aprameyāṇi asaṃkhyeyāni gaṅgā nadī vālukā samāni sattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi sarvajña tā dharmam anuśrāvitāni
translated: Those beings who, when I was a bodhisattva, heard the Dharma of omniscience from me in the teaching of that Bhagavān, those beings who were established in the vehicle of the hearers and the vehicle of the solitary buddhas, and those who were established in the Great Vehicle, those many hundred thousand quintillions of beings as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges River, who were established in the Great Vehicle, and who were taught the Dharma by me, those beings, Bhikṣus, will be your śrāvakas when you attain the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood in this bhadrakalpa.

original: yūyaṃ te bhikṣavastena kālena tena samayena sattvā abhūvan //
analyzed: yūyam te bhikṣavaḥ tena kālena tena samayena sattvāḥ abhūvan
translated: Bhikṣus, those beings at that time, on that occasion, were you.🔽And those who will be my śrāvakas in the future,

original: ye ca mama parinirvṛtasya anāgate 'dhvani śrāvakā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: ye ca mama parinirvṛtasya anāgate dhvani śrāvakāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: when I have passed into nirvāṇa,

original: bodhisattvacaryāṃ ca śroṣyanti /
analyzed: bodhisattva caryām ca śroṣyanti
translated: will hear of the conduct of the bodhisattvas,

original: na cāvabhotsyante bodhisattvā vayamiti /
analyzed: na ca avabhotsyante bodhisattvāḥ vayam iti
translated: but will not understand that they themselves are bodhisattvas.🔽“Bhikṣus, although all of them will think that they have attained nirvāṇa,

original: kiṃcāpi te bhikṣavaḥ sarve parinirvāṇasaṃjñinaḥ parinirvāsyanti /
analyzed: kiṃca api te bhikṣavaḥ sarve parinirvāṇa saṃjñinaḥ parinirvāsyanti
translated: and will attain nirvāṇa,

original: api tu khalu punarbhikṣavo yadahamanyāsu lokadhātuṣvanyonyairnāmadheyairviharāmi /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ yat aham anyāsu lokadhātuṣu anyonyaiḥ nāmadheyaiḥ viharāmi
translated: bhikṣus, I will dwell in other world systems under other names.

original: tatra te punarutpatsyante tathāgatajñānaṃ paryeṣamāṇāḥ /
analyzed: tatra te punar utpatsyante tathāgata jñānam paryeṣamāṇāḥ
translated: There they will be reborn, seeking the wisdom of the tathāgatas.

original: tatra ca te punarevaitāṃ kriyāṃ śroṣyanti /
analyzed: tatra ca te punar eva etām kriyām śroṣyanti
translated: There they will again hear this activity.

original: ekameva tathāgatānāṃ parinirvāṇam /
analyzed: ekam eva tathāgatānām parinirvāṇam
translated: There is only the nirvāṇa of the tathāgatas.

original: nāstyanyad dvitīyamito bahirnirvāṇam /
analyzed: na asti anyat dvitīyam itas bahis nirvāṇam
translated: There is no other nirvāṇa apart from that.

original: tathāgatānāmetadbhikṣava upāyakauśalyaṃ veditavyaṃ dharmadeśanābhinirhāraśca /
analyzed: tathāgatānām etat bhikṣavaḥ upāya kauśalyam veditavyam dharma deśanā abhinirhāraḥ ca
translated: “Bhikṣus, you should know that this is the skill in methods of the tathāgatas and the accomplishment of teaching the Dharma.

original: yasmin bhikṣavaḥ samaye tathāgataḥ parinirvāṇakālasamayamātmanaḥ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: yasmin bhikṣavaḥ samaye tathāgataḥ parinirvāṇa kāla samayam ātmanaḥ samanupaśyati
translated: “Bhikṣus, when the Tathāgata sees that the time has come for him to pass into nirvāṇa,

original: pariśuddhaṃ ca parṣadaṃ paśyati adhimuktisārāṃ śūnyadharmagatiṃ gatāṃ dhyānavatīṃ mahādhyānavatīm /
analyzed: pariśuddham ca parṣadam paśyati adhimukti sārām śūnya dharma gatim gatām dhyānavatīm mahā dhyānavatīm
translated: he sees that the assembly is pure, that they have the essence of devotion, that they have realized the emptiness of phenomena, that they have meditation, and that they have great meditation.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavastathāgato 'yaṃ kāla iti viditvā sarvān bodhisattvān sarvaśrāvakāṃśca saṃnipātya paścādetamarthaṃ saṃśrāvayati /
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ tathāgataḥ yam kāle iti viditvā sarvān bodhisattvān sarva śrāvakān ca saṃnipātya paścāt etam artham saṃśrāvayati
translated: “Bhikṣus, then the Tathāgata, knowing that the time has come, assembles all the bodhisattvas and all the śrāvakas and then teaches this meaning:

original: na bhikṣavaḥ kiṃcidasti loke dvitīyaṃ nāma yānaṃ parinirvāṇaṃ vā /
analyzed: na bhikṣavaḥ kiṃcid asti loke dvitīyam nāma yānam parinirvāṇam vā
translated: ‘Bhikṣus, there is no second yāna or nirvāṇa in this world.

original: kaḥ punarvādastṛtīyasya /
analyzed: kaḥ punarvādaḥ tṛtīyasya
translated: How much less is there a third!’

original: upāyakauśalyaṃ khalvidaṃ bhikṣavastathāgatānāmarhatām dūrapranaṣṭaṃ sattvadhātuṃ viditvā hīnābhiratān kāmapaṅkamagnān /
analyzed: upāya kauśalyam khalu idam bhikṣavaḥ tathāgatānām arhatām dūra pranaṣṭam sattvadhātum viditvā hīna abhiratān kāma paṅka magnān
translated: “Bhikṣus, knowing that the realm of beings has been lost to the far reaches, that they delight in the inferior, and that they are sunk in the mud of desire,

original: tata eṣāṃ bhikṣavastathāgatastannirvāṇaṃ bhāṣate yadadhimucyante //
analyzed: tatas eṣām bhikṣavaḥ tathāgataḥ tat nirvāṇam bhāṣate yat adhimucyante
translated: the Tathāgata then teaches them that nirvāṇa to which they aspire.”

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhikṣava iha syāt pañcayojanaśatikamaṭavīkāntāram /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhikṣavaḥ iha syāt pañca yojana śatikam aṭavī kāntāram
translated: Monks, it is like this: Suppose there were a forest wilderness five hundred yojanas long,

original: mahāṃścātra janakāyaḥ pratipanno bhaved ratnadīpaṃ gamanāya /
analyzed: mahān ca atra jana kāyaḥ pratipannaḥ bhavet ratna dīpam gamanāya
translated: and a great multitude of people were to set out to go to a jewel island,

original: deśikaścaiṣāmeko bhaved vyaktaḥ paṇḍito nipuṇo medhāvī kuśalaḥ khalvaṭavīdurgāṇām /
analyzed: deśikaḥ ca eṣām ekaḥ bhavet vyaktaḥ paṇḍitaḥ nipuṇaḥ medhāvī kuśalaḥ khalu aṭavī durgāṇām
translated: and they would have a single guide who was wise, learned, intelligent, and skilled in the paths through the forest wildernesses,

original: sa ca taṃ sārthamaṭavīmavakrāmayet /
analyzed: sa ca tam sārtham aṭavīm avakrāmayet
translated: and he would lead that caravan through the forest wilderness.

original: atha khalu sa mahājanakāyaḥ śrāntaḥ klānto bhītastrastaḥ evaṃ vadet yat khalvārya deśika pariṇāyaka jānīyāḥ vayaṃ hi śrāntāḥ klāntā bhītāstrastā
analyzed: atha khalu sa mahā jana kāyaḥ śrāntaḥ klāntaḥ bhītaḥ trastaḥ evam vadet yat khalu ārya deśika pariṇāyaka jānīyāḥ vayam hi śrāntāḥ klāntāḥ bhītāḥ trastāḥ
translated: Then, indeed, that great multitude of people, being tired, exhausted, frightened, and terrified, would say, 'O noble guide and leader, you should know that we are tired, exhausted, frightened, and terrified,

original: anirvṛtāḥ /
analyzed: anirvṛtāḥ
translated: and we are not satisfied.

original: punareva pratinivartayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: punar eva pratinivartayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will turn back again.

original: atidūramito 'ṭavīkāntāramiti /
analyzed: ati dūram itas ṭavī kāntāram iti
translated: This forest wilderness is too far from there.'

original: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ sa deśika upāyakuśalastān puruṣān pratinivartitukāmān viditvā evaṃ cintayet mā khalvime tapasvinastādṛśaṃ mahāratnadvīpaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ sa deśikaḥ upāya kuśalaḥ tān puruṣān pratinivartitu kāmān viditvā evam cintayet mā khalu ime tapasvinaḥ tādṛśam mahā ratna dvīpam
translated: Then, monks, that guide, skilled in means, knowing that those people wanted to turn back, would think like this: 'Oh, may these poor people not go to that great jewel island

original: na gaccheyuriti /
analyzed: na gaccheyuḥ iti
translated: and not obtain those jewels.'

original: sa teṣāmanukampārthamupāyakauśalyaṃ prayojayet /
analyzed: sa teṣām anukampā artham upāya kauśalyam prayojayet
translated: And in order to have compassion on them, he would employ a skillful means.

original: tasyā aṭavyā madhye yojanaśataṃ vā dviyojanaśataṃ vā triyojanaśataṃ vā atikramya ṛddhimayaṃ nagaramabhinirmimīyāt /🔽tatastān puruṣānevaṃ vadet mā bhavanto bhaiṣṭa /
analyzed: tasyāḥ aṭavyāḥ madhye yojana śatam vā dvi yojana śatam vā tri yojana śatam vā atikramyaḥ ṛddhi mayam nagaram abhinirmimīyāt  tatas tān puruṣān evam vadet mā bhavantaḥ bhaiṣṭa
translated: In the middle of that wilderness, after traveling one hundred, two hundred, or three hundred leagues, he would magically create a city.

original: mā nivartadhvam /
analyzed: mā nivartadhvam
translated: Then he would say to those people, ‘Do not be afraid, do not turn back!

original: ayamasau mahājanapadaḥ /
analyzed: ayam asau mahā janapadaḥ
translated: This is a great country.

original: atra viśrāmyata /
analyzed: atra viśrāmyata
translated: Rest here.

original: atra vo yāni kānicit karaṇīyāni tāni sarvāṇi kurudhvam /
analyzed: atra vaḥ yāni kānicid karaṇīyāni tāni sarvāṇi kurudhvam
translated: Do whatever you need to do here.

original: atra nirvāṇaprāptā viharadhvamatra viśrāntāḥ /
analyzed: atra nirvāṇa prāptāḥ viharadhvam atra viśrāntāḥ
translated: You have attained nirvāṇa here. Rest here.’

original: yasya punaḥ kāryaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yasya punar kāryam bhaviṣyati
translated: But if someone has business to do,

original: sa taṃ mahāratnadvīpaṃ gamiṣyati //
analyzed: sa tam mahā ratna dvīpam gamiṣyati
translated: he will go to that great island of jewels.”

original: atha khalu bhikṣavaste kāntāraprāptāḥ sattvā āścaryaprāptā adbhutaprāptā bhaveyuḥ muktā vayamaṭavīkāntārāt /
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ te kāntāra prāptāḥ sattvāḥ āścarya prāptāḥ adbhuta prāptāḥ bhaveyuḥ muktāḥ vayam aṭavī kāntārāt
translated: “Bhikṣus, those beings who have entered the wilderness will be astonished and amazed, thinking, ‘We are freed from the wilderness.’

original: iha nirvāṇaprāptā vihariṣyāma iti /
analyzed: iha nirvāṇa prāptāḥ vihariṣyāmaḥ iti
translated: They will think, ‘We have attained nirvāṇa here. We will rest here.’

original: atha khalu bhikṣavaste puruṣāstadṛddhimayaṃ nagaraṃ praviśeyuḥ /🔽āgatasaṃjñinaśca bhaveyuḥ /🔽nistīrṇasaṃjñinaśca bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ te puruṣāḥ tat ṛddhi mayam nagaram praviśeyuḥ  āgata saṃjñinaḥ ca bhaveyuḥ  nistīrṇa saṃjñinaḥ ca bhaveyuḥ
translated: “Bhikṣus, those people will enter that magically created city.🔽They will think that they have arrived.🔽They will think that they have been saved.

original: nirvṛtāḥ śītībhūtā sma iti manyeran /
analyzed: nirvṛtāḥ śītībhūtā smaḥ iti manyeran
translated: They will think, ‘We are at peace, we are cooled, we are at rest.’

original: tatastān deśiko viśrāntān viditvā tadṛddhimayaṃ nagaramantardhāpayet /
analyzed: tatas tān deśikaḥ viśrāntān viditvā tat ṛddhi mayam nagaram antardhāpayet
translated: Then, the guide, knowing that they are rested, should make that magically created city disappear.

original: antardhāpayitvā ca tān puruṣānevaṃ vadet āgacchantu bhavantaḥ sattvāḥ /
analyzed: antardhāpayitvā ca tān puruṣān evam vadet āgacchantu bhavantaḥ sattvāḥ
translated: And having made it disappear, he should say to those people, ‘Come, good people,

original: abhyāsanna eṣa mahāratnadvīpaḥ /
analyzed: abhyāsannaḥ eṣa mahā ratna dvīpaḥ
translated: this great island of jewels is near.

original: idaṃ tu mayā nagaraṃ yuṣmākaṃ viśrāmaṇārthamabhinirmitamiti //
analyzed: idam tu mayā nagaram yuṣmākam viśrāmaṇa artham abhinirmitam iti
translated: But this city was created by me just for your rest.’

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: evameva bhikṣavastathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho yuṣmākaṃ sarvasattvānāṃ ca deśikaḥ /
analyzed: evam eva bhikṣavaḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ yuṣmākam sarva sattvānām ca deśikaḥ
translated: In the same way, monks, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One is your guide and that of all beings.

original: atha khalu bhikṣavastathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddha evaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ evam
translated: Then, monks, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One sees thus:

original: paśyati mahadidaṃ kleśakāntāraṃ nirgantavyaṃ niṣkrāntavyaṃ prahātavyam /
analyzed: paśyati mahat idam kleśa kāntāram nirgantavyam niṣkrāntavyam prahātavyam
translated: ‘This great wilderness of afflictions must be gone out from, escaped from, abandoned.

original: mā khalvime ekameva buddhajñānaṃ śrutvā draveṇaiva pratinivartayeyuḥ /
analyzed: mā khalu ime ekam eva buddha jñānam śrutvā draveṇa eva pratinivartayeyuḥ
translated: Lest, having heard only about the one Buddha-knowledge, they should turn back with difficulty,

original: naivopasaṃkrameyuḥ /
analyzed: na eva upasaṃkrameyuḥ
translated: and not approach at all.

original: bahuparikleśamidaṃ buddhajñānaṃ samudānayitavyamiti /
analyzed: bahu parikleśam idam buddha jñānam samudānayitavyam iti
translated: This Buddha-knowledge is to be accomplished with much hardship.’

original: tatra tathāgataḥ sattvān durbalāśayān viditvā yathā sa deśikastadṛddhimayaṃ nagaramabhinirmitīte teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ viśrāmaṇārtham /
analyzed: tatra tathāgataḥ sattvān durbala āśayān viditvā yathā sa deśikaḥ tat ṛddhi mayam nagaram abhinirmitīte teṣām sattvānām viśrāmaṇa artham
translated: There, the Tathāgata, knowing that beings have weak aspirations, is like that guide who conjures up that magical city for the sake of resting those beings.

original: viśrāntānāṃ caiṣāmevaṃ kathayati idaṃ khalu ṛddhimayaṃ nagaramiti /
analyzed: viśrāntānām ca eṣām evam kathayati idam khalu ṛddhi mayam nagaram iti
translated: And when they have rested, he says to them, 'This is that magical city.'

original: evameva bhikṣavastathāgato 'pyarhan samyaksaṃbuddho mahopāyakauśalyena antarā dve
analyzed: evam eva bhikṣavaḥ tathāgataḥ pi arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ mahā upāya kauśalyena antarā dve
translated: In the same way, monks, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, with great skillful means, in between the two

original: nirvāṇabhūmī sattvānāṃ viśrāmaṇārthaṃ deśayati saṃprakāśayati yadidaṃ śrāvakabhūmiṃ
analyzed: nirvāṇa bhūmī sattvānām viśrāmaṇa artham deśayati saṃprakāśayati yat idam śrāvaka bhūmim
translated: levels of nirvāṇa, teaches and explains for the sake of resting beings, namely the level of the hearers

original: pratyekabuddhabhūmiṃ ca /
analyzed: pratyekabuddha bhūmim ca
translated: and the level of the solitary buddhas.

original: yasmiṃśca bhikṣavaḥ samaye te sattvāstatra sthitā bhavanti /
analyzed: yasmin ca bhikṣavaḥ samaye te sattvāḥ tatra sthitāḥ bhavanti
translated: And, monks, at that time when those beings are dwelling there,

analyzed: atha khalu bhikṣavaḥ tathāgataḥ u pi evam saṃśrāvayati na khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ yūyam kṛtakṛtyāḥ kṛta karaṇīyāḥ
translated: then, monks, the Tathāgata proclaims thus: 'Monks, you are not yet accomplished, your work is not yet done.

original: api tu khalu punarbhikṣavo yuṣmākamabhyāsaḥ /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ yuṣmākam abhyāsaḥ
translated: But, monks, you have practiced.

original: itastathāgatajñānaṃ vyavalokayadhvaṃ bhikṣavo vyavacārayadhvam /
analyzed: itas tathāgata jñānam vyavalokayadhvam bhikṣavaḥ vyavacārayadhvam
translated: Look at the Tathāgata's knowledge, monks, investigate it.

original: yad yuṣmākaṃ nirvāṇaṃ naiva nirvāṇam /
analyzed: yat yuṣmākam nirvāṇam na eva nirvāṇam
translated: Your nirvāṇa is not really nirvāṇa.

original: api tu khalu punarūpāyakauśalyametad bhikṣavastathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ yat trīṇi yānāni saṃprakāśayantīti //
analyzed: api tu khalu punar upāya kauśalyam etat bhikṣavaḥ tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām yat trīṇi yānāni saṃprakāśayanti iti
translated: But, bhikṣus, it is a skillful method of the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas to teach three yānas.”

original: atha khalu bhagavānimamevārthaṃ bhūyasyā mātrayopadarśayamānastasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān imam eva artham bhūyasyā mātrayā upadarśayamānaḥ tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Bhagavān, in order to teach this topic, gave a detailed teaching on this sūtra by chanting the following verses to the youth Candraprabha:

original: abhijñajñānābhibhu lokanāyako yadbodhimaṇḍasmi niṣaṇṇa āsīt /
analyzed: abhijña jñāna abhibhu loka nāyakaḥ yat bodhimaṇḍa asmi niṣaṇṇaḥ āsīt
translated: “The Lord of the World, who has the higher knowledge and the higher wisdom, who was seated on the Bodhimaṇḍa,

original: daśeha so antarakalpa pūrṇān na lapsi bodhiṃ paramārthadarśī // / //
analyzed: daśa iha saḥ antara kalpa pūrṇān na lapsi bodhim parama artha darśī
translated: For ten intermediate eons did not attain enlightenment, the one who sees the ultimate truth.

original: devātha nāgā asurātha guhyakā udyukta pūjārtha jinasya tasya /
analyzed: devāḥ atha nāgāḥ asurāḥ atha guhyakāḥ udyukta pūjā artha jinasya tasya
translated: The devas, nāgas, asuras, and guhyakas were devoted to making offerings to the Jina.

original: puṣpāṇa varṣaṃ pramumocu tatra buddhe ca bodhiṃ naranāyake 'smin // / //
analyzed: varṣam pramumocu tatra buddhe ca bodhim nara nāyake smin
translated: They caused a rain of flowers to fall there for the Buddha, the Bodhi tree, and the Guide of humans.

original: upariṃ ca khe dundubhayo vineduḥ satkārapūjārtha jinasya tasya /
analyzed: uparim ca khe dundubhayaḥ vineduḥ satkāra pūjā artha jinasya tasya
translated: In the sky above, they sounded celestial drums in order to make offerings and honor the Jina.

original: suduḥkhitā cāpi jinena tatra cirabudhyamānena anuttaraṃ padam // / //
analyzed: su duḥkhitā ca api jinena tatra cira budhyamānena anuttaram padam
translated: The Jina, who had been there for a long time, was in great suffering, not having attained the supreme enlightenment.

original: daśāna co antarakalpa atyayāt spṛśe sa bodhiṃ bhagavānanābhibhūḥ /
analyzed: antara kalpa atyayāt spṛśe sa bodhim
translated: And after ten intermediate eons had passed, that Blessed One, the Unconquered, attained enlightenment.

original: hṛṣṭā udagrāstada āsu sarve devā manuṣyā bhujagāsurāśca // / //
analyzed: hṛṣṭāḥ udagrāḥ tadaḥ āsu sarve devāḥ manuṣyāḥ bhujaga asurāḥ ca
translated: Then all the gods, humans, serpents, and asuras were delighted and overjoyed.

original: vīrāḥ kumārā atha tasya ṣoḍaśa putrā guṇāḍhyā naranāyakasya /
analyzed: vīrāḥ kumārāḥ atha tasya ṣoḍaśa putrāḥ guṇa āḍhyāḥ nara nāyakasya
translated: The sixteen sons of that Virtuous One, the Prince of Men, who were endowed with virtues,

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: the physicians

original: upasaṃkramī prāṇīsahasrakoṭibhiḥ puraskṛtāstaṃ dvipadendramagryam // / //
analyzed: upasaṃkramī prāṇī sahasra koṭibhiḥ puraskṛtāḥ tam dvipada indram agryam
translated: approached with many billions of living beings, that foremost of two-legged beings,

original: vanditva pādau ca vināyakasya adhyeṣiṣū dharma prakāśayasva /
analyzed: vanditva pādau ca vināyakasya adhyeṣiṣū dharma prakāśayasva
translated: having bowed at the feet of that Leader, they requested him: Teach the Dharma!

original: asmāṃśca tarpehi imaṃ ca lokaṃ subhāṣiteneha narendrasiṃha // / //
analyzed: asmān ca tarpehi imam ca lokam su bhāṣitena iha narendra siṃha
translated: Satisfy us and this world with your eloquent speech, O Lion among Men!

original: cirasya lokasya daśaddiśe 'smin vidito 'si utpannu mahāvināyaka /
analyzed: cirasya lokasya daśaddiśe smin viditaḥ si utpannu mahāvināyaka
translated: After a long time, O Great Leader, you have become known in this world in the ten directions.

original: nimittasaṃcodanahetu prāṇināṃ brāhmā vimānāni prakampayantaḥ // / //
analyzed: nimitta saṃcodana hetu prāṇinām brāhmāḥ vimānāni prakampayantaḥ
translated: Shaking the Brahmā palaces, you are the cause of urging with signs for living beings.

original: diśāya pūrvāya sahasrakoṭyaḥ kṣetrāṇa pañcāśadabhūṣi kampitāḥ /
analyzed: diśāya pūrvāya sahasra koṭyaḥ kampitāḥ
translated: In the eastern direction, fifty billion fields trembled.

original: tatrāpi ye brāhma vimāna agrāste tejavanto adhimātramāsi // / //
analyzed: tatra api ye brāhma vimāna agrāḥ te tejavantaḥ
translated: And the foremost Brahmā palaces there became extremely radiant.

original: viditva te pūrvanimittamīdṛśamupasaṃkramī lokavināyakendram /
analyzed: viditvā te pūrva nimittam īdṛśam upasaṃkramī loka vināyaka indram
translated: Knowing this kind of premonition, they approached the lord of the world's guides.

original: puṣpairihābhyokiriyāṇa nāyakamarpenti te sarva vimāna tasya // / //
analyzed: puṣpaiḥ te sarva tasya
translated: Scattering flowers here on the guide, they offered him all their palaces.

original: adhyeṣiṣū cakrapravartanāya gāthābhigītena abhisaṃstaviṃsu /
analyzed: adhyeṣiṣū cakra pravartanāya gāthā abhigītena
translated: They requested him to turn the wheel, praising him with verses.

original: tūṣṇīṃ ca so āsi narendrarājā na tāva kālo mama dharma bhāṣitum // / //
analyzed: tūṣṇīm ca saḥ āsi narendra rājā na kālaḥ mama dharma bhāṣitum
translated: But the king of men remained silent, thinking, This is not yet the time for me to teach the Dharma.

original: evaṃ diśi dakṣiṇiyāṃ pi tatra atha paścimā heṣṭima uttarasyām /
analyzed: evam diśi dakṣiṇiyām tatra atha paścimā uttarasyām
translated: In the same way, in the southern direction, and then in the west, below, and in the north,

analyzed: vidiśāsu ca eva āgatya sahasra koṭyaḥ
translated: And in the upper direction and in the intermediate directions, thousands of koṭis of Brahmās came.

original: puṣpebhi abhyokiriyāṇa nāyakaṃ pādau ca vanditva vināyakasya /
analyzed: puṣpebhi nāyakam pādau ca vanditvā vināyakasya
translated: Scattering flowers on the guide, they bowed at the feet of the leader.

original: niryātayitvā ca vimāna sarvānabhiṣṭavitvā punarabhyayāci // / //
analyzed: niryātayitvā ca vimāna sarvān abhiṣṭavitvā punar abhyayāci
translated: Having offered all their palaces, they praised him again and made a request:

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: O physician!

original: pravartayā cakramanantacakṣuḥ sudurlabhastvaṃ bahukalpakoṭibhiḥ /
analyzed: pravartaya cakram ananta cakṣuḥ su durlabhaḥ tvam bahu kalpa koṭibhiḥ
translated: Turn the wheel, O you of infinite vision! You are very difficult to find even in many millions of eons.

original: darśehi maitrībala pūrvasevitamapāvṛṇohī amṛtasya dvāram // / //
analyzed: darśehi maitrī bala pūrva sevitam apāvṛṇohi amṛtasya dvāram
translated: Show the power of friendliness practiced in the past, and open the door to immortality!

original: adhyeṣaṇāṃ jñātva anantacakṣuḥ prakāśate dharma bahuprakāram /
analyzed: adhyeṣaṇām jñātvā ananta cakṣuḥ prakāśate bahu prakāram
translated: Explained the Dharma in many ways,

original: catvāri satyāni ca vistareṇa pratītya sarve imi bhāva utthitāḥ // / //
analyzed: catvāri satyāni ca vistareṇa pratītya sarve imi bhāva utthitāḥ
translated: In detail the four truths, and how all these phenomena arise dependently.

original: avidya ādīkariyāṇa cakṣumān prabhāṣate sa maraṇāntaduḥkham /
analyzed: cakṣumān prabhāṣate sa maraṇa anta duḥkham
translated: The one with eyes explained the suffering of death and so forth,

original: jātiprasūtā imi sarvadoṣā mṛtyuṃ ca mānuṣyamimeva jānatha // / //
analyzed: jāti prasūtāḥ sarva doṣāḥ mṛtyum ca mānuṣyam imā iva jānatha
translated: Beginning with ignorance, and that all these faults arise from birth. Know this, humans!

original: samanantaraṃ bhāṣitu dharma tena bahuprakārā vividhā anantāḥ /
analyzed: samanantaram tena bahu prakārāḥ vividhāḥ anantāḥ
translated: Immediately after he spoke the Dharma, in many ways, in many infinite varieties,

original: śrutvānaśītī nayutāna koṭyaḥ sattvāḥ sthitāḥ śrāvaka bhūtale laghum // / //
analyzed: sattvāḥ sthitāḥ śrāvaka bhū tale laghum
translated: Having heard, 80 koṭi niyutas of beings quickly attained the stage of śrāvakas.

original: kṣaṇaṃ dvitīyaṃ aparaṃ abhūṣi jinasya tasyo bahu dharma bhāṣataḥ /
analyzed: kṣaṇam dvitīyam aparam jinasya bahu dharma bhāṣataḥ
translated: In the second moment, as that Jina spoke much Dharma,

original: viśuddhasattvā yatha gaṅgavālukāḥ kṣaṇena te śrāvakabhūta āsīt // / //
analyzed: gaṅgavālukāḥ kṣaṇena te śrāvaka bhūtaḥ āsīt
translated: Beings as pure as the sands of the Ganges became śrāvakas in an instant.

original: tatottarī agaṇiyu tasya āsīt saṃghastadā lokavināyakasya /
analyzed: tasya āsīt saṃghaḥ tadā loka vināyakasya
translated: After that, the saṅgha of that Lokavijayaka

original: kalpāna koṭīnyayutā gaṇenta ekaika no cāntu labheya teṣām // / //
analyzed: koṭīni ayutā gaṇentaḥ ekaika no cāntu labheya teṣām
translated: Was incalculable. Counting for many quintillions of eons, I could not reach the end of them.

original: ye cāpi te ṣoḍaśa rājaputrā ye aurasā cailakabhūta sarve /
analyzed: ye ca api te ṣoḍaśa rāja putrāḥ ye sarve
translated: And those sixteen princes, who were all his own sons,

original: te śrāmaṇerā avaciṃsu taṃ jinaṃ prakāśayā nāyaka agradharmam // / //
analyzed: te śrāmaṇerāḥ tam jinam prakāśaya nāyaka agra dharmam
translated: Those novice monks asked that Victor, Illuminate the supreme Dharma, O Guide!

original: yathā vayaṃ lokavidū bhavema yathaiva tvaṃ sarvajinānamuttama /
analyzed: yathā vayam loka vidū bhavema yathā eva tvam
translated: May we become like you, O knower of the world, as you are the best of all Victors,

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Physician

original: ime ca sattvā bhavi sarvi eva yathaiva tvaṃ vīra viśuddhacakṣuḥ // / //
analyzed: ime ca sattvāḥ eva yathā eva tvam vīra viśuddha cakṣuḥ
translated: And may all these beings become just like you, O hero with pure vision!

original: so cā jino āṃśayu jñātva teṣāṃ kumārabhūtāna tathātmajānām /🔽prakāśayī uttamamagrabodhiṃ dṛṣṭāntakoṭīnayutairanekaiḥ // / //
analyzed: teṣām tathā ātmajānām  uttamam agra bodhim dṛṣṭānta koṭī nayutaiḥ anekaiḥ
translated: And that Victor, knowing their aspiration, of those sons of his who were like princes,🔽Illuminated the supreme, highest enlightenment with countless quintillions of parables.

original: hetūsahasrairupadarśayanto abhijñajñānaṃ ca pravartayantaḥ /
analyzed: hetu sahasraiḥ upadarśayantaḥ abhijña jñānam ca pravartayantaḥ
translated: Displaying it with thousands of reasons, causing the knowledge of the higher perceptions to arise,

original: bhūtāṃ cariṃ darśayi lokanātho yathā caranto vidu bodhisattvāḥ // / //
analyzed: bhūtām carim lokanāthaḥ yathā carantaḥ vidu bodhisattvāḥ
translated: The Lord of the World showed his true conduct, as the wise Bodhisattvas practice.

original: idameva saddharmapuṇḍarīkaṃ vaipulyasūtraṃ bhagavānuvāca /
analyzed: idam eva saddharmapuṇḍarīkam vaipulya sūtram bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed One spoke this very Lotus of the True Dharma, the extensive sutra,

original: gāthāsahasrehi analpakehi yeṣāṃ pramāṇaṃ yatha gaṅgavālikāḥ // / //
analyzed: gāthā sahasrehi analpakehi yeṣām gaṅgavālikāḥ
translated: With many thousands of verses, whose extent is like the sands of the Ganges.

original: so cā jino bhāṣiya sūtrametadvihāru praviśitva vilakṣayīta /
analyzed: saḥ ca jinaḥ sūtram etat vihāru praviśitvā vilakṣayīta
translated: And that Victor, having spoken this sutra, entered his dwelling and contemplated,

original: pūrṇānaśītiṃ caturaśca kalpān samāhitaikāsani lokanāthaḥ // / //
analyzed: pūrṇān aśītim caturaḥ ca kalpān samāhita eka āsani lokanāthaḥ
translated: For a full eighty-four eons, the Lord of the World, with single-pointed concentration,

original: te śrāmaṇerāśca viditva nāyakaṃ vihāri āsannamaniṣkramantam /
analyzed: te śrāmaṇerāḥ ca nāyakam vihāri āsannam a niṣkramantam
translated: Those novice monks, knowing that the Guide, dwelling in the monastery, was not leaving,

original: saṃśrāvayiṃsu bahuprāṇikoṭināṃ bauddha imaṃ jñānamanāsravaṃ śivam // / //
analyzed: saṃśrāvayiṃsu bahu prāṇi koṭinām bauddhaḥ imam jñānam anāsravam śivam
translated: Proclaimed this auspicious, pure, and enlightened knowledge to many millions of beings.

original: pṛthak pṛthagāsana prajñapitvā abhāṣi teṣāmidameva sūtram /
analyzed: pṛthak pṛthak āsana prajñapitvā abhāṣi teṣām idam eva sūtram
translated: Having arranged separate seats, they taught this very sūtra to them.

original: sugatasya tasya tada śāsanasmin adhikāra kurvanti mamevarūpam // / //
analyzed: sugatasya tasya adhikāra kurvanti mamevarūpam
translated: In that Sugata's teaching, they performed such a service.

original: gaṅgā yathā vāluka aprameyā sahasra ṣaṣṭiṃ tada śrāvayiṃsu /
analyzed: gaṅgā yathā vāluka aprameyā sahasra ṣaṣṭim tada śrāvayiṃsu
translated: Like the immeasurable sands of the Ganges, they taught for sixty-four thousand years.

original: ekaiku tasya sugatasya putro vineti sattvāni analpakāni // / //
analyzed: tasya sugatasya putraḥ vinā iti sattvāni analpakāni
translated: Each one of those sons of the Sugata guided countless beings.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: tasyo jinasya parinirvṛtasya caritva te paśyisu buddhakoṭyaḥ /
analyzed: tasya u jinasya parinirvṛtasya caritva te buddha koṭyaḥ
translated: After the Jina's parinirvāṇa, they practiced and saw millions of Buddhas.

original: tehī tadā śrāvitakehi sārdhaṃ kurvanti pūjāṃ dvipadottamānām // / //
analyzed: tadā śrāvitakehi sārdham kurvanti pūjām dvipada uttamānām
translated: Together with those who were taught by them, they made offerings to the supreme humans.

original: caritva caryāṃ vipulāṃ viśiṣṭāṃ buddhā ca te bodhi daśaddiśāsu /
analyzed: caritva caryām vipulām viśiṣṭām buddhā ca te daśat diśāsu
translated: Having practiced vast and excellent conduct, they attained enlightenment and became Buddhas in the ten directions.

original: te ṣoḍaśā tasya jinasya putrā diśāsu sarvāsu dvayo dvayo jināḥ // / //
analyzed: te ṣoḍaśā tasya jinasya putrāḥ diśāsu sarvāsu dvayaḥ dvayaḥ jināḥ
translated: Those sixteen were the sons of that Jina, two Jinas in each of the directions.

original: ye cāpi saṃśrāvitakā tadāsī te śrāvakā teṣa jināna sarve /
analyzed: ye ca api te śrāvakāḥ sarve
translated: And all those who were then proclaimed as disciples of those Jinas,

original: imameva bodhiṃ upanāmayanti kramakrameṇa vividhairupāyaiḥ // / //
analyzed: imam eva bodhim upanāmayanti krama krameṇa vividhaiḥ upāyaiḥ
translated: They are led to this very enlightenment, in sequence, by various means.

original: ahaṃ pi abhyantari teṣa āsīnmayāpi saṃśrāvita sarvi yūyam /
analyzed: aham āsīt mayā api yūyam
translated: I too was among them, and I proclaimed all of you.

original: teno mama śrāvaka yūyamadya bodhāvupāyeniha sarvi nemi // / //
analyzed: tena u mama śrāvaka yūyam adya sarvi
translated: Therefore, you are my disciples now, and I lead all of you to enlightenment by this means.

original: ayaṃ khu hetustada pūrva āsīdayaṃ pratyayo yena hu dharma bhāṣe /
analyzed: ayam khu hetuḥ tada pūrvaḥ āsīt ayam pratyayaḥ yena hu dharma bhāṣe
translated: This was the cause and condition in the past by which I teach the Dharma.

original: nayāmyahaṃ yena mamāgrabodhiṃ mā bhikṣavo utrasatheha sthāne // / //
analyzed: nayāmi aham yena mama agra bodhim mā bhikṣavaḥ sthāne
translated: I lead you to my supreme enlightenment. Do not be afraid, monks, in this place.

original: yathāṭavī ugra bhaveya dāruṇā śūnyā nirālamba nirāśrayā ca /
analyzed: yathā aṭavī ugra bhaveya dāruṇā śūnyā nirālamba nirāśrayā ca
translated: As if there were a terrible, frightening wilderness, empty, without support or refuge,

original: bahuśvāpadā caiva apāniyā ca bālāna sā bhīṣaṇikā bhaveta // / //
analyzed: ca eva ca sā bhīṣaṇikā bhaveta
translated: With many wild animals and no water, it would be terrifying for the foolish.

original: purūṣāṇa co tatra sahasra nekā ye prasthitāstāmaṭavīṃ bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: tatra neke ye prasthitāḥ tām aṭavīm bhaveyuḥ
translated: And many thousands of men who set out into that wilderness,

original: aṭavī ca sā śūnya bhaveta dīrghā pūrṇāni pañcāśata yojanāni // / //
analyzed: aṭavī ca sā śūnya bhaveta dīrghā pūrṇāni pañcāśata yojanāni
translated: And that wilderness would be empty and long, full of five hundred leagues.

original: puruṣaśca āḍhyaḥ smṛtimantu vyakto dhīro vinītaśca viśāradaśca /
analyzed: puruṣaḥ ca āḍhyaḥ smṛtimān tu vyaktaḥ dhīraḥ vinītaḥ ca viśāradaḥ ca
translated: The man is wealthy, mindful, clear, patient, disciplined, and confident,

original: yo deśikasteṣa bhaveta tatra aṭavīya durgāya subhairavāya // / //
analyzed: yaḥ bhaveta tatra durgāya subhairavāya
translated: And he becomes their guide in that dangerous and difficult wilderness.

original: Vaidya 🔽te cāpi khinnā bahuprāṇikoṭya uvāca taṃ deśika tasmi kāle /
analyzed: vaidya  te ca api khinnāḥ bahu prāṇi koṭyaḥ uvāca tam deśika tasmin kāle
translated: Vaidya

original: khinnā vayaṃ ārya na śaknuyāma nivartanaṃ adyiha rocate naḥ // / //
analyzed: khinnāḥ vayam ārya na śaknuyāma nivartanam adya iha rocate naḥ
translated: And those many millions of exhausted beings said to the guide at that time, We are exhausted, noble one, we are unable to continue. Today we prefer to turn back.

original: kuśalaśca so pi tada paṇḍitaśca praṇāyakopāya tadā vicintayet /
analyzed: kuśalaḥ ca saḥ pi paṇḍitaḥ ca praṇāya kopāya tadā vicintayet
translated: And the skillful and wise leader thought about a means at that time,

original: dhikkaṣṭa ratnairimi sarvi bālā bhraśyanti ātmāna nivartayantaḥ // / //
analyzed: dhik kaṣṭa bālāḥ bhraśyanti
translated: Alas, these foolish ones will all lose their jewels and turn back.

original: yannūnahaṃ ṛddhibalena vādya nagaraṃ mahantaṃ abhinirmiṇeyam /
analyzed: yat nūna aham ṛddhi balena vā adya nagaram mahantam abhinirmiṇeyam
translated: What if I were to create a great city by the power of my spiritual abilities?

original: pratimaṇḍitaṃ veśmasahasrakoṭibhirvihāraudyānupaśobhitaṃ ca // / //
analyzed: pratimaṇḍitam veśma sahasra koṭibhiḥ vihāra audyāna upaśobhitam ca
translated: Adorned with billions of houses, and beautified with monasteries and gardens,

original: vāpī nadīyo abhinirmiṇeyam ārāmapuṣpaiḥ pratimaṇḍitaṃ ca /
analyzed: vāpī nadīyaḥ abhinirmiṇeyam ārāma puṣpaiḥ pratimaṇḍitam ca
translated: I will create pools and rivers, and adorn it with garden flowers,

original: prākāradvārairupaśobhitaṃ ca nārīnaraiścāpratimairupetam // / //
analyzed: prākāra dvāraiḥ upaśobhitam ca nārī naraiḥ ca apratimaiḥ upetam
translated: And beautify it with walls and gates, and provide it with incomparable men and women.

original: nirmāṇu kṛtva iti tān vadeya mā bhāyathā harṣa karotha caiva /
analyzed: nirmāṇu kṛtvas iti tān vadeya mā bhāyathāḥ harṣa karotha ca eva
translated: Having created the illusion, I would say to them, 'Do not be afraid, but be joyful!

original: prāptā bhavanto nagaraṃ variṣṭhaṃ praviśya kāryāṇi kuruṣva kṣipram // / //
analyzed: prāptāḥ bhavantaḥ nagaram variṣṭham praviśya kāryāṇi kuruṣva kṣipram
translated: You have reached the supreme city. Enter and quickly do your duties.'

original: udagracittā bhaṇatheha nirvṛtā nistīrṇa sarvā aṭavī aśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: udagra cittāḥ bhaṇatha iha nirvṛtāḥ sarvā aṭavī aśeṣatas
translated: With uplifted minds, they would say, 'We are liberated! We have crossed over the entire wilderness without exception!'

original: āśvāsanārthāya vadeti vācaṃ kathaṃ na pratyāgata sarvi asyā // / //
analyzed: āśvāsana arthāya vada iti vācam katham na
translated: In order to reassure them, I would speak these words: 'How could all of you return from this?'

original: viśrāntarūpāṃśca viditva sarvān samānayitvā ca punarbravīti /
analyzed: viśrānta rūpān ca sarvān samānayitvā ca punar bravīti
translated: Knowing that they were all rested, I would gather them together again and say,

original: āgacchatha mahya śṛṇotha bhāṣato ṛddhīmayaṃ nagaramidaṃ vinirmitam // / //
analyzed: āgacchatha nagaram idam vinirmitam
translated: 'Come! Listen to me! This is a magically created city of illusion.

original: yuṣmāka khedaṃ ca mayā vitdivā nivartanaṃ mā ca bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: khedam ca mayā nivartanam mā ca bhaviṣyati iti
translated: I knew that you were weary, so I turned you back.

original: upāyakauśalyamidaṃ mameti janetha vīryaṃ gamanāya dvīpam // / //
analyzed: upāya kauśalyam idam mama iti janetha vīryam gamanāya dvīpam
translated: This is my skillful means. Generate energy to go to the continent.'

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: emeva haṃ bhikṣava deśiko vā praṇāyakaḥ prāṇisahasrakoṭinām /
analyzed: ham bhikṣava deśikaḥ vā praṇāyakaḥ prāṇi sahasra koṭinām
translated: Bhikṣus, in the same way, I am a guide and leader for billions of beings.

original: khidyanta paśyāmi tathaiva prāṇinaḥ kleśāṇḍakośaṃ na prabhonti bhettum // / //
analyzed: paśyāmi tathā eva prāṇinaḥ kleśa aṇḍa kośam na prabhonti bhettum
translated: I see that beings are likewise weary, unable to break through the shell of the afflictions.

original: tato mayā cintitu eṣa artho viśrāmabhūtā imi nirvṛtīkṛtāḥ /
analyzed: tatas mayā eṣa arthaḥ viśrāma bhūtāḥ imi nirvṛtīkṛtāḥ
translated: “Then I thought of this meaning: ‘These nirvāṇas are resting places.

original: sarvasya duḥkhasya nirodha eṣa arhantabhūmau kṛtakṛtya yūyam // / //
analyzed: sarvasya duḥkhasya nirodhaḥ eṣa arhanta bhūmau kṛtakṛtya yūyam
translated: The cessation of all suffering is this. You have done what had to be done on the level of the arhats.’

original: samaye yadā tu sthita atra sthāne paśyāmi yūyāmarhanta tatra sarvān /
analyzed: samaye yadā tu sthita atra sthāne paśyāmi tatra sarvān
translated: “When I saw that all of you arhats were present in this place,

original: tadā ca sarvāniha saṃnipātya bhūtārthamākhyāmi yathaiṣa dharmaḥ // / //
analyzed: tadā ca sarvān iha saṃnipātya bhūta artham ākhyāmi yathā eṣa dharmaḥ
translated: Then I gathered you all together here And taught the true meaning of this Dharma.

original: upāyakauśalya vināyakānāṃ yad yāna deśenti trayo maharṣī /
analyzed: upāya kauśalya vināyakānām yat trayaḥ mahā ṛṣī
translated: “The skillful method of the guides is that the three great sages teach the yāna.

original: ekaṃ hi yānaṃ na dvitīyamasti viśrāmaṇārthaṃ tu dviyāna deśitā // / //
analyzed: ekam hi yānam na dvitīyam asti viśrāmaṇa artham tu dvi yāna deśitā
translated: There is only one yāna; there is no second. Two yānas are taught for the sake of resting.

original: tato vademi ahamadya bhikṣavo janetha vīryaṃ paramaṃ udāram /
analyzed: tatas vademi aham adya bhikṣavaḥ vīryam paramam udāram
translated: “Therefore, bhikṣus, I say to you today, Generate the highest, vast effort.

original: sarvajñajñānena kṛtena yūyaṃ naitāvatā nirvṛti kāci bhoti // / //
analyzed: sarvajña jñānena kṛtena yūyam na etāvatā
translated: Through the wisdom of omniscience you will have done what had to be done. Through this alone you will not have nirvāṇa.

original: sarvajñajñānaṃ tu yadā spṛśiṣyatha daśo balā ye ca jināna dharmāḥ /
analyzed: sarvajña jñānam tu yadā spṛśiṣyatha daśa balāḥ ye ca dharmāḥ
translated: “When you have attained the wisdom of omniscience, the ten powers, and the qualities of a jina,

original: dvātriṃśatīlakṣaṇarūpadhārī buddhā bhavitvāna bhavetha nirvṛtāḥ // / //
analyzed: dvātriṃśatī lakṣaṇa rūpa dhārī buddhāḥ nirvṛtāḥ
translated: You will have the form of the thirty-two signs of a great being. Having become a buddha, you will have nirvāṇa.”

original: etādṛśī deśana nāyakānāṃ viśrāmahetoḥ pravadanti nirvṛtim /
analyzed: etādṛśī nāyakānām viśrāma hetoḥ pravadanti nirvṛtim
translated: Such is the teaching of the guides, which they proclaim as nirvana for the sake of rest.

original: viśrānta jñātvāna ca nirvṛtīye sarvajñajñāne upanenti sarvān // / //
analyzed: ca nirvṛtīye sarvajña jñāne upanenti sarvān
translated: Knowing that they have rested in nirvana, they lead them all to the omniscient knowledge.

original: ityāryasaddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye pūrvayogaparivarto nāma saptamaḥ //
analyzed: iti ārya saddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye pūrvayogaparivartaḥ nāma saptamaḥ
translated: Thus ends the seventh chapter in the Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma, called “Past Associations.”

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: pañcabhikṣuśatavyākaraṇaparivartaḥ /
analyzed: pañca bhikṣu śata vyākaraṇa parivartaḥ
translated: The Chapter on the Predictions to the Five Hundred Bhikṣus

original: atha khalvāyuṣmān pūrṇo maitrāyaṇīputro bhagavato 'ntikādidamevaṃrūpamupāyakauśalyajñānadarśanaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān pūrṇaḥ maitrāyaṇīputraḥ bhagavataḥ ntikāt idam evaṃrūpam upāya kauśalya jñāna darśanam
translated: Then the venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaṇīputra, having heard this kind of knowledge of skillful means, this vision,

original: saṃdhābhāṣitanirdeśaṃ śrutvā eṣāṃ ca mahāśrāvakāṇāṃ vyākaraṇaṃ śrutvā imāṃ ca pūrvayogapratisaṃyuktāṃ
analyzed: saṃdhā bhāṣita nirdeśam śrutvā eṣām ca mahāśrāvakāṇām vyākaraṇam śrutvā imām ca pūrvayoga pratisaṃyuktām
translated: this teaching of the implied meaning from the Bhagavān, having heard the predictions to these great śrāvakas, having heard this discourse connected with past associations,

original: kathāṃ śrutvā imāṃ ca bhagavato vṛṣabhatāṃ śrutvā āścaryaprāpto 'bhūdadbhutaprāpto
analyzed: kathām śrutvā imām ca bhagavataḥ vṛṣabha tām śrutvā āścarya prāptaḥ bhūt adbhuta prāptaḥ
translated: and having heard this supremacy of the Bhagavān, was amazed and astonished.

original: 'bhūnnirāmiṣeṇa ca cittena prītiprāmodyena sphuṭo 'bhūt /
analyzed: bhūt nirāmiṣeṇa ca cittena prīti prāmodyena sphuṭaḥ bhūt
translated: He was filled with a nonmaterialistic mind of joy and delight.

original: mahatā ca prītiprāmodyena mahatā ca dharmagauraveṇa utthāyāsanād bhagavataścaraṇayoḥ praṇipatya evaṃ cittamutpāditavān āścaryaṃ bhagavan /
analyzed: mahatā ca prīti prāmodyena mahatā ca dharma gauraveṇa utthāya āsanāt bhagavataḥ caraṇayoḥ praṇipatya evam cittam utpāditavān āścaryam bhagavan
translated: with great joy and delight, and with great respect for the Dharma, rose from his seat, bowed down at the feet of the Blessed One, and gave rise to this thought: It is amazing, Blessed One!

original: āścaryaṃ sugata /
analyzed: āścaryam sugata
translated: It is wonderful, Sugata!

original: paramaduṣkaraṃ tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ kurvanti /
analyzed: parama duṣkaram tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ kurvanti
translated: The Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones do what is extremely difficult,

original: ya imaṃ nānādhātukaṃ lokamanuvartayante /
analyzed: ye imam nānā dhātukam lokam anuvartayante
translated: in that they follow this world with its various elements.

original: bahubhiścopāyakauśalyajñānanidarśanaiḥ sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayanti /
analyzed: bahubhiḥ ca upāya kauśalya jñāna nidarśanaiḥ sattvānām dharmam deśayanti
translated: And they teach the Dharma to beings through many skillful means and knowledge of examples,

original: tasmiṃstasmiṃśca sattvān vilagnānupāyakauśalyena pramocayanti /
analyzed: tasmin tasmin ca sattvān vilagnān upāya kauśalyena pramocayanti
translated: and with skillful means they liberate beings who are attached here and there.

original: kimatra bhagavan asmābhiḥ śakyaṃ kartum /
analyzed: kim atra bhagavan asmābhiḥ śakyam kartum
translated: What can we do here, Blessed One?

original: tathāgata evāsmākaṃ jānīte āśayaṃ pūrvayogacaryāṃ ca /
analyzed: tathāgataḥ eva asmākam jānīte āśayam pūrva yoga caryām ca
translated: The Tathagata alone knows our intention and our practice in former lifetimes.

original: sa bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandya ekānte sthito 'bhūd bhagavantameva namaskurvan animiṣābhyāṃ ca netrābhyāṃ saṃprekṣamāṇaḥ //
analyzed: sa bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya ekānte sthitaḥ bhūt bhagavantam eva namaskurvan animiṣābhyām ca netrābhyām saṃprekṣamāṇaḥ
translated: Having bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One, he stood to one side, paying homage to the Blessed One, gazing at him with unblinking eyes.

original: atha khalu bhagavānāyuṣmantaḥ pūrṇasya maitrāyaṇīputrasya cittāśayamavalokya sarvāvantaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmantaḥ pūrṇasya maitrāyaṇīputrasya citta āśayam avalokya sarvāvantam
translated: Then the Blessed One, having observed the thoughts and intentions of the venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaṇī­putra, addressed the entire assembly with these words:

original: bhikṣusaṃghamāmantrayate sma paśyatha bhikṣavo yūyamimaṃ śrāvakaṃ pūrṇaṃ maitrāyaṇīputraṃ
analyzed: bhikṣu saṃgham āmantrayate sma paśyatha bhikṣavaḥ yūyam imam śrāvakam pūrṇam maitrāyaṇīputram
translated: He addressed the assembly of monks, saying, Monks, do you see this disciple Pūrṇa Maitrāyaṇīputra,

original: yo mayāsya bhikṣusaṃghasya dharmakathikānāmagryo nirdiṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ mayā asya bhikṣu saṃghasya dharma kathikānām agryaḥ nirdiṣṭaḥ
translated: whom I have designated as the foremost of those who expound the Dharma among my monks?

original: bahubhiśca bhūtairguṇairabhiṣṭutaḥ /
analyzed: bahubhiḥ ca bhūtaiḥ guṇaiḥ abhiṣṭutaḥ
translated: He is praised by many beings for his virtues,

original: bahubhiśca prakārairasmin mama śāsane saddharmaparigrahāyābhiyuktaḥ /
analyzed: bahubhiḥ ca prakāraiḥ asmin mama śāsane saddharma parigrahāya abhiyuktaḥ
translated: and in many ways he is devoted to upholding the true Dharma in my teaching.

original: catasṛṇāṃ parṣadāṃ saṃharṣakaḥ samādāpakaḥ samuttejakaḥ saṃpraharṣako 'klānto dharmadeśanayā /
analyzed: catasṛṇām parṣadām saṃharṣakaḥ samādāpakaḥ samuttejakaḥ saṃpraharṣakaḥ klāntaḥ dharma deśanayā
translated: He is tireless in teaching the Dharma, delighting, inspiring, and gladdening the four assemblies.

original: alamasya dharmasyākhyātā /
analyzed: alam asya dharmasya ākhyātā
translated: He is able to expound this Dharma,

original: alamanugrahītā sabrahmacāriṇām /
analyzed: alam anugrahītā sabrahmacāriṇām
translated: and able to benefit those who practice with him.

original: muktvā bhikṣavastathāgataṃ nānyaḥ śaktaḥ pūrṇaṃ maitrāyaṇīputramarthato vā vyañjanato vā paryādātum /
analyzed: muktvā bhikṣavaḥ tathāgatam na anyaḥ śaktaḥ pūrṇam maitrāyaṇīputram arthataḥ vā vyañjanataḥ vā paryādātum
translated: Monks, except for the Tathāgata, no one is able to fully understand the meaning or the words of Pūrṇa Maitrāyaṇīputra.

original: tatkiṃ manyadhve bhikṣavo mamaivāyaṃ saddharmaparigrāhaka iti /
analyzed: tat kim manyadhve bhikṣavaḥ mama eva ayam saddharma parigrāhakaḥ iti
translated: Monks, what do you think? Is he alone the upholder of my true Dharma?

original: na khalu punarbhikṣavo yuṣmābhirevaṃ draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: na khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ yuṣmābhiḥ evam draṣṭavyam
translated: Monks, you should not view it in that way.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: abhijānāmyahaṃ bhikṣavo 'tīte 'dhvani navanavatīnāṃ buddhakoṭīnām /
analyzed: abhijānāmi aham bhikṣavaḥ tīte dhvani navanavatīnām buddha koṭīnām
translated: “Monks, I remember that in the past, ninety-nine koṭis of Buddhas

original: yatra anenaiva teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ śāsane saddharmaḥ parigṛhītaḥ /
analyzed: yatra anena eva teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām śāsane saddharmaḥ parigṛhītaḥ
translated: in whose teachings this good man received and upheld the true Dharma.

original: tadyathāpi nāma mama etarhi sarvatra cāgryo dharmakathikānāmabhūt /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma mama etarhi sarvatra ca agryaḥ dharma kathikānām abhūt
translated: He was always the foremost of Dharma teachers, just as he is for me now.

original: sarvatra ca śūnyatāgatiṃ gato 'bhūt /
analyzed: sarvatra ca śūnyatā gatim gataḥ bhūt
translated: He always attained the realization of emptiness.

original: sarvatra ca pratisaṃvidāṃ lābhī abhūt /
analyzed: sarvatra ca pratisaṃvidām lābhī abhūt
translated: He always attained the realization of the discernments.

original: sarvatra ca bodhisattvābhijñāsu gatiṃ gato 'bhūt /
analyzed: sarvatra ca bodhisattva abhijñāsu gatim gataḥ bhūt
translated: He always attained the realization of the bodhisattva’s supernormal knowledge.

original: suviniścitadharmadeśako nirvicikitsadharmadeśakaḥ pariśuddhadharmadeśakaścābhūt /
analyzed: su viniścita dharma deśakaḥ nirvicikitsa dharma deśakaḥ pariśuddha dharma deśakaḥ ca abhūt
translated: He taught the Dharma with great certainty, taught the Dharma without doubt, and taught the Dharma with complete purity.

original: teṣāṃ ca buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ śāsane yāvadāyuṣpramāṇaṃ brahmacaryaṃ caritavān /
analyzed: teṣām ca buddhānām bhagavatām śāsane yāvat āyuṣpramāṇam brahmacaryam caritavān
translated: He practiced celibacy for as long as he lived in the teachings of those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: sarvatra ca śrāvaka iti saṃjñāyate sma /🔽sa khalvanenopāyena aprameyāṇāmasaṃkhyeyānāṃ sattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇāmarthamakārṣīt /
analyzed: sarvatra ca śrāvakaḥ iti saṃjñāyate sma  sa khalu anena upāyena aprameyāṇām asaṃkhyeyānām sattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇām artham akārṣīt
translated: Everywhere he was known as a śrāvaka.🔽By this method, he benefited countless, innumerable hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of beings.

original: aprameyānasaṃkhyeyāṃśca sattvān paripācitavānanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: aprameyān asaṃkhyeyān ca sattvān paripācitavān anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: He ripened countless, innumerable beings for supreme, perfect enlightenment.

original: sarvatra ca buddhakṛtyena sattvānāṃ pratyupasthito 'bhūt /
analyzed: sarvatra ca buddha kṛtyena sattvānām pratyupasthitaḥ bhūt
translated: And he was present everywhere to carry out the activities of a Buddha for sentient beings.

original: sarvatra cātmano buddhakṣetraṃ pariśodhayati sma /
analyzed: sarvatra ca ātmanaḥ buddhakṣetram pariśodhayati sma
translated: And everywhere he was purifying his own Buddha-field.

original: sattvānāṃ ca paripākāyābhiyukto 'bhūt /
analyzed: sattvānām ca paripākāya abhiyuktaḥ bhūt
translated: And he was devoted to bringing sentient beings to maturity.

original: eṣāmapi bhikṣavo vipaśyipramukhānāṃ saptānāṃ tathāgatānāṃ yeṣāmahaṃ saptamaḥ /
analyzed: eṣām api bhikṣavaḥ vipaśyi pramukhānām saptānām tathāgatānām yeṣām aham saptamaḥ
translated: Monks, I am the seventh of these seven Tathāgatas beginning with Vipaśyin.

original: eṣa evāgryo dharmakathikānāmabhūt //
analyzed: eṣaḥ eva agryaḥ dharma kathikānām abhūt
translated: He was also the foremost of those who expound the Dharma.”

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: The Physician

original: yadapi tadbhikṣavo bhaviṣyatyanāgate 'dhvani asmin bhadrakalpe caturbhirbuddhairūnaṃ buddhasahasram /
analyzed: yat api tat bhikṣavaḥ bhaviṣyati anāgate dhvani asmin bhadra kalpe caturbhiḥ buddhaiḥ ūnam buddha sahasram
translated: “Monks, in the future, in this fortunate eon, there will be a thousand Buddhas, minus four.

original: teṣāmapi śāsane eṣa eva pūrṇo maitrāyaṇīputro 'gryo dharmakathikānāṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: teṣām api śāsane eṣaḥ eva pūrṇaḥ maitrāyaṇīputraḥ gryaḥ dharma kathikānām bhaviṣyati
translated: In the teachings of those Buddhas, this very Pūrṇa Maitrāyaṇīputra will be the foremost of those who expound the Dharma.

original: saddharmaparigrāhakaśca bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: saddharma parigrāhakaḥ ca bhaviṣyati
translated: He will uphold the true Dharma.

original: evamanāgate 'dhvani aprameyāṇāmasaṃkhyeyānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ saddharmamādhārayiṣyati /
analyzed: evam anāgate dhvani aprameyāṇām asaṃkhyeyānām buddhānām bhagavatām saddharmam ādhārayiṣyati
translated: In this way, in the future, he will uphold the true Dharma of immeasurable, incalculable Buddhas.

original: aprameyāṇāmasaṃkhyeyānāṃ sattvānāmarthaṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: aprameyāṇām asaṃkhyeyānām sattvānām artham kariṣyati
translated: He will benefit immeasurable, incalculable sentient beings.

original: aprameyānasaṃkhyeyāṃśca sattvān paripācayiṣyatyanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: aprameyān asaṃkhyeyān ca sattvān paripācayiṣyati anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: He will ripen countless, innumerable beings for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: satatasamitaṃ cābhiyukto bhaviṣyatyātmano buddhakṣetrapariśuddhaye sattvaparipācanāya /
analyzed: satata samitam ca abhiyuktaḥ bhaviṣyati ātmanaḥ buddhakṣetra pariśuddhaye sattva paripācanāya
translated: He will always be dedicated to purifying his own buddha realm and ripening beings.

original: sa imāmevaṃrūpāṃ bodhisattvacaryāṃ paripūrya aprameyairasaṃkhyeyaiḥ kalpairanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyate /🔽dharmaprabhāso nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho loke bhaviṣyati vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ
analyzed: saḥ imām evaṃrūpām bodhisattva caryām paripūrya aprameyaiḥ asaṃkhyeyaiḥ kalpaiḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate  dharmaprabhāsaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke bhaviṣyati vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ
translated: Having completed this kind of bodhisattva conduct for immeasurable, countless eons, he will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: He will be a thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha in the world, one with proper knowledge and conduct, a blissful one, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed being, a charioteer who tames people, a teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, a blessed one named Dharma Light.

original: asminneva buddhakṣetra utpatsyate //
analyzed: asmin eva buddhakṣetre utpatsyate
translated: He will appear in this very buddha realm.

original: tena khalu punarbhikṣavaḥ samayena gaṅgānadīvālukopamāstrisāhasramahāsāhasralokadhātava ekaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tena khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ samayena gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamāḥ tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātavaḥ ekam buddhakṣetram bhaviṣyati
translated: Bhikṣus, at that time, as many worlds as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River in the trichiliocosm will become one buddha realm.

original: samaṃ pāṇitalajātaṃ saptaratnamayamapagataparvataṃ saptaratnamayaiḥ kūṭāgāraiḥ paripūrṇaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: samam pāṇi tala jātam sapta ratna mayam apagata parvatam sapta ratna mayaiḥ kūṭāgāraiḥ paripūrṇam bhaviṣyati
translated: It will be as level as the palm of a hand, free of mountains, filled with the seven precious substances, and filled with palaces made of the seven precious substances.

original: devavimānāni cākāśasthitāni bhaviṣyanti /🔽devā api manuṣyān drakṣyanti /
analyzed: deva vimānāni ca ākāśa sthitāni bhaviṣyanti  devāḥ api manuṣyān drakṣyanti
translated: The celestial palaces of the gods will be suspended in the sky.🔽The gods will see the humans,

original: manuṣyā api devān drakṣyanti /
analyzed: manuṣyāḥ api devān drakṣyanti
translated: and the humans will see the gods.

original: tena khalu punarbhikṣavaḥ samayena idaṃ buddhakṣetramapagatapāpaṃ bhaviṣyati apagatamātṛgrāmaṃ ca /
analyzed: tena khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ samayena idam buddhakṣetram apagata pāpam bhaviṣyati apagata mātṛgrāmam ca
translated: Bhikṣus, at that time this buddhafield will be free of evil and free of women.

original: sarve ca te sattvā aupapādukā bhaviṣyanti brahmacāriṇo manomayairātmabhāvaiḥ svayaṃprabhā
analyzed: sarve ca te sattvāḥ aupapādukāḥ bhaviṣyanti brahmacāriṇaḥ manaḥ mayaiḥ ātmabhāvaiḥ svayaṃprabhā
translated: All those beings will be spontaneously born, celibate, with bodies made of mind, self-luminous,

original: ṛddhimanto vaihāyasaṃgamā vīryavantaḥ smṛtimantaḥ prajñāvantaḥ suvarṇavarṇaiḥ samucchrayairdvātriṃśadbhirmahāpuruṣalakṣaṇaiḥ
analyzed: ṛddhimantaḥ vaihāyasaṃgamāḥ vīryavantaḥ smṛtimantaḥ prajñāvantaḥ suvarṇa varṇaiḥ samucchrayaiḥ dvātriṃśadbhiḥ mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ
translated: possessing miraculous powers, traveling through the air, strong, mindful, wise, with golden-colored bodies, adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: samalaṃkṛtavigrahāḥ /
analyzed: samalaṃkṛta vigrahāḥ
translated: Their bodies will be well adorned.

original: tena khalu punarbhikṣavaḥ samayena tasmin buddhakṣetre teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ dvāvāhārau bhaviṣyataḥ /
analyzed: tena khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ samayena tasmin buddhakṣetre teṣām sattvānām dvau āhārau bhaviṣyataḥ
translated: Bhikṣus, at that time in that buddhafield those beings will have two kinds of nourishment.

original: katamau dvau /
analyzed: katamau dvau
translated: What are the two?

original: yaduta dharmaprītyāhāro dhyānaprītyāhāraśca /
analyzed: yat uta dharma prīti āhāraḥ dhyāna prīti āhāraḥ ca
translated: They are the nourishment of delight in the Dharma and the nourishment of delight in meditation.

original: aprameyāṇi cāsaṃkhyeyāni bodhisattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi bhaviṣyanti sarveṣāṃ ca mahābhijñāprāptānāṃ pratisaṃvidgatiṃgatānāṃ sattvāvavādakuśalānām
analyzed: aprameyāṇi ca asaṃkhyeyāni bodhisattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi bhaviṣyanti sarveṣām ca mahā abhijñā prāptānām pratisaṃvid gatiṃgatānām sattva avavāda kuśalānām
translated: There will be countless, innumerable hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of bodhisattvas, all of whom will have attained the great higher knowledges, have gone to the perfection of the discernments, and be skilled in instructing beings.

original: gaṇanāsamatikrāntāścāsya śrāvakā bhaviṣyanti maharddhikā mahānubhāvā aṣṭavimokṣadhyāyinaḥ /
analyzed: gaṇanā samatikrāntāḥ ca asya śrāvakāḥ bhaviṣyanti maharddhikāḥ mahā anubhāvāḥ aṣṭa vimokṣa dhyāyinaḥ
translated: His śrāvakas will be beyond number, having great power and great majesty, meditating in the eight liberations.

original: evamaparimitaguṇasamanvāgataṃ tad buddhakṣetraṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: evam aparimita guṇa samanvāgatam tat buddhakṣetram bhaviṣyati
translated: Thus, that buddha-field will be endowed with immeasurable qualities.

original: ratnāvabhāsaśca nāma sa kalpo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ratnāvabhāsaḥ ca nāma sa kalpaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: That eon will be named Ratnâvabhāsa.

original: suviśuddhā ca nāma sā lokadhāturbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: suviśuddhā ca nāma sā lokadhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: That world system will be named Suviśuddhā.

original: aprameyānasaṃkhyeyāṃścāsya kalpānāyuṣpramāṇaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: aprameyān asaṃkhyeyān ca asya kalpān āyuṣpramāṇam bhaviṣyati
translated: His lifespan will be immeasurable and incalculable eons.

original: parinirvṛtasya ca tasya bhagavato dharmaprabhāsasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya saddharmaścirasthāyī bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: parinirvṛtasya ca tasya bhagavataḥ dharmaprabhāsasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya saddharmaḥ cira sthāyī bhaviṣyati
translated: And after the parinirvāṇa of the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha Dharmaprabhāsa, the true Dharma will remain for a long time.

original: ratnamayaiśca stūpaiḥ sā lokadhātuḥ sphuṭā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ratna mayaiḥ ca stūpaiḥ sā lokadhātuḥ sphuṭā bhaviṣyati
translated: That world system will be filled with stūpas made of jewels.

original: evamacintyaguṇasamanvāgataṃ bhikṣavastasya bhagavatastadbuddhakṣetraṃ bhaviṣyati //
analyzed: evam acintya guṇa samanvāgatam bhikṣavaḥ tasya bhagavataḥ tat buddhakṣetram bhaviṣyati
translated: Thus, monks, that Buddha-field of the Blessed One will be endowed with inconceivable qualities.

original: idamavocadbhagavān /
analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān
translated: This was said by the Blessed One.

original: idaṃ vaditvā sugato hyathāparametaduvāca śāstā
analyzed: idam vaditvā sugataḥ hi atha aparam etat uvāca śāstā
translated: Having said this, the Well-Gone One, the Teacher, then said this further:

original: śṛṇotha me bhikṣava etamarthaṃ yathā carī mahya sutena cīrṇā /
analyzed: śṛṇotha me bhikṣavaḥ etam artham yathā sutena cīrṇā
translated: Monks, listen to me about this matter, how the conduct was practiced by my son,

original: upāyakauśalyasuśikṣitena yathā ca cīrṇā iya bodhicaryā // / //
analyzed: upāya kauśalya su śikṣitena yathā ca cīrṇā iya bodhi caryā
translated: By one well-trained in skillful means, how the conduct of this enlightenment was practiced.

original: hīnādhimuktā ima sattva jñātvā udārayāne ca samuttrasanti /
analyzed: hīna adhimuktāḥ ima sattva jñātvā udāra yāne ca samuttrasanti
translated: Knowing these beings to be of inferior aspiration, they are terrified by the vast vehicle.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Physician

original: tatu śrāvakā bhontimi bodhisattvāḥ pratyekabodhiṃ ca nidarśayanti // / //
analyzed: śrāvakāḥ bodhisattvāḥ pratyeka bodhim ca nidarśayanti
translated: They become disciples of that bodhisattva, and demonstrate individual enlightenment.

original: upāyakauśalyaśatairanekaiḥ paripācayanti bahubodhisattvān /
analyzed: upāya kauśalya śataiḥ anekaiḥ paripācayanti bahu bodhisattvān
translated: By many hundreds of skillful means, they bring to maturity many bodhisattvas.

original: evaṃ ca bhāṣanti vayaṃ hi śrāvakā dūre vayaṃ uttamamagrabodhiyā // / //
analyzed: evam ca bhāṣanti vayam hi śrāvakāḥ dūre vayam uttamam agra bodhiyā
translated: And they say, We are disciples, far from the supreme highest enlightenment.

original: etāṃ cariṃ teṣvanuśikṣamāṇāḥ paripāku gacchanti hi sattvakoṭyaḥ /
analyzed: etām carim teṣu anuśikṣamāṇāḥ paripāku gacchanti hi sattva koṭyaḥ
translated: Following in their footsteps, they bring to maturity millions of beings.

original: hīnādhimuktāśca kusīdarūpā anupūrva te sarvi bhavanti buddhāḥ // / //
analyzed: hīna adhimuktāḥ ca te bhavanti buddhāḥ
translated: Those of inferior aspiration and lazy disposition, all of them eventually become Buddhas.

original: ajñānacaryāṃ ca caranti ete vayaṃ khalu śrāvaka alpakṛtyāḥ /
analyzed: ajñāna caryām ca caranti ete vayam khalu śrāvaka alpa kṛtyāḥ
translated: They practice the conduct of ignorance, while we are the disciples with few duties.

original: nirviṇṇa sarvāsu cyutopapattiṣu svakaṃ ca kṣetraṃ pariśodhayanti // / //
analyzed: sarvāsu cyuta upapattiṣu svakam ca kṣetram pariśodhayanti
translated: Disgusted with all death and rebirth, they purify their own realms.

original: sarāgatāmātmani darśayanti sadoṣatāṃ cāpi samohatāṃ ca /
analyzed: sa rāga tām ātmani darśayanti sa doṣa tām ca api sa moha tām ca
translated: They show attachment to themselves, and also aversion and delusion.

original: dṛṣṭīvilagnāṃśca viditva sattvāṃsteṣāṃ pi dṛṣṭiṃ samupāśrayanti // / //
analyzed: sattvān teṣām dṛṣṭim samupāśrayanti
translated: And knowing that beings are attached to views, they resort to those views for their sake.

original: evaṃ caranto bahu mahya śrāvakāḥ sattvānupāyena vimocayanti /
analyzed: evam carantaḥ śrāvakāḥ sattvān upāyena vimocayanti
translated: Thus my many disciples practice, liberating beings through skillful means.

original: unmādu gaccheyu narā avidvasū sa caiva sarvaṃ caritaṃ prakāśayet // / //
analyzed: unmādu gaccheyuḥ narāḥ avidvasū sa ca eva sarvam caritam prakāśayet
translated: Ignorant people might go crazy, but he would reveal all that conduct.

original: pūrṇo ayaṃ śrāvaka mahya bhikṣavaścarito purā buddhasahasrakoṭiṣu /
analyzed: pūrṇaḥ ayam purā buddha sahasra koṭiṣu
translated: This monk Pūrṇa here was my disciple in the past, practicing under thousands of koṭis of Buddhas.

original: teṣāṃ ca saddharma parigrahīṣīd bauddhaṃ idaṃ jñāna gaveṣamāṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: teṣām ca saddharma bauddham idam jñāna gaveṣamāṇaḥ
translated: Seeking this knowledge of the Buddha, he upheld their true Dharma.

original: sarvatra caiṣo abhu agraśrāvako bahuśrutaścitrakathī viśāradaḥ /
analyzed: sarvatra ca eṣaḥ agra śrāvakaḥ bahu śrutaḥ citra kathī viśāradaḥ
translated: Everywhere he was the foremost disciple, learned, eloquent, and fearless.

original: saṃharṣakaścā akilāsi nityaṃ sada buddhakṛtyena ca pratyupasthitaḥ // / //
analyzed: nityam buddha kṛtyena ca pratyupasthitaḥ
translated: Always delighting others without weariness, he was always present for the Buddha's work.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: mahāabhijñāsu sadā gatiṃgataḥ pratisaṃvidānāṃ ca abhūṣi lābhī /
analyzed: mahā abhijñāsu sadā gatiṃgataḥ pratisaṃvidānām ca abhūṣi lābhī
translated: He has always attained mastery over the great higher knowledges and has attained the analytical knowledges.

original: sattvāna co indriyagocarajño dharmaṃ ca deśeti sadā viśuddham // / //
analyzed: indriya gocara jñaḥ dharmam ca deśeti sadā viśuddham
translated: He knows the faculties and domains of beings and always teaches the pure Dharma.

original: saddharma śreṣṭhaṃ ca prakāśayantaḥ paripācayī sattvasahasrakoṭyaḥ /
analyzed: saddharma śreṣṭham ca prakāśayantaḥ sattva sahasra koṭyaḥ
translated: Illuminating the supreme true Dharma, he ripens billions of beings,

original: anuttarasminniha agrayāne kṣetraṃ svakaṃ śreṣṭhu viśodhayantaḥ // / //
analyzed: anuttarasmin iha agra yāne kṣetram svakam śreṣṭhu viśodhayantaḥ
translated: In this unsurpassed, supreme vehicle, purifying his own supreme realm.

original: anāgate cāpi tathaiva adhve pūjeṣyatī buddhasahasrakoṭyaḥ /🔽saddharma śreṣṭhaṃ ca parigrahīṣyati svakaṃ ca kṣetraṃ pariśodhayiṣyati // / //
analyzed: anāgate ca api tathā eva adhve pūjeṣyatī buddha sahasra koṭyaḥ  saddharma śreṣṭham ca parigrahīṣyati svakam ca kṣetram pariśodhayiṣyati
translated: In the future as well, he will make offerings to billions of buddhas,🔽Uphold the supreme true Dharma, and purify his own realm.

original: deśeṣyatī dharma sadā viśārado upāyakauśalyasahasrakoṭibhiḥ /
analyzed: upāya kauśalya sahasra koṭibhiḥ
translated: He will always fearlessly teach the Dharma using billions of skillful means,

original: bahūṃśca sattvān paripācayiṣyati sarvajñajñānasmi anāsravasmin // / //
analyzed: bahūn ca sattvān paripācayiṣyati anāsravasmin
translated: Ripening many beings in the uncontaminated omniscient wisdom.

original: so pūja kṛtvā naranāyakānāṃ saddharma śreṣṭhaṃ sada dhārayitvā /
analyzed: kṛtvā nara nāyakānām saddharma śreṣṭham sada dhārayitvā
translated: Having made offerings to the guides of humans, and always upholding the supreme true Dharma,

original: bhaviṣyatī buddha svayaṃbhu loke dharmaprabhāso diśatāsu viśrutaḥ // / //
analyzed: loke dharmaprabhāsaḥ diśatāsu viśrutaḥ
translated: He will become a self-arisen Buddha in the world, Dharma Light, renowned in all directions.

original: kṣetraṃ ca tasya suviśuddha bheṣyatī ratnāna saptāna sadā viśiṣṭam /
analyzed: kṣetram ca tasya su viśuddha ratnāna saptāna sadā viśiṣṭam
translated: And his realm will be completely pure, always distinguished by the seven precious substances.

original: ratnavabhāsaśca sa kalpu bheṣyatī suviśuddha so bheṣyati lokadhātuḥ // / //
analyzed: ratnavabhāsaḥ ca sa su viśuddha saḥ bheṣyati lokadhātuḥ
translated: That eon will be called Ratnavyūha, and that world realm will be completely pure.

original: bahubodhisattvāna sahasrakoṭyo mahāabhijñāsu sukovidānām /
analyzed: sahasra koṭyaḥ mahā abhijñāsu su kovidānām
translated: Many thousands of millions of bodhisattvas, very skilled in the great higher knowledges,

original: yehi sphuṭo bheṣyati lokadhātuḥ suviśuddha śuddhehi maharddhikehi // / //
analyzed: sphuṭaḥ lokadhātuḥ su viśuddha śuddhehi maharddhikehi
translated: By whom the world realm will be filled with pure, very powerful ones.

original: atha śrāvakāṇāṃ pi sahasrakoṭyaḥ saṃghastadā bheṣyati nāyakasya /
analyzed: atha śrāvakāṇām sahasra koṭyaḥ saṃghaḥ tadā nāyakasya
translated: Then there will be thousands of millions of śrāvakas, the Saṅgha of the Guide,

original: maharddhikānaṣṭavimokṣadhyāyināṃ pratisaṃvidāsū ca gatiṃgatānām // / //
analyzed: maharddhika anaṣṭa vimokṣa dhyāyinām pratisaṃvid asū ca gatiṃgatānām
translated: Of great power, meditating on the eight liberations, having attained mastery in the discernments.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: sarve ca sattvāstahi buddhakṣetre śuddhā bhaviṣyanti ca brahmacāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca sattvāḥ tahi buddhakṣetre śuddhāḥ bhaviṣyanti ca brahmacāriṇaḥ
translated: All beings in that Buddha-field will be pure and celibate,

original: upapādukāḥ sarvi suvarṇavarṇā dvātriṃśatīlakṣaṇarūpadhāriṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: upapādukāḥ suvarṇa varṇāḥ dvātriṃśatī lakṣaṇa rūpa dhāriṇaḥ
translated: All of them will be spontaneously born, golden-colored, bearing the thirty-two marks.

original: āhārasaṃjñā ca na tatra bheṣyati anyatra dharme rati dhyānaprītiḥ /
analyzed: āhāra saṃjñā ca na tatra anyatra dharme dhyāna prītiḥ
translated: There will be no concept of food there, only the joy of Dharma and meditation.

original: na mātṛgrāmo 'pi ca tatra bheṣyati na cāpyapāyāna ca durgatībhayam // / //
analyzed: na ca tatra ca durgatī bhayam
translated: There will be no women there, nor the lower realms or the fear of bad destinies.

original: etādṛśaṃ kṣetravaraṃ bhaviṣyati pūrṇasya saṃpūrṇaguṇānvitasya /
analyzed: etādṛśam kṣetra varam bhaviṣyati pūrṇasya saṃpūrṇa guṇa anvitasya
translated: “This supreme field will be like that, completely full of those who are completely endowed with good qualities.

original: ākīrṇa sattvehi subhadrakehi yatkiṃcimātraṃ pi idaṃ prakāśitam // / //
analyzed: ākīrṇa sattvehi su bhadrakehi idam prakāśitam
translated: It will be crowded with beings who are good and excellent. I have revealed just a little bit of this…”

original: atha khalu teṣāṃ dvādaśānāṃ vaśībhūtaśatānāmetadabhavat āścaryaprāpta sma /
analyzed: atha khalu teṣām dvādaśānām vaśībhūta śatānām etat abhavat āścarya prāpta sma
