translated: Then those twelve hundred who had mastered themselves thought, “We have attained the marvelous!

original: adbhutaprāptāḥ sma /
analyzed: adbhuta prāptāḥ sma
translated: We have attained the wonderful!

original: sacedasmākamapi bhagavān yatheme 'nye mahāśrāvakā vyākṛtāḥ /
analyzed: saced asmākam api bhagavān yathā ime nye mahāśrāvakāḥ vyākṛtāḥ
translated: If the Blessed One would prophesy for us just as he has prophesied for these other great disciples,

original: evamasmākamapi tathāgataḥ pṛthak pṛthag vyākuryāt /
analyzed: evam asmākam api tathāgataḥ pṛthak pṛthak vyākuryāt
translated: then the Thus-Gone One would prophesy separately for us as well.”

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃsteṣāṃ mahāśrāvakāṇāṃ cetasaiva cetaḥparivitarkamājñāya āyuṣmantaṃ mahākāśyapamāmantrayate sma imāni kāśyapa dvādaśa vaśībhūtaśatāni /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān teṣām mahāśrāvakāṇām cetasā eva cetaḥ parivitarkam ājñāya āyuṣmantam mahākāśyapam āmantrayate smaḥ imāni kāśyapa dvādaśa vaśībhūta śatāni
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing the thoughts that were in the minds of those great disciples, said to the venerable Mahākāśyapa, “Kāśyapa, these twelve hundred who have mastered themselves

original: yeṣāmahametarhi saṃmukhībhūtaḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām aham etarhi saṃmukhībhūtaḥ
translated: are present before me.

original: sarvāṇyetānyahaṃ kāśyapa dvādaśa vaśībhūtaśatānyanantaraṃ vyākaromi /
analyzed: sarvāṇi etāni aham kāśyapa dvādaśa vaśībhūta śatāni anantaram vyākaromi
translated: Kāśyapa, I prophesy that all of these twelve hundred who have mastered themselves will be the next to attain perfect and complete awakening.”

original: tatra kāśyapa kauṇḍinyo bhikṣurmahāśrāvako dvāṣaṣṭīnāṃ buddhakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇāṃ pareṇa parataraṃ samantaprabhāso nāma tathāgato 'rhan
analyzed: tatra kāśyapa kauṇḍinyaḥ bhikṣuḥ mahāśrāvakaḥ dvāṣaṣṭīnām buddha koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇām pareṇa parataram samantaprabhāsaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan  /
translated: There, Kashyapa, the great disciple monk Kaundinya, after sixty-two hundred thousand koṭis of nayutas of Buddhas, will become a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Awakened One, named Samantaprabhāsa.

original: samyaksaṃbuddho loke bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke bhaviṣyati
translated: He will appear in the world.

original: vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: He will be virtuous and wise, a Sugata, an unsurpassed knower of the world, a driver of men to be tamed, a teacher of gods and men, a Buddha, a Blessed One.

original: tatra kāśyapa anenaikena nāmadheyena pañca tathāgataśatāni bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tatra kāśyapa anena ekena nāmadheyena pañca tathāgata śatāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: There, Kashyapa, under this one name, there will be five hundred Tathāgatas.

original: ataḥ pañca mahāśrāvakaśatāni sarvāṇyanantaramanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyante /
analyzed: atas pañca mahāśrāvaka śatāni sarvāṇi anantaram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante
translated: After them, all five hundred great disciples will fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: sarvāṇyeva samantaprabhāsanāmadheyāni bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: sarvāṇi eva samantaprabhāsa nāmadheyāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: All of them will have the name Samantaprabhāsa.

original: tadyathā gayākāśyapo nadīkāśyapaḥ urubilvakāśyapaḥ kālaḥ kālodāyī aniruddho revataḥ kapphiṇo bakkulaścundaḥ svāgataḥ ityevaṃpramukhāni pañca
analyzed: tat yathā gayākāśyapaḥ nadīkāśyapaḥ urubilvakāśyapaḥ kālaḥ kālodāyī aniruddhaḥ revataḥ kapphiṇaḥ bakkulaḥ cundaḥ svāgataḥ iti evaṃpramukhāni pañca
translated: For example, the five hundred leading disciples such as Gayākāśyapa, Nadīkāśyapa, Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa, Kāla, Kālodāyin, Aniruddha, Revata, Kapphiṇa, Bakkula, Cunda, Svāgata, and so on,

original: vaśībhūtaśatāni //
analyzed: vaśībhūta śatāni
translated: who have attained mastery.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses on that occasion:

original: kauṇḍinyagotro mama śrāvako 'yaṃ tathāgato bheṣyati lokanāthaḥ /
analyzed: kauṇḍinya gotraḥ mama śrāvakaḥ yam tathāgataḥ loka nāthaḥ
translated: This disciple of mine belonging to the Kauṇḍinya clan will become a Tathāgata, a Lord of the World.

original: anāgate 'dhvāni anantakalpe vineṣyate prāṇisahasrakoṭyaḥ // / //
analyzed: anāgate ananta kalpe vineṣyate prāṇi sahasra koṭyaḥ
translated: In the future, after countless eons, he will guide billions of beings.

original: samantaprabho nāma jino bhaviṣyati kṣetraṃ ca tasya pariśuddha bheṣyati /🔽Vaidya
analyzed: samantaprabhaḥ nāma jinaḥ bhaviṣyati kṣetram ca tasya pariśuddha  vaidya
translated: His name will be Samantaprabhāsa, the Victorious One, and his realm will be pure.

original: anantakalpasmi anāgate 'dhvani dṛṣṭvāna buddhān bahavo hyanantān // / //🔽prabhāsvaro buddhabalenupeto vighuṣṭaśabdo daśasu ddiśāsu /
analyzed: ananta kalpasmi anāgate buddhān bahavaḥ hi anantān  prabhāsvaraḥ buddha balena upetaḥ vighuṣṭa śabdaḥ daśasu ddiśāsu
translated: Having seen many infinite Buddhas in the future, after countless eons,🔽he will be endowed with the power of the Buddha, his voice illuminating, his fame resounding in the ten directions.

original: puraskṛtaḥ prāṇisahasrakoṭibhirdeśeṣyatī uttamamagrabodhim // / //
analyzed: puraskṛtaḥ prāṇi sahasra koṭibhiḥ deśeṣyatī uttamam agra bodhim
translated: Surrounded by billions of beings, he will teach the supreme highest enlightenment.

original: tatu bodhisattvā abhiyuktarūpā vimānaśreṣṭhānyabhiruhya cāpi /
analyzed: bodhisattvāḥ abhiyukta rūpāḥ vimāna śreṣṭhāni abhiruhya ca api
translated: There, the bodhisattvas, dedicated to practice, will ascend to the best of palaces.

original: viharanta tatra anucintayanti viśuddhaśīlā sada sādhuvṛttayaḥ // / //
analyzed: viharanta tatra anucintayanti
translated: Dwelling there, they will contemplate, always of pure conduct, virtuous in their ways.

original: śrutvāna dharmaṃ dvipadottamasya anyāni kṣetrāṇyapi co sadā te /
analyzed: dharmam dvipada uttamasya anyāni kṣetrāṇi api sadā te
translated: Having heard the Dharma from the Best of Two-Legged Beings, they will always go to other realms.

original: vrajanti te buddhasahasravandakāḥ pūjāṃ ca teṣāṃ vipulāṃ karonti // / //
analyzed: vrajanti te buddha sahasra vandakāḥ pūjām ca teṣām vipulām karonti
translated: They will go to pay homage to thousands of Buddhas and make vast offerings to them.

original: kṣeṇena te cāpi tadāsya kṣetraṃ pratyāgamiṣyanti vināyakasya /
analyzed: kṣeṇena te ca api tadā asya kṣetram pratyāgamiṣyanti vināyakasya
translated: In a short time, they will return to that realm of the Obstructer,

original: prabhāsanāmasya narottamasya caryābalaṃ tādṛśakaṃ bhaviṣyati // / //
analyzed: prabhāsa nāmasya nara uttamasya caryā balam tādṛśakam bhaviṣyati
translated: The supreme human named Prabhāsa, his power of practice will be like that.

original: ṣaṣṭiḥ sahasrā paripūrṇakalpānāyuṣpramāṇaṃ sugatasya tasya /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭiḥ sahasrā paripūrṇa kalpān āyuṣpramāṇam sugatasya tasya
translated: The lifespan of that Sugata will be a full sixty thousand eons,

original: tataśca bhūyo dviguṇena tāyinaḥ parinirvṛtasyeha sa dharma sthāsyati // / //
analyzed: tatas ca bhūyas dviguṇena tāyinaḥ parinirvṛtasya iha sa dharma sthāsyati
translated: And after the Protector's parinirvāṇa, his Dharma will remain here for twice that long.

original: pratirūpakaścāsya bhaviṣyate punastriguṇaṃ tato ettakameva kālam /
analyzed: pratirūpakaḥ ca asya bhaviṣyate punar triguṇam kālam
translated: And his semblance Dharma will last for another three times that, the same amount of time.

original: saddharmabhraṣṭe tada tasya tāyino dukhitā bhaviṣyanti narā marū ca // / //
analyzed: saddharma bhraṣṭe tada tasya tāyinaḥ dukhitāḥ bhaviṣyanti narāḥ marū ca
translated: When the Protector's true Dharma has disappeared, humans and gods will be miserable.

original: jināna teṣāṃ samanāmakānāṃ samantaprabhāṇāṃ puruṣottamānām /
analyzed: teṣām sama nāmakānām samanta prabhāṇām puruṣa uttamānām
translated: Of those Jinas who have the same name, Samantaprabhas, supreme among men,

original: paripūrṇa pañcāśata nāyakānāṃ ete bhaviṣyanti paraṃparāya // / //
analyzed: paripūrṇa pañcāśata nāyakānām ete bhaviṣyanti paraṃparāya
translated: There will be five hundred leaders in succession.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vaidya

original: sarveṣa etādṛśakāśca vyūhā ṛddhibalaṃ ca tatha buddhakṣetram /
analyzed: sarveṣaḥ etādṛśakāḥ ca vyūhāḥ ṛddhi balam ca buddhakṣetram
translated: All of them will have such arrays, miraculous powers, and Buddha-fields,

original: gaṇaśca saddharma tathaiva īdṛśaḥ saddharmasthānaṃ ca samaṃ bhaviṣyati // / //
analyzed: gaṇaḥ ca saddharma tathā eva īdṛśaḥ saddharma sthānam ca samam bhaviṣyati
translated: And the Saṅgha and the true Dharma will be the same, and the abode of the true Dharma will be equal.

original: sarveṣametādṛśakaṃ bhaviṣyati nāmaṃ tadā loki sadevakasmin /
analyzed: sarveṣam etādṛśakam bhaviṣyati nāmam tadā loki sa devakasmin
translated: All of them will be like this, and that name will be in the world together with the gods,

original: yathā mayā pūrvi prakīrtitāsīt samantaprabhāsasya narottamasya // / //
analyzed: yathā mayā pūrvi prakīrtitā āsīt samantaprabhāsasya nara uttamasya
translated: Just as it was proclaimed by me before for Samantaprabhāsa, the highest of men.

original: paraṃparā eva tathānyamanyaṃ te vyākariṣyanti hitānukampī /
analyzed: paraṃparā eva tathā anyam anyam te vyākariṣyanti hita anukampī
translated: In the same way, one after another, they will prophesy to each other, those who are compassionate and benevolent.

original: anantarāyaṃ mama adya bheṣyati yathaiva śāsāmyahu sarvalokam // / //
analyzed: anantarāyam mama adya yathā eva sarva lokam
translated: Today, without delay, it will be as I rule over the whole world.

original: evaṃ khu ete tvamihādya kāśyapa dhārehi pañcāśatanūnakāni /
analyzed: evam khu ete tvam iha adya kāśyapa dhārehi pañcāśat anūnakāni
translated: Thus, indeed, you should uphold here today, Kāśyapa, the five hundred immediate ones,

original: vaśibhūta ye cāpi mamānyaśrāvakāḥ kathayāhi cānyeṣvapi śrāvakeṣu // / //
analyzed: vaśi bhūta ye ca api mama anya śrāvakāḥ kathayāhi ca anyeṣu api śrāvakeṣu
translated: And the other disciples of mine who have attained mastery. Speak also to the other disciples.

original: atha khalu tāni pañcārhacchatāni bhagavataḥ saṃmukhamātmano vyākaraṇāni śrutvā tuṣṭā udagrā āttamanasa pramuditāḥ prītisaumanasyajātā yena
analyzed: atha khalu tāni pañca arhat śatāni bhagavataḥ saṃmukham ātmanaḥ vyākaraṇāni śrutvā tuṣṭāḥ udagrāḥ ātta manasaḥ pramuditāḥ prīti saumanasya jātāḥ yena
translated: Then those five hundred arhats, having heard their own prophecies directly from the Blessed One, were satisfied, elated, delighted, joyful, and blissful. They went to the city of Rājagṛha,

original: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādayoḥ śirobhirnipatya evamāhuḥ atyayaṃ vayaṃ bhagavan deśayāmo yairasmābhirbhagavannevaṃ satatasamitaṃ cittaṃ paribhāvitam
analyzed: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādayoḥ śirobhiḥ nipatya evam āhuḥ atyayam vayam bhagavan deśayāmaḥ yaiḥ asmābhiḥ bhagavan evam satata samitam cittam paribhāvitam  /
translated: Having approached, they bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One and said this: Blessed One, we confess our mistake, in that we, Blessed One, have always and continuously cultivated such a thought,

original: idamasmākaṃ parinirvāṇam /
analyzed: idam asmākam parinirvāṇam
translated: thinking 'This is our nirvāṇa.'

original: parinirvṛtā vayamiti /
analyzed: parinirvṛtāḥ vayam iti
translated: We have attained nirvāṇa.

original: yathāpīdaṃ bhagavan avyaktā akuśalā avidhijñāḥ /
analyzed: yathā api idam bhagavan avyaktāḥ akuśalāḥ a vidhi jñāḥ
translated: Blessed One, we are indeed unmanifest, unskilled, and ignorant of the rules.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: yairnāma asmābhirbhagavaṃstathāgatajñāne 'bhisaṃboddhavye evaṃrūpeṇa parīttena jñānena paritoṣaṃ gatāḥ sma /
analyzed: yaiḥ nāma asmābhiḥ bhagavan tathāgata jñāne abhisaṃboddhavye evaṃrūpeṇa parīttena jñānena paritoṣam gatāḥ sma
translated: Blessed One, we have been satisfied with such a small amount of knowledge, thinking that we should awaken to the Tathāgata's knowledge in that way.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhagavan kasyacideva puruṣasya kaṃcideva mitragṛhaṃ praviṣṭasya mattasya
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhagavan kasyacid eva puruṣasya kaṃcid eva mitra gṛham praviṣṭasya mattasya
translated: Blessed One, it is as if some man, having entered the house of a friend,

original: vā suptasya vā sa mitro 'narghamaṇiratnaṃ vastrānte badhnīyāt asyedaṃ maṇiratnaṃ bhavatviti /
analyzed: vā suptasya vā sa mitraḥ na argha maṇi ratnam vastra ante badhnīyāt asya idam maṇi ratnam bhavatu iti
translated: while he is intoxicated or asleep, that friend would tie an inestimable priceless jewel to the waistband of his clothes, thinking 'This jewel is for him.'

original: atha khalu bhagavan sa puruṣa utthāyāsanāt prakāmet /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavan sa puruṣaḥ utthāya āsanāt prakāmet
translated: Then, Blessed One, that man would rise from his seat and depart.

original: so 'nyaṃ janapadapradeśaṃ prapadyeta /
analyzed: saḥ nyam janapada pradeśam prapadyeta
translated: He would go to another district.

original: sa tatra kṛcchraprāpto bhavet /
analyzed: sa tatra kṛcchra prāptaḥ bhavet
translated: There he would encounter hardship.

original: āhāracīvaraparyeṣṭihetoḥ kṛcchramāpadyeta /
analyzed: āhāra cīvara paryeṣṭi hetoḥ kṛcchram āpadyeta
translated: For the sake of seeking food and clothing, he would undergo hardship.

original: mahatā ca vyāyāmena kathaṃcit kaṃcidāhāraṃ pratilabheta /
analyzed: mahatā ca vyāyāmena kathaṃcid kaṃcid āhāram pratilabheta
translated: And with great effort, he would somehow obtain some food.

original: tena ca saṃtuṣṭo bhavedāttamanaskaḥ pramuditaḥ /
analyzed: tena ca saṃtuṣṭaḥ bhavet ātta manaskaḥ pramuditaḥ
translated: And he would be satisfied with that, his mind uplifted and joyful.

original: atha khalu bhagavaṃstasya puruṣasya sa purāṇamitraḥ puruṣo yena tasya tadanargheyaṃ maṇiratnaṃ vastrānte baddham /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavan tasya puruṣasya sa purāṇa mitraḥ puruṣaḥ yena tasya tat anargheyam maṇi ratnam vastra ante baddham
translated: Then, Blessed One, that man's old friend, the man who had tied that priceless jewel to the hem of his garment,

original: sa taṃ punareva paśyet /
analyzed: sa tam punar eva paśyet
translated: would see him again.

original: tamevaṃ vadet kiṃ tvaṃ bhoḥ puruṣa kṛcchramāpadyase āhāracīvaraparyeṣṭihetoḥ /
analyzed: tam evam vadet kim tvam bhoḥ puruṣa kṛcchram āpadyase āhāra cīvara paryeṣṭi hetoḥ
translated: He would say to him, 'Hey, man, why do you undergo hardship for the sake of seeking food and clothing?

original: yadā yāvad bhoḥ puruṣa mayā tava sukhavihārārthaṃ sarvakāmanivartakamanargheyaṃ maṇiratnaṃ vastrānte upanibaddham /
analyzed: yadā yāvat bhoḥ puruṣa mayā tava sukha vihāra artham sarva kāma nivartakam anargheyam maṇi ratnam vastra ante upanibaddham
translated: Hey, man, I tied that priceless jewel, which fulfills all desires, to the hem of your garment for the sake of your comfort.

original: niryātitaṃ te bhoḥ puruṣa mamaitanmaṇiratnam /
analyzed: niryātitam te bhoḥ puruṣa mama etat maṇi ratnam
translated: Hey, man, I give you this jewel.

original: tadevamupanibaddhameva bhoḥ puruṣa vastrānte maṇiratnam /
analyzed: tat evam upanibaddham eva bhoḥ puruṣa vastra ante maṇi ratnam
translated: Hey, man, that jewel is tied right there at the hem of your garment.

original: na ca nāma tvaṃ bhoḥ puruṣa pratyavekṣase kiṃ mama baddhaṃ yena vā baddhaṃ ko hetuḥ kiṃnidānaṃ vā Vaidya
analyzed: na ca nāma tvam bhoḥ puruṣa pratyavekṣase kim mama baddham yena vā baddham kaḥ hetuḥ kiṃnidānam vā vaidya
translated: But, hey, man, you don't examine what is tied to you, by whom it is tied, what is the cause, or what is the reason for it. You don't know it, don't see it, don't understand it, don't penetrate it, don't comprehend it, don't give it any thought, don't investigate it, don't reflect on it, don't ponder it, and don't meditate on it.

original: baddhametat /
analyzed: baddham etat
translated: This is bound.

original: bālajātīyastvaṃ bhoḥ puruṣa yastvaṃ kṛcchreṇa āhāracīvaraṃ paryeṣamāṇastuṣṭimāpadyase /
analyzed: bāla jātīyaḥ tvam bhoḥ puruṣa yaḥ tvam kṛcchreṇa āhāra cīvaram paryeṣamāṇaḥ tuṣṭim āpadyase
translated: You are like a child, sir, in that you are satisfied with seeking alms and robes with difficulty.

original: gaccha tvaṃ bhoḥ puruṣa etanmaṇiratnaṃ grahāya mahānagaraṃ gatvā parivartayastva /
analyzed: gaccha tvam bhoḥ puruṣa etat maṇi ratnam grahāya mahā nagaram gatvā parivartayaḥ tvam
translated: Go, sir, take this jewel and go to the great city and sell it.

original: tena ca dhanena sarvāṇi dhanakaraṇīyāni kuruṣveti //
analyzed: tena ca dhanena sarvāṇi dhana karaṇīyāni kuruṣva iti
translated: And with that wealth, do all your money-related tasks.

original: evameva bhagavan asmākamapi tathāgatena pūrvameva bodhisattvacaryāṃ caratā sarvajñatācittānyutpāditānyabhūvan /
analyzed: evam eva bhagavan asmākam api tathāgatena pūrvam eva bodhisattva caryām caratā sarvajña tā cittāni utpāditāni abhūvan
translated: In the same way, Blessed One, for us also, when the Tathāgata was previously practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva, he generated the mind of omniscience.

original: tāni ca vayaṃ bhagavan na jānīmo na budhyāmahe /
analyzed: tāni ca vayam bhagavat na jānīmaḥ na budhyāmahe
translated: But, Blessed One, we do not know those, we do not understand them.

original: te vayaṃ bhagavan arhadbhūmau nirvṛtāḥ sma iti saṃjānīmaḥ /
analyzed: te vayam bhagavan arhat bhūmau nirvṛtāḥ smaḥ iti saṃjānīmaḥ
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, we think, 'We have attained nirvāṇa in the state of an arhat.'

original: vayaṃ kṛcchraṃ jīvāmaḥ /
analyzed: vayam kṛcchram jīvāmaḥ
translated: We live in difficulty.

original: yadvayaṃ bhagavan evaṃ parīttena jñānena paritoṣamāpadyāmaḥ /
analyzed: yat vayam bhagavan evam parīttena jñānena paritoṣam āpadyāmaḥ
translated: Because, Blessed One, we are satisfied with such a small amount of knowledge.

original: sarvajñajñānapraṇidhānena sadā avinaṣṭena /
analyzed: sarvajña jñāna praṇidhānena sadā a vinaṣṭena
translated: With the vow for the knowledge of omniscience always undestroyed.

original: te vayaṃ bhagavaṃstathāgatena saṃbodhyamānāḥ mā yūyaṃ bhikṣava etannirvāṇaṃ manyadhvam /
analyzed: te vayam bhagavan tathāgatena saṃbodhyamānāḥ mā yūyam bhikṣavaḥ etat nirvāṇam manyadhvam
translated: But, Blessed One, when we are being fully awakened by the Tathāgata, he says, 'Monks, do not think this is nirvāṇa.

original: saṃvidyante bhikṣavo yuṣmākaṃ saṃtāne kuśalamūlāni yāni mayā pūrvaṃ paripācitāni /
analyzed: saṃvidyante bhikṣavaḥ yuṣmākam saṃtāne kuśala mūlāni yāni mayā pūrvam paripācitāni
translated: Bhikṣus, the roots of virtue that you have in your mindstreams have been ripened by me in the past.

original: etarhi ca mamaivedamupāyakauśalyaṃ dharmadeśanābhilāpena yad yūyametarhi nirvāṇamiti manyadhve /
analyzed: etarhi ca mama evā idam upāya kauśalyam dharma deśanā abhilāpena yat yūyam etarhi nirvāṇam iti manyadhve
translated: Now, this skillful means of mine is that you think now, 'This is nirvāṇa,' through the teaching and explanation of the Dharma.

original: evaṃ ca vayaṃ bhagavatā saṃbodhayitvā adyānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau vyākṛtāḥ //
analyzed: evam ca vayam bhagavatā saṃbodhayitvā adya anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau vyākṛtāḥ
translated: Thus, having awakened us in this way, the Blessed One has now prophesied our unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: atha khalu tāni pañca vaśībhūtaśatānyājñātakauṇḍinyapramukhāni tasyāṃ velāyamimā gāthā abhāṣanta
analyzed: atha khalu tāni pañca vaśībhūta śatāni ājñātakauṇḍinya pramukhāni tasyām velāyam imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣanta
translated: Then, at that time, those five hundred who had attained mastery, headed by Ājñāta Kauṇḍinya, spoke these verses:

original: hṛṣṭā prahṛṣṭā sma śruṇitva etāṃ āśvāsanāmīdṛśikāmanuttarām /
analyzed: hṛṣṭā prahṛṣṭā sma śruṇitvā etām āśvāsanām īdṛśikām anuttarām
translated: Delighted and overjoyed, we have heard this kind of unsurpassed consolation,

original: yaṃ vyākṛtāḥ sma paramāgrabodhaye namo 'stu te nāyaka nantacakṣuḥ // / //
analyzed: yam vyākṛtāḥ sma parama agra bodhaye namaḥ stu te nāyaka nanta cakṣuḥ
translated: That we have been prophesied for the supreme, highest enlightenment. Homage to you, Guide with infinite vision!

original: deśemahe atyayu tubhyamantike yathaiva bālā avidū ajānakāḥ /
analyzed: deśemahe tubhyam antike yathā eva bālāḥ a vidū a jānakāḥ
translated: We confess in your presence that we were like foolish, ignorant, unknowing ones,

original: yaṃ vai vayaṃ nirvṛtimātrakeṇa parituṣṭa āsīt sugatasya śāsane // / //
analyzed: yam vai vayam nirvṛti mātrakeṇa parituṣṭaḥ āsīt sugatasya śāsane
translated: Who were satisfied with mere nirvāṇa in the Sugata's teaching.

original: yathāpi puruṣo bhavi kaścideva praviṣṭa sa syādiha mitraśālam /
analyzed: yathā api puruṣaḥ kaścid eva sa syāt iha mitra śālam
translated: It is as if there were a certain man who had entered here a friend's house,

original: mitraṃ ca tasya dhanavantamāḍhyaṃ so tasya dadyād bahū khādyabhojyam // / //🔽saṃtarpayitvāna ca bhojanena anekamūlyaṃ ratanaṃ ca dadyāt /
analyzed: mitram ca tasya dhanavantam āḍhyam saḥ tasya dadyāt khādya bhojyam  ca bhojanena aneka mūlyam ratanam ca dadyāt
translated: And he would give him much food and drink,🔽Having satisfied him with food, he would give him a jewel of great value.

original: baddhvāntarīye vasanānti granthiṃ datvā ca tasyeha bhaveta tuṣṭaḥ // / //
analyzed: baddhvā antarīye vasana anti granthim da tvā ca tasya iha bhaveta tuṣṭaḥ
translated: He would tie it in the corner of his garment and give it to him, being pleased here.

original: so cāpi prakrāntu bhaveta bālo utthāya so 'nyaṃ nagaraṃ vrajeta /
analyzed: saḥ ca api bhaveta bālaḥ utthāya saḥ nagaram vrajeta
translated: And that foolish one would depart, and having risen, he would go to another city.

original: so kṛcchraprāptaḥ kṛpaṇo gaveṣī āhāra paryeṣati khidyamānaḥ // / //
analyzed: saḥ kṛcchra prāptaḥ kṛpaṇaḥ gaveṣī āhāra paryeṣati khidyamānaḥ
translated: He, having come to hardship, miserable, searching, would seek food, being afflicted.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Physician

original: paryeṣitaḥ bhojananirvṛtaḥ syād bhaktaṃ udāraṃ avicintayantaḥ /
analyzed: paryeṣitaḥ bhojana nirvṛtaḥ syāt bhaktam udāram a vicintayantaḥ
translated: Having sought, he would be satisfied with food, not thinking of the excellent meal.

original: taṃ cāpi ratnaṃ hi bhaveta vismṛtaṃ baddhvāntarīye smṛtirasya nāsti // / //🔽tameva so paśyati pūrvamitro yenāsya dattaṃ ratanaṃ gṛhe sve /
analyzed: tam ca api ratnam hi bhaveta vismṛtam baddhvā antarīye smṛtiḥ asya nā asti  tam eva saḥ paśyati pūrva mitraḥ yena asya dattam ratanam gṛhe sve
translated: And that jewel would be forgotten by him, he would not remember it in the corner of his garment.🔽That very same friend would see him, by whom that jewel was given to him in his own house.

original: tameva suṣṭhū paribhāṣayitvā darśeti ratnaṃ vasanāntarasmin // / //
analyzed: tam eva suṣṭhū paribhāṣayitvā darśa iti ratnam vasana antarasmin
translated: Having scolded him well, he would show him the jewel in the corner of his garment.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca so paramasukhaiḥ samarpito ratnasya tasyo anubhāva īdṛśaḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca saḥ parama sukhaiḥ samarpitaḥ ratnasya anubhāvaḥ īdṛśaḥ
translated: And he, having seen it, would be filled with the highest bliss, such is the power of that jewel.

original: mahādhanī kośabalī ca so bhavet samarpitaḥ kāmaguṇehi pañcahi // / //
analyzed: mahādhanī kośa balī ca saḥ bhavet samarpitaḥ kāma guṇehi
translated: He becomes very wealthy, with a full treasury, and endowed with the five sense pleasures.

original: emeva bhagavan vayamevarūpam ajānamānā praṇidhānapūrvakam /
analyzed: emā iva bhagavan vayam eva rūpam a jānamānā praṇidhāna pūrvakam
translated: In the same way, Blessed One, we, not knowing this kind of thing, made a vow.

original: tathāgatenaiva idaṃ hi dattaṃ bhaveṣu pūrveṣviha dīrgharātram // / //
analyzed: tathāgatena eva idam hi dattam bhaveṣu pūrveṣu iha dīrgharātram
translated: It was given by the Tathāgata himself in our previous existences over a long time.

original: vayaṃ ca bhagavanniha bālabuddhayo ajānakāḥ smo sugatasya śāsane /
analyzed: vayam ca bhagavan iha bāla buddhayaḥ ajānakāḥ smaḥ sugatasya śāsane
translated: And we, Blessed One, are foolish here, ignorant of the Sugata's teaching.

original: nirvāṇamātreṇa vayaṃ hi tuṣṭā na uttarī prārthayi nāpi cintayī // / //
analyzed: nirvāṇa mātreṇa vayam hi tuṣṭāḥ naḥ
translated: We were content with mere nirvāṇa, and did not aspire to or think of anything higher.

original: vayaṃ ca saṃbodhita lokabandhunā na eṣa etādṛśa kāci nirvṛtiḥ /
analyzed: vayam ca nirvṛtiḥ
translated: But we have been enlightened by the kinsman of the world: This is not such a nirvāṇa at all.

original: jñānaṃ praṇītaṃ puruṣottamānāṃ yā nirvṛtīyaṃ paramaṃ ca saukhyam // / //
analyzed: jñānam praṇītam puruṣa uttamānām yā nirvṛtīyam paramam ca saukhyam
translated: The knowledge of the Supreme Beings, which is nirvāṇa and the highest bliss,

original: idaṃ cudāraṃ vipulaṃ bahūvidhaṃ anuttaraṃ vyākaraṇaṃ ca śrutvā /
analyzed: idam cudāram vipulam bahūvidham anuttaram vyākaraṇam ca śrutvā
translated: Having heard this vast, extensive, manifold, unsurpassed prophecy,

original: prītā udagrā vipulā sma jātāḥ parasparaṃ vyākaraṇāya nātha // / //
analyzed: prītāḥ udagrāḥ vipulā sma jātāḥ parasparam vyākaraṇāya nātha
translated: we have become delighted, elated, and full of joy, and we are looking to each other for the prophecy, O Lord.

original: ityāryasaddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye pañcabhikṣuśatavyākaraṇaparivarto nāmāṣṭamaḥ //
analyzed: iti ārya saddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye pañcabhikṣuśatavyākaraṇaparivartaḥ nāma aṣṭamaḥ
translated: Thus ends the eighth chapter named The Prophecy to the Five Hundred Bhikṣus in the noble Mahāyāna sūtra The White Lotus of the True Dharma.🔽Vidy

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: ānandādivyākaraṇaparivartaḥ /
analyzed: ānanda ādi vyākaraṇa parivartaḥ
translated: The Chapter on the Prophecy of Ānanda and Others.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmānānandastasyāṃ velāyāmevaṃ cintayāmāsa apyeva nāma vayamevaṃrūpaṃ vyākaraṇaṃ pratilabhemahi /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān ānandaḥ tasyām velāyām evam cintayāmāsa api eva nāma vayam evaṃrūpam vyākaraṇam pratilabhemahi
translated: Then at that time the Venerable Ānanda thought like this: May we also obtain such a prophecy.

original: evaṃ ca cintayitvā anuvicintya prārthayitvā utthāyāsanād bhagavataḥ pādayornipatya /
analyzed: evam ca cintayitvā anuvicintya prārthayitvā utthāya āsanāt bhagavataḥ pādayoḥ nipatya
translated: Having thought like this, having reflected, having prayed, he rose from his seat, bowed at the feet of the Blessed One,

original: āyuṣmāṃśca rāhulo 'pyevaṃ cintayitvā anuvicintya prārthayitvā bhagavataḥ pādayornipatya evaṃ vācamabhāṣata asmākamapi tāvad bhagavan avasaro
analyzed: āyuṣmān ca rāhulaḥ pi evam cintayitvā anuvicintya prārthayitvā bhagavataḥ pādayoḥ nipatya evam vācam abhāṣata asmākam api tāvat bhagavan avasaraḥ
translated: and the Venerable Rāhula, having thought like this, having reflected, having prayed, bowed at the feet of the Blessed One, and said these words: May we also, Blessed One,

original: bhavatu /
analyzed: bhavatu
translated: have an opportunity.

original: asmākamapi tāvat sugata avasaro bhavatu /
analyzed: asmākam api tāvat sugata avasaraḥ bhavatu
translated: May we also, Well-Gone One, have an opportunity.

original: asmākaṃ hi bhagavān pitā janako layanaṃ trāṇaṃ ca /
analyzed: asmākam hi bhagavān pitā janakaḥ layanam trāṇam ca
translated: For the Blessed One is our father, our progenitor, our refuge, our protection.

original: vayaṃ hi bhagavan sadevamānuṣāsure loke 'tīva citrīkṛtāḥ bhagavataścaite putraḥ bhagavataścopasthāyakāḥ bhagavataśca dharmakośaṃ dhārayantīti
analyzed: vayam hi bhagavan sa deva mānuṣa asure loke tīva citrīkṛtāḥ bhagavataḥ ca ete putraḥ bhagavataḥ ca upasthāyakāḥ bhagavataḥ ca dharma kośam dhārayanti iti
translated: For we, Blessed One, are greatly admired in the world with its gods, humans, and asuras: 'They are the sons of the Blessed One, the attendants of the Blessed One, who uphold the Blessed One's basket of teachings.'

original: tannāma bhagavan kṣiprameva pratirūpaṃ bhaved yad bhagavānasmākaṃ vyākuryādanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau //
analyzed: tat nāma bhagavan kṣipram eva pratirūpam bhavet yat bhagavān asmākam vyākuryāt anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, it would be fitting if the Blessed One were to prophesy our unsurpassed perfect awakening.

original: anye ca dve bhikṣusahasre sātireke śaikṣāśaikṣāṇāṃ śrāvakāṇāmutthāyāsanebhya ekāṃsamuttarāsaṅgaṃ
analyzed: anye ca dve bhikṣu sahasre sa atireke śaikṣa aśaikṣāṇām śrāvakāṇām utthāya āsanebhyaḥ eka aṃsam uttarāsaṅgam
translated: And two thousand more monks, both those in training and those who had passed beyond training, rose from their seats,🔽put their upper robes over one shoulder,

original: kṛtvā añjaliṃ pragṛhya bhagavato 'bhimukhaṃ bhagavantamullokayamāne tasthatuḥ etāmeva🔽cintāmanuvicintayamāne yaduta idameva buddhajñānam apyeva nāma vayamapi vyākaraṇaṃ
analyzed: kṛtvā añjalim pragṛhya bhagavataḥ bhimukham bhagavantam ullokayamāne tasthatuḥ etām eva  cintām anuvicintayamāne yat uta idam eva buddha jñānam api eva nāma vayam api vyākaraṇam
translated: and stood with palms joined, gazing at the Blessed One.🔽They were contemplating this very thought: May we also obtain the prophecy

original: pratilabhemahi anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhāviti //
analyzed: pratilabhemahi anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau iti
translated: of unsurpassed perfect awakening, this very buddha-knowledge.

original: atha khalu bhagavānāyuṣmantamānandamāmantrayate sma bhaviṣyasi tvamānanda anāgate
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam āmantrayate sma  bhaviṣyasi tvam ānanda anāgate
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the venerable Ānanda: You will become, Ānanda, in the future

original: 'dhvani sāgaravaradharabuddhivikrīḍitābhijño nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho
analyzed: dhvani sāgaravaradharabuddhivikrīḍitābhijñaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One, named SāgaravaradharaBuddhivikrīḍitābhijña,

original: vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devānāṃ ca
analyzed: vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā devānām ca
translated: perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed guide for those to be trained, a teacher of gods and humans,

original: manuṣyāṇāṃ ca buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: manuṣyāṇām ca buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: a Buddha, a Blessed One.

original: dvāṣaṣṭīnāṃ buddhakoṭīnāṃ satkāraṃ kṛtvā /
analyzed: dvāṣaṣṭīnām buddha koṭīnām satkāram kṛtvā
translated: You have made offerings to sixty-two koṭis of buddhas,

original: gurukāraṃ mānanāṃ pūjanāṃ ca kṛtvā /
analyzed: gurukāram mānanām pūjanām ca kṛtvā
translated: and have shown respect, reverence, and worship to them.

original: teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ saddharmaṃ dhārayitvā /
analyzed: teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām saddharmam dhārayitvā
translated: You have upheld the true Dharma of those buddhas, the blessed ones,

original: śāsanaparigrahaṃ ca kṛtvā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyasi /🔽sa tvamānanda anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhiṃ saṃbuddhaḥ samāno viṃśatigaṅgānadīvālukāsamāni bodhisattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi paripācayiṣyasyanuttarāyāṃ
analyzed: śāsana parigraham ca kṛtvā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyasi  sa tvam ānanda anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim saṃbuddhaḥ samānaḥ viṃśati gaṅgā nadī vālukā samāni bodhisattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi paripācayiṣyasi anuttarāyām
translated: and have taken up the teaching. You will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.🔽Ānanda, when you have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, you will ripen for unsurpassed, perfect

original: samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: enlightenment one hundred thousand koṭis of nayutas of bodhisattvas equal to the sands of twenty Ganges Rivers.

original: samṛddhaṃ ca te buddhakṣetraṃ bhaviṣyati vaiḍūryamayaṃ ca /
analyzed: samṛddham ca te buddhakṣetram bhaviṣyati vaiḍūrya mayam ca
translated: Your buddha-field will be prosperous and made of beryl.

original: anavanāmitavaijayantī ca nāma sā lokadhāturbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: anavanāmitavaijayantī ca nāma sā lokadhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: That world system will be named Ananāmitavaijayantī.

original: manojñaśabdābhigarjitaśca nāma sa kalpo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: manojñaśabdābhigarjitaḥ ca nāma sa kalpaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: That eon will be named Manoṣṇāśabdagarjit.

original: aparimitāṃśca kalpāṃstasya bhagavataḥ sāgaravaradharabuddhivikrīḍitābhijñasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya āyuṣpramāṇaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: aparimitān ca kalpān tasya bhagavataḥ sāgaravaradharabuddhivikrīḍitābhijñasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya āyuṣpramāṇam bhaviṣyati
translated: The lifespan of that blessed one, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Sāgaravaradhara-buddhivikrīḍitābhijña, will be immeasurable eons.

original: yeṣāṃ kalpānāṃ na śakyaṃ gaṇanayā paryanto 'dhigantum /🔽tāvadasaṃkhyeyāni tāni kalpakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi tasya bhagavata āyuṣpramāṇaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yeṣām kalpānām na śakyam gaṇanayā paryantaḥ dhigantum  tāvat asaṃkhyeyāni tāni kalpa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi tasya bhagavataḥ āyuṣpramāṇam bhaviṣyati
translated: The lifespan of that Bhagavān will be for as many countless eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River.

original: yāvacca ānanda tasya bhagavataḥ sāgaravaradharabuddhivikrīḍitābhijñasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasyāyuṣpramāṇaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yāvat ca ānanda tasya bhagavataḥ sāgaravaradharabuddhivikrīḍitābhijñasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya āyuṣpramāṇam bhaviṣyati
translated: Ānanda, the lifespan of that Bhagavān, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha Sāgara­vara­dhara­buddhi­vikrīḍitābhijña will be for that many countless hundreds of thousands of quintillions of eons.

original: taddviguṇaṃ parinirvṛtasya saddharmaḥ sthāsyati /
analyzed: tad dviguṇam parinirvṛtasya saddharmaḥ sthāsyati
translated: And for twice that length of time, after the parinirvāṇa of that bhagavān, the true Dharma will remain.

original: yāvāṃstasya bhagavataḥ saddharmaḥ sthāsyati /
analyzed: yāvān tasya bhagavataḥ saddharmaḥ sthāsyati
translated: And for as long as the true Dharma of that bhagavān remains,

original: taddviguṇaḥ saddharmapratirūpakaṃ sthāsyati /
analyzed: tad dviguṇaḥ saddharma pratirūpakam sthāsyati
translated: for twice that length of time the imitation Dharma will remain.

original: tasya khalu punarānanda sāgaravaradharabuddhivikrīḍitābhijñasya tathāgatasya daśasu dikṣu bahūni gaṅgānadīvālukāsamāni buddhakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi
analyzed: tasya khalu punar ānanda sāgaravaradharabuddhivikrīḍitābhijñasya tathāgatasya daśasu dikṣu bahūni gaṅgā nadī vālukā samāni buddha koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi
translated: Ānanda, in the ten directions, many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of buddhas, as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges River,

original: varṇaṃ bhāṣiṣyanti //
analyzed: varṇam bhāṣiṣyanti
translated: will praise his qualities.”

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Bhagavān at that time spoke these verses:

original: ārocayāmi ahu bhikṣusaṃghe ānandabhadro mama dharmadhārakaḥ /
analyzed: ārocayāmi ahu bhikṣu saṃghe ānanda bhadraḥ mama dharma dhārakaḥ
translated: I declare to the assembly of monks that Ānanda, the good one, is my Dharma holder,

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: I declare to the assembly of monks that Ananda Bhadra, the upholder of my Dharma,🔽will become a Buddha in the future,

original: anāgate 'dhvāni jino bhaviṣyati pūjitva ṣaṣṭiṃ sugatāna koṭyaḥ // / //
analyzed: anāgate jinaḥ bhaviṣyati ṣaṣṭim sugatāna koṭyaḥ
translated: having worshipped sixty koṭis of Sugatas.

original: nāmena so sāgarabuddhidhārī abhijñaprāpto iti tatra viśrutaḥ /
analyzed: nāmena saḥ sāgarabuddhidhārī abhijñaprāptaḥ iti tatra viśrutaḥ
translated: His name will be Sāgara Buddhidhara, renowned as one who has attained the higher knowledges,

original: pariśuddhakṣetrasmi sudarśanīye anonatāyāṃ dhvajavaijayantyām // / //
analyzed: sudarśanīye an ūna tāyām dhvaja vaijayantyām
translated: in the delightful and perfectly pure land of Anontā, in the Dhvajavaijayantī world system.

original: tahi bodhisattvā yathā gaṅgavālikāstataśca bhūyo paripācayiṣyati /
analyzed: bodhisattvāḥ yathā gaṅga vālikāḥ tatas ca paripācayiṣyati
translated: There, he will further develop the Bodhisattvas as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River.

original: maharddhikaśco sa jino bhaviṣyati daśaddiśe lokavighuṣṭaśabdaḥ // / //
analyzed: maharddhikaḥ ca u sa jinaḥ bhaviṣyati daśat diśe loka vighuṣṭa śabdaḥ
translated: That Jina will possess great spiritual powers, and his fame will spread in the worlds of the ten directions.

original: amitaṃ ca tasyāyu tadā bhaviṣyati yaḥ sthāsyate lokahitānukampakaḥ /🔽parinirvṛtasyāpi jinasya tāyino dviguṇaṃ ca saddharmu sa tasya sthāsyati // / //
analyzed: amitam ca tasya āyuḥ tadā bhaviṣyati yaḥ sthāsyate loka hita anukampakaḥ  parinirvṛtasya api jinasya tāyinaḥ dviguṇam ca saddharmu sa tasya sthāsyati
translated: His lifespan will be immeasurable, as he will remain to benefit and have compassion for the world.🔽Even after the passing of that Jina, the Protector, his true Dharma will remain twice as long.

original: pratirūpakaṃ taddviguṇena bhūyaḥ saṃsthāsyate tasya jinasya śāsane /
analyzed: pratirūpakam tat dviguṇena bhūyas saṃsthāsyate tasya jinasya śāsane
translated: The semblance Dharma will remain twice as long as that.

original: tadāpi sattvā yathā gaṅgavālikā hetuṃ janeṣyantiha buddhabodhau // / //
analyzed: tadā api sattvāḥ yathā gaṅgavālikā hetum janeṣyanti iha buddha bodhau
translated: At that time, beings as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River will generate the cause for Buddhahood.

original: atha khalu tasyāṃ parṣadi navayānasaṃprasthitānāmaṣṭānāṃ bodhisattvasahasrāṇāmetadabhavat na bodhisattvānāmapi tāvadasmābhirevamudāraṃ vyākaraṇaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu tasyām parṣadi nava yāna saṃprasthitānām aṣṭānām bodhisattva sahasrāṇām etat abhavat na bodhisattvānām api tāvat asmābhiḥ evam udāram vyākaraṇam
translated: Then, in that assembly, eight thousand bodhisattvas who had newly set out in the vehicle had this thought: Even for bodhisattvas, such an extensive prophecy

original: kaḥ punarvādaḥ śrāvakāṇām /🔽kaḥ khalvatra heturbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ śrāvakāṇām  kaḥ khalu atra hetuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: is not given, let alone for śrāvakas.🔽What could be the reason here?

original: kaḥ pratyaya iti /
analyzed: kaḥ pratyayaḥ iti
translated: What could be the condition?

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃsteṣāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ cetasaiva cetaḥ parivitarkamājñāya tān bodhisattvānāmantrayāmāsa
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān teṣām bodhisattvānām cetasā eva cetaḥ parivitarkam ājñāya tān bodhisattvān āmantrayāmāsa
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing with his mind the thoughts occurring to those bodhisattvas, addressed those bodhisattvas, saying:

original: samamasmābhiḥ kulaputrā ekakṣaṇe ekamuhūrte mayā ca ānandena ca anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau
analyzed: samam asmābhiḥ kula putrāḥ eka kṣaṇe eka muhūrte mayā ca ānandena ca anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Sons of noble family, at the same time, at the same moment, Ānanda and I

original: cittamutpāditaṃ dharmagaganābhyudgatarājasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya saṃmukham /
analyzed: cittam utpāditam dharmagaganābhyudgatarājasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya saṃmukham
translated: generated the mind of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment in the presence of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Dharma-Gagana-Abhyudgata-Rāja.

original: tatraiṣa kulaputrā bāhuśrutye ca satatasamitamabhiyukto 'bhūt /
analyzed: tatra eṣa kula putrāḥ bāhuśrutye ca satata samitam abhiyuktaḥ bhūt
translated: There, son of noble family, he was always and constantly devoted to great learning,

original: ahaṃ ca vīryārambhe 'bhiyuktaḥ /
analyzed: aham ca vīrya ārambhe bhiyuktaḥ
translated: while I was devoted to the exertion of vigor.

original: tena mayā kṣiprataramanuttarā samyaksaṃbodhirabhisaṃbuddhā /
analyzed: tena mayā kṣiprataram anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ abhisaṃbuddhā
translated: Therefore, I attained unexcelled, perfect enlightenment more quickly.

original: ayaṃ punarānandabhadro buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ saddharmakośadhara eva bhavati sma yaduta bodhisattvānāṃ pariniṣpattihetoḥ praṇidhānametatkulaputrā
analyzed: ayam punar ānanda bhadraḥ buddhānām bhagavatām saddharma kośa dharaḥ eva bhavati sma yat uta bodhisattvānām pariniṣpatti hetoḥ praṇidhānam etat kula putrā  /
translated: And this Ananda Bhadra is indeed the keeper of the treasury of the true Dharma of the Blessed Buddhas, namely for the sake of perfecting the bodhisattvas. This is his vow, O sons of good family,

original: asya kulaputrasyeti //
analyzed: asya kula putrasya iti
translated: of this son of good family.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmānānando bhagavato 'ntikādātmano vyākaraṇaṃ śrutvā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ ntikāt ātmanaḥ vyākaraṇam śrutvā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Then the venerable Ananda, having heard from the Blessed One the prediction of himself regarding supreme perfect enlightenment,

original: ātmanaśca buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhān śrutvā /
analyzed: ātmanaḥ ca buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhān śrutvā
translated: and having heard of the array of qualities in his own Buddha-field,

original: pūrvapraṇidhānacaryāṃ ca śrutvā /
analyzed: pūrva praṇidhāna caryām ca śrutvā
translated: and having heard of his former vow and conduct,

original: tuṣṭa udagra āttamanaskaḥ pramuditaḥ prītisaumanasyajāto 'bhūt /
analyzed: tuṣṭaḥ udagraḥ ātta manaskaḥ pramuditaḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ bhūt
translated: was satisfied, elated, delighted, joyful, and happy.

original: tasmiṃśca samaye bahūnāṃ buddhakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇāṃ saddharmamanusmarati sma /
analyzed: tasmin ca samaye bahūnām buddha koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇām saddharmam anusmarati sma
translated: And at that time he remembered the true Dharma of many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of kotis of Buddhas,

original: ātmanaśca purvapraṇidhānam //
analyzed: ātmanaḥ ca purva praṇidhānam
translated: and his own former vow.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: atha khalvāyuṣmānānandastasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān ānandaḥ tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the venerable Ananda, at that time, spoke these verses:

original: āścaryabhūtā jina aprameyā ye smārayanti mama dharmadeśanām /
analyzed: āścarya bhūtāḥ jina aprameyāḥ ye smārayanti mama dharma deśanām
translated: The Jinas, who are of wondrous nature and immeasurable, remind me of the teaching of the Dharma.

original: parinirvṛtānāṃ hi jināna tāyināṃ samanusmarāmī yatha adya śvo vā // / //
analyzed: parinirvṛtānām hi tāyinām samanusmarāmi adya śvas vā
translated: I remember the parinirvāṇa of the victorious protectors as if it were today or yesterday.

original: niṣkāṅkṣaprāpto 'smi sthito 'smi bodhaye upāyakauśalya mamedamīddaśam /
analyzed: niṣkāṅkṣa prāptaḥ smi sthitaḥ smi bodhaye upāya kauśalya mama idam īddaśam
translated: I have attained certainty and am established in enlightenment. This is the extent of my skill in means.

original: paricārako 'haṃ sugatasya bhomi saddharma dhāremi ca bodhikāraṇāt // / //
analyzed: paricārakaḥ ham sugatasya bhomi saddharma dhāremi ca bodhi kāraṇāt
translated: I serve the Sugata and uphold the true Dharma for the sake of enlightenment.

original: atha khalu bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ rāhulabhadramāmantrayate sma bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ rāhulabhadra
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmantam rāhulabhadram āmantrayate sma  bhaviṣyasi tvam rāhulabhadra
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the venerable Rāhula: Rāhulabhadra, you will become

original: anāgate 'dhvani saptaratnapadmavikrāntagāmī nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho🔽vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devānāṃ ca
analyzed: anāgate dhvani saptaratnapadmavikrāntagāmī nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ  vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā devānām ca
translated: in the future the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One named Sapta-ratna-padma-vikrānta-gāmin,

original: manuṣyāṇāṃ ca buddho bhagavān daśalokadhātuparamāṇurajaḥsamāṃstathāgatānarhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān
analyzed: manuṣyāṇām ca buddhaḥ bhagavān daśa lokadhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ samān tathāgatān arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān
translated: perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed guide for those to be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed One, equal to the atoms in ten world systems, of Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones,

original: satkṛtya gurukṛtya mānayitvā pūjayitvā arcayitvā /
analyzed: satkṛtya gurukṛtya mānayitvā pūjayitvā arcayitvā
translated: having honored, revered, respected, and worshipped them,

original: sadā teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ jyeṣṭhaputro bhaviṣyasi tadyathāpi nāma mamaitarhi /
analyzed: sadā teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām jyeṣṭha putraḥ bhaviṣyasi tat yathā api nāma mama etarhi
translated: you will be the eldest son of those Buddhas, just as you are now for me.

original: tasya khalu punā rāhulabhadra bhagavataḥ saptaratnapadmavikrāntagāminastathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya evaṃrūpamevāyuṣpramāṇaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tasya khalu punar rāhulabhadra bhagavataḥ saptaratnapadmavikrāntagāminaḥ tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya evaṃrūpam eva āyuṣpramāṇam bhaviṣyati
translated: And, Rāhulabhadra, the lifespan of that Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, Saptaratnapadmavikrāntagāmin, will be just like this.

original: evaṃ rūpaiva sarvākāraguṇasaṃpad bhaviṣyati tadyathāpi nāma tasya bhagavataḥ sāgaravaradharabuddhivikrīḍitābhijñasya
analyzed: evam rūpā eva sarva ākāra guṇa saṃpad bhaviṣyati tat yathā api nāma tasya bhagavataḥ sāgara vara dhara buddhi vikrīḍita abhijñasya
translated: He will have just such a complete set of all good qualities, just as the Blessed One SāgaravaradharaBuddhivikrīḍitābhijña

original: tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya sarvākāraguṇopetā buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya sarva ākāra guṇa upetāḥ buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: has all good qualities complete in every way, and the adornments of the qualities of the Buddha-field will be just like that.

original: tasyāpi rāhula sāgaravaradharabuddhivikrīḍitābhijñasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya tvameva jyeṣṭhaputro bhaviṣyasi /
analyzed: tasya api rāhula sāgaravaradharabuddhivikrīḍitābhijñasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya tvam eva jyeṣṭha putraḥ bhaviṣyasi
translated: And, Rāhula, you will be the eldest son of that Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, SāgaravaradharaBuddhivikrīḍitābhijña.

original: tataḥ paścāt pareṇānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyasīti //
analyzed: tatas paścāt pareṇa anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyasi iti
translated: After that, you will fully awaken to highest genuine full Awakening.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses on that occasion:

original: ayaṃ mamā rāhula jyeṣṭhaputro yo auraso āsi kumārabhāve /
analyzed: ayam mama ā rāhula jyeṣṭha putraḥ yaḥ aurasaḥ āsi kumāra bhāve
translated: This Rāhula is my eldest son, born to me in my youth.

original: bodhiṃ pi prāptasya mamaiṣa putro dharmasya dāyādyadharo maharṣiḥ // / //
analyzed: bodhim pi prāptasya mama eṣa putraḥ dharmasya dāyādya dharaḥ mahā ṛṣiḥ
translated: And when I attain enlightenment, this son of mine will be a great sage, the heir to the Dharma.

original: anāgate 'dhve bahubuddhakoṭyo yān drakṣyase yeṣa pramāṇu nāsti /
analyzed: anāgate bahu buddha koṭyaḥ yān drakṣyase na asti
translated: In the future, there will be many millions of Buddhas, whose number is unknown,

original: sarveṣa teṣāṃ hi jināna putro bhaviṣyatī bodhi gaveṣamāṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: teṣām hi jināna putraḥ bodhi gaveṣamāṇaḥ
translated: And he will be the son of all those Jinas, seeking enlightenment.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vaidya

original: ajñātacaryā iya rāhulasya praṇidhānametasya ahaṃ prajānami /
analyzed: ajñāta caryā rāhulasya praṇidhānam etasya aham
translated: This is Rahula's unknown practice, and I know his vow.

original: karoti saṃvarṇana lokabandhuṣu ahaṃ kilā putra tathāgatasya // / //
analyzed: karoti saṃvarṇana loka bandhuṣu aham kila putra tathāgatasya
translated: I am indeed the son of the Tathagata, he says, praising the Kinsman of the Sun.

original: guṇāna koṭīnayutāprameyāḥ pramāṇu yeṣāṃ na kadācidasti /
analyzed: guṇāna yeṣām na kadācid asti
translated: His immeasurable merits are in the many millions, and they are never measured.

original: ye rāhulasyeha mamaurasatya tathā hi eṣo sthitu bodhikāraṇāt // / //
analyzed: ye rāhulasya iha mama aurasatya tathā hi bodhi kāraṇāt
translated: This Rahula is my true son, for he stands thus for the sake of enlightenment.

original: adrākṣītkhalu punarbhagavāṃste dve śrāvakasahasre śaikṣāśaikṣāṇāṃ śrāvakāṇāṃ bhagavantamavalokayamāne abhimukhaṃ prasannacitte mṛducitte mārdavacitte
analyzed: adrākṣīt khalu punar bhagavān te dve śrāvaka sahasre śaikṣa aśaikṣāṇām śrāvakāṇām bhagavantam avalokayamāne abhimukham prasanna citte mṛdu citte mārdava citte
translated: The Blessed One saw those two thousand disciples, the learners and the adepts, looking at the Blessed One with serene minds, gentle minds, and tender minds.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmāyuṣmantamānandamāmantrayate sma paśyasi tvamānanda ete dve śrāvakasahasre śaikṣāśaikṣāṇāṃ śrāvakāṇām /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām āyuṣmantam ānandam āmantrayate sma paśyasi tvam ānanda ete dve śrāvaka sahasre śaikṣa aśaikṣāṇām śrāvakāṇām
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the Venerable Ānanda at that time: Ānanda, do you see these two thousand disciples, the learners and the adepts?

original: āha paśyāmi bhagavan /
analyzed: āha paśyāmi bhagavan
translated: He said, I see them, Blessed One.

original: paśyāmi sugata /
analyzed: paśyāmi sugata
translated: I see them, Sugata.

original: bhagavānāha sarva evaite ānanda dve bhikṣu sahasre samaṃ bodhisattvacaryāṃ samudānayiṣyanti /
analyzed: bhagavān āha sarve eva ete ānanda dve bhikṣu sahasre samam bodhisattva caryām samudānayiṣyanti
translated: The Blessed One said, Ānanda, all these two thousand monks will together practice the conduct of the bodhisattvas.

original: pañcāśallokadhātuparamāṇurajaḥsamāṃśca buddhān bhagavataḥ satkṛtya gurukṛtya mānayitvā
analyzed: pañcāśat lokadhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ samān ca buddhān bhagavataḥ satkṛtya gurukṛtya mānayitvā
translated: After serving, venerating, respecting, worshipping, and revering the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, equal to the atoms in fifty worlds,

original: pūjayitvā arcayitvā apacāyitvā saddharma ca dhārayitvā paścime samucchraye ekakṣaṇenaikamuhūrtenaikalavenaikasaṃnipātena
analyzed: pūjayitvā arcayitvā apacāyitvā saddharma ca dhārayitvā paścime samucchraye eka kṣaṇena eka muhūrtena eka lavena eka saṃnipātena
translated: and upholding their true Dharma, in their final existence, in one instant, in one moment, in one day, in one coming together,

original: daśasu dikṣvanyonyāsu lokadhātuṣu sveṣu sveṣu buddhakṣetreṣvanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyante /
analyzed: daśasu dikṣu anyonyāsu lokadhātuṣu sveṣu sveṣu buddhakṣetreṣu anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante
translated: in the ten directions, in the different worlds, in their own buddha-fields, they will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: ratnaketurājā nāma tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: ratnaketurājāḥ nāma tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will become the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Enlightened Ones named Ratnaketu.

original: paripūrṇaṃ caiṣāṃ kalpamāyuṣpramāṇaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: paripūrṇam ca eṣām kalpam āyuṣpramāṇam bhaviṣyati
translated: Their lifespan will be a full eon.

original: samāścaiṣāṃ buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: samāḥ ca eṣām buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Their buddha-fields will be equal in their array of qualities.

original: samaḥ śrāvakagaṇo bodhisattvagaṇaśca bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: samaḥ śrāvaka gaṇaḥ bodhisattva gaṇaḥ ca bhaviṣyati
translated: Their assemblies of śrāvakas and bodhisattvas will be equal.

original: samaṃ caiṣāṃ parinirvāṇaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: samam ca eṣām parinirvāṇam bhaviṣyati
translated: Their parinirvāṇas will be equal.

original: samaścaiṣāṃ saddharmaḥ sthāsyati //
analyzed: samaḥ ca eṣām saddharmaḥ sthāsyati
translated: And their true Dharma will remain for an equal length of time.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses on that occasion:

original: dve vai sahasre ime śrāvakāṇāṃ ānanda ye te mama agrataḥ sthitāḥ /
analyzed: dve vai sahasre ime śrāvakāṇām ānanda ye te mama agratas sthitāḥ
translated: Ānanda, these two thousand śrāvakas who stand before me,

original: tān vyākaromī ahamadya paṇḍitānanāgate 'dhvāni tathāgatatve // / //
analyzed: tān vyākaromi aham adya paṇḍitān anāgate tathāgata tve
translated: I declare today that these wise ones will attain buddhahood in the future.

original: ananta aupamyanidarśanehi buddhāna agryāṃ kariyāṇa pūjām /
analyzed: ananta aupamya nidarśanehi buddhāna agryām kariyāṇa pūjām
translated: Through infinite similes, they will make offerings to the supreme buddhas,

original: ārāgayiṣyanti mamāgrabodhiṃ sthihitva carimasmi samucchrayasmin // / //
analyzed: ārāgayiṣyanti mama agra bodhim sthihitvā
translated: And having attained the supreme enlightenment of a buddha in their final existence,

original: ekena nāmena daśaddiśāsu kṣaṇasmi ekasmi tathā muhūrte /
analyzed: ekena nāmena daśaddiśāsu ekasmi tathā muhūrte
translated: In the same instant and moment, in the ten directions,

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidyādhara

original: niṣadya ca drumapravarāṇa mūle buddhā bhaviṣyanti spṛśitva jñānam // / //
analyzed: niṣadya ca druma pravarāṇa mūle buddhāḥ bhaviṣyanti spṛśitva jñānam
translated: And having attained knowledge, they will become buddhas, sitting at the foot of the supreme tree.

original: ekaṃ ca teṣāmiti nāma bheṣyati ratnasya ketūtiha loki viśrutāḥ /
analyzed: ekam ca teṣām iti nāma ratnasya loki viśrutāḥ
translated: And their name will be the same, known in the world as Ratnaketu,

original: samāni kṣetrāṇi varāṇi teṣāṃ samo gaṇaḥ śrāvakabodhisattvāḥ // / //
analyzed: samāni kṣetrāṇi varāṇi teṣām samaḥ gaṇaḥ śrāvaka bodhisattvāḥ
translated: Their fields are equal and excellent, and their assemblies of śrāvakas and bodhisattvas are equal.

original: ṛddhiprabhūtā iha sarvi loke samantataste daśasu ddiśāsu /
analyzed: ṛddhi prabhūtāḥ iha loke samantataḥ te daśasu ddiśāsu
translated: All of them in this world have great miraculous powers, extending in all directions to the ten directions.

original: dharmaṃ prakāśetva yadāpi nirvṛtāḥ saddharmu teṣāṃ samameva sthāsyati // / //
analyzed: dharmam yadā api nirvṛtāḥ teṣām samam eva sthāsyati
translated: Having taught the Dharma, when they attain nirvāṇa, the true Dharma of those buddhas will remain for the same length of time.

original: atha khalu te śaikṣāśaikṣāḥ śrāvakā bhagavato 'ntikāt saṃmukhaṃ svāni svāni vyākaraṇāni
analyzed: atha khalu te śaikṣa aśaikṣāḥ śrāvakāḥ bhagavataḥ ntikāt saṃmukham svāni svāni vyākaraṇāni
translated: Then those śrāvakas, both those in training and those who had passed beyond training, having heard their individual prophecies directly from the Bhagavān,

original: śrutvā tuṣṭā udagrā āttamanaskāḥ pramuditāḥ prītisaumanasyajātā bhagavantaṃ gāthābhyāmadhyabhāṣanta
analyzed: śrutvā tuṣṭāḥ udagrāḥ ātta manaskāḥ pramuditāḥ prīti saumanasya jātāḥ bhagavantam gāthābhyām adhyabhāṣanta
translated: were satisfied, delighted, elated, and overjoyed. They were joyful, and experienced happiness and pleasure. They addressed the Bhagavān with these verses:

original: tṛptāḥ sma lokapradyota śrutvā vyākaraṇaṃ idam /
analyzed: tṛptāḥ sma loka pradyota śrutvā vyākaraṇam idam
translated: We are satisfied, O Lamp of the World, having heard this prophecy.

original: amṛtena yathā siktāḥ sukhitāḥ sama tathāgata // / //
analyzed: amṛtena yathā siktāḥ sukhitāḥ tathāgata
translated: We are happy, O Sugata, as if sprinkled with ambrosia.

original: nāsmākaṃ kāṅkṣā vimatirna bheṣyāma narottamāḥ /
analyzed: na asmākam kāṅkṣā vimatiḥ na nara uttamāḥ
translated: We have no doubt, no uncertainty that we will become supreme among men.

original: adyāsmābhiḥ sukhaṃ prāptaṃ śrutvā vyākaraṇaṃ idam // / //
analyzed: adya asmābhiḥ sukham prāptam śrutvā vyākaraṇam idam
translated: Today we have attained happiness, having heard this prophecy.

original: ityāryasaddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye ānandarāhulābhyāmanyābhyāṃ ca dvābhyāṃ bhikṣusahasrābhyāṃ vyākaraṇaparivarto nāma navamaḥ //
analyzed: iti ārya saddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye ānanda rāhulābhyām anyābhyām ca dvābhyām bhikṣu sahasrābhyām vyākaraṇaparivartaḥ nāma navamaḥ
translated: Thus ends the chapter on the prophecy to Ānanda, Rāhula, and two thousand other monks, the ninth chapter in the noble Mahāyāna sūtra “Ratna-cūḍa.”

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: dharmabhāṇakaparivartaḥ /
analyzed: dharmabhāṇakaparivartaḥ
translated: The Chapter on the Dharma Preacher

original: atha khalu bhagavan bhaiṣajyarājaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamārabhya tānyaśītiṃ bodhisattvasahasrāṇyāmantrayate
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavan bhaiṣajyarājam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam ārabhya tāni aśītim bodhisattva sahasrāṇi āmantrayate
translated: Then the Blessed One, beginning with the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajyarāja, addressed those eighty thousand bodhisattvas:

original: sma paśyasi tvaṃ bhaiṣajyarāja asyāṃ parṣadi bahudevanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragamanuṣyāmanuṣyān
analyzed: sma paśyasi tvam bhaiṣajya rāja asyām parṣadi bahu deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga manuṣya amanuṣyān
translated: Bhaiṣajyarāja, do you see in this assembly many devas, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans and non-humans,

original: bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikāḥ śrāvakayānīyān pratyekabuddhayāniyān bodhisattvayānīyāṃśca /
analyzed: bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikāḥ śrāvaka yānīyān pratyekabuddha yāniyān bodhisattva yānīyān ca
translated: bhikṣus, bhikṣuṇīs, upāsakas, upāsikās, followers of the Śrāvakayāna, followers of the Pratyekabuddhayāna, and followers of the Bodhisattvayāna,

original: yairayaṃ dharmaparyāyastathāgatasya saṃmukhaṃ śrutaḥ /
analyzed: yaiḥ ayam dharmaparyāyaḥ tathāgatasya saṃmukham śrutaḥ
translated: who have heard this Dharma discourse directly from the Tathāgata?

original: āha paśyāmi bhagavan /
analyzed: āha paśyāmi bhagavan
translated: He said, I see them, Blessed One.

original: paśyāmi sugata /
analyzed: paśyāmi sugata
translated: I see them, Sugata.

original: bhagavānāha sarve svalvete bhaiṣajyarāja bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ /🔽yairasyāṃ parṣadi antaśaḥ ekāpi gāthā śrutā /
analyzed: bhagavān āha sarve svalu ete bhaiṣajyarāja bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ  yaiḥ asyām parṣadi antaśas ekā api gāthā śrutā
translated: The Blessed One said, Bhaiṣajyarāja, all of these bodhisattva mahāsattvas,🔽in this assembly, have heard at least one verse

original: ekapadamapi śrutam /
analyzed: eka padam api śrutam
translated: or one line of this Dharma discourse.

original: yairvā punarantaśa ekacittotpādenāpyanumoditamidaṃ sūtram /
analyzed: yaiḥ vā punar antaśas eka citta utpādena api anumoditam idam sūtram
translated: Or those who have rejoiced in this sūtra, even for a single moment of thought,

original: sarvā etā ahaṃ bhaiṣajyarāja catasraḥ parṣado vyākaromyanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: sarvāḥ etāḥ aham bhaiṣajya rāja catasraḥ parṣadaḥ vyākaromi anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: I declare all these four assemblies, O Bhaiṣajyarāja, to the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: ye 'pi kecid bhaiṣajyarāja tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śroṣyanti /
analyzed: ye pi kecid bhaiṣajyarāja tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya imam dharmaparyāyam śroṣyanti
translated: Bhaiṣajyarāja, those who will hear this Dharma discourse of the Tathāgata after his parinirvāṇa,

original: antaśa ekagāthāmapi śrutvā /
analyzed: antaśas eka gāthām api śrutvā
translated: even if it is only a single verse,

original: antaśa ekenāpi cittotpādena abhyamumodayiṣyanti /
analyzed: antaśas ekena api citta utpādena
translated: and will rejoice with even a single thought,

original: tānapyahaṃ bhaiṣajyarāja kulaputrān va kuladuhitṛrvā vyākaromyanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /🔽paripūrṇabuddhakoṭīnayutaśatasahasraparyupāsitāvinaste bhaiṣajyarāja kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā bhaiṣyanti /
analyzed: tān api aham bhaiṣajya rāja kula putrān kula duhitṛḥ vā vyākaromi anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau  paripūrṇa buddha koṭī nayuta śata sahasra paryupāsitāvinaḥ te bhaiṣajya rāja kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā bhaiṣyanti
translated: I declare those sons or daughters of good family, O Bhaiṣajyarāja, to the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.🔽Those sons or daughters of good family, O Bhaiṣajyarāja, will have attended upon a full hundred thousand koṭis of niyutas of Buddhas.

original: buddhakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrakṛtapraṇidhānāste bhaiṣajyarājakulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: buddha koṭī nayuta śata sahasra kṛta praṇidhānāḥ te bhaiṣajya rāja kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā bhaviṣyanti
translated: Those sons or daughters of good family, O Bhaiṣajyarāja, will have made aspirations to the Buddhas for a hundred thousand koṭis of niyutas.

original: sattvānāmanukampārthamasmin jambudvīpe manuṣyeṣu pratyājātā veditavyāḥ /
analyzed: sattvānām anukampā artham asmin jambudvīpe manuṣyeṣu pratyājātāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: They should be known as having been reborn among humans in this Jambudvīpa out of compassion for sentient beings.

original: ya ito dharmaparyāyādantaśa ekagāthāmapi dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti prakāśayiṣyanti saṃgrāhayiṣyanti likhiṣyanti /
analyzed: ye itas dharmaparyāyāt antaśas eka gāthām api dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti prakāśayiṣyanti saṃgrāhayiṣyanti likhiṣyanti
translated: Those who, from this Dharma discourse, will retain even a single verse, will recite it, will teach it, will collect it, will write it,

original: likhitvā cānusmariṣyanti /
analyzed: likhitvā ca anusmariṣyanti
translated: and having written it, will recollect it,

original: kālena ca kālaṃ vyavalokayiṣyanti /
analyzed: kālena ca kālam vyavalokayiṣyanti
translated: and from time to time will look at it,

original: tasmiṃśca pustake tathāgatagauravamutpādayiṣyanti /
analyzed: tasmin ca pustake tathāgata gauravam utpādayiṣyanti
translated: and towards that book will generate reverence for the Tathāgata,

original: śāstṛgauraveṇa satkariṣyanti gurukariṣyanti mānayiṣyanti pūjayiṣyanti /
analyzed: śāstṛ gauraveṇa satkariṣyanti gurukariṣyanti mānayiṣyanti pūjayiṣyanti
translated: with the reverence for the Teacher, will honor it, will revere it, will worship it, will make offerings to it,

original: taṃ ca pustakaṃ puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākāvādyādibhirnamaskārāñjalikarmabhiśca pūjayiṣyanti /
analyzed: tam ca pustakam puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākā vādya ādibhiḥ namaskāra añjali karmabhiḥ ca pūjayiṣyanti
translated: and that book will be worshipped with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, flags, music, and so forth, with prostrations and joining the palms in homage.

original: ye kecid bhaiṣajyarāja kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā ito dharmaparyāyādantaśa ekagāthāmapi dhārayiṣyanti anumodayiṣyanti vā /
analyzed: ye kecid bhaiṣajya rāja kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā itas dharmaparyāyāt antaśas eka gāthām api dhārayiṣyanti anumodayiṣyanti vā
translated: Bhaiṣajyarāja, I prophesy that all those sons or daughters of good family who, from this Dharma discourse, will retain even a single verse, will rejoice in it,

original: sarvāṃstānahaṃ bhaiṣajyarāja vyākaromyanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau //
analyzed: sarvān tān aham bhaiṣajya rāja vyākaromi anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: I prophesy them all, Bhaiṣajyarāja, for unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: tatra bhaiṣajyarāja yaḥ kaścidanyataraḥ puruṣo vā strī vā evaṃ vadet kīdṛśāḥ khalvapi te sattvā bhaviṣyantyanāgate 'dhvani tathāgatā arhantaḥ
analyzed: tatra bhaiṣajya rāja yaḥ kaścid anyataraḥ puruṣaḥ vā strī vā evam vadet kīdṛśāḥ khalu api te sattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti anāgate dhvani tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ  /
translated: Bhaiṣajyarāja, if any man or woman were to say, What will those beings be like in the future who will be Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones?

original: samyaksaṃbuddhā iti /🔽tasya bhaiṣajyarāja puruṣasya vā striyā vā sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā darśayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ iti  tasya bhaiṣajya rāja puruṣasya vā striyāḥ vā sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā darśayitavyaḥ
translated: “Bhaiṣajyarāja, if any man or woman were to say, ‘What will those beings be like in the future who will become tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas?’

original: ya ito dharmaparyāyādantaśaścatuṣpādikāmapi gāthāṃ dhārayitā śrāvayitā vā deśayitā vā sagauravo veha dharmaparyāye /
analyzed: yaḥ itas dharmaparyāyāt antaśas catuṣpādikām api gāthām dhārayitā śrāvayitā vā deśayitā vā sa gauravaḥ vā iha dharmaparyāye
translated: “Bhaiṣajyarāja, that man or woman should be shown to be a noble man or noble woman who, from this Dharma teaching, upholds even as little as a four-line verse of it, listens to it, teaches it, or respectfully listens to it.

original: ayaṃ sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā /
analyzed: ayam sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā
translated: This is the noble man or noble woman

original: yo hyanāgate 'dhvani tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho bhaviṣyati /
