translated: “Moreover, Bhaiṣajyarāja, those noble sons or noble daughters should be known to be covered by the Tathāgata’s robe,

original: anyalokadhātusthitaiśca tathāgatairavalokitāśca adhiṣṭhitāśca /
analyzed: anya lokadhātu sthitaiḥ ca tathāgataiḥ avalokitāḥ ca adhiṣṭhitāḥ ca
translated: They will be seen and blessed by the Tathāgatas dwelling in other world systems.

original: pratyātmikaṃ ca teṣāṃ śraddhābalaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: pratyātmikam ca teṣām śraddhā balam bhaviṣyati
translated: They will have the power of faith within themselves.

original: kuśalamūlabalaṃ ca praṇidhānabalaṃ ca /
analyzed: kuśala mūla balam ca praṇidhāna balam ca
translated: They will have the power of the roots of virtue and the power of aspiration.

original: tathāgatavihāraikasthānanivāsinaśca te bhaiṣajyarāja kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tathāgata vihāra eka sthāna nivāsinaḥ ca te bhaiṣajya rāja kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā bhaviṣyanti
translated: Bhaiṣajyarāja, those noble men or noble women will dwell in the same place as the Tathāgata, in the Tathāgata’s temple.

original: tathāgatapāṇiparimārjitamūrdhānaśca te bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tathāgata pāṇi parimārjita mūrdhānaḥ ca te bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will have their heads anointed by the Tathāgata’s hand.

original: ya imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya śraddadhiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti likhiṣyanti satkariṣyanti gurukariṣyanti pareṣāṃ ca saṃśrāvayiṣyanti
analyzed: ye imam dharmaparyāyam tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya śraddadhiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti likhiṣyanti satkariṣyanti gurukariṣyanti pareṣām ca saṃśrāvayiṣyanti
translated: Those who, after the Tathāgata’s passing into nirvāṇa, will have faith in this Dharma teaching, will recite it, write it out, honor it, venerate it, and make offerings to it,

original: yasmin khalu punarbhaiṣajyarāja pṛthivīpradeśe 'yaṃ dharmaparyāyo bhāṣyeta vā deśyeta vā likhyeta vā svādhyāyeta vā saṃgāyeta vā /
analyzed: yasmin khalu punar bhaiṣajya rāja pṛthivī pradeśe yam dharmaparyāyaḥ bhāṣyeta vā deśyeta vā likhyeta vā su ādhyāyeta vā saṃgāyeta vā
translated: “Bhaiṣajyarāja, in whatever place this Dharma teaching is being taught, explained, written out, recited, or chanted,

original: tasmin bhaiṣajyarāja pṛthivīpradeśe tathāgatacaityaṃ kārayitavyaṃ mahantaṃ ratnamayamuccaṃ pragṛhītam /
analyzed: tasmin bhaiṣajya rāja pṛthivī pradeśe tathāgata caityam kārayitavyam mahantam ratna mayam uccam pragṛhītam
translated: Bhaiṣajyarāja, in that place a great stūpa made of the seven precious materials should be erected for the Tathāgata. It should be high and well constructed.

original: na ca tasminnavaśyaṃ tathāgataśarīrāṇi pratiṣṭhāpayitavyāni /
analyzed: na ca tasmin avaśyam tathāgata śarīrāṇi pratiṣṭhāpayitavyāni
translated: And it is not necessary to install the relics of the Tathāgata in it.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: ekaghanameva tasmiṃstathāgataśarīramupanikṣiptaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: eka ghanam eva tasmin tathāgata śarīram upanikṣiptam bhavati
translated: The relics of the Tathāgata are to be placed in a single place.

original: yasmin pṛthivīpradeśe 'yaṃ dharmaparyāyo bhāṣyeta vā deśyeta vā paṭhyeta vā saṃgāyeta vā likhyeta vā likhito vā pustakagatastiṣṭhet /
analyzed: yasmin pṛthivī pradeśe yam dharmaparyāyaḥ bhāṣyeta vā deśyeta vā paṭhyeta vā saṃgāyeta vā likhyeta vā likhitaḥ vā pustaka gataḥ tiṣṭhet
translated: In whatever place this Dharma teaching is spoken, taught, recited, chanted, written, or even a book with it is placed,

original: tasmiṃśca stūpe satkāro gurukāro mānanā pūjanā arcanā karaṇīyā sarvapuṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākāvaijayantībhiḥ
analyzed: tasmin ca stūpe satkāraḥ gurukāraḥ mānanā pūjanā arcanā karaṇīyā sarva puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākā vaijayantībhiḥ
translated: in that stūpa one should make offerings of all flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, flags, and banners of victory,

original: sarvagītavādyanṛtyatūryatālāvacarasaṃgītisaṃpravāditaiḥ pūjā karaṇīyā /
analyzed: sarva gīta vādya nṛtya tūrya tālāvacara saṃgīti saṃpravāditaiḥ pūjā karaṇīyā
translated: and one should make offerings with all singing, music, dancing, percussion, and musical entertainment.

original: ye ca khalu punarbhaiṣajyarāja sattvāstaṃ tathāgatacaityaṃ labheran vandanāya pūjanāya darśanāya vā /
analyzed: ye ca khalu punar bhaiṣajyarāja sattvāḥ tam tathāgata caityam labheran vandanāya pūjanāya darśanāya vā
translated: And, Bhaiṣajyarāja, those beings who obtain that stūpa of the Tathāgata in order to venerate, worship, or see it,

original: sarve te bhaiṣajyarāja abhyāsannībhūtā veditavyā anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: sarve te bhaiṣajya rāja abhyāsannībhūtāḥ veditavyāḥ anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: Bhaiṣajyarāja, all of them should be known to be close to the highest, complete enlightenment.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: bahavo bhaiṣajyarāja gṛhasthāḥ pravrajitāśca Vaidya
analyzed: bahavaḥ bhaiṣajya rāja gṛhasthāḥ pravrajitāḥ ca vaidya
translated: “Bhaiṣajyarāja, there are many householders and renunciants who practice medicine

original: bodhisattvacaryāṃ caranti /
analyzed: bodhisattva caryām caranti
translated: and who practice the conduct of the bodhisattvas.

original: na ca punarimaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ labhante darśanāya vā śravaṇāya vā likhanāya vā pūjanāya vā /
analyzed: na ca punar imam dharmaparyāyam labhante darśanāya vā śravaṇāya vā likhanāya vā pūjanāya vā
translated: But they do not obtain this Dharma teaching in order to see it, to hear it, to write it, or to make offerings to it.

original: na tāvatte bhaiṣajyarāja bodhisattvacaryāyāṃ kuśalā bhavanti /
analyzed: na tāvat te bhaiṣajyarāja bodhisattva caryāyām kuśalāḥ bhavanti
translated: Bhaiṣajyarāja, they are not skilled in the conduct of the bodhisattvas

original: yāvannemaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śṛṇvanti /
analyzed: yāvat na imam dharmaparyāyam śṛṇvanti
translated: until they hear this Dharma teaching.

original: ye tvimaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śṛṇvanti /
analyzed: ye tu imam dharmaparyāyam śṛṇvanti
translated: Those who hear this Dharma teaching

original: śrutvā cādhimucyanti avataranti vijānanti parigṛhṇanti /
analyzed: śrutvā ca adhimucyanti avataranti vijānanti parigṛhṇanti
translated: and, having heard it, have conviction in it, enter into it, understand it, uphold it, and teach it extensively to others

original: tasmin samaye te āsannasthāyino bhaviṣyantyanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: tasmin samaye te āsanna sthāyinaḥ bhaviṣyanti anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: will at that time be close to the highest, complete enlightenment.

original: abhyāśībhūtāḥ //
analyzed: abhyāśībhūtāḥ
translated: They will be near to it.”

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhaiṣajyarāja kaścideva puruṣo bhavedudakārthī udakagaveṣī /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhaiṣajya rāja kaścid eva puruṣaḥ bhavet udaka arthī udaka gaveṣī
translated: “Bhaiṣajyarāja, it is as if there were a man who needed water and, seeking water,

original: sa udakārthamujjaṅgale pṛthivīpradeśe udapānaṃ khānayet /
analyzed: saḥ udaka artham ujjaṅgale pṛthivī pradeśe udapānam khānayet
translated: dug a well in a place where there was no water.

original: sa yāvat paśyecchuṣkaṃ pāṇḍaraṃ pāṃsuṃ nirvāhyamānam /🔽tāvajjānīyāt /
analyzed: sa yāvat paśyet śuṣkam pāṇḍaram pāṃsum nirvāhyamānam  tāvat jānīyāt
translated: As long as he saw dry dirt being removed,

original: dūra itastāvadūdakamiti /
analyzed: dūre itas tāvat ūdakam iti
translated: he would know that the water was still far away.🔽But when he saw wet dirt and mud being removed,🔽he would know that the water was near.

original: atha pareṇa samayena sa puruṣa ārdrapaṃsumudakasaṃniśraṃ kardamapaṅkabhutamudakabindubhiḥ sravadbhirnirvāhyamānaṃ paśyet /
analyzed: atha pareṇa samayena sa puruṣaḥ ārdra paṃsum udaka saṃniśram kardama paṅka bhutam udaka bindubhiḥ sravadbhiḥ nirvāhyamānam paśyet
translated: “Then, at a later time, that man would see the dry earth being carried away by the flowing water, becoming mud and mire, and flowing with drops of water.

original: tāṃśca puruṣānudapānakhānakān kardamapaṅkadigdhāṅgān /
analyzed: tān ca puruṣān udapāna khānakān kardama paṅka digdha aṅgān
translated: And he would see those men who were digging the well, their bodies covered with mud and mire.

original: atha khalu punarbhaiṣajyarāja sa puruṣastatpūrvanimittaṃ dṛṣṭvā niṣkāṅkṣo bhavennirvicikitsaḥ āsannamidaṃ khalūdakamiti /
analyzed: atha khalu punar bhaiṣajya rāja sa puruṣaḥ tad pūrva nimittam dṛṣṭvā niṣkāṅkṣaḥ bhavet nirvicikitsaḥ āsannam idam khalu udakam iti
translated: Then, Bhaiṣajyarāja, that man, having seen those previous signs, would be free from doubt and uncertainty, thinking, ‘The water is near.’

original: evameva bhaiṣajyarāja dūre te bodhisattvā mahāsattvā bhavantyanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: evam eva bhaiṣajya rāja dūre te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ bhavanti anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: In the same way, Bhaiṣajyarāja, those bodhisattva mahāsattvas are far from the highest, complete enlightenment.

original: yāvannemaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śṛṇvanti /
analyzed: yāvat na imam dharmaparyāyam śṛṇvanti
translated: As long as they do not hear this Dharma teaching,

original: nodgṛhṇanti nāvataranti nāvagāhante na cintayanti /
analyzed: na udgṛhṇanti na avataranti na avagāhante na cintayanti
translated: do not take it up, do not enter into it, do not penetrate it, and do not contemplate it.

original: yadā khalu punarbhaiṣajyarāja bodhisattvā mahāsattvā imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śṛṇvanti udgṛhṇanti dhārayanti vācayanti avataranti svādhyāyanti cintayanti
analyzed: yadā khalu punar bhaiṣajyarāja bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ imam dharmaparyāyam śṛṇvanti udgṛhṇanti dhārayanti vācayanti avataranti su ādhyāyanti cintayanti
translated: But when, Bhaiṣajyarāja, those bodhisattva mahāsattvas hear this Dharma teaching, take it up, bear it in mind, recite it, penetrate it, contemplate it, and understand it,

original: tadā te 'bhyāśībhūtā bhaviṣyantyanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: tadā te bhyāśībhūtāḥ bhaviṣyanti anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: then they will have approached the highest, complete enlightenment.”

original: sattvānāmito bhaiṣajyarāja dharmaparyāyādanuttarā samyaksaṃbodhirājāyate /
analyzed: sattvānām itas bhaiṣajyarāja dharmaparyāyāt anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ ājāyate
translated: “Bhaiṣajyarāja, from this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma, beings will attain the highest, complete enlightenment.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: paramasaṃdhābhāṣitavivaraṇo hyayaṃ dharmaparyāyastathāgatairarhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ /
analyzed: parama saṃdhā bhāṣita vivaraṇaḥ hi ayam dharmaparyāyaḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ
translated: This Dharma teaching is the explanation of the ultimate truth taught by the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas.

original: dharmanigūḍhasthānamākhyātaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ pariniṣpattihetoḥ /
analyzed: dharma nigūḍha sthānam ākhyātam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām pariniṣpatti hetoḥ
translated: It is taught in order to bring the bodhisattva mahāsattvas to perfection.

original: yaḥ kaścid bhaiṣajyarāja bodhisattvo 'sya dharmaparyāyasyotraset saṃtraset saṃtrāsamāpadyet /
analyzed: yaḥ kaścid bhaiṣajya rāja bodhisattvaḥ sya dharmaparyāyasya utraset saṃtraset saṃtrāsam āpadyet
translated: “Bhaiṣajyarāja, if a bodhisattva were to be frightened, terrified, and gripped by fear on hearing this Dharma teaching,

original: navayānasaṃprasthitaḥ sa bhaiṣajyarāja bodhisattvo mahāsattvo veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: nava yāna saṃprasthitaḥ sa bhaiṣajyarāja bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: Bhaiṣajyarāja, one should know that bodhisattva mahāsattva to be one who has newly set out in the vehicle.

original: sacet punaḥ śrāvakayānīyo 'sya dharmaparyāyasyotraset saṃtraset saṃtrāsamāpadyeta /
analyzed: saced punar śrāvaka yānīyaḥ sya dharmaparyāyasya utraset saṃtraset saṃtrāsam āpadyeta
translated: “Bhaiṣajyarāja, if someone from the vehicle of the hearers were to be frightened, terrified, and gripped by fear on hearing this Dharma teaching,

original: adhimānikaḥ sa bhaiṣajyarāja śrāvakayānikaḥ pudgalo veditavyaḥ //
analyzed: adhimānikaḥ sa bhaiṣajya rāja śrāvaka yānikaḥ pudgalaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: Bhaiṣajyarāja, one should know that person from the vehicle of the hearers to be arrogant.”

original: yaḥ kaścid bhaiṣajyarāja bodhisattvo mahāsattvastathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya paścime kāle paścime samaye imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ catasṛṇāṃ parṣadāṃ🔽tena bhaiṣajyarāja bodhisattvena mahāsattvena tathāgatalayanaṃ praviśya tathāgatacīvaraṃ
analyzed: yaḥ kaścid bhaiṣajyarāja bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya paścime kāle paścime samaye imam dharmaparyāyam catasṛṇām parṣadām  tena bhaiṣajya rāja bodhisattvena mahāsattvena tathāgata layanam praviśya tathāgata cīvaram
translated: Bhaiṣajyarāja, if there is any bodhisattva mahāsattva who, in the later times, during the later five hundred years, teaches this Dharma teaching to the fourfold assembly...🔽Bhaiṣajyarāja, that bodhisattva mahāsattva should enter the Tathāgata's shrine hall, put on the Tathāgata's robe,🔽

original: prāvṛtya tathāgatasyāsane niṣadya ayaṃ dharmaparyāyaścatasṛṇāṃ parṣadāṃ saṃprakāśayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: prāvṛtya tathāgatasya āsane niṣadya ayam dharmaparyāyaḥ catasṛṇām parṣadām saṃprakāśayitavyaḥ
translated: Bhaiṣajyarāja, if there is a bodhisattva mahāsattva who, in the later times, during the later five hundred years, teaches this Dharma teaching to the fourfold assembly of bhikṣus, bhikṣuṇīs, upāsakas, and upāsikās, and if there is another bodhisattva mahāsattva who, in the later times, during the later five hundred years, having entered the stūpa of a Tathāgata, having put on the Tathāgata's robe, having sat on the Tathāgata's seat, teaches this Dharma teaching to the fourfold assembly, then, Bhaiṣajyarāja, the latter will have greater merit.

original: katamaśca bhaiṣajyarāja tathāgatalayanam /
analyzed: katamaḥ ca bhaiṣajyarāja tathāgata layanam
translated: Bhaiṣajyarāja, what is the Tathāgata's stūpa?

original: sarvasattvamaitrīvihāraḥ svalu punarbhaiṣajyarāja tathāgatalayanam /
analyzed: sarva sattva maitrī vihāraḥ svalu punar bhaiṣajyarāja tathāgata layanam
translated: Bhaiṣajyarāja, the Tathāgata's stūpa is the place where all beings dwell in loving kindness.

original: tatra tena kulaputreṇa praveṣṭavyam /
analyzed: tatra tena kula putreṇa praveṣṭavyam
translated: That is the Tathāgata's stūpa, and the noble man should enter there.

original: katamacca bhaiṣajyarāja tathāgatacīvaram /
analyzed: katamat ca bhaiṣajya rāja tathāgata cīvaram
translated: Bhaiṣajyarāja, what is the Tathāgata's robe?

original: mahākṣāntisauratyaṃ khalu punarbhaiṣajyarāja tathāgatacīvaram /
analyzed: mahā kṣānti sauratyam khalu punar bhaiṣajya rāja tathāgata cīvaram
translated: Bhaiṣajyarāja, the Tathāgata's robe is great patience and gentleness.

original: tattena kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā prāvaritavyam /
analyzed: tat tena kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā
translated: That is the Tathāgata's robe, and the noble man or noble woman should put it on.

original: katamacca bhaiṣajyarāja tathāgatasya dharmāsanam /
analyzed: katamat ca bhaiṣajyarāja tathāgatasya dharma āsanam
translated: Bhaiṣajyarāja, what is the Tathāgata's Dharma seat?

original: sarvadharmaśūnyatāpraveśaḥ khalu punarbhaiṣajyarāja tathāgatasya dharmāsanam /
analyzed: sarva dharma śūnyatā praveśaḥ khalu punar bhaiṣajyarāja tathāgatasya dharma āsanam
translated: “Bhaiṣajyarāja, the Tathāgata’s Dharma seat is the entrance into the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: tatra tena kulaputreṇa niṣattavyam /🔽niṣadya cāyaṃ dharmaparyāyaścatasṛṇāṃ parṣadāṃ saṃprakāśayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: tatra tena kula putreṇa niṣattavyam  niṣadya ca ayam dharmaparyāyaḥ catasṛṇām parṣadām saṃprakāśayitavyaḥ
translated: That noble man should sit there.🔽And having sat there, he should teach this Dharma teaching to the fourfold assembly.

original: anavalīnacittena bodhisattvena purastādbodhisattvagaṇasya bodhisattvayānasaṃprasthitānāṃ catasṛṇāṃ parṣadāṃ saṃprakāśayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: anavalīnacittena bodhisattvena purastāt bodhisattva gaṇasya bodhisattva yāna saṃprasthitānām catasṛṇām parṣadām saṃprakāśayitavyaḥ
translated: The bodhisattva who is not fainthearted should teach this Dharma teaching to the assembly of bodhisattvas and to the fourfold assembly that has set out in the Bodhisattva­yāna.

original: anyalokadhātusthitaścāhaṃ bhaiṣajyarāja tasya kulaputrasya nirmitaiḥ Vaidya
analyzed: anya lokadhātu sthitaḥ ca aham bhaiṣajya rāja tasya kula putrasya nirmitaiḥ vaidya
translated: “Bhaiṣajyarāja, I, who am in another world realm, will send emanations of bodhisattvas

original: parṣadaḥ samāvartayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: parṣadaḥ samāvartayiṣyāmi
translated: to gather the assembly for that noble man.

original: nirmitāṃśca bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikāḥ saṃpreṣayiṣyāmi dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: nirmitān ca bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikāḥ saṃpreṣayiṣyāmi dharma śravaṇāya
translated: I will send emanations of bhikṣus, bhikṣuṇīs, upāsakas, and upāsikās to listen to the Dharma.

original: te tasya dharmabhāṇakasya bhāṣitaṃ na pratibādhiṣyanti /
analyzed: te tasya dharma bhāṇakasya bhāṣitam na pratibādhiṣyanti
translated: They will not contradict or reject the words of that Dharma teacher.

original: na pratikṣepsyanti /
analyzed: na pratikṣepsyanti
translated: They will not reject them.

original: sacetkhalu punararaṇyagato bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: saced khalu punar araṇya gataḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: If he is in the forest,

original: tatrāpyahamasya bahudevanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragān saṃpreṣayiṣyāmi dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: tatra api aham asya bahu deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoragān saṃpreṣayiṣyāmi dharma śravaṇāya
translated: There, too, I will send many gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas to listen to the Dharma.

original: anyalokadhātusthitaścāhaṃ bhaiṣajyarāja tasya kulaputrasya mukhamupadarśayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: anya lokadhātu sthitaḥ ca aham bhaiṣajya rāja tasya kula putrasya mukham upadarśayiṣyāmi
translated: And, Bhaiṣajyarāja, I will reveal my face to that noble man who is dwelling in another world system.

original: yāni ca asya asmāddharmaparyāyāt padavyañjanāni paribhraṣṭāni bhaviṣyanti /

translated: On each of those, a Tathāgata sat cross-legged.

original: anena paryāyeṇa sarvasyāṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasrāyāṃ lokadhātau sarvaratnavṛkṣamūleṣu tathāgatāḥ paryaṅkaṃ baddhvā niṣaṇṇā abhūvan //
analyzed: anena paryāyeṇa sarvasyām tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrāyām lokadhātau sarva ratna vṛkṣa mūleṣu tathāgatāḥ paryaṅkam baddhvā niṣaṇṇāḥ abhūvan
translated: In this way, the Tathāgatas sat cross-legged at the foot of all the jeweled trees in the entire great trichiliocosm.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena iyaṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasrī lokadhātustathāgataparipūrṇābhūt /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena iyam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrī lokadhātuḥ tathāgata paripūrṇā abhūt
translated: At that time, this great trichiliocosm was filled with Tathāgatas.

original: na tāvad bhagavataḥ śākyamunestathāgatasyātmabhāvanirmitā ekasmādapi digbhāgāt sarva āgatā abhūvan /
analyzed: na tāvat bhagavataḥ śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya ātmabhāva nirmitāḥ ekasmāt api digbhāgāt sarve āgatāḥ abhūvan
translated: The magically created bodies of the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, had not yet arrived from even one direction.

original: atha khalu punarbhagavān śākyamunistathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhasteṣāṃ tathāgatavigrahāṇāmāgatāgatānāmavakāśaṃ nirmimīte sma /
analyzed: atha khalu punar bhagavān śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ teṣām tathāgata vigrahāṇām āgata āgatānām avakāśam nirmimīte sma
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha Śākyamuni created space for those magically created Tathāgata forms that had arrived.

original: samantādaṣṭabhyo digbhyo viṃśatibuddhakṣetrakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi sarvāṇi vaiḍūryamayāni
analyzed: samantāt aṣṭabhyaḥ digbhyaḥ viṃśati buddhakṣetra koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi sarvāṇi vaiḍūrya mayāni
translated: From the eight directions, twenty hundred thousand koṭis of nayutas of Buddha-fields were all made of beryl,

original: saptaratnahemajālasaṃchannāni kiṅkiṇījālālaṃkṛtāni māndāravamahāmāndāravapuṣpasaṃstīrṇāni
analyzed: sapta ratna hema jāla saṃchannāni kiṅkiṇī jāla alaṃkṛtāni māndārava mahāmāndārava puṣpa saṃstīrṇāni
translated: covered with nets of the seven precious substances and gold, adorned with nets of small bells, strewn with coral tree and great coral tree flowers,

original: divyavitānavitatāni divyapuṣpadāmābhipralambitāni divyagandhadhūpanadhūpitāni /
analyzed: divya vitāna vitatāni divya puṣpa dāma abhipralambitāni divya gandha dhūpana dhūpitāni
translated: They were covered with divine canopies, hung with divine flower garlands, and perfumed with divine incense and perfumes.

original: sarvāṇi ca tāni viṃśatibuddhakṣetrakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇyapagatagrāmanagaranigamajanapadarāṣṭrarājadhānīni🔽apagatakālaparvatāni apagatamucilindamahāmucilindaparvatāni apagatacakravālamahācakravālaparvatāni
analyzed: sarvāṇi ca tāni viṃśati buddhakṣetra koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi apagata grāma nagara nigama janapada rāṣṭra rājadhānīni  apagata kālaparvatāni apagata mucilinda mahāmucilinda parvatāni apagata cakravāla mahācakravāla parvatāni
translated: All those twenty hundred thousand quintillion buddha-fields were free of villages, towns, cities, states, and countries,🔽free of the Black Mountain, the Enclosure of Mountains, and the Great Enclosure of Mountains,🔽free of the Cakravāḍa and Mahācakravāḍa mountain ranges,

original: apagatasumeruparvatāni apagatatadanyamahāparvatāni apagatamahāsamudrāṇi apagatanadīmahānadīni
analyzed: apagata sumeru parvatāni apagata tad anya mahā parvatāni apagata mahā samudrāṇi apagata nadī mahā nadīni
translated: free of Mount Sumeru, and free of the other great mountains, free of the great oceans, free of the rivers and great rivers,

original: parisaṃsthāpayati apagatadevamanuṣyāsurakāyāni apagatanirayatiryagyoniyamalokāni /
analyzed: parisaṃsthāpayati apagata deva manuṣya asura kāyāni apagata niraya tiryagyoni yama lokāni
translated: free of the bodies of gods, humans, and demigods, and free of the realms of hell-beings, animals, and hungry ghosts.

original: tāni ca sarvāṇi bahubuddhakṣetrāṇi ekameva buddhakṣetramekameva pṛthivīpradeśaṃ parisaṃsthāpayāmāsa samaṃ ramaṇīyaṃ saptaratnamayaiśca Vaidya🔽vṛkṣaiścitritam /
analyzed: tāni ca sarvāṇi bahu buddhakṣetrāṇi ekam eva buddhakṣetram ekam eva pṛthivī pradeśam parisaṃsthāpayāmāsa samam ramaṇīyam sapta ratna mayaiḥ ca vaidya 🔽vṛkṣaiḥ citritam
translated: He made all those many buddha-fields into one buddha-field, one level and even expanse, delightful, adorned with trees made of the seven precious materials.

original: teṣāṃ ca ratnavṛkṣāṇāṃ pañcayojanaśatānyārohapariṇāho 'nupūrvaśākhāpatrapuṣpaphalopetaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām ca ratna vṛkṣāṇām pañca yojana śatāni āroha pariṇāhaḥ nupūrva śākhā patra puṣpa phala upetaḥ
translated: Each of those jewel trees was five hundred leagues high, with branches, leaves, flowers, and fruits in succession.

original: sarvasmiṃśca ratnavṛkṣamūle pañcayojanaśatānyārohapariṇāhaṃ divyaratnamayaṃ vicitraṃ darśanīyaṃ siṃhāsanaṃ prajñaptamabhūt /
analyzed: sarvasmin ca ratna vṛkṣa mūle pañca yojana śatāni āroha pariṇāham divya ratna mayam vicitram darśanīyam siṃhāsanam prajñaptam abhūt
translated: At the foot of each jewel tree, a lion throne was set up, made of divine jewels, marvelous and beautiful, five hundred leagues high, with the same dimensions in width.

original: teṣu ratnavṛkṣamūleṣvāgatāgatāstathāgatāḥ siṃhāsaneṣu paryaṅkaṃ baddhvā niṣīdante sma /
analyzed: teṣu ratna vṛkṣa mūleṣu āgata āgatāḥ tathāgatāḥ siṃhāsaneṣu paryaṅkam baddhvā niṣīdante sma
translated: The Tathāgatas who had come to those jewel trees sat cross-legged on those lion thrones.

original: anena paryāyeṇa punaraparāṇi viṃśatilokadhātukoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇyekaikasyāṃ diśi śākyamunistathāgataḥ pariśodhayati sma teṣāṃ tathāgatānāmāgatānāmavakāśārtham
analyzed: anena paryāyeṇa punar aparāṇi viṃśati lokadhātu koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi ekaikasyām diśi śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ pariśodhayati sma teṣām tathāgatānām āgatānām avakāśa artham
translated: In this way, Śākyamuni Tathāgata purified another twenty hundred thousand quintillion world systems in each of the ten directions, for the sake of providing space for the Tathāgatas who had come.

original: tānyapi viṃśatilokadhātukoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇyaikaikasyāṃ diśi apagatagrāmanagaranigamajanapadarāṣṭrarājadhānīni
analyzed: tāni api viṃśati lokadhātu koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi ā ekaikasyām diśi apagata grāma nagara nigama janapada rāṣṭra rājadhānīni
translated: Those other twenty hundred thousand quintillion world systems in each of the ten directions were devoid of villages, towns, cities, states, countries, and capitals,

original: apagatakālaparvatāni apagatamucilindamahāmucilindaparvatāni apagatacakravālamahācakravālaparvatāni
analyzed: apagata kālaparvatāni apagata mucilinda mahāmucilinda parvatāni apagata cakravāla mahācakravāla parvatāni
translated: devoid of Mount Cakravāḍa, Great Cakravāḍa, Muci, and Mahāmuci,

original: apagatasumeruparvatāni apagatatadanyamahāparvatāni apagatamahāsamudrāṇi apagatanadīmahānadīni
analyzed: apagata sumeru parvatāni apagata tad anya mahā parvatāni apagata mahā samudrāṇi apagata nadī mahā nadīni
translated: They were devoid of Mount Sumeru, other great mountains, the great oceans, and rivers and great rivers.

original: parisaṃsthāpayati apagatadevamanuṣyāsurakāyāni apagatanirayatiryagyoniyamalokāni /
analyzed: parisaṃsthāpayati apagata deva manuṣya asura kāyāni apagata niraya tiryagyoni yama lokāni
translated: They were devoid of the bodies of gods, humans, and asuras, and devoid of hells, animal realms, and the world of Yama.

original: te ca sarvasattvā anyeṣu lokadhātuṣūpanikṣiptāḥ /
analyzed: te ca sarva sattvāḥ anyeṣu lokadhātuṣu upanikṣiptāḥ
translated: And all those beings were placed in other world systems.

original: tānyapi buddhakṣetrāṇi vaiḍūryamayāni saptaratnahemajālapraticchannāni kiṅkiṇījālālaṃkṛtāni🔽māndāravamahāmāndāravapuṣpasaṃstīrṇāni divyavitānavitatāni divyapuṣpadāmābhipralambitāni
analyzed: tāni api buddhakṣetrāṇi vaiḍūrya mayāni sapta ratna hema jāla praticchannāni kiṅkiṇī jāla alaṃkṛtāni  māndārava mahāmāndārava puṣpa saṃstīrṇāni divya vitāna vitatāni divya puṣpa dāma abhipralambitāni
translated: Those buddha-fields were made of beryl, covered with nets of the seven precious substances and gold, adorned with nets of little bells,🔽strewn with coral tree and great coral tree flowers, covered with celestial canopies, hung with garlands of celestial flowers,

original: divyagandhadhūpanadhūpitāni ratnavṛkṣopaśobhitāni /
analyzed: divya gandha dhūpana dhūpitāni ratna vṛkṣa upaśobhitāni
translated: perfumed with celestial incense and perfume, and beautified with jeweled trees.

original: sarve ca te ratnavṛkṣāḥ pañcayojanaśatapramāṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca te ratna vṛkṣāḥ pañca yojana śata pramāṇāḥ
translated: And all those jeweled trees were five hundred leagues high.

original: pañcayojanapramāṇāni ca siṃhāsanānyabhinirmitāni /
analyzed: pañca yojana pramāṇāni ca siṃhāsanāni abhinirmitāni
translated: And five hundred league high lion thrones were created.

original: tataste tathāgatā niṣīdante sma pṛthak pṛthak siṃhāsaneṣu ratnavṛkṣamūleṣu paryaṅkaṃ baddhvā //
analyzed: tatas te tathāgatāḥ niṣīdante sma pṛthak pṛthak siṃhāsaneṣu ratna vṛkṣa mūleṣu paryaṅkam baddhvā
translated: Then those Tathagatas sat down, each on a separate lion throne at the foot of a jeweled tree, having crossed their legs.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena bhagavatā śākyamuninā ye nirmitāstathāgatāḥ pūrvasyāṃ diśi sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayanti sma gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena bhagavatā śākyamuninā ye nirmitāḥ tathāgatāḥ pūrvasyām diśi sattvānām dharmam deśayanti sma gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu
translated: At that time, the Tathagatas who were emanated by the Blessed One Shakyamuni and were teaching the Dharma to beings in the eastern direction, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,

original: te sarve samāgatā daśabhyo digbhyaḥ /
analyzed: te sarve samāgatāḥ daśabhyaḥ digbhyaḥ
translated: all assembled from the ten directions.

original: te cāgatā aṣṭāsu dikṣu niṣaṇṇā abhūvan /
analyzed: te ca āgatāḥ aṣṭāsu dikṣu niṣaṇṇāḥ abhūvan
translated: And having come, they sat in the eight directions.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayenaikaikasyāṃ diśi triṃśallokadhātukoṭīśatasahasrāṇyaṣṭabhyo digbhyaḥ samantāttaistathāgatairākrāntā abhūvan /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena ekaikasyām diśi triṃśat lokadhātu koṭī śata sahasrāṇi aṣṭabhyaḥ digbhyaḥ samantāt taiḥ tathāgataiḥ ākrāntāḥ abhūvan
translated: At that time, each of the ten directions, from the eight directions all around, was filled by those Tathagatas, with thirty hundred thousand koti of world systems in each direction.

original: atha khalu te tathāgatāḥ sveṣu sveṣu siṃhāsaneṣūpaviṣṭāḥ svān svānupasthāyakān saṃpreṣayanti sma bhagavataḥ śākyamunerantikam /
analyzed: atha khalu te tathāgatāḥ sveṣu sveṣu siṃhāsaneṣu upaviṣṭāḥ svān svān upasthāyakān saṃpreṣayanti sma bhagavataḥ śākyamuneḥ antikam
translated: Then, those Tathagatas, seated on their respective lion thrones, sent their respective attendants to the presence of the Blessed One Shakyamuni.

original: ratnapuṣpapuṭān datvā evaṃ vadanti sma gacchata yūyaṃ gṛdhrakūṭaṃ parvatam /
analyzed: ratna puṣpa puṭān da tvā evam vadanti sma gacchata yūyam gṛdhrakūṭam parvatam
translated: Having given them jeweled flower bowls, they said, Go to Vulture Peak Mountain.

original: gatvā ca punastasmiṃstaṃ bhagavantaṃ śākyamuniṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ
analyzed: gatvā ca punar tasmin tam bhagavantam śākyamunim tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham
translated: And having gone there, to that Blessed One, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, Shakyamuni,

original: vanditvā asmadvacanādalpābādhatāṃ mandaglānatāṃ ca balaṃ ca sparśavihāratāṃ ca paripṛcchadhvaṃ
analyzed: vanditvā asmad vacanāt alpa ābādha tām manda glāna tām ca balam ca sparśavihāra tām ca paripṛcchadhvam
translated: and ask about our well-being, our freedom from troubles, our ease, our strength, and our comfort.

original: sārdhaṃ bodhisattvagaṇena śrāvakagaṇena /
analyzed: sārdham bodhisattva gaṇena śrāvaka gaṇena
translated: Together with the assembly of bodhisattvas and the assembly of śrāvakas,

original: anena ca ratnarāśinā abhyavakiradhvam /
analyzed: anena ca ratna rāśinā abhyavakiradhvam
translated: and scatter this heap of jewels.

original: evaṃ ca vadadhvam dadāti khalu punarbhagavāṃstathāgataśchandamasya mahāratnastūpasya samuddhāṭane /
analyzed: evam ca vadadhvam dadāti khalu punar bhagavān tathāgataḥ chandam asya mahā ratna stūpasya samuddhāṭane
translated: And say this: 'The Blessed One, the Tathāgata, indeed gives his consent to the opening of this great jewel stūpa.'

original: evaṃ te tathāgatāḥ sarve svān svānupasthāyakān saṃpreṣayāmāsuḥ //
analyzed: evam te tathāgatāḥ sarve svān svān upasthāyakān saṃpreṣayāmāsuḥ
translated: Thus all those Tathāgatas sent their own attendants.

original: atha khalu bhagavān śākyamunistathāgatastasyāṃ velāyāṃ svānnirmitānaśeṣataḥ samāgatān viditvā /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ tasyām velāyām svān nirmitān aśeṣatas samāgatān viditvā
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, knowing that all his emanations had assembled without exception,

original: pṛthakpṛthak siṃhāsaneṣu niṣaṇṇāṃśca viditvā /🔽tāṃścopasthāyakāṃsteṣāṃ tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāmāgatān viditvā /
analyzed: pṛthak pṛthak siṃhāsaneṣu niṣaṇṇān ca viditvā  tān ca upasthāyakān teṣām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām āgatān viditvā
translated: and knowing that they were seated on separate lion thrones,🔽and knowing that the attendants of those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones had come,

original: chandaṃ ca taistathāgatairarhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhairārocitaṃ viditvā /
analyzed: chandam ca taiḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ ārocitam viditvā
translated: and knowing that the consent had been announced by those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones,

original: tasyāṃ velāyāṃ svakāddharmāsanādutthāya vaihāyasamantarīkṣe 'tiṣṭhat /
analyzed: tasyām velāyām svakāt dharma āsanāt utthāya vaihāyasam antarīkṣe tiṣṭhat
translated: at that time rose from his Dharma seat and remained in the sky in the intervening space.

original: tāśca sarvāścatasraḥ pariṣadaḥ utthāyāsanebhyo 'ñjalīḥ parigṛhya bhagavato mukhamullokayantyastasthuḥ /🔽atha khalu bhagavāṃstaṃ Vaidya
analyzed: tāḥ ca sarvāḥ catasraḥ pariṣadaḥ utthāya āsanebhyaḥ parigṛhya bhagavataḥ mukham ullokayantyaḥ tasthuḥ  atha khalu bhagavān tam vaidya
translated: All four of those assemblies rose from their seats, put their palms together, and stood looking at the face of the Blessed One.

original: mahāntaṃ ratnastūpaṃ vaihāyasaṃ sthitaṃ dakṣiṇayā hastāṅgulyā madhye samuddhāṭayati sma /
analyzed: mahāntam ratna stūpam vaihāyasam sthitam dakṣiṇayā hasta aṅgulyā madhye samuddhāṭayati sma
translated: Then the Blessed One, with his right hand, opened in the middle the great jeweled stūpa that was suspended in the air,

original: samuddhāṭya ca dve bhittī pravisārayati sma /
analyzed: samuddhāṭya ca dve bhittī pravisārayati sma
translated: and having opened it, he extended the two sides.

original: tadyathāpi nāma mahānagaradvāreṣu mahākapāṭasaṃpuṭāvargalavimuktau pravisāryete /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma mahā nagara dvāreṣu mahā kapāṭa saṃpuṭau argala vimuktau pravisāryete
translated: Just as at the gates of a great city, when the great doors are opened and released from the bolt, they are extended,

original: evameva bhagavāṃstaṃ mahāntaṃ ratnastūpaṃ vaihāyasaṃ sthitaṃ dakṣiṇayā hastāṅgulyā madhye samuddhāṭya apāvṛṇoti sma /
analyzed: evam eva bhagavān tam mahāntam ratna stūpam vaihāyasam sthitam dakṣiṇayā hasta aṅgulyā madhye samuddhāṭya apāvṛṇoti sma
translated: in the same way, the Blessed One, with his right hand, opened in the middle the great jeweled stūpa that was suspended in the air, and having opened it, he extended it.

original: samanantaravivṛtasya khalu punastasya mahāratnastūpasya /
analyzed: samanantara vivṛtasya khalu punar tasya mahā ratna stūpasya
translated: Immediately after that great jeweled stūpa was opened,

original: atha khalu bhagavān prabhūtaratnastathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ siṃhāsanopaviṣṭaḥ paryaṅkaṃ baddvā pariśuṣkagātraḥ saṃghaṭitakāyo yathā
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān prabhūtaratnaḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ siṃhāsana upaviṣṭaḥ paryaṅkam baddvā pariśuṣka gātraḥ saṃghaṭita kāyaḥ yathā
translated: then the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Prabhūtaratna, seated on a lion throne, having bound his legs in full lotus position, with his body dried up, his body composed, just as

original: samādhisamāpannastathā saṃdṛśyate sma /
analyzed: samādhi samāpannaḥ tathā saṃdṛśyate sma
translated: He was seen in that way while in samādhi.

original: evaṃ ca vācamabhāṣata sādhu sādhu bhagavan śākyamune /
analyzed: evam ca vācam abhāṣata sādhu sādhu bhagavan śākyamune
translated: And he spoke these words: Excellent, excellent, Blessed One Śākyamuni!

original: subhāṣitaste 'yaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīko dharmaparyāyaḥ /
analyzed: su bhāṣitaḥ te yam saddharmapuṇḍarīkaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ
translated: This Dharma discourse called The White Lotus of the True Dharma has been well-spoken by you.

original: sādhu khalu punastvaṃ bhagavan śākyamune yastvamimaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīkaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ parṣanmadhye bhāṣase /
analyzed: sādhu khalu punar tvam bhagavan śākyamune yaḥ tvam imam saddharmapuṇḍarīkam dharmaparyāyam parṣad madhye bhāṣase
translated: Blessed One Śākyamuni, it is truly excellent that you are teaching this Dharma discourse called The White Lotus of the True Dharma in the midst of the assembly.

original: asyaivāhaṃ bhagavan saddharmapuṇḍarīkasya dharmaparyāyasya śravaṇāyehāgataḥ //🔽atha khalu tāścatasraḥ parṣadastaṃ bhagavantaṃ prabhūtaratnaṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ
analyzed: asya eva aham bhagavan saddharmapuṇḍarīkasya dharmaparyāyasya śravaṇāya iha āgataḥ  atha khalu tāḥ catasraḥ parṣadaḥ tam bhagavantam prabhūtaratnam tathāgatam arhantam
translated: Blessed One, I have come here to listen to this Dharma discourse called The White Lotus of the True Dharma.🔽Then those four assemblies, seeing that Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Prabhūtaratna,

original: samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ bahukalpakoṭīnayutaśatasahasraparinirvṛtaṃ tathā bhāṣamāṇaṃ dṛṣṭvā
analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddham bahu kalpa koṭī nayuta śata sahasra parinirvṛtam tathā bhāṣamāṇam dṛṣṭvā
translated: who had passed into parinirvāṇa many quintillions of eons before, speaking in that way,

original: āścaryaprāptā adbhutaprāptā abhūvan /🔽tasyāṃ velāyāṃ taṃ bhagavantaṃ prabhūtaratnaṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddha
analyzed: āścarya prāptāḥ adbhuta prāptāḥ abhūvan  tasyām velāyām tam bhagavantam prabhūtaratnam tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddha
translated: were amazed and astonished.🔽At that time, they saw that Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Prabhūtaratna,

original: taṃ ca bhagavantaṃ śākyamuniṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ divyamānuṣyakai
analyzed: tam ca bhagavantam śākyamunim tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham divya mānuṣyakaiḥ
translated: and that Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Śākyamuni, with divine and human

original: ratnarāśibhirabhyavakiranti sma /
analyzed: ratna rāśibhiḥ abhyavakiranti sma
translated: and they scattered them over the Buddha.

original: atha khalu bhagavān prabhūtaratnastathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho bhagavataḥ śākyamunestathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya tasminneva siṃhāsane
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān prabhūtaratnaḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ bhagavataḥ śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya tasmin eva siṃhāsane
translated: Then the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Prabhūtaratna, who had passed into nirvāṇa, who was enshrined in a stūpa made of the seven precious materials in the middle of the stūpa,

original: tasyaiva mahāratnastūpābhyantare /
analyzed: tasya eva mahā ratna stūpa abhyantare
translated: in the middle of that great precious stūpa,

original: evaṃ ca vadati ihaiva bhagavān śākyamunistathāgato niṣīdatu /
analyzed: evam ca vadati iha eva bhagavān śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ niṣīdatu
translated: said to the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Śākyamuni, “Bhagavān Śākyamuni, sit here on my seat!”

original: atha khalu bhagavān śākyamunistathāgatastasminnardhāsane niṣasāda tenaiva tathāgatena sārdham /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ tasmin ardhāsane niṣasāda tena eva tathāgatena sārdham
translated: Then the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Śākyamuni sat down on that seat together with that tathāgata.

original: ubhau ca tau tathāgatau tasya mahāratnastūpasya madhye siṃhāsanopaviṣṭau vaihāyasamantarīkṣasthau saṃdṛśyete //
analyzed: ubhau ca tau tathāgatau tasya mahā ratna stūpasya madhye siṃhāsana upaviṣṭau vaihāyasam antarīkṣa sthau saṃdṛśyete
translated: Both tathāgatas were seen seated on lion thrones in the middle of that great precious stūpa, in the sky above.

original: atha khalu tāsāṃ catasṛṇāṃ parṣadāmetadabhavat dūrasthā vayamābhyāṃ tathāgatābhyām /
analyzed: atha khalu tāsām catasṛṇām parṣadām etat abhavat dūra sthāḥ vayam ābhyām tathāgatābhyām
translated: Then the fourfold assembly thought, “We are far from those two tathāgatas.

original: yannūnaṃ vayamapi tathāgatānubhāvena vaihāyasamabhyudgacchema iti /
analyzed: yat nūnam vayam api tathāgata anubhāvena vaihāyasam abhyudgacchema iti
translated: Let us, by the power of the Tathāgata, rise up into the air.”

original: atha khalu bhagavān śākyamunistathāgatastāsāṃ catasṛṇāṃ parṣadāṃ cetasaiva cetaḥparivitarkamājñāya
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ tāsām catasṛṇām parṣadām cetasā eva cetaḥ parivitarkam ājñāya
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, knowing with his mind the thoughts in the minds of the fourfold assembly,

original: tasyāṃ velāyāmṛddhibalena tāścatasraḥ parṣado vaihāyasamuparyantarīkṣe pratiṣṭhāpayati sma /
analyzed: tasyām velāyām ṛddhi balena tāḥ catasraḥ parṣadaḥ vaihāyasam upari antarīkṣe pratiṣṭhāpayati sma
translated: at that time, through his supernormal power, caused the fourfold assembly to stand in the air in the intermediate space.

original: atha khalu bhagavān śākyamunistathāgatastasyāṃ velāyāṃ tāścatasraḥ parṣada āmantrayate🔽sma ko bhikṣavo yuṣmākamutsahate tasyāṃ sahāyāṃ lokadhātau imaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīkaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ tasyām velāyām tāḥ catasraḥ parṣadaḥ āmantrayate  sma kaḥ bhikṣavaḥ yuṣmākam utsahate tasyām sahāyām lokadhātau imam saddharmapuṇḍarīkam
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, addressed the fourfold assembly at that time, saying:

original: dharmaparyāyaṃ saṃprakāśayitum /🔽ayaṃ sa kālaḥ /
analyzed: dharmaparyāyam saṃprakāśayitum  ayam sa kālaḥ
translated: Monks, who among you is eager to teach this Dharma discourse called The White Lotus of the True Dharma in that Sahā world system?🔽This is the time.

original: ayaṃ sa samayaḥ /
analyzed: ayam sa samayaḥ
translated: This is the occasion.

original: saṃmukhībhūtastathāgataḥ /
analyzed: saṃmukhībhūtaḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: The Tathāgata is present.

original: parinirvāyitukābho bhikṣavastathāgata imaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīkaṃ dharmaparyāyamupanikṣipya //
analyzed: parinirvāyitukā bho bhikṣavaḥ tathāgataḥ imam saddharmapuṇḍarīkam dharmaparyāyam upanikṣipya
translated: Monks, the Tathāgata, wishing to pass into parinirvāṇa, has entrusted this Dharma discourse called The White Lotus of the True Dharma.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses at that time:

original: ayamāgato nirvṛtako maharṣī ratanāmayaṃ stūpa praviśya nāyakaḥ /
analyzed: ayam āgataḥ nirvṛtakaḥ mahā ṛṣiḥ rata nāmayam stūpa praviśya nāyakaḥ
translated: The great sage has come and entered the jeweled stūpa, the guide has passed into nirvāṇa.

original: śravaṇārtha dharmasya imasya bhikṣavaḥ ko dharmahetorna janeta vīryam // / //
analyzed: śravaṇa artha dharmasya imasya bhikṣavaḥ kaḥ dharma hetoḥ na janeta vīryam
translated: For the sake of hearing this Dharma, O monks, who would not generate effort for the sake of the Dharma?

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: bahukalpakoṭīparinirvṛto 'pi so nāma adyāpi śṛṇoti dharmam /
analyzed: bahu kalpa koṭī parinirvṛtaḥ pi saḥ nāma adya api śṛṇoti dharmam
translated: Even though he attained parinirvāṇa many millions of eons ago, he still hears the Dharma.

original: tahiṃ tahiṃ gacchati dharmahetoḥ sudurlabho dharma yamevarūpaḥ // / //
analyzed: tahim tahim gacchati dharma hetoḥ su durlabhaḥ yam evarūpaḥ
translated: He goes here and there for the sake of the Dharma, for such Dharma is very difficult to obtain.

original: praṇidhānametasya vināyakasya niṣevitaṃ pūrvabhave yadāsīt /
analyzed: praṇidhānam etasya vināyakasya niṣevitam pūrva bhave yadā āsīt
translated: This is the aspiration of the Guide, cultivated in his past lives:

original: parinirvṛto 'pī imu sarvalokaṃ paryeṣatī sarvadaśaddiśāsu // / //
analyzed: sarva lokam
translated: Even though I have attained parinirvāṇa, may I still seek out this entire world in all the ten directions.

original: ime ca sarve mama ātmabhāvāḥ sahasrakoṭyo yatha gaṅgavālikāḥ /
analyzed: ime ca sarve mama ātmabhāvāḥ sahasra koṭyaḥ gaṅgavālikāḥ
translated: All of these bodies of mine, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges,

original: te dharmakṛtyasya kṛtena āgatāḥ parinirvṛtaṃ ca imu draṣṭu nātham // / //
analyzed: te dharma kṛtyasya kṛtena āgatāḥ parinirvṛtam ca imu draṣṭu nātham
translated: have come for the sake of performing the duties of the Dharma, to see this protector who has attained parinirvāṇa.

original: choritva kṣetrāṇi svakasvakāni tatha śrāvakāntara marutaśca sarvān /
analyzed: choritvā kṣetrāṇi svaka svakāni śrāvaka antara marutaḥ ca sarvān
translated: Abandoning their own individual realms, and all the other Śrāvakas and Maruts,

original: saddharmasaṃrakṣaṇahetu sarve kathaṃ ciraṃ tiṣṭhiya dharmanetrī // / //
analyzed: saddharma saṃrakṣaṇa hetu sarve katham ciram dharma netrī
translated: all of them ask, For the sake of preserving the true Dharma, how can the Dharma-eye remain for a long time?

original: eteṣu buddhāna niṣīdanārthaṃ bahulokadhātūna sahasrakoṭyaḥ /
analyzed: eteṣu buddhāna niṣīdana artham bahu lokadhātūna sahasra koṭyaḥ
translated: For the sake of seating these Buddhas, there are many millions of world systems,

original: saṃkrāmitā me tatha sarvasattvā ṛddhībalena pariśodhitāśca // / //
analyzed: saṃkrāmitāḥ me sarva sattvāḥ ṛddhī balena pariśodhitāḥ ca
translated: And I have transferred it to all beings, purifying them with the power of miracles.

original: etādṛśī utsukatā iyaṃ me kathaṃ prakāśediya dharmanetrī /
analyzed: etādṛśī utsuka tā iyam me katham dharma netrī
translated: This is my eagerness: How can this Dharma eye be revealed?

original: ime ca buddhā sthita aprameyā drumāṇa mūle yatha padmarāśiḥ // / //
analyzed: ime ca buddhā sthita aprameyāḥ drumāṇa mūle yatha padmarāśiḥ
translated: And these immeasurable Buddhas, like a heap of lotuses at the foot of a tree,

original: drumamūlakoṭīya analpakāyo siṃhāsanasthehi vināyakehi /
analyzed: analpa kāyaḥ siṃhāsana sthehi vināyakehi
translated: At the foot of a tree, in countless bodies, with the leaders seated on lion thrones,

original: śobhanti tiṣṭhanti ca nityakālaṃ hutāśaneneva yathāndhakāram // / //
analyzed: śobhanti tiṣṭhanti ca nityakālam hutāśanena iva yathā andhakāram
translated: They shine and always stand, like darkness by a blazing fire.

original: gandho manojño daśasū diśāsu pravāyate lokavināyakānām /
analyzed: gandhaḥ manojñaḥ diśāsu pravāyate loka vināyakānām
translated: The delightful fragrance of the world guides spreads in the ten directions,

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Physician

original: yenā ime mūrcchita sarvasattvā vāte pravāte iha nityakālam // / //
analyzed: yena ime mūrcchita sarva sattvāḥ vāte pravāte iha nityakālam
translated: By which all these beings are constantly intoxicated here, as if by a blowing wind.

original: mayi nirvṛte yo etaṃ dharmaparyāyu dhārayet /
analyzed: mayi nirvṛte yaḥ etam dharmaparyāyu dhārayet
translated: When I have passed into Nirvāṇa, whoever upholds this Dharma discourse,

original: kṣipraṃ vyāharatāṃ vācaṃ lokanāthāna saṃmukham // / //
analyzed: kṣipram vyāharatām vācam saṃmukham
translated: Will quickly hear the speech of the lords of the world face to face.

original: parinirvṛto hi saṃbuddhaḥ prabhūtaratano muniḥ /
analyzed: parinirvṛtaḥ hi saṃbuddhaḥ prabhūta ratanaḥ muniḥ
translated: The fully enlightened one, the sage Prabhūtaratna, has passed into Nirvāṇa.

original: siṃhanādaṃ śruṇe tasya vyavasāyaṃ karoti yaḥ // / //
analyzed: siṃhanādam śruṇe tasya vyavasāyam karoti yaḥ
translated: He who hears his lion's roar and makes a resolve,

original: ahaṃ dvitīyo bahavo ime ca ye koṭiyo āgata nāyakānām /
analyzed: aham dvitīyaḥ bahavaḥ ime ca ye nāyakānām
translated: I am the second, and these many who have come, the koṭis of leaders,

original: vyavasāya śroṣyāmi jinasya putrāt yo utsaheddharmamimaṃ prakāśitum // / //
analyzed: vyavasāya śroṣyāmi jinasya putrāt yaḥ utsahet dharmam imam prakāśitum
translated: I will listen to the resolve from the Victor's son who is eager to proclaim this Dharma.

original: ahaṃ ca tena bhavi pūjitaḥ sadā prabhūtaratnaśca jinaḥ svayaṃbhūḥ /
analyzed: aham ca tena pūjitaḥ sadā prabhūta ratnaḥ ca jinaḥ svayaṃbhūḥ
translated: And I will always be worshipped by him, and the self-arisen Victor Prabhūtaratna,

original: yo gacchate diśavidiśāsu nityaṃ śravaṇāya dharmaṃ imamevarūpam // / //
analyzed: yaḥ gacchate diśa vidiśāsu nityam śravaṇāya dharmam imam eva rūpam
translated: Who always goes to the cardinal and intermediate directions to listen to this kind of Dharma.

original: ime ca ye āgata lokanāthā vicitritā yairiya śobhitā bhūḥ /
analyzed: ime ca ye loka nāthāḥ vicitritāḥ yaiḥ iya śobhitā bhūḥ
translated: And these lords of the world who have come, by whom this earth is adorned with various things,

original: teṣāṃ pi pūjā vipula analpakā kṛtā bhavetsūtraprakāśanena // / //
analyzed: teṣām pūjā kṛtā bhavet sūtra prakāśanena
translated: Their worship would be vast and not small, if this sūtra were proclaimed.

original: ahaṃ ca dṛṣṭo iha āsanasmin bhagavāṃśca yo 'yaṃ sthitu stūpamadhye /
analyzed: aham ca dṛṣṭaḥ iha āsanasmin bhagavān ca yaḥ yam stūpa madhye
translated: And I am seen here on this seat, and this Blessed One who is standing in the middle of the stūpa,

original: ime ca anye bahulokanāthā ye āgatāḥ kṣetraśatairanekaiḥ // / //
analyzed: ime ca anye bahu loka nāthāḥ ye āgatāḥ kṣetra śataiḥ anekaiḥ
translated: And these other many lords of the world who have come from many hundreds of realms.

original: cintetha kulaputrāho sarvasatvānukampayā /
analyzed: cintetha kula putra aho sarva satva anukampayā
translated: Think, O sons of noble family, out of compassion for all beings,

original: suduṣkaramidaṃ sthānamutsahanti vināyakāḥ // / //
analyzed: su duṣkaram idam sthānam utsahanti vināyakāḥ
translated: This is a difficult task, but the guides are eager for it.

original: bahusūtrasahasrāṇi yathā gaṅgāya vālikāḥ /
analyzed: bahu sūtra sahasrāṇi yathā gaṅgāya vālikāḥ
translated: As many thousands of sūtras as there are sands in the Ganges,

original: tāni kaścitprakāśeta na tadbhavati duṣkaram // / //
analyzed: tāni kaścid prakāśeta na tat bhavati duṣkaram
translated: Someone might proclaim them, but that would not be difficult.

original: sumeruṃ yaśca hastena adhyālambitva muṣṭinā /
analyzed: sumerum yaḥ ca hastena muṣṭinā
translated: And someone might take Mount Sumeru in their hand, crush it to dust,

original: kṣipeta kṣetrakoṭīyo na tadbhavati duṣkaram // / //
analyzed: kṣipeta kṣetra koṭīyaḥ na tat bhavati duṣkaram
translated: To shake a koṭi of fields, that is not difficult.

original: yaśca imāṃ trisāhasrīṃ pādāṅguṣṭhena kampayet /
analyzed: yaḥ ca imām trisāhasrīm pādāṅguṣṭhena kampayet
translated: And he who would shake with his big toe this trichiliocosm,

original: kṣipeta kṣetrakoṭīyo na tadbhavati duṣkaram // / //
analyzed: kṣipeta kṣetra koṭīyaḥ na tat bhavati duṣkaram
translated: And throw koṭis of fields, that is not difficult.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Physician

original: bhavāgre yaśca tiṣṭhitvā dharmaṃ bhāṣennaro iha /
analyzed: bhava agre yaḥ ca tiṣṭhitvā dharmam bhāṣet naraḥ iha
translated: And he who, standing at the peak of existence, would teach the Dharma here,

original: anyasūtrasahasrāṇi na tadbhavati duṣkaram // / //
analyzed: anya sūtra sahasrāṇi na tat bhavati duṣkaram
translated: And other thousands of sūtras, that is not difficult.

original: nirvṛtasmiṃstu lokendre paścātkāle sudāruṇe /
analyzed: nirvṛtasmin tu loka indre paścātkāle su dāruṇe
translated: But when the Lord of the World has passed into Nirvāṇa, in the terrible later times,

original: ya idaṃ dhārayet sūtraṃ bhāṣedvā tatsuduṣkaram // / //
analyzed: yaḥ idam dhārayet sūtram bhāṣet vā tat su duṣkaram
translated: He who would uphold this sūtra or teach it, that is very difficult.

original: ākāśadhātuṃ yaḥ sarvāmekamuṣṭiṃ tu nikṣipet /
analyzed: ākāśa dhātum yaḥ sarvām eka muṣṭim tu nikṣipet
translated: He who would place the entire element of space in one hand,

original: prakṣipitvā ca gaccheta na tadbhavati duṣkaram // / //
analyzed: prakṣipitvā ca gaccheta na tat bhavati duṣkaram
translated: And having thrown it away, would go, that is not difficult.

original: yastu īdṛśakaṃ sūtraṃ nirvṛtasmiṃstadā mayi /
analyzed: yaḥ tu īdṛśakam sūtram nirvṛtasmin tadā mayi
translated: But he who, when I have passed into Nirvāṇa,

original: paścātkāle likheccāpi idaṃ bhavati duṣkaram // / //
analyzed: paścātkāle likhet ca api idam bhavati duṣkaram
translated: Would write this kind of sūtra in the later times, that is difficult.

original: pṛthivīdhātuṃ ca yaḥ sarvaṃ nakhāgre saṃpraveśayet /
analyzed: pṛthivī dhātum ca yaḥ sarvam nakha agre saṃpraveśayet
translated: And he who would place the entire element of earth on the tip of his nail,

original: prakṣipitvā ca gaccheta brahmalokaṃ pi āruhet // / //
analyzed: prakṣipitvā ca gaccheta brahma lokam āruhet
translated: And having thrown it away, would ascend to the Brahma world,

original: na duṣkaraṃ hi so kuryānna ca vīryasya tattakam /
analyzed: na duṣkaram hi saḥ kuryāt na ca vīryasya
translated: That would not be difficult for him, and that is not the extent of his energy.

original: taṃ duṣkaraṃ karitvāna sarvalokasyihāgrataḥ // / //
analyzed: tam duṣkaram sarva lokasya iha agratas
translated: Having performed that difficult task in the presence of the entire world,

original: ato 'pi duṣkarataraṃ nirvṛtasya tadā mama /
analyzed: duṣkarataram nirvṛtasya tadā mama
translated: Even more difficult than that is for someone

original: paścātkāle idaṃ sūtraṃ vadeyā yo muhūrtakam // / //
analyzed: paścātkāle idam sūtram vadeyāḥ yaḥ muhūrtakam
translated: To teach this sūtra for just a moment after my nirvāṇa.

original: na duṣkaramidaṃ loke kalpadāhasmi yo naraḥ /
analyzed: na duṣkaram idam loke kalpa dā aham asmi yaḥ naraḥ
translated: This is not difficult in the world: for a man

original: madhye gacchedadahyantastṛṇabhāraṃ vaheta ca // / //🔽ato 'pi duṣkarataraṃ nirvṛtasya tadā mama /
analyzed: madhye gacchet a dahyantaḥ tṛṇa bhāram vaheta ca  duṣkarataram nirvṛtasya tadā mama
translated: To walk in the midst of a burning kalpa fire and carry a load of grass.🔽Even more difficult than that is for someone

original: dhārayitvā idaṃ sūtramekasattvaṃ pi śrāvayet // / //
analyzed: dhārayitvā idam sūtram eka sattvam śrāvayet
translated: To uphold this sūtra and teach it to even one being after my nirvāṇa.

original: dharmaskandhasahasrāṇi caturaśīti dhārayet /
analyzed: dharma skandha sahasrāṇi caturaśīti dhārayet
translated: One may uphold the eighty-four thousand aggregates of the Dharma

original: sopadeśān yathāproktān deśayet prāṇikoṭinām // / //
analyzed: sa upadeśān yathā proktān deśayet prāṇi koṭinām
translated: As taught, and expound them to millions of beings,

original: na hyetaṃ duṣkaraṃ bhoti tasmin kālasmi bhikṣuṇām /
analyzed: na hi etam duṣkaram tasmin bhikṣuṇām
translated: But for the bhikṣus at that time, this is not difficult.

original: vinayecchrāvakān mahyaṃ pañcābhijñāsu sthāpayet // / //
analyzed: vinayet śrāvakān mahyam pañca abhijñāsu sthāpayet
translated: One may guide my śrāvakas and establish them in the five higher knowledges,

original: tasyedaṃ duṣkarataraṃ idaṃ sūtraṃ ca dhārayet /
analyzed: tasya idam duṣkarataram idam sūtram ca dhārayet
translated: But for them, it is even more difficult to uphold this sūtra

original: śraddadhedadhimucyedvā bhāṣedvāpi punaḥ punaḥ // / //
analyzed: śraddadhet adhimucyet vā bhāṣet vā api punar punar
translated: And have faith in it, aspire to it, and teach it again and again.🔽One may establish many thousands of koṭis

original: koṭīsahasrān bahavaḥ arhattve yo 'pi sthāpayet /
analyzed: koṭī sahasrān bahavaḥ arhat tve yaḥ pi sthāpayet
translated: In arhatship,

original: ṣaḍabhijñān mahābhāgān yathā gaṅgāya vālikāḥ // / //
analyzed: ṣaḍabhijñān mahābhāgān yathā gaṅgāya vālikāḥ
translated: The six higher knowledges and great fortune, like the sands of the Ganges.

original: ato bahutaraṃ karma karoti sa narottamaḥ /
analyzed: atas bahutaram karma karoti sa nara uttamaḥ
translated: Therefore, that supreme human performs even more karma.

original: nirvṛtasya hi yo mahyaṃ sūtraṃ dhārayate varam // / //
analyzed: nirvṛtasya hi yaḥ mahyam sūtram dhārayate varam
translated: For one who upholds this supreme sutra after my nirvana,

original: lokadhātusahasreṣu bahu me dharma bhāṣitāḥ /
analyzed: lokadhātu sahasreṣu bahu me dharma bhāṣitāḥ
translated: In thousands of world systems, much Dharma has been taught by me.

original: adyāpi cāhaṃ bhāṣāmi buddhajñānasya kāraṇāt // / //
analyzed: adyā api ca aham bhāṣāmi buddha jñānasya kāraṇāt
translated: Even now I teach, for the sake of the knowledge of a Buddha.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Physician

original: idaṃ tu sarvasūtreṣu sūtramagraṃ pravucyate /
analyzed: idam tu sarva sūtreṣu sūtram agram pravucyate
translated: This sutra is declared to be the foremost of all sutras.

original: dhāreti yo idaṃ sūtraṃ sa dhāre jinavigraham // / //
analyzed: dhārā iti idam sūtram sa dhāre jina vigraham
translated: One who upholds this sutra upholds the form of the Victor.

original: bhāṣadhvaṃ kulaputrāho saṃmukhaṃ vastathāgataḥ /
analyzed: bhāṣadhvam kula putra aho saṃmukham vaḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: Sons of noble family, speak! The Tathagata is present.

original: ya utsahati vaḥ kaścit paścātkālasmi dhāraṇam // / //
analyzed: yaḥ utsahati vaḥ kaścid paścātkālasmi dhāraṇam
translated: If any of you is able to uphold it in the future,

original: mahatpriyaṃ kṛtaṃ bhoti lokanāthāna sarvaśaḥ /
analyzed: mahat priyam kṛtam sarvaśas
translated: Great love is shown to all the Lords of the world.

original: durādhāramidaṃ sutraṃ dhārayedyo muhūrtakam // / //
analyzed: durādhāram idam sutram dhārayet yaḥ muhūrtakam
translated: If one were to uphold this difficult-to-uphold sutra for just a moment,

original: saṃvarṇitaśca so bhoti lokanāthehi sarvadā /
analyzed: saṃvarṇitaḥ ca saḥ sarvadā
translated: One would always be praised by the Lords of the world.

original: śūraḥ śauṭīryavāṃścāpi kṣiprābhijñaśca bodhaye // / //
analyzed: śūraḥ śauṭīryavān ca api kṣipra abhijñaḥ ca bodhaye
translated: One would be a hero, full of courage, and would quickly attain the knowledge leading to enlightenment.

original: dhurāvāhaśca so bhoti lokanāthāna aurasaḥ /
analyzed: dhurāvāhaḥ ca aurasaḥ
translated: One would become a son born from the heart of the Lords of the world.

original: dāntabhūmimanuprāptaḥ sūtraṃ dhāreti yo idam // / //
analyzed: dānta bhūmim anuprāptaḥ sūtram dhārā iti idam
translated: And has attained the stage of self-control, who upholds this sūtra,

original: cakṣubhūtaśca so bhoti loke sāmaramānuṣe /
analyzed: cakṣu bhūtaḥ ca saḥ loke sa amara mānuṣe
translated: He becomes an eye for the world, including the gods and humans.

original: idaṃ sutraṃ prakāśitvā nirvṛte naranāyake // / //
analyzed: idam sutram prakāśitvā nirvṛte nara nāyake
translated: Having taught this sūtra, after the Nirvāṇa of the Leader of men,

original: vandanīyaśca so bhoti sarvasattvāna paṇḍitaḥ /
analyzed: vandanīyaḥ ca saḥ bhoti sarva sattvāna paṇḍitaḥ
translated: The wise one becomes worthy of veneration by all beings.

original: paścime kāli yo bhāṣet sūtramekaṃ muhūrtakam // / //
analyzed: paścime kāli yaḥ bhāṣet sūtram ekam muhūrtakam
translated: In the future time, if one teaches this sūtra for just a moment,

original: atha khalu bhagavān kṛtsnaṃ bodhisattvagaṇaṃ sasurāsuraṃ ca lokamāmantraya etadavocat
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān kṛtsnam bodhisattva gaṇam sa sura asuram ca lokam āmantraya etat avocat
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the entire assembly of bodhisattvas and the world with its gods, humans, and asuras, saying:

original: bhūtapūrvaṃ bhikṣavo 'tīte 'dhvani ahamaprameyāsaṃkhyeyān kalpān saddharmapuṇḍarīkaṃ
analyzed: bhūta pūrvam bhikṣavaḥ tīte dhvani aham aprameya asaṃkhyeyān kalpān saddharmapuṇḍarīkam
translated: Monks, in the past, innumerable and incalculable eons ago, I sought the Saddharma-puṇḍarīka Sūtra

original: sūtraṃ paryeṣitavānakhinno 'viśrāntaḥ /
analyzed: sūtram paryeṣitavān akhinnaḥ viśrāntaḥ
translated: without weariness or rest.

original: pūrvaṃ ca ahamanekān kalpānanekāni kalpaśatasahasrāṇi rājābhūvamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau kṛtapraṇidhānaḥ /
analyzed: pūrvam ca aham anekān kalpān anekāni kalpa śata sahasrāṇi rājā abhūvam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau kṛta praṇidhānaḥ
translated: In the past, for many eons, many hundreds of thousands of eons, I was a king who made aspirations for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: na ca me cittavyāvṛttirabhūt /
analyzed: na ca me citta vyāvṛttiḥ abhūt
translated: But my mind did not turn back.

original: ṣaṇṇāṃ ca pāramitānāṃ paripūryā udyukto 'bhūvamaprameyadānapradaḥ suvarṇamaṇimuktāvaidūryaśaṅkhaśilāpravālajātarūparajatāśmagarbham
analyzed: ṣaṇṇām ca pāramitānām paripūryai udyuktaḥ bhūvam aprameya dāna pradaḥ suvarṇa maṇi muktā vaidūrya śaṅkha śilā pravāla jātarūpa rajata aśma garbham
translated: I was dedicated to fulfilling the six perfections, and I gave immeasurable gifts of gold, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, quartz, coral, refined gold, silver, and cat's eye gems.

original: usāragalvalohitamuktāgrāmanagaranigamajanapadarāṣṭrarājadhānībhāryāputraduhitṛdāsīdāsakarmakarapauruṣeyahastyaśvarathaṃ
analyzed: usāragalva lohita muktā grāma nagara nigama janapada rāṣṭra rājadhānī bhāryā putra duhitṛ dāsī dāsa karmakara pauruṣeya hasti aśva ratham
translated: I was dedicated to fulfilling the six perfections. I gave immeasurable gifts, such as gold, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, quartz, coral, red pearls, villages, towns, cities, countries, kingdoms, capitals, wives, sons, daughters, female servants, male servants, workers, elephants, horses, chariots,

original: yāvadātmaśarīraparityāgī karacaraṇaśirottamāṅgapratyaṅgajīvitadātā /
analyzed: yāvat ātma śarīra parityāgī kara caraṇa śira uttamāṅga pratyaṅga jīvita dātā
translated: up to the renunciation of my own body, giving away hands, feet, head, limbs, and even my life.

original: na ca me kadācidāgrahacittamutpannam /
analyzed: na ca me kadācid āgraha cittam utpannam
translated: And I never gave rise to a stingy mind.

original: tena ca samayena ayaṃ loko dīrghāyurabhat /
analyzed: tena ca samayena ayam lokaḥ dīrgha āyuḥ abhat
translated: At that time, this world had a long lifespan.

original: anekavarṣaśatasahasrajīvitena ca ahaṃ kālena dharmārthaṃ rājyaṃ kāritavān /
analyzed: aneka varṣa śata sahasra jīvitena ca aham kālena dharma artham rājyam kāritavān
translated: With a lifespan of many hundreds of thousands of years, I ruled the kingdom for the sake of the Dharma,

original: na viṣayārtham /
analyzed: na viṣaya artham
translated: not for the sake of sense pleasures.

original: so 'haṃ jyeṣṭhaṃ kumāraṃ rājye 'bhiṣicya caturdiśaṃ jyeṣṭhadharmagaveṣaṇāya udyukto 'bhūvam /
analyzed: saḥ ham jyeṣṭham kumāram rājye bhiṣicya caturdiśam jyeṣṭha dharma gaveṣaṇāya udyuktaḥ bhūvam
translated: Having consecrated my eldest son to the throne, I was dedicated to seeking the supreme Dharma in the four directions.

original: evaṃ ghaṇṭayā ghoṣāpayitavān yo me jyeṣṭhaṃ dharmamanupradāsyati /
analyzed: evam ghaṇṭayā ghoṣāpayitavān yaḥ me jyeṣṭham dharmam anupradāsyati
translated: Thus I proclaimed with a bell: Whoever will teach me the supreme Dharma,

original: arthaṃ cākhyāsyati /
analyzed: artham ca ākhyāsyati
translated: and explain its meaning,

original: tasyāhaṃ dāso bhūyāsam /
analyzed: tasya aham dāsaḥ bhūyāsam
translated: I will become his servant.

original: tena ca kālena ṛṣirabhūt /
analyzed: tena ca kālena ṛṣiḥ abhūt
translated: At that time, there was a sage.

original: sa māmetadavocat asti mahārāja saddharmapuṇḍarīkaṃ nāma sutraṃ jyeṣṭhadharmanirdeśakam /
analyzed: sa mām etat avocat asti mahā rāja saddharmapuṇḍarīkam nāma sutram jyeṣṭha dharma nirdeśakam
translated: He said to me, 'Great King, there is a sutra called the White Lotus of the True Dharma, which teaches the supreme Dharma.

original: tadyadi dāsyamabhyupagacchasi /
analyzed: tat yadi dāsyam abhyupagacchasi
translated: If you agree to become my servant,

original: tataste 'haṃ taṃ dharmaṃ śrāvayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: tatas te ham tam dharmam śrāvayiṣyāmi
translated: then I will recite that Dharma for you.'

original: so 'haṃ śrutvā tasyarṣervacanaṃ hṛṣṭastuṣṭa udagra āttamanāḥ prītisaumanasyajāto yena sa ṛṣistenopeyivān /
analyzed: saḥ ham śrutvā tasya ṛṣeḥ vacanam hṛṣṭaḥ tuṣṭaḥ udagraḥ ātta manāḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ yena saḥ ṛṣiḥ tena upeyivān
translated: Having heard those words of the sage, I was delighted, joyful, uplifted, and overjoyed, and I went to that sage.

original: upetyāvocat yatte dāsena karma karaṇīyaṃ tatkaromi /
analyzed: upetya avocat yat te dāsena karma karaṇīyam tat karomi
translated: Having approached, I said, 'Whatever work a servant should do, I will do that for you.'

original: so 'haṃ tasyarṣerdāsabhāvamabhyupetya tṛṇakāṣṭhapānīyakandamūlaphalādīni preṣyakarmāṇi kṛtavān /
analyzed: saḥ ham tasya ṛṣeḥ dāsa bhāvam abhyupetya tṛṇa kāṣṭha pānīya kanda mūla phala ādīni preṣya karmāṇi kṛtavān
translated: Having agreed to become that sage's servant, I performed the duties of a servant, such as fetching grass, wood, water, roots, and fruits.

original: yāvad dvārādhyakṣo 'pyahamāsam /
analyzed: yāvat
translated: I even became the doorkeeper.

original: divasaṃ caivaṃvidhaṃ karma kṛtvā rātrau śayānasya mañcake pādān dhārayāmi /
analyzed: divasam ca evaṃvidham karma kṛtvā rātrau śayānasya mañcake pādān dhārayāmi
translated: Having done such work during the day, I would hold the feet of the sage as he lay on his bed at night.

original: na ca me kāyaklamo na cetasi klamo 'bhūt /
analyzed: na ca me kāya klamaḥ na cetasi klamaḥ bhūt
translated: Yet I did not experience physical fatigue, nor mental fatigue.

original: evaṃ ca me kurvataḥ paripūrṇaṃ varṣāsahasraṃ gatam //
analyzed: evam ca me kurvataḥ paripūrṇam varṣā sahasram gatam
translated: While doing this, a full thousand years passed for me.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vaidya

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmetamevārthaṃ paridyotayannimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām etam eva artham paridyotayan imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One, illuminating just this meaning, spoke these verses:

original: kalpānatītān samanusmarāmi yadāhamāsaṃ dhārmiko dharmarājā /
analyzed: kalpān atītān samanusmarāmi yadā aham āsam dhārmikaḥ dharma rājā
translated: I remember the past eons, when I was a righteous Dharma king.

original: rājyaṃ came dharmahetoḥ kṛtaṃ tanna ca kāmahetorjyeṣṭhadharmahetoḥ // / //
analyzed: rājyam came dharma hetoḥ kṛtam tat na ca kāma hetoḥ jyeṣṭha dharma hetoḥ
translated: My kingdom was established for the sake of the Dharma, not for the sake of desire, but for the sake of the highest Dharma.

original: caturdiśaṃ me kṛta ghoṣaṇo 'yaṃ dharmaṃ vadedyastasya dāsyaṃ vrajeyam /
analyzed: caturdiśam me kṛta ghoṣaṇaḥ yam dharmam vadet yaḥ tasya dāsyam vrajeyam
translated: I proclaimed in the four directions: 'I will go into slavery for anyone who teaches the Dharma.'

original: āsīdṛṣistena kālena dhīmān sūtrasya saddharmanāmnaḥ pravaktāḥ // / //
analyzed: āsīt ṛṣiḥ tena kālena dhīmān sūtrasya saddharma nāmnaḥ pravaktāḥ
translated: At that time there was a wise sage, the expounder of the sutra called 'True Dharma.'

original: sa māmavocadyadi te dharmakāṅkṣā upehi dāsyaṃ dharmamataḥ pravakṣye /
analyzed: sa mām avocat yadi te dharma kāṅkṣā upehi dāsyam dharmam atas pravakṣye
translated: He said to me, 'If you have a desire for the Dharma, go into slavery, and then I will teach it to you.'

original: tuṣṭaścāhaṃ vacanaṃ taṃ niśāmya karmākaroddāsayogyaṃ tadā yam // / //🔽na kāyacittaklamatho spṛśenmāṃ saddharmahetordāsamāgatasya /
analyzed: tuṣṭaḥ ca aham vacanam tam niśāmya karma akarot dāsa yogyam tadā yam  na kāya citta klama atho spṛśet mām saddharma hetoḥ dāsam āgatasya
translated: Hearing those words, I was satisfied and did whatever work was suitable for a slave.🔽Neither physical nor mental fatigue should touch me, as I have come into slavery for the sake of the true Dharma.

original: praṇidhistadā me bhavi sattvahetornātmānamuddiśya na kāmahetoḥ // / //
analyzed: praṇidhiḥ tadā me sattva hetoḥ na ātmānam uddiśya na kāma hetoḥ
translated: At that time, my aspiration was for the sake of beings, not for the sake of myself or desire.

original: sa rāja āsīttadā abdhavīryo ananyakarmāṇi daśaddiśāsu /
analyzed: sa rājaḥ āsīt tadā abdha vīryaḥ an anya karmāṇi daśat diśāsu
translated: At that time, that king was Abdhāvirya, who had no other duties in the ten directions.

original: paripūrṇa kalpāna sahasrakhinno yāvatsūtraṃ labdhavān dharmanāmam // / //
analyzed: sahasra khinnaḥ yāvat sūtram labdhavān dharma nāmam
translated: For a thousand years, he was exhausted, until he obtained the sūtra called the Dharma.

original: tatkiṃ manyadhve bhikṣavaḥ anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena rājābhūt /
analyzed: tat kim manyadhve bhikṣavaḥ anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena rājā abhūt
translated: What do you think, monks? Was there another king at that time and in those days?

original: na khalu punarevaṃ draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: na khalu punar evam draṣṭavyam
translated: You should not see it like that.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: ahaṃ sa tena kālena tena samayena rājābhūvam /
analyzed: aham sa tena kālena tena samayena rājā abhūvam
translated: I was the king at that time and in those days.

original: syātkhalu punarbhikṣavo 'nyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayenarṣirabhūt /
analyzed: syāt khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ nyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena ṛṣiḥ abhūt
translated: Monks, could there have been another sage at that time and in those days?

original: na khalu punarevaṃ draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: na khalu punar evam draṣṭavyam
translated: You should not see it like that.

original: ayameva sa tena kālena tena samayena devadatto bhikṣurṛṣirabhut /
analyzed: ayam eva sa tena kālena tena samayena devadattaḥ bhikṣuḥ ṛṣiḥ abhut
translated: At that time and in those days, the monk Devadatta was the sage.

original: devadatto hi bhikṣavo mama kalyāṇamitram /
analyzed: devadattaḥ hi bhikṣavaḥ mama kalyāṇa mitram
translated: Monks, Devadatta is my good friend.

original: devadattameva cāgamya mayā ṣaṭū pāramitāḥ paripūritāḥ /
analyzed: devadattam eva ca āgamya mayā ṣaṭū pāramitāḥ paripūritāḥ
translated: It is by relying on Devadatta alone that I have perfected the six perfections.

original: mahāmaitrī mahākaruṇā mahāmuditā mahopekṣā /
analyzed: mahā maitrī mahā karuṇā mahā muditā mahā upekṣā
translated: Great loving-kindness, great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity.

original: dvātriṃśanmahāpuruṣalakṣaṇāni aśītyanuvyañjanāni suvarṇavarṇacchavitā daśa balāni
analyzed: dvātriṃśat mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇāni aśīti anuvyañjanāni suvarṇa varṇa chavi tā daśa balāni
translated: The thirty-two marks of a great man, the eighty minor marks, a golden-colored body, the ten powers,

original: catvāri vaiśāradyāni catvāri saṃgrahavastūni aṣṭādaśāveṇikabuddhadharmā maharddhibalatā
analyzed: catvāri vaiśāradyāni catvāri saṃgraha vastūni aṣṭādaśa āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ mahā ṛddhi bala tā
translated: The four fearlessnesses, the four bases of miraculous power, the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, great power and strength,

original: daśadiksattvanistāraṇatā /
analyzed: daśa diś sattva nistāraṇa tā
translated: and the ability to liberate beings in the ten directions.

original: sarvametaddevadattamāgasya /
analyzed: sarvam etat devadatta māgasya
translated: All of this belongs to Devadatta.

original: ārocayāmi vo bhikṣavaḥ /
analyzed: ārocayāmi vaḥ bhikṣavaḥ
translated: I announce to you, monks,

original: prativedayāmi eṣa devadatto bhikṣuranāgate 'dhvani aprameyaiḥ kalpairasaṃkhyeyairdevarājo nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho Vaidya
analyzed: prativedayāmi eṣa devadattaḥ bhikṣuḥ anāgate dhvani aprameyaiḥ kalpaiḥ asaṃkhyeyaiḥ devarājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ vaidya
translated: I make it known that this monk Devadatta, in the future, after immeasurable and incalculable eons, will become a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One named Devendra,

original: bhaviṣyati vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca bhagavān devasopānāyāṃ lokadhātau
analyzed: bhaviṣyati vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca bhagavān deva sopānāyām lokadhātau
translated: a knower of the world, a leader of those to be trained, a supreme one, a teacher of gods and humans, an Enlightened One, a Blessed One, in the world system called Devakrama.

original: devarājasya khalu punarbhikṣavastathāgatasya viṃśatyantarakalpānāyuṣpramāṇaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: devarājasya khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ tathāgatasya viṃśati antara kalpān āyuṣpramāṇam bhaviṣyati
translated: Monks, the lifespan of the Tathāgata Devendra will be twenty intermediate eons.

original: vistareṇa ca dharmaṃ deśayiṣyati /
analyzed: vistareṇa ca dharmam deśayiṣyati
translated: And he will extensively teach the Dharma.

original: gaṅgānadīvālukāsamāśca sattvāḥ sarvakleśaprahāṇādarhattvaṃ sākṣātkariṣyanti /
analyzed: gaṅgā nadī vālukā samāḥ ca sattvāḥ sarva kleśa prahāṇāt arhat tvam sākṣātkariṣyanti
translated: Beings as numerous as the sands of the Ganges will directly realize arhatship through the complete abandonment of all afflictions.

original: aneke ca sattvāḥ pratyekabodhau cittamutpādayiṣyanti /
analyzed: aneke ca sattvāḥ pratyeka bodhau cittam utpādayiṣyanti
translated: And many beings will generate the intention to achieve individual enlightenment.

original: gaṅgānadīvālukāsamāśca sattvā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpādayiṣyanti /
analyzed: gaṅgā nadī vālukā samāḥ ca sattvāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayiṣyanti
translated: And beings as numerous as the sands of the Ganges will generate the mind of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

original: avaivartikakṣāntipratilabdhāśca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: a vaivartika kṣānti pratilabdhāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: And they will attain irreversible patience.

original: devarājasya khalu punarbhikṣavastathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya viṃśatyantarakalpān saddharmaḥ sthāsyati /
analyzed: devarājasya khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya viṃśati antara kalpān saddharmaḥ sthāsyati
translated: Bhikṣus, after the parinirvāṇa of the Tathāgata Devendra, the true Dharma will remain for twenty intermediate eons.

original: na ca śarīraṃ dhātubhedena bhetsyate /
analyzed: na ca śarīram dhātu bhedena bhetsyate
translated: And the body will not be divided into relics.

original: ekaghanaṃ cāsya śarīraṃ bhaviṣyati saptaratnastūpaṃ praviṣṭam /
analyzed: eka ghanam ca asya śarīram bhaviṣyati sapta ratna stūpam praviṣṭam
translated: His body will be one whole, entered into a stūpa of the seven precious substances.

original: sa ca stūpaḥ ṣaṣṭiyojanaśatānyuccaistvena bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: sa ca stūpaḥ ṣaṣṭi yojana śatāni uccaistvena bhaviṣyati
translated: And that stūpa will be sixty yojanas high.

original: catvāriṃśadyojanānyāyāmena /
analyzed: catvāriṃśat yojanāni āyāmena
translated: Forty yojanas in breadth.

original: sarve ca tatra devamanuṣyāḥ pūjāṃ kariṣyanti puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākābhirgāthābhiḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca tatra deva manuṣyāḥ pūjām kariṣyanti puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ gāthābhiḥ
translated: And all the gods and humans there will make offerings with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, flags, and verses.

original: tena cābhiṣṭoṣyanti /
analyzed: tena ca abhiṣṭoṣyanti
translated: And they will praise it.

original: ye ca taṃ stūpaṃ pradakṣiṇaṃ kariṣyanti praṇāmaṃ vā /
analyzed: ye ca tam stūpam pradakṣiṇam kariṣyanti praṇāmam vā
translated: And those who circumambulate that stūpa or bow to it,

original: teṣāṃ kecidagraphalamarhattvaṃ sākṣātkariṣyanti kecit pratyekabodhimanuprāpsyante acintyācāścāprameyā devamanuṣyā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau
analyzed: teṣām kecid agra phalam arhat tvam sākṣātkariṣyanti kecid pratyeka bodhim anuprāpsyante acintya ācāḥ ca aprameyāḥ deva manuṣyāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Some of them will manifest the highest fruit, arhatship, some will attain the enlightenment of a pratyekabuddha, and countless, innumerable devas and humans will generate the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening,

original: cittānyutpādya avinivartanīyā bhaviṣyanti //
analyzed: cittāni utpādya a vinivartanīyāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: and will become irreversible.”

original: atha khalu bhagavān punareva bhikṣusaṃghamāmantrayate sma yaḥ kaścit bhikṣavo 'nāgate 'dhvani kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīkaṃ 🔽sūtraparivartaṃ śroṣyati /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān punar eva bhikṣu saṃgham āmantrayate sma yaḥ kaścid bhikṣavaḥ na āgate dhvani kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imam saddharmapuṇḍarīkam  sūtra parivartam śroṣyati
translated: Then the Blessed One again addressed the assembly of monks: “Monks, any noble son or noble daughter in the future who hears this chapter of the Dharma Flower Sutra,

original: śrutvā ca na kāṅkṣiṣyati na vicikitsiṣyati /
analyzed: śrutvā ca na kāṅkṣiṣyati na vicikitsiṣyati
translated: hears it and does not doubt it,

original: viśuddhacittaścādhimokṣyate /
analyzed: viśuddha cittaḥ ca adhimokṣyate
translated: but with a pure mind believes in it and accepts it,

original: tena tisṛṇāṃ durgatīnāṃ dvāraṃ pithitaṃ bhaviṣyati ḥ narakatiryagyoniyamalokopapattiṣu na patiṣyati /
analyzed: tena tisṛṇām durgatīnām dvāram pithitam bhaviṣyati naraka tiryagyoni yama loka upapattiṣu na patiṣyati
translated: will shut the door to the three evil destinies and will not fall into the hells, animal realms, or the realm of hungry ghosts.

original: daśadigbuddhakṣetropapannaścedameva sūtraṃ janmani janmani śroṣyati /
analyzed: daśa diś buddhakṣetra upapannaḥ ca idam eva sūtram janmani janmani śroṣyati
translated: If reborn in the buddha-lands of the ten directions, in lifetime after lifetime he will hear this sutra.

original: devamanuṣyalokopapannasya cāsya viśiṣṭasthānaprāptirbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: deva manuṣya loka upapannasya ca asya viśiṣṭa sthāna prāptiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: If reborn in the realms of devas and humans, he will attain the most distinguished status.

original: yasmiṃśca buddhakṣetra upapatsyate /
analyzed: yasmin ca buddhakṣetre upapatsyate
translated: And in whatever Buddha-field he will be reborn,

original: tasminnaupapāduke saptaratnamaye padme upapatsyate tathāgatasya saṃmukham //
analyzed: tasmin aupapāduke sapta ratna maye padme upapatsyate tathāgatasya saṃmukham
translated: he will be reborn in a lotus made of the seven precious substances, in the presence of the Tathagata, by spontaneous birth.

original: atha khalu tasyāṃ velāyāmadhastāddiśaḥ prabhūtaratnasya tathāgatasya buddhakṣetrādāgataḥ prajñākūṭo nāma bodhisattvaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu tasyām velāyām adhastāddiśaḥ prabhūtaratnasya tathāgatasya buddhakṣetrāt āgataḥ prajñākūṭaḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ
translated: Then at that time the Bodhisattva named Prajnakūṭa came from the Buddha-field of the Tathāgata Prabhūtaratna, from below.

original: sa taṃ prabhūtaratnaṃ tathāgatametadavocat gacchāmo bhagavan svakaṃ buddhakṣetram /
analyzed: sa tam prabhūtaratnam tathāgatam etat avocat gacchāmaḥ bhagavan svakam buddhakṣetram
