translated: He said this to the Tathāgata Prabhūtaratna: We will go, Blessed One, to our own Buddha-field.

original: atha khalu bhagavān śākyamunistathāgataḥ prajñākūṭaṃ bodhisattvametadavocat muhūrtaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ prajñākūṭam bodhisattvam etat avocat muhūrtam
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, said this to the Bodhisattva Prajñākūṭa: Wait a moment,

original: tāvat kulaputra āgamayasva yāvanmadīyena bodhisattvena mañjuśriyā kumārabhūtena sārdhaṃ
analyzed: tāvat kula putra āgamayasva yāvat madīyena bodhisattvena mañjuśriyā kumāra bhūtena sārdham
translated: son of good family, until you have had some discussion of the Dharma with my Bodhisattva Mañjuśrī, the Youth,

original: kaṃcideva dharmaviniścayaṃ kṛtvā paścāt svakaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ gamiṣyasi /
analyzed: kaṃcid eva dharma viniścayam kṛtvā paścāt svakam buddhakṣetram gamiṣyasi
translated: and then afterwards you can go to your own Buddha-field.

original: atha khalu tasyāṃ velāyāṃ mañjuśrīḥ kumārabhūtaḥ sahasrapatre padme śakaṭacakrapramāṇamātre
analyzed: atha khalu tasyām velāyām mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ sahasra patre padme śakaṭa cakra pramāṇa mātre
translated: Then at that time Mañjuśrī, the Youth, on a lotus with a thousand petals, the size of a chariot wheel,

original: niṣaṇṇo 'nekabodhisattvaparivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ samudramadhyāt sāgaranāgarājabhavanādabhyudgamya
analyzed: niṣaṇṇaḥ neka bodhisattva parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ samudra madhyāt sāgara nāga rāja bhavanāt abhyudgamya
translated: He was seated, surrounded and honored by many bodhisattvas, having emerged from the middle of the ocean, from the palace of the nāga king Sāgara,

original: upari vaihāyasaṃ khagapathena gṛdhrakūṭe parvate bhagavato 'ntikamupasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: upari vaihāyasam khaga pathena gṛdhrakūṭe parvate bhagavataḥ ntikam upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: and having flown through the sky, on the path of the birds, he had approached the Blessed One on Vulture Peak Mountain.

original: atha mañjuśrīḥ kumārabhūtaḥ padmādavatīrya bhagavataḥ śākyamuneḥ prabhūtaratnasya ca tathāgatasya pādau śirasābhivanditvā yena prajñākūṭo bodhisattvastenopasaṃkrāntaḥ
analyzed: atha mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ padmāt avatīrya bhagavataḥ śākyamuneḥ prabhūtaratnasya ca tathāgatasya pādau śirasā abhivanditvā yena prajñākūṭaḥ bodhisattvaḥ tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: Then Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, having descended from the lotus, bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One Śākyamuni and of the Tathāgata Prabhūtaratna, and approached the bodhisattva Heap of Wisdom.

original: upasaṃkramya prajñākūṭena bodhisattvena sārdhaṃ saṃmukhaṃ saṃmodanīṃ saṃrañjanīṃ vividhāṃ kathāmupasaṃgṛhya ekānte nyaṣīdat /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya prajñākūṭena bodhisattvena sārdham saṃmukham saṃmodanīm saṃrañjanīm vividhām kathām upasaṃgṛhya ekānte nyaṣīdat
translated: Having approached, he engaged in various delightful and entertaining conversations with the bodhisattva Heap of Wisdom, and then sat to one side.

original: atha khalu prajñākūṭo bodhisattvo mañjuśriyaṃ kumārabhūtametadavocat samudramadhyagatena tvayā mañjuśrīḥ kiyān sattvadhāturvinītaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu prajñākūṭaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mañjuśriyam kumāra bhūtam etat avocat samudra madhya gatena tvayā mañjuśrīḥ kiyān sattvadhātuḥ vinītaḥ
translated: Then the bodhisattva Heap of Wisdom said this to Mañjuśrī, the youthful one: Having gone to the middle of the ocean, Mañjuśrī, how many beings have you guided?

original: mañjuśrīrāha anekānyaprameyāṇyasaṃkhyeyāni sattvāni vinītāni /
analyzed: mañjuśrīḥ āha anekāni aprameyāṇi asaṃkhyeyāni sattvāni vinītāni
translated: Mañjuśrī said, Many beings have been guided, countless and immeasurable.

original: tāvadaprameyāṇyasaṃkhyeyāni yāvadvācā na śakyaṃ vijñāpayituṃ cittena vā cintayitum Vaidya /
analyzed: tāvat aprameyāṇi asaṃkhyeyāni yāvat vācā na śakyam vijñāpayitum cittena vā cintayitum vaidya
translated: As many as cannot be expressed by speech or conceived by the mind.

original: muhūrtaṃ tāvat kulaputra āgamayasva yāvat pūrvanimittaṃ drakṣyasi /
analyzed: muhūrtam tāvat kula putra āgamayasva yāvat pūrva nimittam drakṣyasi
translated: Just wait a moment, noble one, until you see the previous signs.

original: samanantarabhāṣitā ceyaṃ mañjuśriyā kumārabhūtena vāk /
analyzed: samanantara bhāṣitā ca iyam mañjuśriyā kumāra bhūtena vāc
translated: As soon as Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, spoke these words,

original: tasyāṃ velāyāmanekāni padmasahasrāṇi samudramadhyādabhyudgatāni upari vaihāyasam /
analyzed: tasyām velāyām anekāni padma sahasrāṇi samudra madhyāt abhyudgatāni upari vaihāyasam
translated: many thousands of lotuses emerged from the middle of the ocean, floating in the sky above.

original: teṣu ca padmeṣvanekāni bodhisattvasahasrāṇi saṃniṣaṇṇāni /
analyzed: teṣu ca padmeṣu anekāni bodhisattva sahasrāṇi saṃniṣaṇṇāni
translated: And on those lotuses, many thousands of bodhisattvas were seated.

original: atha te bodhisattvāstenaiva khagapathena yena gṛdhrakūṭaḥ parvatastenopasaṃkrāntāḥ /
analyzed: atha te bodhisattvāḥ tena eva khaga pathena yena gṛdhrakūṭaḥ parvataḥ tena upasaṃkrāntāḥ
translated: Then those bodhisattvas, by that very path through the sky, went to Vulture Peak Mountain.

original: upasaṃkramya tataścopari vaihāyasaṃ sthitāḥ saṃdṛśyante sma /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya tatas ca upari vaihāyasam sthitāḥ saṃdṛśyante sma
translated: Having arrived, they were seen standing in the sky above.

original: sarve ca te mañjuśriyā kumārabhūtena vinītā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: sarve ca te mañjuśriyā kumāra bhūtena vinītāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And all of them were guided by Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, towards unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: tatra ye bodhisattvā mahāyānasaṃprasthitāḥ pūrvamabhūvan /
analyzed: tatra ye bodhisattvāḥ mahāyāna saṃprasthitāḥ pūrvam abhūvan
translated: Among them, those bodhisattvas who had previously set out in the Great Vehicle,

original: te mahāyānaguṇān ṣaṭ pāramitāḥ saṃvarṇayanti /
analyzed: te mahāyāna guṇān ṣaṭ pāramitāḥ saṃvarṇayanti
translated: they praised the qualities of the Great Vehicle, the six perfections.

original: ye śrāvakapūrvā bodhisattvāste śrāvakayānameva saṃvarṇayanti /🔽sarve ca te sarvadharmān śūnyāniti
analyzed: ye śrāvaka pūrvāḥ bodhisattvāḥ te śrāvaka yānam eva saṃvarṇayanti  sarve ca te sarva dharmān śūnyān iti
translated: Those bodhisattvas who were previously śrāvakas praised only the Śrāvakayāna.

original: saṃjānanti sma /
analyzed: saṃjānanti sma
translated: And all of them perceived all phenomena as empty.

original: mahāyānagūṇāṃśca /
analyzed: mahāyāna gūṇān ca
translated: And the qualities of the Mahāyāna.

original: atha khalu mañjuśrīḥ kumārabhūtaḥ prajñākūṭaṃ bodhisattvametadavocat sarvo 'yaṃ kulaputra mayā samudramadhyagatena sattvavinayaḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ prajñākūṭam bodhisattvam etat avocat sarvaḥ yam kula putra mayā samudra madhya gatena sattva vinayaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: Then Mañjuśrī, the youthful bodhisattva, said this to the bodhisattva Prajñākūṭa: All these beings, O son of noble family, have been guided by me while in the middle of the ocean.

original: sa cāyaṃ saṃdṛśyate /
analyzed: sa ca ayam saṃdṛśyate
translated: And this is seen.

original: atha khalu prajñākūṭo bodhisattvo mañjuśriyaṃ kumārabhūtaṃ gāthābhigītena paripṛcchati 🔽mahābhadra prajñayā sūranāman asaṃkhyeyā ye vinītāstvayādya /
analyzed: atha khalu prajñākūṭaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mañjuśriyam kumāra bhūtam gāthā abhigītena paripṛcchati  mahā bhadra prajñayā sūra nāman asaṃkhyeyāḥ ye vinītāḥ tvayā adya
translated: Then the bodhisattva Prajñākūṭa asked Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, with a verse:🔽O greatly virtuous one, O wise one named Sūra, those countless beings who have been guided by you today,

original: sattvā amī kasya cāyaṃ prabhāvastadbūhi pṛṣṭo naradeva tvametat // / //
analyzed: sattvāḥ amī kasya ca ayam prabhāvaḥ tat būhi pṛṣṭaḥ naradeva tvam etat
translated: to whom does this power belong? Tell me this, O god among men, when asked.

original: kaṃ vā dharmaṃ deśitavānasi tvaṃ kiṃ vā sūtraṃ bodhimārgopadeśam /
analyzed: kam vā dharmam deśitavān asi tvam kim vā sūtram bodhi mārga upadeśam
translated: What Dharma have you taught? What sūtra that teaches the path to enlightenment?

original: yacchrutvāmī bodhaye jātacittāḥ sarvajñatve niścitaṃ labdhagādhāḥ // / //
analyzed: yat śrutvā amī bodhaye jāta cittāḥ sarvajña tve niścitam labdha gādhāḥ
translated: Hearing which, these beings have generated the mind set on enlightenment and have attained the depth of certainty in omniscience.

original: mañjuśrīrāha samudramadhye saddharmapuṇḍarīkaṃ sūtraṃ bhāṣitavān / na cānyat /
analyzed: mañjuśrīḥ āha samudra madhye saddharmapuṇḍarīkam sūtram bhāṣitavān na ca anyat
translated: Mañjuśrī said, In the middle of the ocean, I have expounded the Saddharma-puṇḍarīka Sūtra, and nothing else.

original: prajñākūṭa āha idaṃ sūtraṃ gambhīraṃ sūkṣmaṃ durdṛśam /
analyzed: prajñākūṭaḥ āha idam sūtram gambhīram sūkṣmam durdṛśam
translated: Prajñākūṭa said, This sūtra is profound, subtle, and difficult to see.

original: na cānena sutreṇa kiṃcidanyat sūtraṃ samamasti /
analyzed: na ca anena sutreṇa kiṃcid anyat sūtram samam asti
translated: And this sūtra has no equal to any other sūtra.

original: asti kaścit sattvo ya idaṃ sūtraratnaṃ satkuryādavaboddhumanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhum /
analyzed: asti kaścid sattvaḥ yaḥ idam sūtra ratnam satkuryāt avaboddhum anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhum
translated: Is there any being who would honor this jewel of a sūtra to understand it and attain supreme perfect enlightenment?

original: mañjuśrīrāha asti kulaputra sāgarasya nāgarājño duhitā aṣṭavarṣā jātyā mahāprajñā
analyzed: mañjuśrīḥ āha asti kula putra sāgarasya nāga rājñaḥ duhitā aṣṭa varṣā jātyā mahā prajñā
translated: Mañjuśrī said, Son of noble family, there is the daughter of the nāga king of the ocean, born eight years ago, of great wisdom,🔽with sharp faculties, endowed with bodily, verbal, and mental actions preceded by knowledge,

original: tīkṣṇendriyā jñānapūrvaṃgamena kāyavāṅmanaskarmaṇā samanvāgatā sarvatathāgatabhāṣitavyañjanārthodgrahaṇe
analyzed: tīkṣṇa indriyā jñāna pūrvaṃgamena kāya vāc manaḥ karmaṇā samanvāgatā sarva tathāgata bhāṣita vyañjana artha udgrahaṇe
translated: who has attained the dhāraṇīs for grasping the words and meanings spoken by all tathāgatas,

original: dhāraṇīpratilabdhā sarvadharmasattvasamādhānasamādhisahasraikakṣaṇapratilābhinī /
analyzed: dhāraṇī pratilabdhā sarva dharma sattva samādhāna samādhi sahasra eka kṣaṇa pratilābhinī
translated: who attains in a single instant thousands of concentrations and meditative absorptions on all phenomena and beings,

original: bodhicittāvinivartinī vistīrṇapraṇidhānā sarvasattveṣvātmapremānugatā guṇotpādane ca samarthā /
analyzed: bodhi citta avinivartinī vistīrṇa praṇidhānā sarva sattveṣu ātma prema anugatā guṇa utpādane ca samarthā
translated: who is not turned away from the mind of enlightenment, whose vast aspirations follow her love for all beings, who is able to produce virtues,

original: na ca tebhyaḥ parihīyate /
analyzed: na ca tebhyaḥ parihīyate
translated: and who does not fall away from them.

original: smitamukhī paramayā śubhavarṇapuṣkalatayā samanvāgatā maitracittā karuṇāṃ ca vācaṃ bhāṣate /
analyzed: smita mukhī paramayā śubha varṇa puṣkala tayā samanvāgatā maitra cittā karuṇām ca vācam bhāṣate
translated: She has a smiling face, is endowed with the highest beautiful complexion, has a loving mind, and speaks words of compassion.

original: sā samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhuṃ samarthāṃ /
analyzed: sā samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhum samarthām
translated: She is able to fully awaken to supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: prajñākūṭo bodhisattva āha dṛṣṭo mayā bhagavān śākyamunistathāgato bodhāya ghaṭamāno bodhisattvabhūto 'nekāni puṇyāni kṛtavān /
analyzed: prajñākūṭaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha dṛṣṭaḥ mayā bhagavān śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ bodhāya ghaṭamānaḥ bodhisattva bhūtaḥ nekāni puṇyāni kṛtavān
translated: Bodhisattva Prajñākūṭa said, I have seen the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, striving for enlightenment. As a bodhisattva, he performed many meritorious deeds.

original: anekāni ca kalpasahasrāṇi na kadācid vīryaṃ sraṃsitavān /
analyzed: anekāni ca kalpa sahasrāṇi na kadācid vīryam sraṃsitavān
translated: For many thousands of eons, he never slackened in his diligence.

original: trisāhasramahāsāhasrāyāṃ lokadhātau nāsti kaścidantaśaḥ sarṣapamātro 'pi pṛthivīpradeśaḥ yatrānena śarīraṃ na nikṣiptaṃ sattvahitahetoḥ /
analyzed: tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrāyām lokadhātau na asti kaścid antaśas pṛthivī pradeśaḥ yatra anena śarīram na nikṣiptam sattva hita hetoḥ
translated: In the great trichiliocosm, there is not even a mustard seed's worth of space where he has not given up his body for the benefit of beings.

original: paścād bodhimabhisaṃbuddha /
analyzed: paścāt bodhim abhisaṃbuddha
translated: Only then did he fully awaken to enlightenment.

original: ka evaṃ śraddadhyāt /
analyzed: kaḥ evam śraddadhyāt
translated: Who would believe that?

original: yadanayā śakyaṃ muhūrtena anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhum /Vaidya
analyzed: yat anayā śakyam muhūrtena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhum vaidya
translated: That she is able to fully awaken to supreme perfect enlightenment in an instant.

original: atha khalu tasyāṃ velāyāṃ sāgaranāgarājaduhitā agrataḥ sthitā saṃdṛśyate sma /
analyzed: atha khalu tasyām velāyām sāgara nāga rāja duhitā agratas sthitā saṃdṛśyate sma
translated: Then at that time, the daughter of the ocean dragon king appeared standing in front.

original: sā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandya ekānte 'sthāt /
analyzed: sā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya ekānte sthāt
translated: She bowed her head to the Blessed One's feet and stood to one side.

original: tasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: At that time, she spoke these verses:

original: puṇyaṃ puṇyaṃ gabhīraṃ ca diśaḥ sphurati sarvaśaḥ /
analyzed: puṇyam puṇyam gabhīram ca diśaḥ sphurati sarvaśas
translated: Meritorious, meritorious, and profound, it shines in all directions.

original: sūkṣmaṃ śarīraṃ dvātriṃśallakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṃkṛtam // / //🔽anuvyajanayuktaṃ ca sarvasattvanamaskṛtam /
analyzed: sūkṣmam śarīram dvātriṃśat lakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṃkṛtam  anuvyajana yuktam ca sarva sattva namaskṛtam
translated: The subtle body adorned with thirty-two marks,🔽Equipped with a fan, revered by all beings,

original: sarvasattvābhigamyaṃ ca antarāpaṇavadyathā // / //
analyzed: sarva sattva abhigamyam ca antarāpaṇa vat yathā
translated: Approachable by all beings, like a marketplace,

original: yathecchayā me saṃbodhiḥ sākṣī me 'tra tathāgataḥ /
analyzed: yathā icchayā me saṃbodhiḥ sākṣī me tathāgataḥ
translated: As I wish, may I attain enlightenment. The Tathagata is my witness here.

original: vistīrṇaṃ deśayiṣyāmi dharmaṃ duḥkhapramocanam // / //
analyzed: vistīrṇam deśayiṣyāmi dharmam duḥkha pramocanam
translated: I will teach the vast Dharma for the liberation from suffering.

original: atha khalu tasyāṃ velāyāmāyuṣmān śāriputrastāṃ sāgaranāgarājaduhitarametadavocat kevalaṃ kulaputri bodhāya cittamutpannam /
analyzed: atha khalu tasyām velāyām āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ tām sāgara nāga rāja duhitaram etat avocat kevalam kula putri bodhāya cittam utpannam
translated: Then at that time the Venerable Shariputra said to the daughter of the Naga King Sagara, Noble lady, you have only given rise to the mind of enlightenment.

original: avivartyāprameyaprajñā cāsi /
analyzed: a vivartya aprameya prajñā ca asi
translated: You have irreversible and immeasurable wisdom.

original: samyaksaṃbuddhatvaṃ tu durlabham /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddha tvam tu durlabham
translated: But perfect Buddhahood is difficult to attain.

original: asti kulaputri strī na ca vīryaṃ sraṃsayati /
analyzed: asti kula putri strī na ca vīryam sraṃsayati
translated: Noble lady, there is a woman who does not let her virtue decline,

original: anekāni ca kalpaśatānyanekāni ca kalpasahasrāṇi puṇyāni karoti /
analyzed: anekāni ca kalpa śatāni anekāni ca kalpa sahasrāṇi puṇyāni karoti
translated: And for many hundreds of eons, many thousands of eons, she makes merit.

original: ṣaṭ pāramitāḥ paripūrayati /
analyzed: ṣaḍ pāramitāḥ paripūrayati
translated: He fulfills the six perfections.

original: na cādyāpi buddhatvaṃ prāpnoti /
analyzed: na ca adya api buddha tvam prāpnoti
translated: But he still has not attained Buddhahood.

original: kiṃ kāraṇam /
analyzed: kim kāraṇam
translated: What is the reason?

original: pañca sthānāni strī adyāpi na prāpnoti /
analyzed: pañca sthānāni strī adya api na prāpnoti
translated: There are five positions that a woman still has not attained.

original: katamāni pañca /
analyzed: katamāni pañca
translated: What are the five?

original: prathamaṃ brahmasthānaṃ dvitīyaṃ śakrasthānaṃ tṛtīyaṃ mahārājasthānaṃ caturthaṃ cakravartisthānaṃ pañcamamavaivartikabodhisattvasthānam //
analyzed: prathamam brahma sthānam dvitīyam śakra sthānam tṛtīyam mahārāja sthānam caturtham cakravarti sthānam pañcamam avaivartika bodhisattva sthānam
translated: The first is the position of Brahmā, the second is the position of Śakra, the third is the position of the Great Kings, the fourth is the position of a wheel-turning king, and the fifth is the position of an irreversible bodhisattva.

original: atha khalu tasyāṃ velāyāṃ sāgaranāgarājaduhitureko maṇirasti /
analyzed: atha khalu tasyām velāyām sāgara nāga rāja duhituḥ ekaḥ maṇiḥ asti
translated: Then at that time, the daughter of the Sāgara Nāga King had a jewel.

original: yaḥ kṛtsnāṃ mahāsāhasrāṃ lokadhātuṃ mūlyaṃ kṣamate /
analyzed: yaḥ kṛtsnām mahā sāhasrām lokadhātum mūlyam kṣamate
translated: Which is worth the entire great trichiliocosm.

original: sa ca maṇistayā sāgaranāgarājaduhitrā bhagavate dattaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca maṇiḥ tayā sāgara nāga rāja duhitrā bhagavate dattaḥ
translated: And that jewel was given by that daughter of the Sāgara Nāga King to the Blessed One.

original: sa bhagavatā ca anukampāmupādāya pratigṛhītaḥ /
analyzed: sa bhagavatā ca anukampām upādāya pratigṛhītaḥ
translated: And it was accepted by the Blessed One out of compassion.

original: atha sāgaranāgarājaduhitā prajñākūṭaṃ bodhisattvaṃ sthaviraṃ ca śāriputrametadavocat yo 'yaṃ maṇirmayā bhagavato dattaḥ /
analyzed: atha sāgara nāga rāja duhitā prajñākūṭam bodhisattvam sthaviram ca śāriputram etat avocat yaḥ yam maṇiḥ mayā bhagavataḥ dattaḥ
translated: Then the daughter of the Sāgara Nāga King said this to the elder bodhisattva Prajñākūṭa and Śāriputra: This jewel that I have given to the Blessed One,

original: sa ca bhagavatā śīrghraṃ pratigṛhīto veti /
analyzed: sa ca bhagavatā śīrghram pratigṛhītaḥ vā iti
translated: and it was quickly accepted by the Blessed One.

original: sthavira āha tvayā ca śīghraṃ datto bhagavatā ca śīghraṃ pratigṛhītaḥ /
analyzed: sthaviraḥ āha tvayā ca śīghram dattaḥ bhagavatā ca śīghram pratigṛhītaḥ
translated: The elder said, You gave it quickly, and the Blessed One accepted it quickly.

original: sāgaranāgarājaduhitā āha yadyahaṃ bhadanta śāriputra maharddhikī syām /
analyzed: sāgara nāga rāja duhitā āha yadi aham bhadanta śāriputra maharddhikī syām
translated: The daughter of the Sāgara Nāgarāja said, If I, Venerable Śāriputra, were to have great magical power,

original: śīghrataraṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhyeyam /
analyzed: śīghrataram samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeyam
translated: I would attain perfect enlightenment even more quickly.

original: na cāsya maṇeḥ pratigrāhakaḥ syāt //
analyzed: na ca asya maṇeḥ pratigrāhakaḥ syāt
translated: And there would be no one to accept this jewel.

original: atha tasyāṃ velāyāṃ sāgaranāgarājaduhitā sarvalokapratyakṣaṃ sthavirasya ca śāriputrasya🔽pratyakṣaṃ tat strīndriyamantarhitaṃ puruṣendriyaṃ ca prādurbhūtaṃ bodhisattvabhūtaṃ
analyzed: atha tasyām velāyām sāgara nāga rāja duhitā sarva loka pratyakṣam sthavirasya ca śāriputrasya  pratyakṣam tat strī indriyam antarhitam puruṣa indriyam ca prādurbhūtam bodhisattva bhūtam
translated: Then at that time, the daughter of the Sāgara Nāgarāja, in the presence of all worlds,

original: cātmānaṃ saṃdarśayati /
analyzed: ca ātmānam saṃdarśayati
translated: and in the presence of the elder Śāriputra, her female organ disappeared and a male organ appeared, and she manifested herself as a bodhisattva.

original: tasyāṃ velāyāṃ dakṣiṇāṃ diśaṃ prakrāntaḥ /
analyzed: tasyām velāyām dakṣiṇām diśam prakrāntaḥ
translated: At that time, she proceeded to the southern direction.

original: atha dakṣiṇasyāṃ diśi vimalā nāma lokadhātuḥ /
analyzed: atha dakṣiṇasyām diśi vimalā nāma lokadhātuḥ
translated: Then in the southern direction, there is a world system called Vimalā.

original: tatra saptaratnamaye bodhivṛkṣamūle niṣaṇṇamabhisaṃbuddhamātmānaṃ saṃdarśayati sma /
analyzed: tatra sapta ratna maye bodhivṛkṣa mūle niṣaṇṇam abhisaṃbuddham ātmānam saṃdarśayati sma
translated: There, at the foot of a bodhi tree made of the seven precious substances, she manifested herself as having attained enlightenment, sitting cross-legged.

original: dvātriṃśallakṣaṇadharaṃ sarvānuvyajanarūpaṃ prabhayā ca daśadiśaṃ sphuritvā dharmadeśanāṃ kurvāṇam /
analyzed: dvātriṃśat lakṣaṇa dharam sarva anuvyajana rūpam prabhayā ca daśa diśam sphuritvā dharma deśanām kurvāṇam
translated: Endowed with the thirty-two marks, with the form of all that is desirable, radiating light that filled the ten directions, she was teaching the Dharma.

original: ye ca sahāyāṃ lokadhātau sattvāḥ /
analyzed: ye ca sahāyām lokadhātau sattvāḥ
translated: and the beings in the Sahā world system,

original: te sarve taṃ tathāgataṃ paśyanti sma /
analyzed: te sarve tam tathāgatam paśyanti sma
translated: all of them saw that Tathāgata.

original: sarvaiśca devanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramanuṣyāmanuṣyairnamasyamānaṃ dharmadeśanāṃ ca kurvantam /
analyzed: sarvaiḥ ca deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara manuṣya amanuṣyaiḥ namasyamānam dharma deśanām ca kurvantam
translated: And he was being worshipped by all the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas, and he was teaching the Dharma.

original: ye ca sattvāstasya tathāgatasya dharmadeśanāṃ śṛṇvanti /
analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ tasya tathāgatasya dharma deśanām śṛṇvanti
translated: And all the beings who heard that Tathāgata's teaching of the Dharma,

original: sarve te 'vinivartanīyā bhavantyanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: sarve te vinivartanīyāḥ bhavanti anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: all of them became irreversible from supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: sā ca vimalā lokadhātuḥ /
analyzed: sā ca vimalā lokadhātuḥ
translated: And that Vimalā world system,

original: iyaṃ ca sahā lokadhātuḥ ṣaḍvikāraṃ prākampat /
analyzed: iyam ca sahā lokadhātuḥ ṣaṣ vikāram prākampat
translated: and this Sahā world system, shook in six ways.

original: bhagavataśca śākyamuneḥ parṣanmaṇḍalānāṃ trayāṇāṃ prāṇisahasrāṇāmanutpattikadharmakṣāntipratilābho 'bhūt /
analyzed: bhagavataḥ ca śākyamuneḥ parṣad maṇḍalānām trayāṇām prāṇi sahasrāṇām anutpattikadharmakṣānti pratilābhaḥ bhūt
translated: And in the circle of the assembly of Lord Śākyamuni, three thousand beings attained receptivity to the non-arising of dharmas,

original: trayāṇāṃ ca prāṇiśatasahasrāṇāmanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau vyākaraṇapratilābho 'bhūt /
analyzed: trayāṇām ca prāṇi śata sahasrāṇām anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau vyākaraṇa pratilābhaḥ bhūt
translated: and three hundred thousand beings attained the prophecy of supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: atha prajñākūṭo bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sthaviraśca śāriputrastūṣṇīmabhūtām //
analyzed: atha prajñākūṭaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sthaviraḥ ca śāriputraḥ tūṣṇīm abhūtām
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Prajñākūṭa and the elder Śāriputra became silent.

original: ityāryasaddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye stūpasaṃdarśanaparivarto nāmaikādaśamaḥ //
analyzed: iti ārya saddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye stūpasaṃdarśanaparivartaḥ nāma ekādaśamaḥ
translated: Thus ends the eleventh chapter, on the appearance of the stūpa, in the noble Mahāyāna sūtra, the White Lotus of the Good Dharma.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: utsāhaparivartaḥ /
analyzed: utsāha parivartaḥ
translated: The Chapter on Exhortation

original: atha khalu bhaiṣajyarājo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo mahāpratibhānaśca bodhisattvo mahāsattvo
analyzed: atha khalu bhaiṣajyarājaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ mahāpratibhānaḥ ca bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajyarāja and the bodhisattva mahāsattva Mahāpratibhāna,

original: viṃśatibodhisattvaśatasahasraparivāro bhagavataḥ saṃmukhamimāṃ vācamabhāṣetām alpotsuko
analyzed: viṃśati bodhisattva śata sahasra parivāraḥ bhagavataḥ saṃmukham imām vācam abhāṣetām alpa utsukaḥ
translated: surrounded by an assembly of twenty hundred thousand bodhisattvas, spoke these words in the presence of the Blessed One: Blessed One, be free from anxiety

original: bhagavān bhavatvasminnarthe /
analyzed: bhagavān bhavatu asmin arthe
translated: regarding this matter.

original: vayamimaṃ bhagavan dharmaparyāyaṃ tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya sattvānāṃ deśayiṣyāmaḥ saṃprakāśayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: vayam imam bhagavan dharmaparyāyam tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya sattvānām deśayiṣyāmaḥ saṃprakāśayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: Blessed One, we will teach this Dharma discourse to beings and illuminate it after the Tathāgata's parinirvāṇa.

original: kiṃcāpi bhagavan śaṭhakāḥ sattvāstasmin kāle bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: kiṃca api bhagavan śaṭhakāḥ sattvāḥ tasmin kāle bhaviṣyanti
translated: Blessed One, although at that time there will be deceitful beings,

original: parīttakuśalamūlā adhimānikā lābhasatkārasaṃniśritā akuśalamūlapratipannā durdamā adhimuktivirahitā anadhimuktibahulāḥ /
analyzed: parītta kuśala mūlāḥ adhimānikāḥ lābha satkāra saṃniśritāḥ akuśala mūla pratipannāḥ durdamāḥ adhimukti virahitāḥ anadhimukti bahulāḥ
translated: with meager roots of virtue, conceited, dependent on gain and honor, engaged in unwholesome actions, difficult to guide, lacking devotion, and abundant in lack of devotion,

original: api tu khalu punarvayaṃ bhagavan kṣāntibalamupadarśayitvā tasmin kāle idaṃ sūtramuddekṣyāmo
analyzed: api tu khalu punar vayam bhagavan kṣānti balam upadarśayitvā tasmin kāle idam sūtram uddekṣyāmaḥ
translated: nevertheless, Blessed One, we will display the power of patience and at that time we will recite this sūtra,

original: dhārayiṣyāmo deśayiṣyāmo likhiṣyāmaḥ satkariṣyāmo gurukariṣyāmo mānayiṣyāmaḥ pūjayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: dhārayiṣyāmaḥ deśayiṣyāmaḥ likhiṣyāmaḥ satkariṣyāmaḥ gurukariṣyāmaḥ mānayiṣyāmaḥ pūjayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will uphold it, teach it, write it out, honor it, revere it, and make offerings to it.

original: kāyajīvitaṃ ca vayaṃ bhagavan utsṛjya idaṃ sūtraṃ prakāśayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: kāya jīvitam ca vayam bhagavan utsṛjya idam sūtram prakāśayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: Blessed One, we will give up our body and life to teach this sūtra.

original: alpotsuko bhagavān bhavatviti //
analyzed: alpa utsukaḥ bhagavān bhavatu iti
translated: May the Blessed One be free from concern.”

original: atha khalu tasyāṃ parṣadi śaikṣāśaikṣāṇāṃ bhikṣūṇāṃ pañcamātrāṇi bhikṣuśatāni bhagavanta metadūcuḥ vayamapi bhagavan utsahāmahe imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu tasyām parṣadi śaikṣa aśaikṣāṇām bhikṣūṇām pañca mātrāṇi bhikṣu śatāni bhagavantam etat ūcuḥ vayam api bhagavan utsahāmahe imam dharmaparyāyam
translated: Then in that assembly, five hundred monks, both those in training and those who had passed beyond training, said to the Blessed One, “Blessed One, we too are inspired to teach this Dharma discourse.

original: api tu khalu punarbhagavan anyāsu lokadhātuṣviti /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar bhagavan anyāsu lokadhātuṣu iti
translated: But, Blessed One, in other world systems.”

original: atha khalu yāvantaste bhagavataḥ śrāvakāḥ śaikṣāśaikṣā bhagavatā vyākṛtā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: atha khalu yāvantaḥ te bhagavataḥ śrāvakāḥ śaikṣa aśaikṣāḥ bhagavatā vyākṛtāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Then all the Blessed One’s hearers, both those in training and those who had passed beyond training, who had been predicted to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by the Blessed One,

original: aṣṭau bhikṣusahasrāṇi /
analyzed: aṣṭau bhikṣu sahasrāṇi
translated: eight thousand monks,

original: sarvāṇi tāni yena bhagavāṃstenāñjaliṃ praṇamayya bhagavantametadūcuḥ alpotsuko bhagavān bhavatu /
analyzed: sarvāṇi tāni yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamayya bhagavantam etat ūcuḥ alpa utsukaḥ bhagavān bhavatu
translated: all of them, having bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined, said this to the Blessed One: “May the Blessed One be free from concern.

original: vayamapīmaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ saṃprakāśayiṣyāmastathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya paścime kāle paścime samaye api tvanyāsu lokadhātuṣu /
analyzed: vayam api imam dharmaparyāyam saṃprakāśayiṣyāmaḥ tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya paścime kāle paścime samaye api tu anyāsu lokadhātuṣu
translated: We too will teach this Dharma teaching, in the later times, in the later period, after the Tathāgata has passed into nirvāṇa, in other world systems.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: asyāṃ bhagavan sahāyāṃ lokadhātau adhimānikāḥ sattvā alpakuśalamūlā nityaṃ vyāpannacittāḥ śaṭhā vaṅkajātīyāḥ //
analyzed: asyām bhagavan sahāyām lokadhātau adhimānikāḥ sattvāḥ alpa kuśala mūlāḥ nityam vyāpanna cittāḥ śaṭhāḥ vaṅka jātīyāḥ
translated: In this Sahā world system, Blessed One, there are proud beings, with little wholesome action, always malicious, deceitful, and crooked.

original: atha khalu mahāprajāpatī gautamī bhagavato mātṛbhaginī ṣaḍbhirbhikṣuṇīsahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu mahāprajāpatī gautamī bhagavataḥ mātṛ bhaginī ṣaḍbhiḥ bhikṣuṇī sahasraiḥ sārdham
translated: Then Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī, the Blessed One’s maternal aunt, together with six thousand nuns,

original: śaikṣāśaikṣābhirbhikṣuṇībhiḥ utthāyāsanād yena bhagavāṃstenāñjaliṃ praṇamayya bhagavantamullokayantī sthitābhūt /
analyzed: śaikṣa aśaikṣābhiḥ bhikṣuṇībhiḥ utthāya āsanāt yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamayya bhagavantam ullokayantī sthitā abhūt
translated: both those in training and those who had passed beyond training, rose from their seats, bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined, and stood there gazing at the Blessed One.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāṃ mahāprajāpatīṃ gautamīmāmantrayāmāsa kiṃ tvaṃ gautami durmanasvinī sthitā tathāgataṃ vyavalokayasi /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām mahāprajāpatīm gautamīm āmantrayāmāsa kim tvam gautami durmanasvinī sthitā tathāgatam vyavalokayasi
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī at that time, “Gautamī, why do you stand there with a troubled mind, gazing at the Tathāgata?

original: nāhaṃ parikīrtitā vyākṛtā ca anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: na aham parikīrtitā vyākṛtā ca anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: I have not proclaimed or predicted you for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: bhāṣiṣyāmaḥ idam sūtram parṣad madhye viśāradāḥ
translated: We will teach this sutra fearlessly in the midst of the assembly.

analyzed: nagareṣu atha grāmeṣu ye iha arthikāḥ
translated: In the cities and villages, those who will be interested in this,

analyzed: gatvā gatvā asya dāsyāmaḥ nikṣepam tava nāyaka
translated: Having gone and gone, we will give them your deposit, O Leader.

original: preṣaṇaṃ tava lokendra kariṣyāmo mahāmune /
analyzed: preṣaṇam tava loka indra kariṣyāmaḥ mahā mune
translated: We will send messengers, O Lord of the World, O Great Sage.

original: alpotsuko bhava tvaṃ hi śāntiprāpto sunirvṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: alpa utsukaḥ bhava tvam hi su nirvṛtaḥ
translated: Be free from worry, having attained peace, well-liberated.

original: sarve ca lokapradyotā āgatā ye diśo daśa /
analyzed: sarve ca loka pradyotāḥ āgatāḥ ye diśaḥ daśa
translated: And all the Lights of the World who have come from the ten directions,

original: satyāṃ vācaṃ prabhāṣāmo adhimuktiṃ vijānasi // / //
analyzed: satyām vācam prabhāṣāmaḥ adhimuktim vijānasi
translated: We will speak truthful words, you know the inclination.

original: ityāryasaddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye utsāhaparivarto nāma dvādaśamaḥ //
analyzed: iti ārya saddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye utsāhaparivartaḥ nāma dvādaśamaḥ
translated: Thus ends the chapter on encouragement, the twelfth in the noble Dharma-discourse called White Lotus of the True Dharma.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: sukhavihāraparivartaḥ /
analyzed: sukhavihāraparivartaḥ
translated: Chapter on the Blissful Abode.

original: atha khalu mañjuśrīḥ kumārabhūto bhagavantametadavocata duṣkaraṃ bhagavan paramaduṣkaramebhirbodhisattvairmahāsattvairutsoḍhaṃ bhagavato
analyzed: atha khalu mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ bhagavantam etat avocata duṣkaram bhagavan parama duṣkaram ebhiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ mahāsattvaiḥ utsoḍham bhagavataḥ
translated: Then Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, it is difficult, most difficult, that these bodhisattva mahāsattvas have undertaken to bear the Blessed One's

original: kathaṃ bhagavan ebhirbodhisattvairmahāsattvairayaṃ dharmaparyāyaḥ paścime kāle paścime samaye saṃprakāśayitavyaḥ /🔽evamukte bhagavān mañjuśriyaṃ kumārabhūtametadavocat caturṣu mañjuśrīrdharmeṣu
analyzed: katham bhagavan ebhiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ mahāsattvaiḥ ayam dharmaparyāyaḥ paścime kāle paścime samaye saṃprakāśayitavyaḥ  evam ukte bhagavān mañjuśriyam kumāra bhūtam etat avocat caturṣu mañjuśrīḥ dharmeṣu
translated: How, Blessed One, should these bodhisattva mahāsattvas teach this Dharma discourse in the later times, in the later period?

original: pratiṣṭhitena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena ayaṃ dharmaparyāyaḥ paścime kāle paścime🔽samaye saṃprakāśayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: pratiṣṭhitena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena ayam dharmaparyāyaḥ paścime kāle paścime  samaye saṃprakāśayitavyaḥ
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, Mañjuśrī, a bodhisattva mahāsattva should teach this Dharma discourse in the later times, in the later period, having been established in four dharmas.

original: katameṣu caturṣu /
analyzed: katameṣu caturṣu
translated: In which four?

original: iha mañjuśrīrbodhisattvena mahāsattvena ācāragocarapratiṣṭhitena ayaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ paścime kāle paścime samaye saṃprakāśayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: iha mañjuśrīḥ bodhisattvena mahāsattvena ācāra gocara pratiṣṭhitena ayam dharmaparyāyam paścime kāle paścime samaye saṃprakāśayitavyaḥ
translated: Here, Mañjuśrī, a bodhisattva mahāsattva should teach this Dharma discourse in the later times, in the later period, having been established in the conduct and sphere of activity.

original: kathaṃ ca mañjuśrīrbodhisattvo mahāsattva ācāragocarapratiṣṭhito bhavati /
analyzed: katham ca mañjuśrīḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ ācāra gocara pratiṣṭhitaḥ bhavati
translated: And how, Mañjuśrī, does a bodhisattva mahāsattva become established in the conduct and sphere of activity?

original: yadā ca mañjuśrīrbodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ kṣānto bhavati /
analyzed: yadā ca mañjuśrīḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ kṣāntaḥ bhavati
translated: When, Mañjuśrī, a bodhisattva mahāsattva becomes patient,

original: dānto dāntabhūmimanuprāpto 'nutrastāsaṃtrastamanā anabhyasūyakaḥ /
analyzed: dāntaḥ dānta bhūmim anuprāptaḥ nu trasta a saṃtrasta manāḥ an abhyasūyakaḥ
translated: tamed, having attained the stage of self-control, with a mind that is fearless and free from fear, and is free from envy,

original: yadā ca mañjuśrīrbodhisattvo mahāsattvo na kasmiṃściddharme carati /
analyzed: yadā ca mañjuśrīḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na kasmiṃścid dharme carati
translated: Mañjuśrī, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva does not practice any dharma,

original: yathābhūtaṃ ca dharmāṇāṃ svalakṣaṇaṃ vyavalokayati /
analyzed: yathābhūtam ca dharmāṇām sva lakṣaṇam vyavalokayati
translated: and observes the individual characteristics of dharmas as they really are,

original: yā khalveṣu dharmeṣvavicāraṇā avikalpanā /
analyzed: yā khalu eṣu dharmeṣu a vicāraṇā a vikalpanā
translated: that non-investigation and non-discrimination of dharmas,

original: ayamucyate mañjuśrīrbodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyācāraḥ /
analyzed: ayam ucyate mañjuśrīḥ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya ācāraḥ
translated: Mañjuśrī, is called the bodhisattva mahāsattva's practice.

original: katamaśca mañjuśrīrbodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya gocaraḥ /
analyzed: katamaḥ ca mañjuśrīḥ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya gocaraḥ
translated: And what, Mañjuśrī, is the bodhisattva mahāsattva's sphere?

original: yadā ca mañjuśrīrbodhisattvo mahāsattvo na rājānaṃ saṃsevate /
analyzed: yadā ca mañjuśrīḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na rājānam saṃsevate
translated: Mañjuśrī, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva does not attend on the king,

original: na rājaputrān na rājamahāmātrān na rājapuruṣān saṃsevate na bhajate na paryupāste nopasaṃkrāmati /
analyzed: na rāja putrān na rāja mahāmātrān na rāja puruṣān saṃsevate na bhajate na paryupāste na upasaṃkrāmati
translated: does not attend on, revere, serve, or approach the king's sons, the king's ministers, or the king's men,

original: nānyatīrthyāścarakaparivrājakājīvakanirgranthān na kāvyaśāstraprasṛtān sattvān saṃsevate /🔽na bhajate na paryupāste /
analyzed: na anya tīrthyāḥ caraka parivrājaka ājīvaka nirgranthān na kāvya śāstra prasṛtān sattvān saṃsevate  na bhajate na paryupāste
translated: does not attend on, revere, or serve beings who are engaged in the treatises of poetry,

original: na ca lokāyatamantradhārakān na lokāyatikān sevate na bhajate na paryupāste /
analyzed: na ca lokāyata mantra dhārakān na lokāyatikān sevate na bhajate na paryupāste
translated: and does not attend on, revere, or serve those who uphold worldly mantra texts or worldly philosophers,

original: na ca taiḥ sārdhaṃ saṃstavaṃ karoti /
analyzed: na ca taiḥ sārdham saṃstavam karoti
translated: and does not associate with them,

original: na cāṇḍalān na mauṣṭikān na saukarikān na kaukkuṭikān na mṛgalubdhakān na māṃsikān na naṭanṛttakān na jhallān na mallān /
analyzed: na cāṇḍalān na mauṣṭikān na saukarikān na kaukkuṭikān na mṛgalubdhakān na māṃsikān na naṭa nṛttakān na jhallān na mallān
translated: He does not visit outcasts, bamboo workers, hunters, elephant keepers, pig keepers, or poultry keepers.

original: anyāni pareṣāṃ ratikrīḍāsthānāni tāni nopasaṃkrāmati /
analyzed: anyāni pareṣām rati krīḍā sthānāni tāni na upasaṃkrāmati
translated: He does not visit any other places of entertainment for others.

original: na ca taiḥ sārdhaṃ saṃstavaṃ karoti /
analyzed: na ca taiḥ sārdham saṃstavam karoti
translated: He does not socialize with them.

original: anyatropasaṃkrāntānāṃ kālena kālaṃ dharmaṃ bhāṣate /
analyzed: anyatra upasaṃkrāntānām kālena kālam dharmam bhāṣate
translated: But if they come to him, he teaches the Dharma to them at the appropriate time.

original: taṃ cāniśrito bhāṣate /
analyzed: tam ca a niśritaḥ bhāṣate
translated: And he teaches without clinging.

original: śrāvakayānīyāṃśca bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikā na sevate na bhajate na paryupāste /
analyzed: śrāvaka yānīyān ca bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikāḥ na sevate na bhajate na paryupāste
translated: He does not attend on or serve bhikṣus, bhikṣuṇīs, upāsakas, or upāsikās who follow the Śrāvakayāna.

original: na ca taiḥ sārdhaṃ saṃstavaṃ karoti /
analyzed: na ca taiḥ sārdham saṃstavam karoti
translated: He does not socialize with them.

original: na ca taiḥ saha samavadhānagocaro bhavati caṃkrame vā vihāre vā /
analyzed: na ca taiḥ saha samavadhāna gocaraḥ bhavati caṃkrame vā vihāre vā
translated: He does not have the same activities as they do in the courtyard or in the temple.

original: anyatropasaṃkrāntānāṃ caiṣāṃ kālena kālaṃ dharmaṃ bhāṣate /
analyzed: anyatra upasaṃkrāntānām ca eṣām kālena kālam dharmam bhāṣate
translated: But if they come to him, he teaches the Dharma to them at the appropriate time.

original: taṃ cāniśrito bhāṣate /
analyzed: tam ca a niśritaḥ bhāṣate
translated: And he teaches without clinging.

original: ayaṃ mañjuśrīrbodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya gocaraḥ //
analyzed: ayam mañjuśrīḥ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya gocaraḥ
translated: Mañjuśrī, this is the domain of a bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: punaraparaṃ mañjuśrīrbodhisattvo mahāsattvo na mātṛgrāmasya anyatarānyataramanunayanimittamudgṛhya abhīkṣṇaṃ dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: punar aparam mañjuśrīḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na mātṛgrāmasya anyatara anyataram anunaya nimittam udgṛhya abhīkṣṇam dharmam deśayati
translated: Furthermore, Mañjuśrī, a bodhisattva mahāsattva does not, having taken up any cause of affection for a woman, frequently teach the Dharma.

original: na ca mātṛgrāmasya abhīkṣṇaṃ darśanakāmo bhavati /
analyzed: na ca mātṛgrāmasya abhīkṣṇam darśana kāmaḥ bhavati

original: na ca kulānyupasaṃkramati /
analyzed: na ca kulāni upasaṃkramati
translated: He does not visit families.

original: na ca dārikāṃ vā kanyāṃ vā vadhukāṃ vā abhīkṣṇamābhāṣitavyāṃ manyate /
analyzed: na ca dārikām vā kanyām vā vadhukām vā abhīkṣṇam ābhāṣitavyām manyate
translated: He does not think that he should frequently speak to a girl, a maiden, or a bride.

original: na pratisaṃmodayati /
analyzed: na pratisaṃmodayati
translated: He does not converse with them.

original: na ca paṇḍakasya dharmaṃ deśayati /🔽na ca tena sārdhaṃ saṃstavaṃ karoti /
analyzed: na ca paṇḍakasya dharmam deśayati  na ca tena sārdham saṃstavam karoti
translated: He does not teach the Dharma to a paṇḍaka.🔽He does not associate with them.

original: na ca pratisaṃmodayati /
analyzed: na ca pratisaṃmodayati
translated: He does not converse with them.

original: na caikākī bhikṣārthamantargṛhaṃ praviśati anyatra tathāgatānusmṛtiṃ bhāvayamānaḥ /
analyzed: na ca ekākī bhikṣā artham antargṛham praviśati anyatra tathāgata anusmṛtim bhāvayamānaḥ
translated: He does not enter a house alone for the sake of alms, except when contemplating the Tathāgata.

original: sacetpunarmātṛgrāmasya dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: saced punar mātṛgrāmasya dharmam deśayati
translated: If he does teach the Dharma to a woman,

analyzed: sa na antaśas dharma saṃrāgeṇa api dharmam vaidya
translated: he does not even teach the Dharma out of passion for the Dharma,

original: deśayati / kaḥ punarvādaḥ strīsaṃrāgeṇa /
analyzed: deśayati kaḥ punar vādaḥ strī saṃrāgeṇa
translated: let alone out of passion for a woman.

original: nāntaśo dantāvalīmapyupadarśayati /
analyzed: na antaśas danta āvalīm api upadarśayati
translated: He does not even show his teeth.

original: kaḥ punarvāda audārikamukhavikāram /
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ audārika mukha vikāram
translated: Let alone a gross facial expression.

original: na ca śrāmaṇeraṃ na ca śrāmaṇerīṃ na bhikṣuṃ na bhikṣuṇīṃ na kumārakaṃ na kumārikāṃ sātīyati /
analyzed: na ca śrāmaṇeram na ca śrāmaṇerīm na bhikṣum na bhikṣuṇīm na kumārakam na kumārikām sā atīyati
translated: He does not associate with novices, female novices, monks, or nuns, young men or young women.

original: na ca taiḥ sārdhaṃ saṃstavaṃ karoti /
analyzed: na ca taiḥ sārdham saṃstavam karoti
translated: He does not keep company with them.

original: na ca saṃlāpaṃ karoti /🔽sa ca pratisaṃlayanaguruko bhavati /
analyzed: na ca saṃlāpam karoti  sa ca pratisaṃlayana gurukaḥ bhavati
translated: He does not converse with them.🔽He is devoted to solitary meditation.

original: abhīkṣṇaṃ ca pratisaṃlayanaṃ sevate /
analyzed: abhīkṣṇam ca pratisaṃlayanam sevate
translated: He constantly practices solitary meditation.

original: ayamucyate mañjuśrīrbodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prathamo gocaraḥ //
analyzed: ayam ucyate mañjuśrīḥ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prathamaḥ gocaraḥ
translated: This, Mañjuśrī, is called the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's first domain.

original: punaraparaṃ mañjuśrīrbodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvadharmān śūnyān vyavalokayati /
analyzed: punar aparam mañjuśrīḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarva dharmān śūnyān vyavalokayati
translated: Moreover, Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva observes all phenomena as empty,

original: yathāvat pratiṣṭhitān dharmān aviparītasthāyino yathābhūtasthitānacalānakampyānavivartyānaparivartān
analyzed: yathāvat pratiṣṭhitān dharmān a viparīta sthāyinaḥ yathābhūta sthitān acalān a kampyān a vivartyān a parivartān
translated: as existing in accordance with reality, as abiding without error, as existing in accordance with reality, as unshakable, unmoving, irreversible, and unchanging,

original: sadā yathābhūtasthitānākāśasvabhāvānniruktivyavahāravivarjitānajātānabhutān anasaṃbhūtān
analyzed: sadā yathā bhūta sthitān ākāśa svabhāvān nirukti vyavahāra vivarjitān ajātān abhutān an asaṃbhūtān
translated: as always existing in accordance with reality, as having the nature of space, as devoid of verbal expression, as unborn, not come into existence, and not arisen,

original: asaṃskṛtān asaṃtānān asattābhilāpapravyāhṛtānasaṅgasthānasthitān saṃjñāviparyāsaprādurbhūtān /
analyzed: a saṃskṛtān a saṃtānān a sattā abhilāpa pravyāhṛtān asaṅga sthāna sthitān saṃjñā viparyāsa prādurbhūtān
translated: as unconditioned, without continuity, as spoken of as non-existent, as abiding in the state of non-attachment, as produced from the perversion of conceptualization,🔽and as existing in the state of non-attachment.

original: evaṃ hi mañjuśrīrbodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'bhīkṣṇaṃ sarvadharmān vyavalokayan viharati anena vihāreṇa viharan bodhisattvo mahāsattvo gocare sthito
analyzed: evam hi mañjuśrīḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhīkṣṇam sarva dharmān vyavalokayan viharati anena vihāreṇa viharan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ gocare sthitaḥ
translated: In this way, Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva mahāsattva dwells, constantly observing all phenomena. Dwelling in this dwelling, the bodhisattva mahāsattva abides in the domain.

original: bhavati /
analyzed: bhavati
translated: In this way, Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva mahāsattva dwells, constantly observing all phenomena. Dwelling in this dwelling, the bodhisattva mahāsattva abides in the domain.

original: ayaṃ mañjuśrīrbodhisattvasya dvitīyo gocaraḥ //
analyzed: ayam mañjuśrīḥ bodhisattvasya dvitīyaḥ gocaraḥ
translated: This, Mañjuśrī, is the bodhisattva's second domain.

original: atha khalu bhagavānetamevārthaṃ bhūyasyā mātrayā saṃdarśayamānastasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān etam eva artham bhūyasyā mātrayā saṃdarśayamānaḥ tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One, manifesting this very meaning even more, spoke these verses at that time:

original: yo bodhisattva iccheyā paścātkāle sudāruṇe /🔽idaṃ sūtraṃ prakāśetuṃ anolīno viśāradaḥ // / //
analyzed: yaḥ bodhisattvaḥ iccheyā paścātkāle su dāruṇe  idam sūtram prakāśetum anolīnaḥ viśāradaḥ
translated: The bodhisattva who wishes, in the terrible future times,🔽To teach this sūtra fearlessly and without laziness,

original: ācāragocaraṃ rakṣedasaṃsṛṣṭaḥ śucirbhavet /
analyzed: ācāra gocaram rakṣet asaṃsṛṣṭaḥ śuciḥ bhavet
translated: Should guard the domain and conduct, be unattached and pure.

original: varjayetsaṃstavaṃ nityaṃ rājaputrehi rājabhiḥ // / //
analyzed: varjayet saṃstavam nityam rāja putra ihi rājabhiḥ
translated: He should always avoid association with princes and kings,

original: ye cāpiṃ rājapuruṣāḥ kuryāttehi na saṃstavam /
analyzed: ye ca āpim rāja puruṣāḥ kuryāt te hi na saṃstavam
translated: And also with those who are the king's men, he should not associate with them.

original: caṇḍālamuṣṭikaiḥ śauṇḍaistīrthikaiścāpi sarvaśaḥ // / //
analyzed: caṇḍāla muṣṭikaiḥ śauṇḍaiḥ tīrthikaiḥ ca api sarvaśas
translated: With caṇḍālas, boxers, drunkards, and with all tīrthikas,

original: adhimānīnna seveta vinaye cāgame sthitān /
analyzed: adhimānīn na seveta vinaye ca āgame sthitān
translated: He should not serve those who are arrogant, who abide in discipline and scriptures,

original: arhantasaṃmatān bhikṣūn duḥśīlāṃścaiva varjayet // / //
analyzed: arhanta saṃmatān bhikṣūn duḥśīlān ca eva varjayet
translated: And he should avoid monks who are considered arhats and those who are of bad conduct.

original: bhikṣuṇīṃ varjayennityaṃ hāsyasaṃlāpagocarām /
analyzed: bhikṣuṇīm varjayet nityam hāsya saṃlāpa gocarām
translated: One should always avoid a nun who is always laughing and talking.

original: upāsikāśca varjeta prākaṭā yā avasthitāḥ // / //
analyzed: upāsikāḥ ca varjeta prākaṭāḥ yāḥ avasthitāḥ
translated: One should also avoid laywomen who are openly engaged in worldly affairs.

original: yā nirvṛtiṃ gaveṣanti dṛṣṭe dharme upāsikāḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ nirvṛtim gaveṣanti dṛṣṭe dharme upāsikāḥ
translated: Those laywomen who seek liberation in this very life,

original: varjayet saṃstavaṃ tābhiḥ ācāro ayamucyate // / //
analyzed: varjayet saṃstavam tābhiḥ ācāraḥ ayam ucyate
translated: One should avoid close association with them. This is said to be the proper conduct.

original: yaścainamupasaṃkramya dharmaṃ pṛcche 'grabodhaye /
analyzed: yaḥ ca enam upasaṃkramya dharmam pṛcche grabodhaye
translated: One who approaches him and asks about the Dharma for the sake of supreme enlightenment,

original: tasya bhāṣet sadā dhīro anolīno aniśritaḥ // / //
analyzed: tasya bhāṣet sadā dhīraḥ an olīnaḥ a niśritaḥ
translated: The wise one should always explain to him, without laziness or dependence.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: strīpaṇḍakāśca ye sattvāḥ saṃstavaṃ tairvivarjayet /🔽kuleṣu cāpi vadhukāṃ kumāryaśca vivarjayet // / //
analyzed: strī paṇḍakāḥ ca ye sattvāḥ saṃstavam taiḥ vivarjayet  kuleṣu ca api vadhukām kumāryaḥ ca vivarjayet
translated: One should avoid close association with those beings who are women, eunuchs,🔽And also with those who are engaged in worldly affairs.

original: na tā saṃmodayejjātu kauśalyaṃ hāsa pṛcchitum /
analyzed: na tā saṃmodayet jātu kauśalyam ha āsa pṛcchitum
translated: One should never delight in them or ask about their skills or laughter.

original: saṃstavaṃ tehi varjeta saukaraurabhrikaiḥ saha // / //
analyzed: saṃstavam varjeta sauka raurabhrikaiḥ saha
translated: One should avoid close association with those who are butchers or raise pigs or sheep,

original: ye cāpi vividhān prāṇīn hiṃseyurbhogakāraṇāt /
analyzed: ye ca api vividhān prāṇīn hiṃseyuḥ bhoga kāraṇāt
translated: And with those who harm various beings for the sake of pleasure,

original: māṃsaṃ sūnāya vikrenti saṃstavaṃ tairvivarjayet // / //
analyzed: māṃsam sūnāya vikrenti saṃstavam taiḥ vivarjayet
translated: And sell meat in the market. One should avoid close association with them.

original: strīpoṣakāśca ye sattvā varjayettehi saṃstavam /
analyzed: strī poṣakāḥ ca ye sattvāḥ varjayet te hi saṃstavam
translated: One should avoid close association with those beings who support women,

original: naṭebhirjhallamallebhirye cānye tādṛśā janāḥ // / //
analyzed: naṭebhiḥ jhalla mallebhiḥ ye ca anye tādṛśāḥ janāḥ
translated: With actors, dancers, wrestlers, and others of that kind.

original: vāramukhyā na seveta ye cānye bhogavṛttinaḥ /
analyzed: vāramukhyāḥ na seveta ye ca anye bhoga vṛttinaḥ
translated: The chief courtesans and others who live off pleasure,

original: pratisaṃmodanaṃ tebhiḥ sarvaśaḥ parivarjayet // / //
analyzed: pratisaṃmodanam tebhiḥ sarvaśas parivarjayet
translated: One should completely avoid all friendly interactions with them.

original: yadā ca dharmaṃ deśeyā mātṛgrāmasya paṇḍitaḥ /
analyzed: yadā ca dharmam deśeyāḥ mātṛgrāmasya paṇḍitaḥ
translated: When a wise one is teaching the Dharma to women,

original: na caikaḥ praviśettatra nāpi hāsyasthito bhavet // / //
analyzed: na ca ekaḥ praviśet tatra na api hāsya sthitaḥ bhavet
translated: One should not enter there alone, nor should one be in a state of laughter.

original: yadāpi praviśed grāmaṃ bhojanārthī punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: yadā api praviśet grāmam bhojana arthī punar punar
translated: Whenever one enters a village again and again for the sake of alms,

original: dvitīyaṃ bhikṣu mārgeta buddhaṃ vā samanusmaret // / //
analyzed: dvitīyam bhikṣu mārgeta buddham vā samanusmaret
translated: One should seek a second monk, or recollect the Buddha.

original: ācāragocaro hyeṣa prathamo me nidarśitaḥ /
analyzed: ācāra gocaraḥ hi eṣa prathamaḥ me nidarśitaḥ
translated: This is the first conduct and domain that I have shown,

original: viharanti yena saprajñā dhārentā sūtramīdṛśam // / //
analyzed: viharanti yena sa prajñāḥ sūtram īdṛśam
translated: By which the wise ones who uphold a sūtra like this abide.

original: yadā na carate dharmaṃ hīnautkṛṣṭamadhyame /
analyzed: yadā na carate dharmam hīna autkṛṣṭa madhyame
translated: When one does not practice the Dharma as inferior, superior, or middling,

original: saṃskṛtāsaṃskṛte cāpi bhūtābhūte ca sarvaśaḥ // / //
analyzed: saṃskṛta asaṃskṛte ca api bhūta abhūte ca sarvaśas
translated: And also as conditioned or unconditioned, or as existent or non-existent in any way,

original: strīti nācarate dhīro puruṣeti na kalpayet /
analyzed: strī iti na ācarate dhīro puruṣa iti na kalpayet
translated: The resolute one does not practice the notion of woman or conceive of man;

original: sarvadharma ajātatvād gaveṣanto na paśyati // / //
analyzed: sarva dharmaḥ a jāta tvāt na paśyati
translated: Searching for all phenomena, he does not see them due to their unborn nature.

original: ācāro hi ayaṃ ukto bodhisattvāna sarvaśaḥ /
analyzed: ācāraḥ hi ayam uktaḥ sarvaśas
translated: This is the conduct that has been taught for all bodhisattvas;

original: gocaro yādṛśasteṣāṃ taṃ śṛṇotha prakāśataḥ // / //
analyzed: gocaraḥ yādṛśaḥ teṣām tam prakāśataḥ
translated: Listen as I explain the domain that is like theirs.

original: asantakā dharma ime prakāśitā aprādubhūtāśca ajāta sarve /
analyzed: asantakāḥ dharma ime prakāśitāḥ a prādubhūtāḥ ca ajāta sarve
translated: These dharmas are taught as being without accumulation, not arisen and unborn at all.

original: śūnyā nirīhā sthita nityakālaṃ ayaṃ gocaro ucyati paṇḍitānām // / //
analyzed: ayam gocaraḥ ucyati paṇḍitānām
translated: Empty, without effort, always abiding - this is said to be the domain of the wise.

original: viparītasaṃjñīhi ime vikalpitā asantasantā hi abhūtabhūtataḥ /
analyzed: ime vikalpitāḥ asanta santāḥ hi abhūta bhūtataḥ
translated: These are conceptualized by those with inverted conceptions, as existent and nonexistent, as unreal and real.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Doctor

original: anutthitāścāpi ajātadharmā jātātha bhūtā viparītakalpitāḥ // / //
analyzed: anutthitāḥ ca api ajāta dharmāḥ jātāḥ atha bhūtāḥ viparīta kalpitāḥ
translated: And those not arisen, unborn dharmas, are conceptualized as arisen and real, in the opposite way.

original: ekāgracitto hi samāhitaḥ sadā sumerukūṭo yatha susthitaśca /
analyzed: ekāgra cittaḥ hi samāhitaḥ sadā sumeru kūṭaḥ susthitaḥ ca
translated: With a one-pointed mind, always in concentration, as stable as the peak of Mount Meru,

original: evaṃ sthitaścāpi hi tān nirīkṣedākāśabhūtānima sarvadharmān // / //
analyzed: evam sthitaḥ ca api hi tān nirīkṣet ākāśa bhūtān ima sarva dharmān
translated: Dwelling thus, I observe those, all dharmas as being like space.

original: sadāpi ākāśasamānasārakān aniñjitān manyanavarjitāṃśca /
analyzed: sadā api ākāśa samāna sārakān an iñjitān manyana varjitān ca
translated: Always equal in essence to space, unmoving, free from conceit,

original: sthitā hi dharmā iti nityakālaṃ ayu gocaro ucyati paṇḍitānām // / //
analyzed: sthitāḥ hi dharmāḥ iti nitya kālam ucyati paṇḍitānām
translated: Dharmas are always abiding - this is said to be the domain of the wise.

original: īryāpathaṃ yo mama rakṣamāṇo bhaveta bhikṣū mama nirvṛtasya /
analyzed: īryāpatham yaḥ mama rakṣamāṇaḥ bhaveta bhikṣū mama nirvṛtasya
translated: One who, after my parinirvāṇa, protects my conduct,

original: prakāśayet sūtramidaṃ hi loke na cāpi saṃlīyana tasya kācit // / //
analyzed: prakāśayet sūtram idam hi loke na ca api tasya kācid
translated: That bhikṣu will illuminate this sūtra in the world, and will never be lazy.

original: kālena vā cintayamānu paṇḍitaḥ praviśya lenaṃ tatha ghaṭṭayitvā /
analyzed: kālena vā ghaṭṭayitvā
translated: The wise one, contemplating in time, having entered the cave and having rubbed,

original: vipaśya dharmaṃ imu sarva yoniśo utthāya deśeta alīnacittaḥ // / //
analyzed: vipaśya dharmam sarva yoniśas utthāya deśeta alīna cittaḥ
translated: Having contemplated this entire Dharma correctly, he should arise and teach it with an undistracted mind.

original: rājāna tasyeha karonti rakṣāṃ ye rājaputrāśca śṛṇonti dharmam /
analyzed: rājāna tasya iha karonti rakṣām ye rāja putrāḥ ca śṛṇonti dharmam
translated: Here, kings will protect him, and the princes who listen to the Dharma,

original: anye 'pi co gṛhapati brāhmaṇāśca parivārya sarve 'sya sthitā bhavanti // / //
analyzed: anye pi ca u gṛhapati brāhmaṇāḥ ca parivārya sarve sya sthitāḥ bhavanti
translated: And other householders, brahmins, and so forth will all gather around him.

original: punaraparaṃ mañjuśrirbodhisattvo mahāsattvastathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya paścime kāle
analyzed: punar aparam mañjuśriḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya paścime kāle
translated: Moreover, Mañjuśrī, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who, in the future time after the Tathāgata has passed into nirvāṇa,

original: paścime samaye saddharmavipralope vartamāne imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ saṃprakāśayitukāmaḥ
analyzed: paścime samaye saddharma vipralope vartamāne imam dharmaparyāyam saṃprakāśayitu kāmaḥ
translated: in the final period when the true Dharma is being destroyed, wishes to teach this Dharma discourse,

original: sukhasthito bhavati /
analyzed: sukha sthitaḥ bhavati
translated: should be well-established in happiness.

original: sa sukhasthitaśca dharmaṃ bhāṣate kāyagataṃ vā pustakagataṃ vā /
analyzed: sa sukha sthitaḥ ca dharmam bhāṣate kāya gatam vā pustaka gatam vā
translated: And while well-established in happiness, he should teach the Dharma, whether it is in his own body or in a book.

original: pareṣāṃ ca deśayamāno nādhimātramupālambhajātīyo bhavati /
analyzed: pareṣām ca deśayamānaḥ na adhimātram upālambha jātīyaḥ bhavati
translated: And while teaching it to others, he should not be excessively fault-finding.

original: na cānyān dharmabhāṇakān bhikṣūn parivadati /
analyzed: na ca anyān dharma bhāṇakān bhikṣūn parivadati
translated: He should not slander other Dharma teachers or monks.

original: na cāvarṇaṃ bhāṣate /
analyzed: na ca avarṇam bhāṣate
translated: He should not speak unfavorably.

original: na cāvarṇaṃ niścārayati /
analyzed: na ca avarṇam niścārayati
translated: He should not utter uncomplimentary words.

original: na cānyeṣāṃ śrāvakayānīyānāṃ bhikṣūṇāṃ nāma gṛhītvā avarṇa bhāṣate /
analyzed: na ca anyeṣām śrāvaka yānīyānām bhikṣūṇām nāma gṛhītvā avarṇa bhāṣate
translated: He should not speak unfavorably about the names of other monks who follow the Śrāvakayāna,

original: na cāvarṇaṃ cārayati /
analyzed: na ca avarṇam cārayati
translated: nor should he utter uncomplimentary words about them.

original: na ca teṣāmantike pratyarthikasaṃjñī bhavati /
analyzed: na ca teṣām antike pratyarthika saṃjñī bhavati
translated: And he does not think of them as adversaries.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: yathāpīdaṃ sukhasthānavasthitatvāt /🔽sa āgatāgatānāṃ dhārmaśrāvaṇikānāmanuparigrāhikayā anabhyasūyayā Vaidya
analyzed: yathā api idam sukha sthān avasthita tvāt  saḥ āgata āgatānām dhārmaśrāvaṇikānām anuparigrāhikayā anabhyasūyayā vaidya
translated: Because he is established in a state of happiness.

original: dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: dharmam deśayati
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those who come to listen to the Dharma with acceptance, without spite,

original: avivadamāno na ca praśnaṃ pṛṣṭaḥ śrāvakayānena visarjayati /
analyzed: a vivadamānaḥ na ca praśnam pṛṣṭaḥ śrāvaka yānena visarjayati
translated: without dispute, and when asked a question, he does not answer with the Śrāvakayāna,

original: api tu khalu punastathā visarjayati /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar tathā visarjayati
translated: but rather he answers in such a way

original: yathā buddhajñānamabhisaṃbudhyate //
analyzed: yathā buddha jñānam abhisaṃbudhyate
translated: that they will fully awaken to the wisdom of the Buddhas.”

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses:

original: sukhasthito bhoti sadā vicakṣaṇaḥ sukhaṃ niṣaṇṇastatha dharmu bhāṣate /
analyzed: sukha sthitaḥ sadā vicakṣaṇaḥ sukham niṣaṇṇaḥ tathā bhāṣate
translated: “The wise one is always well-established, and likewise teaches the Dharma while seated comfortably,

original: udāra prajñapta karitva āsanaṃ caukṣe manojñe pṛthivīpradeśe // / //🔽caukṣaṃ cāsau cīvara prāvaritvā suraktaraṅgaṃ supraśastaraṅgaiḥ /
analyzed: udāra prajñapta karitvaḥ āsanam caukṣe manojñe pṛthivī pradeśe  caukṣam ca asau cīvara prāvaritvā su rakta raṅgam su praśasta raṅgaiḥ
translated: having arranged the seat in an open and pleasant place on the ground.🔽Having put on a clean robe, well-dyed with beautiful colors,

original: āsevakāṃ kṛṣṇa tathādaditvā mahāpramāṇaṃ ca nivāsayitvā // / //
analyzed: āsevakām kṛṣṇa tathā a daditvā mahā pramāṇam ca nivāsayitvā
translated: and having fastened the black waistband, and put on the upper robe of great size,

original: sapādapīṭhasmi niṣadya āsane vicitradūṣyehi susaṃstṛtasmin /
analyzed: niṣadye āsane su saṃstṛtasmin
translated: seated on a seat with a footstool, well-spread with various fine cloths,

original: sudhautapādaśca upāruhitvā snigdhena śīrṣeṇa mukhena cāpi // / //
analyzed: su dhauta pādaḥ ca upāruhitvā snigdhena śīrṣeṇa mukhena ca api
translated: Having washed his feet well and ascended, with a smooth head and face,

original: dharmāsane cātra niṣīdiyāna ekāgrasattveṣu samāgateṣu /
analyzed: dharma āsane ca atra niṣīdiyānaḥ ekāgra sattveṣu samāgateṣu
translated: And sitting on the Dharma seat here, to the beings gathered with one-pointed mind,

original: upasaṃhareccitrakathā bahūśca bhikṣūṇa co bhikṣūṇikāna caiva // / //
analyzed: upasaṃharet citra kathāḥ bahūḥ ca
translated: He should collect together the many colorful stories, and to the monks and nuns,

original: upāsakānāṃ ca upāsikānāṃ rājñāṃ tathā rājasutāna caiva /
analyzed: upāsakānām ca upāsikānām rājñām tathā ca eva
translated: To the male and female lay followers, to the kings and likewise to the princes,

original: vicitritārthāṃ madhurāṃ katheyā anabhyasūyantu sadā sa paṇḍitaḥ // / //
analyzed: vicitrita arthām madhurām katheyāḥ an abhyasūyantu sadā sa paṇḍitaḥ
translated: He should tell the various meaningful and sweet stories, that wise one should always be free from envy.

original: pṛṣṭo 'pi cāsau tada praśna tehi anulomamarthaṃ punarnirdiśeta /
analyzed: anulomam artham punar nirdiśeta
translated: Even if asked by them about that question, he should point out the meaning in accordance with it.

original: tathā ca deśeya tamarthajātaṃ yatha śrutva bodhīya bhaveyu lābhinaḥ // / //
analyzed: tathā ca tam artha jātam bhaveyu lābhinaḥ
translated: And he should teach that collection of meanings in such a way that, having heard it, they would attain enlightenment.

original: kilāsitāṃ cāpi vivarjayitvā na cāpi utpādayi khedasaṃjñām /🔽Vaidya
analyzed: kilāsi tām ca api vivarjayitvā na ca api kheda saṃjñām  vaidya
translated: Having also abandoned laziness, and not producing the notion of weariness,

original: aratiṃ ca sarvāṃ vijaheta paṇḍito maitrībalaṃ cā pariṣāya bhāvayet // / //
analyzed: aratim ca sarvām vijaheta paṇḍitaḥ maitrī balam bhāvayet
translated: The wise one should abandon all discontent and cultivate the power of friendliness in the assembly.

original: bhāṣecca rātriṃdivamagradharmaṃ dṛṣṭāntakoṭīnayutaiḥ sa paṇḍitaḥ /
analyzed: bhāṣet ca rātriṃdivam agra dharmam dṛṣṭānta koṭī nayutaiḥ sa paṇḍitaḥ
translated: And that wise one should speak the supreme Dharma day and night with many quintillions of examples,

original: saṃharṣayetparṣa tathaiva toṣayenna cāpi kiṃcittatu jātu prārthayet // / //
analyzed: saṃharṣayet tathā eva toṣayet na ca api kiṃcid tatu jātu prārthayet
translated: And delight and satisfy the assembly, but never ask for anything at all.

original: khādyaṃ ca bhojyaṃ ca tathānnapānaṃ vastrāṇi śayyāsana cīvaraṃ vā /
analyzed: khādyam ca bhojyam ca tathā anna pānam vastrāṇi śayyā āsana cīvaram vā
translated: Food, drink, and likewise food and drink, clothes, bedding, seats, and robes,

original: gilānabhaiṣajya na cintayeta na vijñapeyā pariṣāya kiṃcit // / //
analyzed: gilāna bhaiṣajya na cintayeta na vijñapeya pariṣāya kiṃcid
translated: And medicine for the sick, he should not think about them, and should not ask the assembly for anything.

original: anyatra cinteya sadā vicakṣaṇo bhaveya buddho 'hamime ca sattvāḥ /
analyzed: anyatra cinteya sadā vicakṣaṇaḥ bhaveya buddhaḥ ham ime ca sattvāḥ
translated: Moreover, the wise one should always think, 'May I become a Buddha for these beings.

original: etanmamo sarvasukhopadhānaṃ yaṃ dharma śrāvemi hitāya loke // / //
analyzed: etat sarva sukha upadhānam yam dharma śrāvemi hitāya loke
translated: This is my provision for all happiness, that I teach this Dharma for the benefit of the world.'

original: yaścāpi bhikṣū mama nirvṛtasya anīrṣuko eta prakāśayeyā /
analyzed: yaḥ ca api bhikṣū mama nirvṛtasya eta prakāśayeyā
translated: And whoever, after my Nirvana, would proclaim this without envy,

original: na tasya duḥkhaṃ na ca antarāyo śokopayāsā na bhavetkadācit // / //
analyzed: na tasya duḥkham na ca śoka upayāsā na bhavet kadācid
translated: For him there will be no suffering, no obstacles, and never any sorrow or distress.

original: na tasya saṃtrāsana kaści kuryānna tāḍanāṃ nāpi avarṇa bhāṣet /
analyzed: na kuryāt na tāḍanām na api bhāṣet
translated: No one will be able to frighten him, nor beat him, nor speak uncomplimentary words about him.

original: na cāpi nipkāsana jātu tasya tathā hi so kṣāntibale pratiṣṭhitaḥ // / //
analyzed: na ca api jātu tasya tathā hi saḥ kṣānti bale pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: And he will never be expelled, for he is established in the power of patience.

original: sukhasthitasyo tada paṇḍitasya evaṃ sthitasyo yatha bhāṣitaṃ mayā /
analyzed: paṇḍitasya evam bhāṣitam mayā
translated: For the wise one who is thus established, as I have taught, in this way,

original: guṇāna koṭīśata bhontyaneke na śakyate kalpaśate hi vaktum // / //
analyzed: na śakyate kalpa śate hi vaktum
translated: There are many hundreds of thousands of qualities, which cannot be described even in a hundred eons.

original: punaraparaṃ mañjuśrīrbodhisattvo mahāsattvastathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya saddharmakṣayāntakāle
analyzed: punar aparam mañjuśrīḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya saddharma kṣaya anta kāle
translated: Moreover, Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, at the time when the Tathāgata has passed into Nirvāṇa, at the end of the destruction of the True Dharma,

original: vartamāne idaṃ sūtraṃ dhārayamāṇo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'nīrṣuko bhavatyaśaṭho 'māyāvī /
analyzed: vartamāne idam sūtram dhārayamāṇaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ nīrṣukaḥ bhavati aśaṭhaḥ māyāvī
translated: while upholding this sūtra, is without envy, without deceit, and without pretense.

original: na cānyeṣāṃ bodhisattvayānīyānāṃ pudgalānāmavarṇaṃ bhāṣate /
analyzed: na ca anyeṣām bodhisattva yānīyānām pudgalānām avarṇam bhāṣate
translated: He does not speak ill of other individuals who follow the Bodhisattva Vehicle.

original: nāpavadati nāvasādayati /
analyzed: na apavadati na avasādayati
translated: He does not revile or disparage them.

original: na cānyeṣāṃ bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikānāṃ śrāvakayānīyānāṃ vā pratyekabuddhayānīyānāṃ
analyzed: na ca anyeṣām bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikānām śrāvaka yānīyānām vā pratyekabuddha yānīyānām
translated: He does not cause regret for others, whether bhikṣus, bhikṣuṇīs, upāsakas, or upāsikās who follow the Śrāvakayāna, the Pratyekabuddhayāna,

original: vā bodhisattvayānīyānāṃ vā kaukṛtyamupasaṃharati dūre yūyaṃ kulaputrā anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: vā bodhisattva yānīyānām vā kaukṛtyam upasaṃharati dūre yūyam kula putrāḥ anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: or the Bodhisattvayāna, saying, 'You, noble sons, are far from the highest, complete enlightenment.

original: na tasyāṃ yūyaṃ Vaidya 🔽sadṛśyadhve /
analyzed: na tasyām yūyam vaidya  sadṛśyadhve
translated: You are not like a physician.

original: atyantapramādavihāriṇo yūyam /
analyzed: atyanta pramāda vihāriṇaḥ yūyam
translated: You are extremely heedless in your practice.

original: na yūyaṃ pratibalāstaṃ jñānamabhisaṃboddhum /
analyzed: na yūyam pratibalāḥ tam jñānam abhisaṃboddhum
translated: You are not able to fully awaken to that knowledge.'

original: ityevaṃ na kasyacid bodhisattvayānīyasya kaukṛtyamupasaṃharati /
analyzed: iti evam na kasyacid bodhisattva yānīyasya kaukṛtyam upasaṃharati
translated: Thus, he does not cause regret for anyone who follows the Bodhisattvayāna.

original: na ca dharmavivādābhirato bhavati /
analyzed: na ca dharma vivāda abhirataḥ bhavati
translated: He is not devoted to disputes about the Dharma.

original: na ca dharmavivādaṃ karoti /
analyzed: na ca dharma vivādam karoti
translated: He does not engage in disputes about the Dharma.

original: sarvasattvānāṃ cāntike maitrībalaṃ na vijahāti /
analyzed: sarva sattvānām ca antike maitrī balam na vijahāti
translated: He does not abandon the power of loving-kindness towards all beings.

original: sarvatathāgatānāṃ cāntike pitṛsaṃjñāmutpādayati /
analyzed: sarva tathāgatānām ca antike pitṛ saṃjñām utpādayati
translated: He generates the perception of father towards all Tathāgatas.

original: sarvabodhisattvānāṃ cāntike śāstṛsaṃjñāmutpādayati /
analyzed: sarva bodhisattvānām ca antike śāstṛ saṃjñām utpādayati
translated: He generates the perception of teacher towards all Bodhisattvas.

original: ye ca daśasu dikṣu loke bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ /
analyzed: ye ca daśasu dikṣu loke bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: And towards those Bodhisattva Mahāsattvas in the worlds of the ten directions,

original: tānabhīkṣṇamadhyāśayena gauraveṇa ca namaskurute /🔽dharmaṃ ca deśayamāno 'nūnamanadhikaṃ dharmaṃ deśayati samena dharmapremṇā /
analyzed: tān abhīkṣṇam adhyāśayena gauraveṇa ca namaskurute  dharmam ca deśayamānaḥ nūnam anadhikam dharmam deśayati samena dharma premṇā
translated: he constantly bows down with a superior intention and reverence.🔽And while teaching the Dharma, he teaches the Dharma without deficiency or excess, with impartial Dharma-love.

original: na ca kasyacidantaśo dharmapremṇāpyadhikataramanugrahaṃ karoti imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ saṃprakāśayamānaḥ //
analyzed: na ca kasyacid antaśas dharma premṇā api adhikataram anugraham karoti imam dharmaparyāyam saṃprakāśayamānaḥ
translated: And while illuminating this Dharma discourse, he does not favor anyone, not even with excessive Dharma-love.

original: anena mañjuśrīstṛtīyena dharmeṇa samanvāgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvastathāgatasya
analyzed: anena mañjuśrīḥ tṛtīyena dharmeṇa samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tathāgatasya
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva who possesses this third quality,

original: parinirvṛtasya saddharmaparikṣayāntakāle vartamāne imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ saṃprakāśayamānaḥ
analyzed: parinirvṛtasya saddharma parikṣaya anta kāle vartamāne imam dharmaparyāyam saṃprakāśayamānaḥ
translated: while teaching this Dharma discourse after the Tathāgata's parinirvāṇa, at the time when the true Dharma is being destroyed,

original: sukhasparśaṃ viharati /
analyzed: sukha sparśam viharati
translated: lives a life of pleasant touch.

original: aviheṭhitaścemaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ saṃprakāśayati /
analyzed: a viheṭhitaḥ ca imam dharmaparyāyam saṃprakāśayati
translated: And he will teach this Dharma discourse without being harmed.

original: bhavanti cāsya
analyzed: bhavanti ca asya
translated: And he will have

original: dharmasaṃgītyāṃ sahāyakāḥ /
analyzed: dharmasaṃgītyām sahāyakāḥ
translated: companions in the recitation of the Dharma.

original: utpatsyante cāsya dhārmaśrāvaṇikāḥ /
analyzed: utpatsyante ca asya dhārmaśrāvaṇikāḥ
translated: And listeners to the Dharma will appear for him,

original: ye 'syemaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śroṣyanti śraddhāsyanti /
analyzed: ye sya imam dharmaparyāyam śroṣyanti śraddhāsyanti
translated: who will listen to this Dharma discourse, have faith in it,

original: pattīyiṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti likhiṣyanti likhāpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: pattīyiṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti likhiṣyanti likhāpayiṣyanti
translated: accept it, uphold it, master it, write it, or cause it to be written,

original: pustakagataṃ ca kṛtvā satkariṣyanti gurukariṣyanti mānayiṣyanti pūjayiṣyanti //
analyzed: pustaka gatam ca kṛtvā satkariṣyanti gurukariṣyanti mānayiṣyanti pūjayiṣyanti
translated: and having made it into a book, will honor it, revere it, respect it, and make offerings to it.

original: idamavocad bhagavān /
analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān
translated: The Blessed One said this.

original: idaṃ vaditvā sugato hyathāparametaduvāca śāstā
analyzed: idam vaditvā sugataḥ hi atha aparam etat uvāca śāstā
translated: Having said this, the Well-Gone One, the Teacher, then said this further:

original: śāṭhyaṃ ca mānaṃ tatha kūṭanāṃ ca aśeṣato ujjhiya dharmabhāṇakaḥ /
analyzed: śāṭhyam ca mānam kūṭanām ca aśeṣatas dharma bhāṇakaḥ
translated: The Dharma teacher should completely abandon deceit, pride, and hypocrisy,

original: īrṣyāṃ na kuryāttatha jātu paṇḍito ya icchate sūtramidaṃ prakāśitum // / //
analyzed: īrṣyām na kuryāt tathā jātu paṇḍitaḥ yaḥ icchate sūtram idam prakāśitum
translated: and the wise one should never be jealous, if he wishes to teach this sūtra.

original: avarṇa jātū na vadeya kasyaciddṛṣṭīvivādaṃ ca na jātu kuryāt /
analyzed: avarṇa jātū na vadeya ca na jātu kuryāt
translated: He should never speak uncomplimentary things about anyone, and should never engage in disputes over views.

original: kaukṛtyasthānaṃ ca na jātu kuryānna lapsyase jñānamanuttara tvam // / //
analyzed: kaukṛtya sthānam ca na jātu kuryāt na lapsyase jñānam anuttara tvam
translated: He should never create a basis for regret, or else you will not attain unsurpassed knowledge.

original: sadā ca so ārjavu mardāvaśca kṣāntaśca bhotī sugatasya putraḥ /
analyzed: sadā ca saḥ ārjavu mardāvaḥ ca kṣāntaḥ ca sugatasya putraḥ
translated: And always be straightforward and gentle, and patient, the offspring of the Sugata,

original: dharmaṃ prakāśetuḥ punaḥ punaścimaṃ na tasya khedo bhavatī kadācit // / //
analyzed: dharmam prakāśetuḥ punar punar cimam na tasya khedaḥ bhavatī kadācid
translated: And again and again proclaim this Dharma, he will never become weary of it.

original: ye bodhisattvā daśasū diśāsu sattvānukampāya caranti loke /
analyzed: ye bodhisattvāḥ diśāsu sattva anukampāya caranti loke
translated: Those bodhisattvas who in the ten directions, out of compassion for beings, practice in the world,

original: te sarvi śāstāra bhavanti mahyaṃ gurugauravaṃ teṣu janeta paṇḍitaḥ // / //
analyzed: te bhavanti mahyam guru gauravam teṣu janeta paṇḍitaḥ
translated: All of them are my teachers; the wise one should generate respect for them as a guru.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Doctor

original: smaritva buddhāna dvipadānamuttamān jineṣu nityaṃ pitṛsaṃjña kuryāt /
analyzed: smaritvā jineṣu nityam pitṛ saṃjña kuryāt
translated: Remembering the Buddhas, the supreme humans, one should always have the perception of fathers towards the Jinas.

original: adhimānasaṃjñāṃ ca vihāya sarvāṃ na tasya bhotī tada antarāyaḥ // / //
analyzed: adhimāna saṃjñām ca vihāya sarvām na tasya antarāyaḥ
translated: And having abandoned all the perception of conceit, for him there is no obstacle to that.

original: śruṇitva dharmaṃ imamevarūpaṃ sa rakṣitavyastada paṇḍitena /
analyzed: dharmam imam eva rūpam sa rakṣitavyaḥ tada paṇḍitena
translated: Having heard this kind of Dharma, the wise one should then protect it.

original: sukhaṃ vihārāya samāhitaśca surakṣito bhoti ca prāṇikoṭibhiḥ // / //
analyzed: sukham vihārāya samāhitaḥ ca su rakṣitaḥ ca prāṇi koṭibhiḥ
translated: And being absorbed in meditation for the sake of dwelling happily, he becomes well-protected by millions of beings.

original: punaraparaṃ mañjuśrīrbodhisattvo mahāsattvastathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya saddharmapratikṣayāntakāle
analyzed: punar aparam mañjuśrīḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya saddharma pratikṣaya anta kāle
translated: Moreover, Mañjuśrī, when the Tathāgata has passed into Nirvāṇa, at the time when the true Dharma is disappearing,

original: vartamāne imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ dhārayitukāmastena bhikṣuṇā gṛhasthapravrajitānāmantikād
analyzed: vartamāne imam dharmaparyāyam dhārayitu kāmaḥ tena bhikṣuṇā gṛhastha pravrajitānām antikāt
translated: If one wishes to uphold this Dharma discourse while it is being taught, that monk should keep far away from householders and renunciants.

original: dūreṇa dūraṃ vihartavyam /
analyzed: dūreṇa dūram vihartavyam
translated: He should dwell far away from them.

original: maitrīvihāreṇa ca vihartavyam /
analyzed: maitrī vihāreṇa ca vihartavyam
translated: He should dwell in friendliness.

original: ye ca sattvā bodhāya saṃprasthitā bhavanti /
analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ bodhāya saṃprasthitāḥ bhavanti
translated: Those beings who have set out for enlightenment,

original: teṣāṃ sarveṣāmantike spṛhotpādayitavyā /
analyzed: teṣām sarveṣām antike spṛhā utpādayitavyā
translated: he should arouse longing towards all of them.

original: evaṃ cānena cittamutpādayitavyam /
analyzed: evam ca anena cittam utpādayitavyam
translated: And he should arouse the following thought:

original: mahāduṣprajñajātīyā bateme sattvāḥ /
analyzed: mahā duṣprajña jātīyāḥ bata ime sattvāḥ
translated: Alas, these beings are of extremely low wisdom,

original: ye tathāgatasyopāyakauśalyaṃ saṃdhābhāṣitaṃ na śṛṇvanti na jānanti na budhyante na pṛcchanti na śraddadhanti nādhimucyante /
analyzed: ye tathāgatasya upāya kauśalyam saṃdhā bhāṣitam na śṛṇvanti na jānanti na budhyante na pṛcchanti na śraddadhanti na adhimucyante
translated: who do not listen to, do not understand, do not realize, do not ask about, do not have faith in, and do not aspire to the skillful means of the Tathāgata's implied teachings.

original: kiṃcāpyete sattvā imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ nāvataranti /
analyzed: kiṃca api ete sattvāḥ imam dharmaparyāyam na avataranti
translated: Although these beings do not enter this Dharma discourse,

original: na budhyante /🔽api tu khalu punarahametāmanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbudhya yo yasmin sthito bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: na budhyante  api tu khalu punar aham etām anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya yaḥ yasmin sthitaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: do not understand it,🔽nevertheless, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, I will, by the power of my spiritual abilities, inspire and lead them to enter and mature in whatever they are established in.

original: taṃ tasminneva ṛddhibalenāvarjayiṣyāmi pattīyāpayiṣyāmi avatārayiṣyāmi paripācayiṣyāmi //
analyzed: tam tasmin eva ṛddhi balena āvarjayiṣyāmi pattīyāpayiṣyāmi avatārayiṣyāmi paripācayiṣyāmi
translated: Thus it is.

original: anenāpi mañjuśrīścaturthena dharmeṇa samanvāgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvastathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ saṃprakāśayamāno 'vyābādho
analyzed: anena api mañjuśrīḥ caturthena dharmeṇa samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya imam dharmaparyāyam saṃprakāśayamānaḥ vyābādhaḥ
