original: bhāṣatu sugataḥ /
analyzed: bhāṣatu sugataḥ
translated: May the Well-Gone One teach.

original: vayaṃ tathāgatasya bhāṣitamabhiśraddhāsyāma iti //
analyzed: vayam tathāgatasya bhāṣitam abhiśraddhāsyāmaḥ iti
translated: We will have faith in what the Tathāgata says.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃsteṣāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ yāvattṛtīyakamapyadhyeṣaṇāṃ viditvā tān bodhisattvānāmantrayate sma tena hi kulaputrāḥ śṛṇudhvamidamevaṃrūpaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān teṣām bodhisattvānām yāvat tṛtīyakam api adhyeṣaṇām viditvā tān bodhisattvān āmantrayate sma tena hi kula putrāḥ śṛṇudhvam idam evaṃrūpam
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing that those bodhisattvas had requested this up to the third time, said to those bodhisattvas, So be it, O sons of noble family! Listen to this kind of

original: yadayaṃ kulaputrāḥ sadevamānuṣāsuro loka evaṃ saṃjānīte sāṃprataṃ bhagavatā śākyamuninā
analyzed: yat ayam kula putrāḥ sa deva mānuṣa asuraḥ loke evam saṃjānīte sāṃpratam bhagavatā śākyamuninā
translated: that this world with its gods, humans, and asuras understands in this way: 'The Blessed One, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni,

original: tathāgatena śākyakulādabhiniṣkramya gayāhvaye mahānagare bodhimaṇḍavarāgragatena
analyzed: tathāgatena śākya kulāt abhiniṣkramya gayā āhvaye mahā nagare bodhimaṇḍa vara agra gatena
translated: having gone forth from the Śākya clan, having gone to the excellent seat of enlightenment in the great city called Gayā,

original: anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhirabhisaṃbuddheti /
analyzed: anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ abhisaṃbuddhā iti
translated: has fully awakened to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.'

original: naivaṃ draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: na evam draṣṭavyam
translated: This should not be seen in this way.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ kulaputrāḥ bahūni mama kalpakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇyanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhasya /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar kula putrāḥ bahūni mama kalpa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhasya
translated: Moreover, sons of noble family, many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of eons have passed since I attained supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kulaputrāḥ pañcāśatsu lokadhātukoṭīnayutaśatasahasreṣu ye pṛthivīdhātuparamāṇavaḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putrāḥ pañcāśatsu lokadhātu koṭī nayuta śata sahasreṣu ye pṛthivī dhātu paramāṇavaḥ
translated: Just as, sons of noble family, in fifty hundred thousand quintillion world systems, there are atoms in the earth element,

original: atha khalu kaścideva puruṣa utpadyate /
analyzed: atha khalu kaścid eva puruṣaḥ utpadyate
translated: then suppose some person were to appear

original: sa ekaṃ paramāṇurajaṃ gṛhītvā pūrvasyāṃ diśi pañcāśallokadhātvasaṃkhyeyaśatasahasrāṇyatikramya tadekaṃ paramāṇurajaḥ samupanikṣipet /
analyzed: saḥ ekam paramāṇu rajam gṛhītvā pūrvasyām diśi pañcāśat lokadhātu asaṃkhyeya śata sahasrāṇi atikramya tat ekam paramāṇu rajaḥ samupanikṣipet
translated: who, taking one atom, would pass through fifty hundred thousand quintillion world systems to the east and deposit that atom there.

original: anena paryāyeṇa kalpakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi sa puruṣaḥ sarvāṃstāṃllokadhātūna vyapagatapṛthivīdhātūn kuryāt /
analyzed: anena paryāyeṇa kalpa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi sa puruṣaḥ sarvān tān lokadhātūn vyapagata pṛthivī dhātūn kuryāt
translated: In this way, that person would cause all those world systems to be devoid of the earth element, even down to the atoms.

original: sarvāṇi ca tāni pṛthivīdhātuparamāṇurajāṃsi anena paryāyeṇa anena ca lakṣanikṣepeṇa pūrvasyāṃ diśyupanikṣipet /
analyzed: sarvāṇi ca tāni pṛthivī dhātu paramāṇu rajāṃsi anena paryāyeṇa anena ca lakṣa nikṣepeṇa pūrvasyām diśi upanikṣipet
translated: And he would deposit all those atoms of the earth element, in this way and with this method of calculation and this measure of deposition, to the east.

original: tatkiṃ manyadhve kulaputrāḥ śakyaṃ te lokadhātavaḥ kenaciccintayituṃ vā gaṇayituṃ vā tulayituṃ vā upalakṣayituṃ vā /
analyzed: tat kim manyadhve kula putrāḥ śakyam te lokadhātavaḥ kenacid cintayitum vā gaṇayitum vā tulayitum vā upalakṣayitum vā
translated: What do you think, noble sons? Are those world systems able to be conceived, counted, compared, or even imagined by anyone?

original: evamukte maitreyo bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sa ca sarvāvān bodhisattvagaṇo bodhisattvarāśirbhagavantametadavocat asaṃkhyeyāste bhagavaṃllokadhātavaḥ /
analyzed: evam ukte maitreyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sa ca sarvāvān bodhisattva gaṇaḥ bodhisattva rāśiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat asaṃkhyeyāḥ te bhagavan lokadhātavaḥ
translated: When this was said, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya, together with that entire assembly of bodhisattvas, that mass of bodhisattvas, said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, those world systems are incalculable.

original: agaṇanīyāścittabhūmisamatikrāntāḥ /
analyzed: a gaṇanīyāḥ citta bhūmi samatikrāntāḥ
translated: They are beyond the realm of thought, beyond the realm of mind, beyond the realm of thought construction, beyond the realm of mental activity, beyond the realm of the intellect, beyond the realm of the mind, beyond the realm of the mental faculty, beyond the realm of the mental consciousness, and beyond the realm of the mental factors.

original: sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhairapi bhagavan āryeṇa jñānena na śakyaṃ cintayituṃ vā gaṇayituṃ vā tulayituṃ vā upalakṣayituṃ vā /
analyzed: sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhaiḥ api bhagavan āryeṇa jñānena na śakyam cintayitum vā gaṇayitum vā tulayitum vā upalakṣayitum vā
translated: Blessed One, even all the noble knowledge of the hearers and solitary buddhas is unable to conceive, count, compare, or even imagine them.

original: asmākamapi tāvad bhagavan avaivartyabhūmisthitānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāmasmin sthāne cittagocaro na pravartate /
analyzed: asmākam api tāvat bhagavan avaivartya bhūmi sthitānām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām asmin sthāne citta gocaraḥ na pravartate
translated: Blessed One, even for us bodhisattvas who are established in the stage of nonretrogression, the sphere of thought does not operate in this matter.

original: tāvadaprameyā bhagavaṃste lokadhātavo bhaveyuriti //
analyzed: tāvat aprameyāḥ bhagavan te lokadhātavaḥ bhaveyuḥ iti
translated: Blessed One, those world systems would be immeasurable.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: evamukte bhagavāṃstān bodhisattvān mahāsattvānetadavocat ārocayāmi vaḥ kulaputrāḥ /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān tān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān etat avocat ārocayāmi vaḥ kula putrāḥ
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to those bodhisattva mahāsattvas, Noble sons, I declare to you:

original: prativedayāmi vaḥ /
analyzed: prativedayāmi vaḥ
translated: I declare this to you.

original: yāvantaḥ kulaputrāste lokadhātavo yeṣu tena puruṣeṇa tāni paramāṇurajāṃsyupanikṣiptāni /
analyzed: yāvantaḥ kula putrāḥ te lokadhātavaḥ yeṣu tena puruṣeṇa tāni paramāṇu rajāṃsi upanikṣiptāni
translated: As many world systems as there are, son of noble family, in which that man has deposited those atomic particles,

original: yeṣu ca nopanikṣiptāni /
analyzed: yeṣu ca na upanikṣiptāni
translated: and in which he has not deposited them,

original: sarveṣu teṣu kulaputra lokadhātukoṭīnayutaśatasahasreṣu na tāvanti paramāṇurajāṃsi saṃvidyante /
analyzed: sarveṣu teṣu kula putra lokadhātu koṭī nayuta śata sahasreṣu na tāvanti paramāṇu rajāṃsi saṃvidyante
translated: in all those world systems, son of noble family, there are not even that many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of atomic particles,

original: yāvanti mama kalpakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇyanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhasya /
analyzed: yāvanti mama kalpa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhasya
translated: as there are my kalpas of hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of kalpas since I attained supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: yataḥprabhṛtyahaṃ kulaputrā asyāṃ sahāyāṃ lokadhātau sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayāmi /
analyzed: yatas prabhṛti aham kula putrāḥ asyām sahāyām lokadhātau sattvānām dharmam deśayāmi
translated: Since then, son of noble family, I have been teaching the Dharma to beings in this Sahā world system,

original: anyeṣu ca lokadhātukoṭīnayutaśatasahasreṣu /
analyzed: anyeṣu ca lokadhātu koṭī nayuta śata sahasreṣu
translated: and in other hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of world systems.

original: ye ca mayā kulaputrā atrāntarā tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ parikīrtitā dīpaṃkaratathāgataprabhṛtayaḥ /
analyzed: ye ca mayā kula putrāḥ atra antarā tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ parikīrtitāḥ dīpaṃkara tathāgata prabhṛtayaḥ
translated: And those tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas whom I have mentioned here, son of noble family, beginning with Dīpaṃkara,

original: teṣāṃ ca tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ parinirvāṇāni /
analyzed: teṣām ca tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām parinirvāṇāni
translated: and the parinirvāṇas of those tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas,

original: mayaiva tāni kulaputrā upāyakauśalyadharmadeśanābhinirhāranirmitāni /
analyzed: mayā eva tāni kula putrāḥ upāya kauśalya dharma deśanā abhinirhāra nirmitāni
translated: those, son of noble family, were all created by me through the accomplishment of skillful means and the teaching of the Dharma.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ kulaputrāḥ /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar kula putrāḥ
translated: But, noble ones, it is like this.

original: tathāgata āgatāgatānāṃ sattvānāmindriyavīryavaimātratāṃ vyavalokya tasmiṃstasminnātmano nāma vyāharati /
analyzed: tathāgataḥ āgata āgatānām sattvānām indriya vīrya vaimātra tām vyavalokya tasmin tasmin ātmanaḥ nāma vyāharati
translated: The Tathāgata, having observed the differences in the faculties and efforts of the beings who have come, proclaims his name in this and that way.

original: tasmiṃstasmiṃścātmanaḥ parinirvāṇaṃ vyāharati /
analyzed: tasmin tasmin ca ātmanaḥ parinirvāṇam vyāharati
translated: And he proclaims his parinirvāṇa in this and that way.

original: tathā tathā ca sattvān paritoṣayati nānāvidhairdharmaparyāyaiḥ /
analyzed: tathā tathā ca sattvān paritoṣayati nānāvidhaiḥ dharmaparyāyaiḥ
translated: And he satisfies beings in this and that way with various kinds of Dharma teachings.

original: tatra kulaputrāstathāgato nānādhimuktānāṃ sattvānāmalpakuśalamūlānāṃ bahūpakleśānāmevaṃ vadati daharo 'hamasmi bhikṣavo jātyābhiniṣkrāntaḥ
analyzed: tatra kula putrāḥ tathāgataḥ nānā adhimuktānām sattvānām alpa kuśala mūlānām bahu upakleśānām evam vadati daharaḥ ham asmi bhikṣavaḥ jātyā abhiniṣkrāntaḥ
translated: There, noble ones, the Tathāgata says to beings with various aspirations, little wholesome, and much defilement, 'Monks, I am young, having just gone forth.'

original: acirābhisaṃbuddho 'smi bhikṣavo 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim /
analyzed: acira abhisaṃbuddhaḥ smi bhikṣavaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim
translated: 'Monks, I have just attained supreme perfect enlightenment.'

original: yatkhalu punaḥ kulaputrāḥ /
analyzed: yat khalu punar kula putrāḥ
translated: But, noble ones,

original: tathāgata evaṃ cirābhisaṃbuddha evaṃ vyāharati acirābhisaṃbuddho 'hamasmīti /
analyzed: tathāgataḥ evam cira abhisaṃbuddhaḥ evam vyāharati acira abhisaṃbuddhaḥ ham asmi iti
translated: when the Tathāgata, having attained enlightenment a long time ago, says 'I have just attained enlightenment,'

original: nānyatra sattvānāṃ paripācanārtham /
analyzed: na anyatra sattvānām paripācana artham
translated: it is not for any other reason than to bring beings to maturity.

original: avatāraṇārthamete dharmaparyāyā bhāṣitāḥ /
analyzed: avatāraṇa artham ete dharmaparyāyāḥ bhāṣitāḥ
translated: These Dharma teachings are spoken for the sake of guiding them.

original: sarve ca te kulaputrā dharmaparyāyāstathāgatena sattvānāṃ vinayārthāya bhāṣitāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca te kula putrāḥ dharmaparyāyāḥ tathāgatena sattvānām vinaya arthāya bhāṣitāḥ
translated: And all those Dharma teachings of the Tathāgata were spoken for the sake of disciplining sentient beings.

original: yāṃ ca kulaputrāstathāgataḥ sattvānāṃ vinayārthavācaṃ bhāṣate ātmopadarśanena vā paropadarśanena vā /
analyzed: yām ca kula putrāḥ tathāgataḥ sattvānām vinaya artha vācam bhāṣate ātma upadarśanena vā para upadarśanena vā
translated: And, noble sons, the speech that the Tathāgata speaks for the sake of disciplining sentient beings, whether by showing himself or by showing another,

original: ātmārambaṇena vā parārambanena vā yatkiṃcittathāgato vyāharati /
analyzed: ātma ārambaṇena vā para ārambanena vā yat kiṃcid tathāgataḥ vyāharati
translated: whether with himself as the object or with another as the object, whatever the Tathāgata utters,

original: sarve te dharmaparyāyāḥ satyāstathāgatena bhāṣitāḥ /
analyzed: sarve te dharmaparyāyāḥ satyāḥ tathāgatena bhāṣitāḥ
translated: all those Dharma teachings are true and spoken by the Tathāgata.

original: nāstyatra tathāgatasya mṛṣāvādaḥ /
analyzed: na asti atra tathāgatasya mṛṣāvādaḥ
translated: There is no false speech on the part of the Tathāgata in this regard.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: dṛṣṭaṃ hi tathāgatena traidhātukaṃ yathābhūtam /
analyzed: dṛṣṭam hi tathāgatena traidhātukam yathābhūtam
translated: For the Tathāgata has seen the three realms as they really are.

original: na jāyate na mriyate na cyavate nopapadyate na saṃsarati na parinirvāti /
analyzed: na jāyate na mriyate na cyavate na upapadyate na saṃsarati na parinirvāti
translated: He does not arise, does not die, does not pass away, does not reappear, does not transmigrate, and does not attain final nirvāṇa.

original: na bhūtaṃ nābhūtaṃ na santaṃ nāsantaṃ na tathā nānyathā na vitathā nāvitathā /
analyzed: na bhūtam na abhūtam na santam na asantam na tathā na anyathā na vitathā na avitathā
translated: He is not real, not unreal, not existent, not nonexistent, not thus, not otherwise, not false, not true.

original: na tathā traidhātukaṃ tathāgatena dṛṣṭaṃ yathā bālapṛthagjanāḥ paśyanti /
analyzed: na tathā traidhātukam tathāgatena dṛṣṭam yathā bāla pṛthagjanāḥ paśyanti
translated: The Tathāgata has not seen the three realms in the same way that foolish ordinary beings see it.

original: pratyakṣadharmā tathāgataḥ khalvasmin sthāne 'saṃpramoṣadharmā /
analyzed: pratyakṣa dharmā tathāgataḥ khalu asmin sthāne saṃpramoṣa dharmā
translated: The Tathāgata, the one who has seen the Dharma in this matter, is the one who has the Dharma of non-forgetfulness.

original: tatra tathāgato yāṃ kāṃcidvācaṃ vyāharati /
analyzed: tatra tathāgataḥ yām kāṃcid vācam vyāharati
translated: There, whatever words the Tathāgata speaks,

original: sarvaṃ tatsatyaṃ na mṛṣā nānyathā /
analyzed: sarvam tat satyam na mṛṣā na anyathā
translated: all that is true, not false, not otherwise.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ sattvānāṃ nānācaritānāṃ nānābhiprāyāṇāṃ saṃjñāvikalpacaritānāṃ kuśalamūlasaṃjananārthaṃ vividhān dharmaparyāyān vividhairārambaṇairvyāharati
analyzed: api tu khalu punar sattvānām nānā caritānām nānā abhiprāyāṇām saṃjñā vikalpa caritānām kuśala mūla saṃjanana artham vividhān dharmaparyāyān vividhaiḥ ārambaṇaiḥ vyāharati
translated: Moreover, for beings with various practices, various intentions, and conceptual practices, in order to generate the roots of virtue, he speaks various Dharma teachings with various objects.

original: yaddhi kulaputrāstathāgatena kartavyaṃ tattathāgataḥ karoti /
analyzed: yat hi kula putrāḥ tathāgatena kartavyam tat tathāgataḥ karoti
translated: Whatever, noble sons, the Tathāgata should do, that the Tathāgata does.

original: tāvaccirābhisaṃbuddho 'parimitāyuṣpramāṇastathāgataḥ sadā sthitaḥ /
analyzed: tāvat cira abhisaṃbuddhaḥ parimita āyuṣpramāṇaḥ tathāgataḥ sadā sthitaḥ
translated: The Tathāgata, having attained enlightenment a long time ago, with immeasurable lifespan, remains forever.

original: aparinirvṛtastathāgataḥ parinirvāṇamādarśayati vaineyavaśena /
analyzed: aparinirvṛtaḥ tathāgataḥ parinirvāṇam ādarśayati vaineya vaśena
translated: The Tathāgata, not having attained final nirvāṇa, displays final nirvāṇa according to the disciples.

original: na ca tāvanme kulaputrā adyāpi paurvikī bodhisattvacaryāṃ pariniṣpāditā /
analyzed: na ca tāvat me kula putrāḥ adyā api paurvikī bodhisattva caryām pariniṣpāditā
translated: Noble sons, even now my former bodhisattva conduct has not been completed.

original: āyuṣpramāṇamapyaparipūrṇam /
analyzed: āyuṣpramāṇam api a paripūrṇam
translated: My lifespan is not yet fulfilled.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ kulaputrā adyāpi taddviguṇena me kalpakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi bhaviṣyanti āyuṣpramāṇasyāparipūrṇatvāt /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar kula putrāḥ adya api tad dviguṇena me kalpa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi bhaviṣyanti āyuṣpramāṇasya a paripūrṇa tvāt
translated: Moreover, noble sons, even now, for me, with twice that, there will be a hundred thousand quintillion eons, because my lifespan is not yet fulfilled.

original: idānīṃ Vaidya
analyzed: idānīm vaidya
translated: Now, the doctor

original: khalu punarahaṃ kulaputrā aparinirvāyamāṇa eva parinirvāṇamārocayāmi /
analyzed: khalu punar aham kula putrāḥ a parinirvāyamāṇaḥ eva parinirvāṇam ārocayāmi
translated: “Moreover, noble ones, I do not pass into nirvāṇa without having ripened those beings who are not yet fully ripened.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: sattvānahaṃ kulaputrā anena paryāyeṇa paripācayāmi mā haiva me 'ticiraṃ tiṣṭhato
analyzed: sattvān aham kula putrāḥ anena paryāyeṇa paripācayāmi mā ha eva me ticiram
translated: Noble ones, I ripen those beings by this method, thinking, ‘If I were to remain for a very long time,

original: 'bhīkṣṇadarśanena akṛtakuśalamūlāḥ sattvāḥ puṇyavirahitā daridrabhūtāḥ kāmalolupā
analyzed: bhīkṣṇa darśanena a kṛta kuśala mūlāḥ sattvāḥ puṇya virahitāḥ daridra bhūtāḥ kāma lolupā
translated: and if I were to be seen frequently by those beings who have not planted the roots of merit, who are devoid of merit, who are poor, who are greedy for desire,

original: andhā dṛṣṭijālasaṃchannāḥ tiṣṭhati tathāgata iti viditvā kilīkṛtasaṃjñā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: andhāḥ dṛṣṭi jāla saṃchannāḥ tiṣṭhati tathāgataḥ iti viditvā kilīkṛta saṃjñāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: who are blind, and who are covered by the net of views, thinking, “The Tathāgata remains,” they would become complacent,

original: na ca tathāgate durlabhasaṃjñāmutpādayeyuḥ āsannā vayaṃ tathāgatasyeti /
analyzed: na ca tathāgate durlabha saṃjñām utpādayeyuḥ āsannāḥ vayam tathāgatasya iti
translated: and they would not think of the Tathāgata as being difficult to find, thinking, “We are close to the Tathāgata.”

original: vīryaṃ nārabheyustraidhātukānniḥsaraṇārtham /
analyzed: vīryam na ārabheyuḥ traidhātukāt niḥsaraṇa artham
translated: They would not make an effort to escape from the three realms.

original: na ca tathāgate durlabhasaṃjñāmutpādayeyuḥ /
analyzed: na ca tathāgate durlabha saṃjñām utpādayeyuḥ
translated: And they would not think of the Tathāgata as being difficult to find.

original: tataḥ kulaputrāḥ tathāgataḥ upāyakauśalyena teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ durlabhaprādurbhāvo bhikṣavastathāgata iti vācaṃ vyāharati sma /
analyzed: tatas kula putrāḥ tathāgataḥ upāya kauśalyena teṣām sattvānām durlabha prādurbhāvaḥ bhikṣavaḥ tathāgataḥ iti vācam vyāharati sma
translated: “Therefore, noble ones, the Tathāgata, with skillful means, utters this statement to those beings: ‘Bhikṣus, the appearance of a tathāgata is difficult to find.’

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ bahubhiḥ kalpakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrairapi tathāgatadarśanaṃ
analyzed: tathā hi teṣām sattvānām bahubhiḥ kalpa koṭī nayuta śata sahasraiḥ api tathāgata darśanam
translated: For those beings, even after many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of eons, they do not see a Tathāgata.

original: bhavati vā na vā /
analyzed: bhavati vā na vā
translated: For those beings, it is possible that they may or may not see a Tathagata even in many quintillions of eons.

original: tataḥ khalvahaṃ kulaputrāstadārambaṇaṃ kṛtvaivaṃ vadāmi durlabhaprādurbhāvā hi bhikṣavastathāgatā iti /
analyzed: tatas khalu aham kula putrāḥ tat ārambaṇam kṛtvā evam vadāmi durlabha prādurbhāvāḥ hi bhikṣavaḥ tathāgatāḥ iti
translated: Therefore, noble sons, taking that as a basis, I say, 'Bhikṣus, it is rare for a Tathāgata to appear.'

original: te bhūyasyā mātrayā durlabhaprādurbhāvāṃstathāgatān viditvā āścaryasaṃjñāmutpādayiṣyanti /
analyzed: te bhūyasyā mātrayā durlabha prādurbhāvān tathāgatān viditvā āścarya saṃjñām utpādayiṣyanti
translated: Knowing that the appearance of a Tathāgata is even more rare than that, they will give rise to the notion of a wonder.

original: śokasaṃjñāmutpādayiṣyanti /
analyzed: śoka saṃjñām utpādayiṣyanti
translated: They will give rise to the notion of sorrow.

original: apaśyantaśca tathāgatānarhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān tṛṣitā bhaviṣyanti tathāgatadarśanāya /
analyzed: a paśyantaḥ ca tathāgatān arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān tṛṣitāḥ bhaviṣyanti tathāgata darśanāya
translated: And not seeing the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Enlightened Ones, they will be thirsty for seeing a Tathāgata.

original: teṣāṃ tāni tathāgatārambaṇamanaskārakuśalamūlāni dīrgharātramarthāya hitāya sukhāya ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: teṣām tāni tathāgata ārambaṇa manaskāra kuśala mūlāni dīrgharātram arthāya hitāya sukhāya ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: Those wholesome roots of theirs, with the Tathāgata as their object, will be for their benefit, welfare, and happiness for a long time.

original: etamarthaṃ viditvā tathāgato 'parinirvāyanneva parinirvāṇamārocayati sattvānāṃ vaineyavaśamupādāya /
analyzed: etam artham viditvā tathāgataḥ parinirvāyan eva parinirvāṇam ārocayati sattvānām vaineya vaśam upādāya
translated: Knowing this meaning, the Tathāgata, without actually entering parinirvāṇa, proclaims parinirvāṇa, taking into account the disciples who are to be trained.

original: tathāgatasyaiṣa kulaputrā dharmaparyāyo yadevaṃ vyāharati /
analyzed: tathāgatasya eṣa kula putrāḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ yat evam vyāharati
translated: Noble sons, this is the Tathāgata's Dharma method, that he speaks in this way.

original: nāstyatra tathāgatasya mṛṣāvādaḥ //
analyzed: na asti atra tathāgatasya mṛṣāvādaḥ
translated: There is no false speech on the part of the Tathāgata in this matter.”

original: tadyathāpi nāma kulaputrāḥ kaścideva vaidyapuruṣo bhavet paṇḍito vyakto medhāvī sukuśalaḥ sarvavyādhipraśamanāya /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putrāḥ kaścid eva vaidya puruṣaḥ bhavet paṇḍitaḥ vyaktaḥ medhāvī su kuśalaḥ sarva vyādhi praśamanāya
translated: “Noble ones, it is like this: there is a certain man who is a doctor, who is wise, clear, and intelligent, and is skilled in curing all illnesses.

original: tasya ca puruṣasya bahavaḥ putrā bhaveyurdaśa vā viṃśatirvā triṃśadvā catvāriṃśadvā pañcāśadvā śataṃ vā /
analyzed: tasya ca puruṣasya bahavaḥ putrāḥ bhaveyuḥ daśa vā viṃśatiḥ vā triṃśat vā catvāriṃśat vā pañcāśat vā śatam vā
translated: And that man has many sons, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, up to a hundred sons.

original: sa ca vaidyaḥ pravāsagato bhavet /
analyzed: sa ca vaidyaḥ pravāsa gataḥ bhavet
translated: And that doctor goes away to a foreign land.

original: te cāsya sarve putrā garapīḍā vā viṣapīḍā vā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: te ca asya sarve putrāḥ gara pīḍāḥ vā viṣa pīḍāḥ vā bhaveyuḥ
translated: And all those sons of his are afflicted by poison or afflicted by a spell.

original: tena gareṇa vā viṣeṇa vā duḥkhābhirvedanābhirabhitūrṇā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: tena gareṇa vā viṣeṇa vā duḥkhābhiḥ vedanābhiḥ abhitūrṇāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: They are tormented by painful feelings due to that poison or spell.

original: te tena gareṇa vā viṣeṇa vā dahyamānāḥ pṛthivyāṃ prapateyuḥ /
analyzed: te tena gareṇa vā viṣeṇa vā dahyamānāḥ pṛthivyām prapateyuḥ
translated: Burning with that poison or spell, they fall down on the ground.

original: atha sa teṣāṃ vaidyaḥ pitā pravāsādāgacchet /
analyzed: atha sa teṣām vaidyaḥ pitā pravāsāt āgacchet
translated: Then that father, the doctor, returns from that foreign land.

original: te cāsya putrāstena gareṇa vā viṣeṇa vā duḥkhābhirvedanābhirārtāḥ /🔽kecidviparītasaṃjñino bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: te ca asya putrāḥ tena gareṇa vā viṣeṇa vā duḥkhābhiḥ vedanābhiḥ ārtāḥ  kecid viparīta saṃjñinaḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: And those sons of his, afflicted by that poison or spell, are tormented by painful feelings.🔽Some of them have distorted perceptions.

original: kecidaviparītasaṃjñino bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: kecid aviparīta saṃjñinaḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: Some of them have undistorted perceptions.

original: sarve ca te tenaiva duḥkhenārtāstaṃ pitaraṃ dṛṣṭvābhinandeyuḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca te tena eva duḥkhena ārtāḥ tam pitaram dṛṣṭvā abhinandeyuḥ
translated: And all of them, afflicted by that very suffering, would rejoice upon seeing their father.

original: evaṃ cainaṃ vadeyuḥ diṣṭyāsi tāta kṣemasvastibhyāmāgataḥ /
analyzed: evam ca enam vadeyuḥ diṣṭyā asi tāta kṣema svastibhyām āgataḥ
translated: And they would say to him, 'By good fortune, father, you have come here safe and sound.

original: tadasmākamasmādātmoparodhād garādvā viṣādvā parimocayasva /
analyzed: tat asmākam asmāt ātma uparodhāt garāt vā viṣāt vā parimocayasva
translated: Deliver us, father, from this harm to ourselves, from this poison or venom.

original: dadasva nastāta jīvitamiti /
analyzed: dadasva naḥ tāta jīvitam iti
translated: Give us back our life, father.'

original: atha khalu sa vaidyastān putrān duḥkhārtān dṛṣṭvā vedanābhibhūtān dahyataḥ pṛthivyāṃ pariveṣṭamānān /
analyzed: atha khalu sa vaidyaḥ tān putrān duḥkha ārtān dṛṣṭvā vedanā abhibhūtān dahyataḥ pṛthivyām pariveṣṭamānān
translated: Then, indeed, that physician, seeing those sons afflicted by suffering, overwhelmed by pain, burning on the ground, rolling around,

original: tato mahābhaiṣajyaṃ samudānayitvā varṇasaṃpannaṃ gandhasaṃpannaṃ rasasaṃpannaṃ ca /
analyzed: tatas mahābhaiṣajyam samudānayitvā varṇa saṃpannam gandha saṃpannam rasa saṃpannam ca
translated: would gather together a great medicine, endowed with color, endowed with fragrance, endowed with taste,

original: śilāyāṃ piṣṭvā teṣāṃ putrāṇāṃ pānāya dadyāt /
analyzed: śilāyām piṣṭvā teṣām putrāṇām pānāya dadyāt
translated: and having ground it on a stone, would give it to those sons to drink.

original: evaṃ cainān vadet pibatha putrā idaṃ mahābhaiṣajyaṃ varṇasaṃpannaṃ gandhasaṃpannaṃ rasasaṃpannam /
analyzed: evam ca enān vadet pibatha putrāḥ idam mahā bhaiṣajyam varṇa saṃpannam gandha saṃpannam rasa saṃpannam
translated: And he would say to them, 'Drink this great medicine, sons, which is endowed with color, endowed with fragrance, endowed with taste.

original: idaṃ yūyaṃ putrā mahābhaiṣajyaṃ pītvā kṣipramevāsmād garādvā viṣādvā parimokṣyadhve /
analyzed: idam yūyam putrāḥ mahā bhaiṣajyam pītvā kṣipram eva asmāt garāt vā viṣāt vā parimokṣyadhve
translated: Having drunk this great medicine, sons, you will quickly be freed from this poison or venom.

original: svasthā bhaviṣyatha arogāśca /
analyzed: svasthāḥ bhaviṣyatha arogāḥ ca
translated: You will become well, and free from disease.'

original: tatra ye tasya vaidyasya putrā aviparītasaṃjñinaḥ te bhaiṣajyasya varṇaṃ ca dṛṣṭvā gandhaṃ cāghrāya rasaṃ cāsvādya kṣipramevābhyavahareyuḥ
analyzed: tatra ye tasya vaidyasya putrāḥ aviparīta saṃjñinaḥ te bhaiṣajyasya varṇam ca dṛṣṭvā gandham ca āghrāya rasam ca āsvādya kṣipram eva abhyavahareyuḥ
translated: Among them, those sons of the physician who have non-inverted perception, having seen the color of the medicine, smelled its fragrance, and tasted its flavor, would quickly ingest it.

original: te cābhyavaharantastasmādābādhāt sarveṇa sarvaṃ vimuktā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: te ca abhyavaharantaḥ tasmāt ābādhāt sarveṇa sarvam vimuktāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: And by ingesting it, they would all be completely freed from that illness.

original: ye punastasya putrā viparītasaṃjñinaḥ te taṃ pitaramabhinandeyuḥ /
analyzed: ye punar tasya putrāḥ viparīta saṃjñinaḥ te tam pitaram abhinandeyuḥ
translated: But those sons who have inverted perception would praise that father.

original: enaṃ caivaṃ vadeyuḥ diṣṭayāsi tāta kṣemasvastibhyāmāgato yastvamasmākaṃ cikitsaka iti /
analyzed: enam ca evam vadeyuḥ diṣṭayā asi tāta kṣema svastibhyām āgataḥ yaḥ tvam asmākam cikitsakaḥ iti
translated: And they would say to him, 'Father, you have come well and in good health, since you are our physician.'

original: Vaidya te caivaṃ vācaṃ bhāṣeran /
analyzed: vaidya te ca evam vācam bhāṣeran
translated: The physician would speak those words to them.

original: tacca bhaiṣajyamupanāmitaṃ na pibeyuḥ /
analyzed: tat ca bhaiṣajyam upanāmitam na pibeyuḥ
translated: But they would not drink that medicine that was brought to them.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: tathā hi teṣāṃ tayā viparītasaṃjñyā tad bhaiṣajyamupanāmitaṃ varṇenāpi na rocate /
analyzed: tathā hi teṣām tayā viparīta saṃjñyā tat bhaiṣajyam upanāmitam varṇena api na rocate
translated: Because for them, by that inverted perception, that medicine, when brought, is not pleasing even in color.

original: gandhenāpi rasenāpi na rocate /
analyzed: gandhena api rasena api na rocate
translated: It is not pleasing even in smell or taste.

original: atha khalu sa vaidyapuruṣa evaṃ cintayet ime mama putrā anena gareṇa vā viṣeṇa vā viparītasaṃjñinaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu sa vaidya puruṣaḥ evam cintayet ime mama putrāḥ anena gareṇa vā viṣeṇa vā viparīta saṃjñinaḥ
translated: Then indeed that man-physician would think like this: 'These sons of mine, due to that poison or poison-like substance, have inverted perception.

original: te khalvidaṃ mahābhaiṣajyaṃ
analyzed: te khalu idam mahā bhaiṣajyam
translated: They, however, this great medicine

original: na pibanti / māṃ cābhinandanti /
analyzed: na pibanti mām ca abhinandanti
translated: They do not drink it, and they do not delight in me.

original: yannavahamimān putrānupāyakauśalyena idaṃ bhaiṣajyaṃ pāyayeyamiti /
analyzed: yat na avaham imān putrān upāya kauśalyena idam bhaiṣajyam pāyayeyam iti
translated: I think, ‘How can I make my sons drink this medicine through skillful means?’

original: atha khalu sa vaidyastān putrānupāyakauśalyena tadbhaiṣajyaṃ pāyayitukāma evaṃ vadet jīrṇo 'hamasmi kulaputrāḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu sa vaidyaḥ tān putrān upāya kauśalyena tat bhaiṣajyam pāyayitu kāmaḥ evam vadet jīrṇaḥ ham asmi kula putrāḥ
translated: Then, Subhūti, that physician, wishing to make his sons drink that medicine through skillful means, would say this: ‘I am old, sons,

original: vṛddho mahallakaḥ /
analyzed: vṛddhaḥ mahallakaḥ
translated: advanced in years, elderly and feeble.

original: kālakriyā ca me pratyupasthitā /
analyzed: kālakriyā ca me pratyupasthitā
translated: The time of my death is near.

original: mā ca yūyaṃ putrāḥ śociṣṭha /
analyzed: mā ca yūyam putrāḥ śociṣṭha
translated: Do not grieve, sons,

original: mā ca klamamāpadhvam /
analyzed: mā ca klamam āpadhvam
translated: and do not be exhausted.

original: idaṃ vo mayā mahābhaiṣajyamupanītam /
analyzed: idam vaḥ mayā mahā bhaiṣajyam upanītam
translated: I have brought you this great medicine.

original: sacedākāṅkṣadhve /
analyzed: saced ākāṅkṣadhve
translated: If you wish,

original: tadeva bhaiṣajyaṃ pibadhvam /
analyzed: tat eva bhaiṣajyam pibadhvam
translated: drink that very medicine.’

original: sa evaṃ tān putrānupāyakauśalyena anuśiṣya anyataraṃ janapadapradeśaṃ prakrāntaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ evam tān putrān upāya kauśalyena anuśiṣya anyataram janapada pradeśam prakrāntaḥ
translated: Having thus instructed his sons through skillful means, he would go to another country.

original: tatra gatvā kālagatamātmānaṃ yeṣāṃ glānānāṃ putrāṇāmārocayet /
analyzed: tatra gatvā kālagatam ātmānam yeṣām glānānām putrāṇām ārocayet
translated: Having gone there, he would announce his own death to those sick sons.

original: te tasmin samaye 'tīva śocayeyuḥ /
analyzed: te tasmin samaye tīva śocayeyuḥ
translated: At that time, they would grieve greatly,

original: atīva parideveyuḥ yo hyasmākaṃ pitā nātho janako 'nukampakaḥ so 'pi nāmaikaḥ kālagataḥ /
analyzed: atīva parideveyuḥ yaḥ hi asmākam pitā nāthaḥ janakaḥ nukampakaḥ saḥ pi nāma ekaḥ kālagataḥ
translated: and lament greatly, thinking, ‘He who was our father, protector, and compassionate one, he too has died.

original: te 'dya vayamanāthāḥ saṃvṛttāḥ /
analyzed: te dya vayam anāthāḥ saṃvṛttāḥ
translated: Now we are without a protector.’

original: te khalvanāthabhūtamātmānaṃ samanupaśyanto 'śaraṇamātmānaṃ samanupaśyanto 'bhīkṣṇaṃ śokārtā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: te khalu anātha bhūtam ātmānam samanupaśyantaḥ śaraṇam ātmānam samanupaśyantaḥ bhīkṣṇam śoka ārtāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: They, seeing themselves without a protector, seeing themselves without refuge, would often be overcome with grief.

original: teṣāṃ ca tayābhīkṣṇaṃ śokārtatayā sā viparītasaṃjñā aviparītasaṃjñā bhavet /
analyzed: teṣām ca tayā abhīkṣṇam śoka ārta tayā sā viparīta saṃjñā aviparīta saṃjñā bhavet
translated: And by their often being overcome with grief, that inverted perception of theirs would become non-inverted perception.

original: yacca tad bhaiṣajyaṃ varṇagandharasopetaṃ tadvarṇagandharasopetameva saṃjānīyuḥ /
analyzed: yat ca tat bhaiṣajyam varṇa gandha rasa upetam tat varṇa gandha rasa upetam eva saṃjānīyuḥ
translated: And that medicine, endowed with color, smell, and taste, they would perceive as just endowed with color, smell, and taste.

original: tatastasmin samaye tadbhaiṣajyamabhyavahareyuḥ /
analyzed: tatas tasmin samaye tat bhaiṣajyam abhyavahareyuḥ
translated: Then at that time they would ingest that medicine.

original: te cābhyavaharantastasmādābādhāt parimuktā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: te ca abhyavaharantaḥ tasmāt ābādhāt parimuktāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: And by ingesting it, they would be freed from that sickness.

original: atha khalu sa vaidyastān putrānābādhavimuktān viditvā punarevātmānamupadarśayet /
analyzed: atha khalu sa vaidyaḥ tān putrān ābādha vimuktān viditvā punar eva ātmānam upadarśayet
translated: Then indeed that physician, knowing that his sons were freed from sickness, would show himself again.

original: tatkiṃ manyadhve kulaputrā mā haiva tasya vaidyasya tadupāyakauśalyaṃ kurvataḥ kaścinmṛṣāvādena saṃcodayet /🔽āhuḥ no hīdaṃ bhagavan /
analyzed: tat kim manyadhve kula putrāḥ mā ha eva tasya vaidyasya tad upāya kauśalyam kurvataḥ kaścid mṛṣāvādena saṃcodayet  āhuḥ no hi idam bhagavan
translated: What do you think, noble sirs, would anyone accuse that physician of deceit for doing that skillful means?🔽They said: No indeed, Blessed One.

original: no hīdaṃ sugata /
analyzed: no hi idam sugata
translated: No indeed, Sugata.

original: āha evameva kulaputrāḥ ahamapyaprameyāsaṃkhyeyakalpakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrābhisaṃbuddha imāmanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim /
analyzed: āha evam eva kula putrāḥ aham api aprameya asaṃkhyeya kalpa koṭī nayuta śata sahasra abhisaṃbuddhaḥ imām anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim
translated: He said, “Sons of noble family, it is just like this. I attained supreme perfect enlightenment countless, innumerable hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of eons ago.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ kulaputrāḥ ahamantarāntaramevaṃrūpāṇyupāyakauśalyāni sattvānāmupadarśayāmi vinayārtham /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar kula putrāḥ aham antarā antaram evaṃrūpāṇi upāya kauśalyāni sattvānām upadarśayāmi vinaya artham
translated: But, sons of noble family, from time to time I display such skillful means in order to tame beings.

original: na ca me kaścidatra sthāne mṛṣāvādo bhavati //
analyzed: na ca me kaścid atra sthāne mṛṣāvādaḥ bhavati
translated: And in this matter there is no false speech on my part.”

original: atha khalu bhagavānimāmeva arthagatiṃ bhūyasyā mātrayā saṃdarśayamānastasyāṃ velāyāmimāṃ gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān imām eva arthagatim bhūyasyā mātrayā saṃdarśayamānaḥ tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One, in order to demonstrate this meaning even more, at that time spoke these verses:

original: acintiyā kalpasahasrakoṭyo yāsāṃ pramāṇaṃ na kadāci vidyate /
analyzed: kalpa sahasra koṭyaḥ yāsām pramāṇam na kadācid vidyate
translated: “Inconceivable, for thousands of millions of eons, their measure is never known.

original: prāptā mayā eṣa tadāgrabodhirdharmaṃ ca deśemyahu nityakālam // / //
analyzed: prāptā mayā eṣa tadā agra bodhiḥ dharmam ca deśemi ahu nityakālam
translated: I attained that supreme enlightenment and always teach the Dharma.

original: samādapemī bahubodhisattvān bauddhasmi jñānasmi sthapemi caiva /
analyzed: bahu bodhisattvān ca eva
translated: I inspire many bodhisattvas and establish them in the Buddha's wisdom.

original: sattvāna koṭīnayutānanekān paripācayāmī bahukalpakoṭyaḥ // / //
analyzed: koṭīn ayutān anekān paripācayāmī bahu kalpa koṭyaḥ
translated: I ripen many quintillions of beings for many millions of eons.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Doctor

original: nirvāṇabhūmiṃ cupadarśayāmi vinayārtha sattvāna vadāmyupāyam /
analyzed: nirvāṇa bhūmim vinaya artha vadāmi upāyam
translated: In order to tame beings, I display the ground of nirvana and teach the skillful means.

original: na cāpi nirvāmyahu tasmi kāle ihaiva co dharmu prakāśayāmi // / //
analyzed: na ca api tasmi kāle iha eva ca u dharmu prakāśayāmi
translated: And I do not enter nirvana at that time, but teach the Dharma right here.

original: tatrāpi cātmānamadhiṣṭhahāmi sarvāṃśca sattvāna tathaiva cāham /
analyzed: tatra api ca ātmānam adhiṣṭhahāmi sarvān ca sattvāna tathā eva ca aham
translated: And there too I manifest myself, and all beings in the same way.

original: viparītabuddhī ca narā vimūḍhāḥ tatraiva tiṣṭhantu na paśyiṣū mām // / //
analyzed: viparīta buddhī ca narāḥ vimūḍhāḥ tatra eva tiṣṭhantu na mām
translated: But men with perverted understanding and deluded minds, though they stand right there, do not see me.

original: parinirvṛtaṃ dṛṣṭva mamātmabhāvaṃ dhātūṣu pūjāṃ vividhāṃ karonti /
analyzed: parinirvṛtam dṛṣṭvā mama ātmabhāvam dhātūṣu pūjām vividhām karonti
translated: Having seen my body in parinirvāṇa, they make various offerings to the relics.

original: māṃ cā apaśyanti janenti tṛṣṇāṃ tatorjukaṃ citta prabhoti teṣām // / //
analyzed: mām ca a paśyanti janenti tṛṣṇām tatas ūrjukam citta teṣām
translated: Not seeing me, they give rise to craving, and from that their mind becomes agitated.

original: ṛjū yadā te mṛdumārdavāśca utsṛṣṭakāmāśca bhavanti sattvāḥ /
analyzed: ṛjū yadā te mṛdu mārdavāḥ ca utsṛṣṭa kāmāḥ ca bhavanti sattvāḥ
translated: When they are upright, gentle, and tender, and have given up desire,

original: tato ahaṃ śrāvakasaṃgha kṛtvāḥ ātmāna darśemyahu gṛdhrakūṭe // / //
analyzed: aham śrāvaka saṃgha gṛdhrakūṭe
translated: then I will manifest myself on Vulture Peak, having created an assembly of disciples.

original: evaṃ ca haṃ teṣa vadāmi paścāt ihaiva nāhaṃ tada āsi nirvṛtaḥ /
analyzed: evam ca ham vadāmi paścāt iha eva na aham nirvṛtaḥ
translated: And then I will say to them, 'I did not enter parinirvāṇa right here,

original: upāyakauśalya mameti bhikṣavaḥ punaḥ puno bhomyahu jīvaloke // / //
analyzed: upāya kauśalya mama iti bhikṣavaḥ punar punar jīva loke
translated: but, monks, it was through my skillful means that I again and again appeared in the world of the living.'

original: anyehi sattvehi puraskṛto 'haṃ teṣāṃ prakāśemi mamāgrabodhim /
analyzed: anyehi sattvehi puraskṛtaḥ ham teṣām prakāśemi mama agra bodhim
translated: Honored by other beings, I proclaim to them my supreme enlightenment.

original: yūyaṃ ca śabdaṃ na śṛṇotha mahyaṃ anyatra so nirvṛtu lokanāthaḥ // / //
analyzed: yūyam ca śabdam na śṛṇotha mahyam anyatra saḥ nirvṛtu loka nāthaḥ
translated: And you do not hear my voice, except for the Lord of the World who has passed into Nirvāṇa.

original: paśyāmyahaṃ sattva vihanyamānān na cāhu darśemi tadātmabhāvam /
analyzed: paśyāmi aham sattva vihanyamānān na ca āhu darśemi tad ātma bhāvam
translated: I see beings being destroyed, but I do not show them my body.

original: spṛhentu tāvanmama darśanasya tṛṣitāna saddharmu prakāśayiṣye // / //
analyzed: tāvat mama darśanasya saddharmu prakāśayiṣye
translated: Let them long for seeing me for a while; I will teach the true Dharma to those who are thirsty.

original: sadādhiṣṭhānaṃ mama etadīdṛśaṃ acintiyā kalpasahasrakoṭyaḥ /🔽Vaidya
analyzed: sadā adhiṣṭhānam mama etat īdṛśam acintiyā kalpa sahasra koṭyaḥ  vaidya
translated: This is my constant resolve for countless thousands of millions of eons:

original: na ca cyavāmī itu gṛdhrakūṭāt anyāsu śayyāsanakoṭibhiśca // / //
analyzed: na ca cyavāmī itu gṛdhrakūṭāt anyāsu śayyā āsana koṭibhiḥ ca
translated: I will not pass away from here, Vulture Peak, nor from the other millions of resting places.

original: yadāpi sattvā ima lokadhātuṃ paśyanti kalpenti ca dahyamānam /
analyzed: yadā api sattvāḥ lokadhātum paśyanti kalpenti ca dahyamānam
translated: Even when beings see this world burning at the end of the eon,

original: tadāpi cedaṃ mama buddhakṣetraṃ paripūrṇa bhotī marumānuṣāṇām // / //
analyzed: tadā api ca idam mama buddhakṣetram maru mānuṣāṇām
translated: then too this Buddha-field of mine will be filled with gods and humans.

original: krīḍā ratī teṣa vicitra bhoti udyānaprāsādavimānakoṭyaḥ /🔽pratimaṇḍitaṃ ratnamayaiśca parvatairdrumaistathā puṣpaphalairupetaiḥ // / //
analyzed: udyāna prāsāda vimāna koṭyaḥ  pratimaṇḍitam ratna mayaiḥ ca parvataiḥ drumaiḥ tathā puṣpa phalaiḥ upetaiḥ
translated: They will have various kinds of play and joy, with millions of parks, palaces, and mansions,🔽adorned with jeweled mountains and trees bearing flowers and fruits.

original: upariṃ ca devābhihananti tūryān mandāravarṣaṃ ca visarjayanti /
analyzed: uparim ca deva abhihananti tūryān mandāra varṣam ca visarjayanti
translated: And the gods will beat their drums above, and let fall a rain of coral tree flowers.

original: mamaṃ ca abhyokiri śrāvakāṃśca ye cānya bodhāviha prasthitā vidū // / //
analyzed: śrāvakān ca ye
translated: And they do not think of me, the Sugata, the one who has attained the highest state.

original: evaṃ ca me kṣetramidaṃ sadā sthitaṃ anye ca kalpentimu dahyamānam /
analyzed: evam ca me kṣetram idam sadā sthitam anye ca dahyamānam
translated: Thus, my realm has always been like this, while others imagine it to be burning and destroyed.

original: subhairavaṃ paśyiṣu lokadhātuṃ upadrutaṃ śokaśatābhikīrṇam // / //
analyzed: su bhairavam paśyiṣu lokadhātum upadrutam śoka śata abhikīrṇam
translated: They see the world realm as extremely terrifying, afflicted, and strewn with hundreds of sorrows.

original: na cāpi me nāma śṛṇonti jātu tathāgatānāṃ bahukalpakoṭibhiḥ /
analyzed: na ca api me nāma śṛṇonti jātu tathāgatānām bahu kalpa koṭibhiḥ
translated: And they never hear the names of the Tathagatas for many millions of eons,

original: dharmasya vā mahya gaṇasya cāpi pāpasya karmasya phalevarūpam // / //
analyzed: dharmasya vā gaṇasya ca api pāpasya karmasya
translated: The result of their evil karma.

original: lyadā tu sattvā mṛdu mārdavāśca utpanna bhontīha manuṣyaloke /
analyzed: tu sattvāḥ mṛdu mārdavāḥca utpanna bhonti iha manuṣya loke
translated: But when beings become soft and tender in this human world,

original: utpannamātrāśca śubhena karmaṇā paśyanti māṃ dharmu prakāśayantam // / //
analyzed: utpanna mātrāḥ ca śubhena karmaṇā paśyanti mām prakāśayantam
translated: And as soon as they are born, through good karma, they see me teaching the Dharma.

original: na cāhu bhāṣāmi kadāci teṣāṃ imāṃ kriyāmīdṛśikīmanuttarām /
analyzed: na ca āhuḥ bhāṣāmi teṣām imām kriyām īdṛśikīm anuttarām
translated: And I never speak to them of this kind of unsurpassed practice,

original: teno ahaṃ dṛṣṭa cirasya bhomi tato 'sya bhāṣāmi sudurlabhā jināḥ // / //
analyzed: aham bhomi tatas bhāṣāmi su durlabhāḥ jināḥ
translated: Therefore, I have been seen by him after a long time, and then I speak of the Jinas, who are difficult to find.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: etādṛśaṃ jñānabalaṃ mayedaṃ prabhāsvaraṃ yasya na kaścidantaḥ /
analyzed: etādṛśam jñāna balam mayā idam prabhāsvaram yasya na kaścid antaḥ
translated: I have this kind of knowledge and power, which is luminous and has no end.

original: āyuśca me dīrghamanantakalpaṃ samupārjitaṃ pūrva caritva caryām // / //
analyzed: āyuḥ ca me dīrgham ananta kalpam samupārjitam caryām
translated: And my lifespan is long, for endless eons, having previously practiced and accumulated conduct.

original: mā saṃśayaṃ atra kurudhva paṇḍitā vicikitsitaṃ co jahathā aśeṣam /
analyzed: mā saṃśayam atra kurudhva paṇḍitāḥ vicikitsitam ca u jahathāḥ aśeṣam
translated: Do not have doubt in this, O wise ones, and abandon all hesitation without remainder.

original: bhūtāṃ prabhāṣāmyahameta vācaṃ mṛṣā mamā naiva kadāci vāg bhavet // / //
analyzed: bhūtām prabhāṣāmi aham eta vācam mṛṣā mamā nā eva kadācid vāc bhavet
translated: I speak these words truthfully; my speech can never be false.

original: yathā hi so vaidya upāyaśikṣito viparītasaṃjñīna sutāna hetoḥ /
analyzed: yathā hi saḥ vaidyaḥ upāya śikṣitaḥ hetoḥ
translated: Just as a doctor trained in methods, for the sake of his confused children,

original: jīvantamātmāna mṛteti brūyāt taṃ vaidyu vijño na mṛṣeṇa codayet // / //
analyzed: jīvantam ātmāna mṛta iti brūyāt tam vaidyu vijñaḥ na mṛṣeṇa codayet
translated: would say the living self is dead; a wise doctor would not accuse him of falsehood.

original: yameva haṃ lokapitā svayaṃbhūḥ cikitsakaḥ sarvaprajāna nāthaḥ /
analyzed: yam eva ham loka pitā svayaṃbhūḥ cikitsakaḥ sarvaprajāna nāthaḥ
translated: Just as I, the self-arisen father of the world, the doctor, the protector of all beings,

original: viparīta mūḍhāṃśca viditva bālān anirvṛto nirvṛta darśayāmi // / //
analyzed: viparīta mūḍhān ca bālān anirvṛtaḥ nirvṛta darśayāmi
translated: knowing the confused and deluded children, though not liberated, show them as if liberated.

original: kiṃ kāraṇaṃ mahyamabhīkṣṇadarśanād viśraddha bhontī abudhā ajānakāḥ /
analyzed: kim kāraṇam mahyam abhīkṣṇa darśanāt viśraddha abudhāḥ a jānakāḥ
translated: What is the reason? If the ignorant and unknowing ones see me frequently, they become faithless.

original: viśvasta kāmeṣu pramatta bhontī pramādahetoḥ prapatanti durgatim // / //
analyzed: viśvasta kāmeṣu pramatta pramāda hetoḥ prapatanti durgatim
translated: Trusting in desires, they become heedless. Due to heedlessness, they fall into bad rebirths.

original: cariṃ cariṃ jāniya nityakālaṃ vadāmi sattvāna tathā tathāham /
analyzed: carim carim nityakālam vadāmi tathā tathā aham
translated: Always knowing the conduct of conduct, I speak to beings in such and such ways.

original: kathaṃ nu bodhāvupanāmayeyaṃ katha buddhadharmāṇa bhaveyu lābhinaḥ // / //
analyzed: katham nu bodhau upanāmayeyam katham buddha dharmāṇa bhaveyu lābhinaḥ
translated: How can I lead them to enlightenment? How can they become recipients of the Buddha’s Dharma?”

original: ityāryasaddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye tathāgatāyuṣpramāṇaparivarto nāma pañcadaśamaḥ //
analyzed: iti ārya saddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye tathāgatāyuṣpramāṇaparivartaḥ nāma pañcadaśamaḥ
translated: Thus concludes “The Chapter on the Lifespan of the Tathāgata,” the fifteenth chapter of the Dharma teaching of “The White Lotus of the Good Dharma.”

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: puṇyaparyāyaparivartaḥ /
analyzed: puṇyaparyāya parivartaḥ
translated: The Chapter on the Accumulation of Merit

original: asmin khalu punastathāgatāyuṣpramāṇanirdeśe nirdiśyamāne aprameyāṇāmasaṃkhyeyānāṃ sattvānāmarthaḥ kṛto 'bhūt /
analyzed: asmin khalu punar tathāgata āyuṣpramāṇa nirdeśe nirdiśyamāne aprameyāṇām asaṃkhyeyānām sattvānām arthaḥ kṛtaḥ bhūt
translated: When this teaching on the lifespan of the Tathāgata was being given, the welfare of innumerable, countless beings was accomplished.

original: atha khalu bhagavān maitreyaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamāmantrayate sma asmin khalu
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān maitreyam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam āmantrayate sma  asmin khalu
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya: “In this

original: punarajita tathāgatāyuṣpramāṇanirdeśadharmaparyāye nirdiśyamāne aṣṭaṣaṣṭigaṅgānadīvālukāsamānāṃ🔽bodhisattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇāmanutpattikadharmakṣāntirutpannā /
analyzed: punar ajita tathāgata āyuṣpramāṇa nirdeśa dharmaparyāye nirdiśyamāne aṣṭaṣaṣṭi gaṅgā nadī vālukā samānām  bodhisattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇām anutpattikadharmakṣāntiḥ utpannā
translated: teaching on the lifespan of the Tathāgata, when this Dharma teaching was being given, the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas arose for 6,800,000,000,000,🔽a hundred thousand koṭis of niyutas of bodhisattvas.

original: ebhyaḥ sahasraguṇena yeṣāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ dhāraṇīpratilambho 'bhūt /
analyzed: ebhyaḥ sahasraguṇena yeṣām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām dhāraṇī pratilambhaḥ bhūt
translated: For those bodhisattva mahāsattvas, who were a thousand times greater in number, the attainment of dhāraṇīs arose.

original: anyeṣāṃ ca sāhasrikalokadhātuparamāṇurajaḥsamānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāmimaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śrutvā asaṅgapratibhānatāpratilambho 'bhūt
analyzed: anyeṣām ca sāhasrika lokadhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ samānām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām imam dharmaparyāyam śrutvā asaṅga pratibhāna tā pratilambhaḥ bhūt
translated: And other bodhisattva mahāsattvas, equal in number to the atoms in a world system of a thousand worlds, having heard this Dharma teaching, attained unobstructed eloquence.

original: anyeṣāṃ ca dvisāhasrikalokadhātuparamāṇurajaḥsamānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ koṭīnayutaśatasahasraparivartāyā dhāraṇyāḥ pratilambho 'bhūt
analyzed: anyeṣām ca dvi sāhasrika lokadhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ samānām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām koṭī nayuta śata sahasra parivartāyāḥ dhāraṇyāḥ pratilambhaḥ bhūt
translated: And other bodhisattva mahāsattvas, equal in number to the atoms in a world system of two thousand worlds, attained the dhāraṇī of turning the wheel of the Dharma a hundred thousand quintillion times.

original: anye ca trisāhasrikalokadhātuparamāṇurajaḥsamā bodhisattvā mahāsattvā imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śrutvā avaivartyadharmacakraṃ pravartayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: anye ca tri sāhasrika lokadhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ imam dharmaparyāyam śrutvā avaivartya dharmacakram pravartayāmāsuḥ
translated: And other bodhisattva mahāsattvas, equal in number to the atoms in a world system of three thousand worlds, having heard this Dharma teaching, turned the irreversible wheel of the Dharma.

original: anye ca madhyamakalokadhātuparamāṇurajaḥsamā bodhisattvā mahāsattvā imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śrutvā vimalanirbhāsacakraṃ pravartayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: anye ca madhyamaka lokadhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ imam dharmaparyāyam śrutvā vimala nirbhāsa cakram pravartayāmāsuḥ
translated: And other bodhisattva mahāsattvas, equal in number to the atoms in a world system of a medium-sized universe, having heard this Dharma teaching, turned the wheel of the Dharma of stainless radiance.

original: anye ca kṣudrakalokadhātuparamāṇurajaḥsamā bodhisattvā mahāsattvā imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śrutvā aṣṭajātipratibaddhā abhūvan anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau
analyzed: anye ca kṣudraka lokadhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ imam dharmaparyāyam śrutvā aṣṭa jāti pratibaddhāḥ abhūvan anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And other bodhisattva mahāsattvas, equal to the atoms in a small chiliocosm, having heard this Dharma teaching, became bound by one more birth to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: anye ca catuścāturdvīpikā lokadhātuparamāṇurajaḥsamā bodhisattvā mahāsattvā imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śrutvā caturjātipratibaddhā abhūvan anuttarāyāṃ
analyzed: anye ca catur cāturdvīpikāḥ lokadhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ imam dharmaparyāyam śrutvā catur jāti pratibaddhāḥ abhūvan anuttarāyām
translated: And other bodhisattva mahāsattvas, equal to the atoms in a four-continent world system, having heard this Dharma teaching, became bound by four births to unsurpassed

original: samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: perfect, complete awakening.

original: anye ca tricāturdvīpikā lokadhātuparamāṇurajaḥsamā bodhisattvā mahāsattvā imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śrutvā trijātipratibaddhā abhūvan anuttarāyāṃ
analyzed: anye ca tri cāturdvīpikāḥ lokadhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ imam dharmaparyāyam śrutvā tri jāti pratibaddhāḥ abhūvan anuttarāyām
translated: And other bodhisattva mahāsattvas, equal to the atoms in a triple-thousand, great one-thousand world system, having heard this Dharma teaching, became bound by three births to unsurpassed

original: samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: perfect, complete awakening.

original: anye ca dvicāturdvīpikā lokadhātuparamāṇurajaḥsamā bodhisattvḥ mahḥsattvḥ imaṃ dharmaparyḥyaṃ śrutvḥ dvijḥtipratibaddhḥ abhūvannanuttarḥyḥṃ
analyzed: anye ca dvi cāturdvīpikāḥ lokadhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahḥsattvaḥ imam dharmaparyḥyam śrutvā dvi jḥti pratibaddhḥ abhūvan anuttarāyḥm
translated: And other bodhisattva mahāsattvas, equal to the atoms in a four-continent world system, having heard this Dharma teaching, became bound by two births to unsurpassed🔽perfect, complete awakening.🔽And other bodhisattva mahāsattvas, equal to the atoms in a four-continent world system, having heard this Dharma teaching, became bound by one birth to unsurpassed

original: samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: perfect, complete awakening.

original: anye caikacḥturdvīpikḥ lokadhḥtuparamḥṇurajaḥsamḥ bodhisattvḥ mahḥsattvḥ imaṃ dharmaparyḥyaṃ śrutvḥ ekajḥtipratibaddhḥ abhūvannanuttarḥyḥṃ
analyzed: anye ca eka cḥturdvīpikaḥ bodhisattvḥ mahḥsattvaḥ imam dharmaparyḥyam śrutvā eka jḥti pratibaddhaḥ abhūvan anuttaraḥ
translated: and other bodhisattva mahāsattvas equal to the atoms in one, two, or four continents, having heard this Dharma teaching, became bound by one birth to the highest complete enlightenment.

original: aṣṭatrisḥhasramahḥsḥhasralokadhḥtuparamḥṇurajaḥsamaiśca bodhisattvairmahḥsattvairimaṃ dharmaparyḥyaṃ śrutvḥ anuttarḥyḥṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittḥnyutpḥditḥni
analyzed: aṣṭa tris sḥhasra mahā sḥhasra loka dhḥtu param aṇu rajaḥ samaiḥ ca bodhisattvaiḥ mahḥsattvaiḥ imam dharma paryḥyam śrutvā anuttarāyṃ samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: and bodhisattva mahāsattvas equal to the atoms in a great trichiliocosm, having heard this Dharma teaching, generated the mind of aspiration for the highest complete enlightenment.

original: atha samanantaranirdiṣṭe bhagavataiṣāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ dharmābhisamaye pratiṣṭhāne /
analyzed: atha samanantara nirdiṣṭe bhagavatā eṣām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām dharma abhisamaye pratiṣṭhāne
translated: Then, immediately after the Blessed One had thus taught the bodhisattva mahāsattvas the establishment in the realization of the Dharma,

original: atha tāvadevoparivaihāyasādantarīkṣānmāndāravamahāmāndāravāṇāṃ puṣpāṇāṃ puṣpavarṣamabhipravṛṣṭam /
analyzed: atha tāvat eva upari vaihāyasāt antarīkṣāt māndārava mahāmāndāravāṇām puṣpāṇām puṣpa varṣam abhipravṛṣṭam
translated: at that very moment a rain of coral tree and great coral tree flowers fell from the sky above.

original: teṣu ca lokadhātukoṭīnayutaśatasahasreṣu yāni tāni buddhakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇyāgatya ratnavṛkṣamūleṣu siṃhāsanopaviṣṭāni /🔽tāni sarvāṇi cāvakiranti sma /🔽abhyavakiranti sma /
analyzed: teṣu ca lokadhātu koṭī nayuta śata sahasreṣu yāni tāni buddha koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi āgatya ratna vṛkṣa mūleṣu siṃhāsana upaviṣṭāni  tāni sarvāṇi ca avakiranti sma  abhyavakiranti sma
translated: And in those many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of world systems, the many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of buddhas who had come and were seated on lion thrones at the foot of precious trees,🔽they all scattered flowers.🔽They scattered them.

original: abhiprakiranti sma /
analyzed: abhiprakiranti sma
translated: They scattered them again and again.

original: bhagavantaṃ ca śākyamuniṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ taṃ ca bhagavantaṃ prabhūtaratnaṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ parinirvṛtaṃ
analyzed: bhagavantam ca śākyamunim tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham tam ca bhagavantam prabhūtaratnam tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham parinirvṛtam
translated: They scattered flowers over the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Śākyamuni, and over the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Prabhūtaratna, who had passed into parinirvāṇa,

original: siṃhāsanopaviṣṭamavakiranti sma /🔽abhyavakiranti sma /
analyzed: siṃhāsana upaviṣṭam avakiranti sma  abhyavakiranti sma
translated: and who was seated on a lion throne.🔽They sprinkled them.

original: abhiprakiranti sma /
analyzed: abhiprakiranti sma
translated: They scattered them.

original: taṃ ca sarvāvantaṃ bodhisattvagaṇaṃ tāścatasraḥ parṣado 'vakiranti sma /🔽abhyavakiranti sma /
analyzed: tam ca sarvāvantam bodhisattva gaṇam tāḥ catasraḥ parṣadaḥ vakiranti sma  abhyavakiranti sma
translated: They scattered them over the entire assembly of bodhisattvas and the fourfold assembly.🔽They sprinkled them.

original: abhiprakiranti sma /
analyzed: abhiprakiranti sma
translated: They scattered them.

original: divyāni ca candanāgarucūrṇānyantarīkṣāt pravarṣanti sma /
analyzed: divyāni ca candana agaru cūrṇāni antarīkṣāt pravarṣanti sma
translated: From the sky above, they caused a rain of divine sandalwood and agarwood powder to fall.

original: upariṣṭāccāntarīkṣe vaihāyasaṃ mahādundubhayo 'ghaṭṭitāḥ praṇedurmanojñamadhuragambhīranirghoṣāḥ Vaidya /
analyzed: upariṣṭāt ca antarīkṣe vaihāyasam mahā dundubhayaḥ ghaṭṭitāḥ praṇeduḥ manojña madhura gambhīra nirghoṣāḥ vaidya
translated: And in the sky above, great drums sounded without being struck, with a delightful, sweet, and deep resonance.

original: divyāni ca dūṣyayugmaśatasahasrāṇyupariṣṭādantarīkṣāt prapatanti sma /
analyzed: divyāni ca dūṣya yugma śata sahasrāṇi upariṣṭāt antarīkṣāt prapatanti sma
translated: From the sky above, hundreds of thousands of pairs of divine garments fell.

original: hārārdhahāramuktāhāramaṇiratnamahāratnāni copariṣṭādvaihāyasamantarīkṣe samantāt savāsu dikṣu pralambanti sma /
analyzed: hāra ardhahāra muktā hāra maṇi ratna mahāratnāni ca upariṣṭāt vaihāyasam antarīkṣe samantāt savāsu dikṣu pralambanti sma
translated: Necklaces, half-necklaces, pearl necklaces, jewels, and precious stones hung all around in the sky above in all directions.

original: samantācca anarghaprāptasya dhūpasya ghaṭikāsahasrāṇi ratnamayāni svayameva pravicaranti sma /
analyzed: samantāt ca an argha prāptasya dhūpasya ghaṭikā sahasrāṇi ratna mayāni svayam eva pravicaranti sma
translated: And all around, thousands of incense burners made of precious materials and filled with priceless incense were spontaneously distributed.

original: ekaikasya ca tathāgatasya ratnamayīṃ chatrāvalīṃ yāvad brahmalokādupari vaihāyasamantarīkṣe bodhisattvā mahāsattvā dhārayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: ekaikasya ca tathāgatasya ratna mayīm chatra āvalīm yāvat brahmalokāt upari vaihāyasam antarīkṣe bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ dhārayāmāsuḥ
translated: Each of those tathāgatas had a canopy made of jewels held aloft in the sky above the world system of a billion worlds by bodhisattva mahāsattvas, up to the Brahma world.

original: anena paryāyeṇa sarveṣāṃ teṣāmaprameyāṇāmasaṃkhyeyānāṃ buddhakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇāṃ
analyzed: anena paryāyeṇa sarveṣām teṣām aprameyāṇām asaṃkhyeyānām buddha koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇām
translated: In this way, all those immeasurable, countless hundreds of thousands of quintillions of buddhas

original: te bodhisattvā mahāsattvā ratnamayīṃ chatrāvalīṃ yāvadbrahmalokādupari vaihāyasamantarīkṣe dhārayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ ratna mayīm chatra āvalīm yāvat brahmalokāt upari vaihāyasam antarīkṣe dhārayāmāsuḥ
translated: those bodhisattva mahāsattvas held a canopy made of jewels in the sky above the world system of a billion worlds, up to the Brahma world.

original: pṛthak pṛthag gāthābhinirhārairbhūtairbuddhastavaistāṃstathāgatānābhiṣṭuvanti sma //
analyzed: pṛthak pṛthak gāthā abhinirhāraiḥ bhūtaiḥ buddha stavaiḥ tān tathāgatān ā abhiṣṭuvanti sma
translated: They praised those tathāgatas with true and perfect verses of praise for the buddhas that they had individually accomplished.

original: atha khalu maitreyo bodhisattvo mahāsattvastasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu maitreyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then at that time the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya spoke these verses:

original: āścarya dharmaḥ sugatena śrāvito na jātu asmābhiḥ śrutaiṣa pūrvam /
analyzed: āścarya dharmaḥ sugatena śrāvitaḥ na jātu asmābhiḥ śrutā eṣa pūrvam
translated: “The Sugata has taught a wondrous Dharma that we have never heard before.

original: mahātmatā yādṛśi nāyakānāṃ āyuṣpramāṇaṃ ca yathā anantam // / //
analyzed: mahātma tā yādṛśi nāyakānām āyuṣpramāṇam ca yathā anantam
translated: The greatness of the great beings, the guides, And the infinite extent of their lifespans.

original: evaṃ ca dharmaṃ śruṇiyāna adya vibhajyamānaṃ sugatena saṃmukham /
analyzed: evam ca dharmam adya vibhajyamānam sugatena saṃmukham
translated: Having heard such Dharma today, being directly taught by the Sugata,

analyzed: prīti sphuṭāḥ prāṇa sahasra koṭyaḥ ye aurasāḥ loka vināyakasya
translated: The many quintillions of beings who are the sons of the world's guide, filled with joy,

original: avivartiyā keci sthitāgrabodhau keci sthitā dhāraṇiye varāyām /
analyzed: keci sthitāḥ agra bodhau keci sthitāḥ varāyām
translated: Some are established in irreversible supreme enlightenment, some in the supreme state of retention,

original: asaṅgapratibhāṇi sthitāśca kecit koṭīsahasrāya ca dhāraṇīye // / //
analyzed: asaṅga pratibhāni sthitāḥ ca kecid koṭī sahasrāya ca dhāraṇīye
translated: Some are established in unobstructed eloquence and in the retention of thousands of quintillions,

analyzed: paramāṇu kṣetrasya tathā eva ca anye ye prasthitāḥ uttama buddha jñāne
translated: And others are established in the knowledge of the supreme Buddha in a field of atoms.

original: kecicca jātībhi tathaiva cāṣṭabhi jinā bhaviṣyanti anantadarśinaḥ // / //🔽kecittu catvāri atikramitvā kecitribhiścaiva dvibhiśca anye /
analyzed: kecid ca jināḥ bhaviṣyanti ananta darśinaḥ  kecid tu catvāri atikramitvā kecid tribhiḥ ca eva dvibhiḥ ca anye
translated: Some will become Jinas, seers of the infinite, in just eight lifetimes,🔽And some will attain enlightenment, seeing the ultimate truth, after transcending four, three, or two lifetimes,

original: lapsyanti bodhiṃ paramārthadarśinaḥ śruṇitva dharmaṃ imu nāyakasya // / //
analyzed: lapsyanti bodhim parama artha darśinaḥ dharmam nāyakasya
translated: Having heard this Dharma of the guide.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: The physician

analyzed: ke ca api ekāya sthihitva jātyā sarvajña bhoṣyanti bhava antareṇa
translated: And some will become omniscient in another lifetime, remaining in just one birth,

analyzed: nāyakasya etādṛśam phalam anāsravam
translated: Having heard the lifespan of the Guide, they attained such a result free from defilements.

original: aṣṭāna kṣetrāṇa yathā rajo bhavet evāpramāṇā gaṇanāya tattakāḥ /
analyzed: yathā rajaḥ bhavet evāpramāṇāḥ gaṇanāya
translated: Just as there are eight types of dust in the fields, so are the immeasurable and countless

analyzed: yāḥ sattva koṭyaḥ hi dharmam utpādayiṃsū vara bodhi cittam
translated: Sattvas who, having heard the Dharma, generated the supreme mind of awakening.

analyzed: etādṛśam karma kṛtam mahā ṛṣiṇā prakāśayan tenima buddha bodhim
translated: Such an act was done by the Great Sage, who illuminated this Buddha's enlightenment.

analyzed: anantakam yasya pramāṇu na asti ākāśa dhātū ca yathā prameyaḥ
translated: It is endless and has no measure, just as the realm of space is immeasurable.

analyzed: māndāravāṇām ca pravarṣi varṣam sahasra koṭyaḥ

translated: And Shakra and Brahma, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, came from thousands of millions of fields.

analyzed: caranti ākāśi yathā eva pakṣī vidhivat jinendrān
translated: And moved in the sky like birds, scattering them properly upon the lords of sages.

original: upariṃ ca vaihāyasu dundubhīyo ninādayanto madhurā aghaṭṭitāḥ /
analyzed: uparim ca vaihāyasu dundubhīyaḥ ninādayantaḥ madhurāḥ a ghaṭṭitāḥ

analyzed: sahasra koṭyaḥ kṣipanti ca nāyakānām
translated: Which emit priceless incense,🔽Circumambulate and make offerings to the guides.

analyzed: anargha mūlyasya ca dhūpanasya ratna āmayī ghaṭika sahasra koṭyaḥ  svayam samantena viceru tatra pūjā artha loka adhipatisya tāyinaḥ
translated: Countless quintillions of jeweled parasols,

translated: Which are lofty, vast, and made of jewels,🔽Are held by wise bodhisattvas,

analyzed: dhārantime paṇḍita bodhisattvāḥ avataṃsakān yāvat brahma lokāt  vaidya  sa vaijayantān ca su darśanīyān dhvajān ca nāyakānām

analyzed: gāthā sahasraiḥ ca abhiṣṭuvanti prahṛṣṭa cittāḥ sugatasya putrāḥ
translated: With joyful minds, the sons of the Sugata.🔽Such extraordinary, wondrous, and marvelous

analyzed: adya nāyakāḥ
translated: Various things are seen today of the guides.🔽All these beings have attained joy

analyzed: āyuṣpramāṇasya nidarśanena prāmodya labdhāḥ sarva sattvāḥ
translated: Through the demonstration of the lifespan.🔽Today, the vast meaning in the ten directions

original: caret /

analyzed: yena ca ajita kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā imam tathāgata āyuṣpramāṇa nirdeśam dharmaparyāyam śrutvā ekacitta utpādikā api adhimuktiḥ utpāditā abhiśraddadhāna tā  /

original: kaṃḥ punarvādo ye dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti /
analyzed: kaṃḥ punar vādaḥ ye dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti
translated: how much more so those who will uphold and recite it!

original: tatastathāgataṃ soṃ 'sena pariharati ya imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ pustakagataṃ kṛtvā aṃsena pariharati /
analyzed: tatas tathāgatam soṃ sena pariharati yaḥ imam dharmaparyāyam pustaka gatam kṛtvā aṃsena pariharati
translated: Therefore, Ajita, that noble man or noble woman who, having made this Dharma discourse into a book, carries it on their shoulder, carries the Tathāgata on their shoulder.

original: na me tenājita kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā stūpāḥ kartavyāḥ /
analyzed: na me tena ajita kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā stūpāḥ kartavyāḥ
translated: Ajita, that noble man or noble woman should not make stūpas for me,

original: na vihārā kartavyāḥ /
analyzed: na vihārā kartavyāḥ
translated: should not make monasteries,

original: na bhikṣusaṃghāya glānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariṣkārāstenānupradeyā bhavanti /
analyzed: na bhikṣu saṃghāya glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārāḥ tena anupradeyāḥ bhavanti
translated: should not give medicines and necessities for the sick to the community of monks.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: kṛtā me tena ajita kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā śarīreṣu śarīrapūjā /
analyzed: kṛtā me tena ajita kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā śarīreṣu śarīra pūjā
translated: Ajita, that noble man or noble woman has already made bodily worship of my bodily relics.

original: saptaratnamayāśca stūpāḥ kāritāḥ /
analyzed: sapta ratna mayāḥ ca stūpāḥ kāritāḥ
translated: They have already made stūpas out of the seven precious things,

original: yāvad brahmalokamuccaistvena anupūrvapariṇāhena sacchatraparigrahāḥ savaijayantīkā ghaṇṭāsamudgānuratāḥ /
analyzed: yāvat brahmalokam uccaistvena anupūrva pariṇāhena sa chatra parigrahāḥ sa vaijayantīkāḥ ghaṇṭā samudga anuratāḥ
translated: up to the height of the Brahma world, with gradual terraces, surrounded by canopies, with banners and flags, resounding with the sound of bells,

original: teṣāṃ ca śarīrastūpānāṃ vividhāḥ satkārāḥ kṛtā nānāvidhairdivyairmānuṣyakaiḥ🔽puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākāvaijayantībhirvividhamadhuramanojñapaṭupaṭahadundubhimahādundubhibhirvādyatālaninādarnirghoṣaśabdairnānāvidhaiśca
analyzed: teṣām ca śarīra stūpānām vividhāḥ satkārāḥ kṛtāḥ nānāvidhaiḥ divyaiḥ mānuṣyakaiḥ  puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākā vaijayantībhiḥ vividha madhura manojña paṭu paṭaha dundubhi mahā dundubhibhiḥ vādya tāla ninādaḥ nirghoṣa śabdaiḥ nānāvidhaiḥ ca
translated: And various kinds of worship are performed for those bodily stupas with various kinds of divine and human🔽flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, flags, and banners of victory, with the sounds of various sweet, pleasant, and loud musical instruments such as paṭaha drums, and with the sounds of various

original: gītanṛtyalāsyaprakārairbahubhiraparimitairbahvaprameyāṇi kalpakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi🔽satkāraḥ kṛto bhavati /
analyzed: gīta nṛtya lāsya prakāraiḥ bahubhiḥ aparimitaiḥ bahu aprameyāṇi kalpa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi  satkāraḥ kṛtaḥ bhavati
translated: songs, dances, and entertainments, for many innumerable and immeasurable hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of kalpas.🔽When this Dharma discourse is upheld, recited, written out,

original: imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ mama parinirvṛtasya dhārayitvā vācayitvā likhitvā Vaidya
analyzed: imam dharmaparyāyam mama parinirvṛtasya dhārayitvā vācayitvā likhitvā vaidya
translated: and explained by me after my parinirvāṇa, Ajita, by that

original: prakāśayitvā vihārā api tena ajita kṛtā bhavanti vipulā vistīrṇāḥ /
analyzed: prakāśayitvā vihārā api tena ajita kṛtā bhavanti vipulāḥ vistīrṇāḥ
translated: monasteries are also made by him, vast and extensive,

original: pragṛhītāśca lohitacandanamayā dvātriṃśatprāsādā aṣṭatalā bhikṣusahasrāvāsāḥ /
analyzed: pragṛhītāḥ ca lohita candana mayāḥ dvātriṃśat prāsādāḥ aṣṭa talāḥ bhikṣu sahasra āvāsāḥ
translated: and thirty-two palaces made of red sandalwood, with eight stories, dwellings for thousands of monks, are taken up.

original: ārāmapuṣpopaśobhitāścaṃkramavanopetāḥ śayanāsanopastabdhāḥ khādyabhojyānnapānaglānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariṣkāraparipūrṇāḥ sarvasukhopadhānapratimaṇḍitāḥ🔽te ca bahvaprameyā yaduta śataṃ vā sahasraṃ vā śatasahasraṃ vā koṭī vā koṭīśataṃ vā koṭīsahasraṃ vā koṭiśatasahasraṃ vā koṭīnayutaśatasahasraṃ
analyzed: ārāma puṣpa upaśobhitāḥ caṃkrama vana upetāḥ śayana āsana upastabdhāḥ khādya bhojya anna pāna glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkāra paripūrṇāḥ sarva sukha upadhāna pratimaṇḍitāḥ  te ca bahu aprameyāḥ yat uta śatam vā sahasram vā śata sahasram vā koṭī vā koṭī śatam vā koṭī sahasram vā koṭi śata sahasram vā koṭī nayuta śata sahasram
translated: They were adorned with garden flowers, had walking paths, were equipped with beds and seats, were filled with food, drink, and medicines for the sick, and were fully endowed with all the requisites for happiness.

original: vā /
analyzed: vā
translated: And they were innumerable, namely, one hundred, one thousand, one hundred thousand, one koṭi, one hundred koṭis, one thousand koṭis, one hundred thousand koṭis, one nayuta, one hundred nayutas, one thousand nayutas, one hundred thousand nayutas.

original: te ca mama saṃmukhaṃ śrāvakasaṃghasya niryātitāḥ /
analyzed: te ca mama saṃmukham śrāvaka saṃghasya niryātitāḥ
translated: And they were offered to the assembly of disciples in my presence.

original: te ca mayā paribhuktā veditavyāḥ /
analyzed: te ca mayā paribhuktāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: And they should be known to have been enjoyed by me.

original: ya imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya dhārayedvā vācayedvā deśayedvā likhedvā lekhayedvā /
analyzed: yaḥ imam dharmaparyāyam tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya dhārayet vā vācayet vā deśayet vā likhet vā lekhayet vā
translated: Whoever, after the Tathāgata's parinirvāṇa, upholds this Dharma discourse, recites it, teaches it, writes it, or has it written,

original: tadanenāhamajitaparyāyeṇa evaṃ vadāmi na me tena parinirvṛtasya dhātustūpāḥ kārayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: tat anena aham ajita paryāyeṇa evam vadāmi na me tena parinirvṛtasya dhātustūpāḥ kārayitavyāḥ
translated: by this method, Ajita, I say thus: 'For me, after parinirvāṇa, stūpas should not be made for my relics,

original: na saṃghapūjā /
analyzed: na saṃgha pūjā
translated: nor should there be worship of the Saṅgha.'

original: kaḥ punarvādo 'jita ya imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ dhārayan dānena vā saṃpādayecchīlena vā kṣāntyā vā vīryeṇa vā dhyānena
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ jita yaḥ imam dharmaparyāyam dhārayan dānena vā saṃpādayet śīlena vā kṣāntyā vā vīryeṇa vā dhyānena
translated: How much more so, Ajita, for one who, holding this Dharma teaching, would practice it with generosity, or with morality, or with patience, or with diligence, or with concentration,

original: vā prajñayā vā saṃpādayet /
analyzed: vā prajñayā vā saṃpādayet
translated: or with wisdom.

original: bahutaraṃ puṇyābhisaṃskāraṃ sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā prasaved buddhajñānasaṃvartanīyamaprameyamasaṃkhyeyamaparyantam /
analyzed: bahutaram puṇya abhisaṃskāram sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā prasavet buddha jñāna saṃvartanīyam aprameyam asaṃkhyeyam aparyantam
translated: That son of a good family or daughter of a good family would produce a much greater creation of merit, immeasurable, incalculable, limitless, leading to Buddha-knowledge.

original: tadyathāpi nāma ajita ākāśa dhāturaparyantaḥ pūrvadakṣiṇapaścimottarādharordhvāsu dikṣu vidikṣu /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma ajita ākāśa dhātuḥ aparyantaḥ pūrva dakṣiṇa paścima uttara adhara ūrdhvāsu dikṣu vidikṣu
translated: Just as, Ajita, the element of space is limitless in the eastern direction, in the southern direction, in the western direction, in the northern direction, below, above, and in the intermediate directions,

original: evamaprameyāsaṃkhyeyān sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā puṇyābhisaṃskārān prasaved buddhajñānasaṃvartanīyān
analyzed: evam aprameya asaṃkhyeyān sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā puṇya abhisaṃskārān prasavet buddha jñāna saṃvartanīyān
translated: in the same way that son of a good family or daughter of a good family would produce immeasurable, incalculable creations of merit leading to Buddha-knowledge,

original: ya imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ dhārayedvā vācayedvā deśayedvā likhedvā likhāpayedvā /🔽tathāgatacaityasatkārārthaṃ ca abhiyukto bhavet /
analyzed: yaḥ imam dharmaparyāyam dhārayet vā vācayet vā deśayet vā likhet vā likhāpayet vā  tathāgata caitya satkāra artham ca abhiyuktaḥ bhavet
translated: who would hold this Dharma teaching, recite it, teach it, write it, or cause it to be written.🔽And he would be devoted to the worship of the Tathāgata's stūpas.

original: tathāgataśrāvakāṇāṃ ca varṇaṃ bhāṣeta /
analyzed: tathāgata śrāvakāṇām ca varṇam bhāṣeta
translated: And he would speak in praise of the Tathāgata's disciples.

original: bodhisattvānāṃ ca mahāsattvānāṃ guṇakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi parikīrtayet /
analyzed: bodhisattvānām ca mahāsattvānām guṇa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi parikīrtayet
translated: He would proclaim the many quintillions of qualities of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: pareṣāṃ ca saṃprakāśayet /
analyzed: pareṣām ca saṃprakāśayet
translated: He would teach them to others.

original: kṣāntyā ca saṃpādayet /
analyzed: kṣāntyā ca saṃpādayet
translated: He would accomplish patience.

original: śīlavāṃśca bhavet /🔽kalyāṇadharmaḥ sukhasaṃvāsaḥ kṣāntaśca bhavet /
analyzed: śīlavān ca bhavet  kalyāṇa dharmaḥ sukha saṃvāsaḥ kṣāntaḥ ca bhavet
translated: He would have morality.🔽He would have good qualities, be easy to be with, and have patience.

original: dāntaśca bhavedanabhyasūyakaśca /
analyzed: dāntaḥ ca bhavet anabhyasūyakaḥ ca
translated: He would be self-controlled and free from envy.

original: apagatakrodhamanaskāro 'vyāpannamanaskāraḥ smṛtimāṃśca sthāmavāṃśca bhavet /
analyzed: apagata krodha manaskāraḥ vyāpanna manaskāraḥ smṛtimān ca sthāmavān ca bhavet
translated: He would be free from thoughts of anger and thoughts of harm, and would have mindfulness and stability.

original: vīryavāṃśca nityābhiyuktaśca bhavet /
analyzed: vīryavān ca nitya abhiyuktaḥ ca bhavet
translated: He would have energy and always be diligent.

original: buddhadharmaparyeṣṭyā dhyāyī ca bhavet /
analyzed: buddha dharma paryeṣṭyā dhyāyī ca bhavet
translated: He would meditate on the search for the Buddha's teachings.

original: pratisaṃlayanagurukaḥ pratisaṃlayanabahulaśca praśnaprabhedakuśalaśca bhavet /
analyzed: pratisaṃlayana gurukaḥ pratisaṃlayana bahulaḥ ca praśna prabheda kuśalaḥ ca bhavet
translated: He would be devoted to seclusion and would often be in seclusion. He would be skilled in distinguishing questions.

original: praśnakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇāṃ visarjayitā /
analyzed: praśna koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇām visarjayitā
translated: He would answer a hundred thousand quintillion questions.

original: yasya kasyacidajita bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya dhārayataḥ ime evaṃrūpā guṇā bhaveyurye mayā
analyzed: yasya kasyacid ajita bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya imam dharmaparyāyam tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya dhārayataḥ ime evaṃrūpāḥ guṇāḥ bhaveyuḥ ye mayā
translated: Ajita, if any bodhisattva mahāsattva, after the Tathāgata's parinirvāṇa, upholds this Dharma teaching, he would have these kinds of qualities, which I have proclaimed for a hundred thousand quintillion eons, and still not finish describing them.

original: so 'jita kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā evaṃ veditavyaḥ bodhimaṇḍasaṃprasthito 'yaṃ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā bodhimabhisaṃboddhuṃ bodhivṛkṣamūlaṃ
analyzed: saḥ jita kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā evam veditavyaḥ bodhimaṇḍa saṃprasthitaḥ yam kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā bodhim abhisaṃboddhum bodhivṛkṣa mūlam
translated: That noble son or noble daughter should be known thus: This noble son or noble daughter has set out for the seat of awakening, has gone to the foot of the tree of awakening in order to awaken to complete and supreme awakening.

original: gacchati /
analyzed: gacchati
translated: They go to the place where the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, is seated, and they say this: May the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, quickly awaken to complete and supreme awakening!

original: yatra ca ajita sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tiṣṭhedvā niṣīdedvā caṃkramedvā /🔽tatra ajita tathāgatamuddiśya caityaṃ kartavyam /
analyzed: yatra ca ajita sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tiṣṭhet vā niṣīdet vā caṃkramet vā  tatra ajita tathāgatam uddiśya caityam kartavyam
translated: Wherever that noble son or noble daughter stands, sits, or walks, there, Ajita, a caitya should be made in honor of the Tathagata.

original: tathāgatastūpo 'yamiti ca sa vaktavyaḥ sadevakena lokeneti //
analyzed: tathāgata stūpaḥ yam iti ca sa vaktavyaḥ sa devakena lokena iti
translated: It should be said to be The Tathagata's stupa, by the world with its gods.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses on that occasion:

original: puṇyaskandho aparyanto varṇito me punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: puṇya skandhaḥ aparyantaḥ varṇitaḥ me punar punar
translated: The boundless heap of merit has been praised by me again and again,

original: ya idaṃ dhārayetsūtraṃ nirvṛte naranāyake // / //
analyzed: yaḥ idam dhārayet sūtram nirvṛte nara nāyake
translated: By the one who will uphold this sutra when the Leader of men has passed into nirvana.

original: pūjāśca me kṛtāstena dhātustūpāśca kāritāḥ /
analyzed: pūjāḥ ca me kṛtāḥ tena dhātu stūpāḥ ca kāritāḥ
