translated: By them offerings have been made to me, and stupas with relics have been erected,

original: ratnāmayā vicitrāśca darśanīyaḥ suśobhanāḥ // / //
analyzed: ratna āmayāḥ vicitrāḥ ca darśanīyaḥ su śobhanāḥ
translated: Made of jewels, various, beautiful, and very lovely.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: brahmalokasamā uccā chatrāvalibhiranvitāḥ /
analyzed: brahma loka samāḥ uccā chatra āvalibhiḥ anvitāḥ
translated: As high as the Brahma world, adorned with rows of parasols,

original: pariṇāhavantaḥ śrīmanto vaijayantīsamanvitāḥ // / //
analyzed: pariṇāhavantaḥ śrīmantaḥ vaijayantī samanvitāḥ
translated: Magnificent, with victory banners,

original: paṭughaṇṭā raṇantaśca paṭṭadāmopaśobhitāḥ /
analyzed: paṭu ghaṇṭāḥ raṇantaḥ ca paṭṭa dāma upaśobhitāḥ
translated: With clear bells ringing, adorned with silk streamers,

original: vāteritāstathā ghaṇṭā śobhanti jinadhātuṣu // / //
analyzed: vāta īritāḥ tathā ghaṇṭā śobhanti jina dhātuṣu
translated: And with bells swaying in the wind, they shine upon the relics of the Victorious Ones.

original: pūjā ca vipulā teṣāṃ puṣpagandhavilepanaiḥ /
analyzed: pūjā ca vipulā teṣām puṣpa gandha vilepanaiḥ
translated: They are worshipped with various offerings of flowers, incense, and ointments,

original: kṛtā vādyaiśca vastraiśca dundubhībhiḥ punaḥ puna // / //
analyzed: kṛtā vādyaiḥ ca vastraiḥ ca dundubhībhiḥ punar punar
translated: With musical instruments and garments, and again and again with kettledrums.

original: madhurā vādyabhāṇḍā ca vāditā teṣu dhātuṣu /
analyzed: madhurā vādya bhāṇḍā ca vāditā teṣu dhātuṣu
translated: The musical instruments are played sweetly upon those relics,

original: gandhatailapradīpāśca dattāste 'pi samantataḥ // / //
analyzed: gandha taila pradīpāḥ ca dattāḥ te samantataḥ
translated: And fragrant oil lamps are offered all around.

original: ya idaṃ dhārayet sūtraṃ kṣayakāli ca deśayet /
analyzed: yaḥ idam dhārayet sūtram kṣaya kāli ca deśayet
translated: Whoever would uphold this sūtra and teach it in the age of decline,

original: īdṛśī me kṛtā tena vividhā pūjanantikā // / //
analyzed: īdṛśī me kṛtā tena vividhā
translated: By them various offerings have been made to me in this way.

original: agrā vihārakoṭyo 'pi bahuścandanakāritāḥ /
analyzed: agrāḥ vihāra koṭyaḥ bahu ścandana kāritāḥ
translated: Even millions of the best monasteries have been made, and many with sandalwood,

original: dvātriṃśatī ca prāsādā uccaistvenāṣṭavattalāḥ // / //
analyzed: dvātriṃśatī ca prāsādāḥ uccaistvena aṣṭa vat talāḥ
translated: And thirty-two palaces, eight stories high,

original: śayyāsanairupastabdhāḥ khādyabhojyaiḥ samanvitāḥ /
analyzed: śayyā āsanaiḥ upastabdhāḥ khādya bhojyaiḥ samanvitāḥ
translated: Furnished with beds and seats, and endowed with food and drink,

original: praveṇī praṇīta prajñaptā āvāsāśca sahasraśaḥ // / //
analyzed: praveṇī praṇīta prajñaptāḥ āvāsāḥ ca sahasraśas
translated: And thousands of residences have been arranged, excellent and well-appointed.

original: ārāmāścaṃkramā dattāḥ puṣpārāmopaśobhitāḥ /
analyzed: ārāmāḥ caṃkramāḥ dattāḥ puṣpa ārāma upaśobhitāḥ
translated: Gardens and walking paths have been given, adorned with flower gardens,

original: bahu ucchadakāścaiva bahurūpavicitritāḥ // / //
analyzed: bahu ucchadakāḥ ca eva bahu rūpa vicitritāḥ
translated: And many kinds of various forms have been made.

original: saṃghasya vividhā pūjā kṛtā me tena saṃmukham /
analyzed: saṃghasya vividhā pūjā kṛtā me tena saṃmukham
translated: I have made various offerings to the Saṅgha in their presence.

original: ya idaṃ dhārayetsūtraṃ nirvṛtasmin vināyake // / //
analyzed: yaḥ idam dhārayet sūtram nirvṛtasmin vināyake
translated: One who would uphold this sūtra after the Guide has passed into nirvāṇa...

original: adhimuktisāro yo syādato bahutaraṃ hi saḥ /
analyzed: adhimukti sāraḥ yaḥ syāt atas bahutaram hi saḥ
translated: ...would have even greater faith and would attain even greater merit.

original: puṇyaṃ labheta yo etatsūtraṃ vācellikheta vā // / //
analyzed: puṇyam labheta yaḥ etat sūtram vā aced likheta vā
translated: One who would recite or write out this sūtra...

original: likhāpayennaraḥ kaścit suniruktaṃ ca pustake /
analyzed: likhāpayet naraḥ kaścid su niruktam ca pustake
translated: ...or have someone write it out in a well-composed book,

original: pustakaṃ pūjayettacca gandhamālyavilepanaiḥ // / //
analyzed: pustakam pūjayet tat ca gandha mālya vilepanaiḥ
translated: and would worship that book with incense, garlands, and ointments...

original: dīpaṃ ca dadyādyo nityaṃ gandhatailasya pūritam /
analyzed: dīpam ca dadyāt yaḥ nityam gandha tailasya pūritam
translated: ...and would always offer a lamp filled with fragrant oil,

original: jātyutpalātimuktaiśca prakaraiścampakasya ca // / //
analyzed: jātyutpala atimuktaiḥ ca prakaraiḥ campakasya ca
translated: with jasmine, blue lotus, and atimukta flowers, and with champaka flowers...

original: kuryādetādṛśīṃ pūjāṃ pustakeṣu ca yo naraḥ /
analyzed: kuryāt etādṛśīm pūjām pustakeṣu ca yaḥ naraḥ
translated: ...one who would make such offerings to the books,

original: bahu prasavate puṇyaṃ pramāṇaṃ yasya no bhavet // / //
analyzed: bahu prasavate puṇyam pramāṇam yasya naḥ bhavet
translated: would generate much merit, the measure of which would be unknown.

original: yathaivākāśadhātau hi pramāṇaṃ nopalabhyate /
analyzed: yathā eva ākāśa dhātau hi pramāṇam na upalabhyate
translated: Just as the measure of the element of space cannot be apprehended,

original: diśāsu daśasū nityaṃ puṇyaskandho 'yamīdṛśaḥ // / //
analyzed: diśāsu nityam puṇya skandhaḥ yam īdṛśaḥ
translated: so too is the mass of merit in the ten directions like this...

original: kaḥ punarvādo yaśca syāt kṣānto dāntaḥ samāhitaḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ yaḥ ca syāt kṣāntaḥ dāntaḥ samāhitaḥ
translated: ...what to speak of one who would be patient, disciplined, and concentrated,

original: śīlavāṃścaiva dhyāyī ca pratisaṃlānagocaraḥ // / //
analyzed: śīlavān ca eva dhyāyī ca pratisaṃlāna gocaraḥ
translated: virtuous, meditative, and dwelling in seclusion...

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: akrodhano apiśunaścaityasmin gaurave sthitaḥ /
analyzed: a krodhanaḥ a piśunaḥ ca eti asmin gaurave sthitaḥ
translated: Without anger, without slander, having respect for the caitya,

original: bhikṣūṇāṃ praṇato nityaṃ nādhimānī na cālasaḥ // / //
analyzed: bhikṣūṇām praṇataḥ nityam na adhimānī na ca alasaḥ
translated: Always bowing to the monks, not conceited, not lazy,

original: prajñavāṃścaiva dhīraśca praśnaṃ pṛṣṭo na kupyati /
analyzed: prajñavān ca eva dhīraḥ ca praśnam pṛṣṭaḥ na kupyati
translated: Wise and patient, not getting angry when asked a question,

original: anulomaṃ ca deśeti kṛpābuddhī ca prāṇiṣu // / //
analyzed: anulomam ca deśeti kṛpā buddhī ca prāṇiṣu
translated: And teaching in accordance with the Dharma, with a compassionate mind towards beings,

original: ya īdṛśo bhavetkaścid yaḥ sūtraṃ dhārayedidam /
analyzed: yaḥ īdṛśaḥ bhavet kaścid yaḥ sūtram dhārayet idam
translated: Whoever may be like this, who would uphold this sūtra,

original: na tasya puṇyaskandhasya pramāṇamupalabhyate // / //
analyzed: na tasya puṇya skandhasya pramāṇam upalabhyate
translated: The measure of his merit cannot be apprehended.

original: yadi kaścinnaraḥ paśyedīdṛśaṃ dharmabhāṇakam /
analyzed: yadi kaścid naraḥ paśyet īdṛśam dharma bhāṇakam
translated: If someone were to see such a Dharma teacher,

original: dhārayantamidaṃ sūtraṃ kuryādvai tasya satkriyām // / //
analyzed: dhārayantam idam sūtram kuryāt vai tasya satkriyām
translated: Upholding this sūtra, he should perform acts of respect for him.

original: divyaiśca puṣpaistatha okireta divyaiśca vastrairabhicchādayeta /
analyzed: divyaiḥ ca puṣpaiḥ tathā okireta divyaiḥ ca vastraiḥ abhicchādayeta
translated: He should scatter divine flowers and cover him with divine garments.

original: mūrdhena vanditva ca tasya pādau tathāgato 'yaṃ janayeta saṃjñām // / //
analyzed: mūrdhena vanditvā ca tasya pādau tathāgataḥ yam janayeta saṃjñām
translated: Having bowed his head to his feet, he should generate the perception that this is the Tathāgata.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca taṃ cintayi tasmi kāle gamiṣyate eṣa drumasya mūlam /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca tam tasmin kāle gamiṣyate eṣa drumasya mūlam
translated: And having seen him, at that time he should think, He is going to the foot of the tree.

original: budhyiṣyate bodhimanuttarāṃ śivāṃ hitāya lokasya sadevakasya // / //
analyzed: budhyiṣyate bodhim anuttarām śivām hitāya lokasya sa devakasya
translated: He will attain the auspicious, unsurpassed enlightenment for the benefit of the world and its devas.

original: yasmiṃśca so caṃkrami tādṛśo viduḥ tiṣṭheta vā yatra niṣīdayedvā /
analyzed: yasmin ca tādṛśaḥ viduḥ tiṣṭheta vā yatra
translated: And in which that kind of wise one walks, or stands, or sits,

original: śayyāṃ ca kalpeya kahiṃci dhīro bhāṣantu gāthāṃ pi tu ekasūtrāt // / //
analyzed: śayyām ca kalpeya kahiṃci dhīraḥ bhāṣantu gāthām tu eka sūtrāt
translated: And in which the wise one would make a bed somewhere, and recite even one verse from one sūtra,

original: yasmiṃśca stūpaṃ puruṣottamasya kārāpayeccitrasudarśanīyam /
analyzed: yasmin ca stūpam puruṣottamasya kārāpayet citra su darśanīyam
translated: And in which someone would have a stūpa made for the Supreme Being, beautiful and lovely to behold,

original: uddiśya buddhaṃ bhagavanta nāyakaṃ pūjāṃ ca citrāṃ tahi kārayettathā // / //
analyzed: uddiśya buddham nāyakam pūjām ca citrām kārayet tathā
translated: And would make various offerings there to the Buddha, the Blessed One, the Leader,

original: mayā sa bhuktaḥ pṛthivīpradeśo mayā svayaṃ caṃkramitaṃ ca tatraṃ /
analyzed: mayā sa bhuktaḥ pṛthivī pradeśaḥ mayā svayam caṃkramitam ca tatram
translated: I have enjoyed that place on earth, and I myself have walked there,

original: tatropaviṣṭo ahameva ca syāṃ yatra sthitaḥ so bhavi buddhaputraḥ // / //
analyzed: tatra upaviṣṭaḥ aham eva ca syām yatra sthitaḥ saḥ buddha putraḥ
translated: And I would be right there where that Buddha's son is standing.

original: iti śrīsaddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye puṇyaparyāyaparivarto nāma ṣoḍaśamaḥ //
analyzed: iti śrī saddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye puṇyaparyāyaparivartaḥ nāma ṣoḍaśamaḥ
translated: Thus ends the sixteenth chapter in the Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma called The Chapter on the Merits.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: anumodanāpuṇyanirdeśaparivartaḥ /
analyzed: anumodanā puṇya nirdeśa parivartaḥ
translated: The Chapter Explaining the Merits of Rejoicing

original: atha khalu maitreyo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavantametadavocat yo bhagavan imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ deśyamānaṃ śrutvā anumodet kulaputro vā
analyzed: atha khalu maitreyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat yaḥ bhagavan imam dharmaparyāyam deśyamānam śrutvā anumodet kula putraḥ vā
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, if a noble son or daughter, having heard this Dharma teaching being taught, rejoices in it,

original: kiyantaṃ sa bhagavan kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā puṇyaṃ prasavediti /
analyzed: kiyantam sa bhagavan kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā puṇyam prasavet iti
translated: How much merit would that son of a good family or daughter of a good family generate?

original: atha khalu maitreyo bodhisattvo mahāsattvastasyāṃ velāyāmimāṃ gāthāmabhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu maitreyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tasyām velāyām imām gāthām abhāṣata
translated: Then at that time the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Maitreya spoke this verse:🔽One who hears such a sutra

original: yo nirvṛte mahāvīre śṛṇuyātsūtramīdṛśam /
analyzed: yaḥ nirvṛte mahāvīre śṛṇuyāt sūtram īdṛśam
translated: when the great hero is extinct,

original: śrutvā cābhyanumodeyā kiyantaṃ kuśalaṃ bhavet // / //
analyzed: śrutvā kiyantam kuśalam bhavet
translated: and having heard it, rejoices in it, how much merit would there be?

original: atha khalu bhagavān maitreyaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvametadavocat yaḥ kaścidajita🔽kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya imaṃ dharmaparyāya deśyamānaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān maitreyam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat yaḥ kaścid ajita  kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya imam dharmaparyāya deśyamānam
translated: Then the Blessed One said this to the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Maitreya: Ajita,🔽whatever son of a good family or daughter of a good family,🔽having heard this Dharma discourse being taught and explained by the Tathagata after his parinirvana,

original: saṃprakāśyamānaṃ śṛṇuyād bhikṣurvā bhikṣuṇī vā upāsako vā upāsikā vā vijñapuruṣo vā kumārako vā /
analyzed: saṃprakāśyamānam śṛṇuyāt bhikṣuḥ vā bhikṣuṇī vā upāsakaḥ vā upāsikā vā vijña puruṣaḥ vā kumārakaḥ vā
translated: whether a monk or nun, layman or laywoman, wise man or boy,

original: kumārikā vā /
analyzed: kumārikā vā
translated: girl,

original: śrutvā ca abhyanumodeta /
analyzed: śrutvā ca abhyanumodeta
translated: and having heard it, rejoices in it,

original: sacettato dharmaśravaṇādutthāya prakrāmet /
analyzed: saced tatas dharma śravaṇāt utthāya prakrāmet
translated: if he rises from that Dharma listening and departs,

original: sa ca vihāragato vā gṛhagato vā araṇyagato vā vīthīgato vā grāmagato vā janapadagato
analyzed: sa ca vihāra gataḥ vā gṛha gataḥ vā araṇya gataḥ vā vīthī gataḥ vā grāma gataḥ vā janapada gataḥ
translated: and whether in a monastery, in a house, in a forest, in a street, in a village, in a country,

original: vā tān hetūṃstāni kāraṇāni taṃ dharmaṃ yathāśrutaṃ yathodgṛhītaṃ yathābalamaparasya
analyzed: vā tān hetūn tāni kāraṇāni tam dharmam yathāśrutam yathā udgṛhītam yathābalam aparasya
translated: Or, having heard those causes, those reasons, that Dharma as heard, as received, according to one's ability, one should explain it to another being,

original: sattvasyācakṣīta māturvā piturvā jñātervā /
analyzed: sattvasya ācakṣīta mātuḥ vā pituḥ vā jñāteḥ vā
translated: to one's mother, father, relative,

original: saṃmoditasya vā anyasya vā saṃstutasya kasyacit /
analyzed: saṃmoditasya vā anyasya vā saṃstutasya kasyacid
translated: or to one who is delighted, or to any other who is pleased.

original: so 'pi yadi śrutvā anumodeta /
analyzed: saḥ pi yadi śrutvā anumodeta
translated: If he, having heard, should rejoice,

original: anumodya ca punaranyasmai ācakṣīta /
analyzed: anumodya ca punar anyasmai ācakṣīta
translated: and having rejoiced, should explain it again to another,

original: so 'pi yadi śrutvānumodeta /
analyzed: saḥ pi yadi śrutvā anumodeta
translated: and if he, having heard, should rejoice,

original: anumodya ca so 'pyaparasmai ācakṣīta /
analyzed: anumodya ca saḥ pi aparasmai ācakṣīta
translated: and having rejoiced, should explain it to another,

original: so 'pi taṃ śrutvānumodeta /
analyzed: saḥ pi tam śrutvā anumodeta
translated: and if he, having heard it, should rejoice.

original: ityanena paryāyeṇa yāvat pañcāśat paraṃparayā /
analyzed: iti anena paryāyeṇa yāvat pañcāśat paraṃparayā
translated: In this way, up to fifty through the succession.

original: atha khalvajita yo 'sau pañcāśattamaḥ puruṣo bhavet paraṃparāśravānumodakaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu ajita yaḥ sau pañcāśattamaḥ puruṣaḥ bhavet paraṃparā śrava anumodakaḥ
translated: Now, Ajita, if that fiftieth person were to be the one who rejoices in the succession of the transmission,

original: tasyāpi tāvadahamajita kulaputrasya vā kuladuhiturvā anumodanāsahagataṃ puṇyābhisaṃskāramabhinirdekṣyāmi /
analyzed: tasya api tāvat aham ajita kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā anumodanā sahagatam puṇya abhisaṃskāram abhinirdekṣyāmi
translated: I will, Ajita, proclaim the merit-making of that noble son or noble daughter's rejoicing.

original: taṃ śṛṇu / sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasikuru /
analyzed: tam śṛṇu sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasikuru
translated: Listen to that, and attend to it well and properly.

original: bhāṣiṣye 'haṃ te //
analyzed: bhāṣiṣye ham te
translated: I will explain it to you.

original: tadyathāpi nāma ajita caturṣu lokadhātuṣvasaṃkhyeyaśatasahasreṣu ye sattvāḥ santaḥ saṃvidyamānāḥ ṣaṭsu gatiṣūpapannāḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma ajita caturṣu lokadhātuṣu asaṃkhyeya śata sahasreṣu ye sattvāḥ santaḥ saṃvidyamānāḥ ṣaṭsu gatiṣu upapannāḥ
translated: Ajita, it is like this: The beings who exist and are found in the four incalculably numerous hundreds of thousands of world systems are born in the six destinies.

original: aṇḍajā vā jarāyujā vā saṃsvedajā vā aupapādukā vā rūpiṇo vā arūpiṇo vā saṃjñino vā
analyzed: aṇḍa jāḥ vā jarāyu jāḥ vā saṃsveda jāḥ vā aupapādukāḥ vā rūpiṇaḥ vā arūpiṇaḥ vā saṃjñinaḥ vā
translated: Whether born from eggs, from the womb, from moisture, or by spontaneous generation; whether having form or formless, whether having perceptions or not having perceptions,

original: asaṃjñino vā naivasaṃjñino vā nāsaṃjñino vā apadā vā dvipadā vā catuṣpadā vā bahupadā
analyzed: asaṃjñinaḥ vā na eva saṃjñinaḥ vā na asaṃjñinaḥ vā apadāḥ vā dvipadāḥ vā catuṣpadāḥ vā bahu padāḥ
translated: whether not having perceptions, not not having perceptions, having many bodies, having one body, or not having a body; whether having feet, having two feet, having four feet, or having many feet;

original: vā yāvadeva sattvāḥ sattvadhātau saṃgrahasamavasaraṇaṃ gacchanti /
analyzed: vā yāvat eva sattvāḥ sattvadhātau saṃgraha samavasaraṇam gacchanti
translated: up to all beings who are included in the realm of beings.

original: atha kaścideva puruṣaḥ samutpadyeta puṇyakāmo hitakāmastasya sattvakāyasya sarvakāmakrīḍāratiparibhogāniṣṭān kāntān priyān manāpān dadyāt /
analyzed: atha kaścid eva puruṣaḥ samutpadyeta puṇya kāmaḥ hita kāmaḥ tasya sattva kāyasya sarva kāma krīḍā rati paribhogān iṣṭān kāntān priyān manāpān dadyāt
translated: Then suppose a certain person were to appear, wishing for merit, wishing for their welfare, and would give to that multitude of beings all the desirable, lovely, pleasing, and agreeable objects of desire, amusement, pleasure, and enjoyment.

original: ekaikasya sattvasya jambudvīpaṃ paripūrṇaṃ dadyāt kāmakrīḍāratiparibhogāya /
analyzed: ekaikasya sattvasya jambudvīpam paripūrṇam dadyāt kāma krīḍā rati paribhogāya
translated: He would give each being a Jambudvīpa filled with the objects of desire, amusement, pleasure, and enjoyment.

original: hiraṇyasuvarṇarūpyamaṇimuktāvaiḍūryaśaṅkhaśilāpravālānaśvarathagorathahastirathān dadyāt prāsādān kūṭāgārān /
analyzed: hiraṇya suvarṇa rūpya maṇi muktā vaiḍūrya śaṅkha śilā pravālān aśva ratha go ratha hasti rathān dadyāt prāsādān kūṭāgārān
translated: He would give gold, silver, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, quartz, coral, horses, chariots, bullock carts, elephants, palaces, and multi-storied buildings.

original: anena paryāyeṇa ajita sa puruṣo dānapatirmahādānapatiḥ paripūrṇānyaśītiṃ varṣāṇi dānaṃ dadyāt /
analyzed: anena paryāyeṇa ajita sa puruṣaḥ dānapatiḥ mahā dānapatiḥ paripūrṇāni aśītim varṣāṇi dānam dadyāt
translated: “Ajita, in this way, that man, the lord of generosity, the great lord of generosity, would give gifts for a full eighty years.

original: atha khalvajita sa puruṣo dānapatirmahādānapatirevaṃ cintayet ime khalu sattvāḥ sarve mayā krīḍāpitā ramāpitāḥ sukhaṃ jivāpitāḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu ajita sa puruṣaḥ dānapatiḥ mahā dānapatiḥ evam cintayet ime khalu sattvāḥ sarve mayā krīḍāpitāḥ ramāpitāḥ sukham jivāpitāḥ
translated: “Then, Ajita, that man, the lord of generosity, the great lord of generosity, would think, ‘These beings have all been amused, delighted, and made to live happily by me.

original: ime ca te bhavantaḥ sattvā balinaḥ palitaśiraso jīrṇavṛddhā mahallakā Vaidya
analyzed: ime ca te bhavantaḥ sattvāḥ balinaḥ palita śirasaḥ jīrṇa vṛddhāḥ mahallakāḥ vaidya
translated: And these beings are strong, with white hair and wrinkled skin, old, aged, and advanced in years,

original: aśītivarṣikā jātyā /
analyzed: aśīti varṣikā jātyā
translated: eighty years old.

original: abhyāśībhūtāścaite kālakriyāyāḥ /
analyzed: abhyāśībhūtāḥ ca ete kālakriyāyāḥ
translated: They are approaching the time of death.

original: yannvahametāṃstathāgatapravedite dharmavinaye 'vatārayeyamanuśāsayeyam /
analyzed: yat nu aham etān tathāgata pravedite dharma vinaye vatārayeyam anuśāsayeyam
translated: I will introduce them to the Dharma-Vinaya taught by the Tathāgata and instruct them.’

original: atha khalvajita sa puruṣastān sarvasattvān samādāpayet /
analyzed: atha khalu ajita sa puruṣaḥ tān sarva sattvān samādāpayet
translated: “Then, Ajita, that man would inspire all those beings.

original: samādāpayitvā ca tathāgatapravedite dharmavinaye 'vatārayed grāhayet /
analyzed: samādāpayitvā ca tathāgata pravedite dharma vinaye vatārayet grāhayet
translated: Having inspired them, he would introduce them to the Dharma-Vinaya taught by the Tathāgata and cause them to take it up.

original: tasya te sattvāstaṃ ca dharmaṃ śṛṇuyuḥ /
analyzed: tasya te sattvāḥ tam ca dharmam śṛṇuyuḥ
translated: Those beings would listen to that Dharma.

original: śrutvā ca ekakṣaṇena ekamuhūrtena ekalavena sarve srotaāpannāḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: śrutvā ca eka kṣaṇena eka muhūrtena eka lavena sarve srotaāpannāḥ syuḥ
translated: Having listened, in a single instant, a single moment, a single second, all of them would become stream-enterers.

original: sakṛdāgāmino 'nāgāmino 'nāgāmiphalaṃ prāpnuyuryāvadarhanto bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: sakṛdāgāminaḥ nāgāminaḥ nāgāmi phalam prāpnuyuḥ yāvat arhantaḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: They would become once-returners, non-returners, and attain the fruit of non-returnership, up to becoming arhats.

original: kṣīṇāsravā dhyāyino mahādhyāyino 'ṣṭavimokṣadhyāyinaḥ /
analyzed: kṣīṇa āsravāḥ dhyāyinaḥ mahā dhyāyinaḥ ṣṭa vimokṣa dhyāyinaḥ
translated: They would be meditators, great meditators, meditators on the eight liberations, with their defilements exhausted.

original: tatkiṃ manyase ajita api nu sa puruṣo dānapatirmahādānapatistatonidānaṃ bahu puṇyaṃ prasavedaprameyamasaṃkhyeyam /
analyzed: tat kim manyase ajita api nu sa puruṣaḥ dānapatiḥ mahā dānapatiḥ tatonidānam bahu puṇyam prasavet aprameyam asaṃkhyeyam
translated: What do you think, Ajita, would that man, the lord of generosity, the great lord of generosity, generate much merit from that cause, immeasurable and incalculable?

original: evamukte maitreyo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavantametadavocat evametat bhagavan /
analyzed: evam ukte maitreyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat evam etat bhagavan
translated: When this was said, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya said to the Blessed One, It is so, Blessed One!

original: evametat sugata /
analyzed: evam etat sugata
translated: It is so, Sugata!

original: anenaiva tāvad bhagavan kāraṇena sa puruṣo dānapatirmahādānapatirbahu puṇyaṃ prasavet /
analyzed: anena eva tāvat bhagavan kāraṇena sa puruṣaḥ dānapatiḥ mahā dānapatiḥ bahu puṇyam prasavet
translated: Blessed One, for this reason alone, that man, the lord of generosity, the great lord of generosity, would generate much merit,

original: yastāvatāṃ sattvānāṃ sarvasukhopadhānaṃ dadyāt /
analyzed: yaḥ tāvatām sattvānām sarva sukha upadhānam dadyāt
translated: if he were to give all forms of happiness to that many beings.

original: kaḥ punarvādo
analyzed: kaḥ punarvādaḥ
translated: How much more so

original: yaduttariarhattve pratiṣṭhāpayet //🔽evamukte bhagavānajitaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvametadavocat ārocayāmi te ajita /
analyzed: yat uttari arhat tve pratiṣṭhāpayet  evam ukte bhagavān ajitam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat ārocayāmi te ajita
translated: if he were to establish them in arhatship.

original: prativedayāmi /
analyzed: prativedayāmi
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Ajita, Ajita, I declare to you, I proclaim to you,

original: yaśca sa dānapatirmahādānapatiḥ puruṣaścaturṣu lokadhātuṣvasaṃkhyeyaśatasahasreṣu sarvasattvānāṃ sarvasukhopadhānaiḥ paripūrya arhattve pratiṣṭhāpya
analyzed: yaḥ ca sa dānapatiḥ mahā dānapatiḥ puruṣaḥ caturṣu lokadhātuṣu asaṃkhyeya śata sahasreṣu sarva sattvānām sarva sukha upadhānaiḥ paripūrya arhat tve pratiṣṭhāpya
translated: And if that person who is a donor, a great donor, were to fill with all the requisites of happiness all the beings in the four innumerable and infinite world systems, and establish them in arhatship,

original: puṇyaṃ prasavet /
analyzed: puṇyam prasavet
translated: he would generate merit.

original: yaśca pañcāśattamaḥ puruṣaḥ paraṃparāśravānugataḥ śravaṇena ito dharmaparyāyādekāmapi gāthāmekapadamapi śrutvā anumodeta /
analyzed: yaḥ ca pañcāśattamaḥ puruṣaḥ paraṃparā śrava anugataḥ śravaṇena itas dharmaparyāyāt ekām api gāthām eka padam api śrutvā anumodeta
translated: And if the fiftieth person in the succession, hearing just one verse or one line from this Dharma teaching, were to rejoice in it,

original: yaccaitasya puruṣasyānumodanāsahagataṃ puṇyakriyāvastu /
analyzed: yat ca etasya puruṣasya anumodanā sahagatam puṇya kriyā vastu
translated: the merit of that person's rejoicing would be

original: yacca tasya puruṣasya dānapatermahādānapaterdānasahagatamarhattvaṃ pratiṣṭhāpanāsahagatapuṇyakriyāvastu /🔽idameva tato bahutaram /
analyzed: yat ca tasya puruṣasya dānapateḥ mahā dānapateḥ dāna sahagatam arhat tvam pratiṣṭhāpanā sahagata puṇya kriyā vastu  idam eva tatas bahutaram
translated: greater than the merit of that person who is a donor, a great donor, who establishes the arhats in the merit of giving and in the merit of establishing them.

original: yo 'yaṃ puruṣaḥ pañcāśattamaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ yam puruṣaḥ pañcāśattamaḥ
translated: This is the one who is the fiftieth person in the succession.

original: tataḥ puruṣaparaṃparāta ito dharmaparyāyādekāmapi gāthāmekapadamapi śrutvā anumodet /
analyzed: tatas puruṣa paraṃparātaḥ itas dharmaparyāyāt ekām api gāthām eka padam api śrutvā anumodet
translated: From this Dharma teaching, hearing just one verse or one line, he would rejoice.

original: asya anumodanāsahagatasya ajita puṇyābhisaṃskārasya kuśalamūlābhisaṃskārasya anumodanāsahagatasya
analyzed: asya anumodanā sahagatasya ajita puṇya abhisaṃskārasya kuśala mūla abhisaṃskārasya anumodanā sahagatasya
translated: Ajita, the merit of this rejoicing,

original: agrataḥasau paurviko dānasahagataśca arhattvapratiṣṭhāpanāsahagataśca puṇyābhisaṃskāraḥ
analyzed: agratas asau paurvikaḥ dāna sahagataḥ ca arhat tva pratiṣṭhāpanā sahagataḥ ca puṇya abhisaṃskāraḥ
translated: The merit of the former and the one associated with generosity, up to the one associated with establishing in arhatship,

original: śatatamīmapi kalāṃ nopayāti /
analyzed: śatatamīm api kalām na upayāti
translated: does not approach even a hundredth part of it.

original: sahasratamīmapi śatasahasratamīmapi koṭītamīmapi koṭīśatatamīmapi koṭīsahasratamīmapi koṭīśatasahasratamīmapi koṭīniyutaśatasahasratamīmapi
analyzed: sahasratamīm api śata sahasratamīm api koṭītamīm api koṭī śatatamīm api koṭī sahasratamīm api koṭī śata sahasratamīm api koṭī niyuta śata sahasratamīm api
translated: It does not approach even a thousandth, a hundred-thousandth, a koṭi-th, a koṭi-hundred-thousandth, a koṭi-hundred-thousand-hundredth, a koṭi-hundred-thousand-millionth part of it.

original: kalāṃ nopayāti /
analyzed: kalām na upayāti
translated: It does not approach even a fraction of it.

original: saṃkhyāmapi kalāmapi gaṇanāmapi upamāmapi upaniḥadamapi na kḥamate /
analyzed: saṃkhyām api kalām api gaṇanām api upamām api upaniḥadam api na kḥamate
translated: It does not even bear comparison, or resemblance, or similarity.

original: evamaprameyamasaṃkhyeyamajita so 'pi tāvat pañcāśattamaḥ paraṃparāśravaṇe puruḥa ito dharmaparyāyādantaśa ekagāthāmapi ekapadamapi anumodya
analyzed: evam aprameyam asaṃkhyeyam ajita saḥ pi tāvat pañcāśattamaḥ paraṃparā śravaṇe itas dharmaparyāyāt antaśas eka gāthām api eka padam api anumodya
translated: In the same way, Ajita, that person who, in the fiftieth successive hearing, approves of even one verse or one line from this Dharma teaching,

original: ca puṇyaṃ prasavati /
analyzed: ca puṇyam prasavati
translated: generates even more merit.

original: kaḥ punarvādo 'jita yo 'yaṃ mama saṃmukhamimaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śṛṇuyāt /
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ jita yaḥ yam mama saṃmukham imam dharmaparyāyam śṛṇuyāt
translated: How much more so, Ajita, for one who hears this Dharma teaching in my presence,

original: śrutvā cābhyanumodet /
analyzed: śrutvā ca abhyanumodet
translated: and having heard it, approves of it.

original: aprameyataramasaṃkhyayetaraṃ tasyāhamajita taṃ puṇyābhisaṃskāraṃ vadāmi //
analyzed: aprameyataram asaṃkhyayā itaram tasya aham ajita tam puṇya abhisaṃskāram vadāmi
translated: Ajita, I declare that to be an even greater production of merit.

original: yaḥ khalu punarajita asya dharmaparyāyasya śravāṇārthaṃ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā svagṛhānniṣkramya vihāraṃ gacchet /
analyzed: yaḥ khalu punar ajita asya dharmaparyāyasya śravāṇa artham kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā sva gṛhāt niṣkramya vihāram gacchet
translated: Ajita, if a son of good family or a daughter of good family, in order to hear this Dharma discourse, were to leave their own home and go to a monastery,

original: sa ca gattvā tasminnimaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ muhūrtakamapi śṛṇuyāt sthito vā niṣaṇṇo vā /
analyzed: sa ca gattvā tasmin imam dharmaparyāyam muhūrtakam api śṛṇuyāt sthitaḥ vā niṣaṇṇaḥ vā
translated: and having gone there, were to listen to this Dharma discourse for even a moment, either standing or sitting,

original: sa sattvastanmātreṇa puṇyābhisaṃskāreṇa kṛtenopacitena jātivinivṛtto dvitīye samucchraye dvitīye ātmabhāvapratilambhe gorathānāṃ lābhī bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: sa sattvaḥ tad mātreṇa puṇya abhisaṃskāreṇa kṛtena upacitena jāti vinivṛttaḥ dvitīye samucchraye dvitīye ātmabhāva pratilambhe go rathānām lābhī bhaviṣyati
translated: that being, by having created and accumulated that much merit, upon the cessation of birth, in the second eon, in the second attainment of a body, would become the owner of ox-drawn carts,

original: aśvarathānāṃ hastirathānāṃ śibikānāṃ goyanānāmṛṣabhayānānāṃ divyānāṃ ca vimānānāṃ lābhī bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: aśva rathānām hasti rathānām śibikānām goyanānām ṛṣabha yānānām divyānām ca vimānānām lābhī bhaviṣyati
translated: horse-drawn carts, elephant-drawn carts, palanquins, bull-drawn vehicles, and divine aerial palaces.

original: sacet punastatra dharmaśravaṇe muhūrtamātramapi niṣadya idaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śṛṇuyāt / Vaidya 🔽paraṃ vā niṣādayet /
analyzed: saced punar tatra dharma śravaṇe muhūrta mātram api niṣadya idam dharmaparyāyam śṛṇuyāt vaidya  param vā niṣādayet
translated: If, moreover, in that Dharma assembly, he were to sit for even a moment and listen to this Dharma discourse,🔽or were to cause another to sit,

original: āsanasaṃvibhāgaṃ vā kuryādaparasya sattvasya /
analyzed: āsana saṃvibhāgam vā kuryāt aparasya sattvasya
translated: or were to share his seat with another being,

original: tena sa puṇyābhisaṃskāreṇa lābhī bhaviṣyati śakrāsanānāṃ brahmāsanānāṃ cakravartisaṃhāsanānām /
analyzed: tena sa puṇya abhisaṃskāreṇa lābhī bhaviṣyati śakra āsanānām brahma āsanānām cakravarti saṃhāsanānām
translated: By that creation of merit, he will obtain the seat of Śakra, the seat of Brahmā, and the seat of a universal monarch.

original: sacet punarajita kaścideva kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā aparaṃ puruṣamevaṃ vadet āgaccha tvaṃ bhoḥ puruṣa /
analyzed: saced punar ajita kaścid eva kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā aparam puruṣam evam vadet āgaccha tvam bhoḥ puruṣa
translated: Moreover, Ajita, if some son or daughter of good family were to say to another person: 'Come, good person,

original: saddharmapuṇḍarīkaṃ nāma dharmaparyāyaṃ śṛṇuṣva /
analyzed: saddharmapuṇḍarīkam nāma dharmaparyāyam śṛṇuṣva
translated: listen to the Dharma discourse called The White Lotus of the True Dharma.'

original: sa ca puruṣastasya tāṃ protsāhanāmāgamya yadi muhūrtamātramapi śṛṇuyāt /
analyzed: sa ca puruṣaḥ tasya tām protsāhanām āgamya yadi muhūrta mātram api śṛṇuyāt
translated: And if that person, having come for that encouragement, were to listen for even a moment,

original: sa sattvastena protsāhena kuśalamūlenābhisaṃskṛtena dhāraṇīpratilabdhairbodhisattvaiḥ sārdhaṃ samavadhānaṃ pratilabhate /
analyzed: sa sattvaḥ tena protsāhena kuśala mūlena abhisaṃskṛtena dhāraṇī pratilabdhaiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ sārdham samavadhānam pratilabhate
translated: that being, by that encouragement and the creation of merit, would obtain association with the bodhisattvas who have attained retention.

original: ajaḍaśca bhavati /
analyzed: a jaḍaḥ ca bhavati
translated: And he would not be dull-witted.

original: tīkṣṇendriyaḥ prajñāvān /
analyzed: tīkṣṇa indriyaḥ prajñāvān
translated: He would have sharp faculties, be wise,

original: na tasya jātiśatasahasrairapi pūti mukhaṃ bhavati na durgandhi /
analyzed: na tasya jāti śata sahasraiḥ api pūti mukham bhavati na durgandhi
translated: and even for hundreds of thousands of lifetimes his mouth would not smell bad or be foul-smelling.

original: nāpyasya jihvārogo bhavati /🔽na mukharogo bhavati /
analyzed: na api asya jihvā rogaḥ bhavati  na mukha rogaḥ bhavati
translated: He would not have a disease of the tongue.🔽He would not have a disease of the mouth.

original: na ca śyāmadanto bhavati /🔽na viṣamadanto bhavati /
analyzed: na ca śyāma dantaḥ bhavati  na viṣama dantaḥ bhavati
translated: He would not have black teeth.🔽He would not have uneven teeth.

original: na pītadanto bhavati /
analyzed: na pīta dantaḥ bhavati
translated: He would not have yellow teeth.

original: na duḥsaṃsthitadanto na khaṇḍadanto na patitadanto na vakradanto na lamboṣṭho bhavati /
analyzed: na duḥsaṃsthita dantaḥ na khaṇḍa dantaḥ na patita dantaḥ na vakra dantaḥ na lamba uṣṭhaḥ bhavati
translated: He does not have crooked teeth, broken teeth, missing teeth, or protruding teeth, nor does he have a hanging lower lip.

original: nābhyantaroṣṭho na prasāritoṣṭho na khaṇḍoṣṭho na vaṅkoṣṭho na kṛṣṇoṣṭho na bībhatsoṣṭho bhavati /
analyzed: na abhyantara uṣṭhaḥ na prasārita uṣṭhaḥ na khaṇḍa uṣṭhaḥ na vaṅka uṣṭhaḥ na kṛṣṇa uṣṭhaḥ na bībhatsa uṣṭhaḥ bhavati
translated: He does not have a retracted lip, a stretched lip, a broken lip, a crooked lip, a black lip, or a repulsive lip.

original: na cipīṭanāso bhavati /
analyzed: na cipīṭa nāsaḥ bhavati
translated: He does not have a flat nose.

original: na vakranāso bhavati /
analyzed: na vakra nāsaḥ bhavati
translated: He does not have a crooked nose.

original: na dīrghamukho bhavati /🔽na vaṅkamukho bhavati /
analyzed: na dīrgha mukhaḥ bhavati  na vaṅka mukhaḥ bhavati
translated: He does not have a long face.🔽He does not have a crooked face.

original: na kṛṣṇamukho bhavati /
analyzed: na kṛṣṇa mukhaḥ bhavati
translated: He does not have a black face.

original: nāpriyadarśanamukhaḥ /
analyzed: na apriya darśana mukhaḥ
translated: He does not have a repulsive face.

original: api tu khalvajita sūkṣmasujātajihvādantoṣṭho bhavati āyatanāsaḥ /
analyzed: api tu khalu ajita sūkṣma su jāta jihvā danta uṣṭhaḥ bhavati āyata nāsaḥ
translated: Moreover, Ajita, he has a subtle, well-formed tongue, teeth, and lips, and a long nose.

original: praṇītamukhamaṇḍalaḥ subhrūḥ suparinikṣiptalalāṭo bhavati /
analyzed: praṇīta mukha maṇḍalaḥ su bhrūḥ su parinikṣipta lalāṭaḥ bhavati
translated: He has an excellent face, beautiful eyebrows, and a well-formed forehead.

original: suparipūrṇapuruṣavyañjanapratilābhī ca bhavati /
analyzed: su paripūrṇa puruṣa vyañjana pratilābhī ca bhavati
translated: He attains the complete male characteristics.

original: tathāgataṃ ca avavādānuśāsakaṃ pratilabhate /
analyzed: tathāgatam ca avavāda anuśāsakam pratilabhate
translated: He obtains a Tathagata as his instructor and guide.

original: kṣipraṃ ca buddhairbhagavadbhiḥ saha samavadhānaṃ pratilabhate /
analyzed: kṣipram ca buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ saha samavadhānam pratilabhate
translated: He quickly attains association with the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: paśya ajita ekasattvamapi nāma utsāhayitvā iyat puṇyaṃ prasavati /
analyzed: paśya ajitaḥ eka sattvam api nāma utsāhayitvā iyat puṇyam prasavati
translated: See, Ajita, how much merit one generates by encouraging even a single being.

original: kaḥ punarvādo yaḥ satkṛtya śṛṇuyāt /🔽satkṛtya vācayet / satkṛtya
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ yaḥ satkṛtya śṛṇuyāt  satkṛtya vācayet satkṛtya
translated: How much more so for one who listens respectfully,🔽listens respectfully,

original: deśayet / satkṛtya prakāśayediti //
analyzed: deśayet satkṛtya prakāśayet iti
translated: teaches respectfully, and illuminates respectfully.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses on that occasion:

original: pañcāśimo yaśca paraṃparāyāṃ sūtrasyimasyo śṛṇutekagāthām /
analyzed: pañcāśimaḥ yaḥ ca paraṃparāyām śṛṇuta ika gāthām
translated: The one who hears even a single verse of this sutra in the fiftieth generation,

original: anumodayitvā ca prasannacittaḥ śṛṇuṣva puṇyaṃ bhavi yattakaṃ tat // / //
analyzed: anumodayitvā ca prasanna cittaḥ śṛṇuṣva puṇyam bhavi yattakam tat
translated: and rejoices with a clear mind, listen to the amount of merit that will be his.

original: sa caiva puruṣo bhavi dānadātā sattvān koṭīnayuteṣu nityam /
analyzed: sa ca eva puruṣaḥ dāna dātā sattvān koṭī nayuteṣu nityam
translated: That very person will become a giver of gifts, always to many quintillions of beings,

original: ye pūrvamaupamyakṛtā mayā vai tān sarvi tarpeya aśīti varṣān // / //
analyzed: ye pūrvam aupamya kṛtāḥ mayā vai tān sarvi tarpeya aśīti varṣān
translated: whom I have previously compared to, and I would satisfy them all for eighty years.

original: so dṛṣṭva teṣāṃ ca jarāmupasthitāṃ valī ca khaṇḍaṃ ca śiraśca pāṇḍaram /
analyzed: saḥ dṛṣṭvā teṣām ca jarām upasthitām valī ca khaṇḍam ca śiraḥ ca pāṇḍaram
translated: When he sees old age come upon them, with wrinkles, broken teeth, and gray hair,

original: hāhādhimucyanti hi sarvasattvā yannūna dharmeṇa hu ovadeyam // / //🔽Vaidya
analyzed: hāhā adhimucyanti hi sarva sattvāḥ yat nūna dharmeṇa hu ovadeyam  vaidya
translated: all beings will cry out 'Alas!' Therefore, I should certainly instruct them with the Dharma.

original: so teṣa dharmaṃ vadatīha paścānnirvāṇabhūmiṃ ca prakāśayeta /
analyzed: dharmam vadati iha paścāt nirvāṇa bhūmim ca prakāśayeta
translated: That one will later speak the Dharma to them here and will reveal the ground of nirvana.

original: sarve bhavāḥ phenamarīcikalpā nirvidyathā sarvabhaveṣu kṣipram // / //
analyzed: sarve bhavāḥ phena marīci kalpāḥ sarva bhaveṣu kṣipram
translated: All existences are like foam and mirage. Quickly become disgusted with all existences.

original: te sarvasattvāśca śruṇitva dharmaṃ tasyaiva dātuḥ puruṣasya antikāt /
analyzed: te sarva sattvāḥ ca dharmam tasya eva dātuḥ puruṣasya antikāt
translated: And all those beings, having heard the Dharma from that very giver,

original: arhantabhūtā bhavi ekakāle kṣīṇāsravā antimadehadhāriṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: arhanta bhūtāḥ eka kāle kṣīṇa āsravāḥ antima dehadhāriṇaḥ
translated: Would become Arhats at the same time, with their defilements exhausted, bearing their last body.

original: puṇyaṃ tato bahutaru tasya hi syat paraṃparātaḥ śruṇi ekagāthām /
analyzed: puṇyam tatas bahu taru tasya hi syat paraṃparātaḥ eka gāthām
translated: Then his merit would be even greater, if he were to hear one verse in succession.

original: anumodi vā yattaku tasya puṇyaṃ kala puṇyaskandhaḥ purimo na bhoti // / //
analyzed: tasya puṇyam puṇya skandhaḥ purimaḥ na
translated: The merit of rejoicing in that would be a fraction, not equal to the former heap of merit.

original: evaṃ bahu tasya bhaveta puṇyaṃ anantakaṃ yasya pramāṇu nāsti /
analyzed: evam bahu tasya bhaveta puṇyam anantakam yasya pramāṇu na asti
translated: Thus his merit would be manifold, immeasurable and infinite,

original: gāthāṃ pi śrutvaika paraṃparāya kiṃ vā punaḥ saṃmukha yo śruṇeyā // / //
analyzed: gāthām kim vā punar
translated: If he were to hear even one verse in succession, or if he were to hear it in person.

original: yaścaikasattvaṃ pi vadeya tatra protsāhaye gaccha śṛṇuṣva dharmam /
analyzed: yaḥ ca eka sattvam vadeya tatra protsāhaye gaccha śṛṇuṣva dharmam
translated: And if he were to tell one being there, encouraging him to go and listen to the Dharma,

original: sudurlabhaṃ sutramidaṃ hi bhoti kalpāna koṭīnayutairanekaiḥ // / //
analyzed: su durlabham sutram idam hi koṭī nayutaiḥ anekaiḥ
translated: Saying, This Sutra is very difficult to obtain, even in many quintillions of eons,

original: sa cāpi protsāhitu tena sattvaḥ śruṇeya sūtrema muhūrtakaṃ pi /
analyzed: sa ca api tena sattvaḥ śruṇeya muhūrtakam
translated: And if that being, thus encouraged by him, were to hear the Sutra for just a moment,

original: tasyāpi dharmasya phalaṃ śṛṇohi mukharoga tasya na kadāci bhoti // / //
analyzed: tasya api dharmasya phalam śṛṇohi mukha roga tasya na kadācid
translated: Listen to the result of that Dharma: he will never have a mouth disease.

original: jihvāpi tasya na kadāci duḥkhati na tasya dantā patitā bhavanti /🔽śyāmātha pītā viṣamā ca jātu bībhatsitoṣṭho na ca jātu bhoti // / //
analyzed: jihvā api tasya na kadācid na tasya dantāḥ patitāḥ bhavanti  śyāmā atha pītā viṣamā ca jātu bībhatsita uṣṭhaḥ na ca jātu
translated: His tongue is never pained, and his teeth never fall out.🔽He never has dark, yellow, or uneven lips, nor ever has repulsive lips.

original: kuṭilaṃ ca śuṣkaṃ ca na jātu dīrghaṃ mukhaṃ na cipiṭaṃ sya kadāci bhoti /🔽Vaidya
analyzed: kuṭilam ca śuṣkam ca na jātu dīrgham mukham na cipiṭam kadācid  vaidya
translated: His face is never crooked, dry, long, or flat.

original: susaṃsthitā nāsa tathā lalāṭaṃ dantā ca oṣṭho mukhamaṇḍalaṃ ca // / //
analyzed: tathā lalāṭam dantāḥ ca oṣṭhaḥ mukha maṇḍalam ca
translated: The wise one has a well-formed nose, forehead, teeth, lips, and face.

original: priyadarśano bhoti sadā narāṇāṃ pūrtiṃ ca vakraṃ na kadāci bhoti /
analyzed: priya darśanaḥ bhoti sadā narāṇām pūrtim ca vakram na kadācid
translated: He is always pleasing to look at for people, and never has a crooked or incomplete face.

original: yathotpalasyeha sadā sugandhiḥ pravāyate tasya mukhasya gandhaḥ // / //
analyzed: yathā utpalasya iha sadā sugandhiḥ pravāyate tasya mukhasya gandhaḥ
translated: Just as the fragrance of a blue lotus always spreads, so does the fragrance of his mouth.

original: gṛhādvihāraṃ hi vrajitva dhīro gaccheta sūtraṃ śravaṇāya etat /
analyzed: gṛhāt vihāram hi vrajitvā dhīraḥ gaccheta sūtram śravaṇāya etat
translated: The wise one, having gone from home to the monastery, should go to listen to this sutra.

original: gatvā ca so tatra śṛṇe muhūrtaṃ prasannacittasya phalaṃ śṛṇotha // / //🔽sugauru tasyo bhavatetmabhāvaḥ pariyāti co aśvarathehi dhīraḥ /
analyzed: gatvā ca saḥ tatra śṛṇe muhūrtam prasanna cittasya phalam  su gauru bhavata ītmabhāvaḥ pariyāti ca u aśva rathehi dhīraḥ
translated: Having gone there and listened for a moment, listen to the fruit of a clear mind.🔽His body becomes very fair, and the wise one moves around in horse-drawn chariots.

original: hastīrathāṃśco abhiruhya uccān ratanehi citrānanucaṃkrameyā // / //
analyzed: abhiruhya uccān ratanehi citrān anucaṃkrameyā
translated: Riding on high elephant chariots adorned with jewels, he moves around.

original: vibhūṣitāṃ so śibikāṃ labheta narairanekairiha vāhyamānām /
analyzed: vibhūṣitām saḥ śibikām labheta naraiḥ anekaiḥ iha vāhyamānām
translated: He would obtain an ornamented palanquin, carried by many men here,

original: gatvāpi dharmaṃ śravaṇāya tasya phalaṃ śubhaṃ bhoti ca evarūpam // / //
analyzed: gatvā api dharmam śravaṇāya tasya phalam śubham ca evarūpam
translated: And even after going to listen to the Dharma, such auspicious fruits would be his.

original: niṣadya cāsau pariṣāya tatra śuklena karmeṇa kṛtena tena /
analyzed: niṣadya ca asau pariṣāya tatra śuklena karmeṇa kṛtena tena
translated: And sitting there in the assembly, by that white deed done by him,

original: śakrāsanānāṃ bhavate sa lābhī brahmāsanānāṃ ca nṛpāsanānām // / //
analyzed: śakra āsanānām bhavate sa lābhī brahma āsanānām ca nṛpa āsanānām
translated: He would become the recipient of Shakra's seats, Brahma's seats, and king's seats.

original: iti śrīsaddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye anumodanāpuṇyanirdeśaparivarto nāma saptadaśamaḥ //
analyzed: iti śrī saddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye anumodanāpuṇyanirdeśaparivartaḥ nāma saptadaśamaḥ
translated: Thus ends the chapter on the teaching of the merit of rejoicing, the seventeenth in the Dharma teaching of the White Lotus of the Good Dharma.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: dharmabhāṇakānuśaṃsāparivartaḥ /
analyzed: dharma bhāṇaka anuśaṃsā parivartaḥ
translated: The Chapter on the Benefits of the Dharma Teacher

original: atha khalu bhagavān satatasamitābhiyuktaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamāmantrayāmāsa yaḥ kaścit kulaputra imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān satatasamitābhiyuktam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam āmantrayāmāsa yaḥ kaścid kula putraḥ imam dharmaparyāyam dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati  /
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the bodhisattva mahāsattva Always Applied: Any son or daughter of good family who will possess this Dharma discourse, recite it,

original: vā deśayiṣyati vā likhiṣyati va /
analyzed: vā deśayiṣyati vā likhiṣyati
translated: teach it, write it out,

original: sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā va aṣṭau cakṣurguṇaśatāni pratilapsyate /
analyzed: sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vaḥ aṣṭau cakṣuḥ guṇa śatāni pratilapsyate
translated: that son or daughter of good family will attain eight hundred qualities of the eyes.

original: dvādaśa śrotraguṇaśatāni pratilapsyate /
analyzed: dvādaśa śrotra guṇa śatāni pratilapsyate
translated: They will attain twelve hundred qualities of the ears.

original: aṣṭau ghrāṇaguṇaśatāni pratilapsyate /
analyzed: aṣṭau ghrāṇa guṇa śatāni pratilapsyate
translated: He will obtain eight hundred qualities of the nose.

original: dvādaśa jihvāguṇaśatāni pratilapsyate /
analyzed: dvādaśa jihvā guṇa śatāni pratilapsyate
translated: He will obtain twelve hundred qualities of the tongue.

original: aṣṭau kāyaguṇaśatāni pratilapsyate /
analyzed: aṣṭau kāya guṇa śatāni pratilapsyate
translated: He will obtain eight hundred qualities of the body.

original: dvādaśa manoguṇaśatāni pratilapsyate /
analyzed: dvādaśa manaḥ guṇa śatāni pratilapsyate
translated: He will obtain twelve hundred qualities of the mind.

original: tasyaibhirbahubhirguṇaśataiḥ ṣaḍindriyagrāmaḥ pariśuddhaḥ supariśuddho bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tasya ebhiḥ bahubhiḥ guṇa śataiḥ ṣaṣ indriya grāmaḥ pariśuddhaḥ su pariśuddhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: His group of six sense faculties will be purified and well purified by these many hundreds of qualities.

original: sa evaṃ pariśuddhena cakṣurindriyeṇa prākṛtena māṃsacakṣuṣā mātāpitṛsaṃbhavena trisāhasramahāsāhasrāṃ
analyzed: saḥ evam pariśuddhena cakṣuḥ indriyeṇa prākṛtena māṃsa cakṣuṣā mātā pitṛ saṃbhavena tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrām
translated: With that purified eye faculty, with his ordinary physical eye born from his parents, he will see

original: lokadhātuṃ sāntarbahiḥ saśailavanaṣaṇḍāmadho yāvadavīcimahānirayamupādāya upari ca
analyzed: lokadhātum sa antar bahis sa śaila vana ṣaṇḍām adhas yāvat avīci mahānirayam upādāya upari ca
translated: the great trichiliocosm, with its inner and outer, its mountains and forests, from below up to the peak of existence,

original: yāvat bhavāgraṃ tat sarvaṃ drakṣyati prākṛtena māṃsacakṣuṣā /
analyzed: yāvat bhava agram tat sarvam drakṣyati prākṛtena māṃsa cakṣuṣā
translated: starting from the great Avīci hell. He will see all that with his ordinary physical eye.

original: ye ca tasmin sattvā upapannāḥ /
analyzed: ye ca tasmin sattvāḥ upapannāḥ
translated: And all the beings born there,

original: tān sarvān drakṣyati /
analyzed: tān sarvān drakṣyati
translated: he will see them all.

original: karmavipākaṃ ca teṣāṃ jñāsyatīti //
analyzed: karma vipākam ca teṣām jñāsyati iti
translated: And he will know their karma and its results.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses on that occasion:

original: ya imaṃ sūtra bhāṣeta parṣāsu ca viśāradaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ imam sūtra bhāṣeta parṣāsu ca viśāradaḥ
translated: He who teaches this sūtra fearlessly in the assemblies,

original: anolīnaḥ prakāśeyā guṇāṃstasya śṛṇuṣva me // / //
analyzed: guṇān tasya śṛṇuṣva me
translated: He should be fearless and should proclaim his qualities. Listen to me!

original: aṣṭau guṇaśatāastasya cakṣuṣo bhonti sarvaśaḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭau guṇa śatāaḥ tasya cakṣuṣaḥ bhonti sarvaśas
translated: He will have all the qualities of the eyes,

original: yenāsya vimalaṃ bhoti śuddhaṃ cakṣuranāvilam // / //
analyzed: yena asya vimalam śuddham cakṣuḥ anāvilam
translated: By which his vision becomes pure, clear, and unclouded.

original: sa māṃsacakṣuṣā tena mātāpitṛkasaṃbhunā /
analyzed: sa māṃsacakṣuṣā tena mātā pitṛka saṃbhunā
translated: With that fleshly eye inherited from his parents,

original: paśyate lokadhātvemāṃ saśailavanakānanām // / //🔽meruṃ sumeru sarvā ca cakravālā sa paśyati /
analyzed: paśyate lokadhātvā imām sa śaila vana kānanām  merum sarvā ca cakravālā sa paśyati
translated: He sees this world realm with its mountains and forests.🔽He sees Meru, Sumeru, and all the Cakravāḍa mountains,

original: ye cānye parvatāḥ khaṇḍāḥ samudrāṃścāpi paśyati // / //
analyzed: ye ca anye parvatāḥ khaṇḍāḥ samudrān ca api paśyati
translated: And the other mountain ranges and oceans.

original: yāvānavīci heṣṭhena bhavāgraṃ copariṣṭataḥ /
analyzed: yāvānavīci heṣṭhena bhava agram ca upariṣṭatas
translated: From the bottom of Avīci up to the peak of existence,

original: sarvaṃ sa paśyate dhīro māṃsacakṣusya īdṛśam // / //
analyzed: sarvam sa paśyate dhīraḥ māṃsa cakṣusyaḥ īdṛśam
translated: The wise one sees all with such fleshly eyes.

original: na tāva divyacakṣu sya bhoti no cāpi jāyate /
analyzed: na tāva divya cakṣu sya bhoti no ca api jāyate
translated: He has not yet attained the divine eye, nor is it born,

original: viṣayo māṃsacakṣusya bhavettasyāyamīdṛśaḥ // / //🔽punaraparaṃ satatasamitābhiyukta sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ
analyzed: viṣayaḥ māṃsa cakṣusya bhavet tasya ayam īdṛśaḥ  punar aparam satata samitā abhiyukta sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imam dharmaparyāyam
translated: But this is the extent of the range of his fleshly eye.🔽Moreover, Satata-Samitābhiyukta, that noble man or noble woman

original: saṃprakāśayamānaḥ pareṣāṃ ca saṃśrāvayamānastairdvādaśabhiḥ śrotraguṇaśataiḥ samanvāgataḥ
analyzed: saṃprakāśayamānaḥ pareṣām ca saṃśrāvayamānaḥ taiḥ dvādaśabhiḥ śrotra guṇa śataiḥ samanvāgataḥ
translated: who teaches this Dharma teaching and causes others to listen to it will be endowed with those twelve hundred qualities of the ears.

original: ye trisāhasramahāsāhasrāyāṃ lokadhātau vividhāḥ śabdā niścaranti yāvadavīcirmahānirayo
analyzed: ye tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrāyām lokadhātau vividhāḥ śabdāḥ niścaranti yāvat avīciḥ mahānirayaḥ
translated: The various sounds that occur in the great trichiliocosm, down to the great Avīci hell,

original: yāvacca bhavāgraṃ sāntarbahiḥ /
analyzed: yāvat ca bhava agram sā antar bahis
translated: The various sounds that occur in the great trichiliocosm, from the Avīci hell up to the peak of existence, both inside and outside,

original: tadyathā hastiśabdā vā aśvaśabdā vā uṣṭraśabdā vā gośabdā vā ajaśabdā vā janapadaśabdā🔽vā rathaśabdā vā ruditaśabdā vā śokaśabdā vā bhairavaśabdā vā śaṅkhaśabdā vā ghaṇṭāśabdā
analyzed: tat yathā hasti śabdāḥ vā aśva śabdāḥ vā uṣṭra śabdāḥ vā go śabdāḥ vā aja śabdāḥ vā janapada śabdāḥ  vā ratha śabdāḥ vā rudita śabdāḥ vā śoka śabdāḥ vā bhairava śabdāḥ vā śaṅkha śabdāḥ vā ghaṇṭā śabdāḥ
translated: such as the sounds of elephants, horses, camels, cows, goats, people,🔽chariots, crying, sorrow, terror, conches, bells,

original: vā paṭahaśabdā vā bherīśabdā vā krīḍāśabdā vā gītaśabdā vā nṛtyaśabdā vā tūryaśabdā🔽vā vādyaśabdā vā strīśabdā vā puruṣaśabdā vā dārakaśabdā vā Vaidya
analyzed: vā paṭaha śabdāḥ vā bherī śabdāḥ vā krīḍā śabdāḥ vā gīta śabdāḥ vā nṛtya śabdāḥ vā tūrya śabdāḥ  vā vādya śabdāḥ vā strī śabdāḥ vā puruṣa śabdāḥ vā dāraka śabdāḥ vā vaidya
translated: drums, kettledrums, play, singing, dancing, musical instruments,

original: dārikāśabdā vā dharmaśabdā vā adharmaśabdā vā sukhaśabdā vā duḥkhaśabdā vā bālaśabdā
analyzed: dārikā śabdāḥ vā dharma śabdāḥ vā adharma śabdāḥ vā sukha śabdāḥ vā duḥkha śabdāḥ vā bāla śabdāḥ
translated: women, men, boys, and girls, as well as the sounds of Dharma, non-Dharma, happiness, suffering, fools,

original: vā āryaśabdā vā manojñaśabdā vā amanojñaśabdā vā devaśabdā vā nāgaśabdā vā yakṣaśabdā
analyzed: vā ārya śabdāḥ vā manojña śabdāḥ vā amanojña śabdāḥ vā deva śabdāḥ vā nāga śabdāḥ vā yakṣa śabdāḥ
translated: noble ones, pleasant, unpleasant, gods, nāgas, yakṣas,

original: vā rākṣasaśabdā vā gandharvaśabdā vā asuraśabdā vā garuḍaśabdā vā kinnaraśabdā vā
analyzed: vā rākṣasa śabdāḥ vā gandharva śabdāḥ vā asura śabdāḥ vā garuḍa śabdāḥ vā kinnara śabdāḥ vā
translated: rākṣasas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras,

original: mahoragaśabdā vā manuṣyaśabdā vā amanuṣyaśabdā vā agniśabdā vā vāyuśabdā vā udakaśabdā
analyzed: mahā uraga śabdāḥ vā manuṣya śabdāḥ vā amanuṣya śabdāḥ vā agni śabdāḥ vā vāyu śabdāḥ vā udaka śabdāḥ
translated: whether the sounds of great serpents, human sounds, non-human sounds, sounds of fire, sounds of wind, sounds of water,

original: vā grāmaśabdā vā nagaraśabdā vā bhikṣuśabdā vā śrāvakaśabdā vā pratyekabuddhaśabdā
analyzed: vā grāma śabdāḥ vā nagara śabdāḥ vā bhikṣu śabdāḥ vā śrāvaka śabdāḥ vā pratyekabuddha śabdāḥ
translated: sounds of villages, sounds of towns, sounds of monks, sounds of disciples, sounds of solitary buddhas,

original: vā bodhisattvaśabdā vā tathāgataśabdā vā /
analyzed: vā bodhisattva śabdāḥ vā tathāgata śabdāḥ vā
translated: sounds of bodhisattvas, or sounds of the Tathāgatas.

original: yāvantaḥ kecitrisāhasramahāsāhasrāyāṃ lokadhātau sāntarbahiḥ śabdā niścaranti /
analyzed: yāvantaḥ kecid tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrāyām lokadhātau sa antar bahis śabdāḥ niścaranti
translated: Whatever sounds there are, inside and outside, in the great trichiliocosm,

original: tān śabdāṃstena prākṛtena pariśuddhena śrotrendriyeṇa śṛṇoti /
analyzed: tān śabdān tena prākṛtena pariśuddhena śrotra indriyeṇa śṛṇoti
translated: he hears those sounds with that ordinary, pure ear faculty.

original: na ca tāvaddivyaṃ śrotramabhinirharati /
analyzed: na ca tāvat divyam śrotram abhinirharati
translated: But he does not yet manifest the divine ear.

original: teṣāṃ teṣāṃ ca sattvānāṃ rutānyavabudhyate /
analyzed: teṣām teṣām ca sattvānām rutāni avabudhyate
translated: He understands the languages of those beings.

original: vibhāvayati vibhajati tena ca prākṛtena śrotrendriyeṇa /
analyzed: vibhāvayati vibhajati tena ca prākṛtena śrotra indriyeṇa
translated: He contemplates, analyzes, and with that ordinary ear faculty,

original: teṣāṃ teṣāṃ ca sattvānāṃ rutāni śṛṇvatastasya taiḥ sarvaśabdaiḥ śrotrendriyaṃ nābhibhūyate /
analyzed: teṣām teṣām ca sattvānām rutāni śṛṇvataḥ tasya taiḥ sarva śabdaiḥ śrotra indriyam na abhibhūyate
translated: while hearing the sounds of those beings, his ear faculty is not overwhelmed by all those sounds.

original: evaṃrūpaḥ satatasamitābhiyukta tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya śrotrendriyapratilambho bhavati /
analyzed: evaṃrūpaḥ tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya śrotra indriya pratilambhaḥ bhavati
translated: Such is the acquisition of the ear faculty by that bodhisattva mahāsattva who is always and constantly devoted,

original: na ca tāvaddivyaṃ śrotramabhinirharati //
analyzed: na ca tāvat divyam śrotram abhinirharati
translated: And he does not yet manifest the divine ear.

original: idamavocadbhagavān /
analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān
translated: This was said by the Blessed One.

original: idaṃ vaditvā sugato hyathāparametaduvāca śāstā
analyzed: idam vaditvā sugataḥ hi atha aparam etat uvāca śāstā
translated: Having said this, the Well-Gone One, the Teacher, then said this further:

original: śrotrendriyaṃ tasya viśuddhu bhoti anāvilaṃ prākṛtakaṃ ca tāvat /
analyzed: śrotra indriyam tasya anāvilam prākṛtakam ca tāvat
translated: His ear faculty becomes pure, unclouded, and ordinary for now.

original: vividhān hi yeneha śṛṇoti śabdāniha lokadhātau hi aśeṣato 'yam // / //
analyzed: vividhān hi yena iha śṛṇoti śabdān iha lokadhātau hi aśeṣatas yam
translated: For by it he hears here in this world system all the various sounds without exception.

original: hastīna aśvāna śṛṇoti śabdān rathāna goṇāna ajaiḍakānām /
analyzed: hastīna aśvāna śṛṇoti śabdān rathāna goṇāna ajaiḍakānām
translated: He hears the sounds of elephants and horses, chariots and oxen, goats and sheep.

original: bherīmṛdaṅgāna sughoṣakānāṃ vīṇāna veṇūnatha vallakīnām // / //
analyzed: bherī mṛdaṅgān sughoṣakānām vīṇān veṇūn atha vallakīnām
translated: Of drums, kettledrums, and pleasant-sounding instruments, of lutes, flutes, and stringed instruments.

original: gītaṃ manojñaṃ madhuraṃ śṛṇoti na cāpi so sajjati tatra dhīraḥ /
analyzed: gītam manojñam madhuram śṛṇoti na ca api saḥ sajjati tatra dhīraḥ
translated: He hears the delightful and sweet singing, but the steadfast one is not attached to it.

original: manuṣyakoṭīna śṛṇoti śabdān bhāṣanti yaṃ yaṃ ca yahiṃ yahiṃ te // / //
analyzed: śṛṇoti śabdān bhāṣanti yam yam ca yahim yahim te
translated: He hears the sounds of many millions of humans, whatever they say wherever they are.

original: devāna co nitya śṛṇoti śabdān gītasvaraṃ ca madhuraṃ manojñam /
analyzed: devāna ca u nitya śṛṇoti śabdān gīta svaram ca madhuram manojñam
translated: And he always hears the sounds of the gods, the sweet and delightful sounds of singing.

original: puruṣāṇa istrīṇa rutāni cāpi tatha dārakāṇāmatha dārikāṇām // / //
analyzed: ca api dārakāṇām atha dārikāṇām
translated: The voices of men and women, and also of boys and girls.

original: ye parvateṣveva guhānivāsī kalaviṅkakā kokila barhiṇaśca /
analyzed: ye parvateṣu eva guhā nivāsī barhiṇaḥ ca
translated: Those who dwell in the caves of the mountains, the avadavats, cuckoos, and peacocks.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: pakṣīṇa ye jīvakajīvakā hi teṣāṃ ca valgū śṛṇute hi śabdān // / //
analyzed: ye jīvakajīvakāḥ hi teṣām ca valgū śṛṇute hi śabdān
translated: And the sounds of the birds Jīvaka and Jīvakā,

original: narakeṣu ye vedana vedayanti sudāruṇāṃścāpi karonti śabdān /
analyzed: narakeṣu ye vedayanti su dāruṇān ca api karonti śabdān
translated: And the sounds that are made in the hells,

original: āhāraduḥkhairavapīḍitānāṃ yān preta kurvanti tathaiva śabdān // / //
analyzed: āhāra duḥkhaiḥ avapīḍitānām yān preta kurvanti tathā eva śabdān
translated: And the sounds that are made by the pretas who are tormented by the suffering of hunger,

original: asurāśca ye sāgaramadhyavāsino muñcanti ghoṣāṃstatha cānyamanyān /
analyzed: asurāḥ ca ye sāgara madhya vāsinaḥ muñcanti
translated: And the sounds that are made by the asuras who dwell in the ocean,

original: sarvānihastho sa hi dharmabhāṇakaḥ śṛṇoti śabdānna ca ostarīyati // / //
analyzed: sa hi dharma bhāṇakaḥ śṛṇoti śabdān na ca
translated: The dharmabhāṇaka, while remaining here, hears all those sounds but is not overwhelmed.

original: tiryāṇa yonīṣu rutāni yāni anyonyasaṃbhāṣaṇatāṃ karonti /
analyzed: rutāni yāni anyonya saṃbhāṣaṇa tām karonti
translated: The sounds of the animal realms that are made by those who communicate with each other,

original: iha sthitastānapi so śṛṇoti vividhāni śabdāni bahūvidhāni // / //
analyzed: iha sthitaḥ tān api saḥ śṛṇoti vividhāni śabdāni bahūvidhāni
translated: While remaining here, he hears those various and numerous sounds.

original: ye brahmaloke nivasanti devā akaniṣṭha ābhāsvara ye ca devāḥ /
analyzed: ye brahma loke nivasanti devāḥ akaniṣṭha ābhāsvara ye ca devāḥ
translated: The devas who dwell in the Brahma world, the devas of Akaniṣṭha and Ābhāsvara,

original: ye cānyamanyasya karonti ghoṣān śṛṇoti tatsarvamaśeṣato 'sau // / //
analyzed: ye ca anyam anyasya karonti ghoṣān śṛṇoti tat sarvam aśeṣatas sau
translated: And the sounds that they make to each other, he hears all of that without exception.

original: svādhyāya kurvantiha ye ca bhikṣavaḥ sugatāniha śāsani pravrajitvā /
analyzed: svādhyāya kurvanti iha ye ca bhikṣavaḥ sugatān iha śāsani pravrajitvā
translated: The bhikṣus who are engaged in recitation, having gone forth in the Sugata's teaching here,

original: parṣāsu ye deśayate ca dharmaṃ teṣāṃ pi śabdaṃ śṛṇute sa nityam // / //
analyzed: parṣāsu ye deśayate ca dharmam teṣām śabdam śṛṇute sa nityam
translated: And the Dharma that he teaches to the assemblies, he always hears the sound of that.

original: ye bodhisattvāściha lokadhātau svādhyāya kurvanti paraspareṇa /
analyzed: ye bodhisattvāḥ ciha lokadhātau svādhyāya kurvanti paraspareṇa
translated: The bodhisattvas who in the world-realm Chih recite the scriptures to each other,

original: saṃgīti dharmeṣu ca ye karonti śṛṇoti śabdān vividhāṃśca teṣām // / //
analyzed: saṃgīti dharmeṣu ca ye karonti śṛṇoti śabdān vividhān ca teṣām
translated: And those who perform the music of the Dharma, he hears the various sounds of that.

original: bhagavān pi buddho naradamyasārathiḥ parṣāsu dharmaṃ bruvate yamagram /
analyzed: bhagavān pi buddhaḥ nara damya sārathiḥ parṣāsu dharmam bruvate yam agram
translated: The Blessed One, the Buddha, the charioteer of men to be tamed, teaches the supreme Dharma to the assemblies.

original: taṃ cāpi so śṛṇvanti ekakāle yo bodhisattvo imu sūtra dhārayet // / //
analyzed: tam ca api śṛṇvanti eka kāle yaḥ bodhisattvaḥ dhārayet
translated: And he who is a bodhisattva and upholds this sūtra hears that at one time.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: sarve trisāhasri imasmi kṣetre ye sattva kurvanti bahūṃ pi śabdān /
analyzed: sarve trisāhasri imasmi kṣetre ye sattva kurvanti śabdān
translated: All the many sounds that beings make in this trichiliocosm,

original: abhyantareṇāpi ca bāhireṇa avīciparyanta bhavāgramūrdhvam // / //
analyzed: abhyantareṇa api ca bāhireṇa bhava agram ūrdhvam
translated: Inside and outside, from the peak of existence down to Avīci,

original: sarveṣa sattvāna śṛṇoti śabdān naṃ cāpi kṣetraṃ uparudhyate 'sya /
analyzed: sarveṣa śṛṇoti śabdān ca api kṣetram uparudhyate
translated: He hears the sounds of all those beings, and that field is not obstructed for him.

original: paṭvindriyo jānati sthānasthānaṃ śrotrendriyaṃ prākṛtakaṃ hi tāvat // / //
analyzed: paṭu indriyaḥ jānati sthāna sthānam śrotra indriyam prākṛtakam hi tāvat
translated: With keen faculties, he knows the place and non-place, just the ordinary ear faculty.

original: na ca tāva divyasmi karoti yatnaṃ prakṛtya saṃtiṣṭhati śrotrametat /
analyzed: na ca karoti yatnam prakṛtya saṃtiṣṭhati śrotram etat
translated: But he does not yet make an effort for the divine, this ear faculty remains as it is by nature.

original: sūtraṃ hi yo dhārayate viśārado guṇā sya etādṛśakā bhavanti // / //
analyzed: sūtram hi yaḥ dhārayate viśāradaḥ etādṛśakāḥ bhavanti
translated: For one who fearlessly upholds this sūtra, these are the kind of qualities that will be his.

original: punaraparaṃ satatasamitābhiyukta asya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ
analyzed: punar aparam satatasamita abhiyukta asya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya imam dharmaparyāyam
translated: Moreover, O Satatasamitābhiyukta, for this bodhisattva mahāsattva who upholds this Dharma discourse,

original: dhārayataḥ prakāśayataḥ svādhyāyato likhato 'ṣṭābhirguṇaśataiḥ samanvāgataṃ ghrāṇendriyaṃ
analyzed: dhārayataḥ prakāśayataḥ svādhyāyataḥ likhataḥ ṣṭābhiḥ guṇa śataiḥ samanvāgatam ghrāṇa indriyam
translated: while he is expounding, reciting, and writing it, the nose faculty will be endowed with eight hundred qualities,

original: pariśuddhaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: pariśuddham bhavati
translated: and will be completely pure.

original: sa tena pariśuddhena ghrāṇendriyeṇa ye trisāhasramahāsāhasrāyāṃ lokadhātau sāntarbahirvividhagandhāḥ saṃvidyante /
analyzed: sa tena pariśuddhena ghrāṇa indriyeṇa ye tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrāyām lokadhātau sa antar bahis vividha gandhāḥ saṃvidyante
translated: With that completely pure nose faculty, he will smell all the various fragrances that exist inside and outside the great trichiliocosm,

original: tadyathā pūtigandhā vā manojñagandhā vā nānāprakārāṇāṃ sumanasāṃ gandhāḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā pūti gandhāḥ vā manojña gandhāḥ vā nānā prakārāṇām sumanasām gandhāḥ
translated: whether foul fragrances or pleasant fragrances, the fragrances of various beautiful flowers,

original: tadyathā jātimallikācampakapāṭalagandhāḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā jāti mallikā campaka pāṭala gandhāḥ
translated: such as the fragrances of jasmine, champak, and pāṭala flowers.

original: tān gandhān ghrāyati /
analyzed: tān gandhān ghrāyati
translated: He will smell those fragrances.

original: jalajānāmapi puṣpāṇāṃ vividhān gandhān ghrāyati /
analyzed: jala jānām api puṣpāṇām vividhān gandhān ghrāyati
translated: He will also smell the various fragrances of water-born flowers,

original: tadyathā utpalapadmakumudapuṇḍarīkāṇāṃ gandhān ghrāyati /
analyzed: tat yathā utpala padma kumuda puṇḍarīkāṇām gandhān ghrāyati
translated: such as the fragrances of blue, red, and white lotuses.

original: vividhānāṃ puṣpaphalavṛkṣāṇāṃ puṣpaphalagandhān ghrāyati /
analyzed: vividhānām puṣpa phala vṛkṣāṇām puṣpa phala gandhān ghrāyati
translated: He will smell the fragrances of various flowering and fruit-bearing trees, their flowers and fruits.

original: tadyathā candanatamālapatratagarāgarusurabhigandhān ghrāyati /
analyzed: tat yathā candana tamāla patra tagara agaru surabhi gandhān ghrāyati
translated: For example, he smells the fragrances of sandalwood, tamāla leaves, tagara, and agaru.

original: nānāvikārāṇi gandhavikṛtiśatasahasrāṇi yānyekasthānasthitaḥ sarvāṇi ghrāyati /
analyzed: nānā vikārāṇi gandha vikṛti śata sahasrāṇi yāni eka sthāna sthitaḥ sarvāṇi ghrāyati
translated: While staying in one place, he smells all the hundreds of thousands of varieties of fragrances.

original: sattvānāmapi vividhān gandhān ghrāyati /
analyzed: sattvānām api vividhān gandhān ghrāyati
translated: He also smells the various fragrances of beings.

original: tadyathā hastyaśvagaveḍakapaśugandhān ghrāyati /🔽vividhānāṃ ca tiryagyonigatānāṃ prāṇināmātmabhāvagandhān ghrāyati /
analyzed: tat yathā hasti aśva gaveḍaka paśu gandhān ghrāyati  vividhānām ca tiryagyoni gatānām prāṇinām ātma bhāva gandhān ghrāyati
translated: For example, he smells the fragrances of elephants, horses, cows, goats, and sheep.🔽He smells the fragrances of the bodies of various animals.

original: strīpuruṣātmabhāvagandhān ghrāyati /🔽dārakadārikātmabhāvagandhān ghrāyati /
analyzed: strī puruṣa ātma bhāva gandhān ghrāyati  dāraka dārikā ātma bhāva gandhān ghrāyati
translated: He smells the fragrances of the bodies of women and men.🔽He smells the fragrances of the bodies of boys and girls.

original: dūrasthānāmapi tṛṇagulmauṣadhivanaspatīnāṃ gandhān ghrāyati /
analyzed: dūra sthānām api tṛṇa gulma oṣadhi vanaspatīnām gandhān ghrāyati
translated: He smells the fragrances of grasses, bushes, herbs, and forests, even those far away.

original: bhūtān gandhān vandati /
analyzed: bhūtān gandhān vandati
translated: He smells the fragrances of spirits.

original: na ca tairgandhaiḥ saṃhriyate /
analyzed: na ca taiḥ gandhaiḥ saṃhriyate
translated: But he is not overwhelmed by those fragrances.

original: na saṃmuhyati /
analyzed: na saṃmuhyati
translated: He is not confused by them.

original: sa ihasthita eva devānāmapi gandhān ghrāyati /
analyzed: saḥ iha sthitaḥ eva devānām api gandhān ghrāyati
translated: While staying here, he smells the fragrances of the gods.

original: tadyathā pārijātakasya kovidārasya māndāravamahāmāndāravamañjūṣakamahāmañjūṣakānāṃ divyānāṃ puṣpāṇāṃ gandhān ghrāyati /
analyzed: tat yathā pārijātakasya kovidārasya māndārava mahāmāndārava mañjūṣaka mahāmañjūṣakānām divyānām puṣpāṇām gandhān ghrāyati
translated: For example, he smells the fragrances of divine flowers such as pārijātaka, kovidāra, māndārava, mahāmāndārava, mañjūṣaka, and mahāmañjūṣaka.

original: divyānāmagarucūrṇacandanacūrṇānāṃ gandhān ghrāyati /
analyzed: divyānām agaru cūrṇa candana cūrṇānām gandhān ghrāyati
translated: He smells the scents of divine powdered agaru and sandalwood.

original: divyānāṃ ca nānāvidhānāṃ puṣpavikṛtiśatasahasrāṇāṃ gandhān ghrāyati /
analyzed: divyānām ca nānāvidhānām puṣpa vikṛti śata sahasrāṇām gandhān ghrāyati
translated: He smells the scents of hundreds of thousands of varieties of divine flowers.

original: nāmāni caiṣāṃ saṃjānīte /
analyzed: nāmāni ca eṣām saṃjānīte
translated: He knows their names.

original: devaputrātmabhāvagandhān ghrāyati /
analyzed: deva putra ātmabhāva gandhān ghrāyati
translated: He smells the scents of the bodies of the sons of the gods.

original: tadyathā śakrasya devānāmindrasya ātmabhāvagandhaṃ ghrāyati /
analyzed: tat yathā śakrasya devānām indrasya ātmabhāva gandham ghrāyati
translated: For example, he smells the scent of the body of Śakra, lord of the gods.

original: taṃ ca jānīte yadi vā vaijayante prāsāde krīḍantaṃ ramantaṃ paricārayantaṃ yadi vā
analyzed: tam ca jānīte yadi vā vaijayante prāsāde krīḍantam ramantam paricārayantam yadi vā
translated: He knows whether he is playing, enjoying, and amusing himself in the Vaijayanta palace,

original: sudharmāyāṃ devasabhāyāṃ devānāṃ trāyastriṃśānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayantaṃ yadi vā udyānabhūmau
analyzed: sudharmāyām deva sabhāyām devānām trāyastriṃśānām dharmam deśayantam yadi vā udyāna bhūmau
translated: or whether he is teaching the Dharma to the gods of the Thirty-Three in the Sudharmā assembly hall, or whether he is

original: niryāntaṃ krīḍanāya /
analyzed: niryāntam krīḍanāya
translated: going out to the pleasure garden to play,🔽or whether he is in the Nandana pleasure grove with the assembly of the gods of the Thirty-Three,

original: anyeṣāṃ ca devaputrāṇāṃ Vaidya 🔽pṛthakpṛthagātmabhāvagandhān ghrāyati /
analyzed: anyeṣām ca deva putrāṇām vaidya  pṛthak pṛthak ātma bhāva gandhān ghrāyati
translated: or whether he is in the assembly of the gods of the Four Great Kings,🔽or whether he is in the assembly of the Thirty-Three gods,🔽or whether he is in the assembly of the Yāma gods,🔽or whether he is in the assembly of the Tuṣita gods,🔽or whether he is in the assembly of the Nirmāṇarati gods,🔽or whether he is in the assembly of the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods,🔽or whether he is in the assembly of the gods of the Brahmā world,🔽or whether he is in the assembly of the gods of the Ābhāsvara world,

original: devakanyānāmapi devavadhūnāmapi ātmabhāvagandhān ghrāyati /🔽devakumārāṇāmapi ātmabhāvagandhān ghrāyati /
analyzed: deva kanyānām api deva vadhūnām api ātma bhāva gandhān ghrāyati  deva kumārāṇām api ātma bhāva gandhān ghrāyati
translated: or whether he is in the assembly of the Śubhakṛtsna gods,🔽or whether he is in the assembly of the Bṛhatphala gods,🔽or whether he is in the assembly of the Avṛha gods,🔽or whether he is in the assembly of the Atapa gods,🔽or whether he is in the assembly of the Sudarśana gods,🔽or whether he is in the assembly of the Akaniṣṭha gods,🔽or whether he is in the assembly of the gods of the Ākāśānantyāyatana world,🔽or whether he is in the assembly of the gods of the Vijñānānantyāyatana world,🔽or whether he is in the assembly of the gods of the Ākiñcanyāyatana world,🔽or whether he is in the assembly of the gods of the Naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñāyatana world,

original: devakumārikāṇāmapi ātmabhāvagandhān ghrāyati /
analyzed: deva kumārikāṇām api ātma bhāva gandhān ghrāyati
translated: or whether he is in the assembly of the gods of the Mahābrahmā world,

original: na ca tairgandhaiḥ saṃhriyate /
analyzed: na ca taiḥ gandhaiḥ saṃhriyate
translated: or whether he is in the assembly of the

original: anena paryāyeṇa yāvad bhavāgropapannānāmapi sattvānāmātmabhāvagandhān ghrāyati /
analyzed: anena paryāyeṇa yāvat bhava agra upapannānām api sattvānām ātma bhāva gandhān ghrāyati
translated: In this way, he smells the bodies of beings up to the peak of existence.

original: brahmakāyikānāmapi devaputrāṇāṃ mahābrahmaṇāmapi cātmabhāvagandhān ghrāyati /
analyzed: brahmakāyikānām api devaputrāṇām mahābrahmaṇām api ca ātmabhāva gandhān ghrāyati
translated: He smells the bodies of the gods of the Brahmakayika realm, and also of the Mahabrahma gods.

original: anena paryāyeṇa sarvadevanikāyānāmapi ātmabhāvagandhān ghrāyati /
analyzed: anena paryāyeṇa sarva devanikāyānām api ātma bhāva gandhān ghrāyati
translated: In this way, he smells the bodies of all the classes of gods.

original: śrāvakapratyekabuddhabodhisattvatathāgatātmabhāvagandhān ghrāyati /
analyzed: śrāvaka pratyekabuddha bodhisattva tathāgata ātmabhāva gandhān ghrāyati
translated: He smells the bodies of the shravakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and tathagatas.

original: tathāgatāsanānāmapi gandhān ghrāyati /
analyzed: tathāgata āsanānām api gandhān ghrāyati
translated: He smells the bodies of the tathagatas.

original: yasmiṃśca sthāne te tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā viharanti /
analyzed: yasmin ca sthāne te tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ viharanti
translated: And he knows in which places those tathagatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas dwell.

original: tacca prajānāti /
analyzed: tat ca prajānāti
translated: He knows that.

original: na cāsya tad ghrāṇendiyaṃ taistairvividhairgandhaiḥ pratihanyate /
analyzed: na ca asya tat ghrāṇa indiyam taiḥ taiḥ vividhaiḥ gandhaiḥ pratihanyate
translated: And his nose faculty is not obstructed by those various smells.

original: nopahanyate /
analyzed: na upahanyate
translated: It is not harmed.

original: na saṃpīḍyate /
analyzed: na saṃpīḍyate
translated: It is not afflicted.

original: ākāṅkṣamāṇaśca tāṃstān gandhān pareṣāmapi vyākaroti /
analyzed: ākāṅkṣamāṇaḥ ca tān tān gandhān pareṣām api vyākaroti
translated: And desiring to, he proclaims those smells to others.

original: na cāsya smṛtirupahanyate //
analyzed: na ca asya smṛtiḥ upahanyate
translated: And his mindfulness is not harmed.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses on that occasion:

original: ghrāṇendriyaṃ tasya viśuddha bhoti vividhāṃśca gandhān bahu ghrāyate 'sau /
analyzed: ghrāṇa indriyam tasya viśuddha vividhān ca gandhān bahu ghrāyate
translated: His nose faculty becomes pure, and he smells many kinds of scents:

original: ye lokadhātau hi imasmi sarve sugandha durgandha bhavanti kecit // / //
analyzed: ye lokadhātau hi imasmi sarve sugandha durgandha bhavanti kecid
translated: All the scents in this world realm, some good, some bad,

original: jātīya gandho atha mallikāyā tamālapatrasya ca candanasya /
analyzed: jātīya gandhaḥ atha mallikāyā tamālapatrasya ca candanasya
translated: The scent of jasmine, the scent of tamala leaves and sandalwood,

original: tagarasya gandho agarusya cāpi vividhāna puṣpāṇa phalāna cāpi // / //
analyzed: tagarasya gandhaḥ agarusya ca api vividhāna puṣpāṇa phalāna ca api
translated: The scent of tagara, the scent of agaru, and various flowers and fruits,

original: sattvāna gandhān pi tathaiva jānati narāṇa nārīṇa ca dūrataḥ sthitaḥ /
analyzed: sattvāna gandhān pi tathā eva jānati narāṇa nārīṇa ca dūratas sthitaḥ
translated: He also knows the scents of beings, of men and women from afar.

original: kumārakāṇāṃ ca kumārikāṇāṃ gandhena so jānati teṣa sthānam // / //
analyzed: kumārakāṇām ca kumārikāṇām gandhena saḥ jānati sthānam
translated: By scent he knows the location of boys and girls,

original: rājñāṃ pi so jānati cakravartināṃ balacakravartīnatha maṇḍalīnām /
analyzed: rājñām saḥ jānati cakravartinām maṇḍalīnām
translated: He also knows the kings, the wheel-turning kings, the powerful wheel-turning kings, and the circle-kings.

original: kumārakāmātya tathaiva teṣāṃ gandhena cāntaḥpura sarva jānati // / //
analyzed: kumāraka amātya tathā eva teṣām gandhena ca antaḥpura sarva jānati
translated: He knows by scent all the princes, ministers, and inner quarters of those kings,

original: paribhogaratnāni bahūvidhāni kupyāni bhūmau nihitāni yāni /
analyzed: paribhoga ratnāni bahūvidhāni kupyāni bhūmau nihitāni yāni
translated: The many kinds of precious enjoyments, and the goods hidden in the earth,

original: strīratnabhūtāni bhavanti yāpi gandhena so jānati bodhisattvaḥ // / //🔽Vaidya
analyzed: strī ratna bhūtāni bhavanti yā api gandhena saḥ jānati bodhisattvaḥ 🔽vaidya
translated: And the one who is a precious woman, the Bodhisattva knows by scent.

original: teṣāṃ ca yā ābharaṇā bhavanti kāyasmi āmukta vicitrarūpā /
analyzed: teṣām ca yāḥ ābharaṇāḥ bhavanti
translated: And the ornaments that they wear on their bodies, of various forms,

original: vastraṃ ca mālyaṃ ca vilepanaṃ ca gandhena so jānati bodhisattvaḥ // / //
analyzed: vastram ca mālyam ca vilepanam ca gandhena saḥ jānati bodhisattvaḥ
translated: The clothes, garlands, and ointments, the Bodhisattva knows by their smell.

original: sthitāṃ niṣaṇṇāṃ śayitāṃ tathaiva krīḍāratiṃ ṛddhibalaṃ ca sarvam /
analyzed: sthitām niṣaṇṇām śayitām tathā eva krīḍā ratim ṛddhi balam ca sarvam
translated: Whether standing, sitting, or lying down, and likewise their play, enjoyment, and all their magical powers,

original: so jānatī ghrāṇabalena dhīro yo dhārayet sūtramidaṃ variṣṭham // / //
analyzed: saḥ jānatī ghrāṇa balena dhīraḥ yaḥ dhārayet sūtram idam variṣṭham
translated: The wise one knows by the power of smell, he who upholds this supreme sūtra.

original: sugandhatailāna tathaiva gandhān nānāvidhān puṣpaphalāna gandhān /
analyzed: su gandha tailān tathā eva gandhān nānāvidhān puṣpa phalān gandhān
translated: The smells of fragrant oils and likewise various fragrances, the smells of flowers and fruits,

original: sakṛtasthito jānati ghrāyate ca amukasmi deśasmi imasmi gandhān // / //
analyzed: sakṛta sthitaḥ jānati ghrāyate ca amukasmi gandhān
translated: Stationed in one place, he smells and knows the smells in such and such a place.

original: ye parvatānāṃ vivarāntareṣu bahu candanā puṣpita tatra santi /
analyzed: ye parvatānām vivara antareṣu santi
translated: Those fragrant sandalwood trees that are in bloom in the mountain caves,

original: ye cāpi tasminnivasanti sattvāḥ sarveṣa gandhena vidurvijānati // / //
analyzed: ye ca api tasmin nivasanti sattvāḥ sarveṣa gandhena viduḥ vijānati
translated: And the beings that dwell there, the wise one knows and understands by their smell.

original: ye cakravālasya bhavanti pārśve ye sāgarasyo nivasanti madhye /
analyzed: ye cakravālasya bhavanti pārśve ye sāgarasyaḥ nivasanti madhye
translated: Those that are on the sides of Cakravāla, and those that dwell in the ocean,

original: pṛthivīya ye madhyi vasanti sattvāḥ sarvān sa gandhena vidurvijānati // / //
analyzed: ye madhyi vasanti sattvāḥ sarvān sa gandhena viduḥ vijānati
translated: And the beings that dwell in the middle of the earth, the wise one knows and understands by their smell.

original: surāṃśca jānāti tathāsurāṃśca asurāṇa kanyāśca vijānate 'sau /
analyzed: surān ca jānāti tathā asurān ca kanyāḥ ca vijānate
