translated: He knows the gods and the asuras, and he knows the daughters of the asuras.

original: asurāṇa krīḍāśca ratiṃ ca jānati ghrāṇasya tasyedṛśakaṃ balaṃ hi // / //
analyzed: krīḍāḥ ca ratim ca jānati ghrāṇasya tasya īdṛśakam balam hi
translated: He knows the play and the pleasure of the asuras. Such is the power of his nose.

original: aṭavīṣu ye keci catuṣpadāsti siṃhāśca vyāghrāstatha hastināgāḥ /
analyzed: aṭavīṣu ye siṃhāḥ ca hasti nāgāḥ
translated: In the forests, whatever four-legged animals there are, lions, tigers, and also elephants,

original: mahiṣā gavā ye gavayaśca tatra ghrāṇena so jānati teṣa vāsam // / //
analyzed: mahiṣāḥ gavā ye gavayaḥ ca tatra ghrāṇena saḥ jānati teṣa vāsam
translated: buffaloes, cows, and wild oxen, he knows their whereabouts through his nose.

original: striyaśca yā gurviṇikā bhavanti kumārakāṃ vāpi kumārikāṃ vā /
analyzed: striyaḥ ca yāḥ gurviṇikāḥ bhavanti kumārakām vā api kumārikām vā
translated: And if there are women who are pregnant, whether with a boy or a girl,

original: dhārenti kukṣau hi kilāntakāyā gandhena so jānati yaṃ tahiṃ syāt // / //
analyzed: kukṣau hi kila antakāyāḥ gandhena saḥ jānati yam syāt
translated: who carry in their wombs, weary in body, he knows through his sense of smell what is in them.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: āpannasattvāṃ pi vijānate 'sau vināśadharmāṃ pi vijānate 'sau /
analyzed: āpannasattvām pi vijānate sau vināśa dharmām pi vijānate sau
translated: He also knows those who are pregnant, and he knows those who are subject to destruction.

original: iyaṃ pi nārī vyapanītaduḥkhā prasaviṣyate puṇyamayaṃ kumāram // / //
analyzed: iyam pi nārī vyapanīta duḥkhā prasaviṣyate puṇya mayam kumāram
translated: This woman, free from suffering, will give birth to a son full of merit.

original: puruṣāṇa abhiprāyu bahuṃ vijānate abhiprāyagandhaṃ ca tathaiva ghrāyate /
analyzed: bahum vijānate abhiprāya gandham ca tathā eva ghrāyate
translated: He knows the many intentions of men, and he smells the scent of their intentions in the same way.

original: raktāna duṣṭāna tathaiva mrakṣiṇāṃ upaśāntacittāna ca gandha ghrāyate // / //
analyzed: raktāna duṣṭāna tathā eva mrakṣiṇām upaśānta cittāna ca gandha ghrāyate
translated: He smells the scent of the lustful, the angry, and the deceitful, and also of those whose minds are at peace.

original: pṛthivīya ye cāpi nidhāna santi ghanaṃ hiraṇyaṃ ca suvarṇarūpyam /
analyzed: ye ca api nidhāna santi ghanam hiraṇyam ca suvarṇa rūpyam
translated: And whatever treasures there are in the earth, solid gold, silver, and copper,

original: mañjūṣa lohī ca tathā supūrṇā gandhena so ghrāyati bodhisattvaḥ // / //
analyzed: ca tathā su pūrṇā gandhena saḥ ghrāyati bodhisattvaḥ
translated: Filled with jewels, the Bodhisattva smells their fragrance.

original: hārārdhahārān maṇimuktikāśca anarghaprāptā vividhā ca ratnā /
analyzed: hāra ardhahārān maṇi muktikāḥ ca an argha prāptāḥ vividhā ca ratnā
translated: Necklaces, half-necklaces, jewels, pearls, and various priceless gems,

original: gandhena so jānati tāni sarvā anarghanāmaṃ dyutisaṃsthitaṃ ca // / //
analyzed: gandhena saḥ jānati tāni sarvā anargha nāmam dyuti saṃsthitam ca
translated: By their fragrance he knows them all, their priceless names and where they are found.

original: upariṃ ca deveṣu tathaiva puṣpā mandāravāṃścaiva mañjūṣakāṃśca /
analyzed: uparim ca deveṣu tathā eva puṣpāḥ mandāravān ca eva mañjūṣakān ca
translated: And likewise, the flowers above in the heavens, the coral trees, and the wish-fulfilling trees,

original: yā pārijātasya ca santi puṣpā iha sthito ghrāyati tā sa dhīraḥ // / //
analyzed: yā pārijātasya ca santi puṣpāḥ iha sthitaḥ ghrāyati tā sa dhīraḥ
translated: The flowers of the pārijāta tree, the steadfast one smells them from here.

original: vimāna ye yādṛśakāśca yasya udāra hīnāstatha madhyamāśca /
analyzed: ye yādṛśakāḥ ca yasya udāra madhyamāḥ ca
translated: Whatever kinds of palaces there are, the vast, the lowly, and the middling,

original: vicitrarūpāśca bhavanti yatra iha sthito ghrāṇabalena ghrāyati // / //🔽udyānabhūmiṃ ca tathā prajānate sudharma devāsani vaijayante /
analyzed: vicitra rūpāḥ ca bhavanti yatra iha sthitaḥ ghrāṇa balena ghrāyati  udyāna bhūmim ca tathā prajānate sudharma deva āsani vaijayante
translated: In which various forms exist, he smells them from here with the power of the nose.🔽And likewise, he knows the pleasure groves, the Sudharmā hall of the gods, the Vaijayanta,

original: prāsādaśreṣṭhe ca tathā vijānate ye co ramante tahi devaputrāḥ // / //
analyzed: prāsāda śreṣṭhe ca tathā vijānate ye deva putrāḥ
translated: And likewise, he knows the best of palaces, and the gods who delight there.

original: iha sthito ghrāyati gandhu teṣāṃ gandhena so jānati devaputrān /
analyzed: iha sthitaḥ ghrāyati gandhu teṣām gandhena saḥ jānati deva putrān
translated: Standing here, he smells their scents and knows by their scents which are the gods' sons.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: The physician

original: yo yatra karmā kurute sthito vā śete vā gacchati yatra vāpi // / //
analyzed: yaḥ yatra karmā kurute sthitaḥ vā śete vā gacchati yatra vā api
translated: Wherever he stands, sleeps, or goes,

original: yā devakanyā bahupuṣpamaṇḍitā āmuktamālyābharaṇā alaṃkṛtāḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ deva kanyāḥ bahu puṣpa maṇḍitāḥ āmukta mālya ābharaṇāḥ alaṃkṛtāḥ
translated: The celestial maidens who are adorned with many flowers, wearing garlands and ornaments,

original: ramanti gacchanti ca yatra yatra gandhena so jānati bodhisattvaḥ // / //
analyzed: ramanti gacchanti ca yatra yatra gandhena saḥ jānati bodhisattvaḥ
translated: Wherever they go and enjoy themselves, the Bodhisattva knows by their scent.🔽Up to the peak of existence, the gods,

original: yāvadbhavāgrādupariṃ ca devā brahmā mahābrahma vimānacāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat bhava agrāt uparim ca devāḥ brahmā mahā brahma vimāna cāriṇaḥ
translated: Brahma, the great Brahma, who move in the celestial palace,

original: tāṃścāpi gandhena tahiṃ prajānate sthitāṃśca dhyāne atha vyutthitān vā // / //
analyzed: tān ca api gandhena tahim prajānate sthitān ca dhyāne atha vyutthitān vā
translated: He also knows them there by their scent, whether they are abiding in meditation or have arisen from it.

original: ābhāsvarān jānati devaputrān cyutopapannāṃśca apūrvakāṃśca /
analyzed: ābhāsvarān jānati deva putrān cyuta upapannān ca apūrvakān ca
translated: He knows the gods of the Abhasvara realm, those who have died and been reborn, and those who are new.

original: ghrāṇendriyaṃ īdṛśa tasya bhoti yo bodhisattvo imu sūtra dhārayet // / //
analyzed: tasya tasya
translated: Such will be his sense of smell, the Bodhisattva who upholds this sutra.

original: ya keci bhikṣū sugatasya śāsane abhiyuktarūpā sthita cakrameṣu /
analyzed: bhikṣū sugatasya śāsane sthita
translated: Whatever monks in the Sugata's teachings are devoted to practice and abide in the stages,

original: uddeśasvādhyāyaratāśca bhikṣavo sarvān hi so jānati bodhisattvaḥ // / //
analyzed: uddeśa svādhyāya ratāḥ ca bhikṣavaḥ sarvān hi saḥ jānati bodhisattvaḥ
translated: And the monks who are devoted to teaching and recitation, the Bodhisattva knows them all.

original: ye śrāvakā bhonti jinasya putrā viharanti kecit sada vṛkṣamūle /
analyzed: ye śrāvakāḥ bhonti jinasya putrāḥ viharanti kecid vṛkṣa mūle
translated: Those who are the disciples of the Victorious Ones, some of whom dwell always at the foot of a tree,

original: gandhena sarvān vidu jānate tān amutra bhikṣū amuko sthito ti // / //
analyzed: gandhena sarvān vidu jānate tān amutra bhikṣū amukaḥ sthitaḥ ti
translated: The wise one knows them all by their scent, that such and such a monk is dwelling there.

original: ye bodhisattvāḥ smṛtimanta dhyāyino uddeśasvādhyāyaratāśca ye sadā /
analyzed: ye bodhisattvāḥ dhyāyinaḥ uddeśa svādhyāya ratāḥ ca ye sadā
translated: Those Bodhisattvas who are mindful and meditative, who are always devoted to teaching and recitation,

original: parṣāsu dharmaṃ ca prakāśayanti gandhena tān jānati bodhisattvaḥ // / //
analyzed: parṣāsu dharmam ca prakāśayanti gandhena tān jānati bodhisattvaḥ
translated: And who proclaim the Dharma in the assemblies, the Bodhisattva knows them by their scent.

original: yasyāṃ diśāyāṃ sugato mahāmunirdharmaṃ prakāśeti hitānukampakaḥ /
analyzed: yasyām diśāyām sugataḥ mahā muniḥ dharmam prakāśa iti hita anukampakaḥ
translated: In whatever direction the Sugata, the Great Sage, the Benefactor and Compassionate One,

original: puraskṛtaḥ śrāvakasaṃghamadhye gandhena so jānati lokanātham // / //
analyzed: puraskṛtaḥ śrāvaka saṃgha madhye gandhena saḥ jānati lokanātham
translated: Proclaims the Dharma, surrounded by the assembly of disciples, by his scent he knows the Lord of the World.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: ye cāpi sattvā sya śṛṇoti dharmaṃ śrutvā ca ye prītamanā bhavanti /
analyzed: ye ca api śṛṇoti dharmam śrutvā ca ye prīta manāḥ bhavanti
translated: And those beings who hear the Dharma, and who become joyful upon hearing it,

original: iha sthito jānati bodhisattvo jinasya parṣāmapui tatra sarvām // / //🔽etādṛśaṃ ghrāṇabalaṃ sya bhoti na ca tāva divyaṃ bhavate sya ghrāṇam /
analyzed: iha sthitaḥ jānati bodhisattvaḥ jinasya tatra sarvām  etādṛśam ghrāṇa balam na ca divyam bhavate sya ghrāṇam
translated: The Bodhisattva, dwelling here, knows the entire assembly of the Victorious One there.🔽Such will be his power of smell, but it is not yet his divine nose.

original: pūrvaṃgamaṃ tasya tu eta bhoti divyasya ghrāṇasya anāsravasya // / //
analyzed: pūrvaṃgamam tasya tu divyasya ghrāṇasya anāsravasya
translated: This is the forerunner of his divine, undefiled nose.

original: punaraparaṃ satatasamitābhiyukta sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ🔽dhārayamāṇo deśayamānaḥ prakāśayamāno likhamānastairdvādaśabhirjihvāguṇaśataiḥ samanvāgataṃ
analyzed: punar aparam satata samitā abhiyukta sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imam dharmaparyāyam  dhārayamāṇaḥ deśayamānaḥ prakāśayamānaḥ likhamānaḥ taiḥ dvādaśabhiḥ jihvā guṇa śataiḥ samanvāgatam
translated: Furthermore, Satata-samitābhiyukta, that son of good family or daughter of good family who is upholding,

original: jihvendriyaṃ pratilapsyate /🔽sa tathārūpeṇa jihvendriyeṇa yān yān rasānāsvādayati /
analyzed: jihvā indriyam pratilapsyate  sa tathārūpeṇa jihvā indriyeṇa yān yān rasān āsvādayati
translated: teaching, explaining, and writing out this Dharma teaching will attain the faculty of the tongue endowed with those twelve hundred qualities of the tongue.🔽With that kind of faculty of the tongue, whatever tastes he experiences,

original: yān yān rasān jihvendriye upanikṣepsati /
analyzed: yān yān rasān jihvā indriye upanikṣepsati
translated: whatever tastes he places on his tongue,

original: sarve te divyaṃ mahārasaṃ mokṣyante /
analyzed: sarve te divyam mahārasam mokṣyante
translated: all of them will become divine, great tastes.

original: tathā ca āsvādayiṣyati yathā na kaṃcid rasamamanaāpamāsvādayiṣyati /
analyzed: tathā ca āsvādayiṣyati yathā na kaṃcid rasam amanaāpam āsvādayiṣyati
translated: He will experience them in such a way that he will not experience any taste that is unpleasant.

original: ye 'pi amanaāpā rasāste 'pi tasya jihvendriye samupanikṣiptāḥ divyaṃ rasaṃ mokṣyante /
analyzed: ye pi amanaāpāḥ rasāḥ te pi tasya jihvā indriye samupanikṣiptāḥ divyam rasam mokṣyante
translated: Even those tastes that are unpleasant, when placed on his tongue, will become divine tastes.

original: yaṃ ca dharmaṃ vyāhariṣyati parṣanmadhyagataḥ /
analyzed: yam ca dharmam vyāhariṣyati parṣad madhya gataḥ
translated: And whatever Dharma he explains while in the midst of the assembly,

original: tena tasya te sattvāḥ prīṇitendriyā bhaviṣyanti tuṣṭāḥ paramatuṣṭāḥ prāmodyajātāḥ /
analyzed: tena tasya te sattvāḥ prīṇita indriyāḥ bhaviṣyanti tuṣṭāḥ parama tuṣṭāḥ prāmodya jātāḥ
translated: those beings will have their faculties satisfied by that, will be content, supremely content, and will experience joy.

original: madhuraścāsya valgumanojñasvaro gambhīro niścariṣyati hṛdayaṃgamaḥ premaṇīyaḥ /
analyzed: madhuraḥ ca asya valgu manojña svaraḥ gambhīraḥ niścariṣyati hṛdayaṃgamaḥ premaṇīyaḥ
translated: And his voice will issue forth sweetly, pleasantly, beautifully, deeply, touching the heart, and endearing.

original: tenāsya te sattvāstuṣṭā udagracittā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tena asya te sattvāḥ tuṣṭāḥ udagra cittāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Therefore, those beings will be satisfied and uplifted in mind.

original: yeṣāṃ ca dharmaṃ deśayiṣyati /
analyzed: yeṣām ca dharmam deśayiṣyati
translated: And to those to whom he teaches the Dharma,

original: te cāsya madhuranirghoṣaṃ śrutvā valgumanojñaṃ devā apyupasaṃkramitavyaṃ maṃsyante darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharmaśravanāya ca /🔽devaputrā api devakanyā api upasaṃkramitavyaṃ maṃsyante darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharmaśravaṇāya ca /
analyzed: te ca asya madhura nirghoṣam śrutvā valgu manojñam devāḥ api upasaṃkramitavyam maṃsyante darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharma śravanāya ca  deva putrāḥ api deva kanyāḥ api upasaṃkramitavyam maṃsyante darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharma śravaṇāya ca
translated: having heard his sweet, pleasant, and agreeable voice, even the gods will think to approach him to see him, to pay homage to him, to honor him, and to listen to the Dharma.🔽Even the sons of gods and the daughters of gods will think to approach him to see him, to pay homage to him, to honor him, and to listen to the Dharma.

original: śakrā api brahmāṇo 'pi brahmakāyikā api devaputrā upasaṃkramitavyaṃ maṃsyante darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharmaśravaṇāya ca /
analyzed: śakrāḥ api brahmāṇaḥ pi brahmakāyikāḥ api deva putrāḥ upasaṃkramitavyam maṃsyante darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharma śravaṇāya ca
translated: Even Śakra, Brahmā, and the sons of gods from the Brahmā group will think to approach him to see him, to pay homage to him, to honor him, and to listen to the Dharma.

original: nāgā nāgakanyā api upasaṃkramitavyaṃ maṃsyante darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharmaśravaṇāya ca /
analyzed: nāgāḥ nāga kanyāḥ api upasaṃkramitavyam maṃsyante darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharma śravaṇāya ca
translated: Even nāgas and nāga girls will think to approach him to see him, to pay homage to him, to honor him, and to listen to the Dharma.

original: asurā asurakanyā api upasaṃkramitavyaṃ maṃsyante darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharmaśravaṇāya ca /
analyzed: asurāḥ asura kanyāḥ api upasaṃkramitavyam maṃsyante darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharma śravaṇāya ca
translated: Even asuras and asura girls will think to approach him to see him, to pay homage to him, to honor him, and to listen to the Dharma.

original: garūḍā garūḍakanyā api upasaṃkramitavyaṃ maṃsyante darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharmaśravaṇāya ca /
analyzed: garūḍāḥ garūḍa kanyāḥ api upasaṃkramitavyam maṃsyante darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharma śravaṇāya ca
translated: Garuḍas and Garuḍa maidens will think to approach him in order to see him, to pay homage to him, to honor him, and to listen to the Dharma.

original: kinnarāḥ kinnarakanyā api /
analyzed: kinnarāḥ kinnara kanyāḥ api
translated: Kinnaras and Kinnara maidens,

original: mahoragā mahoragakanyā api /
analyzed: mahoragāḥ mahoraga kanyāḥ api
translated: mahoragas and mahoraga maidens,

original: yakṣā yakṣakanyā api /
analyzed: yakṣāḥ yakṣa kanyāḥ api
translated: yakṣas and yakṣa maidens,

original: piśācāḥ piśācakanyā api upasaṃkramitavyaṃ maṃsyante darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharmaśravaṇāya ca /
analyzed: piśācāḥ piśāca kanyāḥ api upasaṃkramitavyam maṃsyante darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharma śravaṇāya ca
translated: piśācas and piśāca maidens will think to approach him in order to see him, to pay homage to him, to honor him, and to listen to the Dharma.

original: te cāsya satkāraṃ kariṣyanti /
analyzed: te ca asya satkāram kariṣyanti
translated: And they will honor him,

original: gurukāraṃ mānanāṃ pūjanāmarcanāmapacāyanāṃ kariṣyanti /
analyzed: gurukāram mānanām pūjanām arcanām apacāyanām kariṣyanti
translated: respect him, esteem him, venerate him, and revere him.

original: bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikā api darśanakāmā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikāḥ api darśana kāmāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Bhikṣus, bhikṣuṇīs, upāsakas, and upāsikās will want to see him.

original: rājāno 'pi rājaputrā api rājāmātyā api rājamahāmātrā api darśanakāmā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: rājānaḥ pi rāja putrāḥ api rāja amātyāḥ api rāja mahāmātrāḥ api darśana kāmāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Kings, princes, royal ministers, and chief ministers will want to see him.

original: balacakravartino 'pi rājānaḥ /
analyzed: bala cakravartinaḥ pi rājānaḥ
translated: Kings who are powerful cakravartins,

original: cakravartino 'pi saptaratnasamanvāgatāḥ sakumārāḥ sāmātyāḥ sāntaḥpuraparivārā darśanakāmā bhaviṣyanti
analyzed: cakravartinaḥ pi sapta ratna samanvāgatāḥ sa kumārāḥ sa amātyāḥ sa antaḥpura parivārāḥ darśana kāmāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: cakravartins endowed with the seven jewels, princes, ministers, and retinues of women from the inner quarters will want to see him

original: satkārārthinaḥ /
analyzed: satkāra arthinaḥ
translated: and will seek to honor him.

original: tāvanmadhuraṃ sa dharmabhāṇako dharmaṃ bhāṣiṣyate yathābhūtaṃ yathoktaṃ tathāgatena /
analyzed: tāvat madhuram sa dharma bhāṇakaḥ dharmam bhāṣiṣyate yathābhūtam yathā uktam tathāgatena
translated: The Dharma teacher will speak the Dharma in such a sweet way, in accordance with reality, as taught by the Tathāgata.

original: anye 'pi brāhmaṇagṛhapatayo naigamajānapadāstasya dharmabhāṇakasya Vaidya
analyzed: anye pi brāhmaṇa gṛhapatayaḥ naigama jānapadāḥ tasya dharmabhāṇakasya vaidya
translated: Other brahmins, householders, townspeople, and country people will always follow that Dharma teacher,

original: satatasamitaṃ samanubaddhā bhaviṣyanti yāvadāyuṣparyavasānam /
analyzed: satata samitam samanubaddhāḥ bhaviṣyanti yāvat āyuṣparyavasānam
translated: like a shadow, as long as he lives.

original: tathāgataśrāvakā api asya darśanakāmā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tathāgata śrāvakāḥ api asya darśana kāmāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: The Tathāgata's disciples will also wish to see him.

original: pratyekabuddhā apyasya darśanakāmā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: pratyekabuddhāḥ api asya darśana kāmāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: The pratyekabuddhas will also wish to see him.

original: buddhā apyasya bhagavanto darśanakāmā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: buddhāḥ api asya bhagavantaḥ darśana kāmāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, will also wish to see him.

original: yasyāṃ ca diśi sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā vihariṣyati /
analyzed: yasyām ca diśi sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā vihariṣyati
translated: In whatever direction that noble man or noble woman dwells,

original: tasyāṃ diśi tathāgatābhimukhaṃ dharmaṃ deśayiṣyati /
analyzed: tasyām diśi tathāgata abhimukham dharmam deśayiṣyati
translated: in that direction the Dharma will be taught facing the Tathāgatas.

original: buddhadharmāṇāṃ ca bhājanabhūto bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: buddha dharmāṇām ca bhājana bhūtaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: He will become a vessel for the Buddha's teachings.

original: evaṃ manojñastasya gambhīro dharmaśabdo niścariṣyati //
analyzed: evam manojñaḥ tasya gambhīraḥ dharma śabdaḥ niścariṣyati
translated: Such a delightful and profound sound of the Dharma will emerge from him.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses on that occasion:

original: jihvendriyaṃ tasya viśiṣṭu bhoti na jātu hīnaṃ rasa svādayeta /
analyzed: jihvā indriyam tasya na jātu hīnam svādayeta
translated: His faculty of the tongue will be excellent; he will never taste inferior flavors.

original: nikṣiptamātrāśca bhavanti divyā rasena divyena samanvitāśca // / //
analyzed: nikṣipta mātrāḥ ca bhavanti divyāḥ rasena divyena samanvitāḥ ca
translated: As soon as they are placed, they become divine, endowed with a divine taste.

original: valgusvarāṃ madhura prabhāṣate girāṃ śravaṇīyamiṣṭāṃ ca manoramāṃ ca /
analyzed: valgu svarām madhura prabhāṣate girām śravaṇīyam iṣṭām ca manoramām ca
translated: He speaks with a pleasant voice, with sweet words, with words worth hearing, with words that are pleasing and delightful.

original: parṣāya madhyasmi ha premaṇīyaṃ gambhīraghoṣaṃ ca sadā prabhāṣate // / //
analyzed: ha premaṇīyam gambhīra ghoṣam ca sadā prabhāṣate
translated: In the midst of the assembly, he always speaks with a deep voice, which is endearing.

original: yaścāpi dharmaṃ śṛṇute 'sya bhāṣato dṛṣṭāntakoṭīnayutairanekaiḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca api dharmam śṛṇute bhāṣataḥ dṛṣṭānta koṭī nayutaiḥ anekaiḥ
translated: And whoever hears him teach the Dharma with countless quintillions of parables,

original: prāmodya tatrāpi janeti so 'graṃ pūjāṃ ca tasya kurute 'prameyām // / //
analyzed: tatra api jana iti saḥ pūjām ca tasya kurute prameyām
translated: He generates the highest joy there, and makes immeasurable offerings to him.

original: devā pi nāgāsuraguhyakāśca draṣṭuṃ tamicchanti ca nityakālam /
analyzed: nāga asura guhyakāḥ ca draṣṭum tam icchanti ca nityakālam
translated: Even the gods, nāgas, asuras, and guhyakas always wish to see him.

original: śṛṇvanti dharmaṃ ca sagauravāśca ime guṇāstasya bhavanti sarve // / //
analyzed: śṛṇvanti dharmam ca sa gauravāḥ ca ime guṇāḥ tasya bhavanti sarve
translated: They listen to the Dharma with respect, and he has all these qualities.

original: ākāṅkṣamāṇaśca ima lokadhātuṃ svareṇa sarvāmabhivijñapeyā /
analyzed: ākāṅkṣamāṇaḥ ca lokadhātum svareṇa sarvām abhivijñapeyā
translated: If he wishes, he can make this entire world system hear with his voice.

original: snigdhaḥ svaro 'sya madhuraśca bhoti gambhīra valguśca supremaṇīyaḥ // / //
analyzed: snigdhaḥ svaraḥ sya madhuraḥ ca gambhīra valguḥ ca su premaṇīyaḥ
translated: His voice is smooth, sweet, deep, pleasant, and very endearing.

original: rājāna ye kṣitipati cakravartinaḥ pūjārthikāstasyupasaṃkramanti /
analyzed: ye kṣitipati cakravartinaḥ pūjā arthikāḥ tasi upasaṃkramanti
translated: Those who are kings, lords of the earth, and universal monarchs, who come to him for the sake of worship,

original: saputradārā kariyāṇa añjaliṃ śṛṇvanti dharmasya ca nityakālam // / //
analyzed: sa putra dārā añjalim śṛṇvanti dharmasya ca nityakālam
translated: With sons and wives, they will always join their palms and listen to the Dharma.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Doctor

original: yakṣāṇa co bhoti sadā puraskṛto nāgāna gandharvagaṇāna caiva /
analyzed: yakṣāṇa ca u bhoti sadā puraskṛtaḥ nāgāna gandharva gaṇāna ca eva
translated: He will always be honored by the yakshas, nagas, and hosts of gandharvas,

original: piśācakānāṃ ca piśācikānāṃ susatkṛto mānitu pūjitaśca // / //
analyzed: piśācakānām ca piśācikānām su satkṛtaḥ pūjitaḥ ca
translated: And will be well-respected, revered, and worshipped by the pishachas and pishachis.

original: brahmāpi tasya vaśavarti bhoti maheśvaro īśvara devaputraḥ /
analyzed: brahmā api tasya vaśavarti maheśvaraḥ īśvara devaputraḥ
translated: Even Brahma will be under his control, as will Mahesvara, Ishvara, and the god-sons.

original: śakrastathānye 'pi ca devaputrā bahudevakanyāścupasaṃkramanti // / //
analyzed: śakraḥ tathā anye ca deva putrāḥ bahu deva kanyāḥ ca upasaṃkramanti
translated: Shakra and the other god-sons, and many daughters of the gods, will approach him.

original: buddhāśca ye lokahitānukampakāḥ saśrāvakāstasya niśāmya ghoṣam /
analyzed: buddhāḥ ca ye loka hita anukampakāḥ sa śrāvakāḥ tasya niśāmya ghoṣam
translated: The Buddhas who are compassionate towards beings, together with their disciples, will hear his voice,

original: karonti rakṣāṃ mukhadarśanāya tuṣṭāśca bhonti bruvato 'sya dharmam // / //
analyzed: karonti rakṣām mukha darśanāya tuṣṭāḥ ca bhonti bruvataḥ sya dharmam
translated: And will protect him by showing their faces. They will be pleased when he speaks the Dharma.

original: punaraparaṃ satatasamitābhiyukta sa bodhisattvo mahāsattva imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ dhārayamāṇo
analyzed: punar aparam satatasamita abhiyukta sa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ imam dharmaparyāyam dhārayamāṇaḥ
translated: Moreover, Satatasamitabhiyukta, that bodhisattva mahāsattva who upholds this Dharma teaching,

original: vā vācayamāno vā prakāśayamāno vā deśayamāno vā likhamāno vā aṣṭau kāyaguṇaśatāni pratilapsyati /
analyzed: vā vācayamānaḥ vā prakāśayamānaḥ vā deśayamānaḥ vā likhamānaḥ vā aṣṭau kāya guṇa śatāni pratilapsyati
translated: whether reading it, explaining it, teaching it, or writing it, will attain eight hundred qualities of the body.

original: tasya kāyaḥ śuddhaḥ pariśuddho vaiḍūryapariśuddhacchavivarṇo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tasya kāyaḥ śuddhaḥ pariśuddhaḥ vaiḍūrya pariśuddha chavi varṇaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: His body will be pure, very pure, with a complexion like a pure beryl.

original: priyadarśanaḥ sattvānām /
analyzed: priya darśanaḥ sattvānām
translated: It will be delightful to behold for beings.

original: sa tasminnātmabhāve pariśuddhe sarvaṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasralokadhātuṃ drakṣyati /
analyzed: sa tasmin ātmabhāve pariśuddhe sarvam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātum drakṣyati
translated: In that pure body, he will see the entire trichiliocosm.

original: ye ca trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau sattvāścyavanti upapadyante ca /
analyzed: ye ca tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau sattvāḥ cyavanti upapadyante ca
translated: And the beings who die and are reborn in the trichiliocosm,

original: hīnāḥ praṇītāśca /
analyzed: hīnāḥ praṇītāḥ ca
translated: whether inferior or excellent,

original: suvarṇā durvarṇāḥ /
analyzed: su varṇāḥ durvarṇāḥ
translated: whether beautiful or ugly,

original: sugatau durgatau /
analyzed: sugatau durgatau
translated: whether in good or bad destinies,

original: ye ca cakravālamahācakravāleṣu merusumeruṣu ca parvatarājeṣu sattvāḥ prativasanti /
analyzed: ye ca cakravāla mahā cakravāleṣu meru sumeruṣu ca parvata rājeṣu sattvāḥ prativasanti
translated: and the beings who dwell on the Cakravāla and Mahācakravāla mountains, on Meru and Sumeru, the kings of mountains,

original: ye ca adhastādavīcyāmūrdhvaṃ ca yāvad bhavāgraṃ sattvāḥ prativasanti /
analyzed: ye ca adhastāt avīcyām ūrdhvam ca yāvat bhavāgram sattvāḥ prativasanti
translated: and those beings who dwell below in the Avīci hell and above up to the peak of existence,

original: tān sarvān sva ātmabhāve drakṣyati /
analyzed: tān sarvān sve ātmabhāve drakṣyati
translated: he will see them all in his own body.

original: ye cāpi kecidasmiṃstrisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātrau śrāvakā vā pratyekabuddhā vā bodhisattvā vā tathāgatā vā prativasanti /
analyzed: ye ca api kecid asmin tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātrau śrāvakāḥ vā pratyekabuddhāḥ vā bodhisattvāḥ vā tathāgatāḥ vā prativasanti
translated: And whatever śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, or tathāgatas dwell in this trichiliocosm,

original: yaṃ ca te tathāgatā dharmaṃ deśayanti /
analyzed: yam ca te tathāgatāḥ dharmam deśayanti
translated: and whatever Dharma those tathāgatas teach,

original: ye ca sattvāstāṃstathāgatān paryupāsante /
analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ tān tathāgatān paryupāsante
translated: And the beings who attend on those Tathāgatas,

original: sarveṣāṃ teṣāṃ sattvānāmātmabhāvapratilambhān sva ātmabhāve drakṣyati /
analyzed: sarveṣām teṣām sattvānām ātmabhāva pratilambhān sve ātmabhāve drakṣyati
translated: he will see the attainment of their own bodies in his own body.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: yathāpīdaṃ pariśuddhatvādātmabhāvasyeti //
analyzed: yathā api idam pariśuddha tvāt ātma bhāvasya iti
translated: Because of the purity of his own body.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses on that occasion:

original: pariśuddha tasyo bhavatetmabhāvo yathāpi vaiḍūryamayo viśuddhaḥ /
analyzed: pariśuddha bhavatā ītma bhāvaḥ yathā api vaiḍūrya mayaḥ viśuddhaḥ
translated: His own body becomes pure, like a pure crystal.

original: sattvāna nityaṃ priyadarśanaśca yaḥ sūtra dhāreti idaṃ udāram // / //
analyzed: nityam priya darśanaḥ ca yaḥ iti idam udāram
translated: He is always dear to see, like the moon, he who upholds this vast sūtra.

original: ādarśapṛṣṭhe yatha vimbu paśyet loko 'sya kāye ayu dṛśyate tathā /🔽Vaidya
analyzed: paśyet vimbu paśyet dṛśyate tathā  vaidya
translated: Just as one would see a reflection in a mirror, so the world sees him in his body.

original: svayaṃbhu so paśyati nānyi sattvāḥ pariśuddhi kāyasmi ima evarūpā // / //
analyzed: svayaṃbhu saḥ paśyati na anyi sattvāḥ ime evarūpā
translated: The self-existent one sees it, not other beings. Such is the purity of the body.

original: ye lokadhātau hi ihāsti sattvā manuṣya devāsura guhyakā vā /
analyzed: ye lokadhātau hi iha asti sattvāḥ manuṣya deva asura guhyakāḥ vā
translated: Whatever beings there are in this world system, humans, gods, asuras, or guhyakas,

original: narakeṣu preteṣu tiraścayoniṣu pratibimbu saṃdṛśyati tatra kāye // / //
analyzed: narakeṣu preteṣu tiraścayoniṣu pratibimbu saṃdṛśyati tatra kāye
translated: in the hells, as ghosts, or in the animal realm, their reflections are seen in his body.

original: vimāna devāna bhavāgra yāvacchailaṃ pi co parvatacakravālam /
analyzed: yāvat śailam pi parvata cakravālam
translated: The gods in the palaces, up to the peak of existence, the mountains and the Cakravāla mountains,

original: himavān sumeruśca mahāṃśca meruḥ kāyasmi dṛśyantimi sarvathaiva // / //
analyzed: himavān sumeruḥ ca mahān ca meruḥ sarvathā eva
translated: The Himalayas, Mount Sumeru, and the great Mount Meru will all be seen within his body.

original: buddhān pi so paśyati ātmabhāve saśrāvakān buddhasutāṃstathānyān /
analyzed: buddhān pi saḥ paśyati ātma bhāve sa śrāvakān buddha sutān tathā anyān
translated: He will see the Buddhas, together with their disciples and the sons of the Buddhas,

original: ye bodhisattvā viharanti caikakā gaṇe ca ye dharma prakāśayanti // / //
analyzed: ye bodhisattvāḥ viharanti ca ekakāḥ gaṇe ca ye dharma prakāśayanti
translated: And the Bodhisattvas who dwell alone, and those who teach the Dharma to the assembly.

original: etādṛśī kāyaviśuddhi tasya yahi dṛśyate sarviya lokadhātuḥ /
analyzed: etādṛśī tasya lokadhātuḥ
translated: Such will be the purity of his body, that he will see the entire world realm.

original: na ca tāva so divya na prāpuṇoti prakṛtīya kāyasyiyamīdṛśī bhavet // / //
analyzed: na ca tāva saḥ divya na prāpuṇoti prakṛtīya kāyasya iyam īdṛśī bhavet
translated: And even though he has not yet attained the divine eye, his body will naturally be like this.

original: punaraparaṃ satatasamitābhiyukta asya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya tathāgate parinirvṛte
analyzed: punar aparam satata samitā abhiyukta asya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya tathāgate parinirvṛte
translated: Moreover, Satata-samitābhiyukta, when the Tathāgata has passed into nirvāṇa,

original: imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ dhārayato deśayataḥ saṃprakāśayato likhato vācayatastairdvādaśabhirmanaskāraguṇaśataiḥ
analyzed: imam dharmaparyāyam dhārayataḥ deśayataḥ saṃprakāśayataḥ likhataḥ vācayataḥ taiḥ dvādaśabhiḥ manaskāra guṇa śataiḥ
translated: for this Bodhisattva Mahāsattva who upholds this Dharma teaching, who teaches it, who illuminates it, who writes it out, and who recites it, his mental faculty will be endowed with

original: samanvāgataṃ manaindriyaṃ pariśuddhaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: samanvāgatam manā indriyam pariśuddham bhaviṣyati
translated: these twelve hundred qualities of mental activity, and will be completely pure.

original: sa tena pariśuddhena manaindriyeṇa yadyekagāthāmapyantaśaḥ śroṣyati /
analyzed: sa tena pariśuddhena manā indriyeṇa yadi eka gāthām api antaśas śroṣyati
translated: With that completely pure mental faculty, if he hears even a single verse,

original: tasya bahvarthamājñāsyati /
analyzed: tasya bahu artham ājñāsyati
translated: he will understand its great meaning.

original: sa tāvamabudhya tannidānaṃ māsamapi dharmaṃ deśayiṣyati /
analyzed: sa tāvam a budhya tad nidānam māsam api dharmam deśayiṣyati
translated: He will understand that and will teach the Dharma for a month because of that.

original: caturmāsamapi saṃvatsaramapi dharmaṃ deśayiṣyati /
analyzed: catur māsam api saṃvatsaram api dharmam deśayiṣyati
translated: He will teach the Dharma for four months, for a year.

original: yaṃ ca dharmaṃ bhāṣiṣyati /
analyzed: yam ca dharmam bhāṣiṣyati
translated: And whatever Dharma he teaches,

original: so 'sya smṛto na sa saṃpramoṣaṃ yāsyati /
analyzed: saḥ sya smṛtaḥ na sa saṃpramoṣam yāsyati
translated: it will be remembered by him and will not be forgotten.

original: ye kecillaukikā lokavyavahārā bhāṣyāṇi vā mantrā vā /
analyzed: ye kecid laukikāḥ lokavyavahārāḥ bhāṣyāṇi vā mantrāḥ vā
translated: Whatever worldly conventions, treatises, or incantations there are,

original: sarvāṃstān dharmanayena saṃsyandayiṣyati /
analyzed: sarvān tān dharma nayena saṃsyandayiṣyati
translated: he will connect them all with the Dharma.

original: yāvantaśca kecitrisāhasramahāsāhasrāyāṃ lokadhātau ṣaṭsu gatiṣūpapannāḥ sattvāḥ saṃsaranti /
analyzed: yāvantaḥ ca kecid tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrāyām lokadhātau ṣaṭsu gatiṣu upapannāḥ sattvāḥ saṃsaranti
translated: And as many beings as there are in the three-thousand great-thousand world system, born in the six destinies, transmigrating,

original: sarveṣāṃ teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ cittacaritavispanditāni jñāsyati /
analyzed: sarveṣām teṣām sattvānām citta carita vispanditāni jñāsyati
translated: he will know the thoughts, conduct, and activities of all those beings.

original: iñjitamanyitaprapañcitāni jñāsyati praviciniṣyati /
analyzed: iñjita manyita prapañcitāni jñāsyati praviciniṣyati
translated: He will know the movements, thoughts, and elaborations, and will discern them.

original: apratilabdhe ca tāvadāryajñāne evaṃrūpaṃ cāsya manaindriyaṃ pariśuddhaṃ bhaviṣyati //
analyzed: a pratilabdhe ca tāvat ārya jñāne evaṃrūpam ca asya mana indriyam pariśuddham bhaviṣyati
translated: And even before attaining the noble knowledge, his mental faculty will be so pure in this way.

original: yāṃ yāṃ ca dharmaniruktimanuvicintya dharmaṃ deśayiṣyati /
analyzed: yām yām ca dharma niruktim anuvicintya dharmam deśayiṣyati
translated: And whatever Dharma explanation he teaches after contemplating the Dharma,

original: sarvaṃ tad bhūtaṃ deśayiṣyati /
analyzed: sarvam tat bhūtam deśayiṣyati
translated: he will teach it all as it is.

original: sarvaṃ tattathāgatabhāṣitaṃ sarvaṃ pūrvajinasūtraparyāyanirdiṣṭaṃ bhāṣati //
analyzed: sarvam tat tathāgata bhāṣitam sarvam pūrva jinasūtra paryāya nirdiṣṭam bhāṣati
translated: He speaks everything that is spoken by the Tathāgata, and everything that is taught in the sūtras of the former victorious ones.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses on that occasion:

original: manaindriyaṃ tasya viśuddha bhoti prabhāsvaraṃ śuddhamanāvilaṃ ca /
analyzed: tasya prabhāsvaram śuddham anāvilam ca
translated: His mental faculty becomes pure, radiant, clear, and unclouded.

original: so tena dharmān vividhān prajānati hīnānathotkṛṣṭa tathaiva madhyamān // / //
analyzed: tena dharmān vividhān prajānati tathā eva madhyamān
translated: Through that, he knows various dharmas: inferior, superior, and middling.

original: ekāmapi gātha śruṇitva dhīro artha bahuṃ jānati tasya tatra /
analyzed: ekām api dhīraḥ bahum jānati tasya tatra
translated: The wise one, having heard even one verse, knows much meaning in it.

original: samitaṃ ca bhūtaṃ ca sadā prabhāṣate māsān pi catvāri tathāpi varṣam // / //
analyzed: samitam ca bhūtam ca sadā prabhāṣate māsān catvāri tathā api varṣam
translated: He always speaks what is true and real, for four months, and likewise for a year.

original: ye cāpi sattvā iha lokadhātau abhyantare bāhiri ye vasanti /
analyzed: ye ca api sattvāḥ iha lokadhātau abhyantare ye vasanti
translated: Whatever beings dwell in this world system, inside and out,

original: devā manuṣyāsuraguhyakāśca nāgāśca ye cāpi tiraścayoniṣu // / //
analyzed: devāḥ manuṣya asura guhyakāḥ ca nāgāḥ ca ye ca api tiraśca yoniṣu
translated: Gods, humans, asuras, guhyakas, nāgas, and those in the animal realm,

original: ṣaṭsu gatīṣu nivasanti sattvā vicintitaṃ teṣa bhaveta yaṃ ca /
analyzed: ṣaṭsu nivasanti sattvāḥ bhaveta yam ca
translated: Whatever thoughts the beings who dwell in the six destinies may have,

original: ekakṣaṇe sarvi vidurvijānate dhāretva sūtraṃ ima ānuśaṃsāḥ // / //
analyzed: ekakṣaṇe sarvi sūtram
translated: The wise one knows them all in an instant. These are the benefits of upholding this sūtra.

original: yaṃ cāpi buddhaḥ śatapuṇyalakṣaṇo dharmaṃ prakāśedida sarvaloke /
analyzed: yam ca api buddhaḥ śata puṇya lakṣaṇaḥ dharmam sarva loke
translated: And whatever Dharma the Buddha, endowed with a hundred marks of merit, teaches in this whole world,

original: tasyāpi śabdaṃ śṛṇute viśuddhaṃ yaṃ cāpi so bhāṣati gṛhyate tat // / //
analyzed: tasya api śabdam śṛṇute viśuddham yam ca api saḥ bhāṣati gṛhyate tat
translated: One hears that pure sound, and whatever he speaks is understood.

original: bahūn vicinteti ca agradharmān bahūṃśca so bhāṣati nityakālam /
analyzed: bahūn vicinta iti ca agra dharmān bahūn ca saḥ bhāṣati nityakālam
translated: One contemplates many supreme Dharmas, and one always speaks of many.

original: na cāsya saṃmoha kadāci bhoti dhāretva sūtraṃ imi ānuśaṃsāḥ // / //
analyzed: na ca asya saṃmoha kadācid
translated: One never becomes confused, these are the benefits of upholding this sūtra.

original: saṃdhiṃ visaṃdhiṃ ca vijānate 'sau sarveṣu dharmeṣu vilakṣaṇāni /
analyzed: saṃdhim visaṃdhim ca vijānate sau sarveṣu dharmeṣu vilakṣaṇāni
translated: One knows the connections and disconnections, the various characteristics of all dharmas.

original: prajānate artha niruktayaśca yathā ca taṃ jānati bhāṣate tathā // / //
analyzed: prajānate artha niruktayaḥ ca yathā ca tam jānati bhāṣate tathā
translated: One understands the meanings and etymologies, and as one knows them, one speaks accordingly.
