original: na vyāpādacittamutpādayati /
analyzed: na vyāpāda cittam utpādayati
translated: and he did not develop thoughts of malice.

original: ye cāsya evaṃ saṃśrāvayato loṣṭaṃ vā daṇḍaṃ vā kṣipanti /
analyzed: ye ca asya evam saṃśrāvayataḥ loṣṭam vā daṇḍam vā kṣipanti
translated: And those who, when he was teaching like this, threw clods or sticks at him,

original: sa teṣāṃ dūrata eva uccaiḥsvaraṃ kṛtvā saṃśrāvayati sma nāhaṃ yuṣmākaṃ paribhavāmīti /
analyzed: sa teṣām dūratas eva uccais svaram kṛtvā saṃśrāvayati sma na aham yuṣmākam paribhavāmi iti
translated: he would make a loud noise from far away, saying, “I do not despise you.”

original: tasya tābhirabhimānikabhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikābhiḥ satatasamitaṃ saṃśrāvyamāṇābhiḥ sadāparibhūta iti nāma kṛtamabhūt //
analyzed: tasya tābhiḥ abhimānika bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikābhiḥ satata samitam saṃśrāvyamāṇābhiḥ sadāparibhūtaḥ iti nāma kṛtam abhūt
translated: And because he was constantly being taught by those conceited monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen, his name became known as Sadāparibhūta.

original: tena khalu punarmahāsthāmaprāpta sadāparibhūtena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena kālakriyāyāṃ
analyzed: tena khalu punar mahāsthāmaprāpta sadāparibhūtena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena kālakriyāyām
translated: “Mahā­sthāma­prāpta, when the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāparibhūta was at the point of death,

original: pratyupasthitāyāṃ maraṇakālasamaye pratyupasthite ayaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīko dharmaparyāyaḥ śruto 'bhūt /
analyzed: pratyupasthitāyām maraṇa kāla samaye pratyupasthite ayam saddharmapuṇḍarīkaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ śrutaḥ bhūt
translated: at the time of his death, he heard this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma.

original: tena ca bhagavatā bhīṣmagarjitasvararājena tathāgatenārhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena ayaṃ dharmaparyāyo viṃśatibhirgāthāviṃśatikoṭīnayutaśatasahasrairbhāṣito 🔽'bhūt /
analyzed: tena ca bhagavatā bhīṣmagarjitasvararājena tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena ayam dharmaparyāyaḥ viṃśatibhiḥ gāthā viṃśati koṭī nayuta śata sahasraiḥ bhāṣitaḥ 🔽bhūt
translated: And that bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Bhīṣma­garjita­svara­rāja taught this Dharma teaching with two hundred thousand quintillion verses,🔽two hundred thousand trillion verses,🔽two hundred thousand hundred million verses,

original: sa ca sadāparibhūto bodhisattvo mahāsattvo maraṇakālasamaye pratyupasthite antarīkṣanirghoṣādimaṃ dharmaparyāyamaśrauṣīt /
analyzed: sa ca sadāparibhūtaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ maraṇa kāla samaye pratyupasthite antarīkṣa nirghoṣāt imam dharmaparyāyam aśrauṣīt
translated: And that bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāparibhūta, when the time of his death arrived, heard this Dharma teaching from the sound of a voice in the sky.

original: yena kenacid bhāṣitamantarīkṣānnirghoṣaṃ śrutvā imaṃ dharmaparyāyamudgṛhītavān /
analyzed: yena kenacid bhāṣitam antarīkṣāt nirghoṣam śrutvā imam dharmaparyāyam udgṛhītavān
translated: Having heard this Dharma teaching spoken by an unknown voice from the sky, he took it up.

original: imāṃ caivaṃrūpāṃ cakṣurviśuddhiṃ śrotraviśuddhiṃ ghrāṇaviśuddhiṃ jihvāviśuddhiṃ kāyaviśuddhiṃ manoviśuddhiṃ ca pratilabdhavān /🔽sahapratilabdhābhirviśuddhibhiḥ punaranyāni viṃśativarṣakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi ātmano jīvitasaṃskāramadhiṣṭhāya imaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīkaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ
analyzed: imām ca evaṃrūpām cakṣuḥ viśuddhim śrotra viśuddhim ghrāṇa viśuddhim jihvā viśuddhim kāya viśuddhim manaḥ viśuddhim ca pratilabdhavān  saha pratilabdhābhiḥ viśuddhibhiḥ punar anyāni viṃśati varṣa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi ātmanaḥ jīvita saṃskāram adhiṣṭhāya imam saddharmapuṇḍarīkam dharmaparyāyam
translated: And he attained this kind of eye-purification, ear-purification, nose-purification, tongue-purification, body-purification, and mind-purification.🔽Together with the attainments of purification, he extended the life-formations of his own body for another twenty hundred thousand koṭi nayuta years,

original: saṃprakāśitavān /
analyzed: saṃprakāśitavān
translated: and he taught this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma.

original: ye ca te 'bhimānikāḥ sattvā bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikāḥ /
analyzed: ye ca te bhimānikāḥ sattvāḥ bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikāḥ
translated: And those conceited beings, the monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen,

original: ye pūrvaṃ nāhaṃ yuṣmākaṃ paribhavāmīti saṃśrāvitāḥ /
analyzed: ye pūrvam na aham yuṣmākam paribhavāmi iti saṃśrāvitāḥ
translated: who had previously been told, I do not despise you,

original: yairasyedaṃ sadāparibhūta iti nāma kṛtamabhūt /
analyzed: yaiḥ asya idam sadāparibhūtaḥ iti nāma kṛtam abhūt
translated: and who had given him the name Sadāparibhūta,

original: tasyodārarddhibalasthāmaṃ pratijñāpratibhānabalasthāmaṃ prajñābalasthāmaṃ Vaidya
analyzed: tasya udāra ṛddhi bala sthāmam pratijñā pratibhāna bala sthāmam prajñā bala sthāmam vaidya
translated: Seeing his great power, strength, and firmness in his vow and his power, strength, and firmness in his wisdom, and seeing that he was a doctor,

original: ca dṛṣṭvā sarve 'nusahāyībhūtā abhūvan dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: ca dṛṣṭvā sarve nu sahāyībhūtāḥ abhūvan dharma śravaṇāya
translated: all of them became his companions in listening to the Dharma.

original: sarve tena anyāni ca bahūni prāṇikoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitānyabhūvan //
analyzed: sarve tena anyāni ca bahūni prāṇi koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau samādāpitāni abhūvan
translated: He also inspired many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of other beings to highest, complete enlightenment.

original: sa khalu punarmahāsthāmaprāpta bodhisattvo mahāsattvastataścyavitvā candrasvararājasahanāmnāṃ tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ viṃśatikoṭīśatānyārāgitavān /
analyzed: sa khalu punar mahāsthāmaprāpta bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tatas cyavitvā candrasvararāja saha nāmnām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām viṃśati koṭī śatāni ārāgitavān
translated: “Mahā­sthāma­prāpta, that bodhisattva mahāsattva, after passing away from that life, pleased twenty thousand koṭis of tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas named Candra­sūrya­rāja.

original: sarveṣu ca imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ saṃprakāśayāmāsa /🔽so 'nupūrveṇa tenaiva pūrvakeṇa kuśalamūlena punarapyanupūrveṇa dundubhisvararājasahanāmnāṃ
analyzed: sarveṣu ca imam dharmaparyāyam saṃprakāśayāmāsa  saḥ nupūrveṇa tena eva pūrvakeṇa kuśala mūlena punar api anupūrveṇa dundubhi svararāja sahanāmnām
translated: He taught this Dharma teaching to all of them.🔽In due course, through that root of merit, he pleased twenty thousand koṭis of tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas named Dundubhi­svara­rāja.

original: tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ viṃśatimeva tathāgatakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇyārāgitavān /
analyzed: tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām viṃśatim eva tathāgata koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi ārāgitavān
translated: He pleased twenty thousand koṭis of nayutas of hundreds of thousands of tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas named Dundubhi­svara­rāja.

original: sarveṣu ca imameva saddharmapuṇḍarīkaṃ dharmaparyāyamārāgitavān /
analyzed: sarveṣu ca imam eva saddharmapuṇḍarīkam dharmaparyāyam ārāgitavān
translated: He pleased all of them and requested them to teach the Dharma.

original: saṃprakāśitavāṃścatasṛṇāṃ parṣadām /
analyzed: saṃprakāśitavān catasṛṇām parṣadām
translated: He also requested this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma from them and taught it to the fourfold assembly.

original: so 'nenaiva pūrvakeṇa kuśalamūlena punarapyapūrveṇa meghasvararājasahanāmnāṃ tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ viṃśatimeva tathāgatakoṭīśatasahasrāṇyārāgitavān /🔽sarveṣu ca imameva saddharmapuṇḍarīkaṃ dharmaparyāyamāragitavān /
analyzed: saḥ nena eva pūrvakeṇa kuśala mūlena punar api apūrveṇa meghasvararāja saha nāmnām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām viṃśatim eva tathāgata koṭī śata sahasrāṇi ārāgitavān  sarveṣu ca imam eva saddharmapuṇḍarīkam dharmaparyāyam āragitavān
translated: Through that root of merit, he pleased twenty thousand million buddhas, as many buddha bhagavāns as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River, in forward order.🔽He pleased all of them and requested them to teach the Dharma.

original: saṃprakāśitavāṃścatasṛṇāṃ parṣadām /
analyzed: saṃprakāśitavān catasṛṇām parṣadām
translated: He also requested this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma from them and taught it to the fourfold assembly.

original: sarveṣu ca evaṃrūpayā cakṣuḥpariśuddhayā samanvāgato 'bhūt /
analyzed: sarveṣu ca evaṃrūpayā cakṣuḥ pariśuddhayā samanvāgataḥ bhūt
translated: He was endowed with such pure eyes.

original: śrotrapariśuddhyā ghrāṇapariśuddhayā jihvāpariśuddhayā kāyapariśuddhayā manaḥpariśuddhayā samanvāgato 'bhūt //
analyzed: śrotra pariśuddhyā ghrāṇa pariśuddhayā jihvā pariśuddhayā kāya pariśuddhayā manaḥ pariśuddhayā samanvāgataḥ bhūt
translated: He was endowed with pure ears, a pure nose, a pure tongue, a pure body, and a pure mind.

original: sa khalu punarmahāsthāmaprāpta sadāparibhūto bodhisattvo mahāsattva iyatāṃ tathāgata
analyzed: sa khalu punar mahāsthāmaprāpta sadāparibhūtaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ iyatām tathāgata
translated: “Mahā­sthāma­prāpta, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sadāparibhūta pleased that many tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas.

original: koṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇāṃ satkāraṃ gurukāraṃ mānanāṃ pūjanāmarcanāmapacāyanāṃ kṛtvā
analyzed: koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇām satkāram gurukāram mānanām pūjanām arcanām apacāyanām kṛtvā
translated: Having made offerings, venerations, respect, worship, reverence, and honor to hundreds of thousands of quintillions of buddhas,

original: anyeṣāṃ ca bahūnāṃ buddhakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇāṃ satkāraṃ gurukāraṃ mānanāṃ pūjanāmarcanāmapacāyanāṃ kṛtvā /
analyzed: anyeṣām ca bahūnām buddha koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇām satkāram gurukāram mānanām pūjanām arcanām apacāyanām kṛtvā
translated: and having made offerings, venerations, respect, worship, reverence, and honor to many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of other buddhas,

original: sarveṣu ca teṣu imameva saddharmapuṇḍarīkaṃ dharmaparyāyamārāgitavān /
analyzed: sarveṣu ca teṣu imam eva saddharmapuṇḍarīkam dharmaparyāyam ārāgitavān
translated: he obtained this very Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma from all of them.

original: ārāgayitvā sa tenaiva pūrvakeṇa kuśalamūlena paripakvena anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhaḥ /
analyzed: ārāgayitvā sa tena eva pūrvakeṇa kuśala mūlena paripakvena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: Having obtained it, through that very previously accumulated root of merit he ripened it and attained the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood.

original: syātkhalu punaste mahāsthāmaprāpta evaṃ kāṅkṣā vā vimatirvā vicikitsā vā anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena sadāparibhūto nāma bodhisattvo
analyzed: syāt khalu punar te mahā sthāma prāptaḥ evam kāṅkṣā vā vimatiḥ vā vicikitsā vā anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena sadāparibhūtaḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ
translated: “Mahā­sthāma­prāpta, at that time, on that occasion, was there any doubt, uncertainty, or indecision in you that the bodhisattva mahāsattva named Sadāparibhūta

original: mahāsattvo 'bhūt /
analyzed: mahā sattvaḥ bhūt
translated: was someone else?

original: yastasya bhagavato bhīṣmagarjitasvararājasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya śāsane catasṛṇāṃ parṣadāṃ sadāparibhūtaḥ saṃmato 'bhūt /
analyzed: yaḥ tasya bhagavataḥ bhīṣmagarjitasvararājasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya śāsane catasṛṇām parṣadām sadā paribhūtaḥ saṃmataḥ bhūt
translated: He was the one who in the teaching of the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Bhīṣma­garjita­svara­rāja was always disrespected by the fourfold assembly.

original: yena te tāvantastathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā ārāgitā abhūvan /
analyzed: yena te tāvantaḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ ārāgitāḥ abhūvan
translated: By whom those thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas were pleased.

original: na khalu punaste mahāsthāmaprāpta evaṃ draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: na khalu punar te mahā sthāma prāptaḥ evam draṣṭavyam
translated: Mahā­sthāma­prāpta, you should not see it like that.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: ahameva sa mahāsthāmaprāpta tena kālena tena samayena sadāparibhūto nāma bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'bhūvam /
analyzed: aham eva tena kālena tena samayena sadāparibhūtaḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhūvam
translated: Mahā­sthāma­prāpta, I myself at that time, on that occasion, was the bodhisattva mahāsattva named Sadāparibhūta.

original: yadā mayā mahāsthāmaprāpta pūrvamayaṃ dharmaparyāyo nodgṛhīto 'bhaviṣyat /
analyzed: yadā mayā mahāsthāmaprāpta pūrvam ayam dharmaparyāyaḥ na udgṛhītaḥ bhaviṣyat
translated: Mahā­sthāma­prāpta, if I had not previously received this Dharma teaching,

original: na dhāritaḥ /
analyzed: na dhāritaḥ
translated: not held it,

original: nāhamevaṃ kṣipramanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddho 'bhaviṣyam /
analyzed: na aham evam kṣipram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ bhaviṣyam
translated: I would not have awakened in this way to perfect and complete buddhahood.

original: yataścāhaṃ mahāsthāmaprāpta paurvikāṇāṃ tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāmantikādimaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ dhāritavān vācitavān deśitavān /
analyzed: yatas ca aham mahā sthām aprāpta paurvikāṇām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām antikāt imam dharmaparyāyam dhāritavān vācitavān deśitavān
translated: Mahā­sthāma­prāpta, because I have held, recited, and taught this Dharma teaching in the presence of the past thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas,

original: tato 'hamevaṃ kṣipramanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ham evam kṣipram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: I have awakened in this way to perfect and complete buddhahood.

original: yānyapi tāni mahāsthāmaprāpta tena sadāparibhūtena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena bhikṣuśatāni
analyzed: yāni api tāni tena sadāparibhūtena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena bhikṣu śatāni
translated: Mahā­sthāma­prāpta, those one hundred bhikṣus

original: bhikṣuṇīśatāni ca upāsakaśatāni upāsikāśatāni ca tasya bhagavataḥ śāsane imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ
analyzed: bhikṣuṇī śatāni ca upāsaka śatāni upāsikā śatāni ca tasya bhagavataḥ śāsane imam dharmaparyāyam
translated: and hundreds of bhikṣus, hundreds of upāsakas, and hundreds of upāsikās in the teaching of that Bhagavān

original: saṃśrāvitānyabhūvan nāhaṃ yuṣmākaṃ paribhavāmīti /
analyzed: saṃśrāvitāni abhūvan na aham yuṣmākam paribhavāmi iti
translated: listened to this Dharma teaching, saying, ‘We are not disparaging you.’

original: sarve bhavanto bodhisattvacaryāṃ carantu /
analyzed: sarve bhavantaḥ bodhisattva caryām carantu
translated: All of you should practice the conduct of a bodhisattva.

original: bhaviṣyatha yūyaṃ tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ /
analyzed: bhaviṣyatha yūyam tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: You will become tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas.

original: yaistasya bodhisattvasyāntike vyāpādacittamutpāditamabhūt / Vaidya
analyzed: yaiḥ tasya bodhisattvasya antike vyāpāda cittam utpāditam abhūt vaidya
translated: Those who gave rise to a mind of ill-will toward that bodhisattva

original: tairviśatikalpakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi na jātu tathāgato dṛṣṭo 'bhūt /
analyzed: taiḥ viśati kalpa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi na jātu tathāgataḥ dṛṣṭaḥ bhūt
translated: for twenty hundred thousand quintillion eons never saw a tathāgata,

original: nāpi dharmaśabdo na saṃghaśabdaḥ śruto 'bhūt /
analyzed: na api dharma śabdaḥ na saṃgha śabdaḥ śrutaḥ bhūt
translated: nor heard the words ‘Dharma’ or ‘saṅgha.’

original: daśa ca kalpasahasrāṇyavīcau mahānarake dāruṇāṃ vedanāṃ vedayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: daśa ca kalpa sahasrāṇi avīcau mahā narake dāruṇām vedanām vedayāmāsuḥ
translated: For ten thousand eons they experienced terrible suffering in the Avīci hell.

original: te ca sarve tasmāt karmāvaraṇāt parimuktāḥ
analyzed: te ca sarve tasmāt karma āvaraṇāt parimuktāḥ
translated: All of them were freed from that karmic obscuration,

original: tenaiva bodhisattvena mahāsattvena paripācitā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: tena eva bodhisattvena mahāsattvena paripācitāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: and were ripened for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by that very bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: syātkhalu punaste mahāsthāmaprāpta kāṅkṣā vā vimatirvā vicikitsā vā katame tena
analyzed: syāt khalu punar te mahāsthāmaprāpta kāṅkṣā vā vimatiḥ vā vicikitsā vā katame tena
translated: Mahā­sthāma­prāpta, you may have doubts, uncertainty, or skepticism about this,

original: kālena tena samayena te sattvā abhūvan ye te taṃ bodhisattvaṃ ptahāsattvamullāpitavanta uccagghitavantaḥ /
analyzed: kālena tena samayena te sattvāḥ abhūvan ye te tam bodhisattvam ptahāsattvam ullāpitavantaḥ uccagghitavantaḥ
translated: “Mahā­sthāma­pṛāpta, at that time, on that occasion, those beings who ridiculed and mocked that bodhisattva mahāsattva

original: asyāmeva mahāsthāmaprāpta parṣadi bhadrapālapramukhāṇi pañca bodhisattvaśatāni siṃhacandrāpramukhāni
analyzed: asyām eva mahāsthāmaprāpta parṣadi bhadrapāla pramukhāṇi pañca bodhisattva śatāni siṃhacandrā pramukhāni
translated: in this very assembly, the five hundred bodhisattvas headed by Bhadrapāla,🔽the five hundred bhikṣus headed by Siṃhacandrā,

original: pañcabhikṣuṇīśatāni sugatacetanāpramukhāni pañcopāsikāśatāni sarvāṇyavaivartikāni
analyzed: pañca bhikṣuṇī śatāni sugata cetanā pramukhāni pañca upāsikā śatāni sarvāṇi a vaivartikāni
translated: the five hundred upāsikās headed by Sugatacetanā, all of whom are irreversible

original: kṛtāni anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: kṛtāni anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: from the highest, complete enlightenment.

original: evamiyaṃ mahāsthāmaprāpta mahārthasya dharmaparyāyasya dhāraṇā vācanā deśanā bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāmanuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodherāhārikā
analyzed: evam iyam mahāsthāmaprāpta mahā arthasya dharmaparyāyasya dhāraṇā vācanā deśanā bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ āhārikā
translated: “Mahā­sthāma­pṛāpta, in that way, the retention, recitation, and teaching of this Dharma teaching of great meaning by bodhisattva mahāsattvas brings about

original: saṃvartate /🔽tasmāttarhi mahāsthāmaprāpta ayaṃ dharmaparyāyo bodhisattvairmahāsattvaistathāgate parinirvṛte abhīkṣṇaṃ dhārayitavyo vācayitavyo deśayitavyaḥ
analyzed: saṃvartate  tasmāt tarhi mahā sthāma prāpta ayam dharmaparyāyaḥ bodhisattvaiḥ mahāsattvaiḥ tathāgate parinirvṛte abhīkṣṇam dhārayitavyaḥ vācayitavyaḥ deśayitavyaḥ  /
translated: the nourishment of the highest, complete enlightenment.🔽“Therefore, Mahā­sthāma­pṛāpta, after the Tathāgata’s parinirvāṇa, this Dharma teaching should be frequently retained, recited, and taught

original: saṃprakāśayitavya iti //
analyzed: saṃprakāśayitavyaḥ iti
translated: and made widely known by bodhisattva mahāsattvas.”

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Bhagavān spoke these verses:

original: atītamadhvānamanusmarāmi bhīṣmasvaro rāja jino yadāsi /
analyzed: atītam adhvānam anusmarāmi bhīṣma svaraḥ rāja jinaḥ yadā asi
translated: I remember the past, when Bhishmasvara was the Jina, the Victorious King,

original: mahānubhāvo naradevapūjitaḥ praṇāyako naramaruyakṣarakṣasām // / //
analyzed: mahā anubhāvaḥ naradeva pūjitaḥ praṇāyakaḥ nara maru yakṣa rakṣasām
translated: Who had great power and was worshipped by the gods of men, the leader of men, gods, yakshas, and rakshasas.

original: tasya jinasya parinirvṛtasya saddharma saṃkṣobha vrajanti paścime /
analyzed: tasya jinasya parinirvṛtasya saddharma saṃkṣobha vrajanti paścime
translated: After the nirvana of that Jina, in the end, the true Dharma was about to be destroyed,

original: bhikṣū abhūṣī tada bodhisattvo nāmena so sadaparibhūta ucyate // / //
analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ saḥ sadaparibhūtaḥ ucyate
translated: There was a bodhisattva monk, called Sadaparibhukta.

original: upasaṃkramitvā tada bhikṣu anyān upalambhadṛṣṭīna tathaiva bhikṣuṇī /
analyzed: upasaṃkramitvā anyān upalambha dṛṣṭīna tathā eva bhikṣuṇī
translated: Having approached, he said to other monks who had the view of grasping, and to nuns,

original: paribhāva mahyaṃ na kadācidasti yūyaṃ hi caryāṃ carathāgrabodhaye // / //
analyzed: paribhāva mahyam na kadācid asti yūyam hi caryām caratha agra bodhaye
translated: I have never had any honor. You should practice for the sake of supreme enlightenment.

original: evaṃ ca saṃśrāvayi nityakālaṃ ākrośa paribhāṣa sahantu teṣām /
analyzed: evam ca nityakālam ākrośa paribhāṣa sahantu teṣām
translated: And he always proclaimed this, enduring their insults and abuse.

original: kālakriyāyāṃ samupasthitāyāṃ śrutaṃ idaṃ sūtramabhūṣi tena // / //
analyzed: kālakriyāyām samupasthitāyām śrutam idam sūtram abhūṣi tena
translated: When the time of death arrived, he heard this sutra.

original: akṛtva kālaṃ tada paṇḍitena adhiṣṭhihitvā ca sudīrghamāyuḥ /
analyzed: kālam ca su dīrgham āyuḥ
translated: The wise one did not die then, but extended his life for a long time.

original: prakāśitaṃ sūtramidaṃ tadāsīt tahi śāsane tasya vināyakasya // / //
analyzed: prakāśitam sūtram idam tadā āsīt śāsane tasya vināyakasya
translated: And this sutra was revealed, in the teaching of that guide.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vaidya

original: te cāpi sarve bahu opalambhikā bodhīya tena paripācitāsīt /
analyzed: te ca api sarve bahu opalambhikā bodhīya tena paripācitā āsīt
translated: And all of them, who were full of grasping, were ripened for enlightenment by him.

original: tataścyavitvāna sa bodhisattvo ārāgayī buddhasahasrakoṭyaḥ // / //
analyzed: tatas cyavitvāna sa bodhisattvaḥ ārāgayī buddha sahasra koṭyaḥ
translated: And after passing away from there, that bodhisattva pleased ten thousand million buddhas.

original: anupūrva puṇyena kṛtena tena prakāśayitvā imu sūtra nityam /
analyzed: anupūrva puṇyena kṛtena tena prakāśayitvā imu sūtra nityam
translated: And by the merit he had previously created, having always taught this sūtra,

original: bodhiṃ sa saṃprāpta jinasya putro ahameva so śākyamunistadāsīt // / //
analyzed: bodhim sa saṃprāpta jinasya putraḥ aham eva saḥ śākyamuniḥ tadā āsīt
translated: That son of the Jina attained enlightenment. I myself was he, the Śākyamuni of that time.

original: ye cāpi bhikṣū tada opalambhikā yā bhikṣuṇī ye ca upāsakā vā /
analyzed: ye ca api bhikṣū tadā opalambhikāḥ yā bhikṣuṇī ye ca upāsakāḥ vā
translated: And those monks who were grasping at that time, and the nuns and lay followers,

original: upāsikāstatra ca yā tadāsīd ye bodhi saṃśrāvita paṇḍitena // / //
analyzed: upāsikāḥ tatra ca yā tadā āsīt ye paṇḍitena
translated: And the laywomen who were there at that time, who were taught the enlightenment by the wise one,

original: te cāpi dṛṣṭvā bahubuddhakoṭya ime ca te pañcaśatā anūnakāḥ /
analyzed: te ca api dṛṣṭvā bahu buddha koṭyaḥ ime ca te pañcaśatāḥ anūnakāḥ
translated: They too saw many millions of buddhas, and these five hundred are not lacking,

original: tathaiva bhikṣūṇa ca bhikṣuṇī ca upāsikāścāpi mi mahya saṃmukham // / //
analyzed: tathā eva ca bhikṣuṇī ca upāsikāḥ ca api saṃmukham
translated: And the monks and nuns and laywomen who were in my presence then,

original: sarve mayā śrāvita agradharmā te caiva sarve paripācitā me /
analyzed: sarve mayā śrāvita agra dharmā te ca eva sarve paripācitāḥ me
translated: All of them were taught the supreme Dharma by me, and all of them were ripened by me.

original: mayi nirvṛte cāpimi sarvi dhīrā imu dhārayiṣyanti ha sūtramagram // / //
analyzed: mayi nirvṛte dhīrāḥ dhārayiṣyanti ha sūtram agram
translated: And after my nirvāṇa, all these wise ones will uphold this supreme sūtra.

original: kalpāna koṭyo bahubhīracintyairna kadācidetādṛśa dharma śrūyate /
analyzed: koṭyaḥ dharma śrūyate
translated: For many inconceivable millions of eons, such a Dharma is never heard.

original: buddhāna koṭīśata caiva bhonti na ca te pimaṃ sūtra prakāśayanti // / //
analyzed: koṭī śata ca eva bhonti na ca te sūtra prakāśayanti
translated: Even if there are a hundred million buddhas, they do not teach this sutra.

original: tasmācchrūṇitvā idamevarūpaṃ parikīrtitaṃ dharmu svayaṃ svayaṃbhūvā /
analyzed: tasmāt śrūṇitvā idam eva rūpam parikīrtitam
translated: Therefore, having heard this kind of Dharma, which is proclaimed by the Self-Existent One himself,

original: ārāgayitvā ca punaḥ punaścimaṃ prakāśayet sūtra mayīha nirvṛte // / //
analyzed: ārāgayitvā ca punar punar cimam prakāśayet sūtra mayi iha nirvṛte
translated: Having attained it again and again, one should teach this sutra here after the nirvana.

original: iti śrīsaddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye sadāparibhūtaparivarto nāmaikonaviṃśatimaḥ //
analyzed: iti śrī saddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye sadāparibhūtaparivartaḥ nāma ekonaviṃśatimaḥ
translated: Thus concludes the nineteenth chapter, on Sadaprarudita, in the Dharma teaching of the White Lotus of the Good Dharma.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: tathāgataddharyabhisaṃskāraparivartaḥ /
translated: The Chapter on the Tathāgata's Supernormal Powers

original: atha khalu yāni tāni sāhasralokadhātuparamāṇurajaḥsamāni bodhisattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi pṛthivīvivarebhyo niṣkrāntāni /
analyzed: atha khalu yāni tāni sāhasra lokadhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ samāni bodhisattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi pṛthivī vivarebhyaḥ niṣkrāntāni
translated: Then those many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of bodhisattvas equal to the atoms in a world system who emerged from the openings in the earth,

original: tāni sarvāṇi bhagavato 'bhimukhamañjaliṃ pragṛhya bhagavantametadūcuḥ vayaṃ bhagavan
analyzed: tāni sarvāṇi bhagavataḥ abhimukham añjalim pragṛhya bhagavantam etat ūcuḥ vayam bhagavan
translated: all of them, with palms joined, said to the Bhagavān, Bhagavān,

original: imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya sarvabuddhakṣetreṣu yāni yāni bhagavato buddhakṣetrāṇi /
analyzed: imam dharmaparyāyam tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya sarva buddhakṣetreṣu yāni yāni bhagavataḥ buddhakṣetrāṇi
translated: When the Tathāgata has passed into parinirvāṇa, in all the Buddha-fields, in the Buddha-fields of the Blessed One,

original: yatra yatra bhagavān parinirvṛto bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yatra yatra bhagavān parinirvṛtaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: wherever the Blessed One will have passed into parinirvāṇa,

original: tatra tatra saṃprakāśayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: tatra tatra saṃprakāśayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: there we will teach this Dharma discourse.

original: arthino vayaṃ bhagavan anenaikavamudāreṇa dharmaparyāyeṇa dhāraṇāya vācanāya deśanāya saṃprakāśanāya vā likhanāya //
analyzed: arthinaḥ vayam bhagavan anena eka vam udāreṇa dharmaparyāyeṇa dhāraṇāya vācanāya deśanāya saṃprakāśanāya vā likhanāya
translated: We are eager, Blessed One, to uphold, recite, teach, explain, and write out this vast Dharma discourse.

original: atha khalu mañjuśrīpramukhāni bahūni bodhisattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi yāni asyāṃ sahāyāṃ lokadhātau vāstavyāni /
analyzed: atha khalu mañjuśrī pramukhāni bahūni bodhisattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi yāni asyām sahāyām lokadhātau vāstavyāni
translated: Then many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of bodhisattvas headed by Mañjuśrī, who dwell in this Sahā world system,

original: bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikā devanāgayakṣāgandharvāsuragarūḍakinnaramahoragamanuṣyāmanuṣyāḥ /
analyzed: bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikāḥ deva nāga yakṣā gandharva asura garūḍa kinnara mahoraga manuṣya amanuṣyāḥ
translated: and bhikṣus, bhikṣuṇīs, upāsakas, upāsikās, devas, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans,

original: bahavaśca gaṅgānadīvālikopamā bodhisattvā mahāsattvā bhagavantametadūcuḥ vayamapi bhagavan imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ saṃprakāśayiṣyāmastathāgatasya
analyzed: bahavaḥ ca gaṅgā nadī vālikā upamāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ bhagavantam etat ūcuḥ vayam api bhagavan imam dharmaparyāyam saṃprakāśayiṣyāmaḥ tathāgatasya
translated: and many bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are like the sands of the Ganges river, said to the Blessed One, We too, Blessed One, will teach this Dharma discourse when the Tathāgata has

original: parinirvṛtasya addaṣṭenātmabhāvena /
analyzed: parinirvṛtasya addaṣṭena ātmabhāvena
translated: passed into parinirvāṇa, with our own bodies visible.

original: bhagavan antarīkṣe sthitā ghoṣaṃ saṃśrāvayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: bhagavan antarīkṣe sthitāḥ ghoṣam saṃśrāvayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: Blessed One, we will proclaim the sound while remaining in the sky.

original: anavaropitakuśalamūlānāṃ ca sattvānāṃ kuśalamūlānyavaropayiṣyāmaḥ //
analyzed: an avaropita kuśala mūlānām ca sattvānām kuśala mūlāni avaropayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will plant roots of virtue for beings who have not planted roots of virtue.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāṃ teṣāṃ paurvikāṇāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām teṣām paurvikāṇām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām
translated: Then at that time the Blessed One addressed the foremost of those former bodhisattva mahāsattvas,

original: gaṇināṃ mahāgaṇināṃ gaṇācāryāṇāmekaṃ pramukhaṃ viśiṣṭacāritraṃ nāma bodhisattvaṃ
analyzed: gaṇinām mahāgaṇinām gaṇācāryāṇām ekam pramukham viśiṣṭacāritram nāma bodhisattvam
translated: the great leaders, the great leaders of great assemblies, the teachers of assemblies, the bodhisattva mahāsattva named Viśiṣṭacāritra,

original: mahāsattvaṃ mahāgaṇinaṃ gaṇācāryamāmantrayāmāsa sādhu sādhu viśiṣṭacāritra /
analyzed: mahāsattvam mahā gaṇinam gaṇa ācāryam āmantrayāmāsa sādhu sādhu viśiṣṭa cāritra
translated: the great leader, the teacher of assemblies, Excellent, excellent, Viśiṣṭacāritra!

original: evaṃ yuṣmābhiḥ karaṇīyamasya dharmaparyāyasyārthe /
analyzed: evam yuṣmābhiḥ karaṇīyam asya dharmaparyāyasya arthe
translated: You should do this for the sake of this Dharma discourse.

original: yūyaṃ tathāgatena paripācitāḥ //
analyzed: yūyam tathāgatena paripācitāḥ
translated: You have been matured by the Tathāgata.

original: atha khalu bhagavān śākyamunistathāgataḥ sa ca bhagavān prabhūtaratnastathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ parinirvṛtaḥ stūpamadhye /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ sa ca bhagavān prabhūtaratnaḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ parinirvṛtaḥ stūpa madhye
translated: Then indeed the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, and the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Prabhūtaratna, who had passed into parinirvāṇa in the middle of the stūpa,

original: siṃhāsanopaviṣṭau dvāvapi smitaṃ prāduṣkṛrutaḥ /
analyzed: siṃhāsana upaviṣṭau dvau api smitam prāduṣkṛrutaḥ
translated: both of them, while seated on the lion throne, manifested a smile.

original: mukhavivarāntarābhyāṃ ca jihvendriyaṃ nirṇāmayataḥ /
analyzed: mukha vivara antarābhyām ca jihvā indriyam nirṇāmayataḥ
translated: And from within the openings of their mouths they extended the organ of the tongue,🔽and with their two voices they uttered a cry of the Buddha, a cry of the Dharma, a cry of the Saṅgha.

original: tābhyāṃ ca jihvendriyābhyāṃ yāvad brahmalokamanuprāpnutaḥ /
analyzed: tābhyām ca jihvā indriyābhyām yāvat brahma lokam anuprāpnutaḥ
translated: And with those two tongues they reached the Brahma world.

original: tābhyāṃ ca jihvendriyābhyāṃ bahūni raśmikoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi niścaranti sma /
analyzed: tābhyām ca jihvā indriyābhyām bahūni raśmi koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi niścaranti sma
translated: And from those two tongues, many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of light rays emerged.

original: tāsu ca raśmiṣvekaikasyā raśmerbahūni bodhisattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi niśceruḥ /
analyzed: tāsu ca raśmiṣu ekaikasyāḥ raśmeḥ bahūni bodhisattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi niśceruḥ
translated: And in those light rays, from each light ray, many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of bodhisattvas emerged,

original: suvarṇavarṇāḥ kāyairdvātriṃśadbhirmahāpuruṣalakṣaṇaiḥ samanvāgatāḥ padmagarbhe siṃhāsane niṣaṇṇāḥ /
analyzed: suvarṇa varṇāḥ kāyaiḥ dvātriṃśadbhiḥ mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ samanvāgatāḥ padmagarbhe siṃhāsane niṣaṇṇāḥ
translated: with golden-colored bodies, endowed with the thirty-two marks of a great man, seated on lion thrones in the center of lotuses.

original: te ca bodhisattvā digvidikṣu lokadhātuśatasahasreṣu visṛtāḥ /
analyzed: te ca bodhisattvāḥ diś vidikṣu lokadhātu śata sahasreṣu visṛtāḥ
translated: And those bodhisattvas were sent to hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of world systems in the directions and intermediate directions.

original: sarvāsu digvidikṣvantarīkṣe sthitā dharmaṃ deśayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: sarvāsu diś vidikṣu antarīkṣe sthitāḥ dharmam deśayāmāsuḥ
translated: And in all the directions and intermediate directions, they remained in the sky and taught the Dharma.

original: yathaiva bhagavān śākyamunistathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho jihvendriyeṇa ṛddhiprātihāryaṃ
analyzed: yathā eva bhagavān śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ jihvā indriyeṇa ṛddhi prātihāryam
translated: Just as the Blessed One, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha Shakyamuni, with his tongue,

original: karoti prabhūtaratnaśca tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tathaiva te sarve tathāgatā
analyzed: karoti prabhūta ratnaḥ ca tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tathā eva te sarve tathāgatāḥ
translated: performed the miracle of spiritual power, and the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha Prabhutaratna, in the same way, all those Tathagatas,

original: arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ /
analyzed: arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: the Arhats, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddhas,

original: ye te 'nyalokadhātukoṭīnayutaśatasahasrebhyo 'bhyāgatā ratnavṛkṣamūleṣu pṛthak pṛthak siṃhāsanopaviṣṭā jihvendriyeṇa ṛddhiprātihāryaṃ kurvanti
analyzed: ye te nya lokadhātu koṭī nayuta śata sahasrebhyaḥ bhyāgatāḥ ratna vṛkṣa mūleṣu pṛthak pṛthak siṃhāsana upaviṣṭāḥ jihvā indriyeṇa ṛddhi prātihāryam kurvanti
translated: Those who had come from other world systems, hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of worlds, were seated separately on lion thrones at the foot of jeweled trees, and with their tongues they performed a miracle.

original: atha khalu bhagavān śākyamunistathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ te ca sarve tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ tamṛddhayabhisaṃskāraṃ paripūrṇaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ te ca sarve tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ tam ṛddhaya abhisaṃskāram paripūrṇam
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha Śākyamuni, and all those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Buddhas, completed that miracle

original: varśaśatasahasraṃ kṛtavantaḥ /
analyzed: varśa śata sahasram kṛtavantaḥ
translated: for a full hundred thousand years.

original: atha khalu varṣaśatasahasrasyātyayena te tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāstāni
analyzed: atha khalu varṣa śata sahasrasya atyayena te tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ tāni
translated: Then, after the passing of a hundred thousand years, those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Buddhas,

original: jihvendriyāṇi punarevopasaṃhṛtya ekasminneva kṣaṇalavamuhūrte samakālaṃ sarvairmahāsiṃhotkāsanaśabdaḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: jihvā indriyāṇi punar eva upasaṃhṛtya ekasmin eva kṣaṇa lava muhūrte sama kālam sarvaiḥ mahā siṃha utkāsana śabdaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: having withdrawn those tongues, in a single instant, a single moment, at the same time all made the sound of a great lion's roar.

original: ekaścācchaṭāsaṃghātaśabdaḥ Vaidya kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: ekaḥ ca acchaṭā saṃghāta śabdaḥ vaidya kṛtaḥ
translated: And a single sound of snapping the fingers was made.

original: tena ca mahotkāsanaśabdena mahācchaṭāsaṃghātaśabdena yāvanti daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetrakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi /
analyzed: tena ca mahā utkāsana śabdena mahā chaṭā saṃghāta śabdena yāvanti daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetra koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi
translated: By that great sound of the lion's roar and the great sound of snapping the fingers, all the hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of Buddha-fields in the ten directions

original: tāni sarvāṇyākampitānyabhūvan /
analyzed: tāni sarvāṇi ākampitāni abhūvan
translated: all shook.

original: prakampitāni saṃprakampitāni calitāni pracalitāni saṃpracalitāni vedhitāni pravedhitāni saṃpravedhitāni /
analyzed: prakampitāni saṃprakampitāni calitāni pracalitāni saṃpracalitāni vedhitāni pravedhitāni saṃpravedhitāni
translated: They were shaken, greatly shaken, trembled, greatly trembled, quaked, greatly quaked, and crashed, greatly crashed.

original: teṣu ca sarveṣu buddhakṣetreṣu yāvantaḥ sarvasattvā devanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragamanuṣyāmanuṣyāḥ /
analyzed: teṣu ca sarveṣu buddhakṣetreṣu yāvantaḥ sarva sattvāḥ deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga manuṣya amanuṣyāḥ
translated: And all the beings in all those buddha-fields, from the devas, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans,

original: te 'pi sarve buddhānubhāvena tatrasthā evamimāṃ sahāṃ lokadhātuṃ paśyanti sma /
analyzed: te pi sarve buddha anubhāvena tatrasthāḥ evam imām sahām lokadhātum paśyanti sma
translated: they too, all of them, by the power of the Buddha, while remaining there, saw this Sahā world-system.

original: tāni ca sarvatathāgatakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi ratnavṛkṣamūleṣu pṛthak pṛthak siṃhāsanopaviṣṭāni
analyzed: tāni ca sarva tathāgata koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi ratna vṛkṣa mūleṣu pṛthak pṛthak siṃhāsana upaviṣṭāni
translated: And those many quintillions of tathāgatas were seated separately on lion thrones at the foot of jeweled trees,

original: bhagavantaṃ ca śākyamuniṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ taṃ ca bhagavantaṃ
analyzed: bhagavantam ca śākyamunim tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham tam ca bhagavantam
translated: and they saw the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha Śākyamuni, and they saw the Blessed One,

original: prabhūtaratnaṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ parinirvṛtaṃ tasya mahāratnastūpasya
analyzed: prabhūtaratnam tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham parinirvṛtam tasya mahā ratna stūpasya
translated: the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha Prabhūtaratna, who had passed into parinirvāṇa,

original: madhye siṃhāsanopaviṣṭaṃ bhagavatā śākyamuninā tathāgatena sārdhaṃ niṣaṇṇāṃ tāśca
analyzed: madhye siṃhāsana upaviṣṭam bhagavatā śākyamuninā tathāgatena sārdham niṣaṇṇām tāḥ ca
translated: seated on a lion throne in the middle of that great jeweled stūpa, together with the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, and they saw

original: tisraḥ parṣadaḥ paśyanti sma /
analyzed: tisraḥ parṣadaḥ paśyanti sma
translated: those three assemblies.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca āścaryaprāptā adbhutaprāptā audbilyaprāptā abhūvan /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca āścarya prāptāḥ adbhuta prāptāḥ audbilya prāptāḥ abhūvan
translated: And having seen it, they were amazed, astonished, and overjoyed.

original: evaṃ ca antarīkṣād ghoṣamaśrauṣuḥ eṣa mārṣā aprameyāṇyasaṃkhyeyāni lokadhātukoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇyatikramya sahā nāma lokadhātuḥ /
analyzed: evam ca antarīkṣāt ghoṣam aśrauṣuḥ eṣa mārṣāḥ aprameyāṇi asaṃkhyeyāni lokadhātu koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi atikramya sahā nāma lokadhātuḥ
translated: And they heard this voice from the sky: “Friends, beyond innumerable, countless hundreds of thousands of quintillions of world systems, there is the world system called Endurance.

original: tasyāṃ śākyamunirnāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ /🔽sa etarhi saddharmapuṇḍarīkaṃ nāma dharmaparyāyaṃ sūtrāntaṃ mahāvaipulyaṃ bodhisattvāvavādaṃ sarvabuddhaparigrahaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ
analyzed: tasyām śākyamuniḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ  saḥ etarhi saddharmapuṇḍarīkam nāma dharmaparyāyam sūtrāntam mahā vaipulyam bodhisattva avavādam sarva buddha parigraham bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām
translated: In it, there is the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha called Śākyamuni.

original: saṃprakāśayati /
analyzed: saṃprakāśayati
translated: He is now teaching the Dharma discourse called The White Lotus of the Good Dharma, a sūtra that is a great extensive teaching, an instruction for bodhisattvas, which is upheld by all the buddhas, to the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: taṃ yūyamadhyāśayena anumodadhvam /
analyzed: tam yūyam adhyāśayena anumodadhvam
translated: Rejoice in that with a superior motivation.

original: taṃ ca bhagavantaṃ śākyamuniṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ taṃ ca bhagavantaṃ prabhūtaratnaṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ namaskurudhvam
analyzed: tam ca bhagavantam śākyamunim tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham tam ca bhagavantam prabhūtaratnam tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham namaskurudhvam
translated: Bow down to the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Śākyamuni, and to the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Prabhūtaratna.

original: atha khalu te sarvasattvā imamevaṃrūpamantarīkṣānnirghoṣaṃ śrutvā tatrasthā eva namo
analyzed: atha khalu te sarva sattvāḥ imam evaṃrūpam antarīkṣāt nirghoṣam śrutvā tatrasthāḥ eva
translated: ” Then all those beings, having heard this kind of voice from the sky, bowed down with their heads to the feet of their parents, and to the feet of other beings to whom they owed reverence, and they said, “We rejoice in that.”

original: bhagavate śākyamunaye tathāgatāyārhate samyaksaṃbuddhāyeti vācaṃ bhāṣante sma añjaliṃ pragṛhya /
analyzed: bhagavate śākyamunaye tathāgatāya arhate samyaksaṃbuddhāya iti vācam bhāṣante sma añjalim pragṛhya
translated: They spoke these words and extended their hands in reverential salutation to the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Śākyamuni:

original: vividhāśca puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākāvaijayantyo yeneyaṃ sahā lokadhātustena kṣipanti sma /
analyzed: vividhāḥ ca puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākā vaijayantyaḥ yena iyam sahā lokadhātuḥ tena kṣipanti sma
translated: They threw various flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, and flags in the direction of this Sahā world system.

original: nānavidhāni cābharaṇāni pindhāṇi hārārdhahāramaṇiratnānyapi kṣipanti sma /
analyzed: nānavidhāni ca ābharaṇāni pindhāṇi hāra ardhahāra maṇi ratnāni api kṣipanti sma
translated: They also threw various ornaments, necklaces, half-necklaces, and precious jewels.

original: bhagavataḥ śākyamuneḥ prabhūtaratnasya ca tathāgatasya pūjākarmaṇe /
analyzed: bhagavataḥ śākyamuneḥ prabhūtaratnasya ca tathāgatasya pūjā karmaṇe
translated: In order to make offerings to the Blessed One Śākyamuni and to the Tathāgata Prabhūtaratna,

original: asya ca saddharmapuṇḍarīkasya dharmaparyāyasya /🔽tāśca puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākāvaijayantyastāni ca hārārdhahāramaṇiratnāni kṣiptāni imāṃ sahāṃ lokadhātumāgacchanti 🔽sma /
analyzed: asya ca saddharmapuṇḍarīkasya dharmaparyāyasya  tāḥ ca puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākā vaijayantyaḥ tāni ca hāra ardhahāra maṇi ratnāni kṣiptāni imām sahām lokadhātum āgacchanti  / sma
translated: and to this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma.🔽Those flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, flags, and precious jewels were thrown and came to this Sahā world system.

original: taiśca puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākāvaijayantīrāśibhirhārārdhahārairmaṇiratnaiśca
analyzed: taiḥ ca puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākā vaijayantī rāśibhiḥ hāra ardhahāraiḥ maṇi ratnaiḥ ca
translated: With those heaps of flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, flags, and precious jewels, and with the necklaces and half-necklaces, and with the precious jewels,

original: asyāṃ sahāyāṃ lokadhātau sārdhaṃ tairanyarlokadhātukoṭīnayutaśatasahasrairekībhūtairye
analyzed: asyām sahāyām lokadhātau sārdham taiḥ anyar lokadhātu koṭī nayuta śata sahasraiḥ ekībhūtaiḥ ye
translated: In this Sahā world realm, together with those other hundreds of thousands of quintillions of world realms,

original: teṣu tathāgatāḥ saṃniṣaṇṇāḥ /
analyzed: teṣu tathāgatāḥ saṃniṣaṇṇāḥ
translated: the thus-gone ones who were seated in those realms,

original: teṣu sarveṣu vaihāyase 'ntarīkṣe samantānmahāpuṣpavitānaṃ parisaṃsthitamabhūt //
analyzed: teṣu sarveṣu vaihāyase ntarīkṣe samantāt mahā puṣpa vitānam parisaṃsthitam abhūt
translated: in all those places, a great canopy of flowers was suspended in the sky all around.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstān viśiṣṭacāritrapramukhān bodhisattvān mahāsattvānāmantrayāmāsa acintyaprabhāvāḥ kulaputrāstathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tān viśiṣṭa cāritra pramukhān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān āmantrayāmāsa acintya prabhāvāḥ kula putrāḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed those bodhisattva mahāsattvas headed by Viśiṣṭa-cāritra, saying, Sons of noble family, the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas have inconceivable power.

original: bahūnyapyahaṃ kulaputrāḥ kalpakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi asya dharmaparyāyasya parīndanārthaṃ nānādharmapramukhairbahūnānuśaṃsān bhāṣeyam /
analyzed: bahūni api aham kula putrāḥ kalpa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi asya dharmaparyāyasya parīndana artham nānā dharma pramukhaiḥ bahūn ānuśaṃsān bhāṣeyam
translated: Sons of noble family, for many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of eons, I could speak with various Dharma teachings about the many benefits of this Dharma discourse.

original: na cāhaṃ guṇānāṃ pāraṃ gaccheyamasya dharmaparyāyasya bhāṣamāṇaḥ /
analyzed: na ca aham guṇānām pāram gaccheyam asya dharmaparyāyasya bhāṣamāṇaḥ
translated: But even if I spoke about the qualities of this Dharma discourse, I would not reach the end.

original: saṃkṣepeṇa kulaputrāḥ sarvabuddhavṛṣabhitā sarvabuddharahasyaṃ sarvabuddhagambhīrasthānaṃ mayā asmin dharmaparyāye deśitam /
analyzed: saṃkṣepeṇa kula putrāḥ sarva buddha vṛṣabhi tā sarva buddha rahasyam sarva buddha gambhīra sthānam mayā asmin dharmaparyāye deśitam
translated: Sons of noble family, in brief, I have taught in this Dharma discourse all the supremacy of the buddhas, all the secrets of the buddhas, and all the profound points of the buddhas.

original: tasmāttarhi kulaputrā yuṣmābhistathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya satkṛtya ayaṃ dharmaparyāyo dhārayitavyo deśayitavyo likhitavyo vācayitavyaḥ prakāśayitavyo
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi kula putrāḥ yuṣmābhiḥ tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya satkṛtya ayam dharmaparyāyaḥ dhārayitavyaḥ deśayitavyaḥ likhitavyaḥ vācayitavyaḥ prakāśayitavyaḥ
translated: Therefore, sons of good family, you should respectfully uphold, teach, write, recite, explain,

original: bhāvayitavyaḥ pūjayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: bhāvayitavyaḥ pūjayitavyaḥ
translated: contemplate, and make offerings to this Dharma discourse of the Tathāgata after his parinirvāṇa.

original: Vaidya yasmiṃśca kulaputrāḥ pṛthivīpradeśe ayaṃ dharmaparyāyo vācyeta vā prakāśyeta
analyzed: vaidya yasmin ca kula putrāḥ pṛthivī pradeśe ayam dharmaparyāyaḥ vācyeta vā prakāśyeta
translated: Sons of good family, in whatever place this Dharma discourse is spoken, explained,

original: vā deśyeta vā likhyeta vā cintyeta vā bhāṣyeta vā svādhyāyeta vā pustakagato vā tiṣṭhat
analyzed: vā deśyeta vā likhyeta vā cintyeta vā bhāṣyeta vā su ādhyāyeta vā pustaka gataḥ vā tiṣṭhat
translated: taught, written, contemplated, or recited, whether in a book,

original: ārāme vā vihāre vā gṛhe vā vane vā nagare vā vṛkṣamūle vā prāsāde vā layane vā guhāyāṃ vā /
analyzed: ārāme vā vihāre vā gṛhe vā vane vā nagare vā vṛkṣa mūle vā prāsāde vā layane vā guhāyām vā
translated: in a monastery, a temple, a house, a forest, a city, at the foot of a tree, in a palace, a hut, or a cave,

original: tasmin pṛthivīpradeśe tathāgatamudiśya caityaṃ kartavyam /
analyzed: tasmin pṛthivī pradeśe tathāgatam udiśya caityam kartavyam
translated: in that place a caitya should be made with the Tathāgata in mind.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /🔽sarvatathāgatānāṃ hi sa pṛthivīpradeśo bodhimaṇḍo veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ  sarva tathāgatānām hi sa pṛthivī pradeśaḥ bodhimaṇḍaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?🔽That place should be known as the seat of enlightenment of all the Tathāgatas.

original: tasmiṃśca pṛthivīpradeśe sarvatathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhā iti veditavyam /
analyzed: tasmin ca pṛthivī pradeśe sarva tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhāḥ iti veditavyam
translated: And in that place, all the Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones should be known as having attained the highest complete enlightenment.

original: tasmiṃśca pṛthivīpradeśe sarvatathāgatairdharmacakraṃ pravartitam /
analyzed: tasmin ca pṛthivī pradeśe sarva tathāgataiḥ dharmacakram pravartitam
translated: And in that place, all the Tathagatas have turned the wheel of Dharma.

original: tasmiṃścapṛthivīpradeśe sarvatathāgatāḥ parinirvṛtā iti veditavyam //
analyzed: tasmin ca pṛthivī pradeśe sarva tathāgatāḥ parinirvṛtāḥ iti veditavyam
translated: And in that place, all the Tathagatas have attained Parinirvana.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses at that time:

original: acintiyā lokahitāna dharmatā abhijñajñānasmi pratiṣṭhitānām /
analyzed: dharmatā pratiṣṭhitānām
translated: The inconceivable nature of the Dharma of those who benefit the world, established in the knowledge of supernormal abilities,

original: ye ṛddhi darśenti anantacakṣuṣaḥ prāmodyahetoriha sarvadehinām // / //
analyzed: ye ananta cakṣuṣaḥ prāmodya hetoḥ iha sarva dehinām
translated: They display miracles with their infinite eyes, for the sake of delighting all embodied beings here.

original: jihvendriyaṃ prāpiya brahmalokaṃ raśmīsahasrāṇi pramuñcamānāḥ /
analyzed: jihvā indriyam brahma lokam raśmī sahasrāṇi pramuñcamānāḥ
translated: Having extended their tongue sense-faculty to the Brahma world, emitting thousands of light rays,

original: āścaryabhūtā iha ṛddhidarśitāḥ te sarvi ye prasthita agrabodhau // / //
analyzed: āścarya bhūtāḥ iha ṛddhi darśitāḥ te sarvi ye prasthita agra bodhau
translated: The miracles they display here are astonishing. All of them who have set out for supreme enlightenment.

original: utkāsitaṃ cāpi karonti buddhā ekācchaṭā ye ca karonti śabdam /
analyzed: utkāsitam ca api karonti buddhāḥ eka acchaṭāḥ ye ca karonti śabdam
translated: The Buddhas also make a sound by clearing their throats, and the sound they make with a single finger snap,

original: te vijñapentī imu sarvalokaṃ daśo diśāyāṃ ima lokadhātum // / //
analyzed: te vijñapentī sarva lokam daśa u diśāyām lokadhātum
translated: They make this known to the entire world, to this world-system in the ten directions.

original: etāni cānyāni ca prātihāryā guṇānnidarśenti hitānukampakāḥ /
analyzed: etāni ca anyāni ca prātihāryāḥ guṇān nidarśenti hita anukampakāḥ
translated: And these and other miracles, the benefactors and compassionate ones demonstrate their qualities,

original: kathaṃ nu te harṣita tasmi kāle dhāreyu sūtraṃ sugatasya nirvṛte // / //
analyzed: katham nu te harṣita tasmin kāle dhāreyuḥ sūtram sugatasya nirvṛte
translated: How will they delight in that time, upholding the sūtra of the Sugata when he has passed into Nirvāṇa?

original: bahū pi kalpāna sahasrakoṭyo vadeya varṇaṃ sugatātmajānām /
analyzed: sahasra koṭyaḥ vadeya varṇam sugata ātmajānām
translated: Even if I were to speak for many thousands of koṭis of kalpas about the qualities of the sons of the Sugata,

original: ye dhārayiṣyantima sūtramagraṃ parinirvṛte lokavināyakasmin // / //
analyzed: ye sūtram agram parinirvṛte loka vināyakasmin
translated: who will uphold this supreme sūtra when the world's guide has attained final Nirvāṇa,

original: na teṣa paryanta bhavedguṇānāṃ ākāśadhātau hi yathā diśāsu /
analyzed: na bhavet guṇānām ākāśa dhātau hi yathā diśāsu
translated: there would be no end to their qualities, just as there is no end to the directions in the realm of space.

original: acintiyā teṣā guṇā bhavanti ye sūtra dhārenti idaṃ śubhaṃ sadā // / //
analyzed: teṣā guṇāḥ bhavanti ye sūtra dhārenti idam śubham sadā
translated: Those who always uphold this auspicious sūtra will have inconceivable qualities.

original: dṛṣṭo ahaṃ sarva ime ca nāyakā ayaṃ ca yo nirvṛtu lokanāyakaḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭaḥ aham sarve ime ca nāyakāḥ ayam ca yaḥ loka nāyakaḥ
translated: I have seen all these guides, and this world-leader who has attained Nirvāṇa,

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: the physician

original: ime ca sarve bahubodhisattvāḥ parṣāśca catvāri anena dṛṣṭāḥ // / //
analyzed: ime ca sarve bahu bodhisattvāḥ parṣāḥ ca catvāri anena dṛṣṭāḥ
translated: and all these many bodhisattvas, and the four assemblies have been seen by him.

original: ahaṃ ca ārāgitu tenihādya ime ca ārāgita sarvi nāyakāḥ /
analyzed: aham ca ime ca nāyakāḥ
translated: I have pleased him here today, and all these guides,

original: ayaṃ ca yo nirvṛtako jinendro ye cāpi anye daśasū diśāsu // / //
analyzed: ayam ca yaḥ nirvṛtakaḥ jinendraḥ ye ca api anye diśāsu
translated: and this lord of jinas who has attained Nirvāṇa, and those in the ten directions as well.

original: anāgatātīta tathā ca buddhāḥ tiṣṭhanti ye cāpi daśasu ddiśāsu /
analyzed: anāgata atīta tathā ca buddhāḥ tiṣṭhanti ye ca api daśasu ddiśāsu
translated: The buddhas of the future and the past, and those who abide in the ten directions,

original: te sarvi dṛṣṭāśca supūjitāśca bhaveyu yo dhārayi sūtrametat // / //
analyzed: te dṛṣṭāḥ ca su pūjitāḥ ca bhaveyu yaḥ sūtram etat
translated: And all of them would be seen and well-worshipped by one who upholds this sūtra.

original: rahasyajñānaṃ puruṣottamānāṃ yaṃ bodhimaṇḍasmi vicintitāsīt /
analyzed: rahasya jñānam puruṣa uttamānām yam vicintitā āsīt
translated: The secret knowledge of the supreme beings, which was contemplated at the Bodhi tree,

original: anucintayetso pi tu kṣiprameva yo dhārayet sūtrimu bhūtadharmam // / //
analyzed: anucintayet saḥ tu kṣipram eva yaḥ dhārayet bhūta dharmam
translated: That one will quickly contemplate as well, who upholds this sūtra of true Dharma.

original: pratibhānu tasyāpi bhavedanantaṃ yathāpi vāyurna kahiṃci sajjati /
analyzed: pratibhānu tasya api bhavet anantam yathā api vāyuḥ na kahiṃci sajjati
translated: His eloquence will also be endless, just as the wind is not obstructed anywhere.

original: dharme 'pi cārthe ca nirukti jānati yo dhārayet sutramidaṃ viśiṣṭam // / //
analyzed: dharme ca arthe ca nirukti jānati yaḥ dhārayet sutram idam viśiṣṭam
translated: He knows the meaning and the expression of the Dharma, who upholds this distinguished sūtra.

original: anusaṃdhisūtrāṇa sadā prajānati saṃdhāya yaṃ bhāṣitu nāyakehi /
analyzed: sadā prajānati saṃdhāya yam
translated: He always understands the connecting sūtras, which were taught with intention by the guides.

original: parinirvṛtasyāpi vināyakasya sūtrāṇa so jānati bhutamartham // / //
analyzed: parinirvṛtasya api vināyakasya saḥ jānati bhutam artham
translated: Even after the guide has attained final nirvāṇa, he understands the true meaning of the sūtras.

original: candropamaḥ sūryasamaḥ sa bhāti ālokapradyotakaraḥ sa bhoti /
analyzed: candra upamaḥ sūrya samaḥ sa bhāti āloka pradyota karaḥ sa
translated: He shines like the moon and the sun, he becomes a giver of light and illumination.

original: vicarantu so medini tena tena samādapetī bahubodhisattvān // / //
analyzed: vicarantu saḥ medini tena tena bahu bodhisattvān
translated: Wandering here and there on the earth, he inspires many bodhisattvas.

original: tasmāddhi ye paṇḍita bodhisattvāḥ śrutvānimānīddaśa ānuśaṃsān /
analyzed: tasmāt hi ye paṇḍita bodhisattvāḥ
translated: Therefore, those wise bodhisattvas, having heard these ten benefits,

original: dhāreyu sūtraṃ mama nirvṛtasya na teṣa bodhāya bhaveta saṃśayaḥ // / //
analyzed: dhāreyu sūtram mama nirvṛtasya na teṣa bodhāya bhaveta saṃśayaḥ
translated: They will uphold this sūtra after my nirvāṇa, And will have no doubt about attaining enlightenment.”

original: iti śrīsaddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye tathāgataddharyabhisaṃskāraparivarto nāma viṃśatitamaḥ //
analyzed: iti śrī saddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye tathāgataddharyabhisaṃskāraparivartaḥ nāma viṃśatitamaḥ
translated: Thus concludes “The Chapter on the Tathāgata’s Supernormal Knowledge,” the twentieth chapter of the Dharma teaching of “The White Lotus of the Good Dharma.”

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: dhāraṇīparivartaḥ /
analyzed: dhāraṇī parivartaḥ
translated: The Chapter on the Dhāraṇī

original: atha khalu bhaiṣajyarājo bodhisattvo mahāsattva utthāyāsanādekāṃsamuttarāsaṅgaṃ kṛtvā
analyzed: atha khalu bhaiṣajyarājaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ utthāya āsanāt eka aṃsam uttarāsaṅgam kṛtvā
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajyarāja rose from his seat, removed his upper robe from one shoulder,

original: dakṣiṇaṃ jānumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavāṃstenāñjaliṃ praṇamya bhagavantametadavocat
analyzed: dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamya bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: placed his right knee on the ground, bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined, and said to the Blessed One:

original: kiyad bhagavan sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā puṇyaṃ prasavet /
analyzed: kiyat bhagavan sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā puṇyam prasavet
translated: Blessed One, how much merit will a son or daughter of good family generate

original: ya imaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīkaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ dhārayet /
analyzed: yaḥ imam saddharmapuṇḍarīkam dharmaparyāyam dhārayet
translated: if they uphold this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma,

original: kāyagataṃ vā pustakagataṃ vā kṛtvā /
analyzed: kāya gatam vā pustaka gatam vā kṛtvā
translated: whether they keep it in their body or in a book?

analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān bhaiṣajyarājam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat  yaḥ kaścid
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajyarāja: Bhaiṣajyarāja, whoever
