original: satkuryād gurukuryānmānayet pūjayet /
analyzed: satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet
translated: Bhaiṣajyarāja, suppose a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family were to honor, venerate, respect, and make offerings to eighty koṭis of nayutas of hundreds of thousands of tathāgatas equal to the number of grains of sand in eighty Ganges Rivers, for eons equal in number to the grains of sand in eighty Ganges Rivers.

original: takiṃ manyase bhaiṣajyarāja kiyatkulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tatonidānaṃ bahu puṇyaṃ prasavet /
analyzed: takim manyase bhaiṣajya rāja kiyat kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tatonidānam bahu puṇyam prasavet
translated: What do you think, Bhaiṣajyarāja? Would that son of a good family or daughter of a good family generate a lot of merit on that basis?

original: bhaiṣajyarājo bodhisattvo mahāsattva āha bahu bhagavan /🔽bahu sugata /🔽bhagavānāha ārocayāmi te bhaiṣajyarāja /🔽prativedayāmi /
analyzed: bhaiṣajyarājaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ āha bahu bhagavan  bahu sugata  bhagavān āha ārocayāmi te bhaiṣajya rāja  prativedayāmi
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajyarāja said, A lot, Bhagavān! A lot, Sugata!

original: yaḥ kaścid bhaiṣajyarāja kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā asmāt saddharmapuṇḍarīkāddharmaparyāyādantaśa ekāmapi catuṣpadīgāthāṃ dhārayet /
analyzed: yaḥ kaścid bhaiṣajya rāja kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā asmāt saddharmapuṇḍarīkāt dharmaparyāyāt antaśas ekām api catuṣpadī gāthām dhārayet
translated: The Bhagavān said, Bhaiṣajyarāja, I declare to you, I proclaim to you, Bhaiṣajyarāja, that any son of a good family or daughter of a good family who from this Dharma discourse, The White Lotus of the Good Dharma, were to take up even just one four-line verse,

original: vācayet /🔽paryavāpnuyāt /
analyzed: vācayet  paryavāpnuyāt
translated: were to recite it,🔽were to master it,

original: pratipattyā ca saṃpādayet /
analyzed: pratipattyā ca saṃpādayet
translated: and were to practice it,

original: ataḥ sa bhaiṣajyarāja kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tatonidānaṃ bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavet //
analyzed: atas sa bhaiṣajya rāja kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tatonidānam bahutaram puṇyam prasavet
translated: on that basis, Bhaiṣajyarāja, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family would generate even more merit than that.

original: atha khalu bhaiṣajyarājo bodhisattvo mahāsattvastasyāṃ velāyāṃ bhagavantametadavocat
analyzed: atha khalu bhaiṣajyarājaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tasyām velāyām bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajyarāja said to the Blessed One at that time:

original: dāsyāmo vayaṃ bhagavaṃsteṣāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṛṇāṃ vā yeṣāmayaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīko🔽dharmaparyāyaḥ kāyagato vā syāt /
analyzed: dāsyāmaḥ vayam bhagavan teṣām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṛṇām vā yeṣām ayam saddharmapuṇḍarīkaḥ  dharmaparyāyaḥ kāya gataḥ vā syāt
translated: Blessed One, we will give to those sons or daughters of good family who have this Dharma discourse of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma

original: pustakagato vā /
analyzed: pustaka gataḥ vā
translated: either on their body or in a book

original: rakṣāvaraṇaguptaye dhāraṇīmantrapadāni / tadyathā
analyzed: rakṣā āvaraṇa guptaye dhāraṇī mantra padāni tat yathā
translated: the dhāraṇī-mantra words for the sake of protection, guarding, and secrecy. They are:

original: anye manye mane mamane citte carite same samitā viśānte mukte muktatame same aviṣame
analyzed: anye manye mane mamane citte carite same samitāḥ viśānte mukte muktatame same aviṣame
translated: anyemanye manemane mamane citte carite same samete viśānte mukte muktatame same aviṣame

original: samasame jaye kṣaye akṣaye akṣiṇe śānte samite dhāraṇi ālokabhāṣe pratyavekṣaṇi nidhiru
analyzed: samasame jaye kṣaye akṣaye akṣiṇe śānte samite dhāraṇi āloka bhāṣe pratyavekṣaṇi
translated: sama-same jayekṣaye akṣaye akṣiṇe śānte samite dhāraṇī ālokabhāṣe pratyavekṣaṇi nidhirū

original: abhyantaraniviṣṭe abhyantarapāriśuddhimutkule araḍe paraḍe sukāṅkṣi asamasame buddhavilokite
analyzed: abhyantara niviṣṭe abhyantara pāriśuddhim utkule araḍe paraḍe sukāṅkṣi asamasame buddha vilokite
translated: abhyantaraniviṣṭe abhyantarapāriśuddhimukule arāḍe parāḍe sukākṣi asamasa-me buddhavilokite

original: dharmaparīkṣite saṃghanirghoṣaṇi nirghoṇi bhayābhayaviśodhani mantre mantrākṣayate
analyzed: dharma parīkṣite saṃgha nirghoṣaṇi nirghoṇi bhaya abhaya viśodhani mantre
translated: dharmapārikṣite saṃghanirghūṣaṇi nirghūṇi bhayābhaya-viśodhani mantre mantrakṣayate

original: rute rutakauśalye akṣaye akṣayavanatāye vakkule valoḍra amanyanatāye svāhā //
analyzed: rute ruta kauśalye akṣaye akṣayavanatāye vakkule valoḍre a manyanatāye svāhā
translated: rute rutakauśalye akṣaye akṣayavanatāye vakkule valodre amanyanatāye svāhā.

original: imāni bhagavan mantradhāraṇīpadāni dvāṣaṣṭibhirgaṅgānadīvālikāsamairbuddhairbhagavadbhirbhāṣitāni /
analyzed: imāni bhagavat mantradhāraṇī padāni dvāṣaṣṭibhiḥ gaṅgā nadī vālikā samaiḥ buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ bhāṣitāni
translated: Bhagavān, these dhāraṇī-mantra words have been spoken by Buddhas, Blessed Ones, as numerous as the grains of sand in sixty Ganges Rivers.

original: te sarve buddhā bhagavantastena drugdhāḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: te sarve buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tena drugdhāḥ syuḥ
translated: All those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, would be deceived by him.

original: ya evaṃrupān dharmabhāṇakānevaṃrūpān sūtrāntadhārakānatikrāmet //
analyzed: yaḥ evaṃrupān dharma bhāṇakān evaṃrūpān sūtrānta dhārakān atikrāmet
translated: Whoever would transgress such Dharma teachers and holders of such sūtras in this way.

original: atha khalu bhagavān bhaiṣajyarājāya bodhisattvāya mahāsattvāya sādhukāramadāt sādhu sādhu bhaiṣajyarāja /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān bhaiṣajyarājāya bodhisattvāya mahāsattvāya sādhukāram adāt sādhu sādhu bhaiṣajyarāja
translated: Then the Blessed One gave his approval to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajyarāja, saying, Excellent, excellent, Bhaiṣajyarāja!

original: sattvānāmarthaḥ kṛtaḥ /🔽dhāraṇīpadāni bhāṣitāni sattvānāmanukampāmupādaya /
analyzed: sattvānām arthaḥ kṛtaḥ  dhāraṇī padāni bhāṣitāni sattvānām anukampām upādaya
translated: You have done this for the sake of beings.🔽Out of compassion for beings, you have spoken the dhāraṇī words.

original: rakṣāvaraṇaguptiḥ kṛtā //
analyzed: rakṣā āvaraṇa guptiḥ kṛtā
translated: You have provided protection, security, and safety.

original: atha khalu pradānaśūro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavantametadavocat ahamapi bhagavan evaṃrūpāṇāṃ dharmabhāṇakānāmarthāya dhāraṇīpadāni dāsyāmi /
analyzed: atha khalu pradānaśūraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat aham api bhagavan evaṃrūpāṇām dharma bhāṇakānām arthāya dhāraṇī padāni dāsyāmi
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Pradānaśūra said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, I too will give dhāraṇī words for the sake of such Dharma teachers.

original: yatteṣāmevaṃrūpāṇāṃ dharmabhāṇakānāṃ na kaścidavatāraprekṣī avatāragaveṣī avatāraṃ lapsyate /
analyzed: yat teṣām evaṃrūpāṇām dharma bhāṇakānām na kaścid avatāra prekṣī avatāra gaveṣī avatāram lapsyate
translated: So that no one who seeks an opportunity and looks for an opportunity to harm such Dharma teachers will find an opportunity.

original: tadyathā yakṣo vā rākṣaso vā pūtano vā kṛtyo vā kumbhāṇḍo vā preto vā avatāraprekṣī avatāragaveṣī avatāraṃ na lapsyata iti //
analyzed: tat yathā yakṣaḥ vā rākṣasaḥ vā pūtanaḥ vā kṛtyaḥ vā kumbhāṇḍaḥ vā pretaḥ vā avatāra prekṣī avatāra gaveṣī avatāram na lapsyate iti
translated: Just as a yakṣa, rākṣasa, pūtana, kṛtya, kumbhāṇḍa, or hungry ghost, looking for an opportunity, searching for an opportunity, will not find an opportunity.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: atha khalu pradānaśūro bodhisattvo mahāsattvastasyāṃ velāyāmimāni dhāraṇīmantrapadāni bhāṣate sma / tadyathā
analyzed: atha khalu pradānaśūraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tasyām velāyām imāni dhāraṇī mantra padāni bhāṣate sma tat yathā
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Pradānaśūra at that time spoke these dhāraṇī-mantra words: Tadyathā

original: jvale mahājvale ukke tukke mukke aḍe aḍāvati nṛtye nṛtyāvati iṭṭini viṭṭini ciṭṭini nṛtyani nṛtyāvati svāhā //
analyzed: jvale mahājvale ukke tukke mukke aḍe aḍāvati nṛtye nṛtyāvati iṭṭini viṭṭini ciṭṭini nṛtyani nṛtyāvati svāhā
translated: Jvale mahā-jvale ukke tukke mukke ade aḍāvati nṛtye nṛtyāvati iṭṭini viṭṭini ciṭṭini nṛtyani nṛtyāvati svāhā.

original: imāni bhagavan dhāraṇīpadāni gaṅgānadīvālikāsamaistathāgatairarhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhairbhāṣitāni /
analyzed: imāni bhagavan dhāraṇī padāni gaṅgā nadī vālikā samaiḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ bhāṣitāni
translated: These dhāraṇī verses, Blessed One, have been spoken by tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River.

original: anumoditāni ca /
analyzed: anumoditāni ca
translated: And they have been approved.

original: te sarve tathāgatāstena drugdhāḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: te sarve tathāgatāḥ tena drugdhāḥ syuḥ
translated: All those tathāgatas would be deceived by him

original: yastānevaṃrūpān dharmabhāṇakānatikrameta //
analyzed: yaḥ tān evaṃrūpān dharma bhāṇakān atikrameta
translated: who would transgress such dharma teachers.

original: atha khalu vaiśravaṇo mahārājo bhagavantametadavocat ahamapi bhagavan dhāraṇīpadāni bhāṣiṣye teṣāṃ dharmabhāṇakānāṃ hitāya sukhāya anukampāyai
analyzed: atha khalu vaiśravaṇaḥ mahā rājaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat aham api bhagavan dhāraṇī padāni bhāṣiṣye teṣām dharma bhāṇakānām hitāya sukhāya anukampāyai  /
translated: Then the great king Vaiśravaṇa said this to the Blessed One: I too, Blessed One, will speak the dhāraṇī verses for the benefit, happiness, and compassion of those dharma teachers.

original: rakṣāvaraṇaguptaye // tadyathā
analyzed: rakṣā āvaraṇa guptaye tat yathā
translated: For the sake of protection, defense, and concealment. Namely:

original: aṭṭe taṭṭe naṭṭe vanaṭṭe anaḍe nāḍi kunaḍi svāhā //
analyzed: aṭṭe taṭṭe naṭṭe vanaṭṭe anaḍe nāḍi kunaḍi svāhā
translated: Aṭṭe taṭṭe naṭṭe vanaṭṭe anaḍe nāḍi kuṇḍi svāhā.

original: ebhirbhagavan dhāraṇīpadaisteṣāṃ dharmabhāṇakānāṃ pudgalānāṃ rakṣāṃ karomi /
analyzed: ebhiḥ bhagavan dhāraṇī padaiḥ teṣām dharma bhāṇakānām pudgalānām rakṣām karomi
translated: With these dhāraṇī verses, Blessed One, I offer protection to those dharma teachers and individuals.

original: yojanaśatāccāhaṃ teṣāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṛṇāṃ ca evaṃrūpāṇāṃ sūtrāntadhārakāṇāṃ rakṣā kṛtā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yojana śatāt ca aham teṣām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṛṇām ca evaṃrūpāṇām sūtrānta dhārakāṇām rakṣā kṛtā bhaviṣyati
translated: I will offer protection to those sons and daughters of good family who possess such sūtras as these, even from a hundred leagues away.

original: svastyayanaṃ kṛtaṃ bhaviṣyati //🔽atha khalu virūḍhako mahārājo tasyāmeva parṣadi saṃnipatito 'bhūt saṃniṣaṇṇaśca kumbhāṇḍakoṭīnayutaśatasahasraiḥ parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ /
analyzed: svastyayanam kṛtam bhaviṣyati  atha khalu virūḍhakaḥ mahā rājaḥ tasyām eva parṣadi saṃnipatitaḥ bhūt saṃniṣaṇṇaḥ ca kumbhāṇḍa koṭī nayuta śata sahasraiḥ parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ
translated: I will offer them safety and well-being.

original: sa utthāyāsanādekāṃsamuttarāsaṅgaṃ kṛtvā yena bhagavāṃstenāñjaliṃ praṇāmya bhagavantametadavocat ahamapi bhagavan dhāraṇīpadāni bhāṣiṣye
analyzed: saḥ utthāya āsanāt eka aṃsam uttarāsaṅgam kṛtvā yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇāmya bhagavantam etat avocat aham api bhagavan dhāraṇī padāni bhāṣiṣye
translated: Then the great king Virūḍhaka, who was present in that very assembly, seated among hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of kumbhāṇḍas, surrounded and revered by them, rose from his seat, arranged his upper robe over one shoulder, placed his right knee on the ground, bowed to the Blessed One with folded hands, and said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, I too will speak the dhāraṇī verses

original: teṣāṃ ca tathārūpāṇāṃ dharmabhāṇakānāmevaṃrūpāṇāṃ sūtrāntadhārakāṇāṃ rakṣāvaraṇaguptaye dhāraṇīmantrapadāni / tadyathā
analyzed: teṣām ca tathārūpāṇām dharma bhāṇakānām evaṃrūpāṇām sūtrānta dhārakāṇām rakṣā āvaraṇa guptaye dhāraṇī mantra padāni tat yathā
translated: for the protection, defense, and concealment of those dharma teachers and those who possess such sūtras.

original: agaṇe gaṇe gauri gandhāri caṇḍāli mātaṅgi pukkasi saṃkule vrūsali sisi svāhā //
analyzed: agaṇe gaṇe gauri gandhāri caṇḍāli mātaṅgi pukkasi saṃkule vrūsali sisi svāhā
translated: agane gaṇe gaurī gandhāri cāṇḍāli mātaṅgi puṅkhasi saṃkule vrusali sisis svāhā.

original: imāni tāni bhagavan dhāraṇīmantrapadāni /
analyzed: imāni tāni bhagavan dhāraṇī mantra padāni
translated: These, Blessed One, are the dhāraṇī-mantra words,

original: yāni dvācatvāriṃśadbhirbuddhakoṭībhirbhāṣitāni /
analyzed: yāni dvācatvāriṃśadbhiḥ buddha koṭībhiḥ bhāṣitāni
translated: which were spoken by forty-two koṭis of Buddhas.

original: te sarve tena drugdhāḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: te sarve tena drugdhāḥ syuḥ
translated: All of them would be deceived by him,

original: yastānevaṃrūpān dharmabhāṇakānatikrameta //
analyzed: yaḥ tān evaṃrūpān dharma bhāṇakān atikrameta
translated: who would transgress such Dharma teachers.

original: atha khalu lambā ca nāma rākṣasī vilambā ca nāma rākṣasī kūṭadantī ca nāma rākṣasī
analyzed: atha khalu lambā ca nāma rākṣasī vilambā ca nāma rākṣasī kūṭadantī ca nāma rākṣasī
translated: Then, the rākṣasī named Lambā, the rākṣasī named Vilombā, the rākṣasī named Kūṭadantī,

original: puṣpadantī ca nāma rākṣasī makuṭadantī ca nāma rākṣasī keśinī ca nāma rākṣasī acalā
analyzed: puṣpadantī ca nāma rākṣasī makuṭadantī ca nāma rākṣasī keśinī ca nāma rākṣasī acalā
translated: the rākṣasī named Puṣpadantī, the rākṣasī named Makutadantī, the rākṣasī named Keśinī, the rākṣasī named Acalā,

original: ca nāma rākṣasī mālādhārī ca nāma rākṣasī kuntī ca nāma rākṣasī sarvasattvojohārī
analyzed: ca nāma rākṣasī mālādhārī ca nāma rākṣasī kuntī ca nāma rākṣasī sarva sattva ojaḥ hārī
translated: the rākṣasī named Mālādhāriṇī, the rākṣasī named Kuntī, the rākṣasī named Sarvasattvaudārikāhārī,

original: ca nāma rākṣasī hḥrītī ca nḥma rḥkṣasī saputraparivḥrḥ etḥḥ sarvḥ rḥkṣasyo yena bhagavḥṃstenopasaṃkrḥntḥḥ /
analyzed: ca nāma rākṣasī ca nḥma rḥkṣasī sa putra parivṛḥ sarvḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥḥ
translated: the rākṣasī named Hrīṭī, together with her sons and retinue - all these rākṣasīs approached the Blessed One.

original: upasaṃkramya sarvḥstḥ rḥkṣasya ekasvareṇa bhagavantametadavocan vayamapi bhagavaṃsteṣḥmevaṃrūpḥṇḥṃ sūtrḥntadhḥrakḥṇḥṃ dharmabhḥṇakḥnḥṃ rakṣḥvaraṇaguptiṃ🔽svastyayanaṃ ca kariṣyḥmaḥ /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya eka svareṇa bhagavantam etat avocan vayam api bhagavan teṣām evaṃrūpṇḥm sūtrḥnta dhḥrakḥṇḥm dharma bhḥṇakḥnḥm rakṣḥ varaṇa guptim  svastyayanam ca kariṣyḥmaḥ
translated: safeguard, and safety for those who uphold such sūtras, who are expounders of the Dharma.

original: yathḥ teṣḥṃ dharmabhḥṇakḥnḥṃ na kaścidavatḥraprekṣī avatḥragaveṣī avatḥraṃ lapsyatīti //
analyzed: yathḥ na kaścid avatḥra prekṣī avatḥra gaveṣī avatḥram lapsyati iti
translated: So that no one who seeks to harm, who seeks to find an opportunity to harm, will find an opportunity to harm those expounders of the Dharma.

original: atha khalu tāḥ sarvā rākṣasya ekasvareṇa samaṃ saṃgītyā bhagavata imāni dhāraṇīmantrapadāni prayacchanti sma /
analyzed: atha khalu tāḥ sarvāḥ rākṣasyaḥ eka svareṇa samam saṃgītyā bhagavataḥ imāni dhāraṇī mantra padāni prayacchanti sma
translated: Then all those rākṣasīs, in one voice, with a single intention, offered these dhāraṇī-mantra words to the Blessed One.🔽Namely:

original: tadyathā Vaidya
analyzed: tat yathā vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: iti me iti me iti me iti me iti me /
analyzed: iti me iti me iti me iti me iti me
translated: Ime ime ime ime ime ime.

original: nime nime nime nime nime /
analyzed: nime nime nime nime
translated: Nime nime nime nime nime.

original: ruhe ruhe ruhe ruhe ruhe /
analyzed: ruhe ruhe ruhe ruhe
translated: Ruhe ruhe ruhe ruhe ruhe.

original: stuhe stuhe stuhe stuhe stuhe svāhā //
analyzed: stuhe stuhe stuhe stuhe svāhā
translated: Stuhe stuhe stuhe stuhe stuhe svāhā.

original: imaṃ śīrṣaṃ samāruhya mā kaścid drohī bhavatu dharmabhāṇakānāṃ yakṣo vā rākṣaso vā
analyzed: imam śīrṣam samāruhya mā kaścid drohī bhavatu dharma bhāṇakānām yakṣaḥ vā rākṣasaḥ vā
translated: Having mounted this head, may no one be a harm-doer to the expounders of the Dharma, whether a yakṣa, rākṣasa,

original: preto vā piśāco vā pūtano vā kṛtyo va vetālo vā kumbhāṇḍo vā stabdho vā omārako vā
analyzed: pretaḥ vā piśācaḥ vā pūtanaḥ vā kṛtyaḥ vā vetālaḥ vā kumbhāṇḍaḥ vā stabdhaḥ vā omārakaḥ vā
translated: preta, piśāca, pūtana, kṛtya, vetāla, kumbhāṇḍa, stabdha, or ōmaraka.

original: ostārako vā apasmārako vā yakṣakṛtyo vā amanuṣyakṛtyo vā manuṣyakṛtyo vā ekāhiko
analyzed: ostārakaḥ vā apasmārakaḥ vā yakṣa kṛtyaḥ vā amanuṣya kṛtyaḥ vā manuṣya kṛtyaḥ vā ekāhikaḥ
translated: or a demon, or an epileptic fit, or a yakṣa deed, or a non-human deed, or a human deed, or a one-day fever,

original: vā dvaitīyako vā traitīyako vā caturthako vā nityajvaro vā viṣamajvaro vā /
analyzed: vā dvaitīyakaḥ vā traitīyakaḥ vā caturthakaḥ vā nitya jvaraḥ vā viṣamajvaraḥ vā
translated: or a two-day fever, or a three-day fever, or a four-day fever, or a constant fever, or an irregular fever.

original: antaśaḥ svapnāntaragatasyāpi strīrūpāṇi vā puruṣarūpāṇi vā dārakarūpāṇi vā dārikārūpāṇi vā viheṭhāṃ kuryuḥ /
analyzed: antaśas svapna antara gatasya api strī rūpāṇi vā puruṣa rūpāṇi vā dāraka rūpāṇi vā dārikā rūpāṇi vā viheṭhām kuryuḥ
translated: At the very least, even while dreaming, they might harm the forms of women or the forms of men or the forms of boys or the forms of girls.

original: nedaṃ sthānaṃ vidyate //
analyzed: na idam sthānam vidyate
translated: There is no such possibility.

original: atha khalu tā rākṣasya evasvareṇa samaṃ saṃgītyā bhagavantamābhirgāthābhiradhyabhāṣanta
analyzed: atha khalu tāḥ rākṣasyaḥ eva svareṇa samam saṃgītyā bhagavantam ābhiḥ gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣanta
translated: Then the rākṣasīs, in unison with their own voices, addressed the Blessed One with these verses:

original: saptadhāsya sphuṭenmūrdhā arjakasyeva mañjarī /
analyzed: saptadhā asya sphuṭet mūrdhā arjakasya iva mañjarī
translated: His head would split into seven pieces, like the flower of the arjuna tree,

original: ya imaṃ mantra śrutvā vai atikrameddharmabhāṇakam // / //
analyzed: yaḥ imam śrutvā vai atikramet dharma bhāṇakam
translated: Whoever, having heard this mantra, would transgress the Dharma teacher.

original: yā gatirmātṛghātīnāṃ pitṛghātīna yā gatiḥ /
analyzed: yā gatiḥ mātṛ ghātīnām yā gatiḥ
translated: The fate of those who kill their mothers, the fate of those who kill their fathers,

original: tāṃ gatiṃ pratigacchedyo dharmabhāṇakamatikramet // / //
analyzed: tām gatim pratigacchet yaḥ dharma bhāṇakam atikramet
translated: That fate would befall one who would transgress the Dharma teacher.

original: yā gatistilapīḍānāṃ tilakūṭānāṃ ca yā gatiḥ /
analyzed: yā gatiḥ tilapīḍānām tilakūṭānām ca yā gatiḥ
translated: The fate of those who press sesame seeds, the fate of those who pile up sesame seeds,

original: tāṃ gatiṃ pratigacchedyo dharmabhāṇakamatikramet // / //
analyzed: tām gatim pratigacchet yaḥ dharma bhāṇakam atikramet
translated: That fate would befall one who would transgress the Dharma teacher.

original: yā gatistulakūṭānāṃ kāṃsyakūṭāna yā gatiḥ /
analyzed: yā gatiḥ tulakūṭānām yā gatiḥ
translated: The fate of those who cheat with weights and with measures,🔽

original: tāṃ gatiṃ pratigacchedyo dharmabhāṇakamatikramet // / //
analyzed: tām gatim pratigacchet yaḥ dharma bhāṇakam atikramet
translated: The same fate will befall one who transgresses a Dharma teacher🔽as befalls those who cheat with weights and measures or with dyed cattle's hair.

original: evamuktvā tāḥ kuntipramukhā rākṣasyo bhagavantametadūcuḥ vayamapi bhagavaṃsteṣāmevaṃrūpāṇāṃ dharmabhāṇakānāṃ rakṣāṃ kariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: evam uktvā tāḥ kunti pramukhāḥ rākṣasyaḥ bhagavantam etat ūcuḥ vayam api bhagavan teṣām evaṃrūpāṇām dharma bhāṇakānām rakṣām kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: Having said this, the rākṣasīs headed by Kuntī said to the Blessed One, We too, Blessed One, will protect those Dharma teachers in this way.

original: svastyayanaṃ daṇḍaparihāraṃ viṣadūṣaṇaṃ kariṣyāma iti /
analyzed: svastyayanam daṇḍa parihāram viṣa dūṣaṇam kariṣyāmaḥ iti
translated: We will bring about their welfare, avert punishment, and neutralize poison.

original: evamukte bhagavāṃstā rākṣasya etadavocat sādhu sādhu bhaginyaḥ /🔽yad yūyaṃ teṣāṃ dharmabhāṇakānāṃ rakṣāvaraṇaguptiṃ kariṣyadhve ye 'sya dharmaparyāyasya antaśo nāmadheyamātramapi dhārayiṣyanti /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān tāḥ rākṣasyaḥ etat avocat sādhu sādhu bhaginyaḥ  yat yūyam teṣām dharma bhāṇakānām rakṣā āvaraṇa guptim kariṣyadhve ye dharmaparyāyasya antaśas nāmadheya mātram api dhārayiṣyanti
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to those rākṣasīs, Good, good, sisters!

original: kaḥ punarvādo ya imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ sakalasamāptaṃ dhārayiṣyanti /
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ ye imam dharmaparyāyam sakala samāptam dhārayiṣyanti
translated: It is good that you will provide protection, defense, and security for those Dharma teachers who will even hold just the name of this Dharma discourse, let alone those who will hold this Dharma discourse in its entirety.

original: pustakagataṃ vā satkuryuḥ puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākāvaijayantībhistailapradīpairvā
analyzed: pustaka gatam vā satkuryuḥ puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākā vaijayantībhiḥ taila pradīpaiḥ vā
translated: Those who will honor it with flowers, incense, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, flags, and banners of victory; with oil lamps;

original: ghṛtapradīpairvā gandhatailapradīpairvā campakatailapradīpairvā vārṣikatailapradīpairvā
analyzed: ghṛta pradīpaiḥ vā gandha taila pradīpaiḥ vā campaka taila pradīpaiḥ vā vārṣika taila pradīpaiḥ vā
translated: with ghee lamps, or with fragrant oil lamps, or with campaka oil lamps, or with monsoon oil lamps,

original: utpalatailapradīpairvā sumanātailapradīpairvā īddaśairbahuvidhaiḥ pūjāvidhānaśatasahasraiḥ
analyzed: utpala taila pradīpaiḥ vā sumanā taila pradīpaiḥ vā īddaśaiḥ bahuvidhaiḥ pūjā vidhāna śata sahasraiḥ
translated: or with blue lotus oil lamps, or with jasmine oil lamps, with many hundreds of thousands of such various offerings,

original: satkariṣyanti gurukariṣyanti /
analyzed: satkariṣyanti gurukariṣyanti
translated: they will honor and respect you.

original: te tvayā kunti saparivārayā rakṣitavyāḥ //
analyzed: te tvayā kunti sa parivārayā rakṣitavyāḥ
translated: You and your retinue should protect them.

original: asmin khalu punardhāraṇīparivarte nirdiśyamāne aṣṭāṣaṣṭīnāṃ prāṇisahasrāṇāmanutpattikadharmakṣāntipratilābho 'bhūt //
analyzed: asmin khalu punar dhāraṇī parivarte nirdiśyamāne aṣṭāṣaṣṭīnām prāṇi sahasrāṇām anutpattikadharmakṣānti pratilābhaḥ bhūt
translated: Moreover, when this chapter on the dhāraṇī was being taught, eighty-six thousand beings attained acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

original: iti śrīsaddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye dhāraṇīparivarto nāmaikaviṃśatimaḥ //
analyzed: iti śrī saddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye dhāraṇīparivartaḥ nāma ekaviṃśatimaḥ
translated: Thus concludes the twenty-first chapter, on the dhāraṇī, in the Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: bhaiṣajyarājapūrvayogaparivartaḥ /
analyzed: bhaiṣajya rāja pūrvayoga parivartaḥ
translated: The Chapter on the Past of Bhaiṣajyarāja.

original: atha khalu nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijño bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavantametadavocat
analyzed: atha khalu nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijñaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Nakṣatra-rāja-saṃkusumitābhi-jña said to the Buddha,

original: kena kāreṇena bhagavan bhaiṣajyarājo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'syāṃ sahāyāṃ lokadhātau pravicarati /
analyzed: kena kāreṇena bhagavan bhaiṣajyarājaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ syām sahāyām lokadhātau pravicarati
translated: Bhagavān, for what reason does the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajya-rāja move about in this Sahā world system?

original: bahūni cāsya bhagavan duṣkarakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi saṃdṛśyante /
analyzed: bahūni ca asya bhagavan duṣkara koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi saṃdṛśyante
translated: Bhagavān, many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of difficult tasks are seen to be undertaken by him.

original: tatsādhu bhagavān deśayatu tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho bhaiṣajyarājasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya yat kiṃciccaryāpradeśamātram /
analyzed: tat sādhu bhagavān deśayatu tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ bhaiṣajyarājasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya yat kiṃcid caryā pradeśa mātram
translated: Therefore, it is good if the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha were to teach just a fraction of the conduct of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajyarāja,

original: yacchrutvā devanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragamanuṣyāmanuṣyāstadanyalokadhātvāgatāśca
analyzed: yat śrutvā deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga manuṣya amanuṣyāḥ tad anya lokadhātu āgatāḥ ca
translated: having heard which, the devas, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans and non-humans, and the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have come here from other world systems,

original: bodhisattvā mahāsattvā ime ca mahāśrāvakāḥ śrutvā sarve prītāstuṣṭā udagrā āttamanaso bhaveyuriti //🔽atha khalu bhagavān nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijñasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya
analyzed: bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ ime ca mahāśrāvakāḥ śrutvā sarve prītāḥ tuṣṭāḥ udagrāḥ ātta manasaḥ bhaveyuḥ iti  atha khalu bhagavān nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijñasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya
translated: and these great śrāvakas, having heard it, would all be delighted, satisfied, joyful, and uplifted.🔽 Then the Bhagavān, knowing the request of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña,🔽at that time said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, Noble one, in the past, beyond kalpas as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,

original: adhyeṣaṇāṃ viditvā tasyāṃ velāyāṃ nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijñaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvametadavocat🔽bhūtapurvaṃ kulaputra atīte 'dhvani gaṅgānadīvālikāsamaiḥ kalpairyadāsīt /
analyzed: adhyeṣaṇām viditvā tasyām velāyām nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijñam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat 🔽kula putra atīte dhvani gaṅgā nadī vālikā samaiḥ kalpaiḥ yat āsīt
translated: there was a world system called Ratnaviśuddhā, and in that world system there was a central world called Sutejomaṇḍalanirbhāsā.🔽 Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, in that world system called Ratnaviśuddhā, in the central world called Sutejomaṇḍalanirbhāsā, there was a buddha called Jala­dhara­garjita­ghoṣa­susvarana­kṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened Buddha, one who possessed perfect knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, one who knew the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, a bhagavān.

original: tena kālena tena samayena candrasūryavimalaprabhāsaśrīrnāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho🔽loka udapādividyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā
analyzed: tena kālena tena samayena candrasūryavimalaprabhāsaśrīḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ  lokaḥ udapādi vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā
translated: At that time, there appeared in the world a tathāgata, an arhat, a perfectly enlightened buddha,

original: devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: perfect in wisdom and conduct, a sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, a bhagavat named Candrasūryavimalaprabhāśrī.

original: tasya khalu punarnakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña bhagavataścandrasūryavimalaprabhāsaśriyastathāgatasyārhataḥ
analyzed: tasya khalu punar nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña bhagavataḥ candra sūrya vimala prabhāsa śriyaḥ tathāgatasya arhataḥ
translated: Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, that bhagavat, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Candrasūryavimalaprabhāśrī

original: samyaksaṃbuddhasya aśītikoṭyo bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ mahāsaṃnipāto 'bhūt dvāsaptatigaṅgānadīvālikāsamāścāsya
analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddhasya aśīti koṭyaḥ bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām mahā saṃnipātaḥ bhūt dvāsaptati gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ ca asya
translated: had an assembly of eighty koṭis of bodhisattva mahāsattvas and a śrāvaka assembly of as many as the sands of seventy-two Ganges Rivers.

original: śrāvakasaṃnipāto 'bhūt /🔽apagamātṛgrāmaṃ ca tatpravacanamabhūt /
analyzed: śrāvaka saṃnipātaḥ bhūt  apaga mātṛgrāmam ca tat pravacanam abhūt
translated: His teaching was without women and

original: apagatanirayatiryagyonipretāsurakāyaṃ samaṃ ramaṇīyaṃ pāṇitalajātaṃ ca tadbuddhakṣetramabhūt /
analyzed: apagata niraya tiryagyoni preta asura kāyam samam ramaṇīyam pāṇi tala jātam ca tat buddhakṣetram abhūt
translated: his buddha realm was even, delightful, and smooth like the palm of the hand, without hells, animal realms, or worlds of the ancestors, and without the suffering of the lower existences.

original: divyavaiḍūryamayabhūmibhāgaṃ ratnacandanavṛkṣasamalakṛtaṃ ca ratnajālasamīritaṃ ca avasaktapaṭṭadāmābhipralambitaṃ ca ratnagandhaghaṭikānirdhūpitaṃ 🔽ca /
analyzed: divya vaiḍūrya maya bhūmi bhāgam ratna candana vṛkṣa samalakṛtam ca ratna jāla samīritam ca avasakta paṭṭa dāma abhipralambitam ca ratna gandha ghaṭikā nirdhūpitam  ca
translated: the ground was made of divine lapis lazuli, adorned with jeweled sandalwood trees, covered with jeweled nets, hung with silk streamers and canopies, and perfumed with incense from jeweled censers.

original: sarveṣu ca ratnavṛkṣamūleṣu iṣukṣepamānamātre ratnavyomakāni saṃsthitānyabhūvan /
analyzed: sarveṣu ca ratna vṛkṣa mūleṣu iṣu kṣepa māna mātre ratna vyomakāni saṃsthitāni abhūvan
translated: At the foot of each jeweled tree, at a distance of one arrow-shot, jeweled pavilions were erected.🔽And on the top of each jeweled pavilion, a hundred koṭis of devas were stationed,

original: sarveṣu ca ratnavyomakamūrdhneṣu koṭīśataṃ devaputrāṇāṃ tūryatālāvacarasaṃgītisaṃprabhāṇitena🔽avasthitamabhūt tasya bhagavataścandrasūryavimalaprabhāsaśriyastathāgatasyārhataḥ
analyzed: sarveṣu ca koṭī śatam devaputrāṇām tūrya tālāvacara saṃgīti saṃprabhāṇitena  avasthitam abhūt tasya bhagavataḥ candra sūrya vimala prabhāsa śriyaḥ tathāgatasya arhataḥ
translated: playing musical instruments and singing hymns

original: samyaksaṃbuddhasya pūjākarmaṇe /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddhasya pūjā karmaṇe
translated: in honor of the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Candra­sūrya­vimala­prabhāsa­śrī.

original: sa ca bhagavānimaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīkaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ teṣāṃ mahāśrāvakāṇāṃ teṣāṃ ca bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ vistareṇa saṃprakāśayati sma /
analyzed: sa ca bhagavān imam saddharmapuṇḍarīkam dharmaparyāyam teṣām mahāśrāvakāṇām teṣām ca bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām vistareṇa saṃprakāśayati sma
translated: And that Blessed One was expounding extensively to those great hearers and those bodhisattva mahāsattvas the Dharma discourse called The White Lotus of the Good Dharma,

original: sarvasattvapriyadarśanaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamadhiṣṭhānaṃ kṛtvā /
analyzed: sarva sattva priya darśanam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam adhiṣṭhānam kṛtvā
translated: taking as the basis the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva­sattva­priya­darśana.

original: tasya khalu punarnakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña bhagavataścandrasūryavimalaprabhāsaśriyastathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya dvācatvāriṃśatkalpasahasrāṇyāyuṣpramāṇamabhūt /
analyzed: tasya khalu punar nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña bhagavataḥ candrasūryavimalaprabhāsaśriyaḥ tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya dvācatvāriṃśat kalpa sahasrāṇi āyuṣpramāṇam abhūt
translated: “Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, the lifespan of the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Candra­sūrya­vimala­prabhāsa­śrī was forty-two thousand eons.

original: teṣāṃ ca bodhisattvanāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ teṣāṃ ca mahāśrāvakāṇāṃ tāvadevāyuṣpramāṇamabhūt /
analyzed: teṣām ca bodhisattvanām mahāsattvānām teṣām ca mahāśrāvakāṇām tāvat eva āyuṣpramāṇam abhūt
translated: The lifespan of those bodhisattva mahāsattvas and those great śrāvakas was also the same.

original: sa ca sarvasattvapriyadarśano bodhisattvo mahāsattvastasya bhagavataḥ pravacane duṣkaracaryābhiyukto 'bhūt /
analyzed: sa ca sarvasattvapriyadarśanaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tasya bhagavataḥ pravacane duṣkara caryā abhiyuktaḥ bhūt
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva­sattva­priya­darśana was dedicated to difficult practices in the teaching of that bhagavān.

original: sa dvādaśavarṣasahasrāṇi caṃkramābhiruḍho 'bhūt /
analyzed: sa dvādaśa varṣa sahasrāṇi caṃkrama abhiruḍhaḥ bhūt
translated: For twelve thousand years he practiced walking meditation.

original: mahāvīryārambheṇa yogābhiyukto
analyzed: mahā vīrya ārambheṇa yoga abhiyuktaḥ
translated: He was dedicated to yoga with great perseverance.

original: 'bhūt / sa dvādaśānāṃ varṣasahasrāṇāmatyayena sarvarūpasaṃdarśanaṃ nāma samādhiṃ pratilabhate sma /
analyzed: bhūt sa dvādaśānām varṣa sahasrāṇām atyayena sarvarūpasaṃdarśanam nāma samādhim pratilabhate sma
translated: After twelve thousand years had passed, he attained the samādhi called manifestation of all forms.

original: sahapratilambhācca tasya samādheḥ sa sarvasattvapriyadarśano bodhisattvo mahāsattvastuṣṭa
analyzed: saha pratilambhāt ca tasya samādheḥ sa sarvasattvapriyadarśanaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tuṣṭa
translated: As soon as he attained that samādhi, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva­sattva­priya­darśana was satisfied, delighted, and joyful.

original: udagra āttamanāḥ pramuditaḥ prītisaumanasyajātastasyāṃ velāyāmevaṃ cintayāmāsa 🔽imaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīkaṃ dharmaparyāyamāgamya ayaṃ mayā sarvarūpasaṃdarśanaḥ Vaidya
analyzed: udagraḥ ātta manāḥ pramuditaḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ tasyām velāyām evam cintayāmāsa  imam saddharmapuṇḍarīkam dharmaparyāyam āgamya ayam mayā sarva rūpa saṃdarśanaḥ vaidya
translated: He was elated, uplifted, and overjoyed. He was filled with happiness and joy, and at that time he thought this:

original: samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ /🔽tasyāṃ velāyāṃ sa sarvasattvapriyadarśano bodhisattvo mahāsattva evaṃ cintayati sma yannvahaṃ bhagavataścandrasūryavimalaprabhāsaśriyastathāgatasya
analyzed: samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ  tasyām velāyām sa sarva sattva priya darśanaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ evam cintayati sma  yat nu aham bhagavataḥ candra sūrya vimala prabhāsa śriyaḥ tathāgatasya
translated: Having obtained this Dharma discourse called The White Lotus of the Good Dharma, I have attained this all-appearance-showing knowledge-perception samādhi.

original: pūjāṃ kuryāmū /
analyzed: pūjām kuryā amū
translated: At that time, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva­sattva­priya­darśana thought this: I will make offerings to the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Candra­sūrya­vimala­prabhāsa­śrī

original: asya ca saddharmapuṇḍarīkasya dharmaparyāyasya /
analyzed: asya ca saddharmapuṇḍarīkasya dharmaparyāyasya
translated: and to this Dharma discourse called The White Lotus of the Good Dharma.

original: sa tasyāṃ velāyāṃ tathārūpaṃ samādhiṃ samāpannaḥ yasya samādheḥ samanantarasamāpannasya sarvasattvapriyadarśanasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya /
analyzed: sa tasyām velāyām tathārūpam samādhim samāpannaḥ yasya samādheḥ samanantara samāpannasya sarvasattvapriyadarśanasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya
translated: At that time, he entered into a samādhi such that, immediately after the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva­sattva­priya­darśana entered that samādhi,

original: adya tāvadevoparyandarīkṣānmāndāravamahāmāndāravāṇāṃ puṣpāṇāṃ mahantaṃ puṣpavarṣamabhipravṛṣḥam /
analyzed: adya tāvat eva upari andarīkṣāt māndārava mahāmāndāravāṇām puṣpāṇām mahantam puṣpa varṣam abhipravṛṣṭam
translated: a great rain of coral tree flowers and great coral tree flowers fell from the sky above.

original: kālānusāricandanameghaḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: kāla anusāri candana meghaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: A cloud of timely-descending sandalwood was created.

original: uragasāracandanavarṣanabhipravṛṣḥam /
analyzed: uraga sāra candana varṣan abhipravṛṣṭam
translated: rained down uragasāra sandalwood.

original: tādṛśī ca nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña sā gandhajātiḥ /
analyzed: tādṛśī ca sā gandha jātiḥ
translated: And that kind of perfume, Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña,

original: yasyā ekaḥ karṣa imāṃ sahālokadhātuṃ mūlyena kṣamati //
analyzed: yasyāḥ ekaḥ karṣaḥ imām sahā lokadhātum mūlyena kṣamati
translated: one kārṣāpaṇa of which is worth this entire Sahā world system.

original: atha khalu punarnakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña sa sarvasattvapriyadarśano bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ smṛtimān saṃprajānaṃstasmāt samādhervyudatiṣṭhat
analyzed: atha khalu punar nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña sa sarvasattvapriyadarśanaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ smṛtimān saṃ prajānan tasmāt samādheḥ vyudatiṣṭhat
translated: Then, Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva­sattva­priya­darśana, mindful and fully aware, rose from that samādhi.

original: vyutthāya caivaṃ ciantayāmāsa na tadarddhiprātihāryasaṃdarśanena bhagavataḥ pūjā kṛtā bhavati /
analyzed: vyutthāya ca evam na tadā ṛddhi prātihārya saṃdarśanena bhagavataḥ pūjā kṛtā bhavati
translated: Having risen, he thought, “One does not make an offering to the Blessed One by displaying such a miracle of supernormal power.

original: yathā ātmabhāvaparityāgeneti /
analyzed: yathā ātma bhāva parityāgena iti
translated: It is by giving up one’s body.”

original: atha khalu punarnakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña sa sarvasattvapriyadarśano bodhisattvo mahāsattvastasyāṃ velāyāmagaruturuṣkakundurukarasaṃ bhakṣayati
analyzed: atha khalu punar nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña sa sarvasattvapriyadarśanaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tasyām velāyām agaru turuṣka kunduruka rasam bhakṣayati
translated: Then, Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva­sattva­priya­darśana at that time ate agaru, turuṣka, and kuṅkuma resin,

original: campakatailaṃ ca pibati sma /
analyzed: campaka tailam ca pibati sma
translated: and drank campaka oil.

original: tena khalu punarnakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña paryāyeṇa tasya sarvasattvapriyadarśanasya
analyzed: tena khalu punar nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña paryāyeṇa tasya sarva sattva priya darśanasya
translated: Then, Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, by that method, that Sarva­sattva­priya­darśana

original: bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya satatasamitaṃ gandhaṃ bhakṣayataścampakatailaṃ ca pibato
analyzed: bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya satata samitam gandham bhakṣayataḥ campaka tailam ca pibataḥ
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva­sattva­priya­darśana, who was constantly eating incense and drinking campaka oil,

original: dvādaśa varṣāṇyatikrāntānyabhūvan /
analyzed: dvādaśa varṣāṇi atikrāntāni abhūvan
translated: had passed twelve years.

original: atha khalu nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña sa sarvasattvapriyadarśano bodhisattvo mahāsattvasteṣāṃ
analyzed: atha khalu nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña sa sarvasattvapriyadarśanaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ teṣām
translated: Then, Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, after those

original: dvādaśānāṃ varṣāṇāmatyayena taṃ svamātmabhāvaṃ divyairvastraiḥ pariveṣṭaya gandhatailaplutaṃ
analyzed: dvādaśānām varṣāṇām atyayena tam svam ātmabhāvam divyaiḥ vastraiḥ pariveṣṭaya gandha taila plutam
translated: twelve years had passed, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva­sattva­priya­darśana wrapped his own body in divine garments, soaked it with fragrant oil,

original: kṛtvā svakamadhiṣṭhānamakarot /
analyzed: kṛtvā svakam adhiṣṭhānam akarot
translated: and consecrated it.

original: svakamadhiṣṭhānaṃ kṛtvā svaṃ kāyaṃ prajvālayāmāsa tathāgatasya pūjākarmaṇe /
analyzed: svakam adhiṣṭhānam kṛtvā svam kāyam prajvālayāmāsa tathāgatasya pūjā karmaṇe
translated: Having consecrated it, he set his own body on fire for the sake of making offerings to the Tathāgata,

original: asya ca saddharmapuṇḍarīkasya dharmaparyāyasya pūjārtham /
analyzed: asya ca saddharmapuṇḍarīkasya dharmaparyāyasya pūjā artham
translated: and for the sake of making offerings to the Dharma teaching of this Dharma Flower Sutra.

original: atha khalu nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña tasya sarvasattvapriyadarśanasya bodhisattvasya
analyzed: atha khalu nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumitābhijña tasya sarvasattvapriyadarśanasya bodhisattvasya
translated: Then, Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva­sattva­priya­darśana

original: mahāsattvasya tābhiḥ kāyapradīpaprabhājvālābhiraśītigaṅgānadīvālikāsamā lokadhātavaḥ sphuṭā abhuvan /
analyzed: mahāsattvasya tābhiḥ kāya pradīpa prabhā jvālābhiḥ aśīti gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ lokadhātavaḥ sphuṭāḥ abhuvan
translated: illuminated with the blazing light of the lamp of his body as many worlds as there are grains of sand in eighty Ganges Rivers.

original: tāsu ca lokadhātuṣu aśītigaṅgānadīvālikāsamā eva buddhā bhagavantaste sarve sādhukāraṃ dadanti sma sādhu sādhu kulaputra /
analyzed: tāsu ca lokadhātuṣu aśīti gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāḥ eva buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ te sarve sādhukāram dadanti sma sādhu sādhu kula putra
translated: In those world systems, there were Buddhas, Blessed Ones, equal to the sands of the Ganges, and they all applauded, saying, Excellent, excellent, O son of noble family!

original: sādhu khalu punastvaṃ kulaputra /
analyzed: sādhu khalu punar tvam kula putra
translated: You are indeed excellent, O son of noble family!

original: ayaṃ sa bhūto bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ vīryārambhaḥ /
analyzed: ayam sa bhūtaḥ bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām vīrya ārambhaḥ
translated: This is the true exertion in diligence of the Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas.

original: iyaṃ sā bhūtā tathāgatapūjā dharmapūjā /
analyzed: iyam sā bhūtā tathāgata pūjā dharma pūjā
translated: This is the true worship of the Tathāgatas, the worship of the Dharma.

original: na tathā puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākāpūjā /
analyzed: na tathā puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākā pūjā
translated: It is not the worship with flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, and flags.

original: nāpyāmiṣapūjā nāpyuragasāracandanapūjā /
analyzed: na api āmiṣa pūjā na api uragasāra candana pūjā
translated: It is not the worship with material offerings, nor the worship with uragasāra sandalwood.

original: iyaṃ tatkulaputra agrapradānam /
analyzed: iyam tad kula putra agra pradānam
translated: O son of noble family, this is the supreme gift.

original: na tathā rājyaparityāgadānaṃ na priyaputrabhāryāparityāgadānam /
analyzed: na tathā rājya parityāga dānam na priya putra bhāryā parityāga dānam
translated: It is not the gift of renouncing a kingdom, nor the gift of renouncing beloved sons and wives.

original: iyaṃ punaḥ kulaputra viśiṣṭā agrā varā pravarā praṇītā dharmapūjā /
analyzed: iyam punar kula putra viśiṣṭā agrā varā pravarā praṇītā dharma pūjā
translated: But this, O son of noble family, is the most distinguished, supreme, excellent, foremost, and sublime worship of the Dharma,

original: yo 'yamātmabhāvaparityāgaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ yam ātma bhāva parityāgaḥ
translated: which is the renunciation of one's own body.

original: atha khalu punarnakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña te buddhā bhagavanta imāṃ vācaṃ bhāṣitvā tūṣṇīmabhūvan //
analyzed: atha khalu punar nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ imām vācam bhāṣitvā tūṣṇīm abhūvan
translated: Then, Nakṣatra-rāja-saṃkusumitâbhijña, those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, having spoken these words, became silent.

original: tasya khalu punarnakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña sarvasattvapriyadarśanātmabhāvasya dīpyato dvādaśa varṣaśatānyatikrāntānyabhūvan /
analyzed: tasya khalu punar nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña sarva sattva priya darśana ātmabhāvasya dīpyataḥ dvādaśa varṣa śatāni atikrāntāni abhūvan
translated: “Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, the body of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva­sattva­priya­darśana burned for twelve hundred years.

original: na ca praśamaṃ gacchati sma /
analyzed: na ca praśamam gacchati sma
translated: It did not go out.

original: sa paścāddvādaśānāṃ varṣaśatānāmatyayāt praśānto 'bhūt /
analyzed: sa paścāt dvādaśānām varṣa śatānām atyayāt praśāntaḥ bhūt
translated: After twelve hundred years it went out.

original: sa khalu punarnakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña sarvasattvapriyadarśano bodhisattvo mahāsattva
analyzed: sa khalu punar nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña sarvasattvapriyadarśanaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattva
translated: “Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva­sattva­priya­darśana,

original: evaṃrūpāṃ tathāgatapūjāṃ ca dharmapūjāṃ ca kṛtvā tataścyutastasyaiva bhagavataścandrasūryavimalaprabhāsaśriyastathāgatasyārhataḥ
analyzed: evaṃrūpām tathāgata pūjām ca dharma pūjām ca kṛtvā tatas cyutaḥ tasya eva bhagavataḥ candra sūrya vimala prabhāsa śriyaḥ tathāgatasya arhataḥ
translated: having made such offerings to the Tathāgata and such offerings of the Dharma, after he died he was reborn in the presence of the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Candra­sūrya­vimala­prabhāsa­śrī,🔽in the house of King Vimaladatta, as a physician

original: samyaksaṃbuddhasya pravacane rājño vimaladattasya gṛhe Vaidya 🔽upapanna aupapādikaḥ /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddhasya pravacane rājñaḥ vimaladattasya gṛhe vaidya  upapannaḥ aupapādikaḥ
translated: who was miraculously born,

original: utsaṅge paryaṅkeṇa prādurbhūto 'bhūt /
analyzed: utsaṅge paryaṅkeṇa prādurbhūtaḥ bhūt
translated: appearing in his mother’s lap, sitting cross-legged.

original: samanantaropapannaśca khalu punaḥ sa sarvasattvapriyadarśano bodhisattvo mahāsattvastasyāṃ velāyāṃ svamātāpitarau gāthayādhyabhāṣata
analyzed: samanantara upapannaḥ ca khalu punar sa sarvasattvapriyadarśanaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tasyām velāyām sva mātā pitarau gāthayā adhyabhāṣata
translated: “Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, as soon as the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva­sattva­priya­darśana was born, he spoke these verses to his mother and father:

original: ayaṃ mamā caṃkramu rājaśreṣṭha yasmin mayā sthitva samādhi labdhaḥ /
analyzed: ayam rāja śreṣṭha yasmin mayā sthitvā samādhi labdhaḥ
translated: “This is my old walking place, O best of kings, Where I attained the samādhi.

original: vīryaṃ dṛḍhaṃ ārabhitaṃ mahāvrataṃ parityajitvā priyamātmabhāvam // / //
analyzed: vīryam dṛḍham ārabhitam mahāvratam parityajitvā priyam ātmabhāvam
translated: I exerted firm diligence, the great vow, And abandoned what was dear, my own body.”

original: atha khalu nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña sa sarvasattvapriyadarśano bodhisattvo mahāsattva
analyzed: atha khalu nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña sa sarva sattva priya darśanaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattva
translated: Then, Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva­sattva­priya­darśana

original: imāṃ gāthāṃ bhāṣitvā svamātāpitarāvetadavocat adyāpyamba tāta sa bhagavāṃścandrasūryavimalaprabhāsaśrīstathāgato
analyzed: imām gāthām bhāṣitvā sva mātā pitarā etat avocat adya api amba tāta sa bhagavān candra sūrya vimala prabhāsa śrīḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: having recited these verses, said to his mother and father, “Mother, Father, the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Candra­sūrya­vimala­prabhāsa­śrī

original: 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddha etarhi tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ etarhi tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati dharmam deśayati
translated: is still present, still existing, and still alive. He is teaching the Dharma.

original: yasya mayā bhagavataścandrasūryavimalaprabhāsaśriyastathāgatasya pūjāṃ kṛtvā sarvarutakauśalyadhāraṇī pratilabdhā /
analyzed: yasya mayā bhagavataḥ candra sūrya vimala prabhāsa śriyaḥ tathāgatasya pūjām kṛtvā sarva ruta kauśalya dhāraṇī pratilabdhā
translated: I made offerings to the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Candra­sūrya­vimala­prabhāsa­śrī, and I attained the dhāraṇī called the skill in words.

original: ayaṃ ca saddharmapuṇḍarīko dharmaparyāyo 'śītibhirgāthākoṭīnayutaśatasahasraiḥ kaṅkaraiśca vivaraiśca akṣobhyaiśca tasya bhagavato 'ntikācchruto 🔽'bhūt /
analyzed: ayam ca saddharmapuṇḍarīkaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ śītibhiḥ gāthā koṭī nayuta śata sahasraiḥ kaṅkaraiḥ ca vivaraiḥ ca akṣobhyaiḥ ca tasya bhagavataḥ ntikāt śrutaḥ 🔽bhūt
translated: I heard from that bhagavān the Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma, which has eight million quintillion lines, with a hundred thousand quintillion repetitions, from the beginning to the end.”

original: sādhu amba tāta gamiṣyāmyahaṃ tasya bhagavato 'ntikam /
analyzed: sādhu amba tāta gamiṣyāmi aham tasya bhagavataḥ ntikam
translated: ‘It is good, mother, father, I will go to that Blessed One.

original: tasmiṃśca gatvā bhūyastasya bhagavataḥ pūjāṃ kariṣyāmīti /🔽atha khalu nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña sa sarvasattvapriyadarśano bodhisattvo mahāsattvastasyāṃ
analyzed: tasmin ca gatvā bhūyas tasya bhagavataḥ pūjām kariṣyāmi iti  atha khalu nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña sa sarvasattvapriyadarśanaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tasyām
translated: And having gone there, I will make offerings to that Blessed One again.’

original: velāyāṃ saptatālamātraṃ vaihāyasamabhyudgamya saptaratnamaye kūṭāgāre paryaṅkamābhujya
analyzed: velāyām sapta tāla mātram vaihāyasam abhyudgamya sapta ratna maye kūṭāgāre paryaṅkam ābhujya
translated: Then, Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva­sattva­priya­darśana at that time rose up into the air to the height of seven palm trees, sat down cross-legged in a house made of the seven precious materials,

original: tasya bhagavataḥ sakāśamupasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: tasya bhagavataḥ sakāśam upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: and went into the presence of that Blessed One.

original: upasaṃkramya tasya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandya taṃ bhagavantaṃ saptakṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya
analyzed: upasaṃkramya tasya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya tam bhagavantam sapta kṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya
translated: Having arrived, he bowed his head to the feet of that Blessed One, circumambulated that Blessed One seven times,

original: yena sa bhagavāṃstenāñjaliṃ praṇāmya taṃ bhagavantaṃ namaskṛtvā anayā gāthāyābhiṣṭauti sma
analyzed: yena sa bhagavān tena añjalim praṇāmya tam bhagavantam namaskṛtvā anayā gāthāyā abhiṣṭauti sma
translated: and having bowed to that Blessed One with palms joined, he praised that Blessed One with this verse:

original: suvimalavadanā narendra dhīrā tava prabha rājatiyaṃ daśaddiśāsu /
analyzed: su vimala vadanā narendra dhīrā tava prabha daśat diśāsu
translated: ‘O leader of men with a face as pure as the full moon, your radiance shines in the ten directions.

original: tubhya sugata kṛtva agrapūjāṃ ahamiha āgatu nātha darśanāya // / //
analyzed: tubhya sugata agra pūjām aham iha āgatu nātha darśanāya
translated: Having made the highest offerings to you, the Well-Gone One, I have come here, O Lord, to see you.’

original: atha khalu nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña sa sarvasattvapriyadarśano bodhisattvo mahāsattvastasyāṃ
analyzed: atha khalu nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña sa sarvasattvapriyadarśanaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tasyām
translated: Then, Nakṣatra-rāja saṃkusumitābhi-jña, at that time the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva-sattva-priya-darśana,

original: velāyāmimāṃ gāthāṃ bhāṣitvā taṃ bhagavantaṃ candrasūryavimalaprabhāsaśriyaṃ saṃkusumitābhijña
analyzed: velāyām imām gāthām bhāṣitvā tam bhagavantam candra sūrya vimala prabhāsa śriyam saṃkusumita abhijña
translated: having spoken this verse, addressed the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Candrasūrya-vimala-prabhāsa-śrī, Saṃkusumitābhi-jña,

original: sa bhagavāṃścandrasūryavimalaprabhāsaśrīstathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhastaṃ sarvasattvapriyadarśanaṃ🔽bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvametadavocat parinirvāṇakālasamayo me kulaputra anuprāptaḥ /
analyzed: sa bhagavān candra sūrya vimala prabhāsa śrīḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tam sarva sattva priya darśanam  bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat parinirvāṇa kāla samayaḥ me kula putra anuprāptaḥ
translated: and that Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Candrasūrya-vimala-prabhāsa-śrī, said to that bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva-sattva-priya-darśana,🔽Son of noble family, the time has come for me to enter parinirvāṇa.

original: kṣayāntakālo me kulaputra anuprāptaḥ /
analyzed: kṣaya anta kālaḥ me kula putra anuprāptaḥ
translated: Son of noble family, the time of my final nirvāṇa has arrived.

original: tadgaccha tvaṃ kulaputra /
analyzed: tat gaccha tvam kula putra
translated: Therefore, go, son of noble family.

original: mama mañcaṃ prajñapayasva /
analyzed: mama mañcam prajñapayasva
translated: Prepare my bed.

original: parinirvāyiṣyāmīti //🔽atha khalu nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña sa bhagavāṃścandrasūryavimalaprabhāsaśrīstathāgatastaṃ
analyzed: parinirvāyiṣyāmi iti  atha khalu nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña sa bhagavān candra sūrya vimala prabhāsa śrīḥ tathāgataḥ tam
translated: I will enter parinirvāṇa.

original: sarvasattvapriyadarśanaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvametadavocat idaṃ ca te kulaputra
analyzed: sarvasattvapriyadarśanam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat idam ca te kula putra
translated: Then, Nakṣatra-rāja saṃkusumitābhi-jña, that Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Candrasūrya-vimala-prabhāsa-śrī, said this to that bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva-sattva-priya-darśana,🔽Son of noble family, I entrust this teaching to you.

original: śāsanamanuparindāmi / Vaidya
analyzed: śāsanam anuparindāmi vaidya
translated: physician

original: imāṃśca bodhisattvān mahāsattvān /
analyzed: imān ca bodhisattvān mahāsattvān
translated: these bodhisattva mahāsattvas,

original: imāṃśca mahāśrāvakān /
analyzed: imān ca mahāśrāvakān
translated: these great śrāvakas,

original: imāṃ ca buddhabodhim /
analyzed: imām ca buddha bodhim
translated: this enlightenment of the Buddha,

original: imāṃ ca lokadhātum /🔽imāni ca ratnavyomakāni /
analyzed: imām ca lokadhātum  imāni ca ratna vyomakāni
translated: this world system,🔽these bejeweled canopies,

original: imāni ca ratnavṛkṣāṇi /
analyzed: imāni ca ratna vṛkṣāṇi
translated: these bejeweled trees,

original: imāṃśca devaputrān /
analyzed: imān ca deva putrān
translated: and these devaputras,

original: mamopasthāyakānanuparindāmi /
analyzed: mama upasthāyakān anuparindāmi
translated: I entrust to you as my attendants.

original: parinirvṛtasya ca me kulaputra ye dhātavastānanuparindāmi /
analyzed: parinirvṛtasya ca me kula putra ye dhātavaḥ tān anuparindāmi
translated: And, noble son, I entrust to you my relics after my parinirvāṇa.

original: ātmanā ca tvayā kulaputra mama dhātūnāṃ vipulā pūjā kartavyā /
analyzed: ātmanā ca tvayā kula putra mama dhātūnām vipulā pūjā kartavyā
translated: And, noble son, you yourself should make extensive offerings to my relics.

original: vaistārikāśca te dhātavaḥ kartavyāḥ /
analyzed: vaistārikāḥ ca te dhātavaḥ kartavyāḥ
translated: Those relics should be distributed.

original: stūpānāṃ ca bahūni sahasrāṇi kartavyāni /🔽atha khalu nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña sa bhagavāṃścandrasūryavimalaprabhāsaśrīstathāgato
analyzed: stūpānām ca bahūni sahasrāṇi kartavyāni  atha khalu nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña sa bhagavān candra sūrya vimala prabhāsa śrīḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: Many thousands of stūpas should be made.

original: 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhastaṃ sarvasattvapriyadarśanaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamevamanuśiṣya
analyzed: rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tam sarva sattva priya darśanam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam evam anuśiṣya
translated: Then, Nakṣatra-rāja-saṃkusumitābhi-jña, that Bhagavān, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha Candra-sūrya-vimala-prabhāsa-śrī, having instructed the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva-sattva-priya-darśana in this way,

original: tasyāmeva rātryāṃ paścime yāme anupadhiśeṣe nirvāṇadhātau parinirvṛto 'bhūt //
analyzed: tasyām eva rātryām paścime yāme an upadhi śeṣe nirvāṇa dhātau parinirvṛtaḥ bhūt
translated: in the last watch of that night, entered into the state of nirvāṇa that is the remainderless equipoise of the elements.

original: atha khalu nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña sa sarvasattvapriyadarśano bodhisattvo mahāsattvastaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña sa sarvasattvapriyadarśanaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tam
translated: Then, Nakṣatra-rāja-saṃkusumitâbhijña, that bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva-sattva-priya-darśana,

original: bhagavanta candrasūryavimalaprabhāsaśriyaṃ tathāgataṃ parinirvṛtaṃ viditvā uragasāracandanacittāṃ
analyzed: bhagavanta candra sūrya vimala prabhāsa śriyam tathāgatam parinirvṛtam viditvā uraga sāra candana cittām
translated: knowing that the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, the One with Perfect Wisdom and Action, the Sugata, the Knower of the World, the Leader of Men to be Tamed, the Supreme Trainer, the Teacher of Gods and Men, the Buddha, the Blessed One, Candrasūryavimalaprabhāśrī, had passed into parinirvāṇa, made a funeral pyre of uragasāra sandalwood

original: kṛtvā taṃ tathāgatātmabhāvaṃ saṃprajvālayāmāsa /
analyzed: kṛtvā tam tathāgata ātmabhāvam saṃprajvālayāmāsa
translated: and set fire to the Tathāgata's body.

original: dagdhaṃ niśāntaṃ ca tathāgatātmabhāvaṃ viditvā tato dhātūn gṛhītvā rodati krandati paridevate sma /
analyzed: dagdham niśāntam ca tathāgata ātmabhāvam viditvā tatas dhātūn gṛhītvā rodati krandati paridevate sma
translated: Knowing that the Tathāgata's body had been completely burned, he collected the relics and wept, wailed, and lamented.

original: atha khalu nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña sa sarvasattvapriyadarśano bodhisattvo mahāsattvo
analyzed: atha khalu nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña sa sarva sattva priya darśanaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: Then, Nakṣatra-rāja-saṃkusumitâbhijña, that bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva-sattva-priya-darśana,

original: ruditvā kranditvā paridevitvā saptaratnamayāni caturaśītikumbhasahasrāṇi kārayitvā
analyzed: ruditvā kranditvā paridevitvā sapta ratna mayāni caturaśīti kumbha sahasrāṇi kārayitvā
translated: having wept, wailed, and lamented, had eighty-four thousand urns made of the seven precious substances

original: teṣu tāṃstathāgatadhātūn prakṣipya saptaratnamayāni caturaśītistūpasahasrāṇi pratiṣṭhāpayāmāsa /
analyzed: teṣu tān tathāgata dhātūn prakṣipya sapta ratna mayāni caturaśīti stūpa sahasrāṇi pratiṣṭhāpayāmāsa
translated: and placed the Tathāgata's relics in them. He erected eighty-four thousand stūpas of the seven precious substances,

original: yāvad brahmalokamuccaistvena /
analyzed: yāvat brahma lokam uccaistvena
translated: as high as the Brahma world,

original: chatrāvalīsamalaṃkṛtāni paṭṭaghaṇṭāsamīritāni ca /
analyzed: chatra āvalī samalaṃkṛtāni paṭṭa ghaṇṭā samīritāni ca
translated: adorned with a series of parasols and with streamers and bells fluttering.

original: sa tān stūpān pratiṣṭhāpya evaṃ cintayāmāsa kṛtā mayā tasya bhagavataścandrasūryavimalaprabhāsaśriyastathāgatasya dhātūnāṃ pūjā /
analyzed: sa tān stūpān pratiṣṭhāpya evam cintayāmāsa kṛtā mayā tasya bhagavataḥ candra sūrya vimala prabhāsa śriyaḥ tathāgatasya dhātūnām pūjā
translated: Having established those stūpas, he thought like this: 'I have made offerings to the relics of that Bhagavān, the Tathāgata Candra­sūrya­vimala­prabhāsa­śrī.

original: ataśca bhūya uttari viśiṣṭatarāṃ tathāgatadhātūnāṃ pūjāṃ kariṣyāmīti /
analyzed: atas ca bhūyaḥ uttari viśiṣṭatarām tathāgata dhātūnām pūjām kariṣyāmi iti
translated: But I will make even more extensive and superior offerings to the relics of the Tathāgata.'

original: atha khalu punarnakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña sa sarvasattvapriyadarśano bodhisattvo
analyzed: atha khalu punar nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña sa sarva sattva priya darśanaḥ bodhisattvaḥ
translated: Then, Nakṣatra-rāja-saṃkusumitâbhijña, that bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva-sattva-priya-darśana

original: mahāsattvastaṃ sarvāvantaṃ bodhisattvagaṇaṃ tāṃśca mahāśrāvakāṃstāṃśca devanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragamanuṣyāmanuṣyagaṇānāmantrayāmāsa
analyzed: mahāsattvaḥ tam sarvāvantam bodhisattva gaṇam tān ca mahāśrāvakān tān ca deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga manuṣya amanuṣya gaṇān āmantrayāmāsa
translated: addressed that entire assembly of bodhisattvas, those great śrāvakas, and those hosts of devas, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans, saying:

original: sarve yūyaṃ kulaputrāḥ samanvāharadhvam /
analyzed: sarve yūyam kula putrāḥ samanvāharadhvam
translated: All of you, sons of noble family, pay attention!

original: tasya bhagavato dhātūnāṃ pūjāṃ kariṣyāma iti /
analyzed: tasya bhagavataḥ dhātūnām pūjām kariṣyāmaḥ iti
translated: We will make offerings to the relics of that Bhagavān.

original: atha khalu nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña sa sarvasattvapriyadarśano bodhisattvo mahāsattvastasyāṃ
analyzed: atha khalu nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña sa sarvasattvapriyadarśanaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tasyām
translated: Then, Nakṣatra-rāja-saṃkusumitâbhijña, that bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva-sattva-priya-darśana,

original: velāyāṃ teṣāṃ caturaśītīnāṃ tathāgatadhātustūpasahasrāṇāṃ purastācchatapuṇyavicitritaṃ🔽svaṃ bāhumādīpayāmāsa /
analyzed: velāyām teṣām caturaśītīnām tathāgata dhātu stūpa sahasrāṇām purastāt śata puṇya vicitritam  svam bāhum ādīpayāmāsa
translated: In front of those 84,000 stūpas of the Tathāgata’s relics, he offered his own arm, which was adorned with a hundred merits.

original: ādīpya ca dvāsaptativarṣasahasrāṇi teṣāṃ tathāgatadhātustūpānāṃ pūjāmakarot /
analyzed: ādīpya ca dvāsaptati varṣa sahasrāṇi teṣām tathāgata dhātu stūpānām pūjām akarot
translated: Having offered it, he made offerings to those stūpas of the Tathāgata’s relics for 72,000 years.

original: pūjāṃ ca kurvatā tasyāḥ parṣado 'saṃkhyeyāni śrāvakakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi vinītāni /
analyzed: pūjām ca kurvatā tasyāḥ parṣadaḥ saṃkhyeyāni śrāvaka koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi vinītāni
translated: While making offerings, he guided countless hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭīs of śrāvakas from that assembly.

original: sarvaiśca tairbodhisattvaiḥ sarvarūpasaṃdarśanasamādhiḥ pratilabdho 'bhūt //
analyzed: sarvaiḥ ca taiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ sarva rūpa saṃdarśana samādhiḥ pratilabdhaḥ bhūt
translated: And all those bodhisattvas attained the samādhi called 'Displaying All Forms.'

original: atha khalu nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña sa sarvāvān bodhisattvagaṇaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña sa sarvāvān bodhisattva gaṇaḥ
translated: Then, Nakṣatra-rāja-saṃkusumitābhi-jña, that entire assembly of bodhisattvas,

translated: Just as, Nakṣatra-rāja Saṃkusumita, the king of physicians is the highest of all physicians,🔽 in the same way, Nakṣatra-rāja Saṃkusumita, this Dharma discourse called the White Lotus of the True Dharma is the highest of all the sūtras spoken by the Tathāgata.

original: ayaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīko dharmaparyāyaḥ sarveṣāṃ tathāgatabhāṣitānāṃ sūtrāntānāṃ rājā mūrdhaprāptaḥ /
analyzed: ayam saddharmapuṇḍarīkaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ sarveṣām tathāgata bhāṣitānām sūtrāntānām rājā mūrdhaprāptaḥ

original: tadyathāpi nāma nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña sarveṣāṃ nakṣatrāṇāṃ candramāḥ prabhākaro 'graprāptaḥ /

translated: “Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, just as the moon is the most radiant of all the stars and is supreme,

original: evameva nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña sarveṣāṃ tathāgatabhāṣitānāṃ sūtrāntānāmayaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīko dharmaparyāyaścandrakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrātirekaprabhākaro
analyzed: evam eva nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña sarveṣām tathāgata bhāṣitānām sūtrāntānām ayam saddharmapuṇḍarīkaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ candra koṭī nayuta śata sahasra atireka prabhākaraḥ
translated: in the same way, Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma is more radiant than a hundred thousand quintillion moons taught by the Tathāgata,

original: 'graprāptaḥ /
analyzed: gra prāptaḥ
translated: and it is supreme.

original: tadyathāpi nāma nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña sūryamaṇḍalaṃ sarvaṃ tamondhakāraṃ vidhamati /

translated: “Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, just as the orb of the sun dispels all darkness,

translated: in the same way, Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma dispels the darkness of all that is unwholesome.

translated: “Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, just as Śakra, lord of the devas, is the king of the devas of the Thirty-Three,

original: tadyathāpi nāma nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña brahmā sahāṃpatiḥ sarveṣāṃ brahmakāyikānāṃ devānāṃ rājā brahmaloke pitṛkāryaṃ karoti /
