translated: “Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, it is like when Brahmā, lord of Sahā, the king of all the devas of the Brahma­kāyika realm, performs the duties of a father in the Brahma realm.

original: evameva nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña ayaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīko dharmaparyāyaḥ sarveṣāṃ🔽sattvānāṃ śaikṣāśaikṣāṇāṃ ca sarvaśrāvakāṇāṃ pratyekabuddhānāṃ bodhisattvayānasaṃprasthitānāṃ
analyzed: evam eva nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña ayam saddharmapuṇḍarīkaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ sarveṣām  sattvānām śaikṣa aśaikṣāṇām ca sarva śrāvakāṇām pratyekabuddhānām bodhisattva yāna saṃprasthitānām
translated: “In the same way, Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma🔽performs the duties of a father for all beings, for all the śrāvakas and pratyeka­buddhas who are training and beyond training,

original: ca pitṛkāryaṃ karoti /
analyzed: ca pitṛ kāryam karoti
translated: and for those who have set out in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas.

original: tadyathāpi nāma nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña sarvabālapṛthagjanānatikrāntaḥ srotaāpannaḥ sakṛdāgāmī anāgāmī arhan pratyekabuddhaśca /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumitābhijña sarva bāla pṛthagjana an atikrāntaḥ srotaāpannaḥ sakṛdāgāmī anāgāmī arhan pratyekabuddhaḥ ca
translated: “Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, it is like when a stream-enterer, a once-returner, a non-returner, an arhat, or a pratyekabuddha has transcended all childish ordinary beings.

original: evameva nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña ayaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīko dharmaparyāyaḥ sarvāṃstathāgatabhāṣitān sūtrāntānatikramya abhyudgato mūrdhaprāpto 🔽veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: evam eva nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña ayam saddharmapuṇḍarīkaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ sarvān tathāgata bhāṣitān sūtrāntān atikramya abhyudgataḥ mūrdha prāptaḥ  veditavyaḥ
translated: “In the same way, Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma surpasses all the sūtras taught by the tathāgatas and is supreme and exalted.🔽“You should know that, Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña,

original: te 'pi nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña sattvā🔽mūrdhaprāptā veditavyāḥ /
analyzed: te sattvā  mūrdha prāptāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: those beings

original: ye khalvimaṃ sūtrarājaṃ dhārayiṣyanti /
analyzed: ye khalu imam sūtrarājam dhārayiṣyanti
translated: who possess this king of sūtras should be known to be supreme.

original: tadyathāpi nāma nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhānāṃ bodhisattvo 'gra ākhyāyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumitābhijña sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhānām bodhisattvaḥ gre ākhyāyate
translated: “For example, Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, the bodhisattvas are said to be supreme among all the śrāvakas and pratyeka­buddhas.

original: evameva nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña ayaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīko dharmaparyāyaḥ sarveṣāṃ tathāgatabhāṣitānāṃ sutrāntānāmagra ākhyāyate /
analyzed: evam eva nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña ayam saddharmapuṇḍarīkaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ sarveṣām tathāgata bhāṣitānām sutrāntānām agre ākhyāyate
translated: In the same way, Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma is said to be supreme among all the sūtras taught by the tathāgatas.

original: tadyathāpi nāma nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña sarveṣāṃ śrāvakapratyekabuddhabodhisattvānāṃ tathāgato dharmarājaḥ paṭṭabaddhaḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumitābhijña sarveṣām śrāvaka pratyekabuddha bodhisattvānām tathāgataḥ dharmarājaḥ paṭṭa baddhaḥ
translated: “For example, Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, the Tathāgata, the Dharma King, is crowned king

original: evameva nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña ayaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīko dharmaparyāyastathāgatabhūto bodhisattvayānasaṃprasthitānām /
analyzed: evam eva nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña ayam saddharmapuṇḍarīkaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ tathāgata bhūtaḥ bodhisattva yāna saṃprasthitānām
translated: “In the same way, Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma is like the Tathāgata for those who have set out in the Bodhisattva­yāna.

original: trātā khalvapi nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña ayaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīko dharmaparyāyaḥ sarvasattvānāṃ sarvabhayebhyaḥ /
analyzed: trātā khalu api nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña ayam saddharmapuṇḍarīkaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ sarva sattvānām sarva bhayebhyaḥ
translated: “Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma is a savior from all fears for all beings.

original: vimocakaḥ sarvaduḥkhebhyaḥ /
analyzed: vimocakaḥ sarva duḥkhebhyaḥ
translated: It is a liberator from all suffering.

original: taḍāga iva tṛṣitānāmagniriva śītārtānāṃ cailamiva nagnānāṃ sārthavāha iva vaṇijānāṃ
analyzed: taḍāgaḥ iva tṛṣitānām agniḥ iva śīta ārtānām cailam iva nagnānām sārthavāhaḥ iva vaṇijānām
translated: It is like a pool for those who are thirsty, like a fire for those who are cold, like clothing for those who are naked, like a caravan leader for merchants,

original: māteva putrāṇāṃ nauriva pāragāmināṃ vaidya iva āturāṇāṃ dīpa iva tamondhakārāvṛtānāṃ
analyzed: mātā iva putrāṇām nauḥ iva pāra gāminām vaidyaḥ iva āturāṇām dīpaḥ iva tamaḥ ndhakāra āvṛtānām
translated: like a mother for her children, like a boat for those who are traveling across the water, like a doctor for the sick, like a lamp in the darkness,

original: ratnamiva dhanārthināṃ cakravartīva sarvakoṭṭarājānāṃ samudra iva saritāmulkeva sarvatamondhakāravidhamanāya /
analyzed: ratnam iva dhana arthinām cakravartī iva sarva koṭṭa rājānām samudraḥ iva saritām ulkā iva sarva tamaḥ ndhakāra vidhamanāya
translated: like a jewel for those who seek wealth, like a cakravartin for all the minor kings, like the ocean for rivers, and like a torch for dispelling all the darkness of the night.

original: evameva nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña ayaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīko dharmaparyāyaḥ sarvaduḥkhapramocakaḥ sarvavyādhicchedakaḥ sarvasaṃsārabhayabandhanasaṃkaṭapramocakaḥ
analyzed: evam eva nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña ayam saddharmapuṇḍarīkaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ sarva duḥkha pramocakaḥ sarva vyādhi chedakaḥ sarva saṃsāra bhaya bandhana saṃkaṭa pramocakaḥ
translated: In the same way, Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma liberates from all suffering, severs all illnesses, and liberates from all the fears, bonds, and calamities of saṃsāra.

original: yena cāyaṃ nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña saddharmapuṇḍarīko dharmaparyāyaḥ śruto bhaviṣyati /🔽yaśca likhati /
analyzed: yena ca ayam nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña saddharmapuṇḍarīkaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ śrutaḥ bhaviṣyati  yaḥ ca likhati
translated: Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, whoever hears this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma,🔽and whoever writes it,

original: yaśca lekhayati /
analyzed: yaḥ ca lekhayati
translated: and whoever has it written,

original: eṣāṃ nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña puṇyābhisaṃskārāṇāṃ bauddhena jñānena na śakyaṃ paryanto 'dhigantum /
analyzed: eṣām nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña puṇya abhisaṃskārāṇām bauddhena jñānena na śakyam paryantaḥ dhigantum
translated: Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, the extent of the creation of merit from these cannot be known through the knowledge of the buddhas.

original: yāvantaṃ puṇyābhisaṃskāraṃ sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā prasaviṣyati /
analyzed: yāvantam puṇya abhisaṃskāram sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā prasaviṣyati
translated: The extent of the creation of merit that the noble man or noble woman will create🔽by possessing this Dharma teaching, by reading it, by teaching it, by listening to it, by writing it,

original: ya imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ dhārayitvā vācayitvā vā deśayitvā vā śrutvā vā likhitvā Vaidya
analyzed: yaḥ imam dharmaparyāyam dhārayitvā vācayitvā vā deśayitvā vā śrutvā vā likhitvā vaidya
translated: or by having it written,

original: vā pustakagataṃ vā kṛtvā satkuryāt gurukuryānmānayet pūjayet puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākavaijayantībhirvādyavastrāñjalikarmabhirvā
analyzed: vā pustaka gatam vā kṛtvā satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patāka vaijayantībhiḥ vādya vastra añjali karmabhiḥ vā
translated: or having written it in a book, he should honor it, respect it, venerate it, make offerings to it with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, flags, and with the performance of prostrations,

original: ghṛtapradīpairvā gandhatailapradīpairvācampakatailapradīpairvā sumanātailapradīpairvā
analyzed: ghṛta pradīpaiḥ vā gandhataila pradīpaiḥ vā ācampaka taila pradīpaiḥ vā sumanā taila pradīpaiḥ vā
translated: with ghee lamps, with perfumed oil lamps, with campaka oil lamps, with jasmine oil lamps,

original: pāṭalatailapradipairvā vārṣikatailapradīpairvā navamālikātailapradīpairvā bahuvidhābhiśca
analyzed: pāṭala taila pradipaiḥ vā vārṣika taila pradīpaiḥ vā navamālikā taila pradīpaiḥ vā bahuvidhābhiḥ ca
translated: with trumpet-flower oil lamps, with rainy season oil lamps, with jasmine-of-the-forest oil lamps, and with many kinds of

original: pūjābhiḥ satkāraṃ kuryād gurukāraṃ kuryāt mānanāṃ kuryāt pūjanāṃ kuryāt /🔽bahu sa nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña bodhisattvayānasaṃprasthitaḥ
analyzed: pūjābhiḥ satkāram kuryāt gurukāram kuryāt mānanām kuryāt pūjanām kuryāt  bahu sa nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña bodhisattva yāna saṃprasthitaḥ
translated: offerings, he should make offerings to it, respect it, honor it, and worship it.🔽That noble son or daughter who possesses this chapter on the past life of the Medicine King, who recites it, and who listens to it will generate much merit.

original: kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā puṇyaṃ prasaviṣyati ya imaṃ bhaiṣajyarājapūvayogaparivartaṃ dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati śroṣyati /
analyzed: kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā puṇyam prasaviṣyati yaḥ imam bhaiṣajya rājapūva yoga parivartam dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati śroṣyati
translated: Nakṣatra-rāja-saṃkusumitābhi-jña, the noble son or daughter who possesses this chapter on the past life of the Medicine King, who recites it, and who listens to it will generate much merit.

original: sacet punarnakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña mātṛgrāma imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śrutvā udgahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati tasya sa eva paścimaḥ strībhāvo bhaviṣyati
analyzed: saced punar nakṣatra rāja saṃkusumita abhijña mātṛgrāmaḥ imam dharmaparyāyam śrutvā udgahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati tasya saḥ eva paścimaḥ strī bhāvaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: “Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, if a woman hears this Dharma teaching, and having heard it, she accepts it, memorizes it, and teaches it, that will be her last existence as a woman.

original: yaḥ kaścinnakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña imaṃ bhaiṣajyarājapūrvayogaparivartaṃ paścimāyāṃ🔽pañcāśatyāṃ śrutvā mātṛgrāmaḥ pratipatsyate sa khalvataścyutaḥ sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāvupapatsyate
analyzed: yaḥ kaścid nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijñaḥ imam bhaiṣajya rāja pūrva yoga parivartam paścimāyām  pañcāśatyām śrutvā mātṛgrāmaḥ pratipatsyate sa khalu atas cyutaḥ sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyate
translated: “Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, any woman who hears this chapter, ‘The Past of Bhaiṣajya­rāja,’ in the latter time,

original: yasyāṃ sa bhagavānamitāyustathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho bodhisattvagaṇaparivṛtastiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati /
analyzed: yasyām sa bhagavān amita āyuḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ bodhisattva gaṇa parivṛtaḥ tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati
translated: in the latter five hundred years, after my passing into nirvāṇa, will be reborn in Sukhāvatī, the world system where the Tathāgata Amitāyus resides, is present, and lives.

original: sa tasyāṃ padmagarbhe siṃhāsane niṣaṇṇa upapatsyate /
analyzed: sa tasyām padmagarbhe siṃhāsane niṣaṇṇaḥ upapatsyate
translated: She will be reborn there on a lotus seat in the center of a lotus.

original: na ca tasya rāgo vyābādhiṣyate /
analyzed: na ca tasya rāgaḥ vyābādhiṣyate
translated: She will not be afflicted by desire,

original: na dveṣo na moho na māno na mātsaryaṃ na krodho na vyāpādaḥ /
analyzed: na dveṣaḥ na mohaḥ na mānaḥ na mātsaryam na krodhaḥ na vyāpādaḥ
translated: or by anger, or by ignorance, or by pride, or by envy, or by anger, or by malice.

original: sahopapannāśca pañcābhijñāḥ pratilapsyate /
analyzed: saha upapannāḥ ca pañca abhijñāḥ pratilapsyate
translated: As soon as she is reborn there she will attain the five higher knowledges.

original: anutpattikadharmakṣāntiṃ ca pratilapsyate /
analyzed: anutpattikadharmakṣāntim ca pratilapsyate
translated: She will attain the acceptance of the non-arising of phenomena.

original: anutpattikadharmakṣāntipratilabdhaḥ sa khalu punarnakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña bodhisattvo mahāsattvo dvāsaptatigaṅgānadīvālikāsamāṃstathāgatān
analyzed: anutpattika dharma kṣānti pratilabdhaḥ sa khalu punar nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ dvāsaptati gaṅgā nadī vālikā samān tathāgatān  /
translated: Nakṣatra-rāja-saṃkusumitābhi-jña, that bodhisattva mahāsattva, who had attained the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas, served🔽🔽seventy-two times as many tathāgatas as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River,

original: drakṣyati /
analyzed: drakṣyati
translated: “Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, that bodhisattva mahāsattva, who has attained the acceptance of the nonarising of phenomena, will see tathāgatas as numerous as the grains of sand in seventy-two Ganges Rivers.

original: tādṛśaṃ cāsya cakṣurindriyaṃ pariśuddhaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tādṛśam ca asya cakṣuḥ indriyam pariśuddham bhaviṣyati
translated: “He will have such pure eyes

original: yena cakṣurindriyeṇa pariśuddhena tān buddhān bhagavato drakṣyati /
analyzed: yena cakṣuḥ indriyeṇa pariśuddhena tān buddhān bhagavataḥ drakṣyati
translated: that with those pure eyes he will see those buddha bhagavāns.

original: te cāsya buddhā bhagavantaḥ sādhukāramanupradāsyanti sādhu sādhu kulaputra /🔽yattvayā saddharmapuṇḍarīkaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śrutvā tasya bhagavataḥ śākyamunestathāgatasyārhataḥ
analyzed: te ca asya buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ sādhukāram anupradāsyanti sādhu sādhu kula putra  yat tvayā saddharmapuṇḍarīkam dharmaparyāyam śrutvā tasya bhagavataḥ śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya arhataḥ
translated: Those buddha bhagavāns will give their approval to him, saying, ‘Excellent, excellent! Noble one!

original: samyaksaṃbuddhasya pravacane uddiṣṭaṃ svādhyāyitaṃ bhāvitaṃ cintitaṃ manasi kṛtaṃ
analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddhasya pravacane uddiṣṭam svādhyāyitam bhāvitam cintitam manasi kṛtam
translated: You have listened to the Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma, and you have recited it, contemplated on it, meditated on it, and kept it in mind.

original: parasattvānāṃ ca saṃprakāśitam /
analyzed: para sattvānām ca saṃprakāśitam
translated: You have taught it to other beings.

original: ayaṃ te kulaputra puṇyābhisaṃskāro na śakyamagninā dagdhuṃ nodakena hartum /
analyzed: ayam te kula putra puṇya abhisaṃskāraḥ na śakyam agninā dagdhum na udakena hartum
translated: Noble one, this accumulation of merit cannot be burned by fire, nor can it be carried away by water.🔽“Noble one, this accumulation of merit cannot be burned by fire, nor can it be carried away by water.

original: ayaṃ te kulaputra puṇyābhisaṃskāro na śakyaṃ buddhasahesreṇāpi nirdeṣṭum /
analyzed: ayam te kula putra puṇya abhisaṃskāraḥ na śakyam buddha sahesreṇa api nirdeṣṭum
translated: This merit-making of yours, noble sir, cannot be described even by a thousand Buddhas.

original: vihatamārapratyarthikastvaṃ kulaputra uttīrṇabhayasaṃgrāmo marditaśatrukaṇṭakaḥ /
analyzed: vihata māra pratyarthikaḥ tvam kula putraḥ uttīrṇa bhaya saṃgrāmaḥ mardita śatru kaṇṭakaḥ
translated: You, noble sir, have defeated Mara and his adversaries, you have crossed over fear and battle, you have crushed the enemy and the thorn.

original: buddhaśatasahasrādhiṣṭhito 'si /
analyzed: buddha śata sahasra adhiṣṭhitaḥ si
translated: You are blessed by a hundred thousand Buddhas.

original: na tava kulaputra sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake saśramaṇabrāhmaṇikāyāṃ prajāyāṃ sadṛśo vidyate tathāgatamekaṃ vinirmucya /
analyzed: na tava kula putra sa devake loke sa mārake sa brahmake sa śramaṇa brāhmaṇikāyām prajāyām sadṛśaḥ vidyate tathāgatam ekam vinirmucya
translated: In the world with its gods, Maras, Brahmas, with its beings including ascetics and brahmins, there is none equal to you, noble sir, except for the Tathagata.

original: nānyaḥ kaścicchrāvako vā pratyekabuddho vā bodhisattvo vā yastvāṃ śaktaḥ puṇyena vā prajñayā vā samādhinā vā abhibhavitum /
analyzed: na anyaḥ kaścid śrāvakaḥ vā pratyekabuddhaḥ vā bodhisattvaḥ vā yaḥ tvām śaktaḥ puṇyena vā prajñayā vā samādhinā vā abhibhavitum
translated: There is no other disciple or solitary buddha or bodhisattva who is able to surpass you in merit, wisdom, or samadhi.

original: evaṃ jñānabalādhānaprāptaḥ sa nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña bodhisattvo bhaviṣyati //
analyzed: evam jñāna bala ādhāna prāptaḥ sa nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña bodhisattvaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Thus, Akasagarbhas, that bodhisattva will attain the power and blessing of wisdom.

original: yaḥ kaścinnakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña imaṃ bhaiṣajyarājapūrvayogaparivartaṃ bhāṣyamāṇaṃ śrutvā sādhukāramanupradāsyati /
analyzed: yaḥ kaścid nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijñaḥ imam bhaiṣajya rāja pūrvayoga parivartam bhāṣyamāṇam śrutvā sādhukāram anupradāsyati
translated: Whoever, Akasagarbhas, having heard this chapter on the past lives of Bhaisajyaraja being taught, will give a 'well done!'

original: tasyotpalagandho mukhādvāsyati /
analyzed: tasya utpala gandhaḥ mukhāt vāsyati
translated: From his mouth will come the fragrance of the blue lotus.

original: gātrebhyaścāsya candanagandho bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: gātrebhyaḥ ca asya candana gandhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And the fragrance of sandalwood will emanate from his body.

original: ya iha dharmaparyāye sādhukāraṃ dāsyati /
analyzed: yaḥ iha dharmaparyāye sādhukāram dāsyati
translated: Whoever gives a 'good' in this Dharma discourse,

original: tasyema evaṃrūpā dṛṣṭadhārmikā guṇānuśaṃsā bhaviṣyanti / Vaidya
analyzed: tasya ime evaṃrūpāḥ dṛṣṭa dhārmikāḥ guṇa anuśaṃsāḥ bhaviṣyanti vaidya
translated: For him, these kinds of visible qualities and benefits will occur,

original: ye mayaitarhi nirdiṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: ye mayā etarhi nirdiṣṭāḥ
translated: as indicated by me now.

original: tasmāttarhi nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña anuparindāmyahamimaṃ sarvasattvapriyadarśanasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya pūrvayogaparivartam /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña anuparindāmi aham imam sarvasattvapriyadarśanasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya pūrva yoga parivartam
translated: Therefore, Nakṣatra-rāja Saṃkusumita, I entrust this chapter on the past lives of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva-sattva-priya-darśana,

original: yathā paścime kāle paścime samaye paścimāyāṃ pañcāśatyāṃ vartamānāyāmasmin jambudvīpe pracaret /
analyzed: yathā paścime kāle paścime samaye paścimāyām pañcāśatyām vartamānāyām asmin jambudvīpe pracaret
translated: so that in the future time, in the future period, in the last five hundred years when it is being practiced in this Jambudvīpa,

original: nāntardhānaṃ gacchet /
analyzed: na antardhānam gacchet
translated: it will not disappear.

original: na ca māraḥ pāpīyānavatāraṃ labhet /
analyzed: na ca māraḥ pāpīyān avatāram labhet
translated: And Māra the evil one will not find an opportunity.

original: na mārakāyikā devatāḥ /
analyzed: na māra kāyikāḥ devatāḥ
translated: Nor will the gods of Māra's retinue.

original: na nāgā na yakṣā na gandharvā na kumbhāṇḍā avatāraṃ labheyuḥ /
analyzed: na nāgāḥ na yakṣāḥ na gandharvāḥ na kumbhāṇḍāḥ avatāram labheyuḥ
translated: Nor will nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, or kumbhāṇḍas find an opportunity.

original: tasmāttarhi nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña adhitiṣṭhāmīmaṃ dharmaparyāyamasmin jambudvīpe /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña adhitiṣṭhāmi imam dharmaparyāyam asmin jambudvīpe
translated: Therefore, Nakṣatra-rāja Saṃkusumita, I authorize this Dharma discourse in this Jambudvīpa.

original: bhaiṣajyabhūto bhaviṣyati glānānāṃ sattvānāṃ vyādhispṛṣṭānām /
analyzed: bhaiṣajya bhūtaḥ bhaviṣyati glānānām sattvānām vyādhi spṛṣṭānām
translated: He will become a medicine for sick beings who are afflicted by disease.

original: imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śrutvā vyādhiḥ kāye na kramiṣyati /
analyzed: imam dharmaparyāyam śrutvā vyādhiḥ kāye na kramiṣyati
translated: Having heard this Dharma discourse, disease will not affect the body.

original: na jarā nākālamṛtyuḥ /
analyzed: na jarā na akāla mṛtyuḥ
translated: There will be no old age or untimely death.

original: sacet punarnakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña yaḥ kaścid bodhisattvayānasaṃprasthitaḥ paśyedevaṃrūpaṃ sūtrāntadhārakaṃ bhikṣum /
analyzed: saced punar nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña yaḥ kaścid bodhisattva yāna saṃprasthitaḥ paśyet evaṃrūpam sūtrānta dhārakam bhikṣum
translated: If, Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, someone who has set out in the Bodhisattva-yāna were to see a bhikṣu who upholds such a sūtra,

original: taṃ candanacūrṇairnīlotpalairabhyakiret /
analyzed: tam candana cūrṇaiḥ nīlotpalaiḥ abhyakiret
translated: and were to scatter sandalwood powder and blue lotuses over him,

original: abhyavakīrya caivaṃ cittamutpādayitavyam gamiṣyatyayaṃ kulaputro bodhimaṇḍam /
analyzed: abhyavakīrya ca evam cittam utpādayitavyam gamiṣyati ayam kula putraḥ bodhimaṇḍam
translated: and having scattered them were to arouse the thought, 'This noble son will go to the seat of awakening,

original: grahīṣyatyayaṃ tṛṇāni /
analyzed: grahīṣyati ayam tṛṇāni
translated: he will take up grass,

original: prajñapayiṣyatyayaṃ bodhimaṇḍe tṛṇasaṃstaram /
analyzed: prajñapayiṣyati ayam bodhimaṇḍe tṛṇa saṃstaram
translated: he will spread out a grass mat on the seat of awakening,

original: kariṣyatyayaṃ mārayakṣaparājayam /🔽prapūrayiṣyatyayaṃ dharmaśaṅkham /
analyzed: kariṣyati ayam māra yakṣa parājayam  prapūrayiṣyati ayam dharma śaṅkham
translated: he will defeat Māra and his yakṣas,🔽he will blow the conch of the Dharma,

original: parāhaniṣyatyayaṃ dharmabherīm /
analyzed: parāhaniṣyati ayam dharma bherīm
translated: he will beat the drum of the Dharma,

original: uttariṣyatyayaṃ bhavasāgaram /
analyzed: uttariṣyati ayam bhava sāgaram
translated: he will cross the ocean of existence,'🔽 Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, that noble son who has set out in the Bodhisattva-yāna should think like this:

original: evaṃ nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña tena bodhisattvayānasaṃprasthitena kulaputreṇa
analyzed: evam nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña tena bodhisattva yāna saṃprasthitena kula putreṇa
translated: Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, that noble son who has set out in the Bodhisattva-yāna should think like this:🔽 Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, that noble son who has set out in the Bodhisattva-yāna should think like this:🔽 Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, that noble son who has set out in the Bodhisattva-yāna should think like this:🔽 Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, that noble son who has set out in the Bodhisattva-yāna should think like this:🔽 Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, that noble son who has set out in the Bodhisattva-yāna should think like this:🔽 Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, that noble son who has set out in the Bodhisattva-yāna should think like this:🔽 Nakṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña, that noble son who has set out in the Bodhisattva-yāna should think like this:🔽 Nak

original: vā kuladuhitrā vā evaṃrūpaṃ sūtrāntadhārakaṃ bhikṣuṃ dṛṣṭvā evaṃ cittamutpādayitavyam
analyzed: vā kula duhitrā vā evaṃrūpam sūtrānta dhārakam bhikṣum dṛṣṭvā evam cittam utpādayitavyam
translated: or a noble woman, having seen such a monk who upholds this sutra, should give rise to this thought:

original: ityetādṛśāścāsya guṇānuśaṃsā bhaviṣyanti yādṛśāstathāgatena nirdiṣṭāḥ //
analyzed: iti etādṛśāḥ ca asya guṇa anuśaṃsāḥ bhaviṣyanti yādṛśāḥ tathāgatena nirdiṣṭāḥ
translated: Such will be his qualities and benefits, as described by the Tathagata.

original: asmin khalu punarbhaiṣajyapūrvayogaparivarte nirdiśyamāne caturaśītīnāṃ bodhisattvasahasrāṇāṃ sarvarutakauśalyānugatāyā dhāraṇyāḥ pratilambho 🔽'bhūt /
analyzed: asmin khalu punar bhaiṣajya pūrva yoga parivarte nirdiśyamāne caturaśītīnām bodhisattva sahasrāṇām sarva ruta kauśalya anugatāyāḥ dhāraṇyāḥ pratilambhaḥ  bhūt
translated: When this chapter on the past life of Bhaisajya-raja was being taught, eighty-four thousand bodhisattvas attained the power of retention that follows from all melodious sounds.

original: sa ca bhagavān prabhūtaratnastathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sādhukāramadāt sādhu sādhu nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijña /
analyzed: sa ca bhagavān prabhūtaratnaḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sādhukāram adāt sādhu sādhu nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijña
translated: And the Blessed One, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha Prabhutaratna, gave his approval, saying, Excellent, excellent! Constellation King Flower Radiance!

original: yatra hi nāma tvamevamacintyaguṇadharmastathāgatena nirdiṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: yatra hi nāma tvam evam acintya guṇa dharmaḥ tathāgatena nirdiṣṭaḥ
translated: For you have been indicated by the Tathagata as having such inconceivable qualities.

original: tvaṃ cācintyaguṇadharmasamanvāgataṃ tathāgataṃ paripṛcchasīti //
analyzed: tvam ca acintya guṇa dharma samanvāgatam tathāgatam paripṛcchasi iti
translated: And you ask about the Tathagata who is endowed with inconceivable qualities.

original: iti śrīsaddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye bhaiṣajyarājapūrvayogaparivarto nāma dvāviṃśatimaḥ //
analyzed: iti śrī saddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye bhaiṣajyarājapūrvayogaparivartaḥ nāma dvāviṃśatimaḥ
translated: Thus concludes the chapter on the past life of Bhaisajya-raja, the twenty-second chapter in the Dharma teaching of the White Lotus of the Good Dharma.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vaidya

original: gadgadasvaraparivartaḥ /
analyzed: gadgada svara parivartaḥ
translated: The Chapter on the Voice of the Jina

original: atha khalu bhagavān śākyamunistathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhastasyāṃ velāyāṃ mahāpuruṣalakṣaṇād bhrūvivarāntarādūrṇākośāt prabhāṃ pramumoca /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tasyām velāyām mahā puruṣa lakṣaṇāt bhrū vivara antarāt ūrṇā kośāt prabhām pramumoca
translated: Then at that time the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha Śākyamuni emitted a light from the ūrṇā hair between his eyebrows, which was a mark of a great being.

original: yayā prabhayā pūrvasyāṃ diśi aṣṭādaśagaṅgānadīvālikāsamāni buddhakṣetrakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi ābhayā sphuṭānyabhūvan /
analyzed: yayā prabhayā pūrvasyām diśi aṣṭādaśa gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāni buddhakṣetra koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi ābhayā sphuṭāni abhūvan
translated: By that light, eighteen hundred thousand koṭis of nayutas of buddha-fields in the eastern direction were illuminated.

original: tāni ca aṣṭādaśagaṅgānadīvālikāsamāni buddhakṣetrakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇyatikramya vairocanaraśmipratimaṇḍitā nāma lokadhātuḥ /
analyzed: tāni ca aṣṭādaśa gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāni buddhakṣetra koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi atikramya vairocanaraśmipratimaṇḍitā nāma lokadhātuḥ
translated: And having passed beyond those eighteen hundred thousand koṭis of nayutas of buddha-fields, there was a world system called Adorned with the Light of Vairocana.

original: tatra kamaladalavimalanakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijño nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhastiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati vipulenāyuṣpramāṇena /
analyzed: tatra kamaladalavimalanakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijñaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati vipulena āyuṣpramāṇena
translated: There the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One named Kamala-dala-vimala-nakṣatra-rāja-saṃkusumitâbhijña was dwelling, remaining alive, and living. He had a vast life-span.

original: vipulena bodhisattvasaṃghena sārdhaṃ parivṛtaḥ puraskṛto dharmaṃ deśayati sma /
analyzed: vipulena bodhisattva saṃghena sārdham parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ dharmam deśayati sma
translated: He was surrounded and attended by a vast saṅgha of bodhisattvas, and he was teaching the Dharma.

original: atha khalu yā bhagavatā śākyamuninā tathāgatenārhatā samyaksaṃbuddhenorṇākośāt prabhā pramuktāḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu yā bhagavatā śākyamuninā tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena ūrṇā kośāt prabhā pramuktāḥ
translated: Then, the light that was emitted from the tuft of white hair between the eyebrows of the Blessed One, the Thus-Gone One, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One Śākyamuni,

original: sā tasyāṃ velāyāṃ vairocanaraśmipratimaṇḍitāṃ lokadhātuṃ mahatyā ābhayā spharati sma /
analyzed: sā tasyām velāyām vairocana raśmi pratimaṇḍitām lokadhātum mahatyā ābhayā spharati sma
translated: at that time pervaded the world realm Adorned with the Radiance of Vairocana with a great light.

original: tasyāṃ khalu punarvairocanaraśmipratimaṇḍitāyāṃ lokadhātau gadgadasvaro nāma bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prativasati sma avaropitakuśalamūlaḥ /
analyzed: tasyām khalu punar vairocana raśmi pratimaṇḍitāyām lokadhātau gadgadasvaraḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prativasati sma avaropita kuśala mūlaḥ
translated: In that world realm Adorned with the Radiance of Vairocana, there dwelt a bodhisattva mahāsattva named Gagana-garjita-ghoṣa-susvarana, who had planted the roots of virtue,

original: dṛṣṭapūrvāśca tena bahūnāṃ tathāgatānāmarhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāmevaṃrūpā raśmyavabhāsāḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭa pūrvāḥ ca tena bahūnām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām evaṃrūpāḥ raśmi avabhāsāḥ
translated: and who had seen such light rays and radiance of many thus-gone ones, worthy ones, perfectly enlightened ones.

original: bahusamādhipratilabdhaśca sa gadgadasvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ /
analyzed: bahu samādhi pratilabdhaḥ ca sa gadgada svaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Gagana-garjita-ghoṣa-susvara had attained many samādhis.

original: tadyathā dhvajāgrakeyūrasamādhipratilabdhaḥ saddharmapuṇḍarīkasamādhipratilabdho
analyzed: tat yathā dhvaja agra keyūra samādhi pratilabdhaḥ saddharmapuṇḍarīka samādhi pratilabdhaḥ
translated: For example, he had attained the samādhi of the crest jewel of the banner, he had attained the samādhi of the white lotus of the good Dharma,

original: vimaladattasamādhipratilabdho nakṣatrarājavikrīḍitasamādhipratilabdhaḥ anilambhasamādhipratilabdho
analyzed: vimaladatta samādhi pratilabdhaḥ nakṣatra rāja vikrīḍita samādhi pratilabdhaḥ anilambha samādhi pratilabdhaḥ
translated: he had attained the samādhi of the gift of purity, he had attained the samādhi of the play of the king of constellations, he had attained the samādhi of non-apprehension,

original: jñānamudrāsamādhipratilabdhaḥ candrapradīpasamādhipratilabdhaḥ sarvarutakauśalyasamādhipratilabdhaḥ
analyzed: jñāna mudrā samādhi pratilabdhaḥ candra pradīpa samādhi pratilabdhaḥ sarva ruta kauśalya samādhi pratilabdhaḥ
translated: He had attained the knowledge-mudra samadhi, the moon-lamp samadhi, the samadhi skilled in all sounds,

original: sarvapuṇyasamuccayasamādhipratilabdhaḥ prasādavatīsamādhipratilabdhaḥ ṛddhivikrīḍitasamādhipratilabdho
analyzed: sarva puṇya samuccaya samādhi pratilabdhaḥ prasādavatī samādhi pratilabdhaḥ ṛddhi vikrīḍita samādhi pratilabdhaḥ
translated: the samadhi of accumulating all merits, the clear-minded samadhi, the samadhi of playfully manifesting supernatural powers,

original: jñānolkāsamādhipratilabdho vyūharājasamādhipratilabdho vimalaprabhāsasamādhipratilabdho
analyzed: jñāna ulkā samādhi pratilabdhaḥ vyūharāja samādhi pratilabdhaḥ vimala prabhāsa samādhi pratilabdhaḥ
translated: the knowledge-torch samadhi, the array-king samadhi, the stainless light samadhi,

original: vimalagarbhasamādhipratilabdho 'pkṛtsnasamādhipratilabdhaḥ sūryāvartasamādhipratilabdhaḥ /
analyzed: vimalagarbha samādhi pratilabdhaḥ u pkṛtsna samādhi pratilabdhaḥ sūryāvarta samādhi pratilabdhaḥ
translated: the stainless womb samadhi, the infinite samadhi, the sun-whorl samadhi.

original: peyālaṃ yāvad gaṅgānadīvālikopamasamādhikoṭīnayutaśatasahasrapratilabdho gadgadasvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ /
analyzed: peyālam yāvat gaṅgā nadī vālikā upama samādhi koṭī nayuta śata sahasra pratilabdhaḥ gadgada svaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: And so on, up to: the Gadgada-svara Bodhisattva-mahasattva had attained a hundred thousand koṭi nayuta of samadhis as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river.

original: tasya khalu punargadgadasvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya sā prabhā kāye nipatitābhūt /
analyzed: tasya khalu punar gadgadasvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya sā prabhā kāye nipatitā abhūt
translated: And that light of the Gadgada-svara Bodhisattva-mahasattva fell upon his body.

original: atha khalu gadgadasvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattva utthāyāsanādekāṃsamuttarāsaṅgaṃ kṛtvā dakṣiṇaṃ jānumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavāṃstenāñjaliṃ 🔽praṇāmya taṃ
analyzed: atha khalu gadgada svaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ utthāya āsanāt eka aṃsam uttarāsaṅgam kṛtvā dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavān tena añjalim  praṇāmya tam
translated: bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined,

original: bhagavantaṃ kamaladalavimalanakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijñaṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhametadavocat🔽gamiṣyāmyahaṃ bhagavaṃstāṃ sahāṃ lokadhātuṃ taṃ bhagavantaṃ śākyamuniṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ
analyzed: bhagavantam kamala dala vimala nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumitābhijñam tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham etat avocat  gamiṣyāmi aham bhagavan tām sahām lokadhātum tam bhagavantam śākyamunim tathāgatam arhantam
translated: and said this to the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Kamala-dala-vimala-nakṣatra-rāja-saṃkusumitābhi-jña:

original: samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddham darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya
translated: Blessed One, I wish to go to that Sahā world system to see, pay homage to, and serve the Blessed Tathāgata Śākyamuni, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One,

original: taṃ ca mañjuśriyaṃ kumārabhūtaṃ darśanāya /
analyzed: tam ca mañjuśriyam kumāra bhūtam darśanāya
translated: and to see Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta,

original: taṃ ca bhaiṣajyarājaṃ bodhisattvaṃ darśanāya /
analyzed: tam ca bhaiṣajyarājam bodhisattvam darśanāya
translated: and to see the bodhisattva Bhaiṣajya-rāja,

original: taṃ ca pradānaśūraṃ bodhisattvaṃ darśanāya /
analyzed: tam ca pradāna śūram bodhisattvam darśanāya
translated: and to see the bodhisattva Prānta-koṭika,

original: taṃ ca nakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijñaṃ bodhisattvaṃ darśanāya /
analyzed: tam ca nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijñam bodhisattvam darśanāya
translated: and to see the bodhisattva Nakṣatra-rāja-saṃkusumitābhi-jña,

original: taṃ ca viśiṣṭacāritraṃ bodhisattvaṃ darśanāya /
analyzed: tam ca viśiṣṭa cāritram bodhisattvam darśanāya
translated: and to see the bodhisattva Viśiṣṭa-cāritra,🔽and to see the bodhisattva Pradāna-śūra,

original: taṃ ca vyūharājaṃ bodhisattvaṃ darśanāya /
analyzed: tam ca vyūha rājam bodhisattvam darśanāya
translated: and to see that Vyuharāja Bodhisattva,

original: taṃ ca bhaiṣajyarājasamudgataṃ bodhisattvaṃ darśanāya //
analyzed: tam ca bhaiṣajya rāja samudgatam bodhisattvam darśanāya
translated: and to see that Bodhisattva Bhaiṣajyarāja-samudgata.”

original: atha khalu bhagavān kamaladalavimalanakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijñastathāgato 'rhan
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān kamala dala vimala nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijñaḥ tathāgataḥ rhan
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Kamala-dalavimalanaksatra-raja-saṃkusumita-abhijña,
