analyzed: iyadbhiḥ kula putra rūpa saṃdarśanaiḥ gadgada svaraḥ bodhisatvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ imam saddharmapuṇḍarīkam dharmaparyāyam sattvānām deśayati sma
translated: Son of a good family, with these many appearances of forms, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Gadgadasvara taught this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma to beings.

original: yāvat keṣāṃcid yakṣarūpeṇa gadgadasvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattva imaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīkaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ sattvānāṃ deśayati sma /
analyzed: yāvat keṣāṃcid yakṣa rūpeṇa gadgada svaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ imam saddharmapuṇḍarīkam dharmaparyāyam sattvānām deśayati sma
translated: Up to: for some, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Gadgadasvara taught this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma to beings in the form of a yakṣa.

original: keṣāṃcit surarūpeṇa /🔽keṣāṃcid garūḍarūpeṇa /
analyzed: keṣāṃcid sura rūpeṇa  keṣāṃcid garūḍa rūpeṇa
translated: For some, in the form of a god.🔽For some, in the form of a garuḍa.

original: keṣāṃcit kinnararūpeṇa /
analyzed: keṣāṃcid kinnara rūpeṇa
translated: For some, in the form of a kinnara.

original: keṣāṃcinmahoragarūpeṇa gadgadasvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattva imaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīkaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ sattvānāṃ deśayati sma /
analyzed: keṣāṃcid mahā uraga rūpeṇa gadgada svaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ imam saddharmapuṇḍarīkam dharmaparyāyam sattvānām deśayati sma
translated: For some, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Gadgadasvara taught this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma to beings in the form of a mahoraga.

original: yāvannirayatiryagyoniyamalokākṣaṇopapannānāmapi sattvānāṃ gadgadasvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattva imaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīkaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ deśayaṃstrātā
analyzed: yāvat niraya tiryagyoni yama loka akṣaṇa upapannānām api sattvānām gadgada svaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ imam saddharmapuṇḍarīkam dharmaparyāyam deśayan trātā  /
translated: Up to those beings who are in the inner palace, Gadgadasvara, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, having manifested the form of a woman, teaches this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma

original: bhavati /🔽yāvadantaḥpuramadhyagatānāmapi sattvānāṃ gadgadasvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ strīrūpamabhinirmāya ima saddharmapuṇḍarīkaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ sattvānāṃ 🔽deśayati sma /
analyzed: bhavati  yāvat antaḥpura madhya gatānām api sattvānām gadgada svaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ strī rūpam abhinirmāya saddharmapuṇḍarīkam dharmaparyāyam sattvānām  deśayati sma
translated: to those beings.

original: asyāṃ sahāyāṃ lokadhātau sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayati sma /
analyzed: asyām sahāyām lokadhātau sattvānām dharmam deśayati sma
translated: He teaches the Dharma to the beings in this Sahā world realm.

original: trātā khalvapi padmaśrīrgadgadasvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sahāyāṃ lokadhātāvupapannānāṃ sattvānām /🔽tasyāṃ ca sahāyāṃ lokadhātāveva sa gadgadasvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattva iyadbhī rūpanimittairimaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīkaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ sattvānāṃ
analyzed: trātā khalu api padmaśrīḥ gadgada svaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sahāyām lokadhātau upapannānām sattvānām  tasyām ca sahāyām lokadhātau eva sa gadgada svaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ iyadbhiḥ rūpa nimittaiḥ imam saddharmapuṇḍarīkam dharmaparyāyam sattvānām
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Gadgadasvara is a savior for the beings who have been born in the Sahā world realm.🔽And in that Sahā world realm, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Gadgadasvara teaches this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma to beings

original: deśayati /
analyzed: deśayati
translated: with that many forms.

original: na cāsya satpuruṣasya ṛddhihānirnāpi prajñāhāniḥ /
analyzed: na ca asya sat puruṣasya ṛddhi hāniḥ na api prajñā hāniḥ
translated: But there is no loss of the spiritual powers of that good man, nor is there any loss of his wisdom.

original: iyadbhiḥ kulaputra jñānāvabhāsairgadgadasvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'syāṃ sahāyāṃ lokadhātau prajñāyate /
analyzed: iyadbhiḥ kula putra jñāna avabhāsaiḥ gadgada svaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ syām sahāyām lokadhātau prajñāyate
translated: “Noble one, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Gadgadasvara is known in this Sahā world realm through those many lights of wisdom.

original: anyeṣu ca gaṅgānadīvālikāsameṣu lokadhātuṣu bodhisattvavaineyānāṃ🔽sattvānāṃ bodhisattvarūpeṇa dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: anyeṣu ca gaṅgā nadī vālikā sameṣu lokadhātuṣu bodhisattva vaineyānām  sattvānām bodhisattva rūpeṇa dharmam deśayati
translated: In other world realms, numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, he teaches the Dharma in the form of a bodhisattva to beings who are to be guided by a bodhisattva.

original: śrāvakavaineyānāṃ sattvānāṃ śrāvakarūpeṇa dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: śrāvaka vaineyānām sattvānām śrāvaka rūpeṇa dharmam deśayati
translated: He teaches the Dharma in the form of a śrāvaka to beings who are to be guided by a śrāvaka.

original: pratyekabuddhavaineyānāṃ sattvānāṃ pratyekabuddharūpeṇa dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: pratyekabuddha vaineyānām sattvānām pratyekabuddha rūpeṇa dharmam deśayati
translated: He teaches the Dharma in the form of a pratyekabuddha to beings who are to be guided by a pratyekabuddha.🔽He teaches the Dharma in the form of a tathāgata to beings who are to be guided by a tathāgata.

original: tathāgatavaineyānāṃ sattvānāṃ tathāgatarūpeṇa dharmaṃ deśayati /🔽yāvattathāgatadhātuvaineyānāṃ sattvānāṃ tathāgatadhātuṃ darśayati /
analyzed: tathāgata vaineyānām sattvānām tathāgata rūpeṇa dharmam deśayati  yāvat tathāgata dhātu vaineyānām sattvānām tathāgata dhātum darśayati
translated: He displays the relics of a tathāgata to beings who are to be guided by the relics of a tathāgata.

original: yāvat parinirvāṇavaineyānāṃ sattvānāṃ parinirvṛtamātmānaṃ darśayati /
analyzed: yāvat parinirvāṇa vaineyānām sattvānām parinirvṛtam ātmānam darśayati
translated: He displays himself as having attained parinirvāṇa to beings who are to be guided by his parinirvāṇa.

original: evaṃ jñānabalādhānaprāptaḥ khalu punaḥ padmaśrīrgadgadasvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ //
analyzed: evam jñāna bala ādhāna prāptaḥ khalu punar padma śrīḥ gadgada svaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: In that way, Padmaśrī, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Gadgadasvara has attained the power and the strength of wisdom.”🔽Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Padmaśrī said to the Bhagavān, “Bhagavān, it is marvelous how much the bodhisattva mahāsattva Gadgadasvara has practiced well,🔽how much he has practiced well the Dharma of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas,🔽how much he has practiced well the perfection of patience,🔽how much he has practiced well the perfection of vigor,🔽how much he has practiced well the perfection of dhyāna,🔽how much he has practiced well the perfection of wisdom,🔽how much he has practiced well the perfection of skill in methods,🔽how much he has practiced well the perfection of aspiration,🔽how much he has practiced well the perfection of power,🔽and how much he has practiced well the perfection of knowledge.

original: atha khalu padmaśrīrbodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavantametadavocat avaropitakuśalamūlo 'yaṃ bhagavan gadgadasvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu padmaśrīḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat avaropita kuśala mūlaḥ yam bhagavan gadgada svaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Padmaśrī said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, this bodhisattva mahāsattva Gadgadasvara has planted the roots of virtue.

original: katama eṣa bhagavan samādhiryasmin samādhāvavasthitena gadgadasvareṇa bodhisattvena mahāsattvena iyantaḥ sattvā vinītā iti /🔽evamukte bhagavān śākyamunistathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ padmaśriyaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvametadavocat eṣa hi kulaputra sarvarūpasaṃdarśano
analyzed: katamaḥ eṣa bhagavan samādhiḥ yasmin samādhau avasthitena gadgadasvareṇa bodhisattvena mahāsattvena iyantaḥ sattvāḥ vinītāḥ iti  evam ukte bhagavān śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ padmaśriyam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat eṣa hi kula putra sarva rūpa saṃdarśanaḥ
translated: Blessed One, what is this samādhi in which the bodhisattva mahāsattva Gadgadasvara abides, by which he has guided so many beings?

original: nāma samādhiḥ /
analyzed: nāma samādhiḥ
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Śākyamuni, said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Padmaśrī, Noble son, this is the samādhi called 'Displaying All Forms.'

original: asmin samādhāvavasthitena gadgadasvareṇa bodhisattvena mahāsattvena evamaprameyaḥ sattvārthaḥ kṛtaḥ //
analyzed: asmin samādhau avasthitena gadgadasvareṇa bodhisattvena mahāsattvena evam aprameyaḥ sattva arthaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: Abiding in this samādhi, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Gadgadasvara has accomplished such immeasurable benefit for beings.

original: asmin khalu punargadgadasvaraparivarte nirdiśyamāne yāni gadgadasvareṇa bodhisattvena
analyzed: asmin khalu punar gadgada svara parivarte nirdiśyamāne yāni gadgadasvareṇa bodhisattvena
translated: Moreover, when this chapter of Gadgadasvara was being taught, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Gadgadasvara

original: mahāsattvena sārdhaṃ caturaśītibodhisattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi imāṃ sahāṃ lokadhātumāgatāni /
analyzed: mahāsattvena sārdham caturaśīti bodhisattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi imām sahām lokadhātum āgatāni
translated: together with 8,400,000,000 bodhisattvas, came to this Sahā world system.

original: sarveṣāṃ teṣāṃ sarvarūpasaṃdarśanasya samādheḥ pratilambho 'bhūt /
analyzed: sarveṣām teṣām sarva rūpa saṃdarśanasya samādheḥ pratilambhaḥ bhūt
translated: All of them attained the samādhi called 'Displaying All Forms'.

original: asyāṃ ca sahāyāṃ lokadhātau Vaidya
analyzed: asyām ca sahāyām lokadhātau vaidya
translated: And in this Sahā world system, there were more than could be counted

original: gaṇanāsamatikrāntānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ yeṣāṃ sarvarūpasaṃdarśanasya samādheḥ pratilambho 'bhūt //
analyzed: gaṇanā samatikrāntānām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām yeṣām sarva rūpa saṃdarśanasya samādheḥ pratilambhaḥ bhūt
translated: bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, who attained the samādhi called 'Displaying All Forms'.

original: atha khalu gadgadasvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavataḥ śākyamunestathāgatasyārhataḥ
analyzed: atha khalu gadgada svaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavataḥ śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya arhataḥ
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Gadgadasvara, having made vast and extensive offerings🔽to the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Śākyamuni

original: samyaksaṃbuddhasya tasya ca bhagavataḥ prabhūtaratnasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya
analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddhasya tasya ca bhagavataḥ prabhūtaratnasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya
translated: and to the stūpa of the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Prabhūtaratna,

original: dhātustūpe vipulāṃ vistīrṇāṃ pūjāṃ kṛtvā punarapi saptaratnamaye kūṭāgāre 'bhiruhya
analyzed: dhātustūpe vipulām vistīrṇām pūjām kṛtvā punar api sapta ratna maye kūṭāgāre bhiḥ uhya
translated: again ascended the multi-storied building made of the seven precious materials,

original: prakampadbhiḥ kṣetraiḥ pravarṣadbhiḥ padmaiḥ pravādyamānaistūryakoṭīnayutaśatasahasraiḥ
analyzed: prakampadbhiḥ kṣetraiḥ pravarṣadbhiḥ padmaiḥ pravādyamānaiḥ tūrya koṭī nayuta śata sahasraiḥ
translated: with trembling realms, raining lotuses, and the sound of hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of musical instruments,

original: sārdhaṃ taiścaturaśītibodhisattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasraiḥ parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ punarapi
analyzed: sārdham taiḥ caturaśīti bodhisattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasraiḥ parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ punar api
translated: together with 8,400,000,000,000 bodhisattvas, surrounded and revered, again

original: svaṃ buddhakṣetramabhigataḥ /🔽samabhigamya ca taṃ bhagavantaṃ kamaladalavimalanakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijñaṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhametadavocat kṛto me bhagavan
analyzed: svam buddhakṣetram abhigataḥ  samabhigamya ca tam bhagavantam kamala dala vimala nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumitābhijñam tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham etat avocat kṛtaḥ me bhagavan
translated: together with those 8,400,000,000 bodhisattvas, surrounded and revered, he returned to his own buddha-field.

original: sahāyāṃ lokadhātau sattvārthaḥ /
analyzed: sahāyām lokadhātau sattva arthaḥ
translated: Having arrived, he said this to the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Kamala-dala-vimala-nakṣatra-rāja-saṃkusumitābhi-jña: Blessed One, I have accomplished the welfare of beings in the Sahā world-system.

original: tasya ca bhagavataḥ prabhūtaratnasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya dhātustūpo dṛṣṭaḥ vanditaśca /
analyzed: tasya ca bhagavataḥ prabhūtaratnasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya dhātustūpaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ vanditaḥ ca
translated: I have seen and paid homage to the stūpa of the relics of the Blessed Tathāgata Prabhūtaratna, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: sa ca bhagavān śākyamunistathāgato dṛṣṭo vanditaśca /
analyzed: sa ca bhagavān śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ dṛṣṭaḥ vanditaḥ ca
translated: I have seen and paid homage to the Blessed Tathāgata Śākyamuni.

original: sa ca mañjuśrīḥ kumārabhūto dṛṣṭaḥ /🔽sa ca bhaiṣajyarājo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo vīryabalabegaprāptaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ  sa ca bhaiṣajyarājaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ vīrya bala bega prāptaḥ
translated: I have seen Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta.🔽I have seen the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajyarāja, who has attained the power of diligence and speed.

original: sa ca pradānaśūro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo dṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca pradānaśūraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: I have seen the bodhisattva mahāsattva Pradānaśūra.

original: sarveṣāṃ ca teṣāṃ caturaśītibodhisattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇāṃ sarvarūpasaṃdarśanasya samādheḥ pratilambho 'bhūt //
analyzed: sarveṣām ca teṣām caturaśīti bodhisattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇām sarva rūpa saṃdarśanasya samādheḥ pratilambhaḥ bhūt
translated: And all of them attained the samādhi called “the manifestation of all forms.”🔽When this chapter on the going and coming of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Gadgadasvara was being taught, forty-two thousand bodhisattvas

original: asmin khalu punargadgadasvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya gamanāgamanaparivarte bhāṣyamāṇe dvācatvāriṃśatāṃ bodhisattvasahasrāṇāmanutpattikadharmakṣāntipratilambho 🔽'bhūt /
analyzed: asmin khalu punar gadgadasvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya gamana āgamana parivarte bhāṣyamāṇe dvācatvāriṃśatām bodhisattva sahasrāṇām anutpattika dharma kṣānti pratilambhaḥ  bhūt
translated: attained the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

original: padmaśriyaśca bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya saddharmapuṇḍarīkasya samādheḥ pratilambho 'bhūt //
analyzed: padmaśriyaḥ ca bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya saddharmapuṇḍarīkasya samādheḥ pratilambhaḥ bhūt
translated: And the bodhisattva mahāsattva Padmaśrī attained the samādhi called “the white lotus of the good Dharma.”

original: iti śrīsaddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye gadgadasvaraparivarto nāma trayoviṃśatimaḥ //
analyzed: iti śrī saddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye gadgadasvaraparivartaḥ nāma trayoviṃśatimaḥ
translated: Thus concludes the chapter on Gadgadasvara, the twenty-third chapter in the Dharma teaching of the Lotus Sutra.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidyā

original: samantamukhaparivartaḥ //
analyzed: samantamukha parivartaḥ
translated: The Chapter on the Universal Gate

original: atha khalu akṣayamatirbodhisattvo mahāsattva utthāyāsanādekāṃsamuttarāsaṅgaṃ kṛtvā
analyzed: atha khalu akṣayamatiḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ utthāya āsanāt eka aṃsam uttarāsaṅgam kṛtvā
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Akṣayamati rose from his seat, put his upper robe over one shoulder,

original: dakṣiṇaṃ jānumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavāṃstenāñjaliṃ praṇāmya bhagavantametadavocat
analyzed: dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇāmya bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: placed his right knee on the ground, bowed to the Blessed One with folded hands, and said to the Blessed One:🔽Blessed One, I would like to ask you a question, if you would be so kind as to answer it.

original: kena kāraṇena bhagavan avalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'valokiteśvara ityucyate /
analyzed: kena kāraṇena bhagavan avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ valokiteśvaraḥ iti ucyate
translated: For what reason, Blessed One, is the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara called Avalokiteśvara?

original: evamukte bhagavānakṣayamatiṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvametadavocat iha kulaputra yāvanti sattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi yāni duḥkhāni pratyuanubhavanti /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān akṣaya matim bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat iha kula putra yāvanti sattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi yāni duḥkhāni pratyuanubhavanti
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Akṣayamati, Here, son of noble family, as many as hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of beings experience suffering,

original: tāni sacedavalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya nāmadheyaṃ śṛṇuyuḥ /
analyzed: tāni saced avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya nāmadheyam śṛṇuyuḥ
translated: if they were to hear the name of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara,

original: te sarve tasmādduḥkhaskandhād parimucyeran /
analyzed: te sarve tasmāt duḥkha skandhāt parimucyeran
translated: they would all be freed from that mass of suffering.

original: ye ca kulaputra sattvā avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya nāmadheyaṃ dhārayiṣyanti /
analyzed: ye ca kula putra sattvāḥ avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya nāmadheyam dhārayiṣyanti
translated: And, son of noble family, those beings who will possess the name of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara,

original: sacette mahatyagniskandhe prapateyuḥ /
analyzed: saced te mahati agni skandhe prapateyuḥ
translated: if they were to fall into a great mass of fire,

original: sarve te avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya tejasā tasmānmahato 'gniskandhāt parimucyeran /
analyzed: sarve te avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya tejasā tasmāt mahataḥ gni skandhāt parimucyeran
translated: all of them would be freed from that great mass of fire by the power of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara.

original: sacet punaḥ kulaputra sattvā nadībhiruhyamānā avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyākrandaṃ kuryuḥ /
analyzed: saced punar kula putra sattvāḥ nadībhiḥ uhyamānāḥ avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya ākrandam kuryuḥ
translated: If, noble sir, beings who are being carried away by rivers were to cry out,

original: sarvāstā nadyasteṣāṃ sattvānāṃ gādhaṃ dadyuḥ /
analyzed: sarvāḥ tāḥ nadyaḥ teṣām sattvānām gādham dadyuḥ
translated: all those rivers would give ground to those beings.

original: sacet punaḥ kulaputra sāgaramadhye vahanābhirūḍhānāṃ sattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇāṃ
analyzed: saced punar kula putra sāgara madhye vahana abhirūḍhānām sattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇām
translated: If, noble sir, in the middle of the ocean, hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of beings were aboard a ship,

original: hiraṇyasuvarṇamaṇimuktāvajravaiḍūryaśaṅkhaśilāpravālāśmagarbhamusāragalvalohitamuktādīnāṃ
analyzed: hiraṇya suvarṇa maṇi muktā vajra vaiḍūrya śaṅkha śilā pravāla aśmagarbha musāragalva lohita muktā ādīnām
translated: and they had collected treasures of gold, silver, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch-shells, quartz, coral, emeralds, sapphires, red pearls, and so on,

original: kṛtanidhīnāṃ sa potasteṣāṃ kālikāvātena rākṣasīdvīpe kṣiptaḥ syāt /
analyzed: kṛta nidhīnām sa potaḥ teṣām kālikā vātena rākṣasī dvīpe kṣiptaḥ syāt
translated: and that ship was blown by a stormy wind onto the island of the rākṣasīs,

original: tasmiṃśca kaścidevaikaḥ sattvaḥ syāt yo 'valokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyākrandaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: tasmin ca kaścid eva ekaḥ sattvaḥ syāt yaḥ valokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya ākrandam kuryāt
translated: and among them there were even just one being who would cry out to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara,

original: sarve te parimucyeraṃstasmād rākṣasīdvīpāt /
analyzed: sarve te parimucyeran tasmāt rākṣasīdvīpāt
translated: all of them would be freed from that island of the rākṣasīs.

original: anena khalu punaḥ kulaputra kāraṇena avalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'valokiteśvara iti saṃjñāyate //
analyzed: anena khalu punar kula putra kāraṇena avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ valokiteśvaraḥ iti saṃjñāyate
translated: For this reason, noble sir, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara is known as Avalokiteśvara.”

original: sacet kulaputra kaścideva vadhyotsṛṣṭo 'valokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyākrandaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: saced kula putra kaścid eva vadhya utsṛṣṭaḥ valokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya ākrandam kuryāt
translated: If, son of noble family, someone who is to be executed were to cry out, Avalokiteśvara, the bodhisattva, the great being!

original: tāni teṣāṃ vadhyaghātakānāṃ śastrāṇi vikīryeran /
analyzed: tāni teṣām vadhya ghātakānām śastrāṇi vikīryeran
translated: those executioners' weapons would be scattered.

original: sacet khalu punaḥ kulaputra ayaṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasro lokadhāturyakṣarākṣasaiḥ paripūrṇo bhavet /
analyzed: saced khalu punar kula putra ayam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasraḥ lokadhātuḥ yakṣa rākṣasaiḥ paripūrṇaḥ bhavet
translated: If, son of noble family, this great trichiliocosm were filled with yakṣas and rākṣasas,

original: te 'valokiteśvarasya mahāsattvasya nāmadheyagrahaṇena duṣṭacittā draṣṭumapyaśaktāḥ syuḥ /🔽sacetkhalu punaḥ kulaputra kaścideva sattvo dārvāyasmayairhaḍinigaḍabandhanairbaddho bhavet /
analyzed: te valokiteśvarasya mahāsattvasya nāmadheya grahaṇena duṣṭa cittāḥ draṣṭum api aśaktāḥ syuḥ  saced khalu punar kula putra kaścid eva sattvaḥ dārva ayasmayaiḥ haḍi nigaḍa bandhanaiḥ baddhaḥ bhavet
translated: they would not be able to look at the great being Avalokiteśvara with an evil mind, even if they wanted to.

original: aparādhyanaparādhī vā /
analyzed: aparādhī anaparādhī vā
translated: If, son of noble family, some being were bound with wooden or iron fetters and chains, whether guilty or not,

original: tasyāvalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya nāmadheyagrahaṇena kṣipraṃ tāni haḍinigaḍabandhanāni vivaramanuprayacchanti /
analyzed: tasya avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya nāmadheya grahaṇena kṣipram tāni haḍi nigaḍa bandhanāni vivaram anuprayacchanti
translated: by the mere utterance of the name of the bodhisattva, the great being Avalokiteśvara, those fetters and chains would quickly open up and give way.

original: īdṛśaḥ kulaputra avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prabhāvaḥ //
analyzed: īdṛśaḥ kula putra avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prabhāvaḥ
translated: Such is the power, son of noble family, of the bodhisattva, the great being Avalokiteśvara.

original: sacetkulaputra ayaṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasro lokadhāturdhūrtairamitraiścauraiśca śastrapāṇibhiḥ paripūrṇo bhavet /
analyzed: saced kula putra ayam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasraḥ lokadhātuḥ dhūrtaiḥ amitraiḥ cauraiḥ ca śastra pāṇibhiḥ paripūrṇaḥ bhavet
translated: If, son of noble family, this great trichiliocosm were filled with deceitful enemies and thieves with weapons in hand,

original: tasmiṃścaikaḥ sārthavāho mahāntaṃ sārthaṃ ratnāḍhyamanardhyaṃ gṛhītvā gacchet /
analyzed: tasmin ca ekaḥ sārthavāhaḥ mahāntam sārtham ratna āḍhyam anardhyam gṛhītvā gacchet
translated: and in that [place] a caravan leader were to lead a great caravan carrying precious and valuable goods,

original: te gacchantastāṃścaurān dhūrtān śatrūṃśca śastrahastān paśyeyuḥ /
analyzed: te gacchantaḥ tān caurān dhūrtān śatrūn ca śastra hastān paśyeyuḥ
translated: and while they were going they would see those thieves, deceitful enemies, and those with weapons in hand,

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punarbhītāstrastā aśaraṇamātmānaṃ saṃjānīyuḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar bhītāḥ trastāḥ aśaraṇam ātmānam saṃjānīyuḥ
translated: and having seen them, they would become frightened, terrified, and think of themselves as having no refuge.

original: sa ca sārthavāhastaṃ sārthamevaṃ brūyāt mā bhaiṣṭa kulaputrāḥ /
analyzed: sa ca sārthavāhaḥ tam sārtham evam brūyāt mā bhaiṣṭa kula putrāḥ
translated: And that caravan leader would say to that caravan: Do not be afraid, sons of noble family!

original: mā bhaiṣṭa /
analyzed: mā bhaiṣṭa
translated: Do not be afraid!

original: abhayaṃdadamavalokiteśvaraṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamekasvareṇa sarve samākrandadhvam /
analyzed: abhayaṃdadam avalokiteśvaram bodhisattvam mahāsattvam eka svareṇa sarve samākrandadhvam
translated: With one voice, all of you should cry out to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara, the giver of fearlessness.

original: tato yūyamasmāccaurabhayādamitrabhayāt kṣiprameva parimokṣyadhve /
analyzed: tatas yūyam asmāt caura bhayāt amitra bhayāt kṣipram eva parimokṣyadhve
translated: Then you will quickly be freed from this danger of thieves and enemies.

original: atha khalu sarva eva sa sārthaḥ ekasvareṇa avalokiteśvaramākrandet namo namastasmai abhayaṃdadāyāvalokiteśvarāya bodhisattvāya mahāsattvāyeti
analyzed: atha khalu sarvaḥ eva sa sārthaḥ eka svareṇa avalokiteśvaram ākrandet namaḥ namaḥ tasmai abhayaṃdadāya avalokiteśvarāya bodhisattvāya mahāsattvāya iti
translated: Then all of that caravan would cry out to Avalokiteśvara with one voice: Homage, homage to that giver of fearlessness, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara!

original: Vaidya /
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vaidya.

original: sahanāmagrahaṇenaiva sa sārthaḥ sarvabhayebhyaḥ parimukto bhavet /
analyzed: saha nāma grahaṇena eva sa sārthaḥ sarva bhayebhyaḥ parimuktaḥ bhavet
translated: By merely uttering his name, one would be liberated from all fears.

original: īdṛśaḥ kulaputra avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prabhāvaḥ //
analyzed: īdṛśaḥ kula putra avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prabhāvaḥ
translated: Such is the power, noble sir, of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara.

original: ye kulaputra rāgacaritāḥ sattvāḥ /
analyzed: ye kula putra rāga caritāḥ sattvāḥ
translated: Those beings, noble sir, who are inclined to passion,

original: te 'valokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya namaskāraṃ kṛtvā vigatarāgā bhavanti /
analyzed: te valokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya namaskāram kṛtvā vigata rāgāḥ bhavanti
translated: having bowed to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara, become free from passion.

original: ye dveṣacaritāḥ sattvāḥ /
analyzed: ye dveṣa caritāḥ sattvāḥ
translated: Those beings who are inclined to aversion,

original: te 'valokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya namaskāraṃ kṛtvā vigatadveṣā bhavanti /
analyzed: te valokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya namaskāram kṛtvā vigata dveṣāḥ bhavanti
translated: having bowed to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara, become free from aversion.

original: ye mohacaritāḥ sattvāḥ /
analyzed: ye moha caritāḥ sattvāḥ
translated: Those beings who are inclined to delusion,

original: te 'valokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya namaskāraṃ kṛtvā vigatamohā bhavanti /
analyzed: te valokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya namaskāram kṛtvā vigata mohāḥ bhavanti
translated: having bowed to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara, become free from delusion.

original: evaṃ maharddhikaḥ kulaputra avalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ //
analyzed: evam maharddhikaḥ kula putra avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: Thus, noble sir, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara has great power.🔽And, noble sir, a woman who desires a son,

original: yaśca kulaputra avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya putrakāmo mātṛgrāmo namaskāraṃ karoti /
analyzed: yaḥ ca kula putra avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya putra kāmaḥ mātṛgrāmaḥ namaskāram karoti
translated: having bowed to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara,

original: tasya putraḥ prajāyate abhirūpaḥ prāsādiko darśanīyaḥ /
analyzed: tasya putraḥ prajāyate abhirūpaḥ prāsādikaḥ darśanīyaḥ
translated: A son is born to him who is handsome, pleasing, and beautiful to behold,

original: putralakṣaṇasamanvāgato bahujanapriyo manāpo 'varopitakuśalamūlaśca bhavati /
analyzed: putra lakṣaṇa samanvāgataḥ bahu jana priyaḥ manāpaḥ varopita kuśala mūlaḥ ca bhavati
translated: endowed with the marks of a son, loved and cherished by many people, and has planted roots of merit.

original: yo dārikāmabhinandati /
analyzed: yaḥ dārikām abhinandati
translated: One who rejoices in a daughter,

original: tasya dārikā prajāyate abhirūpā prāsādikā darśanīyā paramayā śubhavarṇapuṣkaratayā samanvāgatā dārikā lakṣaṇasamanvāgatā bahujanapriyā manāpā
analyzed: tasya dārikā prajāyate abhirūpā prāsādikā darśanīyā paramayā śubha varṇa puṣkara tayā samanvāgatā dārikā lakṣaṇa samanvāgatā bahu jana priyā manāpā  /
translated: a daughter is born to him who is handsome, pleasing, and beautiful to behold, endowed with the marks of a daughter, loved and cherished by many people,

original: avaropitakuśalabhūlā ca bhavati /
analyzed: avaropita kuśala bhūlā ca bhavati
translated: and has planted roots of merit.

original: īdṛśaḥ kulaputra avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prabhāvaḥ //
analyzed: īdṛśaḥ kula putra avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prabhāvaḥ
translated: Such is the power, noble sir, of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara.

original: ye ca kulaputra avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya namaskāraṃ kariṣyanti /🔽nāmadheyaṃ ca dhārayiṣyanti /
analyzed: ye ca kula putra avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya namaskāram kariṣyanti  nāmadheyam ca dhārayiṣyanti
translated: Those who pay homage to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara, noble sir,🔽and who bear his name,

original: teṣāmamoghaphalaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: teṣām amogha phalam bhavati
translated: they will not receive the fruit in vain.

original: yaśca kulaputra avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya namaskāraṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: yaḥ ca kula putra avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya namaskāram kariṣyati
translated: One who pays homage to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara, noble sir,

original: nāmadheyaṃ ca dhārayiṣyati /
analyzed: nāmadheyam ca dhārayiṣyati
translated: and who bears his name,

original: yaśca dvāṣaṣṭīnāṃ gaṅgānadīvālikāsamānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ namaskāraṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: yaḥ ca dvāṣaṣṭīnām gaṅgā nadī vālikā samānām buddhānām bhagavatām namaskāram kuryāt
translated: And one who would pay homage to the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, equal to the sands of sixty-two Ganges Rivers,

original: nāmadheyāni ca dhārayet /
analyzed: nāmadheyāni ca dhārayet
translated: and would bear their names,

original: yaśca tāvatāmeva buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ tiṣṭhatāṃ dhriyatāṃ yāpayatāṃ cīvarapiṇḍapātaśayanāsanaglānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariṣkāraiḥ pūjāṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: yaḥ ca tāvatām eva buddhānām bhagavatām tiṣṭhatām dhriyatām yāpayatām cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkāraiḥ pūjām kuryāt
translated: and one who would make offerings to those very Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, as many as there are, abiding, maintaining themselves, and teaching, with robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, medicines for sickness, and with monastic requisites,

original: tatkiṃ manyase kulaputra kiyantaṃ sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tatonidānaṃ puṇyābhisaṃskāraṃ prasavet /
analyzed: tat kim manyase kula putra kiyantam sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tatonidānam puṇya abhisaṃskāram prasavet
translated: what do you think, son of noble family? How much merit would that son of noble family or daughter of noble family produce on that basis?

original: evamukte akṣayamatirbodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavantametadavocat bahu bhagavan /
analyzed: evam ukte akṣaya matiḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat bahu bhagavan
translated: When this was said, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Akṣayamati said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, it would be much.

original: bahu sugata sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tatonidānaṃ bahuṃ puṇyābhisaṃskāraṃ prasavet /
analyzed: bahu sugata sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tatonidānam bahum puṇya abhisaṃskāram prasavet
translated: Blessed One, that son of noble family or daughter of noble family would produce much merit on that basis.

original: bhagavānāha yaśca kulaputra tāvatāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ satkāraṃ kṛtvā puṇyābhisaṃskāraḥ /
analyzed: bhagavān āha  yaḥ ca kula putra tāvatām buddhānām bhagavatām satkāram kṛtvā puṇya abhisaṃskāraḥ
translated: The Blessed One said, Son of noble family, the production of merit from paying homage to those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,

original: yaśca avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya antaśa ekamapi namaskāraṃ kuryāt nāmadheyaṃ ca dhārayet /
analyzed: yaḥ ca avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya antaśas ekam api namaskāram kuryāt nāmadheyam ca dhārayet
translated: And whoever would offer even a single prostration to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara and remember his name,

original: samo 'nadhiko 'natirekaḥ puṇyābhisaṃskāraḥ ubhayato bhavet /
analyzed: samaḥ na adhikaḥ na atirekaḥ puṇya abhisaṃskāraḥ ubhayatas bhavet
translated: would create an equal, not greater, not lesser, accumulation of merit.

original: yaśca teṣāṃ dvāṣaṣṭīnāṃ gaṅgānadīvālikāsamānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ satkāraṃ kuryāt nāmadheyāni ca dhārayet /
analyzed: yaḥ ca teṣām dvāṣaṣṭīnām gaṅgā nadī vālikā samānām buddhānām bhagavatām satkāram kuryāt nāmadheyāni ca dhārayet
translated: And whoever would honor the sixty-two buddhas equal to the sands of the Ganges River and remember their names,

original: yaśca avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya namaskāraṃ kuryāt nāmadheyaṃ ca dhārayet /
analyzed: yaḥ ca avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya namaskāram kuryāt nāmadheyam ca dhārayet
translated: and whoever would offer a prostration to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara and remember his name,

original: etāvubhau puṇyaskandhau na sukarau kṣapayituṃ kalpakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrairapi /
analyzed: etau ubhau puṇya skandhau na su karau kṣapayitum kalpa koṭī nayuta śata sahasraiḥ api
translated: these two accumulations of merit would not be easily exhausted even in a hundred thousand quintillion eons.

original: evamaprameyaṃ kulaputra avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya nāmadhāraṇāt puṇyam //
analyzed: evam aprameyam kula putra avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya nāmadhāraṇāt puṇyam
translated: Thus, noble one, the merit from remembering the name of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara is immeasurable.

original: atha khalvakṣayamatirbodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavantametadavocat kathaṃ bhagavan avalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'syāṃ sahāyāṃ lokadhātau
analyzed: atha khalu akṣayamatiḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat katham bhagavan avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ syām sahāyām lokadhātau
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Akṣayamati said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, how does the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara

original: kathaṃ sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: katham sattvānām dharmam deśayati
translated: How does he teach the Dharma to beings?

original: kīdṛśaścāvalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyopāyakauśalyaviṣayaḥ /🔽evamukte bhagavānakṣayamatiṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvametadavocat santi kulaputra lokadhātavaḥ Vaidya
analyzed: kīdṛśaḥ ca avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya upāya kauśalya viṣayaḥ  evam ukte bhagavān akṣaya matim bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat santi kula putra lokadhātavaḥ vaidya
translated: And what kind of skillful means does the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara have?

original: yeṣvavalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo buddharūpeṇa sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayati /🔽santi lokadhātavaḥ /
analyzed: yeṣu avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ buddha rūpeṇa sattvānām dharmam deśayati  santi lokadhātavaḥ
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Akṣayamati, Son of noble family, there are world systems where the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara teaches the Dharma to beings in the form of a buddha.

original: yeṣvavalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bodhisattvarūpeṇa sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: yeṣu avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bodhisattva rūpeṇa sattvānām dharmam deśayati
translated: There are world systems where the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara teaches the Dharma to beings in the form of a bodhisattva.

original: keṣāṃcit pratyekabuddharūpeṇa avalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayati /🔽keṣāṃcicchrāvakarūpeṇa avalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: keṣāṃcid pratyekabuddha rūpeṇa avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sattvānām dharmam deśayati  keṣāṃcid śrāvaka rūpeṇa avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sattvānām dharmam deśayati
translated: To some, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara teaches the Dharma in the form of a pratyekabuddha.🔽To some, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara teaches the Dharma in the form of a śrāvaka.

original: keṣāṃcid brahmarūpeṇāvalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: keṣāṃcid brahma rūpeṇa avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sattvānām dharmam deśayati
translated: To some, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara teaches the Dharma in the form of Brahmā.

original: keṣāṃcicchakrarūpeṇāvalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ dharmaṃ deśayati /🔽keṣāṃcid gandharvarūpeṇāvalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: keṣāṃcid śakra rūpeṇa avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ dharmam deśayati  keṣāṃcid gandharva rūpeṇa avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sattvānām dharmam deśayati
translated: For some, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara teaches the Dharma in the form of Śakra.🔽For some, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara teaches the Dharma to beings in the form of a gandharva.

original: keṣāṃcid gandharvarūpeṇāvalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: keṣāṃcid gandharva rūpeṇa avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sattvānām dharmam deśayati
translated: For some, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara teaches the Dharma to beings in the form of a gandharva.

original: yakṣavaineyānāṃ sattvānāṃ yakṣarūpeṇa dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: yakṣa vaineyānām sattvānām yakṣa rūpeṇa dharmam deśayati
translated: For beings to be guided by yakṣas, he teaches the Dharma in the form of a yakṣa.

original: īśvaravaineyānāṃ sattvānāmīśvararūpeṇa /
analyzed: īśvara vaineyānām sattvānām īśvara rūpeṇa
translated: For beings to be guided by Īśvara, in the form of Īśvara.

original: maheśvaravaineyānāṃ sattvānāṃ maheśvararūpeṇa dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: maheśvara vaineyānām sattvānām maheśvara rūpeṇa dharmam deśayati
translated: For beings to be guided by Maheśvara, in the form of Maheśvara, he teaches the Dharma.

original: cakravartirājavaineyānāṃ sattvānāṃ cakravartirājarūpeṇa dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: cakravarti rāja vaineyānām sattvānām cakravarti rāja rūpeṇa dharmam deśayati
translated: For beings to be guided by a wheel-turning king, he teaches the Dharma in the form of a wheel-turning king.

original: piśācavaineyānāṃ sattvānāṃ piśācarūpeṇa dharmaṃ deśayati /🔽vaiśravaṇavaineyānāṃ sattvānāṃ vaiśravaṇarūpeṇa dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: piśāca vaineyānām sattvānām piśāca rūpeṇa dharmam deśayati  vaiśravaṇa vaineyānām sattvānām vaiśravaṇa rūpeṇa dharmam deśayati
translated: For beings to be guided by piśācas, he teaches the Dharma in the form of a piśāca.🔽For beings to be guided by Vaiśravaṇa, he teaches the Dharma in the form of Vaiśravaṇa.

original: senāpativaineyānāṃ sattvānāṃ senāpatirūpeṇa dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: senāpati vaineyānām sattvānām senāpati rūpeṇa dharmam deśayati
translated: For beings to be guided by a general, he teaches the Dharma in the form of a general.

original: brāhmaṇavaineyānāṃ sattvānāṃ brāhmaṇarūpeṇa dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: brāhmaṇa vaineyānām sattvānām brāhmaṇa rūpeṇa dharmam deśayati
translated: For beings who are to be guided by Brahmins, he teaches the Dharma in the form of a Brahmin.

original: vajrapāṇivaineyānāṃ sattvānāṃ vajrapāṇirūpeṇa dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: vajrapāṇi vaineyānām sattvānām vajrapāṇi rūpeṇa dharmam deśayati
translated: For beings who are to be guided by Vajrapani, he teaches the Dharma in the form of Vajrapani.

original: evamacintyaguṇasamanvāgataḥ kulaputra avalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ /
analyzed: evam acintya guṇa samanvāgataḥ kula putra avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: In this way, noble one, the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Avalokitesvara possesses inconceivable qualities.

original: tasmāttarhi kulaputra avalokiteśvaraṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ pūjayadhvam /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi kula putra avalokiteśvaram bodhisattvam mahāsattvam pūjayadhvam
translated: Therefore, noble one, you should worship the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Avalokitesvara.

original: eṣa kulaputra avalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhītānāṃ sattvānāmabhayaṃ dadāti /
analyzed: eṣa kula putra avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhītānām sattvānām abhayam dadāti
translated: Noble one, this Bodhisattva Mahasattva Avalokitesvara grants fearlessness to frightened beings.

original: anena kāraṇena abhayaṃdada iti saṃjñāyate iha sahāyāṃ lokadhātau //🔽atha khalvakṣayamatirbodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavantametadavocat dāsyāmo vayaṃ bhagavan avalokiteśvarāya bodhisattvāya mahāsattvāya dharmaprābhṛtaṃ
analyzed: anena kāraṇena abhayaṃdadaḥ iti saṃjñāyate iha sahāyām lokadhātau  atha khalu akṣayamatiḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat dāsyāmaḥ vayam bhagavan avalokiteśvarāya bodhisattvāya mahāsattvāya dharma prābhṛtam
translated: For this reason, he is known as Abhayamdada in this Saha world system.🔽Then the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Akashagarbha said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, we will offer a Dharma gift,

original: dharmācchādam /
analyzed: dharma ācchādam
translated: a Dharma robe, to the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Avalokitesvara.

original: bhagavānāhayasyedānīṃ kulaputra kālaṃ manyase /
analyzed: bhagavān āha yasya idānīm kula putra kālam manyase
translated: The Blessed One said, Noble one, if you think the time is right,

original: atha khalvakṣayamatirbodhasattvo mahāsattvaḥ svakaṇṭhādavartāya śatasahasramūlyaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu akṣayamatiḥ bodhasattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sva kaṇṭhāt avartāya śata sahasra mūlyam
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Akṣayamati took off from his own neck a necklace worth a hundred thousand

original: muktāhāramavalokiteśvarāya bodhisattvāya mahāsattvāya dharmācchādamanuprayacchati
analyzed: muktā hāram avalokiteśvarāya bodhisattvāya mahāsattvāya dharma ācchādam anuprayacchati
translated: and offered it as a Dharma gift to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara.

original: sma pratīccha satpuruṣa imaṃ dharmācchādaṃ mamāntikāt /
analyzed: sma pratīccha sat puruṣaḥ imam dharma ācchādam mama antikāt
translated: Accept this Dharma gift from me, good man.

original: sa na pratīcchati sma /🔽atha khalvakṣayamatirbodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'valokiteśvaraṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvametadavocat pratigṛhāṇa tvaṃ kulaputra imaṃ muktāhāramasmākamanukampāmupādāya🔽atha khalvavalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'kṣayamaterbodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyāntikāt
analyzed: sa na pratīcchati sma  atha khalu akṣayamatiḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ valokiteśvaram bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat pratigṛhāṇa tvam kula putra imam muktā hāram asmākam anukampām upādāya  atha khalu avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ kṣayamateḥ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya antikāt
translated: But he did not accept it.🔽Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Akṣayamati said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara, Accept this necklace out of compassion for me, noble sir.🔽Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara accepted

original: taṃ muktāhāraṃ pratigṛhṇāti sma akṣayamaterbodhisattvasya mahasattvasyānukampāmupādāya /
analyzed: tam muktā hāram pratigṛhṇāti sma akṣaya mateḥ bodhisattvasya mahasattvasya anukampām upādāya
translated: that necklace from the bodhisattva mahāsattva Akṣayamati out of compassion for the bodhisattva mahāsattva Akṣayamati.

original: tāsāṃ ca catasṛṇāṃ parṣadāṃ teṣāṃ ca devanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragarūḍakinnaramahoragamanuṣyāmanuṣyāṇāmanukampāmupādāya /
analyzed: tāsām ca catasṛṇām parṣadām teṣām ca deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garūḍa kinnara mahoraga manuṣya amanuṣyāṇām anukampām upādāya
translated: and out of compassion for those four assemblies and for those devas, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans,

original: pratigṛhya ca dvau pratyaṃśau kṛtavān /
analyzed: pratigṛhya ca dvau pratyaṃśau kṛtavān
translated: he accepted it and divided it into two parts.

original: kṛtvā caikaṃ pratyaṃśaṃ bhagavate śākyamunaye dadāti sma /
analyzed: kṛtvā ca ekam pratyaṃśam bhagavate śākyamunaye dadāti sma
translated: Having divided it, he gave one part to the Blessed One Śākyamuni,

original: dvitīyaṃ pratyaṃśaṃ bhagavataḥ prabhūtaratnasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya ratnastūpe samupanāmayāyāsa /
analyzed: dvitīyam pratyaṃśam bhagavataḥ prabhūtaratnasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya ratna stūpe
translated: and the second part he offered to the jeweled stūpa of the Blessed Tathāgata Prabhūtaratna, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: īdṛśyā kulaputra vikurvayā avalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'syāṃ sahāyāṃ lokadhātāvanuvicarati //
analyzed: īdṛśyā kula putra vikurvayā avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ syām sahāyām lokadhātau anuvicarati
translated: In this way, noble sir, the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara roams in this Sahā world system, with such transformations.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāmimā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses on that occasion:

original: citradhvaja akṣayomatī etamarthaṃ paripṛcchi kāraṇāt /🔽Vaidya
analyzed: citradhvaja akṣayomatī etam artham paripṛcchi kāraṇāt  vaidya
translated: Citraketu Akṣayamati asked this question for a reason:🔽Why is he called Avalokiteśvara,

original: kenā jinaputra hetunā ucyate hi avalokiteśvaraḥ // / //
analyzed: kenā jinaputra hetunā ucyate hi avalokiteśvaraḥ
translated: for what reason, O son of the Jina?

original: atha sa diśatā vilokiyā praṇidhīsāgaru akṣayomati /
analyzed: atha sa diśatā
translated: Then he, looking in the directions, the ocean of vows, Akṣayamati,

original: citradhvajo 'dhyabhāṣata śṛṇu caryāmavalokiteśvare // / //
analyzed: citradhvajaḥ dhi abhāṣata śṛṇu caryām avalokiteśvare
translated: Citradhvaja said, Listen to the conduct of Avalokiteśvara.

original: kalpaśata nekakoṭyacintiyā bahubuddhāna sahasrakoṭibhiḥ /
analyzed: bahu buddhāna sahasra koṭibhiḥ
translated: For many hundreds of thousands of inconceivable eons, with many thousands of koṭis of Buddhas,

original: praṇidhāna yathā viśodhitaṃ statha śṛṇvāhi mama pradeśataḥ // / //
analyzed: praṇidhāna yathā viśodhitam śṛṇvāhi mama pradeśataḥ
translated: The prayers were purified, so listen to a fraction of that from me.

original: śravaṇo atha darśano 'pi ca anupūrvaṃ ca tathā anusmṛtiḥ /
analyzed: ca anupūrvam ca tathā anusmṛtiḥ
translated: Hearing and seeing, and likewise gradually remembering,

original: bhavatīha amogha prāṇināṃ sarvaduḥkhabhavaśokanāśakaḥ // / //
analyzed: bhavati iha amogha prāṇinām sarva duḥkha bhava śoka nāśakaḥ
translated: For living beings here, it becomes the destroyer of all suffering and sorrow.

original: saci agnikhadāya pātayed ghatanārthāya praduṣṭamānasaḥ /
analyzed: saci agni khadāya pātayet praduṣṭa mānasaḥ
translated: Even if someone were to throw you into a fire pit, with a hostile mind for the sake of killing,

original: smarato avalokiteśvaraṃ abhisikto iva agni śāmyati // / //
analyzed: smarataḥ avalokiteśvaram abhisiktaḥ iva agni śāmyati
translated: Remembering Avalokiteśvara, it would be extinguished like water sprinkled on a fire.

original: saci sāgaradurgi pātayennāgamakarasurabhūtaālaye /
analyzed: saci sāgara durgi pātayet nāga makara sura bhūta ālaye
translated: Even if you were to be thrown into the ocean, a difficult place to cross, the abode of nāgas, makaras, and spirits,

original: smarato avalokiteśvaraṃ jalarāje na kadācisīdati // / //
analyzed: smarataḥ avalokiteśvaram jalarāje na kadācid sīdati
translated: Remembering Avalokiteśvara, you would never sink in the water-king.

original: saci merutalātu pātayed ghatanārthāya praduṣṭamānasaḥ /
analyzed: saci pātayet praduṣṭa mānasaḥ
translated: Even if someone with a hostile mind were to throw you from the peak of Mount Meru for the sake of killing,

original: smarato avalokiteśvaraṃ sūryabhūto va nabhe pratiṣṭhati // / //
analyzed: smarataḥ avalokiteśvaram sūrya bhūtaḥ nabhe pratiṣṭhati
translated: Remembering Avalokiteśvara, you would stand in the sky like the sun.

original: vajrāmaya parvato yadi ghatanārthāya hi mūrdhni oṣaret /
analyzed: vajra āmaya parvataḥ yadi ghatana arthāya hi mūrdhni oṣaret
translated: Even if a mountain made of vajra were to fall on your head for the sake of killing,

original: smarato avalokiteśvaraṃ romakūpa na prabhonti hiṃsitum // / //
analyzed: smarataḥ avalokiteśvaram romakūpa na prabhonti hiṃsitum
translated: Even the pores of their hair cannot be harmed, if they remember Avalokiteśvara.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: saci śatrugaṇaiḥ parīvṛtaḥ śastrahastairvihiṃsacetasaiḥ /
analyzed: saci śatru gaṇaiḥ parīvṛtaḥ śastra hastaiḥ vihiṃsa cetasaiḥ
translated: Even if surrounded by many enemies, with weapons in hand, intent on harming,

original: smarato avalokiteśvaraṃ maitracitta tada bhonti tatkṣaṇam // / //
analyzed: smarataḥ avalokiteśvaram maitracitta bhonti tad kṣaṇam
translated: If they remember Avalokiteśvara, they become friendly-minded towards them.

original: saci āghatane upasthito vadhyaghātanavaśaṃgato bhavet /
analyzed: saci upasthitaḥ vadhya ghātana vaśaṃgataḥ bhavet
translated: Even if brought to execution, under the power of the executioner,

original: smarato avalokiteśvaraṃ khaṇḍakhaṇḍa tada śastra gacchiyuḥ // / //
analyzed: smarataḥ avalokiteśvaram gacchiyuḥ
translated: If they remember Avalokiteśvara, the weapons will shatter into pieces.

original: saci dārumayairayomayairhaḍinigaḍairiha baddhabandhanaiḥ /
analyzed: saci dāru mayaiḥ ayaḥ mayaiḥ haḍi nigaḍaiḥ iha baddha bandhanaiḥ
translated: Even if bound with wooden or iron fetters and chains,

original: smarato avalokiteśvaraṃ kṣiprameva vipaṭanti bandhanā // / //
analyzed: smarataḥ avalokiteśvaram kṣipram eva vipaṭanti bandhanā
translated: If they remember Avalokiteśvara, the bonds will quickly break apart.

original: mantrā bala vidya oṣadhī bhūta vetāla śarīranāśakā /
analyzed: mantrā bala vidyā oṣadhī bhūta vetāla śarīranāśakā
translated: Mantras, powerful spells, herbs, spirits, demons, and those who destroy the body,

original: smarato avalokiteśvaraṃ tān gacchanti yataḥ pravartitāḥ // / //
analyzed: smarataḥ avalokiteśvaram tān gacchanti yatas pravartitāḥ
translated: If they remember Avalokiteśvara, they go back to where they came from.

original: saci ojaharaiḥ parīvṛto nāgayakṣasurabhūtarākṣasaiḥ /
analyzed: saci oja haraiḥ parīvṛtaḥ nāga yakṣa sura bhūta rākṣasaiḥ
translated: Even if surrounded by those who steal vitality, nāgas, yakṣas, gods, bhūtas, and rākṣasas,

original: smarato avalokiteśvaraṃ romakūpa na prabhonti hiṃsitum // / //
analyzed: smarataḥ avalokiteśvaram romakūpa na prabhonti hiṃsitum
translated: Even the pores of their hair cannot be harmed, if they remember Avalokiteśvara.

original: saci vyālamṛgaiḥ parīvṛtastīkṣṇadaṃṣṭranakharairmahābhayaiḥ /
analyzed: saci vyāla mṛgaiḥ parīvṛtaḥ tīkṣṇa daṃṣṭra nakharaiḥ mahā bhayaiḥ
translated: Even if surrounded by wild animals with sharp teeth and claws, causing great fear,

original: smarato avalokiteśvaraṃ kṣipra gacchanti diśā anantataḥ // / //
analyzed: smarataḥ avalokiteśvaram kṣipra gacchanti diśāḥ anantataḥ
translated: If one remembers Avalokiteśvara, they will quickly flee in the endless directions.

original: saci dṛṣṭiviṣaiḥ parīvṛto jvalanārciśikhiduṣṭadāruṇaiḥ /
analyzed: saci dṛṣṭiviṣaiḥ parīvṛtaḥ jvalana arci śikhi duṣṭa dāruṇaiḥ
translated: Even if surrounded by those with poisonous eyes, fierce and terrible like the flames of a burning fire,

original: smarato avalokiteśvaraṃ kṣiprameva te bhonti nirviṣāḥ // / //
analyzed: smarataḥ avalokiteśvaram kṣipram eva te bhonti nirviṣāḥ
translated: If one remembers Avalokiteśvara, their poison will quickly disappear.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: physician

original: gambhīra savidyu niścarī meghavajrāśani vāriprasravāḥ /
analyzed: vāri prasravāḥ
translated: Deep like thunder, lightning, and rain pouring from clouds and thunderbolts,

original: smarato avalokiteśvaraṃ kṣiprameva praśamanti tatkṣaṇam // / //
analyzed: smarataḥ avalokiteśvaram kṣipram eva praśamanti tad kṣaṇam
translated: If one remembers Avalokiteśvara, it will quickly subside at that very moment.

original: bahuduḥkhaśatairupadrutān sattva dṛṣṭva bahuduḥkhapīḍitān /
analyzed: bahu duḥkha śataiḥ upadrutān sattva dṛṣṭva bahu duḥkha pīḍitān
translated: Seeing beings afflicted by many hundreds of sufferings, tormented by great pain,

original: śubhajñānabalo vilokiyā tena trātaru gaje sadevake // / //
analyzed: śubha jñāna balaḥ tena gaje sa devake
translated: Having observed with the power of auspicious knowledge, he is the protector of the world, including the gods.

original: ṛddhībalapāramiṃgato vipulajñāna upāyaśikṣitaḥ /
analyzed: ṛddhī bala pāramiṃgataḥ vipula jñānaḥ upāya śikṣitaḥ
translated: Having attained the perfection of miraculous powers and strength, trained in vast knowledge and skillful means,

original: sarvatra daśaddiśī jage sarvakṣetreṣu aśeṣa dṛśyate // / //
analyzed: sarvatra daśaddiśī jage sarva kṣetreṣu aśeṣa dṛśyate
translated: He is seen everywhere in the world in all the realms in the ten directions.

original: ye ca akṣaṇadurgatī bhayā narakatiryagyamasya śāsane /
analyzed: ye ca akṣaṇa durgatī bhayā naraka tiryagyamasya śāsane
translated: Those in unfortunate realms, the fears of the hells, animals, and Yama's realm,

original: jātījaravyādhipīḍitā anupūrvaṃ praśamanti prāṇinām // / //
analyzed: jātī jara vyādhi pīḍitāḥ anupūrvam praśamanti prāṇinām
translated: The sufferings of birth, old age, and disease gradually subside for living beings.

original: atha khalu akṣamatirhṛṣṭatuṣṭamanā imā gāthā abhāṣata
analyzed: atha khalu akṣamatiḥ hṛṣṭa tuṣṭa manāḥ imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then Akshamati, with a delighted and joyful mind, spoke these verses:

original: śubhalocana maitralocanā prajñājñānaviśiṣṭalocanā /
analyzed: śubha locana maitra locanā prajñā jñāna viśiṣṭa locanā
translated: O you with beautiful eyes, eyes of friendliness, eyes distinguished by wisdom and knowledge,

original: kṛpalocana śuddhalocanā premaṇīya sumukhā sulocanā // / //
analyzed: kṛpa locana śuddha locanā premaṇīya su mukhā su locanā
translated: Eyes of compassion, pure eyes, lovable, with a beautiful face, with beautiful eyes,

original: amalāmalanirmalaprabhā vitimira jñānadivākaraprabhā /
analyzed: amala amala nirmala prabhā vitimira jñāna divākara prabhā
translated: With the radiance of stainless, pure, and immaculate light, with the light of the sun of wisdom free from darkness,

original: apahṛtānilajvalaprabhā pratapanto jagatī virocase // / //
analyzed: apahṛta anila jvala prabhā pratapantaḥ jagatī virocase
translated: Shining forth, you illuminate the world with the radiance of a fire free from wind,

original: kṛpasadguṇamaitragarjitā śubhaguṇa maitramanā mahāghanā /
analyzed: śubha guṇa maitra garjitā
translated: With the thunder of compassion, good qualities, and friendliness, with the beautiful qualities, with a friendly mind, you are a great cloud,

original: kleśāgni śamesi prāṇināṃ dharmavarṣaṃ amṛtaṃ pravarṣasi // / //
analyzed: kleśa agni prāṇinām dharma varṣam amṛtam pravarṣasi
translated: You extinguish the fire of afflictions for beings and rain down the nectar of the Dharma rain,

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: O physician,

original: kalahe ca vivādavigrahe narasaṃgrāmagate mahābhaye /

original: atha khalu kulaputrā vimalagarbho dārako vimalanetraśca dārako daśanakhamañjaliṃ pragṛhya tāṃ svamātaraṃ janayitrīmetadavocatām mithyādṛṣṭikule 🔽'sminnāvāṃ jātau /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putrāḥ vimalagarbhaḥ dārakaḥ vimalanetraḥ ca dārakaḥ daśa nakham añjalim pragṛhya tām sva mātaram janayitrīm etat avocatām mithyādṛṣṭi kule  smin āvām jātau
translated: Then, noble sons, the prince Vimalagarbha and the prince Vimalanetra, with palms joined, said this to their mother, their birth-giver: “We were born in this family with wrong views.

original: āvāṃ punardharmarājaputrāviti /
analyzed: āvām punar dharmarāja putrau iti
translated: We are again the sons of the Dharma King.”

original: atha khalu kulaputrā vimaladattā rājabhāryā tau dvau dārakāvetadavocat sādhu sādhu kulaputrau Vaidya /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putrā vimaladattā rāja bhāryā tau dvau dārakau etat avocat sādhu sādhu kula putrau vaidya
translated: Then, noble ones, Queen Vimaladattā said this to those two boys: “Excellent, excellent, noble sons!

original: yuvāṃ tasya svapitū rājñaḥ śubhavyūhasyānukampāyai kiṃcideva prātihāryaṃ saṃdarśayatam /
analyzed: yuvām tasya sva pituḥ rājñaḥ śubha vyūhasya anukampāyai kiṃcid eva prātihāryam saṃdarśayatam
translated: You two should display some kind of miracle out of compassion for your father, King Śubhavyūha,

original: apyeva nāma yuvayorantike prasādaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: api eva nāma yuvayoḥ antike prasādam kuryāt
translated: so that he might develop faith in you.

original: prasannacittaśca asmākamanujānīyāt tasya bhagavato jaladharagarjitaghoṣasusvaranakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijñasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhamabhigantum
analyzed: prasanna cittaḥ ca asmākam anujānīyāt tasya bhagavataḥ jaladharagarjitaghoṣasusvaranakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijñasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddham abhigantum
translated: And with a mind full of faith, he will give us permission to go to the blessed Thus-Gone One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Buddha Jala-dhara-garjita-ghoṣa-su-svana-nakṣatra-rāja-saṃkusumita-abhijña.”

original: atha khalu kulaputrā vimalagarbho dārako vimalanetraśca dārakastasyāṃ velāyāṃ saptatālamātraṃ🔽vaihāyasamabhyudgamya tasya pitū rājñaḥ śubhavyūhasyānukampāyai buddhānujñātāni yamakāni
analyzed: atha khalu kula putrāḥ vimalagarbhaḥ dārakaḥ vimalanetraḥ ca dārakaḥ tasyām velāyām sapta tāla mātram  vaihāyasam abhyudgamya tasya pituḥ rājñaḥ śubha vyūhasya anukampāyai buddha anujñātāni yamakāni
translated: Then, noble ones, the boy Vimalagarbha and the boy Vimalanetra rose up into the air to the height of seven palm trees

original: prātihāryāṇyakurutām /🔽tau tatraivāntarīkṣe gatau śayyāmakalpayatām /
analyzed: prātihāryāṇi akurutām  tau tatra eva antarīkṣe gatau śayyām akalpayatām
translated: and, out of compassion for their father, King Śubhavyūha, they performed the miracles of a miracle-working pair, which are permitted by the Buddha.🔽They lay down right there in the air.

original: tatraivāntarīkṣe caṃkramataḥ /
analyzed: tatra eva antarīkṣe caṃkramataḥ
translated: They walked right there in the air.

original: tatraivāntarīkṣe rajo vyadhunītām /
analyzed: tatra eva antarīkṣe rajaḥ vyadhunītām
translated: In the sky above, they removed the dust.

original: tatraivāntarīkṣe 'dhaḥkāyādvāridhārāṃ pramumocatuḥ /🔽ūrdhvakāyādagniskandhaṃ prajvālayataḥ sma /🔽ūrdhvakāyādvāridhārāṃ pramumocatuḥ /
analyzed: tatra eva antarīkṣe dhaḥkāyāt vāri dhārām pramumocatuḥ  ūrdhvakāyāt agni skandham prajvālayataḥ sma  ūrdhva kāyāt vāri dhārām pramumocatuḥ
translated: In the sky above, they released a stream of water from the lower part of their bodies.🔽They emitted a mass of fire from the upper part of their bodies.🔽They released a stream of water from the upper part of their bodies.

original: adhaḥkāyādagniskandhaṃ prajvālayataḥ sma /🔽tau tasminnevākāśe mahāntau bhūtvā khuḍḍakau bhavataḥ /
analyzed: adhaḥkāyāt agni skandham prajvālayataḥ sma  tau tasmin eva ākāśe mahāntau bhūtvā khuḍḍakau bhavataḥ
translated: They emitted a mass of fire from the lower part of their bodies.🔽They became large in the sky and then became small.

original: khuḍḍakau bhūtvā mahāntau bhavataḥ /
analyzed: khuḍḍakau bhūtvā mahāntau bhavataḥ
translated: They became small and then became large.

original: tasminnevāntarīkṣe 'ntardhāyataḥ /🔽pṛthivyāmunmajjataḥ /
analyzed: tasmin eva antarīkṣe ntardhāyataḥ  pṛthivyām unmajjataḥ
translated: They disappeared in the sky.🔽They emerged from the earth.

original: pṛthivyāmunmajjitvā ākāśaunmajjataḥ /
analyzed: pṛthivyām unmajjitvā ākāśa aunmajjataḥ
translated: Having emerged from the earth, they emerged in the sky.

original: iyadbhiḥ khalu punaḥ kulaputrā ṛddhiprātihāryaistābhyāṃ dvābhyāṃ dārakābhyāṃ sa śubhavyūho rājā svapitā vinītaḥ /
analyzed: iyadbhiḥ khalu punar kula putrāḥ ṛddhi prātihāryaiḥ tābhyām dvābhyām dārakābhyām sa śubha vyūhaḥ rājā sva pitā vinītaḥ
translated: In this way, those two boys subdued their father, King Subahu, with these miracles.

original: atha khalu kulaputrāḥ sa rājā śubhavyūhastayordārakayostamṛddhiprātihāryaṃ dṛṣṭvā
analyzed: atha khalu kula putrāḥ sa rājā śubha vyūhaḥ tayoḥ dārakayoḥ tam ṛddhi prātihāryam dṛṣṭvā
translated: Then, noble sons, King Subahu, having seen that miracle of supernatural power of those two boys,

original: tasyāṃ velāyāṃ tuṣṭa udagra āttamanāḥ pramuditaḥ prītisaumanasyajāto daśanakhamañjaliṃ
analyzed: tasyām velāyām tuṣṭaḥ udagraḥ ātta manāḥ pramuditaḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ daśa nakham añjalim
translated: at that time, being pleased, elated, delighted, and joyful, with palms joined,

original: pragṛhya tau dārakāvetadavocat ko yuvayoḥ kulaputrau śāstā /
analyzed: pragṛhya tau dārakau etat avocat kaḥ yuvayoḥ kula putrau śāstā
translated: He said to the two boys, ‘Noble ones, who is your teacher?

original: kasya vā yuvāṃ śiṣyāviti /🔽atha khalu kulaputrāstau dvau dārakau taṃ rājānaṃ śubhavyūhametadavocat eṣa sa🔽mahārāja bhagavān jaladharagarjitaghoṣasusvaranakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijñastathāgato
analyzed: kasya vā yuvām śiṣyau iti  atha khalu kula putrāḥ tau dvau dārakau tam rājānam śubha vyūham etat avocat eṣa sa  mahā rāja bhagavān jaladhara garjita ghoṣa susvara nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijñaḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: To whom do you belong?’

original: 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhastiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati ratnamaye bodhivṛkṣamūle dharmāsanopaviṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati ratna maye bodhivṛkṣa mūle dharma āsana upaviṣṭaḥ
translated: “Then, noble ones, the two boys said to King Śubhavyūha, ‘Great King, the Bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha Jala­dhara­garjita­ghoṣa­susvarana­kṣatra­rāja­saṃkusumitābhi­jña­ is at the foot of the Bodhi tree, which is made of jewels, seated on the Dharma seat,

original: sadevakasya lokasya purataḥ saddharmapuṇḍarīkaṃ nāma dharmaparyāyaṃ vistareṇa saṃprakāśayati /
analyzed: sa devakasya lokasya puratas saddharmapuṇḍarīkam nāma dharmaparyāyam vistareṇa saṃprakāśayati
translated: expounding to the world with its devas, māras, and Brahmā, and to the assembled hosts of gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas, the Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma.

original: sa āvayorbhagavān śāstā /
analyzed: saḥ āvayoḥ bhagavān śāstā
translated: He is our teacher, Bhagavān.

original: tasyāvāṃ mahārāja śiṣyau /
analyzed: tasya āvām mahā rāja śiṣyau
translated: Great King, we are his disciples.’

original: atha khalu kulaputrāḥ sa rājā śubhavyūhastau dārakāvetadavocat paśyāmo vayaṃ kulaputrau taṃ yuvayoḥ śāstāram /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putrāḥ sa rājā śubha vyūhaḥ tau dārakau etat avocat paśyāmaḥ vayam kula putrau tam yuvayoḥ śāstāram
translated: “Then, noble ones, King Śubhavyūha said to the two boys, ‘Noble ones, we wish to see your teacher.

original: gamiṣyāmo vayaṃ tasya bhagavataḥ sakāśam //
analyzed: gamiṣyāmaḥ vayam tasya bhagavataḥ sakāśam
translated: We will go into the presence of that Bhagavān.’

original: atha khalu kulaputrāstau dvau dārakau tato 'ntarīkṣādavatīrya yena svamātā janayitrī tenopasaṃkrāmatām /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putrāḥ tau dvau dārakau tatas ntarīkṣāt avatīrya yena sva mātā janayitrī tena upasaṃkrāmatām
translated: Then, noble ones, those two boys descended from the sky and approached their mother, their birth-giver.

original: upasaṃkramya daśanakhamañjaliṃ pragṛhya svamātaraṃ janayitrīmetadavocatām eṣa āvābhyāmamba vinītaḥ svapitā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya daśa nakham añjalim pragṛhya sva mātaram janayitrīm etat avocatām eṣaḥ āvābhyām amba vinītaḥ sva pitā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Having approached, they joined their ten fingers in homage and said this to their mother, their birth-giver: Mother, we have inspired our father to aspire to the highest complete enlightenment.

original: kṛtamāvābhyāṃ pituḥ śāstṛkṛtyam /
analyzed: kṛtam āvābhyām pituḥ śāstṛ kṛtyam
translated: We have fulfilled our duty as teachers to our father.

original: tadidānīmutsraṣṭumarhasi /
analyzed: tat idānīm utsraṣṭum arhasi
translated: Now you should release us.

original: āvāṃ tasya bhagavataḥ sakāśe pravrajiṣyāva iti //
analyzed: āvām tasya bhagavataḥ sakāśe pravrajiṣyāvaḥ iti
translated: We will go forth in the presence of that Bhagavān.

original: atha khalu kulaputrā vimalagarbho dārako vimalanetraśca dārakastasyāṃ velāyāṃ svamātaraṃ janayitrīṃ gāthābhyāmadhyabhāṣatām
analyzed: atha khalu kula putrāḥ vimalagarbhaḥ dārakaḥ vimalanetraḥ ca dārakaḥ tasyām velāyām sva mātaram janayitrīm gāthābhyām adhyabhāṣatām
translated: Then, noble ones, at that time the boy Vimalagarbha and the boy Vimalanetra spoke these verses to their mother, their birth-giver:

original: anujānīhyāvayoramba pravrajyāmanagārikām /
analyzed: anujānīhi āvayoḥ amba pravrajyām anagārikām
translated: Mother, give us permission to go forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: āvāṃ vai pravrajiṣyāvo durlabho hi tathāgataḥ // / //
analyzed: āvām vai pravrajiṣyāvaḥ durlabhaḥ hi tathāgataḥ
translated: For a Tathāgata is difficult to find.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: audumbaraṃ yathā puṣpaṃ sudurlabhataro jinaḥ /
analyzed: audumbaram yathā puṣpam su durlabhataraḥ jinaḥ
translated: A fig tree flower is very difficult to find, and a Jina is even more so.

original: utsṛjya pravrajiṣyāvo durlabhā kṣaṇasaṃpadā // / //
analyzed: utsṛjya pravrajiṣyāvaḥ durlabhā kṣaṇa saṃpadā
translated: We will go forth, abandoning this, for the gathering of moments is difficult to obtain.🔽Queen Vimaladatta said:

original: vimaladattā rājabhāryā āha
analyzed: vimaladattā rāja bhāryā āha
translated: Noble sons,

original: utsṛjāmi yuvāmadya gacchathā sādhu dārakau /
analyzed: utsṛjāmi yuvām adya gacchathā sādhu dārakau
translated: We will now release you. Go, good children.

original: vayaṃ pi pravrajiṣyāmo durlabho hi tathāgataḥ // / //
analyzed: vayam pi pravrajiṣyāmaḥ durlabhaḥ hi tathāgataḥ
translated: We too will go forth, for a Tathāgata is difficult to find.

original: iti //
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus it is said.

original: atha khalu kulaputrāstau dvau dārakāvime gāthe bhāṣitvā tau mātāpitarāvetadavocatām sādhu amba tāta eta /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putrāḥ tau dvau dārakau ime gāthe bhāṣitvā tau mātā pitarau etat avocatām sādhu amba tāta eta
translated: Then, noble sons, after the two children had spoken these verses, they said this to their mother and father: Very well, mother and father, let us go.

original: vayaṃ sarve sahitā bhūtvā gamiṣyāmastasya bhagavato jaladharagarjitaghoṣasusvaranakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijñasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya 🔽sakāśam /
analyzed: vayam sarve sahitāḥ bhūtvā gamiṣyāmaḥ tasya bhagavataḥ jaladharagarjitaghoṣasusvaranakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijñasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya  / sakāśam
translated: We will all go together to the presence of the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Jaladharagarjitaghosa-susvaranakṣatrarāja-saṃkusumitābhijna,

original: upasaṃkramiṣyāmastaṃ bhagavantaṃ darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: upasaṃkramiṣyāmaḥ tam bhagavantam darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharma śravaṇāya
translated: and approach the Blessed One to see him, to pay homage to him, to honor him, and to listen to the Dharma.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: durlabho hyamba tāta buddhotpādaḥ /
analyzed: durlabhaḥ hi amba tāta buddha utpādaḥ
translated: Mother and father, the appearance of a Buddha is rare.

original: udumbarapuṣpasadṛśo mahārṇavyugacchidrakūrmagrīvāpraveśavat /
analyzed: udumbara puṣpa sadṛśaḥ mahā arṇava yuga chidra kūrma grīvā praveśa vat
translated: Like the udumbara flower, like a turtle poking its neck through the hole in a yoke floating on a vast ocean.

original: durlabhaprādurbhāvā amba buddhā bhagavantaḥ /
analyzed: durlabha prādurbhāvāḥ amba buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ
translated: Mother, the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, appear very rarely.

original: tasmāttarhi amba tāta paramapuṇyopastabdhā vayamīdṛśe pravacane upapannāḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi amba tāta parama puṇya upastabdhāḥ vayam īdṛśe pravacane upapannāḥ
translated: Therefore, mother and father, we have been born in such a teaching, supported by supreme merit.

original: tat sādhu amba tāta utsṛjadhvam /
analyzed: tat sādhu amba tāta utsṛjadhvam
translated: Therefore, mother and father, it is good to let go.

original: āvāṃ gamiṣyāvaḥ /
analyzed: āvām gamiṣyāvaḥ
translated: Therefore, mother and father, please let us go.

original: tasya bhagavato jaladharagarjitaghoṣasusvaranakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijñasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya sakāśe pravrajiṣyāvaḥ /
analyzed: tasya bhagavataḥ jaladharagarjitaghoṣasusvaranakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijñasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya sakāśe pravrajiṣyāvaḥ
translated: We will go to the presence of the Blessed One, the thus-gone, the worthy one, the perfectly awakened one, the one with perfect wisdom and conduct, the sugata, the knower of the world, the unsurpassable guide who tames beings, the teacher of gods and humans, the blessed buddha Jala-dhara-garjita-ghosa-su-swara-nakṣatra-rāja-saṃkusumita-ābhijña, and go forth.

original: durlabhaṃ hi amba tāta tathāgatānāṃ darśanam /
analyzed: durlabham hi amba tāta tathāgatānām darśanam
translated: Mother and father, it is rare to see the thus-gone ones.

original: durlabho hyadya kālaḥ /
analyzed: durlabhaḥ hi adya kālaḥ
translated: It is rare to have such a time.

original: īdṛśo dharmarājā /
analyzed: īdṛśaḥ dharma rājā
translated: Such a king of the Dharma.

original: paramadurlabhedṛśī kṣaṇasaṃpat //
analyzed: parama durlabhā īdṛśī kṣaṇa saṃpad
translated: Such a perfect opportunity is extremely rare.

original: tena khalu punaḥ kulaputrāḥ samayena tasya rājñaḥ śūbhavyūhasya antaḥpurāccaturaśītirantaḥpurikāsahasrāṇi asya saddharmapuṇḍarīkasya dharmaparyāyasya 🔽bhājanabhutānyabhūvan /
analyzed: tena khalu punar kula putrāḥ samayena tasya rājñaḥ śūbha vyūhasya antaḥpurāt caturaśītiḥ antaḥpurikā sahasrāṇi asya saddharmapuṇḍarīkasya dharmaparyāyasya  bhājana bhutāni abhūvan
translated: Then, noble ones, at that time, of King Śubhavyūha's harem, 84,000 women became vessels for this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma.

original: vimalanetraśca dārako 'smin dharmaparyāye caritāvī /
analyzed: vimalanetraḥ ca dārakaḥ smin dharmaparyāye caritāvī
translated: The boy Vimalanetra was skilled in this Dharma teaching.

original: vimalagarbhaśca dārako bahukalpakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi sarvasattvapāpajahane samādhau carito 'bhūt kimiti sarvasattvāḥ sarvapāpaṃ jaheyuriti
analyzed: vimalagarbhaḥ ca dārakaḥ bahu kalpa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi sarva sattva pāpa jahane samādhau caritaḥ bhūt kim iti sarva sattvāḥ sarva pāpam jaheyuḥ iti
translated: The boy Vimalagarbha practiced for many quintillions of eons in the samādhi called 'Abandoning the Evil of All Beings,' thinking, 'How can all beings abandon all evil?'

original: sā ca tayordārakayormātā vimaladattā rājabhāryā sarvabuddhasaṃgītiṃ sarvabuddhadharmaguhyasthānāni ca saṃjānīte sma /
analyzed: sā ca tayoḥ dārakayoḥ mātā vimaladattā rāja bhāryā sarva buddha saṃgītim sarva buddha dharma guhya sthānāni ca saṃjānīte sma
translated: And Vimaladatta, the queen and mother of those two boys, understood all the assemblies of the buddhas and all the secret places of the Dharma of the buddhas.

original: atha khalu kulaputrā rājā śubhavyūhastābhyāṃ dvābhyāṃ dārakābhyāṃ tathāgataśāsane vinītaḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu kula putrāḥ rājā śubha vyūhaḥ tābhyām dvābhyām dārakābhyām tathāgata śāsane vinītaḥ
translated: Then, noble ones, King Śubhavyūha was guided by those two boys in the teaching of the Tathāgata.

original: avatāritaśca /
analyzed: avatāritaḥ ca
translated: He was brought in.

original: paripācitaśca sarvasvajanaparivāraḥ /🔽sā ca vimaladattā rājabhāryā sarvasvajanaparivārā tau ca dvau dārakau rājñaḥ śubhavyūhasya
analyzed: paripācitaḥ ca sarva sva jana parivāraḥ  sā ca vimaladattā rāja bhāryā sarva sva jana parivārā tau ca dvau dārakau rājñaḥ śubha vyūhasya
translated: And all his family and retinue were ripened.🔽And Vimaladatta, the queen and mother of those two boys, and all her family and retinue, and those two boys, the sons of King Śubhavyūha,

original: putrau dvācatvāriṃśadbhiḥ prāṇisahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ sāntapurau sāmātyau sarve sahitāḥ🔽samagrāḥ yena bhagavān jaladharagarjitaghoṣasusvaranakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijñastathāgato
analyzed: putrau dvācatvāriṃśadbhiḥ prāṇi sahasraiḥ sārdham sa antapurau sa amātyau sarve sahitāḥ  samagrāḥ yena bhagavān jaladhara garjita ghoṣa susvara nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumita abhijñaḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: together with forty-two thousand beings, with their queens, ministers, and all their retinues, all together

original: 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ /
analyzed: rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ

original: tenopasaṃkrāman /
