original: atha khalu sa rājā śubhavyūhaḥ sā ca vimaladattā rājabhāryā śatasahasramūlyaṃ muktāhāraṃ bhagavata uparyantarīkṣe 'kṣaipsīt /
analyzed: atha khalu sa rājā śubha vyūhaḥ sā ca vimaladattā rāja bhāryā śata sahasra mūlyam muktā hāram bhagavataḥ upari antarīkṣe kṣaipsīt
translated: Then, the king Śubha-vyūha and the queen Vimaladattā threw a pearl necklace worth a hundred thousand into the sky above the Blessed One.

original: samanantarakṣiptaśca sa muktāhārastasya bhagavato mūrdhni muktāhāraḥ kūṭāgāraḥ saṃsthito 'bhūccaturasraścatuḥsthūṇaḥ samabhāgaḥ suvibhakto
analyzed: samanantara kṣiptaḥ ca sa muktāhāraḥ tasya bhagavataḥ mūrdhni muktāhāraḥ kūṭāgāraḥ saṃsthitaḥ bhūt catur asraḥ catur sthūṇaḥ sama bhāgaḥ su vibhaktaḥ
translated: As soon as it was thrown, that pearl necklace became a pavilion of pearls above the head of the Blessed One, square, with four pillars, symmetrical, well constructed,

original: tasmiṃśca kūṭāgāre paryaṅkaḥ prādurbhūto 'nekadūṣyaśatasahasrasaṃstṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tasmin ca kūṭāgāre paryaṅkaḥ prādurbhūtaḥ neka dūṣya śata sahasra saṃstṛtaḥ
translated: and in that pavilion a couch appeared, covered with many hundreds of thousands of garments.

original: tasmiṃśca paryaṅke tathāgatavigrahaḥ paryaṅkabaddhaṃ saṃdṛśyate sma /
analyzed: tasmin ca paryaṅke tathāgata vigrahaḥ paryaṅka baddham saṃdṛśyate sma
translated: And on that couch, the form of the Tathagata was seen, sitting cross-legged.

original: atha khalu rājñaḥ śubhavyūhasyaitadabhavat mahānubhāvamidaṃ buddhajñānam /
analyzed: atha khalu rājñaḥ śubha vyūhasya etat abhavat mahā anubhāvam idam buddha jñānam
translated: Then this occurred to King Subahu: This Buddha-knowledge has great power.

original: acintyaguṇasamanvāgataśca tathāgataḥ /
analyzed: acintya guṇa samanvāgataḥ ca tathāgataḥ
translated: The Tathagata is endowed with inconceivable qualities.

original: yatra hi nāma ayaṃ tathāgatavigrahaḥ kūṭāgāramadhyagataḥ saṃdṛśyate prāsādiko darśanīyaḥ paramaśubhavarṇapuṣkaratayā samanvāgataḥ //🔽atha khalu bhagavān jaladharagarjitaghoṣasusvaranakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijñastathāgataścatasraḥ
analyzed: yatra hi nāma ayam tathāgata vigrahaḥ kūṭāgāra madhya gataḥ saṃdṛśyate prāsādikaḥ darśanīyaḥ parama śubha varṇa puṣkara tayā samanvāgataḥ  atha khalu bhagavān jaladhara garjita ghoṣa susvara nakṣatrarāja saṃkusumitābhijñaḥ tathāgataḥ catasraḥ
translated: For here, this form of the Tathagata, dwelling in the middle of the peaked house, is seen, handsome, lovely, endowed with the supreme beautiful color and radiance.

original: parṣadaḥ āmantrayate sma paśyatha bhikṣavo yūyaṃ śubhavyūhaṃ rājānaṃ gaganatalasthaṃ
analyzed: parṣadaḥ āmantrayate sma paśyatha bhikṣavaḥ yūyam śubha vyūham rājānam gagana tala stham
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathagata Jaladharagarjitaghoṣasusvaranakṣatrarājasaṃkusumitābhijna, addressed the four assemblies, saying: Bhikṣus, do you see this King Subahu, standing in the sky,

original: siṃhanādaṃ nadantam /
analyzed: siṃha nādam nadantam
translated: roaring a lion's roar?

original: āhuḥ paśyāmo bhagavan /
analyzed: āhuḥ paśyāmaḥ bhagavan
translated: They said, We see it, Blessed One.

original: bhagavānāha eṣa khalu bhikṣavaḥ śubhavyūho rājā mama śāsane bhikṣubhāvaṃ kṛtvā śālendrarājo nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho loke bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: bhagavān āha eṣa khalu bhikṣavaḥ śubha vyūhaḥ rājā mama śāsane bhikṣu bhāvam kṛtvā śālendrarājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke bhaviṣyati
translated: The Blessed One said, Bhikṣus, this King Subahu, having become a bhikṣu in my teaching, will become a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One named Śāleṃdrarāja in the world.

original: vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca buddho bhagavān vistīrṇavatyāṃ lokadhātau /
analyzed: vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca buddhaḥ bhagavān vistīrṇavatyām lokadhātau
translated: He will be endowed with knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed guide for those to be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, a Bhagavat.

original: abhyudgatarājo nāma sa kalpo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: abhyudgatarājaḥ nāma sa kalpaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: The eon will be named Abhyudgatārāja.

original: tasya khalu punarbhikṣavaḥ śālendrarājasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya aprameyo bodhisattvasaṃgho bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tasya khalu punar bhikṣavaḥ śālendrarājasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya aprameyaḥ bodhisattva saṃghaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Bhikṣus, that Tathāgata Śālendrarāja, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, will have an immeasurable assembly of bodhisattvas.

original: aprameyaḥ śrāvakasaṃghaḥ /
analyzed: aprameyaḥ śrāvaka saṃghaḥ
translated: He will have an immeasurable assembly of śrāvakas.

original: samā pāṇitalajātā ca vaidūryamayī sā vistīrṇavatī lokadhāturbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: samā pāṇi tala jātā ca vaidūrya mayī sā vistīrṇavatī lokadhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: The world realm Vistīrṇavatī will be level, made of beryl, and will have the arrangement of the earth like the palm of a hand.

original: evamacintyaḥ sa tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: evam acintyaḥ sa tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Thus, that Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One will be inconceivable.

original: syāt khalu punaḥ kulaputrāḥ yuṣmākaṃ kāṅkṣā vā vimatirvā vicikitsā vā anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena śubhavyūho nāma rājābhūt /
analyzed: syāt khalu punar kula putrāḥ yuṣmākam kāṅkṣā vā vimatiḥ vā vicikitsā vā anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena śubhavyūhaḥ nāma rājā abhūt
translated: Noble sons, you may have doubts, uncertainty, or skepticism that at that time, on that occasion, the king named Śubhavyūha was someone else.

original: na khalu punaḥ kulaputrā yuṣmābhirevaṃ draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: na khalu punar kula putrāḥ yuṣmābhiḥ evam draṣṭavyam
translated: Noble sons, you should not see it like that.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: ayameva sa padmaśrīrbodhisattvo mahāsattvastena kālena tena samayena śubhavyūho nāma rājābhut /🔽syātkhalu punaḥ kulaputrā yuṣmākaṃ kāṅkṣā vā vimatirvā vicikitsā vā anyā sā tena kālena tena samayena vimaladattā nāma Vaidya
analyzed: ayam eva sa padmaśrīḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tena kālena tena samayena śubhavyūhaḥ nāma rājā abhud  syāt khalu punar kula putrāḥ yuṣmākam kāṅkṣā vā vimatiḥ vā vicikitsā vā anyā sā tena kālena tena samayena vimaladattā nāma vaidya
translated: This very Padmaśrī, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, was at that time, on that occasion, the king named Śubhavyūha.

original: rājabhāryābhūt /
analyzed: rāja bhāryā abhūt
translated: “Noble ones, you may have doubt, uncertainty, or skepticism that at that time, on that occasion, Vimaladattā, the king’s wife,🔽was someone else.

original: na khalu punaḥ kulaputrā yuṣmābhirevaṃ draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: na khalu punar kula putrāḥ yuṣmābhiḥ evam draṣṭavyam
translated: Noble ones, you should not see it like that.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: ayaṃ sa vairocanaraśmipratimaṇḍitadhvajarājo nāma bodhisattvo mahāsattvastena kālena tena samayena vimaladattā nāma rājabhāryābhut /
analyzed: ayam sa vairocanaraśmipratimaṇḍitadhvajarājaḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tena kālena tena samayena vimaladattā nāma rāja bhāryā bhud
translated: This bodhisattva mahāsattva Vairocana­raśmi­pratimaṇḍita­dhvaja­rāja was at that time, on that occasion, the king’s wife named Vimaladattā.

original: tasya rājñaḥ śubhavyūhasyānukampāyai teṣāṃ ca sattvānāṃ rājñaḥ śubhavyūhasya bhāryātvamabhyupagato 'bhūt /
analyzed: tasya rājñaḥ śubha vyūhasya anukampāyai teṣām ca sattvānām rājñaḥ śubha vyūhasya bhāryā tvam abhyupagataḥ bhūt
translated: Out of compassion for King Śubhavyūha and those beings, she agreed to be the wife of King Śubhavyūha.

original: syātkhalu punaḥ kulaputrā yuṣmākaṃ kāṅkṣā vā vimatirvā vicikitsā vā anyau tau tena kālena tena samayena dvau dārakāvabhūtām /
analyzed: syāt khalu punar kula putrāḥ yuṣmākam kāṅkṣā vā vimatiḥ vā vicikitsā vā anyau tau tena kālena tena samayena dvau dārakau abhūtām
translated: “Noble ones, you may have doubt, uncertainty, or skepticism that at that time, on that occasion, those two boys were two other beings.

original: na khalu punaḥ kulaputrā yuṣmābhirevaṃ draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: na khalu punar kula putrāḥ yuṣmābhiḥ evam draṣṭavyam
translated: Noble ones, you should not see it like this.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: imau tau bhaiṣajyarājaśca bhaiṣajyasamundataśca tena kālena tena samayena tasya rājñaḥ śubhavyūhasya putrāvabhūtām /
analyzed: imau tau bhaiṣajyarājaḥ ca bhaiṣajyasamundataḥ ca tena kālena tena samayena tasya rājñaḥ śubha vyūhasya putrau abhūtām
translated: Those two were the sons of King Śubhavyūha at that time, at that moment.

original: evamacintyaguṇasamanvāgatau kulaputrā bhaiṣajyarājo bhaiṣajyasamudgataśca bodhisattvau mahāsattvau /
analyzed: evam acintya guṇa samanvāgatau kula putrāḥ bhaiṣajyarājaḥ bhaiṣajyasamudgataḥ ca bodhisattvau mahāsattvau
translated: In that way, noble ones, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas Bhaiṣajyarāja and Bhaiṣajya-saṃudgata have inconceivable qualities.

original: bahubuddhakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāvaropitakuśalamūlau
analyzed: bahu buddha koṭī nayuta śata sahasra avaropita kuśala mūlau
translated: They have planted the roots of merit under many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of buddhas.

original: etāvubhāvapi satpuruṣāvacintyadharmasamanvāgatau /
analyzed: etau ubhau api sat puruṣau acintya dharma samanvāgatau
translated: Those two good men are endowed with inconceivable qualities.

original: ye ca etayoḥ satpuruṣayornāmadheyaṃ dhārayiṣyanti /
analyzed: ye ca etayoḥ sat puruṣayoḥ nāmadheyam dhārayiṣyanti
translated: Those who will possess the names of those two good men

original: te sarve namaskaraṇīyā bhaviṣyanti sadevakena lokena //
analyzed: te sarve namaskaraṇīyāḥ bhaviṣyanti sa devakena lokena
translated: will all be revered by the world and its devas.”

original: asmin khalu punaḥ pūrvayogaparivarte bhāṣyamāṇe caturaśītīnāṃ prāṇisahasrāṇāṃ virajo vigatamalaṃ dharmeṣu dharmacakṣurviśuddham //
analyzed: asmin khalu punar pūrva yoga parivarte bhāṣyamāṇe caturaśītīnām prāṇi sahasrāṇām virajaḥ vigata malam dharmeṣu dharma cakṣuḥ viśuddham
translated: Moreover, when this chapter on past events was being taught, the Dharma eye arose in 84,000 beings, free from dust and unobscured.

original: iti śrīsaddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye śubhavyūharājapūrvayogaparivarto nāma pañcaviṃśatimaḥ //
analyzed: iti śrī saddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye śubhavyūharājapūrvayogaparivartaḥ nāma pañcaviṃśatimaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-fifth chapter, on the past life of King Subahu, in the Dharma teaching of the White Lotus of the Good Dharma.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: samantabhadrotsāhanaparivartaḥ /
analyzed: samantabhadra utsāhana parivartaḥ
translated: The Chapter on the Exhortation of Samantabhadra

original: atha khalu samantabhadro bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ pūrvasyāṃ diśi gaṇanāsamatikrāntairbodhisattvairmahāsattvaiḥ
analyzed: atha khalu samantabhadraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ pūrvasyām diśi gaṇanā samatikrāntaiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ mahāsattvaiḥ
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samantabhadra, surrounded and attended by bodhisattva mahāsattvas beyond counting from the east,

original: sārdhaṃ parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ prakampadbhiḥ kṣetrai pravarṣadbhiḥ padmaiḥ pravādyamānaistūryakoṭīnayutaśatasahasraiḥ /
analyzed: sārdham parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ prakampadbhiḥ kṣetraiḥ pravarṣadbhiḥ padmaiḥ pravādyamānaiḥ tūrya koṭī nayuta śata sahasraiḥ
translated: with trembling realms, raining lotuses, and the music of trillions of musical instruments playing,

original: mahatā bodhisattvānubhāvena mahatyā bodhisattvavikurvayā mahatyā bodhisattvaddharyā🔽mahata bodhisattvamāhātmyena mahatā bodhisattvasamāhitena mahatā bodhisattvatejasā jājvalyamānena /
analyzed: mahatā bodhisattva anubhāvena mahatyā bodhisattva vikurvayā mahatyā bodhisattva ddharyā  mahata bodhisattva māhātmyena mahatā bodhisattva samāhitena mahatā bodhisattva tejasā jājvalyamānena
translated: with the great power of the bodhisattvas, the great transformation of the bodhisattvas, the great Dharma of the bodhisattvas,🔽the great greatness of the bodhisattvas, the great concentration of the bodhisattvas, the great splendor of the bodhisattvas shining,

original: mahatā bodhisattvayānena /
analyzed: mahatā bodhisattva yānena
translated: with the great vehicle of the bodhisattvas,

original: mahatā bodhisattvaprātihāryeṇa /
analyzed: mahatā bodhisattva prātihāryeṇa
translated: with the great marvel of the bodhisattvas,

original: mahadbhirdevanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragarūḍakinnaramahoragamanuṣyāmanuṣyaiḥ parivṛtaḥ
analyzed: mahadbhiḥ deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garūḍa kinnara mahoraga manuṣya amanuṣyaiḥ parivṛtaḥ
translated: surrounded by the great gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans,

original: puraskṛtaḥ evamacintyairṛddhiprātihāryaiḥ samantabhadro bodhisattvo mahāsattva imāṃ
analyzed: puraskṛtaḥ evam acintyaiḥ ṛddhi prātihāryaiḥ samantabhadraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ imām
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samantabhadra, having been honored with such inconceivable and marvelous displays of spiritual power,

original: lokadhātuṃ saṃprāptaḥ /
analyzed: lokadhātum saṃprāptaḥ
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samantabhadra, having been honored with such inconceivable miraculous displays, arrived in this world🔽and this buddha field.

original: sa yenagṛdhrakūṭaḥ parvatarājaḥ yena ca bhagavāṃstenopasaṃkrāmat /
analyzed: sa yena gṛdhrakūṭaḥ parvata rājaḥ yena ca bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāmat
translated: He went to Vulture Peak Mountain, to where the Blessed One was.

original: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandya saptakṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya bhagavantametadavocat
analyzed: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya sapta kṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Having arrived, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One, circumambulated him seven times, and said this to the Blessed One:

original: ahaṃ bhagavaṃstasya bhagavato ratnatejobhyudgatarājasya tathāgatasya buddhakṣetrādihāgataḥ
analyzed: aham bhagavan tasya bhagavataḥ ratnatejobhyudgatarājasya tathāgatasya buddhakṣetrāt iha āgataḥ
translated: Blessed One, I have come here from the buddha field of the blessed thus-gone Ratnatejobhyudgatarāja.

original: iha bhagavan sahāyāṃ lokadhātāvayaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīko dharmaparyāyo deśyata iti /
analyzed: iha bhagavan sahāyām lokadhātau ayam saddharmapuṇḍarīkaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ deśyate iti
translated: Blessed One, in this Sahā world system, this Dharma discourse called the White Lotus of the True Dharma is being taught.

original: tamahaṃ śravaṇāyāgato bhagavataḥ śākyamunestathāgatasya sakāśam /
analyzed: tam aham śravaṇāya āgataḥ bhagavataḥ śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya sakāśam
translated: I have come to listen to it from the thus-gone Blessed One Śākyamuni.

original: amūni ca bhagavannetāvanti bodhisattvaśatasahasrāṇi imaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīkaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śravaṇāyāgatāni /
analyzed: amūni ca bhagavan etāvanti bodhisattva śata sahasrāṇi imam saddharmapuṇḍarīkam dharmaparyāyam śravaṇāya āgatāni
translated: Blessed One, these many hundreds of thousands of bodhisattvas have come to listen to this Dharma discourse called the White Lotus of the True Dharma.

original: tatsādhu bhagavān deśayatu tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddha imaṃ saddharmapuṇḍārīkaṃ dharmaparyāyameṣāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ vistareṇa
analyzed: tat sādhu bhagavān deśayatu tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ imam saddharmapuṇḍārīkam dharmaparyāyam eṣām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām vistareṇa
translated: It would be good if the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, would teach this Dharma discourse called The White Lotus of the True Dharma to these bodhisattva mahāsattvas in detail.

original: evamukte bhagavān samantabhadraṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvametadavocat uddhaṭitajñā hi kulaputra ete bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān samantabhadram bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat uddhaṭita jñāḥ hi kula putra ete bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samantabhadra, Noble son, these bodhisattva mahāsattvas are quick to understand.

original: api tvayaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīko dharmaparyāyo yaduta asaṃbhinnatathatā /
analyzed: api tu ayam saddharmapuṇḍarīkaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ yat uta asaṃbhinna tathatā
translated: Moreover, this Dharma discourse called The White Lotus of the True Dharma is none other than the indivisible suchness.

original: te bodhisattvā āhuḥ evametad bhagavan /
analyzed: te bodhisattvāḥ āhuḥ evam etat bhagavan
translated: Those bodhisattvas said, It is so, Blessed One.

original: evametatsugata /
analyzed: evam etat sugata
translated: It is so, Sugata.

original: atha khalu yāstasyāṃ parṣadi bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikāśca saṃnipatitāḥ /🔽tāsāṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye pratiṣṭhāpanārthaṃ punarapi bhagavān samantabhadraṃ
analyzed: atha khalu yāḥ tasyām parṣadi bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikāḥ ca saṃnipatitāḥ  tāsām saddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye pratiṣṭhāpana artham punar api bhagavān samantabhadram
translated: Then, in that assembly, the monks, nuns, male and female lay followers who had gathered,

original: bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvametadavocat caturbhiḥ kulaputra dharmaiḥ samanvāgatasya
analyzed: bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat caturbhiḥ kula putra dharmaiḥ samanvāgatasya
translated: in order to establish them in the Dharma discourse called The White Lotus of the True Dharma, the Blessed One again said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samantabhadra, Noble son, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who possesses four dharmas

original: mātṛgrāmasya ayaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīko dharmaparyāyo hastagato bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: mātṛgrāmasya ayam saddharmapuṇḍarīkaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ hasta gataḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: This Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma will be in the hands of women.

original: katamaiścaturbhiḥ /
analyzed: katamaiḥ caturbhiḥ
translated: What are the four?

original: yaduta buddhairbhagavadbhiradhiṣṭhito bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yat uta buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ adhiṣṭhitaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: They are: being blessed by the Buddha Bhagavats;

original: avaropitakuśalamūlaśca bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: avaropita kuśala mūlaḥ ca bhaviṣyati
translated: having planted the roots of virtue;

original: nirayarāśivyavasthitaśca bhaviṣyati /🔽sarvasattvaparitrāṇārthamanuttarāyāṃ
analyzed: niraya rāśi vyavasthitaḥ ca bhaviṣyati  sarva sattva paritrāṇa artham anuttarāyām
translated: being established in the heap of hells;🔽and generating the mind of unsurpassed,

original: samyaksaṃbodhau cittamutpādayiṣyati /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayiṣyati
translated: perfect enlightenment for the sake of completely liberating all beings.

original: ebhiḥ kulaputra caturbhirdharmaiḥ samanvāgatasya mātṛgrāmasya ayaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīko dharmaparyāyo hastagato bhaviṣyati //🔽atha khalu samantabhadro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavantametadavocat ahaṃ bhagavan
analyzed: ebhiḥ kula putra caturbhiḥ dharmaiḥ samanvāgatasya mātṛgrāmasya ayam saddharmapuṇḍarīkaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ hasta gataḥ bhaviṣyati  atha khalu samantabhadraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat aham bhagavan
translated: Noble sir, this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma will be in the hands of women who have these four qualities.”

original: paścime kāle paścime samaye paścimāyāṃ pañcaśatyāṃ vartamānāyāmevaṃrūpāṇāṃ sūtrāntadhārakāṇāṃ
analyzed: paścime kāle paścime samaye paścimāyām pañcaśatyām vartamānāyām evaṃrūpāṇām sūtrānta dhārakāṇām
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samantabhadra said to the Bhagavān: “Bhagavān, in the later times, during the later times of the last five hundred years of the Dharma, I will give protection

original: bhikṣūṇāṃ rakṣāṃ kariṣyāmi /🔽svastyayanaṃ kariṣyāmi /🔽daṇḍaparihāraṃ kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: bhikṣūṇām rakṣām kariṣyāmi  svastyayanam kariṣyāmi  daṇḍa parihāram kariṣyāmi
translated: to those bhikṣus who possess this kind of sūtra.🔽I will give them well-being.🔽I will remove their staffs.

original: viṣadūṣaṇaṃ kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: viṣa dūṣaṇam kariṣyāmi
translated: I will purify their poisons.

original: yathā na kaścitteṣāṃ dharmabhāṇakānāmavatāraprekṣī avatāragaveṣī avatāraṃ lapsyate /
analyzed: yathā na kaścid teṣām dharma bhāṇakānām avatāra prekṣī avatāra gaveṣī avatāram lapsyate
translated: So that no one who is looking for an opportunity, seeking an opportunity, will find an opportunity among those Dharma teachers.

original: na māraḥ pāpīyānavatāraprekṣī avatāragaveṣī avatāraṃ lapsyate /
analyzed: na māraḥ pāpīyān avatāra prekṣī avatāra gaveṣī avatāram lapsyate
translated: Neither Māra, the evil one, who is looking for an opportunity, seeking an opportunity, will find an opportunity.

original: na māraputrā na mārakāyikā devaputrā na mārakanyā na mārapārṣadyā yāvanna bhūyo māraparyutthito bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: na māra putrāḥ na māra kāyikāḥ deva putrāḥ na māra kanyāḥ na māra pārṣadyāḥ yāvat na bhūyas māra paryutthitaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Neither the sons of Māra, nor the gods of Māra's retinue, nor Māra's daughters, nor Māra's attendants, will be able to disturb him again.

original: na devaputrā na yakṣā na pretā na pūtanā na kṛtyā na vetālāstasya dharmabhāṇakasyāvatāraprekṣiṇo 'vatāragaveṣiṇo 'vatāraṃ lapsyante /
analyzed: na deva putrāḥ na yakṣāḥ na pretāḥ na pūtanāḥ na kṛtyāḥ na vetālāḥ tasya dharma bhāṇakasya avatāra prekṣiṇaḥ vatāra gaveṣiṇaḥ vatāram lapsyante
translated: Neither the gods, nor the yakṣas, nor the pretas, nor the pūtanās, nor the kṛtyās, nor the vetālas who are looking for an opportunity, seeking an opportunity, will find an opportunity among those Dharma teachers.

original: ahaṃ bhagavaṃstasya dharmabhāṇakasya satatasamitaṃ nityakālaṃ rakṣāṃ Vaidya kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: aham bhagavan tasya dharma bhāṇakasya satata samitam nityakālam rakṣām vaidya kariṣyāmi
translated: I, Blessed One, will always, constantly, and at all times protect that Dharma teacher.

original: yadā ca sa dharmabhāṇako 'smin dharmaparyāye cintāyogamanuyuktaścaṃkramābhirūḍho bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yadā ca sa dharmabhāṇakaḥ smin dharmaparyāye cintā yogam anuyuktaḥ caṃkrama abhirūḍhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And when that Dharma teacher, engaged in the yoga of reflection on this Dharma discourse, will be standing in the courtyard,

original: tadāhaṃ bhagavaṃstasya dharmabhāṇakasyāntike śvetaṣaḍdantaṃ gajarājamabhiruhya tasya
analyzed: tadā aham bhagavan tasya dharmabhāṇakasya antike śveta ṣaṣ dantam gaja rājam abhiruhya tasya
translated: then, Blessed One, I will approach that Dharma teacher, mounted on a white six-tusked king of elephants,

original: dharmabhāṇakasya caṃkramakuṭīmupasaṃkramiṣyāmi bodhisattvagaṇaparivṛto 'sya dharmaparyāyasyārakṣāyai /
analyzed: dharma bhāṇakasya caṃkrama kuṭīm upasaṃkramiṣyāmi bodhisattva gaṇa parivṛtaḥ sya dharmaparyāyasya ārakṣāyai
translated: Surrounded by an assembly of bodhisattvas, I will approach the dwelling of the Dharma teacher in order to protect this Dharma teaching.

original: yadā punastasya dharmabhāṇakasya asmin dharmaparyāye cintāyogamanuyuktasya sataḥ ito dharmaparyāyadantaśaḥ padavyañjanaṃ paribhraṣṭaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yadā punar tasya dharma bhāṇakasya asmin dharmaparyāye cintā yogam anuyuktasya sataḥ itas pada vyañjanam paribhraṣṭam bhaviṣyati
translated: When that Dharma teacher, who is engaged in the yoga of reflection on this Dharma teaching, should forget even a single word or syllable from this Dharma teaching,

original: tadāhaṃ tasmin śvetaṣaḍdante gajarāje 'bhiruhya tasya dharmabhāṇakasya saṃmukhamupadarśayitvā imaṃ dharmaparyāyamavikalaṃ pratyuccārayiṣyāmi
analyzed: tadā aham tasmin śveta ṣaṣ dante gaja rāje bhiḥ uhya tasya dharma bhāṇakasya saṃmukham upadarśayitvā imam dharmaparyāyam avikalam pratyuccārayiṣyāmi
translated: then I will mount the white six-tusked king of elephants and appear before that Dharma teacher, reciting this Dharma teaching without omission.

original: sa ca dharmabhāṇako mamātmabhāvaṃ dṛṣṭvā imaṃ ca dharmaparyāyamavikalaṃ mamāntikācchrutvā🔽tuṣṭa udagra āttamanāḥ pramuditaḥ prītisaumanasyajāto bhūyasyā mātrayā asmin dharmaparyāye vīryamārapsyate /
analyzed: sa ca dharma bhāṇakaḥ mama ātmabhāvam dṛṣṭvā imam ca dharmaparyāyam avikalam mama antikāt śrutvā  tuṣṭaḥ udagraḥ ātta manāḥ pramuditaḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ bhūyasyā mātrayā asmin dharmaparyāye vīryam ārapsyate
translated: And when that Dharma teacher sees my body and hears this complete Dharma teaching from me,🔽he will be satisfied, elated, delighted, and overjoyed, and will feel joy and happiness. He will redouble his efforts in this Dharma teaching.

original: āttamanāḥ pramuditaḥ prītisaumanasyajāto bhūyasyā mātrayā asmin dharmaparyāye vīryamārapsyate /
analyzed: ātta manāḥ pramuditaḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ bhūyasyā mātrayā asmin dharmaparyāye vīryam ārapsyate
translated: he will be satisfied, elated, delighted, and overjoyed, and will feel joy and happiness. He will redouble his efforts in this Dharma teaching.

original: mama ca sahadarśanena samādhiṃ pratilapsyate /
analyzed: mama ca saha darśanena samādhim pratilapsyate
translated: And by merely seeing me, they will attain the samādhi.

original: dhāraṇyāvartāṃ ca nāma dhāraṇīṃ pratilapsyate /
analyzed: dhāraṇyāvartām ca nāma dhāraṇīm pratilapsyate
translated: And they will attain the dhāraṇī called 'Turning of the Dhāraṇīs.'

original: koṭīśatasahasrāvartāṃ ca nāma dhāraṇīṃ pratilapsyate /
analyzed: koṭī śata sahasra āvartām ca nāma dhāraṇīm pratilapsyate
translated: And they will attain the dhāraṇī called 'Turning of the Hundred Thousand Koṭis.'

original: sarvarutakauśalyāvartāṃ ca nāma dhāraṇīṃ pratilapsyate //
analyzed: sarvarutakauśalyāvartām ca nāma dhāraṇīm pratilapsyate
translated: And they will attain the dhāraṇī called 'Turning of the Skill in All Sounds.'

original: ye ca bhagavan paścime kāle paścime samaye paścimāyāṃ pañcāśatyāṃ bhikṣavo vā bhikṣūṇyo
analyzed: ye ca bhagavan paścime kāle paścime samaye paścimāyām pañcāśatyām bhikṣavaḥ vā bhikṣūṇyaḥ
translated: Blessed One, in the later times, in the later era, in the last five hundred years, those monks or nuns,

original: vā upāsakā vā upāsikā vā evaṃ sūtrāntadhārakā evaṃ sūtrāntalekhakā evaṃ sūtrāntamārgakā
analyzed: vā upāsakāḥ vā upāsikāḥ vā evam sūtrānta dhārakāḥ evam sūtrānta lekhakāḥ evam sūtrānta mārgakā
translated: or male or female lay followers who uphold such sūtras, who write out such sūtras, who seek out such sūtras,

original: evaṃ sūtrāntavācakā ye paścime kāle paścime samaye paścimāyāṃ pañcaśatyāmasmin dharmaparyāye
analyzed: evam sūtrānta vācakāḥ ye paścime kāle paścime samaye paścimāyām pañcaśatyām asmin dharmaparyāye
translated: who expound such sūtras in the later times, in the later era, in the last five hundred years of this Dharma teaching,

original: trisaptāhamekaviṃśatidivasāni caṃkramābhirūḍhā abhiyuktā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tri sapta aham ekaviṃśati divasāni caṃkrama abhirūḍhāḥ abhiyuktāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: and who, for twenty-one days, for three weeks, are devoted to walking meditation,

original: teṣāmahaṃ sarvasattvapriyadarśanamātmabhāvaṃ saṃdarśayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: teṣām aham sarva sattva priya darśanam ātmabhāvam saṃdarśayiṣyāmi
translated: I will show them my body, which is dear to all beings.

original: tameva śvetaṃ ṣaḍdantaṃ gajarājamabhiruhya bodhisattvagaṇaparivṛtaḥ ekaviṃśatime divase teṣāṃ dharmabhāṇakānāṃ caṃkramamāgamiṣyāmi /
analyzed: tam eva śvetam ṣaṣ dantam gaja rājam abhiruhya bodhisattva gaṇa parivṛtaḥ ekaviṃśatime divase teṣām dharma bhāṇakānām caṃkramam āgamiṣyāmi
translated: Riding that very white elephant with six tusks, surrounded by an assembly of bodhisattvas, on the twenty-first day I will come to the walking place of those Dharma teachers.

original: āgatya ca tān dharmabhāṇakān parisaṃharṣayiṣyāmi samādāpayiṣyāmi samuttejayiṣyāmi saṃpraharṣayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: āgatya ca tān dharma bhāṇakān parisaṃharṣayiṣyāmi samādāpayiṣyāmi samuttejayiṣyāmi saṃpraharṣayiṣyāmi
translated: Having come, I will delight, inspire, encourage, and satisfy those Dharma teachers.

original: dhāraṇīṃ caiṣāṃ dāsyāmi /
analyzed: dhāraṇīm ca eṣām dāsyāmi
translated: I will give them a dhāraṇī.

original: yathā te dharmabhāṇakā na kenaciddharṣaṇīyā bhaviṣyanti /🔽na caiṣāṃ manuṣyā vā amanuṣyā vā avatāraṃ lapsyante /
analyzed: yathā te dharma bhāṇakāḥ na kenacid dharṣaṇīyāḥ bhaviṣyanti  na ca eṣām manuṣyāḥ vā amanuṣyāḥ vā avatāram lapsyante
translated: So that those Dharma teachers will not be troubled by anyone.🔽And neither humans nor non-humans will find an opportunity to harm them.

original: na ca nāryo 'pasaṃhariaṣyanti /🔽rakṣāṃ caiṣāṃ kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: na ca nāryā  rakṣām ca eṣām kariṣyāmi
translated: And women will not seduce them.🔽I will protect them.

original: svastyayanaṃ kariṣyāmi /🔽daṇḍaparihāraṃ kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: svastyayanam kariṣyāmi  daṇḍa parihāram kariṣyāmi
translated: I will bring them well-being.🔽I will avert punishment.

original: viṣadūṣaṇaṃ kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: viṣa dūṣaṇam kariṣyāmi
translated: I will neutralize poison.

original: teṣāṃ vayaṃ bhagavan dharmabhāṇakānāmimāni dhāraṇīpadāni dāsyāmi /
analyzed: teṣām vayam bhagavan dharma bhāṇakānām imāni dhāraṇī padāni dāsyāmi
translated: We will give those Dharma teachers those dhāraṇī phrases, Blessed One.

original: tāni bhagavan dhāraṇīpadāni / tadyathā
analyzed: tāni bhagavan dhāraṇī padāni tat yathā
translated: Those dhāraṇī phrases, Blessed One, are as follows:

original: adaṇḍe daṇḍapati daṇḍāvartani daṇḍakuśale daṇḍasudhāri sudhārapati buddhapaśyane
analyzed: a daṇḍe daṇḍa pati daṇḍa āvartani daṇḍa kuśale daṇḍa sudhāri sudhāra pati buddha paśyane
translated: Adande daṇḍapati daṇḍāvartaṇi daṇḍakuśale daṇḍasudhāri sudhārapati buddhapaśyane

original: sarvadhāraṇi āvartani saṃvartani saṃghaparīkṣite saṃghanirghātani dharmaparīkṣite
analyzed: sarva dhāraṇi āvartani saṃvartani saṃgha parīkṣite saṃgha nirghātani dharma parīkṣite
translated: All retention, turning, dissolving, examined by the Saṅgha, destroying the Saṅgha, examined by the Dharma,

original: sarvasattvarutakauśalyānugate siṃhavikrīḍite anuvarte vartani vartāli svāhā //
analyzed: sarva sattva ruta kauśalya anugate siṃha vikrīḍite anuvarte vartani vartāli svāhā
translated: Following the skill in the sounds of all beings, playing like a lion, following, turning, turning around, svāhā.

original: imāni tāni bhagavan dhāraṇīpadāni yasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya śrotrendriyasyāvabhāsamāgamiṣyanti /
analyzed: imāni tāni bhagavan dhāraṇī padāni yasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya śrotra indriyasya avabhāsam āgamiṣyanti
translated: These, Blessed One, are the dhāraṇī-mantra words, which will come within the range of hearing of that bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: veditavyametat samantabhadrasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyādhiṣṭhānamiti //
analyzed: veditavyam etat samantabhadrasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya adhiṣṭhānam iti
translated: It should be known that this is the blessing of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samantabhadra.

original: ayaṃ ca bhagavan saddharmapuṇḍarīko dharmaparyāyo 'smin jambudvīpe pracaramāṇo yeṣāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ hastagato bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ayam ca bhagavan saddharmapuṇḍarīkaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ smin jambudvīpe pracaramāṇaḥ yeṣām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām hasta gataḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And, Blessed One, when this Dharma discourse of The White Lotus of the True Dharma is circulating in this Jambudvīpa, it will come into the hands of those bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: tairbhagavan dharmabhāṇakairevaṃ veditavyam samantabhadrasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyānubhāvena
analyzed: taiḥ bhagavan dharma bhāṇakaiḥ evam veditavyam samantabhadrasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya anubhāvena
translated: Those Dharma teachers, Blessed One, should know that it is by the power of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samantabhadra.

original: yadasmākamayaṃ dharmaparyāyo hastagataḥ samantabhadrasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya tejasā /
analyzed: yat asmākam ayam dharmaparyāyaḥ hasta gataḥ samantabhadrasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya tejasā
translated: Since this Dharma discourse has come into our hands, it is by the splendor of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samantabhadra.

original: samantabhadrasya bodhisattvasya Vaidya
analyzed: samantabhadrasya bodhisattvasya vaidya
translated: of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samantabhadra,

original: mahāsattvasya caryāyāste bhagavan sattvā lābhino bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: mahāsattvasya caryāyāḥ te bhagavan sattvāḥ lābhinaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Blessed One, those beings will attain the practice of that bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: bahubuddhāvaropitakuśalamūlāśca te sattvā bhaviṣyanti /🔽tathāgatapāṇiparimārjitamūrdhānaśca te bhagavan sattvā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: bahu buddha avaropita kuśala mūlāḥ ca te sattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti  tathāgata pāṇi parimārjita mūrdhānaḥ ca te bhagavan sattvāḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Those beings will have planted roots of virtue under many buddhas.

original: ye idaṃ sūtraṃ likhiṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti /
analyzed: ye idam sūtram likhiṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti
translated: Blessed One, the crowns of the heads of those beings who will write and uphold this sūtra will be caressed by the hands of the Tathāgatas.

original: mama tairbhagavan priyaṃ kṛtaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: mama taiḥ bhagavan priyam kṛtam bhaviṣyati
translated: Blessed One, those who will write and uphold this sūtra will have done what is dear to me.

original: ya idaṃ sūtraṃ likhisyanti /
analyzed: ye idam sūtram likhisyanti
translated: Those who will write this sūtra,

original: ye ca asyārthamanubhotsyante /
analyzed: ye ca asya artham anubhotsyante
translated: and those who will experience its meaning,

original: likhitvā ca te bhagavannidaṃ sūtramitaścyutvā trāyastriṃśatāṃ devānāṃ sabhāgatāya upapatsyante /
analyzed: likhitvā ca te bhagavan idam sūtram itas cyutvā trāyastriṃśatām devānām sabhā gatāya upapatsyante
translated: having written this sūtra, Blessed One, they will be reborn among the devas of the Thirty-Three after passing away from here.

original: sahopapannānāṃ caiṣāṃ caturaśītirapsarasāṃ sahasrāṇyupasaṃkramiṣyanti /
analyzed: saha upapannānām ca eṣām caturaśītiḥ apsarasām sahasrāṇi upasaṃkramiṣyanti
translated: Eighty-four thousand celestial nymphs will approach them upon their rebirth.

original: bherīmātreṇa mukuṭena te devaputrāstāsāmapsarasāṃ madhye sthāsyanti /
analyzed: bherī mātreṇa mukuṭena te devaputrāḥ tāsām apsarasām madhye sthāsyanti
translated: Those gods, with crowns like bherī drums, will stand among those celestial nymphs.

original: īdṛśaḥ kulaputrā imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ likhitvā puṇyaskandhaḥ /
analyzed: īdṛśaḥ kula putrāḥ imam dharmaparyāyam likhitvā puṇya skandhaḥ
translated: Sons of noble family, the accumulation of merit from writing this Dharma discourse is like this.

original: kaḥ punarvādo ye etamuddekṣyanti svādhyāyiṣyanti cintayiṣyanti manasi kariṣyanti /
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ ye etam uddekṣyanti su ādhyāyiṣyanti cintayiṣyanti manasi kariṣyanti
translated: How much more so for those who will recite it, study it, contemplate it, and keep it in mind!

original: tasmāttarhi kulaputrāḥ satkṛtya ayaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīko dharmaparyāyo likhitavyaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi kula putrāḥ satkṛtya ayam saddharmapuṇḍarīkaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ likhitavyaḥ
translated: Therefore, sons of noble family, this Dharma discourse The White Lotus of the Good Dharma should be respectfully written down.

original: sarvadetaḥ samanvāhṛtya /
analyzed: sarvadā itas samanvāhṛtya
translated: With all respect.

original: yaśca avikṣiptena manasikāreṇa likhiṣyati /
analyzed: yaḥ ca avikṣiptena manasikāreṇa likhiṣyati
translated: And whoever writes it down with an undistracted mind,

original: tasya buddhasahasraṃ hastamupanāmayiṣyati /
analyzed: tasya buddha sahasram hastam upanāmayiṣyati
translated: a thousand Buddhas will extend their hands to him.

original: maraṇakāle cāsya buddhasahasraṃ saṃmukhamupadarśanaṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: maraṇa kāle ca asya buddha sahasram saṃmukham upadarśanam kariṣyati
translated: And at the time of death, a thousand Buddhas will appear before him.

original: na ca durgativinipātagāmī bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: na ca durgati vinipāta gāmī bhaviṣyati
translated: He will not go to an unfortunate existence.

original: itaścyutaśca tuṣitānāṃ devānāṃ sabhāgatāyopapatsyate /
analyzed: itas cyutaḥ ca tuṣitānām devānām sabhā gatāya upapatsyate
translated: Having passed away from here, he will be reborn among the Tuṣita gods,

original: yatra sa maitreyo bodhisattvo mahāsattvastiṣṭhati /
analyzed: yatra sa maitreyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tiṣṭhati
translated: where the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya is,

original: dvātriṃśadvaralakṣaṇo bodhisattvasattvagaṇaparivṛto 'psaraḥkoṭīnayutaśatasahasrapuraskṛto dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: dvātriṃśat vara lakṣaṇaḥ bodhisattva sattva gaṇa parivṛtaḥ psaraḥ koṭī nayuta śata sahasra puraskṛtaḥ dharmam deśayati
translated: endowed with the thirty-two excellent marks, surrounded by an assembly of bodhisattvas, honored by many quintillions of celestial maidens, teaching the Dharma.

original: tasmāttarhi kulaputrāḥ paṇḍitena kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitā vā ayaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīko dharmaparyāyaḥ satkṛtya likhitavyaḥ satkṛtyoddeṣṭavyaḥ /🔽satkṛtya svādhyāyitavyaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi kula putrāḥ paṇḍitena kula putreṇa vā kula duhitā vā ayam saddharmapuṇḍarīkaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ satkṛtya likhitavyaḥ satkṛtya uddeṣṭavyaḥ  satkṛtya su ādhyāyitavyaḥ
translated: Therefore, noble sir, a learned noble man or noble woman should write out this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma, should make it into a text, should make offerings to it, and should recite it.🔽They should study it,

original: satkṛtya manasikartavyaḥ /
analyzed: satkṛtya manasi kartavyaḥ
translated: and they should pay attention to it.🔽Noble sir, having written out this Dharma teaching, having made it into a text, having made offerings to it, having recited it,

original: imaṃ kulaputrā dharmaparyāyaṃ likhitvā uddiśya svādhyāyitvā bhāvayitvā manasikṛtvā evamaprameyā guṇā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: imam kula putrāḥ dharmaparyāyam likhitvā uddiśya su ādhyāyitvā bhāvayitvā manasi kṛtvā evam aprameyāḥ guṇāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: having studied it, having contemplated it, having paid attention to it, they will have immeasurable good qualities.

original: tasmāttarhi tena paṇḍitena bhagavan kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā ayaṃ saddharmapuṇḍarīko dharmaparyāyo dhārayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi tena paṇḍitena bhagavan kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā ayam saddharmapuṇḍarīkaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ dhārayitavyaḥ
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, that learned noble man or noble woman should keep this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma.

original: etāvantasteṣāṃ guṇānuśaṃsā bhaviṣyanti🔽tasmāttarhi bhagavan ahamapi tāvadimaṃ dharmaparyāyamadhiṣṭhāsyāmi /
analyzed: etāvantaḥ teṣām guṇa anuśaṃsāḥ bhaviṣyanti  tasmāt tarhi bhagavan aham api tāvat imam dharmaparyāyam adhiṣṭhāsyāmi
translated: They will have those many benefits and virtues.🔽Therefore, Blessed One, I will also bless this Dharma teaching.

original: yathā bhagavan mamādhiṣṭhānena ayaṃ dharmaparyāyo 'smin jambudvīpe pracariṣyati //
analyzed: yathā bhagavat mama adhiṣṭhānena ayam dharmaparyāyaḥ smin jambudvīpe pracariṣyati
translated: Blessed One, by my blessing, may this Dharma teaching spread in this Jambudvīpa.”

original: atha khalu tasyāṃ velāyāṃ bhagavān śākyamunistathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ samantabhadrāya bodhisattvāya mahāsattvāya sādhukāramadāt sādhu
analyzed: atha khalu tasyām velāyām bhagavān śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ samantabhadrāya bodhisattvāya mahāsattvāya sādhukāram adāt sādhu
translated: Then at that time the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha Śākyamuni, gave his approval to the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Samantabhadra, saying, Excellent!

original: sādhu samantabhadra /
analyzed: sādhu samantabhadra
translated: Excellent, Samantabhadra!

original: yatra hi nāma tvamevaṃ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāyai mahato janakāyasyārthāya hitāya sukhāya pratipannaḥ /
analyzed: yatra hi nāma tvam evam bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāyai mahataḥ jana kāyasya arthāya hitāya sukhāya pratipannaḥ
translated: For you have set out for the benefit of many people, for the happiness of many people, out of compassion for the world, for the sake of the great multitude, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of devas and human beings.

original: evamacintyadharmasamanvāgato 'si mahākaruṇāsaṃgṛhītenādhyāśayena /
analyzed: evam acintya dharma samanvāgataḥ si mahā karuṇā saṃgṛhītena adhyāśayena
translated: You are endowed with inconceivable qualities, with a superior intention embraced by great compassion.

original: acintyasaṃgṛhītena cittotpādena /
analyzed: acintya saṃgṛhītena citta utpādena
translated: With a thought of enlightenment embraced by the inconceivable,

original: yastvaṃ svayameva teṣāṃ dharmabhāṇakānāmadhiṣṭhānaṃ karoṣi /
analyzed: yaḥ tvam svayam eva teṣām dharma bhāṇakānām adhiṣṭhānam karoṣi
translated: you yourself bestow your blessing upon those Dharma teachers.

original: ye kecit kulaputrāḥ samantabhadrasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya nāmadheyaṃ dhārayiṣyanti /
analyzed: ye kecid kula putrāḥ samantabhadrasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya nāmadheyam dhārayiṣyanti
translated: Any sons or daughters of good family who will hold the name of the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Samantabhadra,

original: veditavyaṃ taiḥ śākyamunistathāgato dṛṣṭa iti /
analyzed: veditavyam taiḥ śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ dṛṣṭaḥ iti
translated: they should know that they have seen the Tathāgata Śākyamuni.

original: ayaṃ ca saddharmapuṇḍarīko dharmaparyāyastasya bhagavataḥ śākyamunerantikācchrutaḥ /
analyzed: ayam ca saddharmapuṇḍarīkaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ tasya bhagavataḥ śākyamuneḥ antikāt śrutaḥ
translated: And they have heard this Dharma discourse The White Lotus of the Good Dharma from that Blessed One Śākyamuni.

original: śākyamuniśca tathāgatastaiḥ pūjitaḥ /🔽śākyamuneśca tathāgatasya dharmaṃ deśayataḥ sādhukāro 'nupradattaḥ /
analyzed: śākyamuniḥ ca tathāgataḥ taiḥ pūjitaḥ  śākyamuneḥ ca tathāgatasya dharmam deśayataḥ sādhukāraḥ nupradattaḥ
translated: And the Tathāgata Śākyamuni will be worshipped by them.🔽And the Tathāgata Śākyamuni will give his approval to the teaching of the Dharma.

original: anumoditaścāyaṃ dharmaparyāyo bhaviṣyati śākyamuninā ca tathāgatena teṣāṃ mūrdhni pāṇiḥ pratiṣṭhāpito bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: anumoditaḥ ca ayam dharmaparyāyaḥ bhaviṣyati śākyamuninā ca tathāgatena teṣām mūrdhni pāṇiḥ pratiṣṭhāpitaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And this Dharma discourse will be approved by the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, and he will place his hand on their heads.

original: bhagavāṃśca śākyamunistaiścīvarairavacchādito bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: bhagavān ca śākyamuniḥ taiḥ cīvaraiḥ avacchāditaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And the Blessed One Śākyamuni will be covered with those robes.

original: tathāgataśāsanaparigrāhakāśca te samantabhadra kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro Vaidya
analyzed: tathāgata śāsana parigrāhakāḥ ca te samantabhadra kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vaidya
translated: And those sons or daughters of good family, Samantabhadra, who uphold the teaching of the Tathāgata,

original: vā veditavyāḥ /
analyzed: vā veditavyāḥ
translated: should be known as physicians.

original: na ca teṣāṃ lokāyate rucirbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: na ca teṣām lokāyate ruciḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And they will not delight in worldly treatises.

original: na kāvyaprasṛtāḥ sattvāsteṣāmabhirucitā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: na kāvyaprasṛtāḥ sattvāḥ teṣām abhirucitāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: And beings who are engaged in poetry will not be their delight.

original: na nṛttakā na mallā na nartakā na śauṇḍikaurabhrikakaukkuṭikasaukarikastrīpoṣakāḥ sattvāsteṣāmabhirucitā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: na nṛttakāḥ na mallāḥ na nartakāḥ na śauṇḍika aurabhrika kaukkuṭika saukarika strī poṣakāḥ sattvāḥ teṣām abhirucitāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: And beings who are dancers, wrestlers, actors, distillers, pimps, poultry keepers, pig keepers, or who support women, will not be their delight.

original: īdṛśāṃśca sūtrāntān śrutvā likhitvā dhārayitvā vācayitvā vā na teṣāmanyadabhirucitaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: īdṛśān ca sūtrāntān śrutvā likhitvā dhārayitvā vācayitvā vā na teṣām anyat abhirucitam bhaviṣyati
translated: And having heard, written, possessed, and recited such sūtras, they will not delight in anything else.

original: svabhāvadharmasamanvāgatāśca te sattvā veditavyāḥ /
analyzed: svabhāva dharma samanvāgatāḥ ca te sattvāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: Those beings should be known to possess the nature of the Dharma.

original: pratyātmikaśca teṣāṃ yoniśomanasikāro bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: pratyātmikaḥ ca teṣām yoni śomanasikāraḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: They will have proper mental attention to themselves.

original: svapuṇyabalādhārāśca te sattvā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: sva puṇya bala ādhārāḥ ca te sattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Those beings will be supported by the power of their own merit.

original: priyadarśanāśca te bhaviṣyanti sattvānām /
analyzed: priya darśanāḥ ca te bhaviṣyanti sattvānām
translated: They will be delightful to see for beings.

original: evaṃ sūtrāntadhārakāśca ye bhikṣavo bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: evam sūtrānta dhārakāḥ ca ye bhikṣavaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: In the same way, those monks who uphold the sutras

original: na teṣāṃ rāgo vyābādhiṣyati /
analyzed: na teṣām rāgaḥ vyābādhiṣyati
translated: will not be afflicted by desire.

original: na dveṣo na moho nerṣyā na mātsaryaṃ na mrakṣo na māno nādhimāno na mithyāmānaḥ /
analyzed: na dveṣaḥ na mohaḥ na īrṣyā na mātsaryam na mrakṣaḥ na mānaḥ na adhimānaḥ na mithyāmānaḥ
translated: Not by hatred, not by delusion, not by envy, not by stinginess, not by conceit, not by pride, not by false pride.

original: svalābhasaṃtuṣṭāśca te samantabhadra dharmabhāṇakā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: sva lābha saṃtuṣṭāḥ ca te samantabhadra dharma bhāṇakāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Those Dharma teachers, Samantabhadra, will be content with their own gains.

original: yaḥ samantabhadra paścime kāle paścime samaye paścimāyāṃ pañcaśatyāṃ vartamānāyāmasya saddharmapuṇḍarīkasya dharmaparyāyasya dhārakaṃ bhikṣuṃ
analyzed: yaḥ samantabhadra paścime kāle paścime samaye paścimāyām pañcaśatyām vartamānāyām asya saddharmapuṇḍarīkasya dharmaparyāyasya dhārakam bhikṣum
translated: Samantabhadra, in the later times, in the later era, in the final five hundred years when this Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma is being taught, if a monk

original: evaṃ cittamutpādayitavyam gamiṣyatyayaṃ kulaputro bodhimaṇḍam /
analyzed: evam cittam utpādayitavyam gamiṣyati ayam kula putraḥ bodhimaṇḍam
translated: should arouse the following thought: 'This noble man will go to the seat of awakening.

original: nirjeṣyatyayaṃ kulaputro mārakalicakram /
analyzed: nirjeṣyati ayam kula putraḥ māra kali cakram
translated: This noble man will defeat the army of Māra.

original: pravartayiṣyatyayaṃ dharmacakram /
analyzed: pravartayiṣyati ayam dharmacakram
translated: This noble man will turn the wheel of the Dharma.'

original: parāhaniṣyatyayaṃ dharmadundubhim /
analyzed: parāhaniṣyati ayam dharma dundubhim
translated: He will beat the drum of the Dharma.

original: prapūrayiṣyatyayaṃ dharmaśaṅkham /🔽pravarṣayiṣyatyayaṃ dharmavarṣam /
analyzed: prapūrayiṣyati ayam dharma śaṅkham  pravarṣayiṣyati ayam dharma varṣam
translated: He will blow the conch of the Dharma.🔽He will rain down the rain of the Dharma.

original: abhirokṣyatyayaṃ dharmasiṃhāsanam /
analyzed: abhirokṣyati ayam dharma siṃhāsanam
translated: He will ascend the lion throne of the Dharma.

original: ya imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ paścime kāle paścime samaye paścimāyāṃ pañcaśatyāṃ vartamānāyāṃ dhārayiṣyanti /
analyzed: ye imam dharmaparyāyam paścime kāle paścime samaye paścimāyām pañcaśatyām vartamānāyām dhārayiṣyanti
translated: Those who in the later times, during the later five hundred years, will possess this Dharma discourse,

original: na te bhikṣavo lubdhā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: na te bhikṣavaḥ lubdhāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: those bhikṣus will not be greedy.

original: na cīvaragṛddhā na pātragṛddhā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: na cīvara gṛddhāḥ na pātra gṛddhāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will not be attached to robes or bowls.

original: ṛjukāśca te dharmabhāṇakā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: ṛjukāḥ ca te dharma bhāṇakāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Those Dharma teachers will be upright.

original: trivimokṣalābhinaśca te dharmabhāṇakā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tri vimokṣa lābhinaḥ ca te dharma bhāṇakāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Those Dharma teachers will attain the three liberations.

original: dṛṣṭadhārmikaṃ ca teṣāṃ nivartiṣyati /
analyzed: dṛṣṭa dhārmikam ca teṣām nivartiṣyati
translated: And for them, it will turn back in this very life.

original: ya evaṃ sūtrāntadhārakāṇāṃ dharmabhāṇakānāṃ bhikṣūṇāṃ mohaṃ dāsyanti /
analyzed: ye evam sūtrānta dhārakāṇām dharma bhāṇakānām bhikṣūṇām moham dāsyanti
translated: Those who give delusion to bhikṣus who are Dharma teachers and possess this kind of sūtra,

original: jātyandhāste sattvā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: jāti andhāḥ te sattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: those beings will be born blind.

original: ye caivaṃrūpāṇāṃ sūtrāntadhārakāṇāṃ bhikṣūṇāmavarṇaṃ saṃśrāvayiṣyanti /
analyzed: ye ca evaṃrūpāṇām sūtrānta dhārakāṇām bhikṣūṇām avarṇam saṃśrāvayiṣyanti
translated: Those who proclaim the disrepute of bhikṣus who possess this kind of sūtra,

original: teṣāṃ dṛṣṭa eva dharme kāyaścitro bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: teṣām dṛṣṭe eva dharme kāyaḥ citraḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: in this very life their bodies will become mottled.

original: ya evaṃ sūtrāntalekhakānāmuccagghanaṃ kariṣyanti ullapiṣyanti /🔽te khaṇḍadantāśca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: ye evam sūtrānta lekhakānām uccagghanam kariṣyanti ullapiṣyanti  te khaṇḍa dantāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: Those who will laugh at, mock,🔽they will have broken teeth,

original: varaladantāśca bhaviṣyanti /🔽bībhatsoṣṭhāśca bhaviṣyanti /🔽cipiṭanāsāśca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: varala dantāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti  bībhatsa uṣṭhāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti  cipiṭa nāsāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: they will have bad teeth,🔽they will have ugly lips,🔽they will have flat noses,

original: viparītahastapādāśca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: viparīta hasta pādāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: their hands and feet will be misshapen,

original: viparītanetrāśca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: viparīta netrāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: their eyes will be misshapen,

original: durgandhikāyāśca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: durgandhikāyāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: their bodies will have a bad smell,

original: gaṇḍapiṭakavicarcidadrukaṇḍvākīrṇaśarīrāśca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: gaṇḍa piṭaka vicarci dadru kaṇḍu ākīrṇa śarīrāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: their bodies will be covered with boils, pimples, leprosy, and itching.

original: ye īdṛśānāṃ sūtrāntalekhakānāṃ sūtrāntavācakānāṃ ca sūtrāntadhārakāṇāṃ ca sūtrāntadeśakānāṃ ca apriyāṃ vācaṃ bhūtāmabhūtāṃ vā saṃśrāvayiṣyanti /
analyzed: ye īdṛśānām sūtrānta lekhakānām sūtrānta vācakānām ca sūtrānta dhārakāṇām ca sūtrānta deśakānām ca apriyām vācam bhūtām abhūtām vā saṃśrāvayiṣyanti
translated: Those who will speak unpleasant words, whether true or false, to the writers, reciters, upholders, and teachers of such sūtras,

original: teṣāmidamāgāḍhataraṃ pāpakaṃ karma veditavyam /
analyzed: teṣām idam āgāḍhataram pāpakam karma veditavyam
translated: should be known to have committed an even more serious evil karma.

original: tasmāttarhi samantabhadra asya dharmaparyāyasya dhārakāṇāṃ bhikṣūṇāṃ dūrata eva pratyutthātavyam /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi samantabhadra asya dharmaparyāyasya dhārakāṇām bhikṣūṇām dūratas eva pratyutthātavyam
translated: Therefore, Samantabhadra, the monks who uphold this Dharma teaching should be welcomed from afar,

original: yathā tathāgatasyāntike gauravaṃ kartavyam /
analyzed: yathā tathāgatasya antike gauravam kartavyam
translated: and respect should be shown to them as if they were the Tathāgata himself.

original: tathā teṣāmeva sūtrāntadhārakāṇāṃ bhikṣūṇāmevaṃ gauravaṃ kartavyam //
analyzed: tathā teṣām eva sūtrānta dhārakāṇām bhikṣūṇām evam gauravam kartavyam
translated: And thus respect should be shown to those very monks who uphold the sūtras.🔽When this chapter encouraging Samantabhadra was being taught, bodhisattva mahāsattvas as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River attained

original: asmin khalu punaḥ samantabhadrotsāhanaparivarte nirdiśyamāne gaṅgānadīvālikāsamānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ koṭīśatasahasrāvartāyā dhāraṇyāḥ 🔽pratilambho 'bhūt //
analyzed: asmin khalu punar samantabhadra utsāhana parivarte nirdiśyamāne gaṅgā nadī vālikā samānām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām koṭī śata sahasra āvartāyāḥ dhāraṇyāḥ  pratilambhaḥ bhūt
translated: the dhāraṇī with a hundred thousand quintillion repetitions.

original: iti śrīsaddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye samantabhadrotsāhanaparivarto nāma ṣaḍviṃśatimaḥ //
analyzed: iti śrī saddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye samantabhadrotsāhanaparivartaḥ nāma ṣaḍviṃśatimaḥ
translated: Thus concludes the twenty-sixth chapter, on encouraging Samantabhadra, in the Dharma teaching of The White Lotus of the Good Dharma.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: anuparīndanāparivartaḥ /
analyzed: anuparīndanā parivartaḥ
translated: The Chapter on Bestowal

original: atha khalu bhagavān śākyamunistathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddha utthāya tasmāddharmāsanāt
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ utthāya tasmāt dharma āsanāt
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened Buddha Śākyamuni rose from that Dharma seat

original: sarvāṃstān bodhisattvāan piṇḍīkṛtya dakṣiṇena pāṇinā ṛddhayabhisaṃskārapariniṣpannena
analyzed: sarvān tān piṇḍīkṛtya dakṣiṇena pāṇinā ṛddhaya abhisaṃskāra pariniṣpannena
translated: and, having combined all those bodhisattvas into one, with his right hand, which was produced by the perfection of supernormal knowledge,

original: dakṣiṇahasteṣvadhyālambya tasyāṃ velāyāmetadavocat imāmahaṃ kulaputrā asaṃkhyeyakalpakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrasamudānītāmanuttarāṃ
analyzed: dakṣiṇa hasteṣu adhyālambya tasyām velāyām etat avocat imām aham kula putrāḥ asaṃkhyeya kalpa koṭī nayuta śata sahasra samudānītām anuttarām
translated: he placed it on the right hands of those bodhisattvas and at that time said this: Noble ones, I have attained supreme enlightenment after an immeasurable, incalculable, limitless, inconceivable, unfathomable, and measureless number of eons.

original: samyaksaṃbodhiṃ yuṣmākaṃ haste parindāmi anuparindāmi nikṣipāmi upanikṣipāmi /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhim yuṣmākam haste parindāmi anuparindāmi nikṣipāmi upanikṣipāmi
translated: I entrust, I fully entrust, I place, I fully place in your hands the supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: yathā vipulā vaistārikī bhavet /
analyzed: yathā vipulā vaistārikī bhavet
translated: So that it may be extensive and spread widely.

original: tathā yuṣmābhiḥ kulaputrāḥ karaṇīyam /
analyzed: tathā yuṣmābhiḥ kula putrāḥ karaṇīyam
translated: In that way, sons of noble family, you should act.

original: dvaitīyakamapi traitīyakamapi bhagavān sarvāvantaṃ bodhisattvagaṇaṃ dakṣiṇena pāṇināadhyālambyaitadavocat🔽imāmahaṃ kulaputrā asaṃkhyeyakalpakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrasamudānītāmanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhiṃ
analyzed: dvaitīyakam api traitīyakam api bhagavān sarvāvantam bodhisattva gaṇam dakṣiṇena pāṇinā adhyālambya etat avocat  imām aham kula putrāḥ asaṃkhyeya kalpa koṭī nayuta śata sahasra samudānītām anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim
translated: For a second time and a third time the Blessed One, having taken hold of the entire assembly of bodhisattvas with his right hand, said this:

original: yuṣmākaṃ haste parindāmi anuparindāmi nikṣipāmi upanikṣipami /
analyzed: yuṣmākam haste parindāmi anuparindāmi nikṣipāmi upanikṣipami
translated: Sons of noble family, I entrust, I fully entrust, I place, I fully place in your hands this supreme perfect enlightenment, which I have accomplished over many quintillions of incalculable eons,

original: yuṣmābhiḥ kulaputra udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā deśayitavyā prakāśayitavyā /
analyzed: yuṣmābhiḥ kula putra udgrahītavyā dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā deśayitavyā prakāśayitavyā
translated: You, sons of noble family, should uphold it, remember it, recite it, master it, teach it, and explain it.

original: sarvasattvānāṃ ca saṃśrāvayitavyā /
analyzed: sarva sattvānām ca saṃśrāvayitavyā
translated: And you should make it heard by all beings.

original: amātsaryo 'haṃ kulaputrā aparigṛhītacitto viśārado buddhajñānasya dātā /
analyzed: amātsaryaḥ ham kula putrāḥ a parigṛhīta cittaḥ viśāradaḥ buddha jñānasya dātā
translated: I am free from stinginess, sons of noble family, my mind is ungrasping, I am fearless, I am the giver of the knowledge of the buddhas.

original: tathāgatajñānasya svayaṃbhūjñānasya dātā /
analyzed: tathāgata jñānasya svayaṃbhū jñānasya dātā
translated: I am the giver of the knowledge of the tathagatas, the knowledge of the self-arisen ones.

original: mahādānapatirahaṃ kulaputrāḥ /
analyzed: mahā dānapatiḥ aham kula putrāḥ
translated: I am a great lord of generosity, sons of noble family.

original: yuṣmābhirapi kulaputrā mamaivānuśikṣitavyam /
analyzed: yuṣmābhiḥ api kula putrāḥ mama eva anuśikṣitavyam
translated: You, noble sons, should also train accordingly.

original: amatsaribhirbhūtvemaṃ tathāgatajñānadarśanaṃ mahopāyakauśalyamāgatānāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṛṇāṃ ca ayaṃ dharmaparyāyaḥ saṃśrāvayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: amatsaribhiḥ bhūtvā imam tathāgata jñāna darśanam mahā upāya kauśalyam āgatānām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṛṇām ca ayam dharmaparyāyaḥ saṃśrāvayitavyaḥ
translated: Without stinginess, you should proclaim this Dharma discourse to those noble sons and daughters who have come to possess the great skillful means of the Tathāgata's wisdom and vision.

original: ye ca aśrāddhāḥ sattvāste 'smin dharmaparyāye samādāpayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: ye ca aśrāddhāḥ sattvāḥ te smin dharmaparyāye samādāpayitavyāḥ
translated: And those beings who lack faith should be encouraged to take up this Dharma discourse.

original: evaṃ yuṣmābhiḥ kulaputrāstathāgatānāṃ pratikāraḥ kṛto bhaviṣyati //
analyzed: evam yuṣmābhiḥ kula putrāḥ tathāgatānām pratikāraḥ kṛtaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: In this way, noble sons, you will have repaid the Tathāgatas.

original: evamuktāste bodhisattva mahāsattva bhagavatā śākyamuninā tathāgatenārhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena mahatā prītiprāmodyena sphutā abhūvan /
analyzed: evam uktāḥ te bodhisattva mahāsattva bhagavatā śākyamuninā tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena mahatā prīti prāmodyena sphutāḥ abhūvan
translated: When the bodhisattva mahāsattvas were thus addressed by the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Śākyamuni, they became filled with great joy and rapture.

original: mahacca gauravamutpādya yena bhagavān śākyamunistathāgato 'rhana samyaksaṃbuddhastenāvanatakāyāḥ
analyzed: mahat ca gauravam utpādya yena bhagavān śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ rhana samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tena avanata kāyāḥ
translated: Giving rise to great respect, they bowed their bodies toward the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Śākyamuni.

original: praṇatakāyāḥ saṃnatakāyāḥ śirāṃsyavanāmya añjaliṃ pragṛhya sarva ekasvaranirghoṣeṇa
analyzed: praṇata kāyāḥ saṃnata kāyāḥ śirāṃsi avanāmya añjalim pragṛhya sarve eka svara nirghoṣeṇa
translated: Bowing their bodies, bending their bodies, lowering their heads, and joining their palms, they all spoke in one voice,

original: bhagavantaṃ śākyamuniṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhametadūcuḥ tathā bhagavan
analyzed: bhagavantam śākyamunim tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham etat ūcuḥ tathā bhagavan
translated: They said this to the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One: Thus it is, Blessed One.

original: kariṣyāmo yathā tathāgata ājñāpayati /
analyzed: kariṣyāmaḥ yathā tathāgataḥ ājñāpayati
translated: We will do as the Tathāgata commands.

original: sarveṣāṃ ca tathāgatānāmājñāṃ kariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: sarveṣām ca tathāgatānām ājñām kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will carry out the instructions of all the Tathāgatas.

original: paripūrayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: paripūrayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will fulfill them.

original: alpotsuko bhagavān bhavatu yathāsukhavihārī /
analyzed: alpa utsukaḥ bhagavān bhavatu yathā sukha vihārī
translated: May the Blessed One be free from anxiety, dwelling as he pleases.

original: dvaitīyakamapi /
analyzed: dvaitīyakam api
translated: For a second time,

original: traitīyakamapi sa sarvāvān bodhisattvagaṇa ekasvaranirghoṣeṇa evaṃ bhāṣate sma alpotsuko bhagavān bhavatu yathāsukhavihārī /
analyzed: traitīyakam api sa sarvāvān bodhisattva gaṇaḥ eka svara nirghoṣeṇa evam bhāṣate sma alpa utsukaḥ bhagavān bhavatu yathā sukha vihārī
translated: and for a third time, that entire assembly of bodhisattvas spoke in one voice: May the Blessed One be free from anxiety, dwelling as he pleases.

original: tathā bhagavan kariṣyāmo yathā tathāgata ājñāpayati /
analyzed: tathā bhagavan kariṣyāmaḥ yathā tathāgataḥ ājñāpayati
translated: Thus it is, Blessed One. We will do as the Tathāgata commands.

original: sarveṣāṃ ca tathāgatānāmājñāṃ paripūrayiṣyāmaḥ //
analyzed: sarveṣām ca tathāgatānām ājñām paripūrayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will fulfill the instructions of all the Tathāgatas.

original: atha khalu bhagavān śākyamunistathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sarvāṃstāṃstathāgatānarhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhānanyebhyo lokadhātubhyaḥ samāgatān
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sarvān tān tathāgatān arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān anyebhyaḥ lokadhātubhyaḥ samāgatān  /
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Śākyamuni, dismissed all those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones who had come from other world systems.🔽He dismissed them,

original: visarjayati sma /
analyzed: visarjayati sma
translated: saying:

original: yathāsukhavihāraṃ ca teṣāṃ tathāgatānāmārocayati sma yathāsukhaṃ tathāgatā viharantvarhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā iti /🔽taṃ ca tasya bhagavataḥ prabhūtaratnasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya ratnastūpaṃ yathābhūmau sthāpayāmāsa /
analyzed: yathāsukha vihāram ca teṣām tathāgatānām ārocayati sma yathāsukham tathāgatāḥ viharantu arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ iti  tam ca tasya bhagavataḥ prabhūtaratnasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya ratna stūpam yathā bhūmau sthāpayāmāsa
translated: He also announced to those Tathāgatas that they could stay as they wished, saying, May the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Enlightened Ones, stay as they wish.🔽He placed that jeweled stūpa of the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Prabhūtaratna, on the ground as it was.

original: tasyāpi tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya yathāsukhavihāramārocayāmāsa //
analyzed: tasya api tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya yathā sukha vihāram ārocayāmāsa
translated: He also announced to that Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One that he could stay as he wished.

original: Vaidya
analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vidy

original: idamavocad bhagavānāttamanāḥ /
analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān ātta manāḥ
translated: The Blessed One said this, and was satisfied.

original: te cāprameyā asaṃkhyeyāstathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā anyalokadhātvāgatā ratnavṛkṣamūleṣu siṃhāsanopaviṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: te ca aprameyāḥ asaṃkhyeyāḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ anya lokadhātu āgatāḥ ratna vṛkṣa mūleṣu siṃhāsana upaviṣṭāḥ
translated: Those immeasurable and innumerable Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones who had come from other world systems, seated on lion thrones at the foot of jeweled trees,

original: prabhutaratnaśca tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sa ca sarvāvān bodhisattvagaṇaḥ /
analyzed: prabhutaratnaḥ ca tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sa ca sarvāvān bodhisattva gaṇaḥ
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Prabhūtaratna, and that entire assembly of bodhisattvas,

original: te ca viśiṣṭacāritrapramukhā aprameyā asaṃkhyeyā bodhisattva mahāsattvā ye pṛthivīvivarebhyo 'bhyudgatāḥ /
analyzed: te ca viśiṣṭa cāritra pramukhāḥ aprameyāḥ asaṃkhyeyāḥ bodhisattva mahāsattvāḥ ye pṛthivī vivarebhyaḥ bhyudgatāḥ
translated: And those immeasurable and innumerable bodhisattva mahāsattvas headed by Viśiṣṭa-cāritra who had emerged from the openings in the earth,

original: te ca mahāśrāvakāḥ tāśca catasraḥ parṣadaḥ /
analyzed: te ca mahāśrāvakāḥ tāḥ ca catasraḥ parṣadaḥ
translated: And those great hearers, and those four assemblies,

original: sadevamānuṣāsuragandharvaśca loko bhagavato bhāṣitamabhyanandanniti //
analyzed: sa deva mānuṣa asura gandharvaḥ ca lokaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandan iti
translated: The world with its gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas rejoiced in the Blessed One's words.

original: iti śrīsaddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye 'nuparīndanāparivarto nāma saptaviṃśatimaḥ samāptaḥ //
analyzed: iti śrī saddharmapuṇḍarīke dharmaparyāye nuparīndanāparivartaḥ nāma saptaviṃśatimaḥ samāptaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-seventh chapter, the chapter on entrusting, in the Dharma discourse called The White Lotus of the True Dharma.

original: ye dharmā hetuprabhavā hetuṃ teṣāṃ tathāgato hyavadat /
analyzed: ye dharmāḥ hetu prabhavāḥ hetum teṣām tathāgataḥ hi avadat
translated: Those phenomena that arise from causes, the Tathāgata has declared their cause.

original: teṣāṃ ca yo nirodha evaṃ vādī mahāśramaṇaḥ //
analyzed: teṣām ca yaḥ nirodhaḥ evam vādī mahā śramaṇaḥ
translated: And that which is the cessation of them, the Great Ascetic has taught that.
